I got it primarily because I wanted a means of connecting to the web while traveling without lugging along a laptop.  Games and reading help round it out.  If you are primarily interested in reading books, however, and do not care so much about the web connectivity features, the $100 Kindle Touch is actually BETTER for this purpose.  The reflective color screen of the Fire is NOT as good as the black and white non-reflective screen of the Touch, and the FIre is NOT NEARLY as good to read in bright light.  Both Kindles are well worth the money and each excels at what it does, but I thought it important to note this issue with readabilty so you do not order the more expensive Fire if all you want is a good e-reader.  The Touch is also smaller and lighter, making it hands down the better to travel with or hold when you are in bed.  Sounds like I am against the FIre, but we actually have both and think they are each good at what they do.  It is important to know what you want to do with it so you will buy the right one!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing
Reviews.Author: Eric Wilson
Reviews.Content: I've had the HD for a matter of weeks now and I absolutely love it. The graphics are amazing, the device is light weight, the battery still strong, and text (for books) is great. I find myself reading much more, as it is more convenient. Only purchased two university level textbooks so far and they both look amazing on the kindle. When looking for a tablet I was mainly looking for books; don't have much experience with iPad, but I don't see how it can better for books. The Kindle is a much cheaper option and with I can browse the web, check emails, watch movies (don't plan on it though), and read. One thing I remember reading in critiques was the keyboard, to some extent it's a little true but I think it's more people just aren't used to it. No biggy in opinion though.This is a purchase I'll enjoy for years to come - for that I give 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: So awesome
Reviews.Author: S. Majocha "Nursee13"
Reviews.Content: Everyone needs to buy one of these.  I bring it everywhere I go.  I barely use my computer anymore.  I use it to browse the internet, pay my bills, email, read books, listen to music, and occasionally watch movies on it.  I also use it to buy more things on Amazon.  The hi-def is amazing - I can't believe what I am looking at.  It looks clearer than my HD TV sometimes and I have a Samsung - a great brand!  The sound is great too, it really sounds like surround.  And for only $199.  Cheaper than buying any Mac product and you get just as much - and more!

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire as much as my Apple products
Reviews.Author: Jayne1004 "Jayne"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to get long-winded here (there's enough of that already)! But I am extremely happy with my Kindle Fire HD. I have an iPad and an iPhone and while I am a huge Apple fan, I must say that Amazon has done an incredible job with the Kindle Fire. Once I figured out the buttons and drop down menus, I found that it's very user friendly. It is very responsive to touch and I like the fact that I can read it in bed at night and turn the brightness down or put the screen to black and the font to white with ease and my husband is not bothered with too much light in the bedroom as he sleeps. I mostly use it for email and reading books, but I also play Angry Birds on it and it is just as responsive as my iPad. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: The New Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Ann Snow "encaustic artist"
Reviews.Content: There is no product that I love more than the new Kindle HD.  I do have a 10.1 tablet as well.. which is a different brand but is similar to an IPad. The Kindle wins for me. I take it everywhere. It fits into my purse easily and with the recommended cover.... it is fantastic.  I especially like the fact that when You close the cover, the Kindle goes off. This makes it so easy when you are interrupted in an appointment. I love reading books on it and I love that you can take special music with you ... that you have downloaded from Amazon MP3. The screen is bright and clear and I often watch movies on it when I am in bed and nothing much is on TV.  I have had all the Kindles. I have passed them along to friends. You can buy other tablets but the biggest reason for getting a Kindle HD is the support you get from Amazon.com. Buy a Kindle HD!  You will never regret it!

Reviews.Title: Wow! Wonderful! fast and easy
Reviews.Author: D. Slaton
Reviews.Content: Ordered Monday and received Wednesday. Out of the box easy to use - I read an already purchased romance that I had on my iPhone Kindle app, signed up for the Southern Living magazine and enjoyed the beautiful pictures with recipes, watched a Prime movie about Yellowstone wildlife in HD and listened to free Huckleberry Finn with Immersion reading program - awesome!  I have an iPad and use it a lot. I enjoy books and technology.  This is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: My new favorite book!
Reviews.Author: Bill Fink
Reviews.Content: The Kndle Fire is perfect for me. I have arthritis in my hands so holding a large novel like a Tom Clancy or W.E.B. Griffin novel is an exercise in pain. With the Kindle Fire I get a paperback size screen to read and I can hold an entire library in my hand. The colors are great. I just finished reading Kiss the Girls by John Patteson and my wife didn't even wake up to tell me to turn out the light and go to bed! I read in the park yesterday during lunch-time, and at the doctor's office waiting for my turn. When I tired of reading a book, I flipped to the USA Today app for the headlines. I'm going to get a couple of my favorite magazine subscriptions; so no more fumbling through the left-overs at the doctor's office. I can't wait to get the NFL and Netflix apps going. My sister has Netflix on her Kindle and watched a movie while her football team lost to mine! I love this Kindle!!

Reviews.Title: Great item.
Reviews.Author: Charlene Heath
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle fire so I was excited to upgrade to the HD fire.  At first I was disappointed because it seemed overly ad based and the area where I was used to having my Favorites was a carousal of items that were ads - trying to sell similar items to what is highlighted on your regular carousal area.I also did not like having to use a USB to charge it but in actuality I just use my regular kindle fire charger on the HD one and it works fine.  I also was disappointed in having no charge light while charging. In other words- my kindle fire had an orange light on it that turned green when it was fully charged and this HD fire has no indication whatsoever of when it is charged up fully unless you go over and look at it constantly to find out on the actual battery icon on the screen. It does not say on it that is is charged you just have to look up at the icon and find out for yourself.  <-- these things are not that big of deal to me anymore. I am used to the Kindle HD and the differences it has from the regular kindle fire now and I would always find myself reaching over to pick one up and always choosing the HD. I like the screen size, and it is not as heavy as my other one. I do not know if that is because of the kindle case I have on the other one being rather bulky leather and the new Kindle HD having a thin sleek case. (I bought my case at the same time and have a separate review on it).The sound and speakers are fantastic, I had to get used to the volume and the on/off buttons being at the top of the unit and the charging and hdmi port being on the side rather than how they are on the regular kindle. And also this one is good with audible books and if you already have both the audio book and the kindle edition they integrate well but if you don't already have both you can also still listen to it read to you but only in a computer voice and not much feeling, etc.The absolute main reason for me wanting the HD in the first place was because it had a camera but the truth is, that the camera is not even very good. I mean it is fine for Skype which is the only purpose I can find on having it on there and it MUST be used in landscape mode. I had wanted it to take pics with and there is not a built in app for it and I can't get it to do that. I don't even use the camera at all, I tried it about two times via skype and it was so/so- okay but I don't use my Kindle for skype that much so I probably won't even use it again.I gave it a good star review and would recommend it to others because it has the best amazing great graphics, the speakers are superb, the size is great, the price is phenomenal, and for reading books and using amazon's apps, it works fantastic.  If you want google play apps don't get this and if you want to use the camera to take pics, don't get it unless you can find an app somewhere that will help you with it or something.  I also want to add that I LOVE amazon customer service and the availability of the products they have, etc. so I went with amazon's product rather than any other similar items I could find because of my experience with them in the past. So, from my original Kindle fire to the Kindle HD- I would def. tell others it is a good item and they should get one.

Reviews.Title: third times a charm!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Matthews "Iris lore girl"
Reviews.Content: Let me just say this is my third kindle. I love it and didn't consider getting any other brand before it came out.  I am not  an expert like some of the reviewers I have read but I am a a shopper to the extrme. My first kindle was a godsend and cost $250.00 it was worth every penny. There was a slight problem with the loading of my books when it was turned on. I called kindle support and my new kindle was shippedthe next day without incident. I have been reading it and buying books without any problems.I had a few word games and thought it might be easier to play on touch screen. The fact that it would still be a kindle sold me. I have never purchased a kindle but recieved as gifts. So this birthday I asked for the kindle hd. I wanted it and I got it."I'm in love all over again". This is a wonderful devie. I have interner access that I can see without having to enlarge the screen to read it, unlike my Iphjone. I just wanted to to say this is a very nice product and I will always read with kindle. Just a laywomans point of view.Last but the most important part of owning my third kindle. AMAZON.COM and THE STAFF!!!! This is the best shopping site I have ever had the pleasure to use. They take care of and consider their customers above all, BAR NONE. It may be a book or a cd or an electronic item that brings you here but it will be the customer service that keepsyou coming back as a loyal shopper.Thanks for the beautiful HD kindle, the OUTSTANDING customer service and the large selection of items and good prices. 3000 books and counting on more to add to my library!!!!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: DanT "Dan T"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this.  I have a couple of computers so I really didn't care about what anyone had to say about the web platform.  It operates like a smart phone rather than a computer in that sense, however it's on WiFi so it is pretty darn fast, and has great reception.  Books and apps take no time to download, and the streaming for PRIME  videos is simply awesome.  For tiny speakers they sure do sound great, and are loud enough for everything I have needed so far. The screen is crystal clear and super sharp.  No eye fatigue from reading, like you would on a computer.  It is light and fits into the pocket of a pair of cargo pants nicely.  Set up was as easy as tuning it on, Amazon pre loads everything, and sync's it to my prime account for me.  Can't beat that, and it took 30 seconds per email account to register them. Simply put I am very happy I decided to purchase this.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Axel
Reviews.Content: Wasn't expecting this when I ordered it. What an great device. I bought it originally to help in college, but after using it a couple times it has been so awesome I use it more frequently than my desktop. If your on the brink of purchasing one for yourself don't wait like I did.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price--BIG upgrade from Generation 1
Reviews.Author: S. Elgan
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the kindle fire HD.  I pre-ordered the first kindle fire and my experience with it was just ok.  I used it some, but found it quite inferior to my 3 ipads (gen 1,2&3).  The motion of swiping and scrolling jittered quite a bit, the internet was laggy, just not as smooth of an experience overall.  I was impressed with the screen and would say it was about as good as the ipad 2's with slightly higher pixel density I believe.Due to my lackluster experience with the first fire I hesitated in getting the kindle fire HD, but after reading the advertising for it to include the upgrades in screen and the added Bluetooth capability, I went ahead and purchased it.  I'm glad I did.  I actually use this right along with my ipad 3.  I like the smaller more portable form factor.  The screen is incredible, a significant upgrade to the original and almost as stunning as the ipad 3.  It is definitively the 2nd best screen I have ever seen (next to the ipad 3).  It truly is a work of art and amazing for only a couple hundred dollars.  In one way, it is even better than the ipad 3, the polarizing filter gets rid of a lot of the annoying glare you see on ipads, which is very nice and surprisingly it works very well.I like that it has Bluetooth.  I love the increase in sound output.  I play movie/scripture stories for my kids at night time and the original kindle fire's speakers were way too quiet so much so that my kids couldn't really hear what was going on.  The speakers on the HD are quite the opposite, I have to turn down the volume a little even. I much welcome change.  The details in the music/audio is kind of fun as well as the surround effect.The device is much more polished all around.  It is easier to hold, more ergonomic.  I like the placement of the buttons and plugs better.  I like the tapered edges.  I even like the larger bezel that makes it easier to hold.  The interface is better and scrolls smoother, and everything is snappier and more fluid all around.  The wi-fi radios are definitely better too and have a much better range. The 5ghz band for 802.11n is a welcome addition too.Great job Amazon, this is what I call an upgrade!  Can't wait to see what you come up with for an encore next year!

Reviews.Title: Great device for $200
Reviews.Author: Mayuresh "M A Hajirnis"
Reviews.Content: It has all the necessary things you expect from a tablet. It's UI is nice, attractive an simple to get used to. Reading books is just one of the many things you can do with this device. Don't expect something like 'iPad3' beater though; because you won't get that for $200.But what you DO get for $200 is definitely worth every penny

Reviews.Title: I Like it
Reviews.Author: James Mahoney
Reviews.Content: I've never owned a Tablet before, but I've wanted an IPad for several years. I was given a couple hundred dollars as an unexpected bday present, and I planned to save a couple more to get the IPad4 for $399.Then while looking for something on Amazon, I saw this New Kindle HD about to Launch. After some research, I decided that I wanted to try it, as for the most part I wanted it in order to reduce the time I'm on my Laptop, and also to give me something Portable to access the Web with when I'm watching T.V., or a Movie... And didn't want to get on my laptop every time I wanted to check what other movies an actor I was watching was in.My Opinion so far;The Screen - Beautiful, and VibrantThe Speed - I've never had another Tablet before, but I'm very happy with its responsiveness.The Battery Charger - Because they advertise it as a Charge Booster I think? I just figured it was a Quicker Charger, and figured I'd just use the Standard one it came with. But it didn't come with a Charger, Lol It does come with a USB Cord to plug into your Computer, but that's supposedly takes 13.5 Hours to Charge, Lol This was too long, so I ordered the Charger. I haven't used the Charger yet, but will soon.Apps - Because all of this App stuff is new to me, I can't say how it compares, only that I'm happy that there are some Free ones. The only App that doesn't work, is the Pandora one. It says it should be in my Library, but it's not. I will be checking into this, as I really like Pandora.Games - I've only put the Free Missle Command Game on it, but it looks and sounds just like the Arcade Version, Love it.Sound - The Speakers are GreatBattery Life - This one I'm still determining... By the percentage drop, it seems that it's only lasting for 5 or 6 hours when charged, but I can't be sure yet, as I haven't gone through a hole charge. It's supposed to last around 11 hours when charged, so hopefully it's not only lasting 5 or 6 hours, or I will contact them and either get a replacement unit, or battery. Though I'm not sure that this will fix it, I will have to continue to read more Reviews. So far I haven't read any about this issue, so either mine needs to be replaced, or it will last longer than I think. We shall see.The Body - It's a beautiful machine, and the weight of it feels substantial, which is very nice.E-mails - I was able to enter 5 different E-mail Accounts, and the app keeps track of them all, which is just awesome. Definitely one of the uses I wanted for it was to check E-mails, without logging onto my Laptop.Twitter - Twitter is a blast to use on this, and switching from one Twitter Account to another is a Breeze.Videos - So far I have only tried a few YouTube Videos, and they Look and Sound Great.HD Movies/Streaming - I have yet to try this, as I thought it came with an HD Cable for some reason, but it didn't. I will be ordering one and connecting it to my HD T.V.Ads - I kinda sorta don't mind the Ads... Might pay the $15 later to get rid of them, but I'm not sure.Final Opinion - Like many of these Reviews indicate, it is definitely a good device when you are an Amazon Customer. But I also find it as an Excellent Device for Managing E-mails, doing Twitter, Researching things on the Internet, Playing Video Games, Listening to Music, Checking The Weather, and all the other things that I do on My Laptop, other than Writing.I have the 7" Screen, so Writing might be kind of tough, but I imagine there's good Apps for it if I decide to.Hope this helps some Beginners out there, which I basically am in regards to Tablets.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle
Reviews.Author: Summerface
Reviews.Content: When you purchase a new Kindle, and it is under warranty it should  be replaced with a new Kindle.  The replacement from Amazonis a refurbished Kindle.  They said they can't guarantee a new one for replacement.  May question is WHY NOT!  I don't agree with this way of doing business.  In the future I will think twice before buying electronics that Amazon manufactures.

Reviews.Title: Whatever happened to patience!
Reviews.Author: D.L.
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD is an outstanding tablet for the price! If people want to spend $300 bucks more on an Ipad so they don't have to wait 1 or 2 additional seconds for an app or the browser to load be my guest. Granted, the Kindle Fire is not as fast as an Ipad or Ipad Mini and I do not hate Apple (they make an outstanding product). It's just crazy how impatient people have become wanting instant gratification from everything they touch and will spend exorbitant amount of money to get it. Whatever happened to patience!  Anyways, the sound on this thing is very loud and clear. The picture is extremely sharp. I do not use it so much for web browsing but have read a lot of books on it. Check out the Wool series by Hugh Howey if your into a good Sci-fi story. I do wish the Personal Videos app was more user friendly because I do have a lot of movies loaded on there. I actually like the advertisements and can't understand why people are complaining because you get a whole bunch of promotional offers (FREE money). I do not regret my purchase and highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Lynn S.
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet for an early Christmas present.  So far, in just two days I have downloaded a bunch of free apps, purchased a few, downloaded some of my books, organized my media lists, set up e-mail and wi-fi, personalized my settings, and tried out just about everything else on the Kindle.  Everything has worked perfectly.  And it was all so quick and easy to do.  The Fire has a fantastic screen for reading and the HD quality of video is awesome.  The speakers are nice and loud and sound really good.  The voice is much better with the Fire when you use the speech to text than it was with my other Kindle.  I am thrilled with the Fire and how easy it is to learn to use, as well as how easy it is to carry.  I bought a rooCase Oragami Dual View case for it that lets me stand it up three different ways without having to worry about it falling down.  I bought the version of the Kindle Fire HD without ads and, in my opinion, this is the best $264 I have ever spent.  If you want a tablet that can handle media, games, e-mail, e-books, etc., and lets you read in the sun, at night, wherever/whenever, the Kindle Fire HD is it.  I looked at the mini iPad and between the better HD screen and the price of the Kindle, the iPad was no competition.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Hd vs Ipad mini
Reviews.Author: Collegestudent2017
Reviews.Content: i have been looking to purchase a new tablet lately since my laptop has recently quit working! i debated on buying another laptop or to go ahead and try a tablet. I started looking at some of the more popular tablets such as the iPad, the new mini, the Kindle Fire with the HD and a samsung galaxy X tablet. My first thought was PRICE! There are all reasonably priced, the iPad and the mini are little high for my current budget but i kept them in the 'maybe pile' because i trust the name!  After doing some research i narrowed my picks down to the Kindle Fire and the Ipad mini.  I need this tablet to do research for school, nots and homework and then more personal uses such as internet surfing and video streaming. I decided to go with the Kindle fire and don't let the small size of the tablet fool you, this thing is a monster! There is the most amazing feature on it, called the speech to text. this feature allows you to say what ever you would like written! as you read or speak the fire picks it up and puts it in text! such an amazing feature when taking notes! I also uploaded movies to it and it has the most clear picture i ahve ever seen on a tablet or even a laptop!i would never go back to only having a laptop!

Reviews.Title: Nice overall device with some limits
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: For comparison, I have both the Ipad2 and Nexus 7 for various Family members (4 & 5 yo boys included).  I also played with the Nook HD and Plain Kindle fire some prior to purchasing the Kindle HD.  I have not used the new Ipad Mini.Overall I should say I am very happy with the device as I still have it to use along w/ the Ipad2 whereas the Nexus has found another home.  I will focus on some of the bigger issues I found.First the kindle HD was easy to setup, navigation is easy and intuitive.The kindle is much smaller than the Ipad, and while not as large for viewing video while sitting on the couch it is nice for holding the device while trying to read a book in bed and can be managed with one hand. I also like the smaller size for travel better personally.  I personally prefer how the Kindle HD feels in my hands vs the Nexus, but that is personal preference.The screen was very nice in my opinion.Compared to either the Ipad or the Nexus, the Kindle HD does seem slightly slower and when the web browser is first opened it takes a little longer to load than on an Ipad or Nexus.  It is more notable if multiple tabs are opened. I also noted there are a few web pages that didn't play some embeded video that worked fine on the Ipad and Nexus (so were not flash).  Overall performance was very good, just not as quick as the other devices for web browsing regardless of WIFI connection.Regarding WIFI connectivity, I would consider it excellent and easy to setup.Cons:The Kindle Free time app is a huge disappointment.  I had the Free time app installed and my 5yo was still able to purchase a couple of games, luckily I was right there, he just clicked on them really fast.  Problem is that the Kindle does not auto-wake to Free time, it goes to the last app opened.  So each time you use it you need to open Free time before setting it down.  I am not going to remember to open Free Time (and didn't know I needed to) for it to be a very effect security tool.Therefore you still need to create a lock screen password or your child can still just grab the device and freely go through everything, if you have a lock screen password then they can not just logon on their own either.  You must logon for them, then open the Free Time app.  Granted,once in the Free time app they can not browse elsewhere or play games that aren't authorized without a password being entered.Personally, I trashed the Free time app and now just use a separate Parental Control Password and separate Lock Screen password.  The Free time app offers nothing in addition IMO besides a Time Limit.You should also disable In-App purchases and probably eliminate 1 click purchasing if you have kids just to be on the safe side.Compared to the Nook HD that allows multiple separate logons to be created so your child can log themselves on, Free time disappointed.No charging Brick!  Granted many users probably already have one, but considering the Kindle HD also has an Ad screen and is the same price as the Nexus or the Nook HD that come w/ charging bricks one needs to consider this in their purchaseRegarding the ads, I don't really mind personally.  It is only on the lock screen so pretty unobtrusive IMO.  If it is that big of an issue to somebody, consider one of the other devices or know your going to spend some extra $ to get rid of them.  Again, figure it into your expense if you think it will be an issue.Nuances/knit-picksSilk browser had issues w/ a few non-flash video and lags on load a little.  It also does not play youtube video very well so you need to find a separate youtube app.  Most websites will go to their main page, but some still go to a mobile site still.  This is an issue w/ tablets in general though.  Although Silk is not perfect, it is very functional for most browsing.The rotation screen does not work appropriately for about 1/2 the games I have.  With many of the Kindle Cases, the Camera is placed on the right in Portrait mode (so hinge of case is on Left).  When the Kindle is held w/ Camera on Right, upon opening the game (ie Where's My Perry) the game will be upside down, to correct you need to hold the Kindle opposite of the Case hinge and it doesn't feel as nice in your hands.  There could be a software update that corrects this in the future, but as of this review it is an issue to me.In comparison to the Nook HD, I can notice the Kindle HD is a little heavier, but not enough to make me go with the Nook HD.Although it is nice that the Power and Volume buttons are recessed and not accidentally bumped, they are hard to find quickly to change the volume.  So a little bit of a give and take. Also, the volume button does not adjust to orientation when going from landscape to portrait mode.  So when in portrait mode w/ buttons on top, left clicking on the volume actually increases the volume while on most devices this would decrease the volume.  That could easily be fixed w/ an update though.When held single handed w/o a case, pressure is sensed where your thumb is placed on the glass screen and can cause page turns etc.  This is not an issue with just then kindle but pretty much all touch readers including the Nexus and Nook I have tried to read with one-handed.  So more of a note for others to be aware of.Typical for android, playlists for music are not always seen on the device and managed as easily as Ipads w/ Itunes, but that will also affect the Nexus, Nook and other tablets using android.  If you download Winamp player at least you can see the Playlist on the Kindle.  Getting the entire playlist deleted from the Kindle can sometimes be mixed results.  You may need to try various MP3 players to best suite your needs.You can not just use windows media player to sync video's that should play on the device that were made for Ipod's/Pad's.  But you can just drop them into the Kindle Video folder, although you get a warning file may not play.  To get to play you must use the Personal Player app on the Kindle (preloaded), not the Video tab that goes to amazon content.Overall I feel the Kindle HD is a very nice device if your main use will be web surfing, checking some email and watching video content from Amazon, checking facebook status or playing Words w/ Friends.  Don't expect to be able to use Google Play or some other services readily and not the entire app store is available, but I found the app selection acceptable.  In regards to considering an Ipad vs a Nexus 7 or Nook HD, I think usability is similar enough for most users.  If you have the money, Ipads are great.  If you don't use Amazon much, you should consider another device than the Kindle.  If you want to be able to have more flexibility, another device like the Nexus or IPad may be better.  If you have kids and want a better logon system and maybe some more interactive children's books, the Nook HD is worth looking at.  Each device has its pro's and cons regarding performance vs content available vs cost. I think you will find it hard to go wrong with this device at this price, esp for those that have kids and don't want them breaking a high $$ Ipad.Don't waste your time getting a standard Kindle Fire, IMO the HD is worth it.None of the tablets are a complete laptop replacement if you actually need to get something creative done IMO.12/12/12I am finding Youtube to be eratic in silk.  When going to Youtube directly from Silk browser and selecting play an alternate App can be selected to play the Youtube video.  However, when using something like Friendcaster to go to a linked Youtube video it wants to play directly in Silk Browser.  I find this often just locks and does not play.  This should be fixable by Amazon and luckily I am not a major youtube user, but do find this to be a hassle.

Reviews.Title: Great for the college student with down time.
Reviews.Author: MrCrobos
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted to avoid paying for the data plan of a smart phone.  I have a cheap little cell with just phone and text, and everywhere I go I have great wifi connectivity, so a tablet seemed Ideal.  At school I get to see all sorts of other people's tablets so I could compare them really well, and the Fire HD was the one missin, because it had just come out.  So I took the risk because the price was so much better.The picture was amazingly good, even when using the HDMI output on a 55" 720p it's still a beautiful crisp image.The battery while watching streaming movies from Amazon Prime or Netflix is about 6-7 hours.  If you aren't streaming it gets closer to the 10 hour mark, but I only watch the streaming ones at school.  If you're listening to streaming radio or MP3's the battery life is closer to like 25 hours, but I'd never leave it unplugged and doing something that long.The page suggests you buy their special charger adapter, but any wall plugged charger of that size will work, so if you have the same for your phones and other devices, just use that one.  Plugged into the wall it charges while you use it, plugged into a USB port, it only charges when off or in standby mode, but will maintain your charge while using it.The power and hdmi ports aren't in the best spot, I have the case that amazone made, which stand up great, but the power is along the bottom side, so makes it difficult to watch and charge while standing.  I solved this by saving the box it came in, and cutting a little notch out of it for the power cable to point down from.The speakers are great, but they're specifically designed to give optimal sound when you're hands are cupped around them and poiting them at your ears.  If you're using the reccommended case stand, you'll lose a lot of volume to the room behind it.  I'm going to make a special stand for mine that properly directs the sound and allows the power in as the same time.Apps from Andriod via amazone does limit the amount of apps you can use, but there's still a ton of them out there.  All the big names are there, and lots of free knock offs.  You can't use software from other things on it it seems, but maybe that'll be solved in the future, however that hasn't been an issue so far, aside from programs that violate copywrite laws, such as emulators/roms, I haven't found anything anyone else had that wasn't available through the app store.Free app everyday between $0.49-$3.99, it's randomly chosen by amazone, and often theme based around the holidays, most are lame, but a few were really good.Amazone prime for students is half priced, so all that streaming prime content this device is perfect for is cheaper then a net flix account, but comes with the free book a month, and prime shipping rates.I've got friends who have Ipads and galaxy tabs, they paid more, have bigger screens, and yet they're still envious of this perfectly sized tablet.  It's not that it's better in every direction, it's that it's perfect for what we need and want it to do.12/21/2012I'm still loving this thing, friends are loving it as well.  Tried out the HDMI out on a 55 in screen TV, thought it would be a bit grainy, but the picture held a true 720p picture.  Was really impressed, not I can put my amazon prime and netflix on any TV and not have to lug around my Xbox everywhere.  My mother's getting one, my GF's getting one, and I'm getting two E-books this semester for it, saving myself a total of $120 dollars, so it's almost paid for it's self.

Reviews.Title: Fellow retirees - Just Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Patty
Reviews.Content: I bought this via my credit union's rewards program, practically the only up to date electronic gizmo offered. I love, love it, love it. I was sans electric for four days during Sandy and I could still read and email. Not only that but getting all comfy under the covers with it is akin to the flashlight `forts' we used to make as kids. It is very easy to figure out, usable right out of the box and then, with apps, highly configurable if you are into that sort of thing which I am. The color is brilliantly crisp and clear and the audio is great although I have only listened to books on it so far, no music. I splurged on the leather cover - horrendously overpriced - and carry it with me in my purse everywhere I go.I do wish it had an app like the iPad one where you hold it up to the sky and see the constellations above you in real time but that is the only area of disappointment. There have been so many times when I am reading a book and just stop and wonder at what a truly marvelous device this is, how far we have come so quickly. I just finished a sequel to a book published a few years ago and thought when I read the first book it was a book, a book made out of paper and that, at that time, I had not envisioned I would be reading the sequel on such a magical device.So many of my friends, fellow retirees, still struggle with their computers and are baffled and helpless as soon as something goes wrong. I have told several to just replace the pc/laptop with this. A regular keyboard is nice for sending long emails but let's face it, mostly what goes through the tubes is pictures of cats, not philosophical ramblings, and the onscreen keyboard provided is totally adequate for most missives.

Reviews.Title: I like the Fire HD. Plus, changing the Home Screen.
Reviews.Author: Michael Miner "LowBFlat"
Reviews.Content: I have had every Kindle since the first when it was so hard to NOT turn a page. The HD screen makes everything better. Text is sharper. Everything, overall, is better looking.I have seen a lot of bad press about the recommendations replacing the favorites below the carousel. If you want to turn off the recommendations, pull down the top menu and select "more". Then "Applications", Amazon Home Recommendations". That is where you can select whether to see them or not. If you shut them off, the carousel is the only thing on the home page.

Reviews.Title: Break on through to the other side.......
Reviews.Author: David M. Smith
Reviews.Content: Ok, I resisted the E Reader concept for a long time. I could not accept the concept of giving up something as tangible as books. I have books that I've owned for YEARS. Sadly, I rarely ever re-read any of them. It's an investment in boxes of stuff that clutters up my life and weighs me down. My resistance was based on thousands of dollars spent on vinyl records, Beta and VHS Tapes, and Cassettes. All became obsolete because of our insatiable desire to become techno-geeks. With the release of the Kindle Fire, I was tempted. It offered more than just the sterile white pages of electronic literature. It had color, it had sound, it was multi-media in the palm of your hand. And yet I still resisted. It wasn't until that I broke down and got a "Smart" phone, that I realized what I was missing. The new Kindle Fire HD is everthing Amazon claims it is. I watch favorite tv shows through Amazon Prime, I get magazines, books and movies in HD. The sound quality is excellent considering the speakers are so small.  And no more magazines, and books to clutter up my life. I can read them all on the Fire HD. I'm hooked. I've crossed over, I'm one of THEM.......

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Pharynx
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a fantastic tablet.The HD screen is awesome. I've enjoyed watching animated movies and some of my favorite classics on the vivid screen. STUNNING quality images!The app store offers tons of apps & games for free and for purchase. The selection gets bigger everyday.  I have no doubt that the amazon app library will soon be as extensive as the Apple app library.Some said the Fire HD couldn't compete with the iPad. I beg to differ.  I used my sister's iPad regularly. I fell in love with it---but I couldn't afford my own.The Kindle Fire HD solved that problem. Only $199. THAT I could afford. It does just about all the same things. And I personally like the slightly smaller size. I got the 7" Fire.The internet access interface gets me onto the internet immediately. It's not sluggish or lacking in any way. If you use amazon.com as your primary e-store you'll love it. I say that because the purchase of the Fire HD includes a free month of their PRIME service which gives you FREE 2-Day delivery on purchases (as well as a free qualifying book per month & free streaming of qualified tv shows & movies.) For me, it's a real money-saver. I'm 100% confident shopping on amazon.com so doing so with the Fire HD makes it that much better.I've added my own photos and home videos to my Fire HD via the micro-USB cable to my pc.I can skype for free with any other skype users.I'm not a big gamer but I like casino games & I've picked up some cool games at the app store.I'm a big camera person & I just wish the Kindle Fire HD had the option to take & record pictures and video. It already has the camera mounted within the frame for crying out loud. I can use it to skype but it can't snap pictures or do videos. I'm sure that feature is coming to the Fire down the line.Overall, don't hesitate to buy the Fire HD. It's so much fun and it's affordable. Absolutely stands up to the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Lila "Lila"
Reviews.Content: I run a Nanny business with my Kindle fire HD! I apply for jobs and track my appointments with it. I thought this tablet did not have a camera but if you get the Imo instant messaging app you can take photos and send then through that.  I am able to upload photos to face book, download picture attachments from there or an email.  The sound is great, the graphics sharp and the tablet is fool proof! My friends bought the Samsung galaxy and not only did it cost quit a bit more they had to make several trips back to the "brick and mortar" store for help in using it! I love the telephone feature, again through Imo who links all my messaging sites together. The Amazon Kindle fire store and customer support can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 7" tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Halgrim
Reviews.Content: I didnt think I needed this because I have  Fire but this is awesome. I love shape better. the picture in hd is enough better that you can tell it.  the sound is great dont have to have extra speakers. Buttons and ports are located well. very east to set up and It takes you through the beginning set up. Its not heavy and with the case I got fits nicely in my purse.  easy to upload doc and pictures to cloud drive but  click and drop.I have put quite a few apps movies books and music on it and no trouble. easy to see outside.  Thanks for the Hd however I still like my fire I will give to my granddaughter because the hd is great. Great to have especially since I am a prime member and have been for years. Fast downloads Haven't tried skype yet but will. 16 gb is a lot of memory esp when you can keep most of stuff on the cloud.  The cloud is great.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I've been playing with my Kindle Fire HD for the past week or so and I absolutely love it! The screen resolution is stunning, the web is quick, and the speakers are the best I've ever heard on a tablet. Amazon delivers with its music, video, and book marketplace. Anything that they don't have with their app market place can easily be side loaded from another android device.  It is a little heavy compared to the Nexus but amazon instant video is more than enough to offset this for me. The advertisements are only displayed on the lock screen. I actually like them because amazon frequently gives discounts to their music, movies, and books through them.All in all, I'd say it was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: amd19999
Reviews.Content: I nervously preordered the Kindle Fire HD before I could read any reviews.  The only items that I own that I can compare this to is an Ipod Touch 4 and a laptop.  The laptop gets used a lot and now there is another "toy" to use if one person is using the laptop.The screen quality is awesome!  I was very impressed.I agree with the other comments on the volume and power buttons.  I am sure I will get use to it though.I am not that affected by the lack of a charger.  I am use to my Ipod needing a computer or borrowing the adaptor from my cellphone, so this was no different to me.  I did not purchase the charger, and probably will not.The ads do not bother me at all.  I would not spend the $15 to make them go away either.I really like the leather case I got to go with it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: SVBeta
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 7".  It has been great!! I have it linked to my iPhone4 and sync's wonderful.  I love the text to speech when it gets noisy in the coffee shops.  My wife has the iPad 2 and has Kindle app.  The one thing she does not have is text to speech on iPad which would be nice. Back on the Kindle Fire HD the best investment made to date!!  Have books on the go without the added weight of a large bag to carry them (TIMBUK2), and the text to speech is a bonus!!!The ads on the begging of startup not really a bother.. Fast Wi-Fi I have a Cisco Dual Band and have the iPad and Kindle Fire @ 5 GHz band, no problem.Thanks Kindle Team for a great product.SVDid not decide to buy the original fire due to no video output, with HDMI out I was sold on Kindle Fire HD!!

Reviews.Title: Best 7inch tablet
Reviews.Author: DoctorCartoon "AK"
Reviews.Content: I have used all 7 inch tablets on the market, the Sam sung galaxy ...very sluggish and horrible os. The galaxy plus, not much different just thinner and touch faster. The nexus 7 is the only 7 inch tablet that was ever worth buying until now. The new kindle fire hd is great its has a beautiful screen that rivals the ipad 3. ( have owned it as well) the build quality is damn near perfect..and far superior to any 7 inch tablet out...this includes the nexus 7 which is good in its own right but is cheaply built to keep cost down, and has less the memory for storage. The sound I cannot explain how good the sound is it really needs to just be listened too..it is clear and louder than my Mac book pro and many other lap tops..I say laptop because in regards to audio no tablet comes close..not even apple. The built in skype works fine, not a hiccup. The new feautres to remove items off carousel is nice..a simple update allowing us to control what apps the carousel can access would be smart in future, but for now  this is ok. The screen resolution is so pretty and bright I honestly think it looks better than ipad 3. The keyboard is finally responsive enough to use that I don't want to toss the device out the window ( 1st gen Kindle Fire)  The best part is we get all this for the same price as a nexus but with more storage 16 gigs vs 8 , and I personally feel the best customer service hands down. The only way it could be better service would be if I worked for Amazon. I am very happy with the overall feel, look and usage of the device. Many will qualm about the lack of a Quadcore which I can see and understand but I do not see the nexus 7 doing anything this device can't...and everything just looks better on this device. If your an avid amazon user like myself I highly recoomend this as well as the official amazon cover ...no I don't work for Amazon but I purchased this as well and for 44 dollars you get a very sleak cover that fits like a glove. Its worth the 44 dollar price tag trust me. The black is gorgeous and very professional looking and the 7 inch is so thin it doesn't feel like a burden to carry. I love larger tablet but the thing is anything 9 inches or larger and you have to carry a bag to put it in. And in my opinion I would carry a laptop if I have to take a bag. But with this it fits, and  its like holding a paperback, it fits in cargo pants pocket, and has great battery life. Any questions just comment below.

Reviews.Title: Updated from original review.
Reviews.Author: Robyn "Mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my daughters for Christmas. I have an iPad and it seems the three of us are always competing to use it. It is so user friendly and intuitive. i read many reviews on the kindle fire and expected it to be perfect for my daughters' needs, using it for reading books, some game apps and some video. I started with the set up. Fine, except it doesn't respond to gentle tapping. I don't know if this is typical or if I have a bad one but I have to keep tapping all over the screen to get it to register. I had no problem setting up my Amazon pay account, that was made supremely easy, of course. I bought one book for my daughter and despite trying, you cannot alter the size of the font. It looks like microfiche. Like a scanned picture of a page from a real book. Ridiculous, I paid $5.99 for something less than a real book. It was only after tapping the screen and slashing at it for awhile that I was able to read a review for the book that says it's not formatted for Kindle reading. They should not even sell books that are not useable! Now it's my problem to get my money back. The Help settings are not helpful at all. I am so disappointed in my purchases. I've been a long time user and fan of Amazon but I am not happy with the Fire at all.3/13 - I was very unhappy initially, however, I realized later that I opened the Fire that was pre-programmed and labeled as Robyn's 2nd Kindle, because I bought 2 at the same time. I was a little bothered that it was already "coded" with my name, makes me wonder what all is in there already. The other Fire was labeled Robyn's Kindle. After I opened that one and got it started they both started to sync up.  While someone evidently knew i would need to have them identified differently, there were no instructions for making sure one was initiated before the other, i figured it out on my own.The original book I bought is still as is, but now I've learned to look more closely at the reviews. My daughters both learned how to navigate it fairly quickly, but that being said, I wouldn't recommend just handing it over without making sure the parental controls are on etc. they love heir Kindle's, and they do have a great display and do what they say they can do, but they aren't an ultimate machine. They're still small to read and it's obviously different than reading from a book, but it's great for some games and Internet searches and all the little things you use your computer or phone for. I still don't think they should offer book that aren't formatted correctly, that is pure bait and switch, you shouldn't have to pour over multiple reviews to find out what a product really is.Overall though, the Kindle is a great tool.

Reviews.Title: Big Improvement over the original Fire
Reviews.Author: ILoveGadgets "Gadgets always fit"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to use my new Kindle Fire HD for a period of time before writing a review.  Below are the reasons why I give it 5 stars.PROS* Screen is vastly improved.  Truly a WOW when I saw it the first time.* Touch is much more responsive and consistent.  This was very evident while reading the Wall Street Journal on the tablet.* Easier access to cloud stored photos.  I setup some folders on my storage and that created the photo album.* Reading experience improved.  Very much linked to the new improved screen and touch response from the device.* Better sound out of the device.  No tablet has been stellar on the sound but this is probably as good as it gets acknowledging that speakers are not a strong suit for any tablet.* Still at an incredibly affordable price.* Addition of buttons for the volume control.  It is easier to work with those buttons via the Kindle cover offered by Amazon that has the magnetic closure.* Favorites are now accessible at any point and don't require you to go back to the home screen.  I have used that feature many times.  While I am browsing if an email arrives, I touch the star and pop into my email and when I leave, I am right where I was before.  That was a very good addition.* Silk browser has been more responsive and stable.* Wifi has been much more stable and strong.* Much improved mail client.  I love the fact that it now syncs with my calendar and contacts.I am ambivalent about the ads on the lock screen.  I know I can opt out at anytime in the Manage Kindles page.  I am also ambivalent about the display of what others purchased based on what I am viewing on the main screen.  Most of the time I do look at that.  It is the purchases that you guys make that have led me to find things I was looking for or things that turned out to be fun and I didn't know they were there.I have only 1 gripe.  That is the relocation of the port for the power.  When I watch movies with it turned horizontal, I used to be able to connect the charger while watching the movie.  Now I cannot do that because what happens when I start a movie is that it rotates to where that port is on the bottom.  Additionally the Amazon cover has been designed with that in mind and so it drives home that design as being intentional but maybe not totally well thought out.  If I could I would deduct a quarter star to a half star for that.  I am not willing to deduct a full star since overall I have been extremely pleased with the purchase.I have had several tablets since they started coming to market including the beloved iPad.  I can never do my job on a tablet due to the necessary tools and environment I must have so tablets are for enjoyment whether that involves feeding the news junkie in me, checking the weather, checking email, or playing games.  I would bet there are people who won't believe that I am sincere that I prefer my Fire over my iPad but I do.  That is the great thing about the iPad, Kindle Fire, Nook, Android tablets in general, and the new to market Windows 8.  There are choices for everyone and there is no wrong choice.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle perfect size for my autistic son
Reviews.Author: C. Siobhan Bataille
Reviews.Content: I got the KINDLE FIRE HD for my 5 year old Autistic son. I will not go into all the specs. I will leave that up to the people who know more about that then me. I will say it is easy to use and the perfect size for kids and adults. The reason I got the KINDLE FIRE HD is my son loves to watch his videos and look at his books every where we go. He also loves to go on youtube and netflix and play some games. I have been using an Ipad 3 I got him a few months ago but with all the other items he needs to bring with him every time we go somewhere the Ipad is just to big to carry around. My son is non verbal and has to bring his talking device with him everywhere, and it is about the size of a large book and very heavy. The KINDLE FIRE HD fits right in the bag with his talker and is always with him. Don't get me wrong the Ipad is great but he is 5 and it is a little large for him to lug around. Also do to the cost of it I am more then a little worried every time he uses it without me. The KINDLE FIRE HD on the other hand does everything he want's it to and much more and it is perfect for his little hands. I just put on a screen protector and a good protective case and I feel much more comfortable about allowing him to use it on his own. He is very good about not breaking his stuff but accidents happen so I always get the insurance. Of course I got the KINDLE FIRE HD because I Will be using it when he's not looking. I'm sure the standard KINDLE FIRE would have worked just fine also but as my wife says I tend to use his toys just as much as he does. Now if I can just talk her into letting me get another one for myself we won't have to fight over it ha ha. I have tried many of the other less expensive (not much less) tablets out there and they all have been just that  "LESS". If you are thinking of getting a cheaper tablet to save a few dollars think very carefully about it. Believe me it is not worth the 40 or 50 dollars you will save just to have it not work when you need it most. I thought a couple of the tablets I tried were good, Then I gave them to my son and every time they failed to load or froze or just took to long to load he was very upset. And Don't get me started on the battery life. A slow tablet or a dead battery is like the end of the world to an Autistic Child and I'm sure not much better for a Child without special needs. So Thank you Amazon for a great product The KINDLE FIRE HD has made my son a very happy boy and you can not put a price on that. We can't wait to see what you will come up with next. My wife and I look foreword to helping are son learn and master all the wonderful things the KINDLE FIRE HD has to offer him. Sorry got off topic this is a review we are just very pleased with this purchase and would recommend the KINDLE FIRE HD for everyone of all age's Thank you. Logan ,Mommy and Daddy

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: pinkcrystal
Reviews.Content: I own all the apple gadgets from phones,laptop and tablet. I was kinda skeptic at first getting this kindle fire hd because am not familiar with the specs but now i have it at last. I am enjoying the lightness of this gadget while reading my books here ...The HD quality of videos and movies is awesome.  The quality of the audio is absolutely pleasing to the ears..I suggest if you want a tablet at a reasonable price get the Kindle Fire HD.. You won't regret it...

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: LovelyAlaskan
Reviews.Content: My husband went on and bought this kindle for me. At first when he asked if I wanted it I said "yeah sure why not", not really super excited about it. I wanted it but wasn't wild about it. It finally came in and I gotta say I can't stop using it! I do LOVE IT! My first thoughts of it were "what am I going to use it for"?, "how often will I use it?" , etc. I've had it now for only 3 days or so and I love it! The games are fun to blow away some time, its light enough for me to carry anywhere , so where ever there is wi-fi (wireless internet to those who are not computer savvy), I can get online with it. It holds a ton of books. I like to have cookbooks on hand when I am cooking so it is awesome for that and of coarse just to have so I can enjoy a book. I love the borrow feature I get with my Amazon Prime and the sample features to give me an idea what the books are like without having to make bad purchases to find out. I have a laptop that I absolutely love but I don't always want or need to pull it out wehn I have/want to look something up real fast online. It's also easier for me to keep and access the apps you can get like "out of milk" for shopping and pantry lists. I also live in "bush Alaska" where we are constantly flying to go into town and this will definately pass the time away because it holds lots of movies and you can rent/borrow from Amazon Prime as well. Its just an all around cool device that I thought I had no need for but I was way wrong it really comes in handy!

Reviews.Title: W.O.W
Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: I just received this fantastic product today. I had some birthday money saved up and preordered this along with a Belkin stylus and a fountain blue Belkin Case. I am VERY happy with the Kindle Fire HD so far. I had originally been saving up for the original Kindle Fire, but I'm very glad I held out and got this instead. My sister has the original kindle, and the HD really blows it away. The touch screen is so much faster and clearer. I really liked that this came pre registered. It saved a LOT of time. The speakers also far surpass the original Kindle. The wifi signal is much stronger. I can now be connected anywhere in my house, something I wasn't able to do on my iPod Touch. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase. I would buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: great product highly recomend
Reviews.Author: Steveabe
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my step-daughter as a birthday present. She is in her 20's and is very intelligent and educated, with 2 masters degrees. I understood when I bought this that it is mostly a "consuming oriented" device.  Here is my verdict, and my step-daughters verdict: It is a wonderful device. It functions better than we expected. It is just the right size for travel. The screen is beautiful. Movies, books, surfing the web, all seamless and flawless. My step-daughter and I both intend on purchasing the Microsoft Surface tablet when it comes out, as we both need productivity machines. However, for non-business purposes, the Kindle Fire is a winner.My advise is "know what you are buying". If you are looking for a productivity tablet, do not buy this.If you are looking for something for books, movies, surfing the internet, email, etc. this is a great great device for this price.And yes, taking all factors into account,  GOODBYE  IPAD.........your time has passed!!!!!!!!!!At least in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: From a user that does not consume for Apple, nor expects this device to be "better" than others.
Reviews.Author: Gjvon Graves "Gjvon"
Reviews.Content: I own a Fire, and now I own a Fire HD. First of all, I am an IPAD user and this is NOT a comparison at all. Kindles are unique devices for users that love reading and doing other things that they love with a tablet. Honestly, I believe the key was to reel in the book lovers that love to also listen to music, play games, and browse when reading gets a tad boring.The Fire, along with Amazon Prime, the Kindle store, and cloud storage, has turned book reading into a whole new light.I love the screen! I was outdoors on break from military training and decided to finish "The Girl with the Dragon Tat.," and I promise you, the screen will diminish sun rays where its now possible to enjoy reading in the sun.The sound is awesome also. best I have heard on a tablet so far. Obviously they wanted you to realize you don't always need expensive headsets. Good job. Now I don't need to wear my BOSE headsets in quiet spaces just to get some great sound.This is not a COMPLETE review because I use my Kindle to read, and when I am bored, play spades and browse the internet. For 200 bucks, I love this device so much. I even offered to buy friends this device because it makes reading so much fun.Obviously there are glitches and small freezes occasionally, but for a device like this and with a $200 price tag? I can not seem to care like most of the negative comments. Very Happy

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Mom of 4
Reviews.Content: Okay so I did a lot of research before I got my Kindle Fire HD.  I am an owner of a Kindle Keyboard which I will say is well used and I have had for almost 2 years.  My husband wanted to get me this for a gift and I was very torn about getting it.  The thing is I couldn't see spending $200 (almost) on it when I was happy with my Kindle Keyboard.I have to say I am very pleased with the kindle fire hd.  I have had it for a month now, I waited to make a review to be sure I had used all of the features and had time to think through if I was going to keep it or not.  My most favorite thing about this vs the kindle keyboard is the ability to see book covers. Sometimes I buy some books or get them when they are free or 99 cent and don't read them for a while.  The ability to see covers is awesome!Now other than that, the internet works well on it.  I like that it doesn't take me to the mobile site for everything which makes things a lot easier.  I haven't had any issues with it yet (knock on wood lol).  All of the features work fine.  It took a google search to figure out how to lock the screen in landscape or portrait, but I now have that down, it was easy I was looking in the wrong place.I have watched movies on it, the case I got allows it to be propped up and my kids have watched a movie on it too.  Very easy to use.  Some of the apps I have had issues with but I am not sure if that's the kindle or the app itsself.  It was nothing important and I just didn't worry about it.My recommendation, if you are debating it go ahead and get it.  You won't be sorry you did.  :)  (Mine was bought from Amazon.com just not from my account since it was a gift)

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Dland
Reviews.Content: I first ourchased a Kindle Touch, then a Kindle Fire, then the Kindle Fire HD 7", 3gb, witout options. I love it so far. The sound is absolutely great on this Kindle. The video quality is also great. I have to also add that the Amazon Customer Service is great to work with too. I had a problem with the Kindle Fire where it would no longer take a charge. I chatted with customer service and they put an order in for a new replacement while I was chatting with them. The brand new Kindle Fire arrived two days later with a pre-paid return lable. It didn't cost me a dime. So far, the best customer service that I have encountered with any company. The one thing I do not like is the fact that digital copy movies cannot be viewed or downloaded on the Kindle Devices. I pre-purchased the 4-DVD BlueRay Promethieus with digital copy from Amazon. When I redeemed my digital copy, it was through Ultra-Violet or Itunes...only. I can not watch my digital copy on my Kindle Fire HD. I contacted customer service about the issue and they told me that at this time, there is no solution to have the ability to use the Digital Copy feature from any DVD sets on the Kindle. They DID however offer a full refund for the DVD set that I purchased, and they even sent me the pre-paid return lable. You will be happy with the Fire HD....just don't expect to use it on your next flight to watch a digital copy. You can purchase and rent movies from Amazon and download them for viewing later, so don't think that the Fire HD is not capable of playing movies..it is. I do not think anyone would be unhappy with the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Look no further!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lisa D. Brown "L Hawk"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought myself and my six year old daughter a Kindle HD for Christmas this year from Best Buy. I own a Kindle E-reader keyboard,I am pleased to announce that this is the  best gift, I love it! I took it out the box to give it a test run last night, and I am pleased to announce it worked flawless, books are beautiful, crisp, clear, and colorful. The touch screen is fast, and not lagging. The sound is loud and clear, I watched the Walking Dead and was enthusiastic, and amazed at the high quality screen. I searched my email and it was not just some run of the mill email, it was the same as looking at it on the email on my desktop computer. I tested the browser which was fast, and went to YOU TUBE but the videos did not load, but I easily fixed that< I just downloaded a free app on Amazon called Tubemate YOUTUBE downlownloader and that worked perfect, and flawless, it even let me save videos that I like to my Kindle or just watch whatever videos I chose. The camera works beautiful, I downloaded the $1.99 app call HD Camera Kindle Tablet it works perfect, I can take pictures, and record videos, and to get rid of the video, I just held the video I recorded and deleted the content, and got rid of the picture by going to the pictures on the tablet and selecting the trash can icon and deleted, also you can control the brightness by playing with the manual settings on the app. All in all this is the best on the market, it does all that I need and more, and I am sure my 6 year old will love it because of the kid friendly apps, books, movies, as well as videos. I would gladly recommend this to anyone looking to buy a tablet. I am just glad that Amazon listens and read all reviews because they have did a fantastic job on the product, as well offering content to go along with the tablet, thanks you so much for looking at quality instead of quantity, or competition. Great Job Amazon, and Apps designers too!!!

Reviews.Title: Trouble with HDMI Cable
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: To start off with, I would like to have given the Kindle Fire HD 5 stars, butfor the problem I encountered connecting it to my Sony Bravia HDTV.The issue is that Amazon does not say anything about the type of Micro-HDMIcable to use. I assumed that the one that I had purchased a year ago for myAndroid phone would work. It did not...After talking with customer support (they were very responsive, but not helpful),I thought I would try buying an expensive cable at Staples. This one did not workeither. Amazon then sent me a new Kindle.I decided to check out cables listed on Amazon, read the reviews, and found onethat people said they found worked. I purchased it quickly and tried iton my original Fire HD. It worked!!! I returned the replacement Kindle.The moral of the story is: Not all Micro-HDMI cables are created equally :(This one does work:Mediabridge Flex Series - High Speed Micro-HDMI to HDMI Cable with Ethernet (6 Feet)I hope Amamzon support and their documentation will be updated to preventfuture customers from having this problem.Happy now, but frustrated.P.S. This cable does not cost that much. It would help if Amazon includedit in their Kindle package.P.S.S. After getting this to work via direct connect to my TV, I tried connectingthrough my Yamaha 6.1 Amp with HDMI switching... works great.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HD is a smooth and fast tablet.  The screen resolution and sound are fine.  We have used it for Internet, email, video, games, Skype, photos, music, and books.  We like that it is a small size to fit in a purse.  We found some cheap accessories (case, stylus, charger) on eBay.  We have high speed Internet at home and we have never experienced any delays in downloads or operation.  There might be better tablets available, but definitely no complaints with this one.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Eric W
Reviews.Content: Originally I had planned to get a Nexus 7 for myself due to my wife having the original Kindle Fire and me not liking it at all.  Out of the blue, I decided that since I couldnt ever get my hands on a Nexus 7 to go ahead and get the Kindle Fire HD.......WOW!  I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to setup and I really love Amazon's eco-system - one place to get music, books, videos, etc on one device.  The colors and the clarity of the screen are truly remarkable and the speed of it is really nice....so much better than my Blackberry Playbook that I bought a while ago.  Games run smooth on the device and the screen makes the colors pop and the graphics engine in the Kindle is nice as well.  Browsing the web, Skype, music, movies, books, etc you name it - you can get it all on the Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet with Incredible Screen and Sound!
Reviews.Author: Zehrfox
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Kindle Fire HD.  I received mine on Sept 17th and took it over to my friends to compare it to his Nexus 7.  Compared to mine, HIS screen looks faded and colors washed out, also the text is much clearer on the KFHD.  The sound is also obviously better, higher volume and quality output on the KFHD.Display - Winner KFHDSound  - Winner KFHDSoftware - Winner Nexus 7I was aware of the software issues, tablet is locked into the Amazon ecosystem.  I was worried that I would not be able to download and use all the apps and games I wanted to (since there is NO Google Play available without rooting).  Despite these "limitations", I found nearly everything I wanted in the Amazon App Store, and for those that are not there, you have several "options" for getting them anyway.  I would like to have ALL Google Apps working out of the box, and Jellybean with all its enhancements, but having twice the storage and an HDMI port, along with the better screen and speakers, it is just hard to beat the KFHD (in my opinion).Overall the higher quality screen, sound and just solid feel of the Kindle Fire HD has won me over.  IMHO these features make up for the small software issues that I personally encountered.  Also with the Dev community already rooting and making mods for all the google apps, I feel that the software issues are easily resolved if you are willing to wait and tinker.  Where as you can not change the screen or speakers on the Nexus 7.Awesome Tablet, loving it more everyday, everyone comments on how incredible the screen looks, and the HDMI has been so useful for business and personal entertainment and just an awesome feature to have when you want or need it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD -- Great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: While I admit that this newest Kindle has it's problems, the pros far outweigh the cons.I just turned on my new HD this morning. When I saw the new screen resolution, a smile broke out on my face. The new "HD" feature is absolutely amazing. The Dolby Sound is so worth it as well -- music is crisp and clear, and LOUD. I have nothing bad to say about the new speakers. They are amazing.Another feature I particularly enjoy is the new 10-touch screen. The old Kindle Fire only allowed a two point touch capability, while on this new Kindle all my fingers can be used AT ONCE to play games (i.e., works well with Fruit Ninja).The CAMERA! I absolutely love having Skype so readily available.  For those of us who have relatives who live far distances away, this is nice to keep in touch.I also like how the bottom menu bar always stays to one side of the Kindle HD, no matter how you turn it or rotate it or whatever. Also, your Favorites are always available to click on by finding the Star icon.The price of the Kindle Fire HD is awesome. The original Kindle Fire was the same price when it first came out, and this one (being an improvement) is the same price?? That is great. $200 is a reasonable price for such a great high-quality product.Longer battery life! Up to 11 hours (supposedly) for longer use. For me this is fantatsic, because I use my Kindle whenever I travel for long periods of time.Plus, I am an avid reader.This new Kindle is also 16 GB. More books, more apps, more music, more stuff available to buy and keep without using Cloud! Don't get me wrong, Cloud is great, but now I don't need Wifi to access more of my stuff whenever I want to. I just love this new Kindle. :)However, some things I don't particularly like about this new Kindle are as follows:>The e-Mail format: Just Inconvenient, not as nice as before on the original Kindle Fire.>The charging and HDMI out: Inconvenient placing on the horizantal side of the Kindle. Plus, no charging light. But oh well.>No virtual shelf background. The original Kindle Fire had the Shelf look, but this one does not. It's no big deal, I just kinda miss the "good-old-fashioned" bookshelf.>Ads and Amazon promos. It doesn't bother me at all, but it seems to be a big issue for some. The one thing I DO like about this is the "Customers also bought..." feature below books you've already purchased. It' nice for seeing new, suggested books that I'd like to read.Overall, and despite the occcasional flaw, I LOVE THIS NEW PRODUCT. Kudos, Amazon. This new Kindle is comparable to the iPad. If $200 is within your price range, why not upgrade from an old Fire to this new Fire HD?

Reviews.Title: Really amazed
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: I have been an Amazon Kindle user since the 2nd generation ereader.  I found I never needed any more that an ereader because I do have a smartphone that covered my needs otherwise.  I have been interested in getting a tablet to ease my facebook, internet  and twitter experience.  The smartphone display is very small and eyestrain was becoming a problem with extended usage.  I considered the original Kindle Fire, but wasn't convinced I really needed it.Then came the Kinde Fire HD. I was ready to go for a tablet and upon my research, I found I didn't want anything as physically large as the iPad and I was put off by the price and most of all, the screen glare. I didn't trust the other products enough to buy, except maybe the Nook, but I didn't care much for it when I tried one at the store and found the products one could download lacking.  When Amazon updated the the original Kindle Fire to the HD model I was sold. Glare resisant screen, HD, decent selection of TV shows and movies and the Prime Service which offers many free products and is really very inexpensive.  The price of $199. was more than I could resist. Most of all, I trust Amazon products.  I haven't had a moments problem with any of my Kindle ereaders (I have had 3) and the Amazon customer service is excellent. Althought the Kindle Fire HD 7" isn't as lightweight as my Kindle Touch, I am still very happy with the ease of handling it when laying down. I am happy with the quality of the apps and haven't had any issues since the first moment I turned it on.  The sound is very good, the quality of the TV and movie displays are great.  I was concerned it would be slow reacting, but haven't found that to be an issue.  I don't really need 4G because I usually use the Fire to read books or watch a downloaded movie when I am away from home and at home, I have WIFI.  The special offers model isn't invasive at all.  As a matter of fact, it has accomplished what is has set out to do, sell me something.So the utilmate comment is that the Kindle Fire HD 7" is exactly what I was looking for all around.  Not too big, not too small...it is just right.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I was one of the first to get an iPad.  I have purchased and used every version of iPad that has been released since.  When the Kindle Fire came out, it was the first tablet other than the iPad the got my interest.  While I enjoyed the Kindle Fire, it didn't come close to the iPad.  I mainly used it for my audible books, but I did like how it was tied in to my Amazon account.  I purchased the Kindle Fire HD because I wanted to see the improvements.  I got my new device two days ago.  There are improvements over the first Kindle Fire.  All and all, it is a Kindle Fire with all the things that Amazon did right the first time, but the improvements send it over the top for me.  I have thoroughly enjoyed the new Kindle Fire HD!  I like that it is thinner ... it just fits in your hand better and is more manageable.  The web browser works much better also.  The speakers are amazing for a tablet.  Being a big audible person, I am very impressed with how integrated audible is with my new device and with the Kindle books.  I don't know that another tablet will completely replace the iPad for me, but I have barely picked up my iPad for the past few days because I have enjoyed this new device so much. The size makes it easier to take with you around town. The only thing I wish is that Amazon would sell a 7" Kindle Fire HD with a 3G or 4G option.Update as of Oct 9, 2012:  I tried the Skype but the camera didn't work.  I called Amazon and they, without any issue, sent me a new one.  I called them yesterday and the new one should arrive today.  I am and have always had a great experience with Amazon customer service!  Even considering the camera issue, I am loving this device more and more each day!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet!
Reviews.Author: mattyboy89 "Matt"
Reviews.Content: Excellent Tablet! Bought this at best buy and it is a big improvement over the original Kindle Fire. The sound is also AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Mid Size Tablet
Reviews.Author: Rick Bennette "Rick Bennette"
Reviews.Content: The construction quality feels very solid. The display is razor sharp with rich color and high contrast. I do not like seeing reflections in the screen. A matte finish would resolve this. It's good for reading books, better than a PC or iMac, but not as good as a dedicated kindle reader.The sound is incredible for a device with speakers this small. Not a hi-fi by any means, but crisp and clear with more low end than any other tablet so far. And plenty loud, too.The built in camera is decent. It's hi-def, but not 1080 hi def. It needs good light or it gets grainy. Decent for Skype, however. Apps allow you to save photos.The internet connection is easy to set up and the speed is nearly as fast as my desktop, which itself is only a year old Dell. The wireless wi-fi seems to connect a longer distance from the transmitter than my friend's iPad, and it picks up more choices in a downtown environment.There are a number of available free apps made specifically for this device, like Facebook, Twitter, and email, and they all work great. Many others made for Android are free and work well, too.It's easy to charge using any computer's USB port or a wall charger with a micro USB connector.
