I called and they said turn it off for 30 seconds and then let it boot up again, fixed and working great. If you care about your Kindle, spend the 45 or so bucks and get the Kindle cover. It is not soft leather, it is a tough case with all the openings in the right place. I can charge it while in the case. All ports and on/off button, sound and ac port easy to access with case on. I like convenience.

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: Gabby4
Reviews.Content: I am loving my Kindle Fire HD!  I went back and forth between this and an iPad. Finally decided on a Kindle because I really just wanted it for books, games and music.  I have all the other stuff on my iPhone.  The picture is clear, navigation is easy, the speakers are outstanding.  The battery last longer than I anticipated, too.  Reading takes almost no power, games eat up more. I actually like that it is connected to my Amazon acct and it is easy to order books and such.  I find I read more now.  I love the audible ability, and use that on a trip or while getting ready in the morning.  I would highly recommend Kindle Fire HD.  iPad is overpriced compared to this nicely done competitor.

Reviews.Title: IGNORE WHINERS..THIS PRODUCT IS WORTH MORE....
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M. Hiatt
Reviews.Content: ...than A measly $199. It leaves mini ipad in the DIRT....and for way less Dee-nero.These whiners that expect a space station for $200 just dont know what they aredoing.I find new and cool things to use this for EVERY DAY. Watched presidential debate live...HD was so clear..saw every candidates flaws perfectly.KILLER DOLBY STEREO SOUND AS WELL.WAKE UP PEOPLE..THIS IS THE BARGAIN OF OUR LIFETIME.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: My children gave me a gift card from Amazon for Christmas. I could not decide which Kindle to purchase, which is what they wanted me to buy with the card. I read reviews on the paperwhite, the 7" fire, the keyboard Kindle. My main purpose was to read; one reviewer on the fire hd said this had the best screen for reading due to the antiglare screen. That's what finally made up my mind. I did, based on his review, expect the screen to be matt, but it does have some glare & reflection. I have ordered a matt screen protector to further help the antiglare feature. Still, even with some shine, I have absolutely loved this product. Didn't think about it at the time of purchase, but the ability to download files from my pc will be a surprise bonus for me. I make jewelry using art clay silver, and I can access my photos and tutorials on my Kindle! Much easier than setting up the laptop which takes up too much room on my table with all my jewelry tools. Another bonus; you can expand the photos by spreading your fingers and I can see minute detail as I am making my jewelry. EVERY ARTIST WHO USES REFERENCE PHOTOS SHOULD BUY THIS KINDLE! I bought the Belkin cover, $29 over the cheaper leather cover due to the features of being able to stand the Kindle up. This will be perfect.The photos are stunning on the Kindle fire hd! Much more detail & sharpness than my pc. The colors are beautiful, important to an artist. I was a little worried that the screen wouldn't be large enough for me, being a baby boomer and using bifocals, but it is perfect for me. The font is adjustable anyway, but I use the default font comfortably. If the white screen is too white for you, it has a soft cream colored screen, and for those who like a black background and white lettering, that's the 3rd choice. In the settings you can select different times for an auto shut down, I set mine on 45 minutes. Also the tutorial said that the Kindle might not charge while it is on, but with the power charger(separate purchase) and the USB cable, I can use it plugged in, and then when I leave the house, I can leave with a fully charged Kindle. Yes the larger Kindle screen would be nice, but I didn't want the larger device to lug around. My purse is full enough lol! And I want to carry my Kindle with me :) I could replace my teddy bear and sleep with my Kindle I love it so much (just kidding-but I could read in bed with it).  I like being able to surf the web when I have wireless available, bigger screen than the cell phone, even though that was not a factor in choosing this device. I am not sure if you could piggyback on a cell phone to get a roaming connection to the web, but that's not what I bought it for; I have a cell that I can access the web anywhere if I need to. That's what I didn't want to do, duplicate services I already own on another device. The tutorial on the Kindle is great, even for me (a little technically challenged) it is easy to use. I like that you can download to the cloud, and access there instead of filling up the storage on the Kindle. I had no trouble at all following the instructions for using the cloud, downloading files to the Kindle, buying books & apps. The free library is wonderful, and it's easy to dump a book if you don't like it. You can completely remove any book from the device easily. They recommend that you remove unwanted files to keep storage room. I have several books and a couple of apps, all my photo files, and I've only used about 2% of my storage. This is very user friendly, thanks Amazon, seems like you've thought of nearly everything. If you are having a hard time deciding which Kindle, figure out your priority use of it, and go from there. I'm very very happy about my choice, it meets my needs perfectly, is lightweight and very portable. I'm glad I took a month to decide which Kindle to purchase. Thanks kids, one of the best gifts you've ever given me, next to you!

Reviews.Title: Love it!  vs. Samsung Galaxy the Kindle Fire HD won!
Reviews.Author: New mom "N. Jane"
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to typically write reviews but since I spent a long time researching the right tablet for our family I thought I'd give my opinion.  First, the main use for our tablet was for the kids to play apps (fun and educational) and watch movies/shows.  I wanted to be able to download movies/shows so they could watch them on the plane or if we didn't have wifi access  I also plan to use it for books for them and me.  I have other Apple products but didn't want to spend the money on something that the kids would primarily be using.  With that said I narrowed my purchase down to the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 and the Kindle Fire HD.  I actually bought both and tried both for a few days.  I read many reviews and most said to go with the Galaxy.  BUT, in the end I liked the Kindle Fire HD much better and here were my reasons:1.  I thought the screen quality was better on the Kindle Fire HD (it is amazing!!!).2.  The screen size was a little wider.3.  The interface was much more user friendly.4.  I'm a big Amazon Shopper and it just made more sense to go with the Kindle plus I plan to keep the Prime Membership up after the trial.  Like that you can borrow a book a month, get free streaming of tons of shows and movies, free 2 day shipping), lots of free books.5.  Supposedly there are many less Amazon apps than on Google Play but this has not been an issue with us at all.  All the apps we want are available on the Amazon store.6.  The big seller for me was the 16 gb internal memory versus 8 gb for the Galaxy.  Also, in reality the Galaxy only has 4 gb internal memory because half it taken up already by the operating system and other stuff that is loaded that you can't delete.  I do understand that there is the option to get an external SD card and in fact I have one but, FIRST, you can't store any apps on it only photos and movies, SECOND, it is a royal pain to transfer stuff to the extSD Card (you have to plug the tablet into the computer, transfer the files onto the computer and then put them back onto the tablet into the extSD card section.  Weird!)7.  So, even though the Kindle Fire HD with 16 gb is really only about 13 gb I like the fact that it has almost 3 times more internal memory8.  You can easily put itunes songs onto the Kindle by plugging it into the computer (have to get a free software called Android File Transfer- prompts you to download when you plug tablet into PC/Mac) and you just find your songs on the  harddrive (not through itunes) and drag to the music file on the tablet (the tablet's files come up when you plug it into the computer (and you have the Android File Transfer software downloaded).9.  To me it seemed of higher quality build.10.  I have family members with the Kindle so we can share some books (not as many as we hoped but still a neat feature).So, these are my 2 cents for what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: nzmarnz
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle for my mum who's 69 years old.  Her reaction after she opened it on Christmas Day was the best, she said, "I never thought I'd have one of these" and she had a huge smile on her face.  She likes the size of the kindle because it fits in her purse easily and she can access & update all of her contacts information.  Now she can Skype with the grandbabies anytime she wants and check out library books.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Brandy K. "Book Devourer"
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD 7" about two weeks ago and have not put it down since! I love this tablet. It is the first touch device I have ever owned and I must say it is wonderful. The touch screen is responsive in just the right way. The colors are brilliant. Watching HD movies through my Prime account looks awesome. And the sound! Wow is all I can say. When you hold the device in landscape position, it is as if the sound surrounds you. Combine that with the brilliant video quality and it is a truly immersive experience. I have found the storage to be ample thus far. I have downloaded quite a few game apps, along with a few others. I also have about 30 books and an album and still have over 11GB of free space. And speaking of books, reading on this device is a pleasure. In the past I haven't typically enjoyed reading on a screen, but being able to adjust the brightness, and putting the screen in sepia format makes it a pleasant experience. I have also only paid for one book. Amazon has so many free books available. If you have Amazon Prime, this device was made for you. With the Prime HD movies, and the lending library you can't go wrong. The device is a little heavy to hold for a long period of time when reading, but that is easy to remedy. I suggest you get the quick charger. It takes just a couple of hours to charge, versus multiple hours through the USB port on a computer. The battery lasts a long time. There have been times where my family and I have played games, read, and surfed the web for hours without using much battery life. I hope this review helps someone! It is the first one I have written.

Reviews.Title: LOVE these Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Kelly A. Fisher "Haileysmom"
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews I was hesitant on getting these for my daughters who are 23, 11 and 12.  But I got them because they really wanted this tablet.  And I am NOT disappointed.  I'm not sure what people were saying things in the other reviews about things they cannot get but my daughters get YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, can play a ton of games, this can do everything they wanted it for.  They can get Pandora and alot of other apps.  If you have kids who want to play games, watch movies, listen to music, take pictures and videos, read books, get on the internet for Facebook and other sites like that - then this is the tablet for you.  They have been on theirs for the last 3 days NON-STOP!!  They love these things.  I highly recommend this tablet.  It has GREAT sound, beautiful picture, easy to use, a ton of free apps, books and games.  The battery lasts several hours.  Only thing, you cannot play it while it is charging.  Besides that, this an awesome tablet for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Everything you've heard it to be!
Reviews.Author: Copper Dave
Reviews.Content: I've had my 7" Kindle Fire HD for just about a month now, and I have absolutely no regrets.I've never owned a tablet or an e-reader, but was starting to get back onto reading fiction, something I used to do constantly, on my Motorola Droid 3. With the new Kindle line, and price structure, I started looking into them. The basic Kindle 2 was my original focus, but the Kindle Fire 2, while twice the price, was color, and so much more than just an e-reader. And then for just a little bit more, there was the HD, that had lots more then just the HD, for the price difference. I'm 'frugal', so neither of these price  steps was taken lightly. I took a lot of time reading the specs and many reviews. The decision was made based on knowledge, not just an urge to own the latest, greatest. It was a rare personal splurge.Once I decided I could justify the expense for something that did all this model could, I then started looking at the competition.  It seems that the Google Nexus 7 was the alternative, and I essentially came to the same conclusion that many reviewers did: They are both great items, with great value. The right one for you depends on your intended use. If it is to be used primarily for work/business, the nod goes to the Google Nexus 7, because Amazon seems to have hobbled some functions to make the Kindle more Amazon-centric. I, on the other hand was looking more for something that had an entertainment focus: the HD screen regularly gets rave reviews from friends, the speaker system is impressive, even when the volume is turned up, and the HDMI output is something that most don't have, and which allows me to show movies on the family HD TV. While I was able to do this with my Motorola Droid 3 phone, it is so much easier with the Fire HD.Video is a big component of such an entertainment device, and after a month's free trial, I have decided to sign up for Amazon's Prime service. In addition to a delivery rate break of future Amazon purchases, this provides access to hundreds of free videos in a variety of categories. The list isn't as extensive as, say, Netflix, but instead of $8-9 per month, the cost is $80 per year.And books, the original motivator for this purchase, are in great supply. With the ease of publishing on the web, in addition to the classics, you'll find many new authors here. Also, unless you must have the current NY Times bestsellers, with very little effort, you should easily be able to find a huge selection of free e-books.As to a couple of the negatives that have been brought up: The lack of a plug end on the USB/mini USB cable was not an issue for me because I just use the one that I use for my Droid phone. I can understand Amazon not including it to save on costs, but the purchase price for one if you do need it, is a bit extreme. And the Ads, that you can make go away for an extra $15 are a bit of an affront, given a device you bought is trying to sell you things, but they are not intrusive. When the unit is shut off, the screen is blank. When you turn it on (instant on), you see an add for a car, or laptop, etc. Swipe your finger to the right and you see more about the product. Swipe your finger to the left, and you an punch in your security code to start using the tablet. Assuming these ads helped keep the cost of the Kindle down, I think the trade is fair.As a 'give' to it's supporters, Amazon might want to consider automatic removal of the ads, a year after the item was purchased. Surely the ads would have paid for themselves after a year, and I'm sure this would address some of the animosity felt toward the ads.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't change it for nothing else
Reviews.Author: DMurphy "DeeDee"
Reviews.Content: I just love my Kindle Fire HD with offers.  When I read the reviews of other people prior to my purchase there were complaints of the offers which are not even noticeable.  Besides, I like the offers.  The Kindle has a whole lot of options and things that I haven't even figured out as of yet.  Slowly but surely I run across something new here and there.  My daughter in law just bought a tablet (oversized cellphone) which can not top the Kindle Fire HD in any way.  She's missing out in my opinion.  Folks, it is the bomb.  I do everything on it.  Watch movies with my Amazon Prime Membership, read books, magazines, all of my email accounts are on it, play games, go on the Internet, etc.  It is just so much you can do.  I found the app to unlock the camera which works just to my liking.  So far I'm a happy camper..  There is just one thing that I don't like about this item.  It is the fact that I can't watch movies on the go.

Reviews.Title: Ipad killer
Reviews.Author: A. Somers
Reviews.Content: I have been an amazon customer for years and known about kindle I am usually first to be interested and my ears almost prick up when I learn about new gadgets and technology. My own experience with these up until now has been to look at them while other people are using them - so frustrating but it just piqued my curiosity all the same while giving me a preview of how they can be used in any public setting...What I figured out is if people can't keep their hands off it must be something really useful. But I digress and so much of the time I spend I found them in the suburbs, urban settings all kind of places usually medical offices and such, and the airports. Major airports. I think the kindle is great, great idea put to work here, and this is what I love about it -* It starts up right away* It is easily connected to the wifi after setting it up.* There is no glare so we can have less strain on the eyes as well as use it in any light source.* It works well with the movies in the Amazon Prime.* My charger works fine.There is nothing I can think of right now as a negative so I just don't think I will add anything with respect to that except - if it could be produced in different colors maybe. I know the mini laptops in general all come in different colors just an idea. If there was a foreign language pack that may be worthwhile but I am experimenting with a whole load of things to do with the android phones and some of them do have apps for that so maybe there are apps that are available. I don't have any experience making apps since I am not an expert when it comes to computers or software by any stretch of the imagination so I can't be of any help there, so sorry. There is always time to check out apps.I never really bothered any one I found using these to ask to try it but I can imagine why they are real popular right now - this is brand new technology and the system of the device is very responsive. I found some slowness in the beginning but quickly sped up when I found out it was registered correctly or fully. I don't have any experience with anything like this other than the ones I have encountered other people using so I got an idea of how they may be addicting - but not overly so. If you can't share and item or don't want to that doesn't mean you don't want to get rid of it I have experienced this with many laptops.I do want to add that the person who is using this primarily won't be me, it is my fiancé's gift but he wanted it so much I could not ever say no. Really must be exciting. The Ipad's I have tried are really something but this takes the cake. It's so interesting and what's best of all is the sound really booms like no other laptop or other type of computer I have used. I guess it is the Dolby system. Really impressive sound/speakers on this thing. Why didn't any one offer me to use one before, I don't know, I guess I could have tried one out at Best Buy pr whoever... but this device plays youtube fine and all the new apps are running smoothly. The Silk browser is fascinating and brand new. I was so curious looking up on the google how to download a Silk browser to the smartphones but no dice the directions were all too complicated so had to forget all about that idea. But very satisfying to try it out on the device and enjoy it. If you're real curious about new technology it couldn't hurt to give it a shot... I have no idea who would give this a negative review. Unless you're used to Linux or whatever. I remember watching people using these and they really were enjoying them. Got to go but this is not my last chance to use a kindle. Something to be grateful for.

Reviews.Title: Love it...
Reviews.Author: Zaturn
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle right out of the box. It works for me because I'm no tech-geek who knows anything better. What you see onscreen displayed here on Amazon, is what you get. Have had it a week now and I have fallen in love with it. The price, you can't beat it (16 gb). My first book ordered was "Faith In the Valley" by Iyanla Vanzant. Powerful Keeper.The sound is awesome and the usb cord that came with it is all I needed to keep powered up. When not in use I just connect it to my computer. If you don't have a computer I suggest that you purchase the adapter or you can buy one at Walmart for the same price of $19.99 or at a reduced amount of $9.98 when you order the KFHD. If you don't you will have to pay the full price.Also I would suggest getting the case for it. I purchased the "Fintie" brand Leopard case after I ordered. Can't wait for it to arrive. They have a great collection here for the 7 inch HD.I'm 60 years old, if I can understand how to use it right out the box, belive me you can too. Get to know it first and away you'll go. (Smiling)This one works for me and after showing two other people, they loved mine and decided last week to order them one because of the fast service (UPS) before Christmas. Ladies at work love it, but they need to keep their paws AND eyes off my Kindle Fire HD, like I tell them....Get your own girlfriend!FYI: Also when running my computer virus checks, my Kindle HD is hooked up to my computer usb port and it checks my Kindle for virus. I can't say if it works. Just a thought that it would, had no problems with either. Norton does make virus protection for tablets $29.99. There is another called Viper as well. Just a thought to keep it in tip top shape for a long time.**Check out Youtube on others who show you right out the box how to use it quickly and some of its features AND how Amazon can protect it just in case its lost, left someplace or stolen. Some folks got sticky fingers when it comes to this new Kindle Fire HD. (smiling) I'm dead serious people, so keep them in check.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Crickett
Reviews.Content: I am a first time kindle owner. I bought the 32 gb Kindle fire Hd. All i can say is WOW!!! I love it!!! I have read many many reviews on this and I am still trying to figure out why people hate it and bash it. This is a great little tablet with tons of features. I can do everything on this things. From social sites such as Facebook to banking and bill paying. I can check and respond to all my emails. Watch tons of videos weather be thru Amazon Prime (which is awesome to have!)netflix, hulu or even you tube. I enoy the skype feature when talking to my family. I dont' have to fire up by big ol' laptop for it. THe picture quality is great. Amozon has great apps ranging from photo editing to games for all ages. there book selcetion is wonderful as well. I am still learning my new kindle but so far i truely enjoy it. I enjoy being able to read without lights on so my husband can sleep considering he has to get up at 330 am every morning for work. I can watch what ever i want with as well without disturbing him. The built in speakers sound great. This thing is also very quick to go from one web page to another and not having to buffer vidios constantly as well. I have read alot of reviews of people liking the ipad much better. Now from my understanding if you have an ipad you have to have itunes and all the "i" product stuff as well. what I like is that fact with the kindle i can up load my music and videos without having to with out having to run them thru itunes and all that nonsense. As far as the carosul on the kindle. you have your main one that shows all your rescent stuff. and the bottom small one is just suggestions of what other customers have either bought or watched or read that was assoucitated with what ever is highlighted on the main carousel. For me it is not an issue and never gets in my way. you also have the option of downloading an app to do documents as well. this is a wonderful product that i so far am enjoying. So no offense but to all those that "hate" the kindle and all. appernatly you don't know how to use it. To each there own. Delivery was next day thru my prime account. I was able to pull it right out of the box and sync it and getting everythign i had on my thru the android kindle/amozon app. anyone that is wondering weather or not to get this kindle i HIGHLY recommend it. It is also small light weight and easy to take with anywere. I can go on and on about this kindle. but you will just have to buy one and see for yourself. Have a great day!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty hip and happenin'
Reviews.Author: Rrrrrey
Reviews.Content: Look, I have never written a review for anything I have ever purchased online, but I honestly think that the Kindle fire HD deserves my time.  This has replaced my IPad 3.  I wanted something and smaller and the IPad mini is just too expensive for something packing hardware so outdated.  I was really nervous when I ordered it.  When I received it, I didn't even want to take out of the wrapper because I knew I was going to return it.  Good thing I did. I put them both right next to each other, testing videos and apps and webpages. It's faster than my IPad for the majority of my test.  The graphics are amazing and the picture quality is up to par next to my IPad. The speakers are a WOW.  It does everything I needed it to do and at just the perfect size. This thing is $500 cheaper than what I paid for my Ipad and does exactly that. I am a little down on app selection...I really didn't like Quick Office on my IPad and doubt I will like it here, but I guess it will have to do. Also, Its a bit "laggy" but it doesn't last long. I usually just have to close the app and try it again. I got a free month of Amazon Prime (thank you Amazon for that).One thing though, I know it's possible to bring my Itunes stuff into here, but I don't know how exactly. I need a very specific run through to understand the concept of how to do it.  I've been reading the discussions and the Amazon support page, but I just don't get it.All in all, I really like it. I am extremely happy I purchased it.  Good bye sweet, sweet expensive IPad of mine...

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted/needed
Reviews.Author: AshaDay
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of iPods, iPads, iPhones, and mac book pros. I decided that the iPad was just too large and expensive to continue carrying around. It also did not fit in most of my purses. That is when I decided to look for a smaller tablet.I buy almost everything from Amazon. I work full time, go to school at night, and drive around 3 hours a day, so I do not have time for shopping. I fell in love with amazon because of their incredible customer service and great "Prime" program. That is when I decided to give the kindle touch a shot.... Around 18 months later, I cannot go a day without reading my kindle touch. I could have went with the nexxus or comparable tablets, but I decided to get the Kindle Fire HD because of Amazon. I could not be happier with my decision.pros:-size is perfect (fits in most purses and bags)-less expensive (not nearly as worried carrying it places with me)-HD quality is amazing to watch movies/tv shows on-so easy to download amazon videos onto your tablet in case you are going on a roadtrip without WiFi (then easily deletable if you want more room)-touch response is good-I like the carousel because I like the idea of not having to go through apps > videos > american horror story > episode #2... I just flick the carousel around until i see the episode I want to playcons:-Kindle Dire HD and Kindle Fire have different dimensions. Be aware when ordering accessories. I accidentally ordered the wrong screen protector and didn't realize under I completely unwrapped it (ooopsies)-(not a con for me, but might be for other people) it isn't an iPad and doesn't pretend to be one. The home screen is completely different and navigating is not similar at all.-power button/ volume controls are kind of difficult to find sometimes.That is all for now... but as of right now kindle fire > iPad 2 ( In my opinion)

Reviews.Title: Switched from iPad
Reviews.Author: swolfe
Reviews.Content: I previously owned an iPad (3rd gen) and an earlier eInk Kindle. I wasn't using my iPad for productivity in general. My iPad was far too large for me to comfortably use as an eReader and unless I was using headphones, I didn't watch shows or movies on it due to the location of the speaker/quality of sound. After looking at the Kindle Fire HD, I decided to sell my iPad and purchase this device. I bought the 32GB version at my local Staples store. I did pay to have the special offers removed, although I did not find them that intrusive.Overall, I'm happy with my decision. Here are the devices strengths and weaknesses after one week of use:STRENGTHS- Speakers- Portability- Overall reading experience- HDMI port (THANK YOU)- Ease of purchasing media from Amazon- Kindle Free Time (SO terrific for my children)- The ability to add individual books to favorites (FANTASTIC)WEAKNESSES- App selection on Amazon isn't as good as the selection on Apple's App Store (I realize you can sideload)- No charger included (Really, Amazon?)- Carousel is only helpful when switching between apps as you can't add apps to it - I use favorites more often- Silk web browser (pleh! pleh!)- Slow loading some games- I wish I could change the settings so that when I read a book I can tap the left side of the screen and turn the page forward (similar to the turn page buttons on the eInk Kindle devices)For the most part, I can do everything I want to do on this device and it's far less expensive than the iPad Mini. I also have no complaints about transferring pictures or music to the device from my MacBook Air. If the carousel were more useful and the book navigation settings were customizable, I'd give the device 5 stars. I have no regrets about selling my iPad and getting the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Donna Stoess
Reviews.Content: I tried the Nexus 7 for a week.  Many issues just on setup which took over a day to work through.  Screen flickered on one ap.  Bought a Kindle Fire HD to compare.  Set up took about five minutes.  Issues with downloading Prime Instant Videos but chatting with Kindle tech support solved the problem quickly. It was not the Kindle.  My Wifi was bogged down. Tech support told me how to fix it.  Downloads great now.  Returned the Nexus 7.  Love my Kindle!  Very user friendly.  Best if you have Amazon Prime, though.  So many more options with free movies, TV shows, and books.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: M Johnson
Reviews.Content: This is the best kindle fire yet. I was an owner of the 1st kindle fire, but this one is much better. More storage, more speed, much better resolution (HD). I would recommend this to anyone who wants a reader, internet access and apps. Great device. I take it with me almost everywhere I go. And the price is just right!

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I bought it to use with my 96 year old mother. She can play games with the touch screen much easier than with a mouse. I use it for facebook and surfing the web. It is great for playing music and sounds great. Also streeming video to the tv. I'm still discovering new features.

Reviews.Title: I Love my new Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Teri
Reviews.Content: I had the original Kindle Fire but gave it to my Mom so she can listen to audible books. I love the new 7" Kindle Fire.  I also have an IPad 2.  I prefer the IPad for web browsing, reading magazines like national geographic (on my Kindle IPad app) and email ( I use a wireless keyboard with it.). I prefer the Kindle Fire for Audible books. I love the timer feature with the audible books--I use it before bed or when I'm lying awake at night in a bout of insomnia. I also prefer the Kindle Fire for reading kindle books and streaming Netflix or Amazon Prime video.  We did buy a new dual band wireless router to take advantage of the dual band input for the kindle.  We also are upgrading our DSL service to eliminate or at least reduce bandwidth contention in our household, since it has affects HD video streaming.The sound is fantastic.I bought my Kindle Fire at Best Buy, but they didn't stock the power charger, so I ordered it through Amazon.  I was pleasantly surprised to see a credit automatically applied for the total cost of the charger  when I checked out (so Amazon is giving it to me for free;-). Cool!)

Reviews.Title: Best Customer Service Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Shooter617
Reviews.Content: Thank You, Thank You, Thank You. The customer service I received today was outstanding. While trying to buy a Kindle HD for my Wife for Christmas I wasn't sure about the product, so I called the number for the Kindle store customer service. It being cyber Monday, I really wasn't expecting much. However, the lady I talked to was kind, patient, and pleasently answered a multitude of questions I had for her. Thinking I knew what I was doing (what was I thinking)I thanked her, and returned to my shopping. When I went to checkout, I filled in the necessary shipping information, but when I tryed to use my gift cards I used the wrong number and started to panic when I couldn't find the money on the account anywhere, so I called again and explained what had happened. The nice man explained to me I used the wrong number, and after giving him the numbers he told me to use, he told me he could see it on my account. I once again thought I knew what I was doing, (what was I thinking again) and went  back to my account to finish the transaction. However, the money still wasn't showing on my account, so I called back paniced again. The nice lady I got this this time was extra patient and helpful figuring out I had an old account that I didn't remember, and hadn't used since 2009, and that's where the money was registered. She helped me get the money in the new account, deleted the old account, and offered to enter the rest of my gift cards for me. She helped me finish placing to order, expained why some of the shipping on items was free, and not free on other items;offering much more help than I ever exspected. The people I delt with today were wonderful, and helped me immensely in a very stressful situation, spending a great deal of time helping me on the busyest online shopping day of the year. You can't go wrong here. Thank to them again.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: GrammieB
Reviews.Content: I had to take a flight a few days after my Kindle Fire HD 7" arrived.  I decided not to travel with my lap top, and to depend on my Kindle.  I have been away for a month and I love the fact I can stick it in my purse and have no extra heavy bags to carry.  I use it constantly and think it is my most amazing electronics purchase...can not say enough good about it.  Love the clarity of sound and the sharpness of movies, fantastic!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Simply love it!
Reviews.Author: Robert Kloepfer "Rob"
Reviews.Content: Love the HD screen , The price is great. So it is not and I-PAD , It did not cost $600.00 either. Great for book reading,gamesand E-mail. Suprisingly fast. Buy one.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: John Spressler
Reviews.Content: The best $200 dollars I've ever spent.  This tablet is the best out there.  I use this as my e-reader, watch my favorite movies on here, go on the Internet and Facebook as well.  Thank you amazon for designing an affordable product that is truly awesome!  Kindle Fire HD is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: JeannieJ
Reviews.Content: I first purchased a Kindle - but the Kindle Fire is great!  It has and does all I need in a tablet.  I am still learning on it but I would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: The best tablet option for playing Amazon Instant Videos
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is simply unbeatable as an Amazon Instant Video player.  The Operating System overlay has built-in options for either streaming or downloading content and the user interface is significantly easier and faster than the user interface on my TV and media player setup, as well as on my Windows 7 OS desktop.  I own several hundred Amazon Instant Video TV shows and movies and I had been frustrated with the inability of my Google Nexus 7 tablet and my HP Web OS tablet to play Amazon Instant Video.  For books, I have an older Kindle reader, which I truly love, and which will continue to serve as my primary Kindle content reader for now.  For my eyes, the Kindle reader's e-ink screen seems more comfortable to read for long periods than any backlit screen that I've used so far, including any HD PC monitor.I would give the Kindle Fire five stars except that mine came without the advertised USB cable - just the bare device.  Fortunately, the Kindle Fire can use the same cable and charger as most Android tablets and smartphones, so I was able to use a cable from my existing supply.  Unless you already have an Android smartphone or tablet compatible cable and charger, you will need to separately purchase the charger, at least, and possibly the cable.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Device!
Reviews.Author: Maximus
Reviews.Content: I use the kindle fire hd for the following-movies-games-tv shows-reading magazine and bookAdvantages-Awesome Screen Resolution-Battery Life-Processor Speed-Speakers(about 100 times better then the apple mini tablet)-amazon prime for the shows you missed or Netflix!- huge book and magazine selectionDisadvantages-Charging Time is really the only crappy thing everything else is awesome!Final ImpressionReally impressed with the quality of the build, dexterity and speaker quality, As a daily little companion for coffee or to watch the occasional show you missed out on the night before this is the device to get. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Love the new Kindle HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Joyce "2Doxies"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new HD Kindle!!! Can't say enough about it... it is so easy to check emails, facebook, play games, watch videos etc.  The only thing I would advise is to not use their Trade-in program!!!  I sent in my barely used original Kindle Fire three months ago and have nothing but the run around on what is going on with it.  Now then they say it was rejected because it wasn't in good shape (it was like brand new when it left here) and they were suppose to have mailed it back to me but now they think it must have gotten lost.  They are trying to get an okay to give me the credit for it.  I would never advise anyone to use their trade-in program!!!  But absolutely 3 thumbs up on the new Kindle HD!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product (Kindle Fire HD)
Reviews.Author: Rebel Librarian
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of the reviews and have noticed that a lot of people are complaining about the suggestions and ads. The ads are only on the lock screen. The suggestions are kind of big. But they aren't really as bad as the other reviews say. They keyboard is super easy to use. I am writing thus review on my kindle right now. The people that reviewed this kindle in depth are very accurate and there is no need for me to do anything more than to say that this device is perfect and very comparable to the apple ipad. My sister in law owns an i pad and I have noticed a lot of similarities between the ipad and the kindle fire. Response time is great typing is easy too.

Reviews.Title: New customer
Reviews.Author: Eileen Irish
Reviews.Content: I am learning how to use it and all of its features.  It has many more features than I realized it contained.

Reviews.Title: OMG
Reviews.Author: Silvetta Ann Kekow "Silvettann"
Reviews.Content: I never knew this device could be as rewarding as it is becoming in my life.  My wonderful friend purchased this for me, she has one and knew I would love it.... and I do.  Since I can't keep my granddaughter and grandson off of mine - I am considering getting them one this next year.  What wonderful technology.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Codimona
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle and Oh my it is a major step up.  I love my kindle its speed and access to what I need and the price it really is a great bargin for what we get.

Reviews.Title: does what i want it to do
Reviews.Author: Thomas Rodebaugh
Reviews.Content: the key is to read the available information and see if the kindle hd can do what you want it to do. for me, the key issues are:--bigger, beautiful display compared to any phone--yet not too big--wonderful for media (videos, books, music)--just fine for work-type-stuff (taking brief notes, having lecture notes at hand, reading and editing documents when a computer isn't handy)even with paying to banish the lock screen ads, the price was excellent to do all of the above and more.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: rmad
Reviews.Content: I have really been enjoying my new Kindle.  I am having a hard time keeping it away from my husband and grandkids!!I only have one problem with it so far.  The on and off button is hard to manipulate and also the volume button.

Reviews.Title: just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for about two weeks now and I love it!  I read all the time and I find it much easier to read than any other tablet I have tried.  I didnt think I would use it much for movies or TV but boy was I wrong!  The HD is crisp and clean, the sound just right for 1 person viewing and listening.  Did not want to spend the money on an Ipad, glad I didnt.  Two of my friends have Ipads and after playing around with my Kindle Fire, they want their money back!! lol.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Koozie
Reviews.Content: My wife was going to either buy me a Go Pro Hero 2 or a KFHD for my birthday and to my surprise, I got the Kindle HD.  I love this thing.  I originally asked for the paper white or just a regular Kindle, but I'm so glad I got the Fire.  After I'm finished reading, it's so easy to check my email, Facebook, weather, news and it's all included in a very light weight and stylish device.  I'm a HUGE Apple fan so I thought there was no way Amazon could compete with the iPAD, but for 200 bucks and "HD," the Kindle holds it down like a BOSS.Pros- Clear HD screen- 7' display which is the perfect size for viewing things w/out being too bulky- Good battery life, even longer with the WIFI turned off- Awesome speakers for such a small device- Built-in dictionary for reading- Amazing lighting choices- Wife is jealous- Micro USB and Mini HDMI connections, connect to your TV, awesome- Books download within seconds- Very responsive touch screenCons- Zero choices in customizing the carousel and menus.  CoughROOTCough, excuse me.- The camera is total garbage.  Ugly picture or maybe I'm just ugly.- It doesn't make me dinnerHighly recommended, buy this thing!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire from Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Jo Lakata
Reviews.Content: I'm able to receive everything that I get on my laptop, plus more. I've been able to get most books, church manuals and the rest of the books that I want.  I got my grandson's high school play off football game on my Kindle Fire and couldn't open it up on my laptop.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love Kindle Fire and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: MillerE
Reviews.Content: We purchased Kindle Fire 3 months ago for our 9 year old.  Owning the Kindle Fire has been an exceptional experience.  It was a more cost effective option as opposed to an ipad.  Differences from ipad, we could only download, browse web, etc. when connected to wireless interenet, however..No problem for us as we simply downloaded movies, tv shows, games, books on the device and she watched/played when on the go. Spectacular product for our family, cost efficient, great quality, we haven't experienced any slow speeds for watching movies, playing games, etc. MOST OF ALL AMAZON CUSTOMER SUPPORT IS FANTASTIC.  One of the issues was due to my 2 year old making a purchase of a movie (before we had set up parental controls) and they were exceptional and rendered a one time refund immediately and walked us through setting up parental controls while on the phone....YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED!!  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE AMAZON...and KINDLE FIRE.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Wildgeyser
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is totally awesome!!!!  The clarity of the screen exceeded my expectations, and is so much better than the regular Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love It!
Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: This will be a very short review as you have seen the ones that go on and on and on and on . . .I couldn't be happier with my new Kindle Fire HD 7". It is sleek, and comfortable to hold. The screen resolution is clear and sharp. It's quick and very intuitive.Amazon has the most amazingly fast shipping. I chose the free shipping (3-5 days) late Tuesday night and received it on Thursday. Crazy fast!I own a "New" iPad and I love it, too, but that doesn't affect the way I feel about my Kindle Fire HD.That would be like saying I have a favorite child!If you have been "on the fence" about buying one - do it - buy one. You will love yours, too!11/17/12I used a silver permanent Sharpie to mark the Power and Volume buttons - no problem finding them now!

Reviews.Title: Great way to read!
Reviews.Author: Chris Franklin
Reviews.Content: Lived up to my expectations and higher. I love it. Plain and simple. For what it is it does it's job most excellent and then some.Going on vacation in a few weeks and looking forward to having this with me. I had the previous version of the kindle and loved it...loved reading on it... but this does so much more and I am looking forward to being able to use those capabilities at home,on vacation and, for example, wherever you get free wifi.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire: Great Overall, A Few Growing Pains
Reviews.Author: MarksOpinion
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire for a few weeks now, and am very happy with it.  I've previously had a Kindle 2, which was stolen recently, so I needed to replace it.  I was most concerned about whether I'd be able to read on this without eyestrain, and I have to say that I've been really happy thus far.  I had originally ordered a Paperwhite, and cancelled my order after seeing so many negative and disappointing reviews.  On the Fire, you can adjust the brightness on the display if it's too bright in a dark room (or plane), and I really like being able to visually see the covers of the books in my library.  I also like having more of a full-featured device than just a reader, for a small additional premium.  I ordered the Amazon leather stand up case, which is nice, albeit a bit pricey.I have to say that the comments here about wi-fi being a little buggy are accurate.  After traveling for a few days, when I come home, it refuses to automatically connect to my home wi-fi network.  The solution is for me to turn off wi-fi, then turn it back on, and it then will automatically connect quickly and reliably.  This extra step is annoying, and not something I've experienced on any of my other devices.The power plug is oddly placed at the bottom of the device, such that you can't really watch a video with the device plugged in and standing up in the case.The app selection is very small, but let's be honest:  this is an Amazon content consumption device.  If you're looking for a wide open Android tablet, this isn't the device for you.  But, if you have a large book library on Amazon, want to watch prime videos, and generally are linked into the Amazon universe, this is a fantastic device.Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase.  The Fire HD isn't perfect, but it's a great way to consume Amazon content, with a few issues that undoubtedly will get fixed in the next version or two.

Reviews.Title: Bang for its buck
Reviews.Author: Priyanshu Kumar Jha "Priyanshu"
Reviews.Content: After contemplating hard and long and 10 days after ordering a paperwhite (in the 3 week waiting period) i decided to go for Fire HD and frankly, its been a great decision.The display is awesome, it is very close to Retina that Apple offers or like 300$ more.The integration with amazon eco system is awesome and if you are a Prime member then its even more awesome.Wi-fi is really fast and compared to my iPhone 4S, this responds faster to my school wi-fi network.Haven't faced any sort of trouble yet and user experience has been good.So, to sum it up!!DISPLAY : 4.5/5, awesome display..great brightness & contrast although don't believe the reduced Glare hypeSPEAKERS : 5/5, Dolby sound completely lives up to all the hype. Its the best i have heard on any tablet.FORM FACTOR : 4/5, the bezels could have been a little narrower so that it could fit in palm better but overall comfortable to hold.PHYSICAL SPECS : 4/5, Process is fast, the placement of Power and volume buttons is not at all intuitive and takes time getting used to.UI : 3.5/5, the carousel is definitely good and the update which allowed to turn off recommendations is a welcome update but i fear it might get monotonous after some time due to lack of any flexibility. Nevertheless, the UI is good as of now.

Reviews.Title: 7" Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Martha Russell "Martha Russell"
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun with the Kindle Fire HD. I have "graduated" from my Apple iPod touch to this with no regrets. I downloaded the instruction book from the lending library and was truly impressed with the capabilities of this device. I think that if one wants to use it out of range of wireless, a MiFi would be perfect for extending the use. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Also note, as a Mac user, I can transfer files from my MacBook Pro to the Kindle Fire using a free download from Amazon for that purpose. If your thinking about purchasing this, think no more!

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: James M Cooper
Reviews.Content: This device is fast. Great sound. I use it for reading or watching movies and playing games. I rarely use my iPad since getting this new kindle.

Reviews.Title: Great multi-featured display/interactive device.
Reviews.Author: Eljefe
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle HD for its new features, replacing my Kindle Fire. The larger screen is not only bigger but also has a sharper image. I just returned from a 2 week vacation in the U.S. and whether in a plane, or hotel, the HD provided me with access to WiFi and well as my reading library. The ability to access Amazon.Com was a bonus feature.

Reviews.Title: Lots of bang for your buck...
Reviews.Author: James G.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tech guy, but this thing is impressive. Everyday I play with it, I'm finding more things that it can do.Besides being an e-book reader, it streams video. You get a month of Amazon Prime for free when you buy the Kindle Fire HD. I've been streaming videos to my TV with this little unit.I did need to buy a patch cord to do it, its micro HDMI to standard HDMI..My Prime just ran out, but I plan to purchase it for the year in the next few days. I see that Apple just came out with their Mini-IPad, $130.00 more. The Kindle Fire HD, only costs $199.00...I think $130.00 looks real fine sitting in my bank account.To sum it all up:If you like to get lots of bang for your money, without breaking the bank buy the Kindle Fire HD..

Reviews.Title: Better than the first but still some work to do
Reviews.Author: RCK
Reviews.Content: Traded in my original Kindle Fire for the new 7" Kindle Fire HD.Big improvement in size,shape and weight.Much improvement in glare and crisper pictureSound louder and can hear stereo separationBattery life better but not 11 hours, closer to 9 if using with wirelessQuicker wireless connectionBrowser still quirky although improved with no lockups yet, no flash so some video on websites will not playthe biggest disappointment is many apps for Kindle Fire do NOT work on Kindle Fire HD. No differentiation in app store as to what will or will not work until try to purchase. Did not see this fact mentioned anywhere in promotion of deviceCarousel still a problem. Books keep loading onto carousel even though I haven't accessed them making a disorganized mess.  Have alerted Amazon to this problem and hoping it will be fixed.Love the magnetic case which puts the unit to sleep when closed and awakens it when opened.Hopefully more apps will become available quickly.

Reviews.Title: Love it and very pleased!!
Reviews.Author: Rissaa
Reviews.Content: I already had the Kindle e-reader which I really liked.  I had purchased the Kindle Fire for my sister as a Xmas present last year and she really loves and takes it with her wherever she goes.  So, when I saw that Kindle was coming out with the new Kindle Fire HD, I mentioned(casually)to my husband that I wanted the Kindle Fire HD 7" for my birthday.  To my pleasant surprise, he pre-ordered it for me and I absolutely LOVE it!!  I'm still learning all the different functions, but I wouldn't give it up for the world.  It's very easy to download e-books and definitely easy to carry around with the case that I ordered for it.  I will definitely be taking it along on vacations with me.  I'm very pleased and to me it's worth the price.  All I have to do now is figure out what to do with my Kindle e-reader :).

Reviews.Title: Great hardware, overall nice update to the software
Reviews.Author: Pigsflew
Reviews.Content: I took a weekend trip from Seattle, WA to Washington, DC, and during the flights I watched 7 hours of video and read for a few hours on this device. I didn't charge it all weekend. It had 30% battery life left when I got home.This is an amazing entertainment device, and I recommend it to anyone. It is easily the best way to experience the Amazon ecosystem (the straight Android apps have not actually caught up yet), and it has incredible hardware. Don't buy it expecting a google experience or a super-workhorse; it's not currently possible to get google+ or any other google app working properly, and yes, that includes maps.If you're concerned about ads, you can opt out, but in practice they're actually often free giveaways and actually decent deals, so you might want to keep them. The lock screen is not configurable so it isn't doing anything special anyway.The Carousel is still *super* annoying. It lists too many items, in order of use, which ends up often showing you a whole boatload of apps, videos, and web pages that you're *finished* with, that you now have to remove one-by-one or scroll through forever to find that book you were reading (its one positive use), *and* it takes up all of the home screen.I would like to add a number row to the on-screen keyboard. I would like to add notifications to the lock screen.Video, Music, and Reading experience is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Stunning
Reviews.Author: Donnie
Reviews.Content: Incredible.  I bought this for my daughter for her birthday.  In "testing" it out I watched Iron Man 2 and all I have to say is WOW.  The quality of the picture and ease of use made me put the 8.9" version on my wishlist.  If you want something for pure entertainment (movies, apps, music, books, etc.), then the Kindle Fire HD is the tablet for you.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT !!!!
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Got my Kindle Fire HD 7 a few weeks ago, I am so addicted !!!  the display is awesome, sound is great! It goes with me everywhere. Lots of apps available for games, email, shopping etc. Batery life is good, for playing games, and reading it does last longer with wireless turned off. I've not been able to find a case/cover I really like, but I'm guessing more will become available.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!  Actually great so far
Reviews.Author: Melisann
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to get a Fire HD, so I went to Best Buy and bought one.  I've been playing with it for a few hours now and I love it.  The web browser is fast, the screen looks awesome, the sound is great.  It found my home wi-fi automatically and super quickly.  I already owned a Kindle (3 w/ keyboard), but not a Fire so this is my first tablet.  I've already read a few chapters of a book and it was very comfortable to hold (I've used a friend's ipad to read before and tonight confirmed for me that i was correct to wait for this because i will use this to read a lot.To sum up, I am very pleased with my purchase and look forward to using this everyday.

Reviews.Title: Unexpectedly frustrating
Reviews.Author: Eric Berg
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD about 10 hours ago.  This is the first tablet that I've owned.Using it has proved to be unexpectedly frustrating in a number of ways:1.  Touch screen isn't reliable -- About a third of the time, I find myself having to repeat a touch, or a swipe, several times before it registers.  Initially, I thought this was just my inexperience, but now I'm not sure.2.  I've had problems accessing websites via WiFi -- in several cases, pages from widely used websites have failed to load or loaded without images.3.  Accessing the user guide has also had problems -- in several cases, when I tried to open sections of the user guide, Kindle displayed "Loading..." indefinitely.4.  It is impossible to enter my PIN while the Kindle is plugged into a USB charger.  Either swiping across the "unlock" icon has no effect, or it displays the screen to enter my PIN but input is totally unreliable -- for example, a long delay in echoing characters, clicking a number once leads to it getting entered multiple (in some cases, 5 or 6) times, etc.  The only way to enter the PIN is to disconnect from the charger.There are lots of other things that I like about the Kindle, but if my experience doesn't get better after a few more days of using it, it's going back.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7-inch
Reviews.Author: jackhardy
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a superior product than the iPad Mini and the smartest most useful e-reader/media device I have--and this comes from a solid Apple fan. The same day Apple introduced the overpriced $329 16 GB iPad Mini, I clicked away from the live press event and clicked on Amazon.com to purchase the 7-inch Kindle Fire HD. Interestingly, I'm not a Microsoft or an Android OS fan, I'm actually a Macbook Pro and iPhone owner. However, I wouldn't trade either one of these tools for productivity (read apps), recreation (read iTunes) and ease of use (Apple iOS). The family already owns several iPhones, shares an iPad 3 and we regularly use 2 original Kindles. The gorgeous display of the iPad 3 (the Retina Display is the key selling point for me), is unparalleled, and is phenomenal for watching movies, but if I had to give up either the original Kindle or the iPad 3, it wouldn't be the Kindle. The iPad is too bulky as an e-reader, and not as convenient to schlep around even though its screen size and browser is better for extended websurfing. The iPhone is simply too small to do lengthy reading or websurfing. My daughter just sold her iPod Touch to buy the Kindle Fire HD and after using it, I have to say I'm now jealous that she has a newer and better version of the Kindle Fire. We both especially like the front facing camera to Skype. You don't need a rear-facing camera to take pictures-- a ridiculously stupid effort for people who hold up the iPad to shoot pictures at public events! Honestly, I do like the size and edges of the original Kindle Fire a bit better for comfort and ease of use while reading for extended periods. It's just a personal thing. I do realize I'm buying into the Amazon ecosystem with the Kindle Fire, but I use it mainly for two things, First: reading books (I've noticed that both me and my daughter have increased our reading time--this is crucial for me since she has previously not been a book lover) This includes the one free book per month via the Kindle Lenders library and free ebooks in the public domain. Second, I use it to watch TV & movies using my Amazon Prime account (and HuluPlus and Netflix) when the kids are hogging the iPad 3. Prime is completely worth the money for the growing library of content AND the 2-day shipping which has paid for itself more than 10 times. If you're a book reader, the Kindle Fire HD is the killer machine. Of course, I can also use the Kindle reading app on my iPhone, iPad and Kindle Fire and it syncs every time I open it up to the latest read page. Perhaps the iPad 3 will eventually replace my laptop when it can perform all the applications that the MacBook Pro still does better. However, when I run out the door to attend a school event where I know I'm going to wait for awhile, the first thing I grab--with one hand--is the Kindle Fire. Buy it and you will never go back to printed books--something I thought I would never do.

Reviews.Title: Love my Fire HD: Beware of the Trolls
Reviews.Author: Just Wondering
Reviews.Content: I received my new HD a few days ago. I have the original Fire and the first thing to note is that this upgrade is substantially better than the original in several important respects. Of particular note are the screen resolution, the sound, and the responsiveness. If you want a high-quality media consumption device at a great price, the HD is a good choice. It is not perfect. It still does not make coffee or clean the toilet.It is not, however, an iPad. It is different. It is intended to provide a good experience for people wanting a tablet to read, listen, view and communicate, with particular attention to providing seamless integration with Amazon's media offerings.On Sunday, October 28, Amazon began to make explicit comparisons with the iPad in its Fire product descriptions. As a result there has been a proliferation of negative reviews published on the product pages by individuals who apparently worship Apple with religious zeal. They do not realize that the iPad is simply a commercial product, not a deity. It is clear that most of these 1 star reviews are by people who have never seen a Fire, much less bought and used one. Pretty funny and in some ways frightening.I have no ax to grind. I just like good products that are useful to me. The HD, for me, is really nice.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Easily Outkindles Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Book Addict
Reviews.Content: I purchased a used Kindle Fire (first generation) early August and quickly fell in love with the device.  However, a few irritations surfaced as I continued to use the Fire, for example, the fact that the screen was not as crisp as I was used to on my iPhone, the lack of an external volume button, and the unattractive bulkiness of the device.  I sold my first generation Fire in the marketplace and upgraded to the Kindle Fire HD.  I am so glad that I did because all of the minor problems with the first generation were addressed in this new generation device.  The screen is (I think) more crisp and sharp than my partner's iPad, the external power and volume buttons are easy to navigate, and, finally, the device is slim and, dare I say it, sexy.Following some YouTube video instructions, I also was able to download the Dolphin Browser so that I could access ADOBE FLASH (which works perfectly on this device!) and a separate app launcher to allow for a Nexus or iPad style desktop with apps and widgets.  Now, I have both the Amazon launcher and the ADW Launcher, and, no, I am not tech savvy, nor did I have to root my device (I don't even know what that means) or do anything special other than download a couple things.I am thrilled with this purchase!, and could I award the Amazon Kindle Fire HD more than five stars, I definitely would!

Reviews.Title: Love It! Loyal to the Kindle Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: ALA
Reviews.Content: I'll go ahead with the one con that I've always had since giving up my earlier version of the Kindle --- still no book categorizing. I am hoping and praying a software update will remedy that. This is my THIRD Kindle after the 3rd Generation reader, and the 1st Generation Kindle Fire.Minor con: This may be a software kink, but sometimes items show back up in the carosel after I've deleted them. I will have to ask AMAZON support about this issue.PROS:--Email is now very well streamlined visually, and adding other email accounts was very simple.--Visual screen for video/movie watching is 1000% improved with HD. Colors really pop.--The improved speakers were much needed over the first KF. I sometimes had to use earplugs....well not any more. I can hear this HD FIRE from the back of my house.--The carosel and tabs are much more simplified, although it took some acclimating to the new drop down menu options and scrolling back to the home page.--Love the new camera and the ability to SKYPE!--Love how photos from the cloud are synced and formatted for viewing. My pics from my Italy trip look amazing on the KF HD!--Being able to now hook my KF HD to my television is great, as I am now able to free up my laptop for viewing Prime and Instant Video selections. Adding the HDMI port was a smart move.--I know I may get flack, but I LIKE the ads and the offers. There's really not alot of advertising and it doesn't impede productivity or use of the Kindle Fire HD (in my opinion).I don't compare the Fire to the iPad or a regular PC/laptop. But for $200, this is a powerful tablet that offers alot of utility and entertainment. Even if it's a closed system to market Amazon products, it's still worth it to this Kindle Fire lover! So far, I've never looked at or considered another tablet and will not as long as Amazon offers this great product.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it was meant for
Reviews.Author: Just Theo
Reviews.Content: I really have no serious complaints about this device. It does exactly what it was meant to do, connect me with my Amazon content easily, allow me to use apps, and surf the net. The only problem I have had was that I couldn't stream movies over a mobile phone hotspot. That's not a problem with the device, that's just because the signal and speed of the phone hotspot isn't good enough. I wasn't planning on doing this, I just wanted to test it out and see if it worked.Screen is beautiful, you really can view it from any angle. The touch screen responsiveness is better than any of my other devices (thrive, galaxy s3, droid incredible). When I first wake it up, it seems groggy for about 3 seconds (any device is when you first wake it up).I have downloaded movies and tv shows from the cloud using my home internet, it took only minutes. I also paused a download halfway through and then finished it using my phone as the hotspot, then downloaded a second show. I was driving while these were downloading and it took less than 10 minutes for them to complete. That's both of them combined took 10 minutes, not individually.I am currently downloading about 1000 songs on it using my wifi at home. It's taking about the same about of time as it would to load 1000 songs on an ipod using a cable.I only briefly tested the sound, it seemed fine but I was doing other things and didn't have a chance. I've been using my phone earbuds to listen to movies while I am at work.I've only used bluetooth to connect to my keyboard, no problems there (other than issues that the keyboard is known to have).Setup was easy. Battery life is pretty good. I must say I am impressed with the battery compared to other tablets. I have to charge my thrive daily, even when it's not in use and the wifi is off. I charged the KFHD on Tuesday night (before bedtime, not overnight) and used it throughout the day Wednesday and today. Downloaded 3 tv episodes, a movie, a few hundred songs, and left the wifi on the entire time and my battery is just down to 15% on Thursday afternoon. I would recommend getting the rapid charger if you don't already have a kindle charger. You will want to charge the KFHD overnight if you are using the usb to computer option. My phone chargers do not work with the fire (fire needs more power than the phone's charger puts out).My only valid complaint is the power and volume buttons. As others have stated, they are small and flush with the device. You can't find them by feel. I have the same problem with my thrive and this really is not a big deal. You will just have to look at the buttons to use them or try to memorize exactly where they are (though it's still hard to find them because they are small). This tiny (haha) problem isn't worth crying about though.Also, others have mentioned a problem with Flash....you can sideload browsers to help you with this. And it's not AMAZON that doesn't support flash, it's ADOBE that doesn't support android. Flash is going out with the dinosaurs.As for your apps not being compatible with the HD, if they are on the fire, they should work with HD. If they don't upon release day, give the developer time to update their app. If the HD sells well, the developer won't neglect the HD.

Reviews.Title: You want this
Reviews.Author: Scott Hicok
Reviews.Content: I was an early buyer of the original kindle fire and I loved it for the most part, but there were a few things that annoyed me slightly and features that I wished it had. The new kindle fire hd has fixed all those problems and a few I didn't even know I wanted fixed. Not perfect, but definitely a solid five stars considering price.NOTE: I traded in my original kindle fire to amazon.com/tradein and got over $80 for it, reducing my upgrade significantly. If you have an original fire you should consider this.Overall: Much like the original fire this device is at its best when used with amazon prime and content. The music store is amazing and mostly very cheap, the video store has everything and prime members get a great selection of FREE videos. The prime library is growing fast, recently adding big movies like Iron Man 2. Obviously its great for books, its a kindle, and reading magazines is much improved over the original fire. The appstore is sometimes a disappointment, but fairly good for big name stuff. In general the home screen is a HUGE improvement over the first fire, though amazon makes it pretty obvious they want you to buy more stuff! Every screen has either small ads or suggestions on what to buy. Sometimes its annoying, sometimes it actually recommends good stuff.Screen: Its fantastic. I never thought the old fire screen was bad... until I got this! No comparison.Buttons!!: the addition of dedicated volume controls is a much needed improvement. Though they can be hard to locate sometimes.Bezel: the bezels are much much bigger. It does leave space to grip the device with your thumb, but it makes it harder to cradle in one hand.Size and feel: the build feels much better, more refined, better then a Samsung tablet but not quite as good as an ipad.Sound: I didn't notice that tablets are VERY quiet  until I cranked up this baby! The sound is still very bright but it is good, doesn't distort, and the stereo actually sounds like stereo. Well done amazon!Case: I bought the amazon case, won't say much here except that its really good.Camera: There is no back camera, which I think is good, people taking pictures with ipads look idiotic. It does have a front facing camera for skype, which works well.Complaints: The native calendar sucks. No sync for subscribed Google calendars. The email sucks too. Third party apps are available but for a cost.The web browser feels slow. Very scientific I know, but it just feels slow.The keyboard can't be changed, so if your a swype User like myself you will have to adjust, though it is better then the original fires keyboard.Hey amazon! Where's my wall charger? This device doesn't come with one.The complaints are actually pretty minor and dint justify even a one star loss in my book.Love love love my kindle fire HD! Buy one and thank me later :)

Reviews.Title: An amazing device for a great price!
Reviews.Author: peter-seattle
Reviews.Content: I placed my order for the new Kindle HD Fire on the release day (September 14), and just received it today (September 18). I was in the market for a low cost device, and I was deciding between this and the Google Nexus 7. I have never owned a Kindle device before; I own an i-Phone and I have used a family member's i-Pad a fair amount.Based on the initial reviews, I was a little unsure about the decision to buy the Kindle HD Fire. But now that I own it, I cannot believe all of the 1 and 2 star reviews, and wonder if these people actually own the same device I do!What follows are my thoughts on a variety of issues that have been raised by others:(1) The Advertisements: When I first read about this, I thought it was annoying and was sure I would pay the $15 to remove them (which I don't mind paying). But, the ads are not a big deal at all. In fact, one of them was for a free $5 credit to rent videos, and I used it to rent two free videos for my next plane trip. I'm not going to pay the $15 -- the ads are fine and in fact can be a positive.(2) The suggested items/websites: This seems to bother a lot of people. I actually like it. I always have a hard time finding good books or movies, and this is a really helpful feature. I used it to rent a movie today, and the suggestion was a good one.(3) Screen: The quality of the screen is amazing! I watched several movie clips and tv shows, and the quality is second to nothing I have ever seen.(4) Size: The size is just perfect -- very portable, yet big enough to do everything I need. The keyboard works fine with my fingers, and I have pretty big hands.(5) Sound: Really good quality, but not as loud as I would like (but my hearing might just not be that good!)(6) I highly recommend buying the case made by Amazon for this. It is a little pricey at $40-ish, but it fits it perfectly, allows you to charge it with the case on, automatically turns it on and off, and works great as a stand!(7) Download speed with the wi-fi is lightning fast! It took about 1/10 of the time to download a movie as it does on my i-Phone!A few semi-negatives:(1) There do need to be more apps for the device. This will come with time, as app developers see the market growing. So this is really only a short-term issue.(2) I wish flash would work with it. This too is a short-term issue, since flash is on the way out, but in the interim it means there are a few websites where you will not be able to make use of something. But this is also a problem with the Google Nexus 7.All in all, you cannot go wrong with this device! I'm very happy I decided to buy my first Kindle device, and even though it is smaller than the i-Pad, it serves my purpose well, with hundreds of dollars left over in my pocket!

Reviews.Title: $199 bucks?! A STEAL!
Reviews.Author: Cigar1995HOtheY
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 7" is my first tablet. My children both have the latest iPad, (grad presents) and my spouse has one of the Samsung tablets..I have a pretty great laptop, so having a tablet for myself was not high on my want or need list. But, I do like to read. A LOT. So, as a sweet gesture, my husband purchased this for me last week and it arrived on Monday, (Sept 17th) one day before scheduled! Anyhow, I was tickled. I have been fussing and fiddling with this thing, and all I can really say is "iPad who'? The Kindle Fire HD 7 inch tablet at $199 is a STEAL! The SOUND is the most impressive...It's like listening to a stereo..Amazon makes it sooooooo easy to put all content at your touch.....I love this thing...So light! Sexy small! You can carry the world in a jacket pocket and nobody would know..! If you are looking for a tablet/reader, please, please look no further. The only thing that the iPad has over the Fire is a camera. I wish the Kindle had a camera, but Amazon threw Apple a small bone...Competition is healthy..  :)

Reviews.Title: What kind of Game Are You Playing?
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Edit- Once again I am changing my review. As you can see below I was very happy with my Kindle not having ads anymore. So happy in fact that I bought an app and was deciding on a few books to buy. To my dismay however my Kindle is now showing ads again. Why? Why do this? Was it to trick me into buying something? Did I not buy something soon enough to satisfy you? You had a satisfied customer willing to spend a lot more than $15. But you decided to pull this crap. Well congratulations. I don't usually buy tech until after the first few generations are out and the bugs are fixed. I took a chance on the Kindle fire for my wife. Great product. Some tried to compare it to the Ipad which it's not supposed to be. Because of the first one My wife got me this new one. We took a chance that the Kindle would be our brand. Not anymore. I'll spend my hard earned cash on a different company. I hope you are happy with the extra $5 because it's the last you will receive from me.Edit- I'm not one for hiding so my original comment is below instead of deleted. I also changed the tittle to "Satisfied Customer" from "Bad Business Practice"It was pointed out that it is listed in the description. Somehow I didn't see it as many times as I looked over it but it's there so I can't be upset for my mistake. However I still feel that if they need the extra $15 then they should just go ahead and charge for it upfront. I must say I am impressed. Even though it wasn't right away, which I imagine they are still busy as the new customers are bombarding them with questions, they seem to have unlocked to the ad feature. I have not received an email or anything but this shows they are trying to make things good and that they are keeping up with the feedback. Until now I have been simply backing up apps from my phone and books and simply side loading them. With this show of good faith I am willing to spend money on the apps, books, and possibly movies they provide and will change my rating to a 5 star. After using it the only 2 things I like about the old kindle over this one is the power button was easy to fin and the width is slightly awkward for one handed reading. However I've adjusted to it and now that I know where the button is it's easy to turn on and off. Can't wait for the case to arrive. Below is my original post.$15 to remove adds when I spent $200+ on the kindle alone? And you are not going to include a wall plug? That will teach me not to rely on the quality of the first product. My wife's fire came with a wall plug and didn't have adds pop up every single time I try to unlock it. The device is great but if this is the kind of cheap tricks it takes to make it look cheaper than it is this is the last one we get. Not going to pay $15 especially when it wasn't even listed. In other words it's something that the heads of Amazon knew would be an issue so they didn't advertise that they would charge you extra after the fact. Cheap tricks. Take the adds off and I'll give it 5 stars. I can somewhat get past the wall charger but I'm sure not everybody has an extra usb adapter. Bottom line don't do this. You have an awesome product.
