Don't go the way of Apple relying on the name for people to overlook cut corners.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD Rocks!!
Reviews.Author: frugalcrafter
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe what we have been missing. We are a tech family, and have been Ipad fans from the get go, have owned all three versions. Never even considered the Kindle until I saw one with no glare to read. So we thought for the price and Amazons great return policy why not try the new HD out and see how it is for reading.OH MY WORD......(mouth open) it is awesome. Reading books on this is like night and day to our Pads. The screen is rich and clear, the abilities to adjust things is great and love the being able to download books through Amazon right to the Kindle. Okay, that in itself was just grand, however being able to watch our movies through HDMI cords to our TV and download and shop with Amazon with such ease was such a nice treat. :)Yes, we still love our Pads and they have their own place, but I like that I can now keep my Pad at home and tote the Kindle around with me with so much ease..it is light weight, small and perfect for my purse. We like it so much we ordered another 7" today, but with 32gb this time for me and hubby will use the 16gb one. We were waiting for the Mini Pad, but once we saw the specs and the screen pixelation, we came right to Amazon and ordered another Kindle Fire HD...Go figure..Goes to show you good things CAN come in small packages!! It's light, fits in my hand and I can still do the daily stuff I used to do on Pad with it. Oh and did I mention some of the Apps are wayyyy cheaper on the Kindle than Apple? Same apps too...yes I do realize they do not need retina and such for the Kindle, but we don't need that for a lot of the apps we use anyways.Get it...it works, it can go with you easier and it ROCKS!!

Reviews.Title: I'm in Love
Reviews.Author: Justpeachy85 "justpeachy85"
Reviews.Content: Seriously was doubtful of liking the color touch screen version of the kindle.  Been thinking about it since the first version of the fire came out but just didn't like it enough to justify trading up from my kindle 2.  Well, I finally decided to go ahead and try this new version and I'm so happy I did.  It's far exceeded my expectations.  My husband has an iPad and I honestly can't find a use for it.  My biggest fear was that it would be everything I hate about the iPad.  I like simplistic things, over stimulation is not my forte so it shocked me that I've grown to love it so much.  I've purchased magazines and books that I normally wouldn't buy on the kindle like cook books, and text style books.  I can flip through the pages easily and am able to find recipes in the books with ease.  I've had it for about a solid week now and I can't put it down.  It fits perfectly in my purse (like the kindle 2 did) and the weight difference isn't too big of a deal.  I like being able to surf the web, check email, looking at magazines, and the text-to-speach is freakin amazing!!!  The only problem is that with seeing so many beautiful book covers I've gone a book buying spree!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Lee Bennet
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle ever so I don't have anything to compare it with but I received the Kindle Fire HD for my birthday about two days ago. So far I really love it! It does everything I need it to and much more. The battery life is really decent and I can watch several movies and listen to a lot of music each day before it needs charged (I use it a lot so it does need charged by the end of the day) The sound is great and the camera for using Skype is really good also. It is well worth the money and I highly recommend it. Of course everyone has their own opinion but this is mine.

Reviews.Title: How  did I live without this?
Reviews.Author: dawn doccola
Reviews.Content: First let me  say I am normally an apple person. I own an ipad macbook etc etc. I  have been loyal to Apple  for years.I also am one of those people who takes a long time to make a decision about buying a new toy. I am never the first one out.Thus said  I am totally enjoying my  new Kindle.I wanted something compact that would allow me to read  books and magazines, watch  movies  and TV shows  during my frequent  travels. Where once I had a bag full of books and magazines I now have my kindle.My only thing that I don't like  and it has nothing to do with the Kindle  itself is I wish the cost of some popular books  was  a bit cheaper.Who knows maybe that will happen soon.I have converted  all my magazine  subscriptions to Kindle.  I get them before the mailman gets them to  me.As I said I love this  new toy.The color and sound  are  good and yes I miss a  few apps that Apple  has .I am an adult figure skater and it seems there  are no skating  apps  for Kindle. apple  has a bunch  but that I can surviveThis is portable . I love the size . it fits in my purse or skating  bag. Great price.to say  no more I love this Kindle and wonder how i managed without it

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it and love it!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I i'm a software trainer and I needed a cheap tool to surf the web, do skype read pdf's and office docs.  THis does all of that and more.  I did not have it for 5 min (received it today about 2:30 MST) and Hotmail was set up, my Audible was setup, and my wireless was working!!  Love the screen and it is very much faster!!  All my content was ready to be used!  I could not be happier!  Thank you for making such a good device at the right price point!  I'm for once glad to do a review!

Reviews.Title: The Fire HD truly delivers what it promises
Reviews.Author: John C. "JC"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle Fire.  I have only been playing with it for a few days so I will hope to add an update later. I gave the Kindle Fire HD five (5) stars for several reasons. First, the 5 star rating is because I "love it". That's what the 5 star rating is intended for. It does not implicate that it is perfect but merely suggests that I really like the item. I laugh when reading some of these other 1 or 2 star ratings and what they complain about.  I will admit that it has some minor flaws and could be improved upon in a few areas but overall even with some menial issues it still delivers what it promises.  That's the basic idea of these reviews; give an appropriate review for what the item offers vs. what it actually delivers. This is a reader, web surfer, media player tablet and does all three things very well. I am not going to bash the product because it doesn't have flash.  It's not Amazon or the Kindle's fault.  That was a decision that Adobe made. It would be nice for Amazon to add a YouTube app or a dedicated app for playing flash if they want us to use their Silk browser.  I am also NOT going to compare it to other tablets.  This review is intended for the Kindle Fire HD not a comparison contest between other tablets. I am not going to put it down because of the ads.  If you don't like them, pay the $15 to have them removed.  Simple as that. Nowadays, you can't open a web site without it being plastered with ads. I don't understand what the big deal is. You go through your carousel, pick what you want to do and you leave. It's like your desktop on your computer. You don't spend hours on your desktop, you click on whatever icon you want to open and go. Surf the web, read your email, open a doc whatever.  What are people doing, playing in the carousel all day or something? I think folks are just finding things to complain about. I truly dislike commercials at the movies. Will I stop going to the movies? Of course not, I just deal with it and enjoy the show.Some folks complain about that the carousel looking too "busy" or because it has the recommendations on the bottom. Again, not sure why people are hanging around in the carousel all the time for. Pick what you want and move on. The carousel doesn't bother me at all. I actually like it and enjoy the recommended items on the bottom.  But that's my opinion.  Oh, here's a neat trick although it takes some effort...turn it on its side in landscape mode and the recommended items disappear. Wow! Now that was difficult, if you gave the Kindle HD 1 or 2 stars because of the recommended items and need help with going into landscape mode I will be glad to help and give you detailed instructions. I think the carousel is fine just the way it is IMO.  If you don't want an item in your carousel than you can remove it. I haven't had any issues doing so. Another thing people are complaining about is the lack of GPS. Am I missing something?? This is a wifi device not a 3G/4G tablet.  If you open Google maps it can locate you as long as you are in a wifi zone. It's not as accurate, but close enough to give you a general location or directions. It picked me up within a couple blocks where as a true GPS can pinpoint me down to a couple yards. Why would you want GPS in a tablet unless it was 3G/4G capable? It's a nice feature to have but I just don't get why or how that would really benefit a tablet that is purely meant for wifi. It's like saying I'm going to give it 2 stars because it can't make phone calls.  I am not going to knock my rating down for something it does not promise to have.  I'm trying to think of a place where GPS could come in handy when I am not in a wifi hotspot...answer, nowhere! Now if this was a 4G device and GPS was not installed than I would be a little baffled and annoyed.  If you truly need GPS get the Kindle HD 4G 8.9.Here are some of the little things I would like on the next Kindle: A charging indicator. Some sort of exterior light that tells me it is charging, fully charged etc without turning on the device. A print wireless feature would be very useful. It is a little hard distinguishing what is the top or bottom, left or right.  Not that it's a big deal but can get a little confusing remembering where the on/off switch is. A photography feature would have been a nice added extra. Not sure why Amazon would install a camera just for Skype and not for taking pictures. Obviously it's only a front facing camera so your picture taking would be very limited. A rear facing camera would definitely be much more beneficial. When watching movies or TV shows it would be a helpful feature to zoom, widen, stretch or expand the screen.  It displays the black bars along the top/bottom or sides depending on the aspect ratio. Most TV's can adjust the picture size according to what you're watching to eliminate those. It would be a nice feature if the Kindle could as well unless I missed something.  There is not a constructive way to organize Apps, books, magazines etc.  It would be nice to have folders in the carousel containing the individual items instead of every item displayed there. The biggest complaint I have is not specifically related to the Kindle HD. It is the Cloud service's ability to play non-Amazon content wirelessly. It is misleading. I thought from the description that I could play all my non Amazon music and watch all my non Amazon videos that were in my Cloud through the Kindle provided I was in a wifi hotspot. This unfortunately is not entirely true. In order to make this happen you do need a computer and load the Amazon MP3 player on it. Download your music content into the player, and then it will show up in the Cloud and become playable on the Kindle. The Videos however you cannot add them to your device wirelessly. You physically need to hook your Kindle up via the USB to your PC and transfer the videos that way.  But now those non-Amazon videos are on your device and not the Cloud. This really isn't a Kindle issue as so much an Amazon issue so that is why I am not bashing the device over it. Any content you buy through Amazon will be playable from the Cloud in any wifi hotspot and NOT take up your storage space. This has got to be one of the most unrecognized and underrated features out there that iTunes has yet to master.So here is where it does deliver. Pretty much everything it was made for. It says it has a great picture, YES it does. Great sound considering the small device, YES it does. Great wifi speeds especially using the 5 GHz bandwidth, YES it does. This thing is way faster than my iPad which only can access my 2.4 GHz bandwidth. Remember, for those that are complaining about the speed...you need to select the appropriate bandwidth on your network in order to utilize the 5 GHz bandwidth and faster speeds.  Also make sure your router even has the 5 Ghz bandwidth. I surfed all day watching videos (using Prime) and TubeMate, surfing around Facebook and shopping. I had no issues whatsoever. I don't know why some folks are complaining about the speed, swiping, or opening links but I didn't really have any problems. One thing that seems to be left out quite often is the Bluetooth capability. This paired with a couple of my devices quickly and easily. I have read using the device in both total darkness and in direct sunlight and it handles both fairly well.  Considering the color display it does a great job. I played with the Kindle HD almost continuously for 8 hours and it still had about 30% battery left.  It feels more rugged than I expected.  Has a nice finish on the back. Not too hard, not too soft. I was able to use my older Kindle AC charger to charge it rather quickly. I understand how people are upset about not having the AC charger but again, it's not the Kindle's fault!  That's Amazon. It did state that "included in the box" was a USB charger not an AC charger so these people who rate this Kindle low need to read their product descriptions before bashing the items they buy.There are a couple features I have yet to try and may change my rating if those features do not deliver what they promise such as the HDMI interface, Skype calling, emailing, side loading etc.  I will update later after I have used the device longer.

Reviews.Title: Caution,  Think twice before buying Kindle Fire HD  better tablets than this one
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mastomas"
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of Kindle products since the Kindle Reader Generation II so I know how to trouble shoot most problems. I bought a Kindle fire HD both the large and small version in December 2012 and I regret doing so because both products give lots of problems. opKindle Fire HD 7 has many malfunctions: Keyboard problems, slow operation, books won't open, on and on and on. Bought another tablet different brand because Kindle Fire HD 7 froze up during a presentation at school, couldn't open an essential book, slow and  disappearing screen. I recommend not buying a Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Personal comparison of Kindle Fire HD, Kindle Fire, & Kindle Keyboard
Reviews.Author: Andrea M Canfield
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD shortly after it was released in October 2012. This is my 3rd Kindle device, and yes I've kept them all for various reasons. In this review I will focus primarily on the strengths and limitations of the Kindle Fire HD, but will also point out how it compares to the "regular" Kindle Fire and the e-Ink Kindle Keyboard device. FYI, I am specifically reviewing the smaller size Kindles (not the larger 8.9" version). I love the "book size" of the smaller Kindles, they are comfortable to hold and very portable (I can just tuck it in my purse or briefcase without a problem).First of all, I must say you can't go wrong with a Kindle (any style), they are tremendous. I received my first Kindle (with the e-Ink display and buttons on the keyboard) as a gift a few Christmases ago, and initially I was actually a little skeptical about whether I'd really like it or use it. Well, in short order I found the answer was a resounding YES to both; and I was instantly hooked by all the bells & whistles offered with the Kindle Fires.Some of the best features for the Kindle Fire HD are the stunningly beautiful screen display -- the colors are rich and the picture is extremely sharp, true HD. There is also slightly less glare on this device than on the "regular" Kindle Fire, which comes in handy if you want to use your Kindle outdoors or in certain overhead lighting conditions. We use WiFi for Internet connectivity, and the Kindle Fire HD connects faster and stays connected much more reliably than the regular Kindle Fire thanks to its dual antennas. Battery life also seems slightly improved over the regular Kindle Fire. When using headphones, the audio sound is fantastic on the HD (however, it is truly nothing special without the headphones, no matter what their ads may imply). One thing to note, I checked the Kindle Fire and Kindle Fire HD side by side: the picture quality is "great" on the regular Kindle Fire and "stunning" on the Kindle Fire HD, but the actual screen display size is in fact slightly smaller on the Kindle Fire HD (the units are the same size overall, but there's more of a "black border" on the HD version).A few comments on the ads that Amazon displays on the Kindle Fire HD: You can pay to block them, but honestly they're not that bothersome to me. Full page ads display whenever you "wake" the device (if the ad interests you then you can press for more info, but otherwise you simply swipe to unlock the screen and the ad disappears). There's also a row of ads for "Apps you might enjoy" on the Home screen. It is very easy to ignore them altogether, but on occasion I have actually been interested in a few of their suggestions and was grateful to learn about some apps I probably wouldn't have discovered otherwise.I do have a few minor critiques for the Kindle Fire HD... Even though there is a "front facing camera" included, in the "out of the box" configuration it can only be used with Skype. If you want to use it as a true camera, you'll need to purchase an app for that. It puzzles me why Amazon didn't provide true camera functionality. To date I haven't bought a camera app yet, but probably will at some point (so far the apps available are not rated very well, so I'm holding off until there's a clear "winner" out there).Another issue that I have is related to bugs with the Email interface. Searching the Kindle forums I've seen similar issues reported by many others... The problem is that I have multiple email accounts (Comcast for my primary email, and GMail for calendar purposes) associated with the device (which it supports), but periodically my Comcast mailbox stops loading. The only workaround is to uninstall/reinstall the Comcast account, which is easy enough to do, but the point is that I should not have to do that... It's a bug, and it's annoying. (Interestingly, I do not have the same issue on my "regular" Kindle Fire... I have not had a single email issue on that device ever.)In terms of accessories, I bought the "fast charger" and a bright pink Kindle case for my Kindle Fire HD. The charger does work faster than previous Kindle chargers (but you have to buy it separately; if you have an older Kindle charger it will work with the Fire HD as well, just not as quickly as the new charger does). Initially I thought the Kindle brand case was overpriced, but it seems worth it. The device fits perfectly, all of the controls are accessible, and it is designed to automatically put the Fire HD to "sleep" when you close the cover, and to "wake it" when you open the cover... There's no need to turn the unit off and on, and I enjoy the "instant on" aspect. I also love the bright pink color since it makes it easy to spot where my Kindle Fire is around the house :-)The Kindle Fires come with a 1 month trial membership to Amazon Prime. I did not become a subscriber with my original Kindle Fire, but signed up after getting the Kindle Fire HD, if for no better reason than being able to watch Downton Abbey any time I choose (it looks and sounds exquisite on the Fire HD)...  It is worth browsing Amazon Prime's selections of shows and movies to see if they interest you enough to justify the subscription cost. The 1-month trial starts the day you activate the device, so be sure to give it a try. It's worth noting that the "free 2 day" shipping benefit (with no minimum purchase) really does help offset the cost. I've used that many times this holiday shopping season!I've gotten many many hours of enjoyment from the Kindles. I must say that for pure "reading" purposes, my first e-Ink Kindle Keyboard wins hands down. The e-Ink display is easiest on the eyes and works in any lighting condition other than "dark" (there is not backlight provided). This is definitely the model you'd want for reading by a pool or on the beach... Also, its battery life is INCREDIBLE (lasts for weeks at a time). However, its web browser capabilities are extremely limited (the interface with the Amazon store works fine, but that's about it), and the Black & White display doesn't lend itself to reading magazines, photo books etc.If you want a more versatile tablet-like device, the regular Kindle Fire and Kindle Fire HD are both excellent choices. They offer excellent value for money... I use my Kindle Fires on a daily basis, reading email, checking Facebook, listening to downloaded music, playing Scrabble and other apps... However, what I don't do that much on the Fires is to read books very much (partly because the other features become "distractions" and partly because I sense some eye strain when reading on the Fires)... For the most part, when it's time to read a good book I'll still turn to my original Kindle Keyboard for that.One final point: The Kindles are pretty much "the best thing since sliced bread" when it comes time to packing for travel. No need to haul a stack of books and games with you: This single lightweight device can hold more books, music, photos, games, etc. than you can ever possibly need. And it fits in my purse.  :-)Kudos to Amazon for an amazing family of products. I am a VERY satisfied customer.Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD vs the Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire HD vs the Google Nexus 7As many of the reviews seem to compare the kindle fire HD to the iPad, I will share my thoughts comparing the kindle to what I consider to be the actual competition, the google Nexus 7. I will start by saying I am a google/android user with an android phone and a big user of Gmail and Gchat etc to keep in touch with friends and family around the world. So what do I think after owning both the Nexus 7 and the Kindle fire HD?Positive things about the Kindle fire HD1. The screen - I cannot fault the screen at all, video is sharp, runs well without pauses (Netflix and amazon prime) and has great colour definition. I actually think the screen is better on the kindle fire HD than the nexus 7, it really is very pretty. The advertisements on the startup screen are really no issue, think of it like a screen saver, how often do you really look at it before you active the device?2. Sound - the speakers on the Kindle Fire HD are also very good, again better than the Nexus 7 and seem louder too.3. Built quality on both platforms seems very good although both suffer from the same small buttons which are hard to find.Negatives about the Kindle Fire HD1. The real negative about this device is the software or lack of Google software, if you have an android phone do not expect this to be an Android pad, its not. You do not get GChat/video chat (a big minus in my book) and the mail application is not the Gmail interface which while it works, I miss the uniformity across devices that I have gotten used to with Android. Yes I can get a 3rd party app to access gchat (again without video) but do I really want to give my password and login details to another application and company I have never heard of? I never did work out whether it has an alarm to wake my up in the morning like my phone.2. I know the Amazon Silk browser is supposed to fast, and yes it does work well, but I guess it really bugs me I cannot download alternatives.3. The carousel interface - this takes a little getting used too if you're an android user. The navigation around the device is not always as easy as it could be, but again something you can get used too.In summaryIf you want a really nice tablet to watch Netflix and Amazon videos, listen to Pandora or read books then this tablet is probably perfect for you. If however, you are looking for an Android tablet then you are perhaps better served looking at the Nexus 7 which for a little more money can do everything the Kindle HD Fire can do and more besides, you will find yourself reaching for your smart phone to check your email etc not your kindle. I carried my Nexus 7 around with me all the time and used it for a wide range of things but my Kindle Fire tends to sit beside my bed at home which is a real shame for such a nice device. If Amazon just allowed the Google apps to run I would certainly up my rating from a 3 star to a 4 star as the functionality of the device will greatly improve, as it is I will probably give my Kindle to my wife as she uses simple email applications, watches videos, reads and so will probably love this device.Final thoughtsI really want to love the device but I cannot, the device is great but is let down by the lack of functionality of the software.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD for Reading
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I'm a technical person. One of the things that I didn't necessarily like about the older Kindle models was that it was difficult to quickly jump through a book to find something. With the Fire, I am now able to quickly flip through pages to get to the information that I need. I am also able to tradionally read a book from start to finish without any issues.  I was also surprised that even in landscape mode (using a stand), I was able to read books without any issues. Sure I have to flick more to change pages, but it's no big deal. There's a little delay in browsing categories on the home page, but it's not that big of a deal. My main purpose of the Fire is for reading, and so far it has been an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: I love this tablet!
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: This is actually my 3rd kindle purchase. I owned the e-reader first, then received a Kindle Fire as a mother's day present earlier this year. My first kindle fire went with me everywhere. Two days ago, I received the Kindle Fire HD as a gift. Talk about improved! Its so much thinner and lighter, first off. And I always loved the size of the Kindle. I always thought the Ipad was too big to be portable. But this is the perfect size! The next thing I noticed was the display. From the second I turned it on, I was in awe of the crispness in the display! The next biggest improvement is definitely the sound!! Wow! It truly is surround sound coming out of this little tablet. Very impressive. Another thing I noticed immediately, was the speed. Noticeably faster than the first Kindle Fire. All in all, I have been extremely happy with it. There are a few things I noticed though that I CAN'T do. The Facebook app has no "share" option, which I find frustrating, especially since my old Kindle Fire had JUST got that option! And with my first Kindle Fire, I could long press on any image and save it. Not able to do that on the new one. Other than those few things, I am more than happy with this tablet. If you are considering buying this, DO IT, you will not he disappointed!

Reviews.Title: I love this little kindle
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I bought my first HD Kindle on October 6th. It worked perfectly for a week then suddenly the speakers pooped out and it kept overheating and shutting itself down before it had a chance to melt itself from the nuclear heat is was radiating. I contacted amazon and they quickly replaced it for free. I received my new kindle on October 23rd. My new kindle is in excellent condition and still going strong. The battery holds for about a week with me playing music for five hours at work, playing games throughout the day, watching videos, and reading.This is the first tablet I've ever bought and I thoroughly enjoy it. It is beyond excellent for the price and I couldn't be happier, even with my first HD kindle being a dud.

Reviews.Title: Kindle or other small pad
Reviews.Author: R. Caine
Reviews.Content: My wife says I am "obsessed " with my Kindle hd.  If you want the best app selection and hardware most will want an Apple mini. If you want the best browser, it's the Google Nexus. The Nook has a great display. More than anything else, I wanted content. If you want the most  content with easy access, a great display, and a very reasonable price, you want the kindle hd.This new kindle is wider and heavier than I'd hoped, but is such an improvement over the original Fire (that I loved), I am happy I bought the Fire hd with much more memory.I have bought all the kindles. The new kindle hd has a much improved display AND software. I love it!

Reviews.Title: This really is different than Kindle Fire First Generation
Reviews.Author: Sydney's Mom "7923"
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire, and thought buying the HD version was not necessary.  After all, Amazon calls this my 7th kindle.  I do love my electronics!  But I decided I liked my original Fire so much, I needed to see what the HD had.  I am glad I did, and consider my money well spent, as this is very different.It really is better in all the ways they describe, and the price is the same!1.  Sound.  I could barely hear my OF (original Fire).  Had to use headphones.  This one has beautiful sound, and bluetooth to beat!  I am going to research the type of bluetooth, and go out and buy headphones. Although the sound was beautiful out of my cheap earbuds, I suspect I will be watching it in bed a lot.  Some more comfortble headphones will be great.NOTE:  If you are watching a movie, and touch the screen, a bar comes up on the top where you can adjust the sound.  But this runs independently of the main volume control.  I had the volume all the way up on a movie, and wasn't quite able to hear it without my headphones.  I went to sound settings, and sound volume was only set 1/3 of the way up.  I increased it to half way up, and I was able to hear just fine.2.  Wireless.  I was able to stream a movie last night with no interruption.  That did not happen with my OF.  In addition, I couldn't believe how fast the wi-fi was.  It was just about useless with my OF.  I went online and was able to surf with no problems. I just paused writing this review to see if HBO Go worked.  With my OF, I could watch it in the living room, if I was able to put up with a lot of buffering, and not in the bedroom, which is farther from the router.  I just streamed an episode of True Blood in the bedroom, and no buffering.  The wireless is like night and day.  The dual band Wi-Fi was brilliant!3.  Picture quality.  Well, I haven't watched anything HD yet (all the things I had bought for my OF were SD.  After all, the screen was so small, it didn't really make a difference.)  But even SD, the picture quality is noticably better.4.  Form.  This kindle is smoothly beveled.  Buch more comfortable to hold than the original.  The OF was very square, and worked better with a case, as it was not comfortable to hold.  This one is very comfortable to hold.I set my Fire up on a plate stand last night, streamed a movie from Amazon, with no headphones, and was happily kntting away.  Then I decided to go to bed.  All I had to do was pause the movie, plug in my headphones, and I was good to go.  Unfortunately, when that movie ended I went to Amazon Prime and watched another.  But I guess Kindle Fire doesn't improve your self-control as well!Update:  I was able to stream 2 hour long TV shows, with no problem, and then watch a 90 minute movie.  I still had half my battery left.  This will be wonderful for long plain rides.  Just remember your earphones!

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet: A Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I have ever owned. I am incredibly impressed with it. I am a middle school music teacher, and there are a variety of apps I have been able to use in my classes. Not to mention, it's fun for personal use as well.Positive things I noticed:(1) The screen in PHENOMENAL. I cannot stress this enough. The image is so crisp and clear.(2) The sound is pretty loud. The speakers create a loud but clear sound.(3) The touch responsiveness on the Kindle Fire HD is pretty good. I rarely ever have to touch an icon more than once to open an application or type something.The only downside I have encountered:(1) Occasionally, the web browser will shut down without warning. It generally opens back up to the same tabs, but it's mildly inconvenient when you're in the middle of reading a webpage.I do not consider myself to be an expert on technology, but I manage to be pretty self-sufficient in using and repairing technology. I have to say, I think the Kindle Fire HD is very user-friendly. Between the ease of use and the amazing graphics and sound, I think this is a pretty good bang for your buck. It is not the world's fanciest tablet, but it is great for entertainment and casual use.

Reviews.Title: Great improvement
Reviews.Author: WestGrl
Reviews.Content: I owned the original Kindle Fire. I decided to upgrade to the Kindle Fire HD for a few reasons. I've been playing with it for a few days. It's a great improvement but there are some changes I don't care for.Screen: HUGE improvement. Pictures are crisp, clear & bright. You do get ads but only in the lock screen. I don't understand why some people have an issue with this. I spend about 1 second on the lock screen. Plus, some of the offers are great. For instance, today I got a $5 credit for an Amazon Instant Video.Kindle Reader: I have noticed the screen, when reading, seems to go more smoothly. A few small tweaks here & there but nothing else that changes the experience.Carousel: Instead of your favorites being at the bottom, below the carousel, now you get photos of what other people have bought. I really don't care for this change. I would rather have the favorites down there. Instead, they now have a star to click on to get to your favorites.Design: I do love the new design! It's slimmer & lighter. Easier to handle. The only downfall with this is that you will need all new cases. I am not crazy about the location of the power button. It's up top, right next to the new volume buttons. They do not stick up away but are rather blended in & I usually have to look for it to make sure I don't hit the volume button.Charger: Yes it's a USB charger. You can use your old KF charger or you can also locate cheap adapters for converting your USB charger into an outlet charger. They are easy to find & don't cost much.HDMI: this is the wow factor for me... I bought the HDMI cable required to plug my KF into my tv. I then streamed a movie. It was fantastic! Picture quality was awesome, sound was perfect! Just be sure to change the settings for the KF to never time out. If the screen goes blank, no more movie on the tv either. This new feature was reason enough for me to upgrade & it hasn't disppointed!Sound: Great sound quality! Great upgrade there.EMail: I'm not a big fan of the new email app. I don't get my notifications as quickly and for some reason it's not as loud so if there's alot going on, I don't hear it. Still messing around with it a bit but I really prefer the email app from the original KF.Web Browser: The new default search engine appears to now be Bing. Not really happy about that. It now will also let you see Most Visited, Trending Now & Selected Sites. There's a History tab & Bookmarks as well.Internet & WiFi: No problems connecting WiFi. Speed is definitely improved!Camera: Can't comment because the only thing you can use it for is Skype. Since I never video chat, the camera is of non-importance to me.Overall, I am happy but at times I miss some of the features from the original KF.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Robert F Harrison
Reviews.Content: As an owner of the original Kindle Fire (KF) I debated long and hard about upgrading to the latest version. I really liked the original, though it had a few faults that I came to know over time.First, let me say the reason I bought the original is that I do a lot of bicycling and my iPad was, frankly, just too big to haul around with me everywhere. The KF was just the right size and had decent enough battery life that I could read a book or watch a bit of a movie on a break during an all day ride.The biggest problems with the KF for me were low volume from the speakers forcing me to use a headset and slow syncing of email when around WiFi.The Kindle Fire HD has solved those problems for me and added a few bonuses. The volume is great (or at least compared to the original). I can listen to a movie in a room with a loud air con without breaking out the headset, a big plus for me at a volunteer phone answering service I do once a week. I like not having to use a headset when I do this as then I don't have problems answering the phone - just hit pause on the movie or media.The addition of a good Bluetooth connection makes is even better as I can use the same headset I use for my phone (LG Tone - HBS-700 Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange) at the same time.The WiFi connection of the KF HD is, as advertised, a lot more solid for me than that of the original KF.I've only had the KF HD for a half a day, but I'm already glad I upgraded. A good friend of mine is glad too as I'm passing my KF on to her. She got my original Kindle as well and later upgraded so passing this on will probably result in her buying whatever the 3rd Gen KF turns out to be. :-)And, though it's only tangentially related, I love the Whispersync bit. I listen to a lot of Audible books and keeping track of where I was on different devices was a pain. This is almost (though not quite - it's been confused) painless.Aloha!

Reviews.Title: I Hope this was just Teething Problems
Reviews.Author: A. Blanco "AllisteR"
Reviews.Content: I will preface this by saying I own 3 other Kindles:I did pick up the HD 7 16GB at local best buy. I think I got a bad one out of the batch:Negatives:1 - Edges of Screen had white bleed through, as if someone pressed the edges really hard and damaged the screen2 - With Netflix jerky video at best with alot of buffering. To test this I used my old Kindle with the same Netflix content and the video was fluid as to be expected with a new dual band wifi set up3 - Either this is a bad processor or damaged screen as there should not be issues rendering Netflix4 - Not all apps are compatible yet; we bought Monopoly and there is not a version for the new Fire Yet. Same with SAS Zombie Attack my current time waster.Nit Picks:1 - Not a big fan of the "People also Bought" at the bottom of the screen in portrait mode2 - I think $15 opt out of ads is LAIM/STUPID at best; if you buy a Kindle you'll consume content you don't need intrusive ads to remind you to spend money3 - no Flash support but that is not Amazon's Fault. Adobe does not support Flash on higher versions of AndroidPostives:1 - no issues with dropped wifi2 - BlueTooth connectivity was really nice feature to go with my SoundFreaq3 - from what I can tell the screen image quality is better than previous Kindles, you can really tell when viewing your "non-HD" cloud content4 - parental conrols are good/not great but new ones are scheduled for releaseThis unit had to be bad. I boxed up and will exchange for a new one. I am rating 2 stars b/c this Kindle deserved 2 stars. The next one should be OK (I Hope). In which case I will update this review.update: Sept 22 2012It took two tries at local Best Buy but I finally got a working unit.The first one see notes above. The second one I never took out of the wrapper because there was no power cord or paperwork in the box. In a rush to get product out are we?Third unit works really well and is a vast improvement over 1st gen. Kindle. High Definition content looks really good streaming and better when you download content. The Lorax looks awesome in HD. The bluetooth sound to my Soundfreaq makes watching movies and gaming really fun. A very good tablet to unwind to. Don't know how productive I could be but that's what the MS Surface Pro is for. Overall beyond the rough start, good unit and I am happy with it from a price/performance perspective. $200 for this Kindle is a deal. No reason to spend more if your casually comsuming content.

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful product except that it does not have flash player. An older Kindle model does have flash player. One of the major reasons I purchased a Kindle HD was to watch online courses (Coursera); however, I cannot watch most of these courses without a flash player.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet/reader...yay!
Reviews.Author: Jodi Jenkins
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, so I don't have anything to compare it to.  But. I really love it!I mostly use it for reading, but I like to check for stuff online too.

Reviews.Title: I like it.... kinda
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I was SOOOO excited about buying this. I did my research and my heart was set on buying the kindle fire HD. My boyfriend  told me to get the Nexus 7. I stood firm and said I wanted to Kindle Fire... welp.... I wish I got the nexus. The Kindle Fire HD isn't bad at all, but the Nexus has so much more. I have a android phone, so I use Google Play. With the kindle Fire HD you have to buy EVERY app, even gmail! For now, I'll keep it. But next time I'm listening to my tech bf and getting the nexus...also- you can't even take photos with this machine... I mean unless you like taking selfies all the time. Oh and you have to buy the camera app too.....

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: lucyhearn
Reviews.Content: this kindle is all that and then more. love the audio and reading at the same time. Keeps track of where you are, so you just continue on. love it!

Reviews.Title: Dollar for Dollar
Reviews.Author: William A. Beckerley "Still Bill"
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Kindle Fire HD for ease of use, for price or for quality.  I own three Kindles each has been a improvement over the other, but all three have their own good individual qualities and usefullness.  Amazon also has the very best customer service.  I'm 73 years along and have not encountered better customer service.

Reviews.Title: Alot to like, with some room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: J. K. Paasch
Reviews.Content: Disclosure: I've been an iOS user for the past several years.I've now owned my Kindle Fire HD for about 2 months. It's the first tablet I've owned. So far, I've been very impressed with it as a media consumption device that ties all my Amazon digital content together into a cohesive package.Screen:Resolution is pretty good. Not completely crisp, but not distractingly pixelated or anything. Makes for a solid viewing and reading experience.Sound:Those integrated speakers put out surprisingly good sound. A set of decent speakers or headphones still sound better than the integrated speakers, but those built-in speakers are certainly passable in a pinch.Amazon Integration:I've been making MP3, book, and video purchases strictly through Amazon for several years. I know, that's something of a sacrilege for a long-time Apple and iOS user like myself. However, Amazon's cross platform functionality means I can enjoy my purchased music, movies, and books across a number of platforms. Something I find sorely lacking with Apple products. Having said that, I think the Kindle HD is an added value for me as I now have even easier access to much of my digital content.Apps:The Amazon App store is somewhat disappointing. Not only do I have repurchase several iOS apps (that's on me and not a knock on the device), but as as has been said by many other reviewers, Amazon's curated app store just doesn't live up to the offerings found in iOS or Google Play. The big apps are all present and accounted for, but there are plenty of other useful apps that you won't find here. I suspect that's mostly a developer motivation issue, but as a consumer that's disappointing. The free app a day program is a nice perk.Incidentals:I'm not a fan of the placement of the mini-USB charging port. They should really include a wall charging plug with the device. Only the built-in web browser, Silk, is available for the Fire. Silk is fine, but I would like the option of downloading and using another browser. I purchased the OtterBox Defender Series Protective Case for Kindle Fire HD 7", Black (with built-in screen protection) along with this unit. Nice fit, and a sense of security when handling the Fire.Final Thoughts:I've been surprisingly impressed with the Fire HD. It's become a part of my regular media consumption routine (web browsing, books, videos, games), and I find myself using my iPhone less and less these days. If you can get past the less than fully stocked app store, then I think you'll find a device worth owning. Even more so if you are already into the Amazon digital eco-system.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" is poorly manufactured
Reviews.Author: Kendalle
Reviews.Content: The reason i chose 3 stars for the Kindle Fire HD 7" is because i think it could have been manufactured alot better, dont get me wrong i think they have alot of neat stuff on it and is definetly up to date on the technology part, but i've been sent 2 different ones from Amazon already and it hasn't even been a yr since i've bought my first one brand new, and after 4 months of having bought my first one it started having problems, it wouldnt let me watch movies ( and mind you, thats pretty much all i do on it) and getting on the internet sucked and it took a long time to just research one thing, and when i'd type something in the search bar it wouldnt let me type the whole thing i wanted to ( for example i would type attept to type "Moth Orchids" and it would only go as far as  "Moth O") and it would reasearch just the "Moth O. and it would Phantomly press buttons and when i'd turn the volumn up from the side and tap the screen to make volumn icon go away it would turn my volumn all the way down. This is happening to the last one they sent me whitch is supposedly brand new, and i have had many more problems with it and the Kindle will blame it on my internet but when i get onto Amazon on my laptop i have no more problems. Other people have told me they have had similair and other problems with their Kindle Fire HD also, so i am not the only one who has complained. If Amazons Techs would modify the Kindle Fire and make it to where it wouldn't have problems like these, then i would definetly rate the Kindle 5 stars...but sadly it's just not there yet.!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Drew K
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review on my iPad, which straightaway gives you an indication of how bad the keyboard is on the Kindle. I mostly use the iPad for checking email, listening to or reading books, watching videos, browsing, and an occasional game. I bought the Kindle for traveling because of its smaller size, and while it may suffice for most of these activities, it is not a replacement for an iPad or Nexus.My first frustration came while setting up my email accounts. While there is a specific selection for Gmail, it does NOT work. In order to link Gmail you have to use the "other" option and enter all the server and port information. While this is easy to do and sufficiently brings in your email it does NOT allow you to bring in either your calendar or your contacts, which is annoying and inconvenient (although writing email on the Kindle keyboard is more annoying so maybe it's for the best in the long run). To get access to your Gmail contacts you have to use the Silk browser to access Gmail from the web. Linking Yahoo mail with the preset option seems to work fine. Here you can get email and contacts without issue, but you can't link the calendar again. A few of the things that make the Kindle keyboard so annoying are: the key clicks sound (it grates on your nerves, I finally had to turn it off), the keys are not as responsive (compared to iPad) especially the first keystroke-it always takes several seconds to register, and the key positioning (where return key is on a normal keyboard Kindle puts the delete key).Where the Kindle excels is for audio and ebooks. Obviously all your Amazon content is readily accessible and fairly easy to navigate through. The screen is a little cramped due to the large area taken up by the bezel, but the definition is excellent and the content is easily readable. The screen is bright and the color is vibrant; easily outshining my iPad2, and the sound quality is excellent even at very high volumes, again much better than the iPad. However, I was shocked that there was no way to filter my Audible content. I have well over 200 titles and there is no way to filter for audiobooks, or newspapers, etc. which makes it exceedingly hard to browse your content. If you know exactly what you are looking for you can do search.Another thing that is really annoying is the size and location of the buttons to control on/off and volume. First, they are difficult to find because they are flush to the case and they are very small and difficult to distinguish by touch, so I wind up turning the Kindle off when I want to change the volume and vice versa. You never have this problem on the iPad because the buttons are raised and the volume is around the corner from the standby button. The placement of the micro-USB and mini-HDMI ports is also clumsy. The two connectors are relatively the same size but not a big deal once you memorize that charging is on the right. Having these ports on the bottom is curious. I put the Kindle in its case upside down, which allows me to use it while charging, but this puts the volume buttons upside down and also puts the camera on the bottom so I suspect that it would not work so well for video chat in this orientation. Also it puts more strain on the cable and connector than it would if the connectors were on the side.Navigation on the Kindle is frustrating. Your ability to customize the home screen or organize content is very minimal. You can add or remove items from the carousel and favorites, but that is about it. On the iPad you can organize apps into groups which allows you to quickly navigate to the content you are looking for (I have over 150 apps and by using groups on the home screen, none is more than 2 taps away). On the Kindle you get the fixed menu items (shop, games, apps, books, music, videos, newsstand, audiobooks, web, photos, docs, offers) which you cannot rearrange or delete. In the center of the screen you have a carousel of recently accessed items in chronological order. You can remove items from this section, but you cannot rearrange them. On the bottom right of the home screen you have a favorites link. Here you can add the apps, books, or videos that you access most often and you can arrange them in any order by holding down and dragging to the desired location.  On the Kindle, to access my 150+ apps would be: tap favorites, scroll, scroll, scroll, scroll, tap desired app. Although, this problem is minimized by the fact that less than half of the apps I have on my iPad are available for the Kindle. This is really disappointing because there are only a few of my iPad apps which do not have a Google Play Store counterpart. However, you cannot access the full Google Play Store from the Kindle - you can only get what is in the Amazon App Store. So like iPad is for iTunes and App Store, Kindle is for Amazon. The difference is that while I can rip the thousands of CDs and DVDs I already own to iTunes and then sync them to my iPad, there is no such option for Kindle. There you can only get what you've purchased at Amazon or uploaded to Amazon Cloud Drive (max 250 songs for free).So, bottom line is while it will work for most of my intended purpose of having a smaller travel device, I'm disappointed in the ability to get and organize content. It is, at its core, an extension of the Amazon store, let's call it what it really is - an "Amazon Appliance," so if that's what you are looking for it's perfect. However, If you are looking for a small full-featured tablet then pay a few more dollars and get an iPad Mini or Google Nexus 7. You will be much happier with your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good if your home network works good, but VERY questionable on the road
Reviews.Author: Mark Schick
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 7 kindles and have had very little problems with them in the past.  However, we have been traveling more and have come across many issues with the inability of the kindle to connect to a hotel wireless network.  I have an IPad, and many laptop computers that had no problem at all connecting, but the Kindle wouldn't connect.  When I called Amazon, they said it was the hotel router, and that the hotel would need to rest the router.  I called the hotel corporate help line, and they had the router reset, and it still didn't solve the problem.  My wife called Amazon again, and they said that it is the routers fault, not Kindle.  My wife called the Amazon customer service line, and when we explained to them what happened, they then informed us of a "firmware" issue, then the person told us that the Kindle was really meant to read books.  So we brought our two Kindles, and one IPad, with only the IPad working.  I would recommend buying a used IPad, over a new fire.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have two Kindle Fire HD 7" and have been very happy with the devices.  These are used exclusively for media.  Just a few highlights on what I considered before picking the Fire:Appearance:-Ads are not annoying, who cares what pops up on the opening screen?-Fingerprints are annoying, but a good reminder to clean the screen regularly-Good size, but can get a bit heavy if holding while watching/playing rather than using a case.  I like how slim it is and the sleek design.Battery:-I can usually get a couple of movies, and depending on length, multiple episodes of a TV show while streaming on a fully charged batteryEase of Use:-very intuitive, my two year old and four year old both figured out how to swipe and open most apps, etc.-good parental controls to avoid those accidental kids purchases-easy to navigate through apps, movies, etcMedia:-Love using this with Amazon Prime, very easy to get movies/shows to stream-Volume is pretty good considering size-Pictures are crisp and most movies/TV shows show up great-A few freeze ups/glitches while playing or switching between apps, and sometimes drops the wi-fi connection, but overall the problems are few and don't happen often (maybe once every few weeks)Customer service:-I have to give a shout out to the Amazon customer service.  I recently cracked the screen (completely my fault) and Amazon sent me a replacement for free (2 day shipping) and paid for the return shipping of the damaged Fire.  I was very happy with that result.

Reviews.Title: MUCH MORE THAN I EXPECTED!
Reviews.Author: Donna Berkowitz
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is much more than I expected!  My husband bought it for Mother's Day and I couldn't be happier.  The colors are incredible, the sound is awesome.  If you have used a laptop then just imagine putting the HD quality of a new laptop add the sound and stuff it all into a seven inch screen, giving you the advantage of portability.  All of the benefits of a laptop, TV, and book in one.  I can surf the web, play a games, read a book, watch a movie or my favorite TV programs anytime.  My biggest suggestion is make sure you have Wi-Fi in your home.

Reviews.Title: more than i tbought it would be
Reviews.Author: Robert R. Miller
Reviews.Content: The Kindle is like a mini computer....did not realize this when I bought itHave enjoyed using it for fun and for many other things....such as a camera, email, skypeAnd many other uses!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7'
Reviews.Author: Rockfish
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle.  I had it for two weeks.  When I first received the Kindle I was wondering whether I would return it for another tablet.  Not................  The Kindle cannot be all things to all people, but if you are a Prime member, like I am, then it makes sense to give the Kindle serious consideration.  I love being able to read and listen to my music from one device, and then surf the web or play poker for a diversion.  The Dolby speakers are fantastic.....  The available apps are sufficient for my needs, and are either free or less than $2.  The Kindle 7 is excellent for content consumption and small enough for local commuting.  The ads are not bothersome, matter of fact, I like seeing what else is out there without hunting for it.The bottom line, I enjoy my Kindle much more than I expected, and make a point of reading with it every day.  Reading Psalms or Proverbs and listening to John Coltrane on my Kindle alway takes the edge off my day.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Wanda Hall
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to use without proper instructions.  I mainly bought the kindle to be able to use when camping or out of town.  I have yet to figure the technicalities of being able to download my emails from my main computer.  Some of the explanations on you tube are not that easy to follow.  I have been searching for a complete manual to be able to read and haven't  found any nor any class of any type to attend.  I am really not that  smart as some of the younger people who grew up with all the electronics available to them. In time and being able to find somebody who can help me I am sure it will be of some use to me. The games that are available to me are a little bit childish but better than nothing at all.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Victoria Lotts
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to order this at first.  I had never used a tablet and really didn't know what to expect. I've had my other kindle for years and have enjoyed reading many books on it.  This is a major step up. I love it.  I love reading books, checking emails, following facebook, etc.  The color and sound is fantastic. The camera is a bit confusing.  I realize it appears to be more for skyping than taking pictures, but with a little ingenuity, I have learned to take pictures with it.  I do wish there had been an instruction booklet include instead of going on line for questions. It was great to have 500 coins included to allow me to purchase apps. As a more "mature" user this has made me feel part of the electronic age.  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: I had been contemplating ordering a Kindle Fire HD for some time. I had purchased the original Kindle Fire for my Mom for Christmas a year ago and she raved about it. My first Kindle that shipped to me somehow went missing at the Post Office. But Amazon's amazing customer service sent me another one and even gave me a credit on my account for the inconvenience I experienced driving across town to the Post Office to try and pick it up with my attempted delivery slip only to be told it wasn't there. My second Kindle arrived quickly and I've been in love ever since. I find the selection of apps is great, there is even a West Law Next I downloaded for free so I can do legal research anywhere there's wifi (I'm an attorney). The screen is crystal clear and I actually like watching movies on it, which surprised me since I'm used to a big screen TV. The speakers are great and reading books is a great experience. I really like being able to tap on a word and have the definition pop up immediately. All in all, this is a great item to have and I'm very happy I took the plunge with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Close but...
Reviews.Author: Reno413
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Amazon customer for many years now. I also am a loyal Apple customer for many years owning many of their fine products over the years. I purchased an Ipad 3 last year but recently decided it was too big and heavy for what I primarily used it for, reading ebooks, checking emails, watching videos, etc.. So I recently decided to investigate something in a smaller footprint. I purchased a Kindle Fire HD and an Ipad mini for comparison. I love the Kindle Fire's bright vivid HD screen and the Dolby stereo is terrific when watch a TV show or movie. After that though it's all downhill for me. After a few days of use the touchscreen stopped being responsive requiring firm and precise and sometimes multiple attempts to get it to register my touch. Also the wifi connection was very slow in grabbing a connection and not very strong at keeping it. Start up time is painfully slow on the Kindle and the charging time is as well. On the other hand the Ipad while not having nearly as nice a screen and not nearly the volume or sound quality of the Kindle just does everything else so well. Start up time is great. It gets and holds my wireless wifi signal all over my house. Something the Kindle could not manage. Also the On/Off and volume buttons on the Kindle are so flush with the unit they're impossible to find in the dark while watching a video. I know the Ipad is more expensive but in the end for me at least the Ipad is the clear winner and that is not even taking into account all the apps that are available for the Ipad that are not available for the Kindle. Just my two cents worth of having and using both products. You judge for yourself.

Reviews.Title: New user to Kindle line of products
Reviews.Author: cmh7611
Reviews.Content: Now that I know how to operate my kindle and all the things you can do on it I am extremely pleased.  So far I have received/sent email, played games.  Looking forward to reading on my Kindle.  I haven't had a chance to watch a movie or tv shows on it, but I'm sure it will be a wonderful addition.  The sound is very good as well as the pictures on the screen.  I origally bought my Kindle to help pass the time on long, boring airplane flights, but I am sure now that I will use it just as often at home.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and I enjoy it a lot.
Reviews.Author: G. Price
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy a Kindle Fire HD but my neighbor bought one and after seeing what she could do with hers, I decided to buy one.  I enjoy using it for email and Facebook and for watching Prime videos.  There is a lot more to explore.

Reviews.Title: How do I live, without you...
Reviews.Author: Tommy Gast
Reviews.Content: The field of competition is fierce for internet tablets. For the 7" versions the top three contendors are without question The Kindle Fire HD, iPad Mini, and the Google Nexus 7.Why I did not choose the iPad mini. #1 reason, I do not like the limited nature of how files are added to this device. You have to use iTunes for everything, and that can be a frustrating experience. You are also limited by compatibility and playability issues for tons of everyday used media formats like XviD, DivX, OGG, Flac, .CBR, and near ALL eBook formats.Why I did not choose the Nexus 7. It's basically a jumbo sized Android phone that does not make calls, I already have a Motorola Razr Maxx and didn't feel it was much of an upgrade with the only sole exception, the screen size.The Kindle Fire HD (A huge improvement to the original Kindle Fire) is a breathtaking unbelievably stunning resourceful and overall life improving device that once you are accustomed to, you will use more than any other technology device with the only near competition being your cellular phone. However once you are familiar with it you will even use your phone less often, probably only to make calls.I did an extensive amount of online research and hands on interactivity with all three tablets before deciding on the Kindle Fire HD.One thing that will blow your mind like that Maxell commercial where the guy in the couch gets blown over by a gust of sound, is just that, the onboard speakers. Phenomenal, crisp, LOUD, detailed, rich, deep, and did I mention LOUD! It's shocking how much better the speakers are on the Kindle Fire HD compared to everything else. The iPad Mini is embarassed into shame, the Nexus7 got Manny Paquiaowwed in the 1st round. The difference is that amazing.Compatibility to/with your mixed media collection. I can play every video format upto even 1920x1080p movies, every audio format including Apples AAC and Windows WMA, all eBooks (mobi, azw, azw3, pdf, cbr. cbz, to name a few).With the ability to "sideload" Android apps you are not limited to what is offered by the Amazon Store. And there are tricks to get apps on the device that are stubborn to get installed. One w3ay is by downloading ES File Explorer to your Android phone, downloading that app to your phone, backing the app up, then copying the file from your phone to the Kindle Fire HD. A good place to learn a lot about how to maximize the unbound potential of this everyday workhorse device is by watching online video tutorials on YouTube. And by reading the eBooks: Kindle Fire HD The Missing Manual, Kindle Fire HD for Dummies, Taking Your Kindle Fire to the Max. One recommended app to have is  Aneesoft's Kindle Fire Converter Suite. Also Handbrake, to convert your DVD and BLURay movies to high quality Mp4 videos to watch and take with you on the road.I use my Kindle Fire daily to listen to music, Chris Medina's What Are Words is blasting right now. I use both gaming emulators N64oid and Gensoid to play ROMS of classic Nintendo 64 and SEGA Genesis games. I read comics with the Comicat app. I listen to Slacker and Pandora radio, watch movies on Netflix. Gamble on a fake slot machine on Slots by Kabam. Watch my movie collection on VLC and CineXPlayer. Control my desktop PC with Jump Desktop. Make Skype calls. Browse and shop on eBay, FB, Tumblr, Spotify, Craigslist, Zoosk, Hulu, Redbox, and the list could go on all the live long day.Improve the quality of your life and just BUY it! I forgot to mention that I am currently disabled in a wheelchair and this device is a lifesaver for me. It's a media consumption,communication, gaming, reading, listening force that will change your life. It did mine.Best purchase I made in 2013 without question. An essential everyday tool for living and... enjoying life.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Love it!
Reviews.Author: spring
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle Fire HD 7" 16 G in January 2013 and I use it every day.  I am in love with it. I hardly use my laptop or desktop computers any more unless it's for something I can't absolutely do on my Kindle. I watch tv and play games on it or make my grocery list out on one of the apps I downloaded on it. I keep my diary on it. I put all my notes on it so I don't forget important information. I keep addresses and phone numbers in the app on it. It was easy to download a app to print from my printer.  So I can print from my kindle fire HD. I can't say enough about my kindle. I have told everyone about it. It's easy to take to the Dr office with me and use it to play games or surf the web if they have open Wi-Fi. I take it shopping to shop fir groceries. I can't say enough good things about it. I have no negative thoughts on it. If I would have had more money when I ordered mine, I would have bought the 32 G, so later I will buy that one and give this one to my son. Watching movies on it is great. Sound is fantastic. Picture is crystal clear. There's so many games on it that can be downloaded that you can keep busy playing them. And it's easy to read a book. I hadn't read a book in a long time until I got this and then I read one in 1 day. It makes it so much easier to read. There are so many reasons why you should want to have one of these. I am hooked on Kindle Fire's

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased and awesome sound
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This Kindles sound is great! After much consideration between an HD and a Ipad mini I finally decided to keep it Kindle since I am an avid book reader. At first I was disappointed that I didnt have animated page turn but that thought went fast when I began to really enjoy this product. I had the regular kindle fire which was OK but this one is great its crisp and clear, very responsive with no lag like regular android tablets I HATE lag and this one hasnt lagged as of yet a week later. The sound is what blew me away it is nice and loud I dont nned ear plugs to enjoy Netflix on Amazon movies along with music. This is a great buy I bought the 32GB one and I have lots and lots of room no deleting of apps and games to make room for more. I have no complaints and I have much praise for Amazon for this enjoyment and feeling that YES I got my moneys worth!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 7"
Reviews.Author: Norma L. Ball
Reviews.Content: I like that the new kindle fire has the 32GB. It does not however, carry the ability to get my banking online, which my regular kindle fire does., So I have to carry two of them with me.

Reviews.Title: Rock beats scissors- fire HD beats IPad 2, for kids
Reviews.Author: kandyroxy
Reviews.Content: Fellow moms- the jury is in after a week+ and the winner the iPad vs. kindle fire hd battle is... The Fire HD!Lowdown:After being heavily invested in apple children's apps, it was difficult to contemplate the switch but after becoming increasingly disillusion with iTunes user friendliness and Apple's general corporate philosophy, I decided to take the plunge for Baby.I was worried they would fight over the iPad but the opposite has happened. No, there are not as many quality kids educational apps but there are enough. Amazon, by whom I am a loyal customer and biased by its locale, is the hands down winner as a media device. With prime rivaling Netflix, there are plenty of free options. We had been buying all out kid movies via Amazon Instant and watching them on our Internet TV. Now the kids can access them all- no more 30 min download like iTunes. Music, just as easy. In fact, waiting in my cloud were digital versions of albums I bought 10 years ago. Free. Most of those CDs are long since scratched or lost. Bonus!The best feature though is Kindle Free Time. You set up a profile for up to 6 kids. And manage exactly what contact each is allowed to access. Then, when you hand over the device in that mode, the kids can't get out of it, surf the web or buy anything. You can choose app by app, movie by movie. And forget about it.Where amazon's content thwomps Apple's is in children's ebooks. For 1.99 per month, 1 profile can access a kid version of prime. Only totally G rated content. Tons of kids books (traditional not speaking),  tv shows etc are right in Freetime for them to explore.I would happily trade in my iPhone for a Fire version if I could and will when I can. For adults, there are plenty of apps and the sound is better than the iPad. The ebooks are crisp and the access to the store to order things you need is just too easy.We will not be purchasing anymore iPads in our house and everyone is pleased about that, especially our pocketbook!

Reviews.Title: Love this!
Reviews.Author: R. Haynes
Reviews.Content: The BEST purchase I've made for myself in years!Pros:HD picture is amazingI purchased (after my free trial) the Amazon Prime and love it.Light and easy to tote around with me.  Even with the leather case I purchased through Amazon.LOVE the fact I can make things on the screen bigger.Love the email feature.Love the contacts feature.It does have a calendar, but it does not sync with my AOL calendar.Which is not a big deal to me.I've purchased several games and they are great.I watch movies or TV shows while I'm cooking or working on something.Very easy to place wherever you want it and start and stop the program.and of course, great for books and magazines.Everything is just prettier and "cooler" than my old Kindle 2nd addition.(I still love you Kindle 2nd Ed.....you were my first)  :)I travel a lot.  I now just send my documents that I need for a trip to my DOCs on my Kindle Fire.So easy and convenient.I used to take a Kindle, a net book, and a folder of documents...now I just take my Kindle FireOnly Con for me:It takes wonderful pictures, but I can't see what I'm taking a picture of.I guess it's made to hold in front of your face and snap a picture of you and whoever is next to you.But, it's okay, as I have a good digital for photos.  So no biggie!It's hard to impress me LOL and I am totally impressed with the Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle
Reviews.Author: StampQueen
Reviews.Content: In a heartbeat, I'd pick a Kindle over an iPad.  The price is right and the quality is second to none.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet Goes To Amazon's Kindle Fire HD 16GB
Reviews.Author: Skeels
Reviews.Content: Why I bought the Kindle Fire HD Tablet:1. Price2. Features3. SizeMy six year old son loved using our desktop computer. So much, that no one else hardly got a chance to use it. That was the turning point in my decision to buy.After a little research I decided to buy the Amazon Kindle Fire HD as my first tablet.What really sold me was FreeTime, Amazon's Kindle Fire HD offers an app called FreeTime. Its a subscription based service for the bargain rate of just $4.99 a month. It's perfect for my 6 year old. Amazon has done all the work for busy parents. I no longer have to search for suitable apps/books/videos for my six year old. FreeTime offers plenty of variety for him to choose from and no advertisements. It took me 5 minutes to get him started with his own profile. One app to do it all. How nice! The Kindle Fire HD is the perfect educational tool for my 6 year old.If you have had experience with an android device before you purchase, then the Kindle Fire HD is a "no brainer" to navigate. My 6 year old son was navigating in seconds. I already had an Amazon account, so out of the box, it took me 5 minutes to set up and start using.The WiFi works great. I had no problem streaming videos from YouTube.A)I found no issues with this device out of the box.B)Incredibly user friendly for users that have experience with android devices.C)A+ educational tool for children.D)The Dual antennae WiFi works works without fault!Purchased at Staples for $199.00 plus 6% tax with a $20.00 rebate on 2-11-13.Thanks Jeff for an fun and affordable tablet!

Reviews.Title: Long time iPad user
Reviews.Author: Bruce Sobocinski
Reviews.Content: So i bought this for my fiancee an I because were always fighting over the iPad. I am in awe of this device. It is so fast and easy to use and such a vast improvement over the kindle fire. Great job amazon. I love my iPad but i think i love the Fire HD more especially the price point. Keep up the great changes!!!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 7"!
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I had been thinking of getting a Kindle Fire for over a year but was feeling guilty as I already had a basic Kindle. I was "forced" to buy one when Newsweek went all digital in Jan. 2013. (Thank you, Newsweek!) I made a conscious decision to go with the Kindle Fire over an iPad. I wanted the smaller form factor. The iPad mini had just launched but I've been a tech user for many, many years and have never been a fan of iTunes and the Apple ecosystem. (No, I'm not an Apple hater, I chose an iPhone over an Android phone.) Although I'm not a big movie buff, in recent years, our local movie rental places have been closing so when I did rent movies, I had been streaming them from amazon. I love having the HDMI output on the Kindle Fire. I can now stream movies on any TV in the house - much more comfortable than using my laptop! (See my review on the 12 ft. HDMI cable I use. It lets me control everything from the couch.) Finally, and not least important, the Kindle Fire won out over the iPad mini based on price. My experience with the Kindle Fire HD - sometimes the responsiveness is not as smooth as it could be, but the fraction of a second of hesitation doesn't hamper my user experience.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Hd Vs. the iPad
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Are you deciding about getting the kindle Fire Hd vs the ipad? Well this will answer your question. The kindle fire hd is way better than any old ipad, because it gets apps that are exclusive for android, has a better processor,has better software, weighs less, and has a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: All My Media Needs Are Met In Stereo & HD
Reviews.Author: N8online
Reviews.Content: I was about to buy an iPad when the last generation Kindle Fire crept up out of nowhere.  I snagged one from Target because most of the time I live on the Amazon website, so it was perfect for me.  I loved what I got out of the first generation Fire.  I was going to get the iPad mini when the Fire HD crept up on me as well. I heard of all the improvements and let me tell you I am happy with my purchase.  I got the Fire HD from Amazon this time.  I like the build improvements that were made.  The high definition screen is a thing of beauty.  I paid a little extra to get the 32 GB model along with the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7" Standing Leather Case, the 2 year Square Trade warranty, the Amazon Kindle PowerFast charger, and the Micro HDMI cable (with a free stylus from Handheld items) to connect to your HDTV. I was able to get all these side items with 16 more GBs of memory for MUCH less than the iPad mini.  I was going to buy the 8.9", but I went with the 7" so I could get the extra 16 GBs of memory.  I am pleased with the compact size of the 7 ".  I personally have grown to like Amazon's music store better than iTunes.  I like the fact that I have access to my music from all my devices, even my iPhone with the new Amazon MP3 app for OS devices.  I also like the fact that all the music you purchase from Amazon is stored in the cloud for free! People's eyes get big when they hear the sound that come from the Fire HD's stereo speakers.  Netflix works very well on this device.  I joined Amazon Prime and loving every minute of it. I love the instant access of Kindle books, free 2 day shipping, and their instant streaming of movies and TV shows.  I can access Amazon videos from my Fire HD, iPhone 4,  Xbox 360, Wii U, Google Chromebook, or  just about any other computer.  The wifi strength has been excellent.  The Kindle Edition game apps are very rich looking and fluid in motion.  I am glad I went with the extra storage so I can store more games.  I enjoy my comic books.  The screen on the fire hd looked better than the iPad mini.  If you or going to use a tablet mainly for books, music, movies, comics, magazines,  basic email, audiobooks, and basic web browsing, it is hard to beat the Kindle Fire HD.  Their Amazon Prime membership privileges, excellent customer service, and their overall value for the price made it an easy decision for me.

Reviews.Title: CAN'T GET BETTER FOR THE PRICE! SO MANY FREE AND PAID SERVICES
Reviews.Author: Windmere
Reviews.Content: GREAT PRICE, GREAT DEVICE, GREAT SERVICES:The price point of the Kindle Fire HD is a great value.  One can do many things with the Fire (as you know, it's much more than just an e-reader). The fact that this Fire is 7" is great for me because it's very portable.
