I really don't want to discuss all the Fire capabilities here because all of this is clearly and truthfully explained in Amazon's comprehensive product description.  I cannot overstate that Amazon's claims regarding the Fire's abilities are true.  I find that the Fire's functions work for me and I enjoy using them very much.  Because the Fire's capabilities are so clearly stated in Amazon's product description, I'm going to be a little different and focus on all of the extra services that can come with the Fire.WITH THE PURCHASE OF A KINDLE FIRE HD, YOU CAN GET THESE SERVICS:PRIME MEMBERSHIP:  My personal experience is that with HD capability, video play is very crisp when you watch an HD video. I did spring for the optional Prime Membership ($79 a year), and there is a huge array of videos that are available for free viewing (both HD and SD). If you shop frequently from Amazon, then the free two day shipping benefit (for Prime eligible items) will pay for Prime in a short time.  With Prime, one can also borrow a different e-book once a month from a large selection of eligible e-books.AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE (PARTICULARLY WITH KINDLE REPLACEMENTS):  One of the great benefits of working with Amazon is the fact that their customer service excellent.  It's been my experience that Amazon customer service representatives go above and beyond to help customers.  If there is a product issue that cannot be resolved, very frequently they will arrange for the product to be returned to Amazon for free and a replacement is promptly shipped. If you have a problem with a device within the warranty period, Amazon backs up that warranty without question.I myself have benefited from Amazon warranty policies several times (INCLUDING A REPLACEMENT KINDLE WHEN MY FIRST KINDLE FIRE BECAME DEFECTIVE).  Additional warranty protection can be purchased from Square Trade and my personal experience with Square Trade is very good.  I have gotten a brand new device replacement from Square Trade with no problems.FREE BOOKS, APPS AND MUSIC:FREE BOOKS:  One extremely attractive benefit of working with Amazon is the huge amount of free perks. With e-books, there is a top 100 list of best selling paid and free downloadable e-books.  This list can be refined by choosing a category (such as cooking, food and wine).  I have gotten so many excellent free cookbooks that I'm sure to become a gourmet cook in no time (grin).  The best selling book lists literally change every hour, so you never know what will come next.FREE MUSIC:  Similar to the to the lists of free books, there is a list of top selling paid and free MP3 music.  Again, you never know what will come next because the list changes hourly.FREE APPS:  There are a ton of free Apps in Amazon's App market.  One benefit I particularly enjoy is the "Free App of the Day."  I have obtained lots of very interesting paid Apps for free. These daily free Apps can normally cost from .99 to as much as 14.99.  The free 14.99 App I obtained was OfficeSuite Professional 6.  Today's (1/24/2013) Free App of the Day is a "White Noise" App with more available ambient sounds than the regular free "lite" version.  Today's free app normally costs 1.99.FOR ME:I don't know what I would do without my Kindle Fire HD.  It's an excellent product with a lots of "cool" capabilities.  It's ideal for me.  After you've evaluated Amazon's product description page, you might find that its capabilities are ideal for you too.  I know there are a lot of tablets available from the tech market.  I have found that the Fire HD is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Osenbaugh
Reviews.Content: Since this is my first tablet I can't compare the Kindle Fire HD to another tablet but I love my Kindle Fire HD 7".  It also comes in an 8.9" if you like a little bit bigger one.  I choose the 7" because we have a trike and it should be handy for me to play games or read a book while we are traveling down the road. It will  also fit in the zipper compartment that is on the drivers backrest in front of me.  I can also keep up with my email while traveling.  The Kindle Fire HD has a quick response and the duel speakers are great.  Very good sound.  It is like having a tiny computer since you can play games, shop, check email and watch movies or TV shows.  It also comes with Skype and has a built in camera for Skype.  I also think the price is very reasonable compared to other tablets.  I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: GOOD FOR AMAZON CONSUMERS
Reviews.Author: Farah
Reviews.Content: This product's great for those who frequent Amazon's ecosystems - needless to mention, the device's custom made Android that the company utilizes to its contents only. If interested in "do it all" tablet, this's probably not be the best for you; however, if you're not into Amazon so much, I suggest you buy all purpose device. Over all, for $200, I'd say great buy.

Reviews.Title: poor user interface, very limited app store, bad stock browser
Reviews.Author: Benson Chiang
Reviews.Content: I have experience with Google Nexus 7 and Ipad 1, 2, and mini.  I purchased the Kindle Fire HD because on paper it has great tech specs and the price is very reasonable (and because I'm a huge fan and supporter of Amazon over the years).  On to my review:The Good:1) $199 is a great price for a 7" tablet2) very good specs on paper3) very good integration with Kindle books, Amazon video, Amazon shopping and experience4  video and sounds are greatThe Bad:1) Horrible horrible user interface, one of the most poorly designed UI I've ever experienced2) Very limited app store, in order to get a lot of common apps, you have to purchase them indirectly- wasn't hard but just a hassle, NO GOOGLE PLAY3) stock web browser is very poor, slow loading time, and to get an alternative browser, you have to go through a third party to buy apps which as previously mentioned, was a hassleThe reason I'm giving this device only 1 star is because with a tablet, User Interface, Apps, and web are the most important part.  They are the main reason you use tablet and on these 3 major areas, the Amazon Kindle Fire HD completely failed.  I am a huge amazon fan and own 2 other Kindle reading devices, so I've been a huge supporter of their products over the years.  I very much wanted to like the Kindle Fire HD but it is just a complete fail unfortunately.For those considering this product, I would recommend the IPad mini or the Google Nexus 7 any day.

Reviews.Title: from five stars to one
Reviews.Author: kat Thomas
Reviews.Content: After two months, four replacements, and Kindle trying to pass off a refurbished device as a brand new one; I have decided Amazon and Kindle are the most fraudulent companies I have ever dealt with.The only feature that I really like about the Kindle is Sywpe. The keyboard and cursor are better on here than the other tablet I've used.If you don't care about a device that actually works the way a company claims or broken screens, Kindle Fire HD 7" is the product for you.But in my humble opinion, it's crap.

Reviews.Title: iPad beware!
Reviews.Author: Ramen Girl
Reviews.Content: I have been using my new KFHD  7" for about 3 days, but I can honestly say it kicks my iPad's butt!  I am a HUGE Amazon.com fan anyway (since the company started) and it just made sense to trade up to a Kindle Fire.  I debated through the Kindle Fire, but couldn't wait any longer once the HD was released.  It is user friendly, the sound is phenomenal, the HD screen is beautiful and the 7" is perfect.  I was leery of going to a smaller size after the iPad, knowing the larger KFHD was available, but I like the portability and weight, and it still seems sturdy.  I am thrilled with my purchase, yet I have one complaint.  Maybe someone can help me, but is there anything comparable to the iPad's podcasts?  I miss those.  Although, I can watch many videos on various websites that I was unable to view before because of Apple's video player and lack of Flash player and I think HTML.  Correct me if I am wrong.  The pros definitely outweigh the cons.  I would invest in Amazon Prime along with the Kindle Fire.  If you compare the cost of a year of Netflix vs the Amazon Prime it's a no-brainer.  With Prime you get access to.many free tv shows and movies, free two day shipping, and a free book rental each month.  Netflix is 7.99 per month.  Prime is 79.00 a year with all the added benefits.  I had Amazon Prime even before the KFHD and it pays for itself.  Thanks Amazon.com for everything!  iPad beware!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Screen and Much Faster than the Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: vbhandyman
Reviews.Content: First impression after turning it on and charging it up Fully is that this is a beautiful screen, very responsive... and FAST! Sound is very loud though the speakers, so you won't miss anything.I got the leather case for it, which is thinner and more sturdy than the one for the first Kindle Fire.It came charged about 66% and with the Fast Charger (which you buy separately) it was fully charged in about 1.5 hours.Overall, a great buy at $214 (i got mine without special offers, cause who wants that on their kindle)OMG, I just realized that the Kindle Fire HD has "Read to Me" Function. Thank god, because my kindle paperwhite got rid of it!UPDATE: HOLY COW!!!!! THE "READ TO ME" VOICE IS 1,000,000 TIMES BETTER THAN IT USED TO BE. THIS FEATURE ALONE IS WORTH THE MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle HD!
Reviews.Author: Rather89
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this kindle! I'm new to tablets, and with so many options out there I feel like I definitely went with the right one. The price is excellent, the sound quality is amazing, and the picture is superior to anything I've seen in a tablet. I know people are complaining about the ads, but they're not a big deal. They only show up for two seconds on the home screen. The only reason I gave this four stars is because the charger was sold separately. Every electronic gadget I've bought had always come with a wall charger, so I was a little disappointed about having to buy that separately. But overall the kindle HD is an amazing product!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Hits a Home Run!
Reviews.Author: Craig Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad 1 and my wife has an iPad 2.  This device is outstanding compared to an iPad.  Really!  I don't understand some of the negative reviews.  The advertisement that some people are complaining about just isn't a big deal at all.  It's on the lock screen.  You only see it for a second when you first open your Kindle!  And the advertisements that I have seen have actually been useful (coupons, movie trailers, etc.).  This is a non issue.Some other things...- It's fast.  Really fast.- Graphics are nice and crisp.- The user interface is slick and intuitive.The only complaint that I have is that the sound isn't a great as what I thought it would be.  From reading other reviews, I expected the sound to blow me away.  It didn't.  The sound is tinny with no bass.  Of course the sound is awesome with headphones.I think the majority of people will be very happy with this product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is the way to go!!!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany E. Case
Reviews.Content: I dont usually write reviews but this is such a great product that I will pay it forward and help others to decide that this is well worth their money. The Kindle is lightweight and has a beautiful HD display!!! I have never seen a tablet or e reader look sooooo crisp and clear. The surround sound is just that and it works well(especially with earphones). I can download a movie and watch with no problems or glitches. I haven't used the camera yet but I'm sure it works fine.Everything is very organized and it only takes a couple of hours to fully learn where everything is located. I like the parental controls setting for when my 8 year old uses it too!! I think that for the price of $199 it is waaaay worth it!!!! When I received it from Amazon, they had already registered it in my name so all I had to do was connect to Wi-fi and I was set to go!!! You also receive a free month of Prime and since I have never tried that before...I like that I am having an option to now and that it is set to go as well right out of the box!!! I am sure I will use this for quite a few years and that's why I got extended accidental coverage. I also bought the Kindle leather case with magnets and it has a lot of nice features too(see other product review). If your looking for an inexpensive tablet/e reader...you should definitely buy this!!! It has a lot of capabilities and is basically a mini laptop. You can also put a HDMI cable into the TV and Kindle and stream HD movies...love it, love it, love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Substantially Better than Original
Reviews.Author: mysticgeek
Reviews.Content: I am heavily invested in Amazon streaming services and a Prime member and pre ordered the original last year. After the Fire HD was announced, I pre ordered it as well. I have to say, this is a substantial improvement over the first one in every way. The software is far better, the interface is a lot more fluid, page turns in books doesn't hesitate like the first one. Although, sometimes, when accessing the Video and Music Stores, they load slowly.The form factor is great. It's different as you can't hold it in one hand like the first one, the bezel is wider around the screen. But, it's lighter and meant to be held in landscape view for the most part.The audio is the best I've heard from any tablet so far, and I've reviewed many. It's not something you're going to listen to for hours, but the sound is perfect for watching YouTube videos and listening to audiobooks and Text to Speech. I connected it to the receiver on my home theater setup, and this little guy is powerful with audio. It;s like having a pre-amp in front of the receiver. Listening via my Grado SR-80 headphones is a dream too.The screen resolution is wonderful. HD Video looks spectacular on its screen and via HDMI. In all aspects of digital media, this is the best by far.If you're looking for a tablet to be productive on -- this isn't it. For a seven inch tablet that's more customization and geeky, get the Nexus 7 if that's what you're looking for. You can get light productivity done between playing games and watching movies though. The email app is far better than the first one, the web browser is nicer and it has some decent office apps that will get the job done for basic editing.It's meant to be a media consumption device and the doorway to Amazon...so Don't try to compare this to the iPad -- it's an entirely different device. Even if you get the 9" model when it's available, you can't compare it to the iPad at all...two different devices.

Reviews.Title: Amazon..Please Tell us which devices are COMPATABLE with the Fire HD
Reviews.Author: David M. Williams
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered my Kindle Fire HD and received it on Sept 14 as promised.  Setup was easy.  All my books transferred from my Kindle account.  It has a good browser and easy to read text.  Bright screen. I can read it easily on a dark airplane.  But i need a headset for Skype and when i ordered one from Amazon I found out it was NOT COMPATIBLE with the Kindle Fire.  So I ordered a new Bluetooth headset for the Fire and it too was NOT COMPATIBLE with the Kindle Fire.I sent emails to Amazon customer service and have not received a reply.AMAZON,  LISTEN.... PLEASE PUBLISH A LIST OF THE BLUETOOTH AND OTHER ACCESSORIES THAT ARE COMPATIBLE WITH THE KINDLE FIRE HD.THANK YOUO

Reviews.Title: Wife and I just upgraded to the Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: We bought the original Kindle fire when it came out last year.  Definitely have enjoyed it and both my wife and myself have begun to use our Prime memberships quite a bit ( Amazon is starting to get some great movie content recently that makes the Prime membership worth it in my opinion ).For those on the fence if it's worth the upgrade let me mention one thing that I love about the new HD.  As an owner and user of an Apple IPhone 4S I've always noticed that the touch screen on the IPhone is very responsive to your fingers and relatively glitch free.  When I would pick up my 1st generation Fire I would always notice that it wasn't quite as responsive as the Apple touch screen.  I would actually use some apps on my phone rather than the older Fire just for this reason.Well it seems that the new Fire HD has a much more responsive screen and I now find it equal to the responsiveness of Apple touch screen products for what it's worth. Amazon seems to have upgraded their touch screen technology and the glitchiness of the previous Fire seems to be gone.Also, the new HD screen is much brighter, clearer and in general just looks great.  Movies look fantastic. Watched " The Midnight Cowboy " last night in bed ( free with Prime membership by the way ) and it looked and sounded great. Streaming is much, much quicker on the Fire HD ( and I already thought it was pretty good on the 1st generation fire ).  The movie started right away, quicker than if I had popped a DVD in my player. The new speakers are a huge improvement.  Also looking forward to getting an HDMI cable and showing Prime movies on my 55" LG HD TV !  That will be really something I think.Well worth the upgrade in my opinion and great job Amazon !

Reviews.Title: $159 kindle to $199 HD kindle
Reviews.Author: lauried21 "Laurie"
Reviews.Content: So I first bought the $159 kindle, but the more i thought about it i realized i should just spend the $40 and get more storage, the camera, better picture, better sound, and a faster kindle. THIS CHOICE WAS A GOOD ONE! i did have the $159 kindle sent first and i was not that excited by it. it was slow and kind of heavy. the hd kindle is a bit lighter, but i think what makes it feel better is the displacement of the weight. i can also see a significantly better picture in the hd version. i was actually pretty annoyed by the poor display on the $159 kindle. you could see the pixalated words, which was annoying and unacceptable in my book. i also find that the text is much more responsive when i type or need to go back and correct something. however, i would recommend to anyone to get the hd version because the upgrades are well worth it and the $159 kind of sucks in my book! you will most definetly see the difference if you did a side by side comparison!with my recommendation for the hd version, please note there are small issues with the kindle in general that are annoying...1) i cant find the facebook or youtube app in the store2) i am writing on the kindle now and it will not auto correct or capitialize the beginning of a sentence because i am on the web (this is stupid amazon, fix it!!!)3)the kindle is warm this was the same on the $159 kindle as well. (this makes me nervous, does anyone else notice this?)4)flash is not installed hindering viewing some websites and videos (you are not apple amazon! put flash back on!)5)i hate that apps, shopping and web are at the top in a line. they are ugly and not efficent! they need to be in carosel.6) when i enlarge text on a webpage it does not "auto fit" the screen like it does on my phone. this is annoying because i have to move the screen from left to right on every sentence.AMAZON YOU MUST FIX THIS!7) when i go to the next screen on a web page after i have enlarged it the large font does not stay. i have to re-enlarge on every page. FIX THIS AMAZON!8) the camera should take pictures, which it does not. all you can do is skype. boo!!!!all in all i am happy i have the kindle hd! get the hd over the $159, it is well worth the $40. i do think you should purchase the kindle hd despite my issues with it because they are all software related and can easily be fixed with a software update that im sure one will come soon. amazons customer service is amazing so im sure they'll listen to their customers as they normally do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is Amazing
Reviews.Author: Gidaup
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my Kindle keyboard ereader for the past two years.  Thought about the first Kindle Fire in 2011, but waited.  Just received my Kindle Fire HD yesterday and I'm thrilled!  The color and images are crisp and vibrant. Navigation and use of the many features has been easy and that's saying a lot for a retired senior citizen!  I have easy access to my books, music, photos,and email. I've downloaded apps for notes and calendar features and I'm looking forward to learning more about this amazing tablet and the wonders it can work.

Reviews.Title: We have a winner!
Reviews.Author: Yu-jin Chia "Yu-Jin Chia"
Reviews.Content: I've played with and owned quite a few Android tablets, including spending a week with the Nexus 7 right at its launch. Inevitably, the Kindle Fire HD is going to be compared to that tablet, as it's the most similar device available at the same pricepoint and generation. I really liked the Nexus 7, but having used both tablets I'd throw my vote with the Fire HD.Memory:The Fire HD has 16 GB of internal memory on the base model. Nexus 7 has 8 GB for the same cost. Some might argue that you don't need a whole lot of internal memory these days, and they're probably right. Still, it sure can't hurt- especially since neither of these tablets has a SD slot and some space is inevitably eaten up by the OS. Both tablets have 1 GB of RAM which is plenty.Ports:Both have micro-USB. The Fire HD also has mini-HDMI. I like this- it never hurts to be able to hook up to a bigger screen and enables the tablet to be used as a makeshift web-TV.Wireless:The Fire HD has a much-touted dual antenna MIMO setup. The main advantage with this is range- I was able to pick up my home wireless signal from my car parked in the driveway on the opposite side of the house. That is better than ANY wireless device I've used- even my 2012 MacBook Air can't do that. Download speeds are also noticeably higher than other tablets.Form Factor:The Fire HD is actually a bit wider than the 1st gen Kindle Fire, but thinner and marginally lighter. The Nexus 7 is overall smaller and more compact, and lighter as well. Unlike the 1st gen Fire, this one has dedicated volume buttons (thank God!) and a beveled back panel. The camera is located in the center of one long side of the tablet, rather than a narrow end as is more typical.Screen:Both the Nexus 7 and Fire HD have very nice screens. They're both extremely crisp, vibrant, and about as easy to view outdoors as any LCD can be. Both are made of gorilla glass and do a remarkable job of not picking up fingerprints. I'd call this one a tie.Sound:This is my favorite part of the Fire HD and the real selling point in my opinion. The Fire HD's audio is superb- better than many full-up laptops I've used. Volume is outstanding and it has a built-in stereo speaker setup. It blows any other tablet out of the water in the audio department, plain and simple- especially ones with mono sound (the Nexus 7 is essentially the same as a 1st generation Fire in the speaker department). This makes the Fire HD an excellent media tablet without requiring headphones. It also makes it easy to use for Internet calls.Software:I find it silly that many people, including supposedly professional reviewers, nitpick at this. Yes, it's a customized Android and has some restrictions including fewer apps since it's hooked up to the Amazon app store. However, this one is a lot closer to Android 4.0 than the original Fire was to Android 2.3- in fact most of the standard Android functionality is pretty much there as is. If you're like me and are an Amazon junkie anyway, the forked version of Android is more of a blessing than a curse. If you're not... you can get around it (and ironically, Google enables that). Software wise, you can do anything with this that you can with an Android tablet. Personally, I prefer the Silk browser over the standard Android Chrome. It's been slightly improved with better starting screens but is otherwise unchanged.Power:I guess the only thing to say about this is both last 'long enough.' You can play a good 5 hours of video on either the Nexus 7 or Fire HD, read all day, and then charge them back to full in an hour or so. They're nothing like the e-ink readers, but these devices are both as good in the power department as any other tablet out there (and better than most).Other hardware:The Nexus 7 has a more powerful processor, little doubt about that. However, you really can't tell in 99% of the apps out there. Quite frankly, a quad core Tegra 3 is huge overkill for pretty much any Android app. Transitions, browsing, and apps are silk smooth on both tablets- I call it a tie as far as that goes. Both devices have a front-facing camera and microphone for videoconferencing.Other:Both devices have bluetooth. The Fire HD has no built-in GPS, but I've never used a tablet for navigation anyway: my phone does that for me quite well. One pretty irritating thing I noticed is that the Fire HD is by default a 'with promotions' device, and it is definitely not made obvious on the product page. I think this is going to cause Amazon the most grief as far as feedback goes. You can pay $15 to get rid of the advertising, which is quite pervasive, but it is a bit sneaky how they put that in there without noting it in the pricepoint as with the eInk Kindles.In short, I think Amazon has a winner. Unless we see an iPad mini for the same price, the Fire HD is set to be another hit product.Pros:Excellent screenGood ergonomicsGood battery lifeGood performanceSuperb soundHDMI outOutstanding wi-fi range and speed16 GB memory at base modelCons:Bit on the wide side compared to most 7" tabletsNo SD slotAds enabled by default

Reviews.Title: Beware of year warrranty.. it has a purpose
Reviews.Author: Tanner P
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle fire for 18 months.  I'm a moderate user at best and when I used it, it was only around the house.  Around 15months it began to have charging problems.  Amazon said it was the charger and bought a new one for me saying the problem would be fixed.  Didn't work, kept shutting down randomly.  I had to do a hard reset everytime I wanted to use it and it would still randomly shut down.  Although the Amazon help team was supportive, eventually it came down to their admitting it was a software problem but the warranty had expired and there was nothing they could do other than offer me a new one a rate you can easily beat on the internet.  There is a reason for the year warranty.  They can't create a produce that can last much longer than that.  I"m totally disappointed as I don't have tons of $$ and this was a splurge for me.  Check the internet... there are lots of blogs about this happening with the same results I received from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Rocky Honeymoon for Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Siri Peterson "PhD^2"
Reviews.Content: This is a very very rocky honeymoon period for the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7"Tonight is the last straw. I'm stalking out of the house in a fit of frustration. I tried for the third time to get access to my existing Netflix account to play stuff on the Kindle Fire, with no success. For one thing, in order to run the POSSIBLE fix, that begins with " you should try this which probably won't work", I have to have a full battery. I have been charging the KFHD all evening and have gotten to [Where is that cursed "on" button, I wonder?] 58 per cent charge.So, I'll see the grandchildren next weekend, and maybe can show them and their parents what Kindle FreeTime has to offer. I set up accounts for each child, and checked today. The oldest has his account filled with a book that indeed I did buy for him, AND two Nancy Drew mystery stories that I needed to compare to the original Nancy Drew mystery stories. He is not really ready for, and his parents and other grandmother may not understand why he has those in his Kindle Fire FreeTime account. BUT there is absolutely no way I could find to delete any content from the Kindle FreeTime app (and there's nothing like it on the IPad, so, Amazon, you've lost a possible sale there. I believe that other grandparents with more than one family of grandchildren might find that what *you*-Amazon think is suitable child content in their Amazon list of purchased content has wound up with a child in a different family for whom it was not intended.I don't really know whether you are losing ME as a customer -- I'm a shut-in and spend 2/3s of my not-so-great income on Amazon.com, your products, and appreciate your terrific customer service (or comparatively terrific, compared to Verizon and ATT).(1) NO WAY I chose those to be in his account, and(2) NO WAY I would have approved them if Amazon had asked, and(3) NO WAY I could find to delete them from his account. I think I may have added them to at one of his siblings instead.So my chance to demonstrate to their parents that the Kindle Fire is neat, and better than their two IPADS is gone. So there, Amazon.I'm glad the chance is gone because my additional gripe is the incredible commercialization of the Kindle Fire HD 7". I paid $15 more NOT to get Special Offers, because with my Kindle PaperWhite, of which I am still fond, I do get daily deals on ebooks, usually for $1.99 or less, sometimes a little bit more, that I often can't resist. So even if Special Offers are sometimes for good deals, they will cost more than my budget can manage. SO, I don't see Special Offers on the sign-in screen. I do see, however, (1) a carousel of random unwanted titles in whatever genre I've searched, and (2) a lot of additional supposedly similar material related to my interests but generally too expensive for me, or not at all suited, or *really* not interesting to me.I do my own choosing, I don't need to be spoon fed, and I don't want to be spoon fed, and I can't afford to be spoon fed content. Please find a way to let me turn it off. Now I am too aware of the creep that has inhabited your web pages, so that now when I choose items for a shopping cart, I have to go through a page of related items before I can give you the money I know I can afford.AMAZON, my beloved AMAZON, how could you let me down so.I guess twenty words of this has been about a product.S Peterson

Reviews.Title: Simple fixes would be nice.
Reviews.Author: Itburns
Reviews.Content: Ok, since I am just a mere common folk, I will not waste my time and yours writing a thesis, or an oratory on this device like some of these reviews. I swear, it's like these guys are either extremely bored and have nothing else to do but spend 3 weeks trying to credit (or discredit) all that the fire has to offer... Or they are writing a thesis for their final exam prior to entering their masters in engineering school... Or they are somehow getting paid by Amazon, or some other reviewers conglomerate.Anyway, my review will be simple and to the point.  I rated it a three stars, not because I think this Kindle Fire HD 7" is only middle of the road, because I think is much better than that, but it is based off of my own opinion of what that stars really mean.Five stars would mean the product is pretty much close to perfect, in design, functionality, usefulness etc... In other words, without flaw, or it really couldn't be any better.Four stars would mean a step just below perfect.  As in it's almost perfect. As in it would only take a few minor adjustments to get there.  It's very good, just not great etc...Three stars, as I rated this, as in this Fire, means it's pretty good, but they just didn't do enough to hit the very good mark.  I mean, I really think Amazon could have done a lot of things better to make the user interface a much better experience.  Simple fixes would have done the trick for many of the things that I think they could have done much better. I will name a few, but the list could be much more extensive.1. Silk browser.  I'm running it off of my Wi-Fi, but the browser itself is just not that good.  I'm not talking about the speed, because speeds are all different wherever you may be. I am talking about just the functionality of the working ways of the browser. A couple examples... you cannot touch one point on any given page to open up the bookmarks menu.  You have to basically take two to three extra steps to get to the bookmarks. In an open page, you have to hit the menu icon, then the starter icon, then the bookmarks tab, and then it will open up your stored bookmarks.- The fix would be to merely add a bookmark tab in the menu, which once hit would open up a side bar with the bookmarks.2. When in the browser you may be trying to read an article, and like me, many people need to expand the font size to read the words easier.  So when you expand the text to enlarge it, the browser will not re-size the lines to fit within the boundaries of your window. So in order to read, you have to scroll back and forth with your finger, to go from the end of one line, then to the beginning of the next.- The fix would be to allow the browser to re-size the lines to fit in your window, so that all you have to do is school down as you are reading.  Apparently, one of the things Amazon touted was the processor.  Seems to do as I just described in my cell phone which has technology that is nearly four years old, so why not the Fire?3. The browser doesn't remember where you were at in a page, if you hit a sub link, and then hit the back button it kicks you back to the starting point of the previous page you were on. For example, say you are on Facebook, and you have scrolled down through a bunch of posts within your page, then you come to a post that you want to comment on. So you hit the comment tab, make your comment and post it, then hit the back button, and the Fire kicks you back to the top of your Facebook page, not back to where you were, so if you want to keep looking through all the postings you then have to scroll through everything you already scrolled through earlier, just to get back to the point you previously were at.- The fix, make the browser remember where you were at in previous page.  Simple really.  Again, works that way in my four year old technology, smart phone.  Hmmmm.Now away from the browser, the Kindle Fire won't allow Apps from the Google Play Store. Amazon is hand cuffing all of its users to the Amazon App Store.  C'mon, really, they run it off the Google Android platform, but we can't get apps from the Google app store?  I kind of get the fact that Amazon wants the revenue, but being as I purchased the device outright, as in I own it, I should be able to buy from whomever I choose.  It would be like if I buy a Cadillac, I would be required to buy all of my gasoline, parts, etc. From the Cadillac dealer.- The fix... you know the fix.  Let's grow up here.So, those are really just the tip of the iceberg.  There are many other easy fixes that would put it on the next level, and like I said, I'm not here to write an oratory.So yeah, 3 Stars.

Reviews.Title: Shopped around looking for more storage than the 1st gen fire
Reviews.Author: R. Simpson "Randy"
Reviews.Content: When I first purchased the Fire last year I bought it knowing I would replace it with a larger storage version in a year or two.  Well with the release of the new Fires, Nexus, and I-pad mini I figured now is the time.I only use my classic Fire for playing music while working outside, playing games, and web surfing so those area's are where I focused my research.I read so many reviews (alot clearly biased towards a brand) and played with them all in stores before I made my choice.  The Nexus was the easiest for me to rule out, I just did not care for the layout and the speakers seemed worse than the model I was replacing.  Otherwise it would have been a very hard choice between them.  The Nexus 7 is the real competition for the Fire HD but I just did not like the feel of it so I didn't research it.  So that left me with the I-pad mini and the Fire HD.The general consensus of the reviews I read over and my personnel experience with the devices lead me to a few main points.  The Fire has a much better display (a horrid business move by Apple to not include a Retina Display), and it has better speakers.  The I-pad mini has the option for twice the storage (another bad move by Amazon to not market a 64GB version).  Then you have the processors, again Apple decided to use a slower processor and with this choice the processor's are basically a wash.  The I-pad runs games better while the Fire runs video better.  Either way its not a noticable diffence for the average user.  Then there is the app stores, Apple is the clear winner here by a few thousand miles.  Amazon is losing alot of business by not allowing easier access to Android apps.  As for web surfing the I-pad would be faster over all but the display is not as good as the Fire so its a personal choice there.  I'll wait 1-3s longer per web page if I can read it better.So in the end I just could not justify the costs of an I-pad knowing Apple will release a Retina/A6 version in the future (what this version should have been).  After all my research I did not buy the Kindle Fire HD because it was the best on the market but because it would fit my needs better and Apple messed up including outdated parts in there new product.  We will be buying a 10" tablet soon and Apple lost that purchase too, I want them both on the same platform.Since I have owned my new Fire I have been mostly pleased with it, I really didn't think the power/volume buttons would be an issue but they are.  Easily 2-5s longer to turn on/off than the classic Fire.  The speakers are louder than the classic and still sound great for a tablet, a huge selling point for me.I have used my classic Fire for a little over a year and would have preferred they kept that design adding the better components along with the on-device volume controls.  The new volume controls are nice to have but were designed badly and are not easy to use like they should be.  I preferred the top mounted speakers over the back mounted ones, but so far the back mounted ones have sounded great in any position so they may have done the right thing here.  As with the classic Fire the placement of the power cord slot is just bad and annoying alot of the time, mounting it either to the left or right would help.  The middle is just in the way if you are actively trying to use the device.I honestly feel I would have been happy with any of these devices as the differences are not as major as the reviews may present them.  The main thing I learned from all this research is that Apple seems to have a business model to encourage there customers to replace there devices frequently (I believe there will be an I-pad mini 2 soon, with the A6 processor and the Retina display, I probably would have purchased an I-pad mini if it had those two upgrades even at a higher price) where I don't feel the same about the other 2 brands.There are alot more people happy with Amazon customer service than Apple customer service.  I have never had ANY problems with an Amazon purchase that Amazon did not resolve in a timely matter to my satifaction.  You will not find that kind of praise about Apple customer service.Update 30 Nov 2012I've used the Fire HD long enough to add a few comments.  First the gryoscope used to orient the display in vertical or landscape mode needs some serious attention, hopefully it can be corrected with software updates.  As it is now I'm opening my case and seeing one orientation and when I try to swipe to unlock it the orientation swaps on me.  I am getting used to it but its an annoying fuction of my HD as of this morning.I also started to experience speaker issues, so I called there help desk and a hard reboot fixed the problem (hold the power button down for 20 seconds).  I must be having an off day that I did not try this without calling them but it happens.  Over the last year I've had to perform maybe 5-6 hard reboots on the classic Fire to corrent software issues.I received my case (rooCASE Origami Dual-View, worth the $8.88 I paid for it but you get what you pay for) a few days ago and was concerned the case would reduce the sound on the speaks.  I was pleasently surprised that it did not seem to change noticable.  Another interesting thing about the speakers, they actually sound better sitting on a hard surface to allow the sound to bounce off.  When put on a carpet like material they sound pretty bad with the carpet absorbing and not reflecting alot of the sound.Once I got the case the power buttons are not as annoying anymore with the Fire HD powering on when you open the case and powering off when you close it.I'm still happy with my purchase but I'd have preferred they kept the classic Fire's design and just added the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: Great ereader
Reviews.Author: William Caldwell
Reviews.Content: If Amazon had given this access to the Google Play store and allowed some customization, I would still own it.  A popup window for all the Amazon content, links to shopping on Amazon, whatever.  Just let me set my own background, please.  Let me download apps inside the Amazon app store AND Google Play.  Locking things down as tight as these tablets are was worse than owning something made by Apple . . . in other words, Amazon got a return.  I love you Amazon, and even ordered my TF700 from you.  I just wish you didn't force the issue by being so stringent with customization.

Reviews.Title: nice device for what it is
Reviews.Author: Melfi
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me the Kindle Fire HD 7" (16 gig) for a gift a week ago.  I have been using it daily and overall think it is a very nice item.  I have a 2nd generation kindle that I love for reading books.  I plan to keep it and still use it for that purpose (at least for now) as I like screen display of the original kindle.The Fire HD has an absolutely GORGEOUS display...my wife has an iPad first generation and an iPhone 4s.  The Kindle Fire HD's dislpay is similar or better than the iPhone 4S (better actually because the screen size is larger).The major beef I have with the Kindle Fire HD is that the screen is rather small to my liking, however I basically am going to use it (as other reviewers have cited) as a media device.  I'll surf the internet while watching TV at night (so I won't have to steal my wife's iPad---which is probably why she got me the Kindle Fire HD in the first place), read my books at times, check e-mail and maybe watch some movies.Viewing movies from Amazon Prime is very simple and the audio and display are awesome.  The ability to obtain IMDB information easily while viewing the movie is a real plus as well.  Similarly viewing movies from YouTube is a pleasure with the display and audio.I do not find the interface with the various applications, web, videos, etc as intuitive as on the iPad but I am getting used to it.  Again the Kindle is NO WHERE CLOSE to being a true tablet computer and is NOT an iPad in terms of functionality or availability of apps to download.  Skype is nice and ePocrates drug database is very good.My camera did not function at first on the device but I contacted Amazon customer service and had to do a 'reboot' that seemed to fix the problem, so now my wife and I can skype easily (me with my Kindle Fire HD and she with her iPhone 4S).I would STRONGLY recommend shelling out the bucks to get a case for the device and a stylus.  The keyboard is rather small and if you are going to do any typing (at least with my fat fingers) you will be hitting 2 keys at once even holding it in landscape format.  The stylus (Belkin Professional Capacitive Tip Stylus for Kindle Fire, Black) has made responding to e-mails on the Kindle Fire HD a much more pleasent experience.  The case (Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7" Standing Leather Case, Ink Blue) makes the device easier to hold and protects it well.  I LOVE the fact that the case will automatically turn off and turn on the device with closing or opening the cover.  Before I got the case I just could NEVER remember where the on/off button was located on the Kindle Fire HD as all the buttons are flush with the device so I was stroking all over the edges to try to find the buttons...now I don't need to worry.So bottom line:  It is no iPad but it is a very slick and functional device and will work very well for its intended uses...plus it is a wonder to behold its display and very easy to carry due to its size.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: bing
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kindle Fire HD I bought from Amazon. The first two are only 16 GB but they perform very well and so far very happy with both. I bought them for my children. I finally decided to buy one for myself. But this one is a big disappointment for me. I decided to get a 32 GB this time and this piece of crap freezes up with me all the time. I have no problem with it when it comes to watching a movie or listening to music but my biggest problem is reading books. When I open a certain book that I want to read. It freezes up every time. It keeps saying, "Amazon kindle Fire is not responding. If it happens once in a while which it does with my other kindles, that would be fine but this one it freezes every time I open the book. I have two choices with this one, return it and get a refund or replace it. I haven't decided yet because I am just not happy right now.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Updated Version
Reviews.Author: J. Friedman "JF"
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to check out a friend's advanced copy of the 7" version, and used it all day long. I really like this device.DESIGN - I really like how the shortcut bar switches to the right side of the screen when you turn it to landscape mode, so you wont have to look for them. Landscape mode already uses up more vertical space so putting these buttons on the bottom in landscape mode would be silly. It's a bit weird that the home button is now on the right instead of left, but hey, that's fine with me as long as you're not using my landscape space.FEEL - the fire HD was designed very well this time around. It has a soft touch back which looks very pleasant. wider bezel, and is extremely light. It is somewhat thick - definitely thicker than the ipad, but the 8.9 version. It is bigger than the original fire and has nice curved edges which makes it much easier to hold than the original fire. It looks very sharp!!! It has volume buttons, a MAJOR improvement on the original fire as well.SOUND - the sound is clear and fantastic and comes out very crisp. The fire uses dolby digital audio which comes out very clearly. Dolby knows what they are doing. The music plays very nicely and can be stored in the cloud which is great. Amazon allows you to import up to 250 songs which is not very much, but what can you do?SOFTWARE - the device has new programs such as x-ray which is great to learn more about books and movies, and FreeTime which is fantastic for kids.The platform is Android 4.0, but this is Amazon's customized version of the platform. It is based solely to sell products so don't think of this device primarily as a iPad replacement - folks, think of it more as a faster way to line amazon's pockets with other purchases that you will almost certainly make through the device. The home screen is not customizable with widgets, live wallpapers, weather apps, etc., the way an android screen is.Immersive reading is a new feature that allows you to play an audiobook while reading the screen - you can read and listen at the same time, or if you're bored with reading, just listen. I love having the option. They do well with the sound here using the new Dolby digital feature - that is just super neat and not expected in a tablet!While x-rays for movies is super cool, I got bored of it quickly. I enjoy learning about interesting features of the movie, but after the first time, I just want to enjoy the movie.The idea of FreeTime is great for my kids. My daughter can play with her games, and I know she is not doing other things because of the bright, vibrant blue background color of the screen which I can easily ascertain with a quick glance. I can lock them down on time so they can share with each other. Most importantly, the new fire HD is built tougher, so we'll see how my kids fare with it once they introduce the new service.The browser runs very nicely. It seems to run faster than the original fire did. I can turn full screen on or their new "reading view" which eliminates all the background junk that wastes space.Movie and book titles show up the same way the original fire did, in a library look which seems to work well for Amazon's needs. It displays your titles easily and clearly and allows you to find what you are looking for quickly. The whispersync feature was a great idea - it lets you access your content on any device, so I was able to download a book on the fire HD and see it on my original kindle fire and my iPad's kindle app. Now they have whispersync for movies, games and audiobooks as well!!!!You can use skype which works fine on wifi - it's integrated but is not as full featured as their desktop app. You can also check email - they allow access to aol, gmail, etc. Facebook is set up with the device, and you can easily view photos as well. In short, it's a pretty full featured tablet just as all the others on the market, but at a fantastic price point.HARDWARE - The 7" kindle HD comes in 16gb (only $200!!!) and 32gb for $50 more. There is also an 8.9" version in the same specs for $299 and $369 respectively, as well as 32gb and 64gb ($500/$600) with LTE versions, plus you can get a fantastic 250mb data plan for only $50 a year on the LTE version.The 7" version does not include the data plan. The data plan blows away the competition. Consider any smartphone you own - for instance a Galaxy S 2 - you have to pay at least $10 a month premium for the data plan alone, and this is only $50 a year! Not to mention the data plan includes 20gb cloud storage and a $10 Amazon app store credit!It has dual band wi-fi that makes it much faster than the competition. It also has an amazing screen and dolby digital sound! The processor is 1.2 Ghz (I remember when computers were only megabytes...) which is almost as fast as my desktop PC... time to upgrade... :)It is a capacitative touch screen with fantastic resolution. The video playback is 720p. The device also has bluetooth and HDMI out, as well as text to speech which is great for my blind friend. It comes pre-registered to my account which is a good and a bad thing. I have to be sure not to give it to anyone else without undoing that! It also has a USB 2.0 and 3.5mm stereo jack. It has an accelerometer and gyroscope and front facing HD camera with built in microphone for Skype!I was able to check out the cover which has a nice leather grain. The interior is made of nylon which has a bit of a plasticky feel. I love the iPad 3 magnetic locking feature and they seem to have utilized that here which turns the device off (sleep) when you close it, and turns it on when you open it. Simple. Uncomplicated.SCREEN - They have reduced the screen glare on the device using IPS technology, a polarizing filter and anti-glare, which is pretty nice. I don't have as much trouble seeing it in direct sunlight. Also, the screen is much sharper and crisper than the original fire. I can lay the screen down flat on the table and still see what's being played pretty well. The color is vibrant and the magazines show up fantastic similar to the iPad's retina screen.PERFORMANCE - I noticed sometimes that, while the device ran super smoothly and faster than the original, occasionally it would run a bit more slowly. Sometimes I would touch an app or icon on the screen, and it did not load immediately, something I'm very used to. I also saw that when I was launching a big movie it would take a while.Overall, it runs much faster than my current kindle fire. It has a hardware called MIMO (multiple input/multiple output) which is increased antennas that work together to transfer data and improve data performance without taking up more unnecessary power or even adding any bandwidth to the spectrum! It uses all antennas provided to improve the connection quality as well. Not only that, the processor needed can be the same one without requiring an updated one.Downloads are pretty fast. I have Prime so I am able to run movies and shows for free and they ran fantastic on the device. On Wifi they just scream. Much better than my iPad 3. I was able to get about just over 9 hours of battery life with VERY heavy usage, they say over 11 but that did not happen for me. It charges pretty fast - it took only a few hours using their "powerfast" charger.ADVERTISING - The device DOES have advertising, which is displayed on the lock screen only. I found this did not bother me too much, but now Amazon allows you to pay $15 to turn this feature off. If you care so much, then you probably should not be wearing that shirt with the polo logo on it. I'm sure most of you don't and would rather spend that $15 on a new app for the device.OPENING THE BOX - It has a USB 2.0 cable and the quick start guide, as well as the tablet itself. I wish it came with the power adapter up front. I would have to go out and buy one - the iPad comes with one so why not this device?  I would rather pay the extra price up front, although I guess it's better to have the option than the choice made for me. The micro-USB cable is nice for plugging it into the computer. No headphones, although I just plugged mine in from my iPad and was fine.WARRANTY - this comes with Amazon's 1 year limited warranty but you can buy a 2 year warranty as well.ACCESSORIES - You get a $3 mp3 credit with any kindle accessory you buy, so that's a bonus. You can and probably should buy two products with the device. Most importantly, pick up a powerfast charger which allows for superfast charging in only 4 hours and costs $20 which is not unreasonable. Amazon Kindle PowerFast for Accelerated Charging (for all Kindle Fire models, not included with device). You can also get the leather case I mentioned. Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7" Standing Leather Case, Onyx Black (will only fit Kindle Fire HD 7"). It's $45 which is expensive for a case or you could just buy from one of the manufacturers already out there such as Marware Marware EcoVue Genuine Leather Standing Case for Kindle Fire HD 7", Purple (will only fit Kindle Fire HD 7") or Belkin Belkin Quilted Standing Case for Kindle Fire HD 7", Ruby (will only fit Kindle Fire HD 7"), most of which are a tad cheaper and DO have the magnetic auto-open and close feature.CONS - No GPS (makes sense - this is just a wifi version). No charger included. No microSD port. No rear camera (most have dual cams now). You are stuck with Amazon's app store - google play is so much better and has more apps!Price is great but you still need a charger and probably a case. Definitely a worthwhile buy if you are looking for a functional tablet and you want to be at the forefront of the technology line.***UPDATE 11/23/12 - I also compared this device with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" version so feel free to check out my review there: http://www.amazon.com/review/RM0EJRMDXSQ9W/ref=cm_cr_rdp_permThanks for reading!!!***

Reviews.Title: UPDATE:  Thank you for listening to your customers
Reviews.Author: LV415
Reviews.Content: NOTE:  I've totally updated my review to be fair to Amazon based on the current state of the device and its marketing...THANK YOU, Amazon, for being more upfront about the "special offers" and for allowing us to shut off the recommendations...I was hoping the favorites would be returned to the bottom of the screen (as with the original Fire) since the homepage now seems barren, but I'll take barren over the barrage of recommendations.Although my speakers sound great, a family member is on their second one and both have the speaker issue.  I question whether this is a software issue because, if there were a bug, wouldn't everyone be experiencing it?Based on Amazon's response to customer feedback allowing us to switch off the recommendations, I'm upping my review to 3 stars.  If the on/off button were easier to find and showed the charging status (like the original Fire), the HD supported Flash (like the original Fire), the navigation were less clunky (like the original Fire), and the device sat more logically within the case for powering on/off and charging (like the original Fire), it would easily garner a 4 or 5.  But these little irritating things are becoming more irritating with time.

Reviews.Title: Camera is deceiving...
Reviews.Author: J. Hoidal "Grandma Jean"
Reviews.Content: I already had a Kindle Fire, but I thought the added HD and camera would make it even better so I ordered the newer one and gave the old one to my grandchildren to play games on. Turns out the camera only takes pictures of ME...for using Skype and talking online. I was really bummed and thought about returning it, but the grandkids had my old one and, other than that, I really like a Kindle Fire. When I first read about the camera at only $199 I thought it was too good to be true...which it was. Should have listened to my grandma who said that if it sounded too good to be true, it probably was. The only thing is that Amazon has always been so competitive and have, many times, had phenomenal prices. I'm an Amazon junkie so I didn't second guess it.

Reviews.Title: New Experience
Reviews.Author: Happy shopper
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire HD is a great product especially when you consider all you get for the low price.  I thought it would be light and flimsy like the older Kindle but this has a nice feel and is built solidly.  I was expecting a format more in the line of the iPad & iPod that I already own but it is totally different and somewhat convoluted with too many maneuvers to find your way around instead of the one screen as with the iPad.  I found it the Apple products simple to teach my 'senior' friends the iPad but I won't even venture to explain anything with the Kindle.I'm sure in time that there will be updates and improvements in the OS to simplify things.  The side button to wake it up is annoying especially because it goes to sleep too fast.  I have changed the timing on the turn off but it goes from 1 minute then the next is 5+ minutes.  I don't want 5 minutes because when I  forget it's on, it won't turn off until 5 minutes.  You can hit the side button but if you put it down to do something else, you don't want to turn it off in a minute because you will have to start all over.As I said, this is great for the money but by reading other reviews I didn't get much of a heads up on the downside.  The Apps  that I use are hardly as good as anything on the iPad.  Then again how much do you want to pay?  I got a beautiful cover/case with a stylus on Ebay for $10 delivered too.  All in All I'm happy & that's why I gave it the 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great but different
Reviews.Author: Yollyha
Reviews.Content: I am an apple fangirl- iPad, iPhone, iMac .  I debated on purchasing either the iPad mini, or the kindle fire hd.  I ended up with the Fire and am very happy with my purchase. I do however understand some of the frustrations others have stated.  Most important point when trying to decide Fire or Mini is: WHAT ARE YOU PRIMARILY GOING TO USE IT FOR?If you want a tablet that is super smooth and has lots of apps and will primarily use it for surfing the web, then I would say spend the extra $$$ and go for the iPad mini.If, on the other hand, reading content is what you are primarily interested in, I would recommend the Kindle Fire HD.With an Amazon Prime Membership and a Kindle device, you will have access to some great reading and video material at superb pricing.  (Of course  much of this would also be available on an iPad device), but a lot of the really discounted and free material is only available on a kindle device.  Because I already have an iPhone  and iPad and computer that can do everything I want it to do app and web  wise- it made better sense for me to go with the Fire.  I wanted a simpler READING device that would fit in my purse and that I could feed my reading obsession without breaking the bank.  I got a tablet with beautiful graphics and sound and access to all kinds of free/discounted books and videos (with my Amazon Prime account) that I simply would not have been able to get with the iPad mini.  For me it was more about good deals on CONTENT- which I feel like I get with the Kindle Fire HD.I do not prefer to web surf much on the fire- if that is what you want, then it may not be the best choice for you.  However, if reading is your primary use, you will love the fire.  I prefer it over my iPad or iPhone for reading my daily newspapers, magazine, books and singles from amazon. I love that I can "borrow" a book each month completely free with my Prime membership.  I love its portability and it is easier to do all my Amazon shopping on.  And- I just could not beat the price- with an American Express special I got mine for 149.99.  Great Deal all around.In short, it's not a "do it all" kind of tablet- it is more of an amazon content  reading/shopping/video device that is a really good deal - especially if combined with a Prime membership.

Reviews.Title: A story of good and bad with Kindle Fire HD 7 inch
Reviews.Author: Kentucky Rob
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a few months ago after my nexus 7 was ahem borrowed by a stranger. I was very pleased with the nexus but it had some glitch issues which were annoying like shutting down out of the blue.Since I had a Prime membership I thought I would give this a try versus buying another nexus 7. What made my decision was the amazon ecosystem and dolby surround speakers as the nexus has mono horrible sound.At first I was very pleased but then bugs and glitches started showing up centered around the Silk browser. When your entire system is built around the internet you can't have a bad browser and silk is really bad. If you like posting on forums forget about it. The keyboard for silk erases words as you type. Meaning you type a word it vanishes and you retype it ten times and the eleventh it stays. You get my drift?Overall it is worth the cheap 200 price but sad to say barely worth 200. Here are pro's and con's.ProDolby speakers sound good and better then Nexus. They are not bose by any means.Screen is high resolution and looks great.Amazon ecosystem so in that area it is highly functional.Screen is gorilla glass so resists scratchingConSlow and sluggish. Go to a web page it takes 7 sec to load. Scroll up or down and you get checkerboard as it thinks and renders the page. Unacceptable in 2013 that is 90's stuff.Silk Browser is broken and the keyboard is unusable.Not free and open like Nexus as amazon locked it to their ecosystem.Doesn't play flash without side loading (not their fault Adobe's fault)Recently glitch where WIFI stops out of blue. Looked online and this is happening everywhere. Where is the fix Amazon?Ads on your start page. It doesn't bother me but I paid for this device I shouldn't have forced ads on the start page.Conclusion. With Nexus 7 and KFHD being the same price and having used both extensively the Nexus 7 is your better purchase. It is FAST and responsive where as the kindle is slow, sluggish and kind of broken. If you have Prime and want it for Amazon stuff it works for the price but Nexus 7 should be 3 or 400 dollars and KFHD seems worth about 150 bucks.If Amazon patches the bugs for SILK and the WIFI I will update and bump up a star. Until then it is frustrating to use which is sad.UPDATE:It has been bit and I have seen no update to fix the lingering problems facing all KFHD users. The wifi now must be reset each day or you cannot use the web. When you type into a dialogue box using the Silk browser it erases your words as you type making it impossible to use forums of any type.Amazon please fix the WIFI glitch and the horrible, horrible Silk browser keyboard glitch!

Reviews.Title: Currently an APPLE girl but really LOVE my Kindle Fire HD!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Hankins
Reviews.Content: I have had my device for over 6 months and STILL love it and am VERY happy with my purchase.  I side loaded Flash so that is a bonus.  I especially love the clarity of the HD screen.  This is my 4th Kindle and still use my Kindle Touch for reading outdoors or on the beach but I LOVE my Kindle HD for everything else ESPECIALLY reading in bed at night.  I put the screen on sepia tone and have not had ANY trouble with my eyes.  I tried many, many lights for my K-touch to aid in reading at night but could not find just the right one so the Kindle Fire HD does the trick.  I also read all my magazines on it, watch NetFlix, play games, check email, surf the web, and use it as my "cookbook" with the recipe apps. (The list is too long....)My husband has the IPad 2 and I was considering getting the IPad mini because I prefer the size but am glad I did not.  I LOVE my KF-HD and so do my kids.  WE ALL LOVE THE PRICE TOO!PS:  I have had 3 Kindles before this one and must say the SUPPORT is STELLAR!  Try getting Apple on the phone for support and you will see what I'm talking about.  I have a Mac Book Pro and an IPhone and love them and it would seem like the iPad would be a natural next step but I'm so glad I went with my gut and bought a KINDLE FIRE HE instead!!!!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Enjoy My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tin Man
Reviews.Content: My decision to buy the Kindle Fire HD came down to one goal: not to carry around 300+ pages books anymore or have them clutter my personal area at home. I work in IT and do read a lot of technical books. I have one pile of books for Linux, another pile for Windows server, and several more piles for security and hacking. Moving around my personal area can be quite a challenge at home. I'm also working on my Master's degree. Now I have textbooks that are 500+ pages taking up more space, and they're not a lot of fun to carry.I have an iPad 3 that I love but I find it difficult to read with it. I find that I'm easily distracted with apps, email, web browsing, music, etc. Yes, I do lack a certain amount of discipline. I also find carrying and reading with the iPad in public to be a hassle. I went to the Apple store and looked at the iPad mini, loved the way it felt in my hands but I wasn't 100% convinced it was right for me.I bought the Kindle Fire HD because of it's price point. I also bought a case and anti-glare screen protector. I absolutely enjoy my Kindle. I carry around with me all the time, and it rarely leaves my side. If my wife wants to go shopping, I can sit in the car and read with no problem. Try propping a 500+ page book between you and the steering wheel. It's very awkward. I also like that I can slide the Kindle between my car seat and center console when I'm driving or if I need to leave the car.

Reviews.Title: A HOME RUN!
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Bought one for each of my two teenagers. They both love the Kindle Fire HD. There are plenty of free apps and with a Prime Membership they have access to many more apps, movies , and books.  By setting up an email account and amazon account with a Prime Membership they can share the apps they purchase through the cloud.The picture and sound is better than I had expected.  It is very easy to use.  I am planning to purchase two more for my 7 and 10 year olds.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablets with great graphics and fantastic sound! And parent controls are the best!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Loving the Kindle Fire HD's we got our boys for Christmas. The Free Time unlimited gives them access to a ton of kids books apps and videos, and the Dolby speakers make it the first personal device our son, Reese, who wears hearing aids can easily listen to! And the Parental controls are awesome! Plus, I can purchase apps and books through Amazon and then upload them to the tablets--its nice to only have to buy apps once! We were worried about getting the 7 inch since it seems everyone has the larger screens, but these are much easier to handle, especially for little hands. Believe it or not, I actually like these better than my IPad! (And thats saying a lot since Im a loyal Apple user!)

Reviews.Title: Gift for my GF...makes me think twice about my iPad
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: Great gift! I have an iPad 3...yeah, I got screwed, thanks Apple! Don't get me wrong, I do love my iPad but the Fire HD has great sound and a comparable display. When my girl decide she wanted a tablet I decided to make it my mission to get the one that works best for her, unbiased.So here is why I choose the Kindle, in no particular order:Kindle Freetime- She has two adorable girls that I knew would be using her tablet occasionally. With Freetime each of the girls can have their own profile & apps specifically for them. Additonally, they don't have access to mom's apps.Great sound - We both love Pandora. I stream constantly on my iPad and the one thing I wish was better is the speaker. The sound on the Kindle is significantly betterSimplicity -The Fire HD was ready to go for her as soon as she open the box.

Reviews.Title: My favorite new toy!
Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this for my birthday and I absolutely love it!  I use it mostly for entertainment purposes and social networking.  I did a lot of research prior to putting this on my wish list and found that it serves the purpose ideally.  I thought about an iPad but it was much more expensive and I've already got a laptop anyway and so the Kindle Fire was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: If you are not an IPAD fan this is the tablet you want to buy instead
Reviews.Author: Jose Pena
Reviews.Content: If you are not a big IPAD fan, kindle is the tablet to get. very good and solid tablet. very nice easy set and easy to use menu, apps etc. the only thing I regret not doing is paying the extra money not to get all the ads that constatly pop up but even with that the tablet is excellent, has great sounding speakers. very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT, EXTREMELY HAPPY!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Buyer
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome.  Bought it for my wife who already had a Kindle and who has thinking she needed an iPad as well.  The Kindle does everything she wants.  With a few quick settings, she is able to access from her favorites the Desktop full version of Facebook and view the mobile version of her YouTube account (necessary because the desktop version requires the latest version of Flash which is not part of Kindle's Silk browser).  She also has Pandora radio and her eMail accounts available at one touch.  The sound and picture quality is great on the HD version, and battery life is not a problem.  She is extremely happy with this product and saving a couple hundred dollars by not buying an iPad makes me happy as well!

Reviews.Title: A wonderful product!
Reviews.Author: Socalgirl
Reviews.Content: So I just bought my Kindle Fire HD last night at Best Buy, since I have a $150 gift card. While I'm extremely impressed over my Kindle e-reader, there was one thing that really bothers me. The Kindle Fire doesn't come with a charger, it only came with a USB charging cord. For $200 I would expect to not have to purchase the charger separately and this has really left me somewhat disappointed in the Fire. With that set aside, the screen colors and resolution are outstanding, clear and crisp! The Kindle is easy to navigate and was simple to set up. I have noticed that many of the things take time to open or run slower than they do on my iPhone, which I fount to be a slight nuisance. I expected the apps to run faster than they run on my iPhone, and I've also noticed that browsing the web was a bit slower than I had anticipated. While I've not owned nor tried the Apple iPad, I do see that the app store for my iPhone has more choices than the app store for the Kindle. However, I will still impressed to see some of my loved iPhone apps in the Kindle store of apps. Overall, once the Kindle app store grows, we will have access to more assortment. Overall, I love my new Kindle Fire, but am still slightly disappointed that after spending $200 I would still need to purchase a wall charger separately, which is the reason for 4 stars rather than 5.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Sprinkles16
Reviews.Content: My Husband surprised me with the Kindle Fire HD as an early Christmas present.  I had originally wanted an iPad for a while but the price was just too high.  So he went out on a limb and purchased the Kindle Fire HD for me only knowing very little about it.  We were pleasantly surprised at the quality and capability of the Kindle for being so much cheaper than an iPad.  I've been using it constantly and the only dislike I have about it is that I can't use my iTunes through it.  Other than that the color is very vivid, the Wi-Fi connection is great, the battery life is good for being HD and navigating through the Kindle is fairly easy.  I'd definitely recommend this product to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: Simply Awsome
Reviews.Author: Regular Guy
Reviews.Content: I have had an IPad2 for about a year.  The rest of the family used it far more oftin than I did and I was looking for something less expensive just for me.  I thought I would try the Kindle Fire HD not thinking it would impress me in any way. First off I really thought the market was heading in the wrong direction with the smaller 7 inch units in general.  Boy was I wrong!  Nothing could be more awsome or handy.  I can not put the Kindle Fire HD Down!!!  I am not sure what is exactly but it just seems so much simpler to me than the apple and istore stuff ever was.  Maybe Its the amazon access i don't know but if your not to sure and feel like I did you may be dissapointed just try it!  I really think you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas for my wife.
Reviews.Author: Glen Watts
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife.  I gave it to her early.  I could not have found anything that she has enjoyed more.  She loves to read.play games, internet and face book.The main regret that I have is that she will not lay it down long enough for me to get time with it.

Reviews.Title: Way better than ipad mini for price
Reviews.Author: joanna carson
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD is an awesome product for its price point. We'd recommend to everyone even if you have ipad mini!

Reviews.Title: Love it~
Reviews.Author: LoriLynn
Reviews.Content: Love it!  I ended up buying 3!!!!!!  I cannot wait to see my kids faces on Christmas morning!!  Easy to use and the sound is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love, only one complaint
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: My sweet husband purchased this for me to replace my laptop that broke. I used my laptop mostly for extreme couponning. I was delighted that I could now combine my love of reading with what I did on my laptop. I absolutely love my KFHD!Let me start with my one major complaint.  There is no way to categorize all of my books! It is my understanding that there is one app available, but it's new and they are still working on getting all the bugs out. This is a huge problem for me as I have over 160 books in my library. I've contacted Amazon about this issue and I'm waiting to hear back from them.Some of the complaints I've seen in the reviews have been issues about the camera. I learned this is a quick,easy & free fix. Download the free app called ES file.  You will find it in the Amazon App store. Once you've got it, open it up look under apps & you will find your camera. Once you open the camera you will be able to take photos. I learned this from a book I borrowed from the lending library. I will edit this review and add the title of the book.The only other complaint was minor & May just be my lack of knowledge.  I miss having a note app available while I am on a website. It came in handy for making my grocery list.I would highly recommend this to my friends & family.The name of the book I learned so much with is called, Kindle Fire HD User's Guide Book: Unleash the power of your tablet.  It's $2.99 in the Amazon App store.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Deborah Keener
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the best purchases I've made in years. I wanted something to function as an e-reader. But when I saw this item I just had to have it. I've streamed some tv shows on it, read books on it and even messed around with some games and music. The sound quality and picture are amazing for such a small device. I do recommend getting a carrying case for it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle has been everything we expected and more. Great buy.
Reviews.Author: ezboomer
Reviews.Content: The Kindle is everything Amazon said it would be and especially economical. My wife and I also recommend Amazon Prime which we joined when we bought the Kindle.You have access to thousands of books and hundreds of good movies with your membership as well as 2 day free shipping for any item purchased and fulfilled by Amazon. Fifty percent or more of the movies are current movies unlike NetFlix. The movies alone are worth the membership and the total membership is less a year than NetFlix. You get a $20 discount the firstyear when you join. But even at $79 a year it's still cheaper than NetFlix and you get more for you money. With the BlueRiggerHigh Speed HDMI cable you hook up to your flat screen and get BluRay quality video. Like I said Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: nice to read on
Reviews.Author: Lois Traw
Reviews.Content: Love reading on the Kindle Fire-  don't like the fact that I dont have a manual to teach me to navagate-  for example, how do I use the camera?  How do I delete stuff?

Reviews.Title: Everyone should try this
Reviews.Author: southerndee
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 5 star rating because I have a kindle and love it except for having to use a light at night so this makes reading so much more enjoyable when in bed. Then there is the fact that it is basically a handheld computer which makes it so much easier when skyping ( you can wander all over the house and grounds) and its much lighter than expected. The videos are outstanding and game play is quick and responsive.  All in all so much cheaper than other brand tablets and more than I could have asked for. I am still new to this and look forward to learning all my kindle fire HD can do! thanks amazon

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD!!
Reviews.Author: B. Hale
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this Kindle Fire HD.  I am an avid reader and I also am a huge movie buff.  So...it's the perfect package.  Obviously, if you do not enjoy reading or watching movies, this is not the product for you.  Originally, I didn't think I wanted one as I enjoy actually physically holding a book...flipping the pages, etc.  But...after seeing a Kindle and physically using one, I was hooked and bought my own.  We will now be a "Kindle Family" as I also have two more under the tree for my daughters for Christmas. I was a little disappointed that with Kindle Prime you can only "borrow" one book a month as there are some months that I can go through two or three books. I have halted on purchasing this as I find it may be cheaper to just pay to "rent" the books I want as often as I want without paying nearly $80 to be limited on the amount I read unless I want to pay more.
