I also bought a cover for my Kindle but I did not buy a Kindle brand.  My cover fits perfectly and looks great for $15 compared to the brand name cover for $40. I definitely recommend buying a cover and screen protector though as it is a finger smudge prone product as is any touch screen device.  All said...I would recommend this product to anyone with a passion for books and movies.  It was worth $199

Reviews.Title: <3 LOVE, LOVE, LOVE <3
Reviews.Author: Angie "Angie"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle HD 7"! Its so easy to use, watching movies on it is a dream, and the sound system is amazing. The screen is so clear and the HD is unparalleled. My only complaint is that it takes FOREVER to charge. I use up the battery every day, and then it takes hours and hours to charge fully. You can't use it while its charging or it won't charge, and the device itself doesn't come with a charger. It only comes with a USB/Micro USB connector, that can be used to charge it.I already had a charger that plugs into a socket. I have been using that, and even though it is faster to charge with the wall charger, it still takes at minimum 5 hours. that is a ridiculously long time. So, although I LOVE the device itself there is definitely room for improvement. Its not a deal-breaker for me, but for some it might be.Hopefully this review helped a bit.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase.
Reviews.Author: Hanktut
Reviews.Content: l have really been enjoying my Kindle fire hd. I mainly use it to read, but all the features are great. I like that I can change the font, font size, & background. There are also tons of books to choose from. I am not a prime member yet, but I look forward to getting the advantages when I do. I haven't watched any videos yet. I'm excited to see how it looks.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Harvey Rubin "video maven"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 7" after reading a very good review of it. A main concern was the download rate for internet content. The article said that the Kindle Fire HD was 40% faster than an iPad, and I know those to be very fast. My Kindle did not disappoint in the download aspect, or in any other aspect. It has fantastic HD color picture quality, but the sound is amazing. I still cannot get over it. Of course, it is a great e-reader, and the free month of Amazon Prime make for an excellent plus. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: IT IS AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Brandon2
Reviews.Content: My parents got this for me for my birthday to replace my kindle keyboard, and this is by far one of the best electronics I have ever owned! If you want to replace your old kindle I HIGHLY RECOMMEND gettting this! If you are looking to buy your first kindle I also HIGHLY RECOMMEND getting this!GREAT PRODUCT OVERALL!

Reviews.Title: What an excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Average Guy "Average Guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife for our anniversary. I work at an Office/Electronics retailer and sell tablets as a part of my job. Of all the tablets I sell, I rarely ever see a Kindle Fire returned. With that in mind, I purchased this as it was simple to use, has great features and a hand-held design. Well, she loves this device! It is getting far more use than I could have imagined. Rather than bore everyone with another review about technical specifications, let's talk about the real reason one buys this type of device-using it. It is very simple to navigate, has a beautiful display, very quick and responsive and access to all of our content. For those that have talked about it's limitations (not able to access Google Play store, etc.), do some research prior to buying. I knew this PRIOR to buying it we find it is a non-issue. Amazon has tons of content, books, apps, etc.For anyone looking for a great little tablet with plenty of features and simplicity, I highly recommend this tablet. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Great Price.
Reviews.Author: Carlos Valotto
Reviews.Content: I own an iPad and decided to get this smaller tablet for on the go functions. This tablet is perfect for avid book readers and movie watchers. It has limited apps but if I want high end applications I can either use my computer or my iPad. I would recommend this item to anybody looking for the perfect tablet on the go. For $199, this tablet can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Meets all my expectations.
Reviews.Author: kay
Reviews.Content: I take it with me everywhere. I download library books and it is so handy I love it. It is a little tricky getting books that are not from Amazon but not a real problem. It is really comfortable to read. I bought a case that has a magnet and it automatically shuts down the Kindle when you close the case and turns it back on when you open the case. It stays on the page I was reading. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: D. Pfeiffer
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire HD.  I wish I would have bought one sooner.  I would really Recommend buying one.  Love to Read books on it.

Reviews.Title: She loves it!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend and she adores it.  Great battery life, amazing screen display and is an overall awesome device. I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Linda Rickert
Reviews.Content: I love it,I was a sceptic at first..I like holding real books. I am now a tablet reader and love browsing the "library" from my arm chair.

Reviews.Author: R. Burton "Aloha"
Reviews.Content: It does everything it claims to do.  It took me a while to figure some of the gadgetsoperations, but I'm 80 years old, and I can do it.  Bravo Kindle Fire !!!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Deborah Lehrmann
Reviews.Content: When I recieved my Kindle I was amazed that there were NO instructions.  It was set up for me entirely from factory.  No reading a booklet or anything.  The graphics are awesome and sound is to die for with Dolby speakers.  I just love..love..it!  So easy and all round accessability to music, movies, games. etc.  I would advise to get prime, for not only do you get unlimited music, movies, games, magazines, etc.....but you also get cloud to hold your apps along with 2 day shipping and FREE shipping on all prime accesories purchased by Amazon. I cdo not regret the Prime feature I purchased, or I've saved enough already to pay this yearly fee. No better tablet around for all you get.  Outdoes Apple by far with clarity of movies, no discounections from WIFI and better visual.  I am buying another for a family member, for this is an awesome tablet.  But try for yourself and find out....you can always return but know you won't.  Greatest Pad for the value and accessories.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Debbie Patterson
Reviews.Content: I liked this so much that I want one too.  the shipper was great the service was very fast. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Just what I was expecting
Reviews.Author: steven fehm
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, interfaces well with email and web. Plays & streams movies just fine. Outstanding value. Great screen display.

Reviews.Title: Wow - Great product with outstanding support!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Fan
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Samsung 7" tablet and struggled with use, loading content etc.  I am an Amazon fan so I purchased the Fire HD and have been thrilled with the product.  Love that it came ready to use out of the box.  So easy to use Amazon Prime perks with the device and connect to my local library for ebooks.I have had to connect with Kindle support twice and opted to use the chat function.  Both times received EXCELLENT service with prompt, concise and easy to follow help.I love my Kindle so much that I bought one for my husband too.  We are both nearing retirement and our Kindles will be with us!

Reviews.Title: KIndle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: nana
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle and so far I love it. I am still learning things I can do with it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" screen
Reviews.Author: Doreen Kibildis
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HD about 2 months ago and I find that I use it the most for reading e-books.  I love the fact that you can order e-books from the local library and it doesn't cost a thing.  In addition, there are many books that aren't full price - $0.99 to $2.99 - so I'm not constantly charging expensive e-books.  I can also use for my email and facebook, as well as for many other things I haven't yet explored.  I do want to look into listening to music on the Kindle since I understand the speakers are of good quality, although I can't confirm that just yet.  It's easy to store and bring along with you to appointments and other places where you're sometimes forced to wait for some time.  I think I'll enjoy this for years to come, and I'm glad to have received it as a gift.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Steven Rupp
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HD does everything I could possibly want and then some. It is a well built and thought out product, which is what we have come to expect from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price for 16GB
Reviews.Author: R. Munroe "Literary Glutton"
Reviews.Content: I've only had my Kindle Fire HD 7" for 24 hours and am very satisfied and happy with my purchase. I would have rated 5 stars but for this:1. No slot for external memory card2. Sometimes when streaming video (Netflix) the picture freezes momentarily, for a couple of frames, then catches up. Barely noticeable but I notice it. Not a big deal and may be related to my connection speed at home.3. No fast charger included. Not a biggie, the charging cables are the same for my Android phone so I can use the phone charger at home and in my car to charge the Kindle (actually a plus.) My house current phone charger seems to take a long time (about 5 hours) to fully charge the Kindle (I'll update later about that.)4. No support for Flash so the Silk browser won't play YouTube videos. There are apps that convert YouTube videos to a Kindle friendly format but you have to download the videos first before viewing, no streaming. The upside is when you download those videos you can view them off line.5. WiFi only, no cellular option.6. No rear facing camera.What you get for the price is pretty great.Here's the good: Very nice display. I have been watching videos and surfing the web on my Droid Razr (when away from my iMac) but the kindle display is about 3 times larger and more visually friendly. I've been an Amazonophile for many years and appreciate that the Kindle is fully integrated with the Amazonosphere. The free Amazon Prime for a month after purchase (registration) is a plus and I will probably renew my lapsed Amazon Prime account again when the free offer expires. I am hoping that Amazon Prime streaming videos will soon rival Netflix's offerings to sweeten the deal.Registering the Kindle was easy and setting up Twitter, Facebook, Skype, and all my email accounts etc. was a snap; very intuitive and no brainer.All in all, I am very satisfied with my purchase. I considered the Google Nexus but chose the Kindle because of the integration with Amazon. I waited to make this purchase until the new mini iPad came out. I was ready to buy the Apple but the specs and price just didn't seem worth it to me. For me, the price, quality, and Amazon integration of the Kindle beats them all (IMHO.)

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD <3
Reviews.Author: Shauna Riley
Reviews.Content: I Love my Kindle Fire HD sooooo much<3 I`m on it everyday, all day! can't get enough of it & I just love the space it has, because now I'm able to download as many apps  as I can; I also love the camera & video feature, because I love filming & taking pictures.  just love it, love it, love it!

Reviews.Title: GREAT product!
Reviews.Author: linetta33 "Linetta33"
Reviews.Content: I bought this is a gift for my daughter.  She loves it.  It is wonderful and used almost equivalent to an iPad, but for 1/2 the cost.  A slight disadvantage is that you have to have WIFI to register the product and can't just hook it up to the computer.  Once you are registered, you can download to your computer and sync the Kindle though.  You also obviously can't use iTunes apps you already have, but  not a problem...just look for them in Amazon if you love them that much or get all different ones.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet!
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: I am really happy I bought the Kindle Fire HD, it's exactly what I needed. The screen is amazin, and it has a wide variety of apps you (and your children!!) can download. I use it for many different activities, not only for reading, etc, but also for teaching: I carry videos and pictures to complement my classes, and just plug it to the classroom's screen. The size is perfect: big enough so I can read and enjoy all its features easily, but small enough that it fits in my handbag. I haven't yet seen any difference with other tablets, and the price is just great.One problem that I'm having is that I can't enjoy most of the benefits of Amazon Prime, such as downloading movies and other videos, as there are "geograhical limitations" for this service (I live in Venezuela), so I had to reject this offer.I bought it together with  a screen protector, a case, and the HDMI cable (see my reviews of these items). I think it's also worth it to buy the fast charger (I just ordered it), as it takes a while to charge.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Natanael
Reviews.Content: This tablet is super fast, has many aplications, crystal clear sound and great hd display. Do Recomend it. Congratulations Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Very satified
Reviews.Author: heather timblin
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with all the kindle fire can do and all the variety of apps and such available. It really pleased my daughter. Will buy another.

Reviews.Title: An awesome e-reader/ipad like device
Reviews.Author: mooseman84
Reviews.Content: This is my first color e-reader/ipad like device, after previously owning a competitors device. In my job as a 911 dispatcher having a good book is essential during down time, and this unit provides that and more. It is so simple to operate and easily switch to the web browser to search out information. The HD display is amazing along with the sound, def a must for folks looking to watch an occasional flick. 5 stars all day long.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Cherilynn Ann Keaton
Reviews.Content: I am getting older and the eyes were going.  When I went anywhere I would load up the  CD book, player and headset which was quite cumbersome.  Now I just grab my Kindle and headset (if audio) and I can sit in the doctors offices and not worry about the wait.  I have now had my eyes fixed so can read the book and not need the headset.!  I would recommedn anyone that has cataracts and/or wants an easier way to read to buy a Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire reviewe
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire! This device not only lets me read, but acts as my handheld computer to keep in touch while on vacation.  I can see and respond to my emails, keep in contact with friends and family on Facebook and am still learning about the many other apps that are beneficial to my busy schedule. And the price is much better than most tablets.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  Packs a punch for the price!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Bizien "Cheryl Bizien"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son on his birthday.  I was amazed at the sound quality.  I was also impressed with the audio read option, which allows him to listen to a much ear higher reading level  for his age.  It is great for our long commutes, where I can't read to him.  Purchasing Amazon Prime gives him many free apps, books, mags, and movies. The price is affordable.  We love it !

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle HD Pretty Nice
Reviews.Author: CmariePurple
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I could read my e-books & online stuff on a bigger screen. For the most part, I really like this. I've watched several movies on Netflix, have used Silk (the web browser), and am currently reading several books. The battery tends to wind down after about 8 hours of solid use. The wireless is nice & strong, picking up a signal nearly 40' (with 2 1'-thick adobe walls between) from the router.There are 2 complaints: Silk tends to crash after several hours, and is sometime quite difficult to bring back up. It's getting worse as time goes on. The other complaint is that, while this is obviously a Kindle product, sometimes I have to purchase reading material through Barnes & Noble, which can only be viewed through Nook. That's annoying, because I only have the Nook App on my much-smaller phone screen.Other than those 2 annoyances, I really like the Kindle HD.

Reviews.Title: Love My New Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: George P. Dreckmann
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle and I really like this unit.  Very compact and travels well.  I am jsut starting to tap into its internet functions.  I highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: earls kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: earl r. cook
Reviews.Content: First, I'm a techy and believe me, this kindle fire hd is the most impressive machine I have ever had. Amazon has a winner here, especially for the $199.00 price tag.  The dual speakers are very impressive as is the clarity on screen.  I have the I-5 and three other computers, but I just cannot put this down.  The e-reader library from Amazon is so impressive with many of the books are FREE.  Also, this device will download many aps.Again, for the price; you will not beat this machine.  A great Christmas or Holiday present.Earl R. Cook

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Pastor
Reviews.Content: One of the best products I have had the pleasure of purchasing. The hd is wonderful. Pictures and videos are awesome. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Ather Haleem
Reviews.Content: we 'upgraded' from the previous version of kindle to kindle HD and we have been pretty happy with the purchase. having compared specs with other tablets in the class (including the ipad mini), i feel pretty happy that this is the best buy. the display, battery life, exchange integration, browsing and amazon music integration certainly make it the best tablet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent  product especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Russell Mills
Reviews.Content: Very  pleased with overall. I use it mostly for web browser now instead of my laptop, pay bills, email etc. Audio sounds awesome, video excellent  and  was easy to learn. I also subscribed to Prime and shopping is easy with lots of products, free streaming movies etc. Had an Apple Blutooth keyboard which sync ed up flawlessly. A couple features I wish it had but love it!

Reviews.Title: I'm sold
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Hyder
Reviews.Content: My wife recieved a kindle fire hd as a birthday present and one is on the way to me as a gift.I could have chose an Ipad mini, but the one thing that got me about Amazon was the free Audible content that came with a book I wanted to read.  As far as I'm concerned, kindle is the better product for books because it is backed by Amazon.I look forward to receiving my kindle.  My wife truly enjoys hers.Thanks,Ed Hyder

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Just bought my Kindle Fire HD today and I have to say it is amazing! right out of the box it was partially charged so I was able to use it some. The HD quality is stunning on almost everything from movies, magazines and games. It had a  nice sturdy feel and very sleek. Right now I am charging it but I am very excited to start using it again. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Larissa
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire hd!! The only thing I'm sad about is that, living in Canada it won't let my download any apps without an American credit card. Otherwise it has been fantastic. I've recommended it to many.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: dog lover "mom"
Reviews.Content: I am a third generation Kindle user. If it weren't for my Kindle, I would no longer be able to enjoy one of my favorite hobbies - reading, because I can enlarge the type size. At first, I was dissappointed seeing all the advertizing but understand why it is necessary. The only other difference in this one and my old Kindle Fire is the size. It is a bit smaller but it doesn't fit into the padded case I had purchased for my last one. Otherwise, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD review
Reviews.Author: bigman
Reviews.Content: Great product. Very pleased with purchase and ease of use. Not a long learning curve and I was up and running within minutes of charging. It would be nice if it shipped with some of the items you need, like a charger etc instead of having to purchase separately. All in all very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Improved Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Pierre
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a huge improvement over the original.  Just about every feature has been improved.  The only con I have is the absence of the charging indicator.  Can't figure out what genius thought it was a feature that should not be included in the new version of the Tablet.

Reviews.Title: Everyone should own one!
Reviews.Author: -C.C. "•[Amazon Prime Member-Top Reviewer]•"
Reviews.Content: Since buying my Kindle Fire 7 HD,  I can't put it down. This portable little gem does everything I expected, and more. Excellent value. Sturdy, and feels nice to hold. Excellent choice of content to load. Thanks Amazon for making an affordable, usable product. Earns my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Perfect streamer
Reviews.Author: Vikram Nagulan
Reviews.Content: The Dolby audio is undoubtedly the best part of this tablet. Movie streaming is quite slick and watching movies with the Dolby audio is amazing.The software however could be refined more. The touch aspects are not very refined.The amazon account should also be made available without a US credit card or a credit card at all - this would at the least allow for installation of free apps which is right now impossible without a credit card tied to the account.

Reviews.Title: Great all around reader/travel computer
Reviews.Author: Christine Ramseyer
Reviews.Content: Well, I was torn between the Kindle Fire HD and the Ipad. I wanted a travel computer that would double as a reader so that I could simplify the travel accessories. Well my husband has the first ipad. He likes it and I have used it a few times while we were traveling. The problems I saw with it was firstly, the weight. That thing is massive. I am not a little person, but I was not comfortable holding it in my hands for long. Secondly, it is the Apple way of doing things. The navigating on that thing is just not intuitive for me. Thirdly, the price. Woo, that's a lot of money for a travel computer and reader. So enter the Kindle Fire HD.  The reviews on Amazon have been very helpful. I must admit that I usually read the negative ones first. You get a lot of honest information from those. But I found that when I looked at what I needed it for, the Kindle Fire HD had everything I needed, plus a lot more. At a price that was very reasonable. So I bought it.  I like the size. I considered waiting for the new Kindle to come out, but I like the size of the original one for travel. I like that weight. It is heavier than a Kindle keyboard, but that is to be expected. It houses a great little computer. I was able to start my email right away. I was able to access my books. I pulled up a couple of movie trailers to see what that was like. Great. I plan to rent a few movies for a long plane trip soon. I'm excited. Surfing the net is really easy and the Kindle remembers the sights you like to look at.  Did I mention the picture. It is amazing. The sound is great. The book print quality is really nice and easy to use.  A lot of reviewers mentioned the ads from Amazon. Well if you are an Amazon shopper anyway, why worry. If the item is something you are not interested in, ignore it.  I bought the cover for the Kindle fire. It works well. It is sturdy and sleek.  Overall, this is a travel companion that I will enjoy a lot. Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Decent, Needs Some Refinement
Reviews.Author: MarkS
Reviews.Content: I am a previous iPad user who decided to go on the lookout for a 7 inch tablet, because I feel the iPad to be too cumbersome for what I use it for, although it is an amazing device. My journey started with the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 which was ok for a little while but soon began to be riddled with bugs in the software, and Samsung support is not the best, so I returned it. Low and behold, the Nexus 7 which I couldn't wait to get my hands on. I went through four of them in the time span that I had one, each with its own unique manufacturing defect. I thought Samsung support was bad until I dealt with Google (for the first 15 days) and then Asus after that. Complete nightmare, and no solutions to be had, they just kept replacing it with more faulty units.So now my journey is here, the Kindle Fire HD, also my first Amazon Kindle product of any kind.The design is decent, the rubber back is good for grip, and I prefer it over the very easily scratched iPad backing. The screen is quite nice, very vibrant and much brighter; it also has deeper colors than the Nexus 7, which always appeared washed out. It is a smidgen heavier than the competition, but weight is not something that I put a whole lot of stock in myself. The thicker bezel also really doesn't bother me, seems to fit my fingers nicely, so no complaints from me there.The power and volume buttons are a complete pain to find and use. The camera is the only way that you can tell which way is up, and in the dark you just fumble around the device until you feel the slightest hint of a bump and then press to see where you are.Software seems fairly snappy and responsive, with the exception of web browsing. I have to say that I am not at all impressed with the Silk web browser, it just seems slow and makes web surfing cumbersome; also doesn't scroll well at all. Really wish they had a nice third party browser like Dolphin available in the AppStore.I haven't figured out how to get my iTunes based music on it yet, but that isn't a huge deal, can't figure everything out right off the bat.Software is not the most intuitive, I find myself wandering around looking for a specific function quite a bit, also needs "one touch" access to the AppStore instead of me having to punch in 3 or 4 different places to get there. Would also like to see a bit more of a customizable home screen vs. the carousel. Many of the "thumbnails/previews" on the carousel look grainy and blurry and it just makes the experience feel cheap.Email and QuickOffice work very nicelyVideos look really good on the device and it seems to stream Netflix and Hulu+ rather nicely.The ads don't bother me a bit, in fact some of them are pretty good, will be interesting to see if they are tailored towards me after some time with the device.Also, it should come with a power adaptor, I shouldn't have to split time between devices with my iPhone's power plug. Nexus 7 came with an adaptor, and it is in the exact same price point.Although it may seem like a lot of griping, I actually do like the device, and am finding it enjoyable for the most part. This is a nice HD entertainment device that does a fair job of standing up to the competition. This review was more about genuine areas where I feel the device needs a bit of improvement, but overall I have a decent first impression of the device.UPDATE: I am finding the device to be somewhat jumpy when it comes to games, not sure if it is a processor or RAM issue, but it isn't the smoothest tablet gaming experience I have seen.Also, seems really slow to open apps, averages a 3-5 second delay before opening, long enough delay to make you wonder if your touch even registered.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7in
Reviews.Author: pinkpanther
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire which I love, and just upgraded to a Kindle Fire HD 7in, and love it even more.  It's simply amazing! I bought the power adapter, and just plugged it in, and set up was a breeze! You have to buy the power adapter extra, which it tells you, but it comes with the USB cord that connects to it, and also you can use it to connect to your computer.  The User Guide is already installed in the Kindle Fire HD, and has everything you need to know.  I definitely give it a 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: As with the other reviews the Kindle HD 7" has shown to be worth the upgrade. I like that the new Kindle HD is lighter and the HD makes a world of difference compared to my original Kindle Fire. I just received it and I am excited to check out all of the upgrades and features. My grandkids walk in the door trying to be the first to ask for the Kindle Fire to use and play on! Wondering if this new Kindle Fire 7" is so nice if I should have gotten the bigger one...Ps: Thank you for the great customer service Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Enrique Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I really like the Amazon Eco system so this tablet is perfect for someone like me. I also have and iPad and an Asus tf300 tablet running Jelly bean so my experience with tablets is not limited.I think Amazon has done a great job with the 7" hd, the screen is absolutely gorgeous and the experience all together is very satisfying. Its much nicer than the original in many ways. For one it now has volume control and I like the GMail integration which the original didn't have.I still don't like the fact that you're stuck with the onscreen keyboard and you can't change it like you can with Android tablets so you're stuck with the keyboard whether you like it or not just like the iPad. It is a little wider than the original more like a shrunken version of an ipad but still light enough to hold with one hand for a little while. Not as fast as my Android tablet or iPad but not so slow it matters.Altogether I give the tablet a 5 star because of the build quality, the beautiful screen and value for money.

Reviews.Title: Another winner for Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Rich Himes
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire HD for a couple of days and here are my impressions, for what they're worth.This tablet feels really solid and seems to be well built. For me it's got good weight and while I liked the  slightly smaller size of the original Kindle Fire, I realize that we've now got a front facing camera as well as a microphone which has to be accommodated. Undoubtedly there are changes inside that required a bit more room.Even so, the KFHD7 still fits into my front pants pocket even with the Amazon case which is really well crafted and is covered in leather. I know some have questioned that but rest assured, that is leather and the craftsmanship is great. The only thing I'd change about the Amazon case would be to have some way to have it held open so as not to put stress on the hinge.This is a minor issue for me.The screen is incredible. I took it to where I work to get the opinion of the technicians I work with. The company I work for produces digital motion picture equipment so when I was told by them that the display was "incredible", I take that at face value.The sound also is impressive. In fact, one of the guys in our IT department lamented that it was much better than his Nexus 7. Not slamming the Nexus 7 but I have to agree, my sound is better.I've found that my music loads and plays almost immediately, just like on my original KF.Netflix also works incredibly well.I was a bit disappointed that the Need for Speed app would not run on the new KFHD7 but that's really an  issue with the developer (EA) not Amazon. Besides, over the years, I've had games not play on the new OS's that come out for my PC but again, this is a minor annoyance.I've read some reviews that say there is a problem with the Silk browser. Mine works really well so I'm thinking that perhaps this may just be a matter of tweaking router settings to get the full speed out of it.I'm still not a huge fan of the carousel but this version of it looks and performs a  lot better than the original did.Lock screen ads are not a problem for me. I see them for a second and then the screen is unlocked. It's certainly not a big enough deal to shell out $15 to "fix".  Suggestions for what other people purchased also do not bother me. I just ignore them after I scroll through them. "Problem" solved.Regarding the KFHD7 shipping without a charger, I have at least three of them around the house. They work just fine and I don't see that they charge the KFHD7 any slower than the original KF. Then again, I usually charge it while I'm sleeping so again this is a non-issue.THANK YOU AMAZON FOR INCLUDING BLUTOOTH SUPPORT!!! I have dusted off my Motorola Rokr's and am pleased with the performance!This may not be the perfect tablet for everyone but it does indeed do what I need it to do and that's what's important to me.Bottom line (for me) is that this is a great tablet for the price and Amazon has done an amazing job with it.Your mileage may vary ;-)

Reviews.Title: I love the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Simone Loren
Reviews.Content: I've noticed a lot of complaints about the Kindle Fire HD, specifically most people complain about the "ads", so I would like to address this first. Personally, to me, the ads are unobtrusive, they show up on the lock screen, and they have a tab all the way at the end called offers. I don't mind them at all, in fact they are pretty neat. Since I have had my Fire HD I have gotten $5 credit towards Amazon MP3 (I bought now thats what I call music #43) and also a $5 credit towards Amazon Videos (I bought the switch) so since I have purchased my FIRE HD, I have already received $10 back. Its not as though the ads just pop up while you are doing something, they are only on the lock screen. GET OVER IT PEOPLE!All in all, I love everything about the HD, I upgraded (had original fire) and the differences are noticeable in picture and sound. I have very happy with it. The only issue I initially had was that I have a mac computer and could not connect my device to my computer or to calibre (where I keep all my non amazon books filed), it takes a bit longer to add them to my kindle using the android app but it still works.

Reviews.Title: Short battery life!
Reviews.Author: zane
Reviews.Content: I have owned different versions of this tablet over the last 3 years and it would have been perfect if it wasn't for the battery. The pros first- Very portable, great picture and sound quality, very convenient especially for Amazon prime members to order books, movies and music. The build and  finish of the tablet is pretty good- the screen is made of some kind of gorilla glass which makes it scratch resistant and durable and the back is soft and rubberized for a comfortable grip. It is lightweight and the dimensions are just right in my opinion.The cons are- Battery life is terrible. This is one aspect of the tablet that needs help. I did not see too many complaints about this because I am assuming people are just happy with the price. The battery levels enters the red zone after about 1.5 hours of reading a book and 40 min. to an hour doing anything else which includes videos, music or just browsing. It is plain irritating when you have to worry about battery life when reading a book. The tablet tends to heat up when charging too.End result I have returned the Kindle Fire and bought an Ipad 3. It was more expensive but has proven worthy- it has 3 times the battery life. This being said, I have been and continue to be a loyal customer and fan of Amazon but until they address this issue, I will not be buying any Kindle tablets any time soon.Please note that this review does not apply to the Kindle readers.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindel Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Kimberly V.
Reviews.Content: Wow! I have never owned a tablet before I know this devices is designed to be a E Reader but it can be used for so much more it is like owning a mini computer I can't believe the picture quality and the sound. I have to say I'm vey impressed with this devise. It is a little heavy but I like that you don't feel like your going to break it. downloading books, movies, music and apps is so easy a little to easy. You have to be carful just on click and you can order books, movies, music and apps. They do make it easy to cancel orders if you accidently order something you do not want. I have only owned this for a few days so I'm still discovering new things. The battery life is so much better than my laptop. The laptop top only lasts for about 3 hours the Kindle Fire last for 8. If you are thinking about buying this devise I highly recommend it. I would also recommend buying a 2 year warranty. I previously owned a Kindle and it broke after owning it for a year and a half.

Reviews.Title: Not great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I read so much into this device and was sold on the advertising that I didn't look nearly as far into it's competition as I should have. First and foremost...Hardware... 1.2 ghz is ok, video is very good, but I don't think it's noticeable enough to pass up it's competition that is $30 cheaper and has some major advantages. Right now the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 is the same size, good looking screen...slightly (not very notiecable) slower processor and is in a very similar, if not better price range. The advantages of the Samsung is that is has GPS, an operating system that allows both the Amazon App Store and Google Play and what is just great is the ability to use it as an IR remote control for your tv. The only real advantages that I can see for the Kindle Fire HD is if you are very invested into prime and use instant videos and rent a free book from the Kindle store. Overall it works good, but this should be a $150 tablet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Multi-Purpose Tablet
Reviews.Author: Fr. Mark
Reviews.Content: I use my tablet for work, church, and personal. I am an Orthodox Priest, who also maintains a secular job, and the Kindle Fire HD is a great tool to have around. The 7" form factor makes it easy to carry around (even in a pocket).First off: WorkThe KFHD allows me to connect to our Exchange server flawlessly. I also connect to our local wireless network, via secure access. I use CalenGoo for calendering software, because it actually displays event text on the screen, not just the time. I have really begun to like WPS Office for document editing, along with Office Suite Pro. Evernote is one of my best friends for meetings, and I round it off with the Citrix Receiver when I need to get to my desktop or servers remotely.Second: ChurchOur liturgical texts are often in PDF format, so I use RepliGo PDF Reader, especially because it has a text re-flow option. I am often typing my homily notes using a portable Bluetooth keyboard. I also have a bunch of liturgical documents that I store locally and in the cloud. I use the web browser for research, and often am playing sacred music from the player. Amazon bookstore has quite a few church books, including the Orthodox Study Bible (of course), but also other books as well, that I love to have for reference and spiritual reading. The other really cool thing about this tablet, is that the Kindle book app (after all this is first and foremost a Kindle), will now do text to speech (which the original Kindle Fire was missing). I often use the special email address that Amazon gives you to email documents to the device (It also converts it to the Kindle format)Third: HomeMy children are often wanting to play games (o.k. me as well), so I have the usual assortment (especially Angry Bird - Star Wars!), I haven't tried out FaceTime, but I'm glad its there. Of course, it also seamlessly connects to my Gmail Accounts and syncs the email, calendar, and contacts (by the way, this is fantastically improved over the original Kindle Fire). I have Pandora going a lot, and TuneIn radio. The social media apps are there as well (I don't do much of these), but I have Skyped, and used Facebook to talk with people.Other thoughts:I have read of other people disliking the Fire interface, but I have found that I like it better (much better) than the stock Android UI. I have had and have used other Android tablets and have a Droid phone, so I am no stranger to Android (I have rooted every device I've owned). The KFHD interface is just easier to use, especially for those that only occasionally use tablets or that are not geeks. The Amazon App Store does have a limited selection compared to the Google Play, but I have yet to not find an app that I have needed. The battery life is good, and the screen is amazing (bright and very clear). The sound is the best I've seen in any tablet. The device feels and looks well made. I have used the HDMI port to display video on our TV, and you will like that it has 16gb of memory.Amazon still has yet to get the power, and volume buttons right, and it would be nice to have GPS. Buy a wall charger right off the bat, or use the one that came with your phone.The KFHD is a great device, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best Kindle yet, better than the first Fire -- and could be the best tablet out there, period.
Reviews.Author: Rich Levin "RBL"
Reviews.Content: The new Kindle Fire HD fixes many of the problems I experienced with the original Fire. Its touch response is excellent, it adds Bluetooth and Dolby stereo and, of course, HD video.The OS/software/GUI experience is by far the best you can find on a tablet from any vendor, bar none (including Google with the Nexus). Amazon's take on Android is far more user friendly, simpler, and consistent.Yes, there are fewer apps available. But the apps are higher quality. And more apps are coming online every day. I have been able to find a solution for every app requirement I need.If you're a heavy Amazon, the Fire HD is a no-brainer. It's seamless integration with the Amazon ecosystem is excellent. If you're torn between a Nexus and a Fire HD, try both in a local store. You'll be using the Fire in seconds, while you'll have to configure the daylights out of the Nexus before you can get anything done. And the Fire's multimedia specs are superior to the Nexus as well.Save yourself the $50 and get the version with the ads. They're nothing more than a screen saver, and easily ignored. Plus, sometimes there's actually a good deal offered on the lock screen.My only complaints so far:* The Fire HD does not come with a power brick. Amazon expects us to shell out $20 for one. Save yourself the trouble if you have any 5V 1.8mA USB chargers around. They'll work.* The buttons for volume and power are hard to find by touch. They're practically flush with the device's body. You'll always be hunting for the power and volume switches. And when you want to power down, you'll often change the audio volume instead.

Reviews.Title: SO SO happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: katiev
Reviews.Content: I first got a Leapad for my boys and after the screen breaking and the piles of batteries needed to keep it going I decided that they needed something they could interact with and not pay the HIGH prices that go along with the apps.This Kindle is $100 more and worth every penny plus, in the long run, I am saving money since there are so many interactive education and fun apps for the boys.  What an amazing price for the quality of this notepad.  This is a fraction of the price for an ipad and to me, it's worth it's weight in gold since I have to buy two of everything with twins.I have only had this a week and my boys are excelling at puzzles, drawing, alphabet games, abc's....I can go on and on.  They are doing preschool up to kindergarten level activities and I couldn't be happier.  They had to be shown once how to do the activity and they are doing it on their own.  Of course, they come for help when they need it but it keeps their hands busy and minds occupied without watching too much tv.They can't get enough of this and I downloaded so many educational activities that if they get bored with one they can go to another.  There is also an app to keep the kids only on what you want and they can't go outside of it to go online or on to your things as well.So happy that this is provided by Amazon and making it so affordable for the quality it provides.  :)

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: J. Combs "bibliobabe"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my new Kindle, a gift from a dear friend.Although the Kindle Fire HD has much more to offer than just books, I'm mostly a reader and was surprised to find how much like a 'book' this actually is, and in many ways better. The screen is bright and navigating around is easy, as is ordering books from Amazon...they just "magically" appear shortly after placing the order.Nor is the Kindle oeuvre limited to Amazon alone, you can access virtually anything that has been formatted for the Kindle from any number of resources, (many of which you can download at no cost,such as your local library.)Just a very cool tool!

Reviews.Title: Most Useful Kindle So Far
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This device has restored my faith in Amazon.  While I was very disappointed by the flimsy last generation Kindles and skipped the original Fire the HD is a winner.PROS* Nothing flimsy about it very solid unit* easy to use with one hand* Reliable, I've carried this every day in a pocket without a single glitch* Sound is phoenomenal for a device this size - sounds significantly better than the new IPad for a quarter the price* Image quality is amazing, can watch a few movies* Works well with the Amazon cloud services* Works well with Caliber to handle older MOBI, PDF and Text booksCons* I've spent more in content than this device cost since I got it. <g>Don't listen to the Apple Hype, try this device and compare it directly to the IPad.  While it may not have all of the apps the IPad does it works very well.  I purchased a Microsoft Bluetooth keyboard and the OfficeSuite Professial 6 software.  It allows me to write and edit Microsoft Office (word/excel/pp) documents with ease.  It has allowed me to mostly retire my Thinkpad X60 for daily use.

Reviews.Title: Another best just got better <3
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: quick and to the point.its:fastsmoothloudbrightlite..only thing it dont have is a stupid apple logo with a bite taken out of it.

Reviews.Title: sd card
Reviews.Author: Maryann E. Milauskas "master chief"
Reviews.Content: The new kindle fire hd is the best tablet on the market I have no problems with it except I need more room for more storage so amazon please include an sd card in the next amazon kindle fire and also a back he camera would be great

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jean Hartwig
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire because my husband and I were planning a trip to Ireland and needed a way to check our e-mails. It worked great for this purpose.  Also I love to play games and only owned the Kindle before.  Wow, what a difference to have the Fire with all the bells and whistles of sound/color and the touch screen.  Can't believe how much more fun it is. I don't think I could get along without it.  I still use my Kindle to read books on though because it is smaller and lighter to carry with me.

Reviews.Title: Totally nuts over my Kindle Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: Bonita E. Blake "Bonnie B."
Reviews.Content: Have been wanting one of these Kindles now for awhile, but heard they were coming out with a new one that had a lot more features then the earlier Kindles.  I debated on the iPad but when I actually started to do my research on this and discovered all that this nifty little Kindle Fire HD could do, then the Kindle won, hands down.  The color is terrific, I love the cloud feature for the music or books because that allows me to listen to the music I love where ever I am. And having email capability is very cool as well as WiFi connect to do internet searches.  Just a great device in my opinion and even though I've only had it about 3 weeks, I'm still totally crazy over it and still learning all that it can do.  Thanks Amazon for bringing us such a great Kindle Fire...

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: faztang
Reviews.Content: Overall VERY happy with my decision to buy a Kindle Fire HD.  It was between the Kindle and the Nexus 7.  I decided on the Kindle mostly because of Amazon Prime.  About $6 a month for movies, tv, one book rental a month, and two day shipping?  I mean the Nexus has nothing like that.  You want movies, tv, or books on the Nexus you have to buy them all a la carte.The small cons of the Kindle Fire are as follows:Not really the full Android experience, so if you expect the navigation to be the same as your android phone you will be disappointed.  This also means you buy your apps through Amazon not Google Play store.  And from my experience Amazon does not offer the same amount of apps as the Play store.  I would say somewhere between 60%-70%.That really wasn't a big deal for me.  I bought a tablet for two main reasons:Entertainment while travelingWeb/Email access while sitting on the couch in a compact device. (I have a huge laptop that I hate lugging around).The Kindle fire hd covers these bases with flying colors, for a very fair price.  I would not waste my money on an ipad mini, unless you are totally locked in the iTunes universe.

Reviews.Title: best purchase ever
Reviews.Author: beth
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire - it exceeded my expectations. I just wanted something inexpensive that I could check facebook and e-mail. The kindle has so many fun (and many free) games and apps that you can get. When it first came I had to get used to how it differs from lap top (which is what I usually used). You have to go to the Amazon shop (which is built in to the kindle - you just click on 'shop' in the menu on top) and download apps for facebook and magazines that you have subscriptions to. Also it doesn't come with a wall charger it comes with one that you have to plug into a laptop to charge your kindle (it is very slow and inconvenient). You can order the wall charger for around $10.00 but it seems like it should come with it because if you aren't at home you may not be able to charge it with the accompanying charger - that was probably my only disappointment with my purchase. I think most people would be willing to pay the extra $10 and have the charger come with the kindle. I LOVE MY AMAZON KINDLE - it is now my favorite toy. I can play games, read my magazines, do my bible study and every day I learn of more apps that I can download that are fun and/or useful! Very reasonable price for what you get!

Reviews.Title: Improved text to speech
Reviews.Author: J. Burgett
Reviews.Content: The computer voice is smoother. Better is that my old Kindle (touch and keyboard) would pronounce "c'mon" as "see Monday" which was pretty annoying. The Kindle Fire HD's text to speech algorithm seems to not try to expand short words and initials ("RD" to "road" was annoying because "RD" was initials of a character in a story I was reading) Anyway, the new voice is more pleasant and seems more accurate.

Reviews.Title: Best 7" Tablet for Movies, Net, on The Go . .
Reviews.Author: kindleclusters
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Super Good !!Kindle Fire HD is just perfect for Full HD movies, Games, Apps, and best of all - surfing the Net.It also keeps you connected to your business world in a sleek 7" tablet that is easy to take along for the ride - not bulky at all - but, has a display that is second to none.Love this lil' rascal . .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: J. Roden
Reviews.Content: I like my original Kindle Fire very much, and when the Kindle Fire HD came along, I couldn't resist giving it a try.  I have not been disappointed.  All the new features are very nice and work just as advertised.  This new version has features that were missing on the original, and I have enjoyed trying them all, including skype, HDMI port, some great special offers, and more.  The sound from the dual speakers is really awesome--it's loud enough for most anything I want to listen to, and often I find myself even turning the volume down. The email app is said to be improved, and I believe it is, because it seems much easier to use the email on this new HD than on the original Kindle Fire. I really like the 7" screen size and the thinness of this device. It is still book-size for easy reading and carrying with me. Some have complained about the width of the bezel surrounding the screen, but I find it pretty convenient, as there is room for my fingers or thumbs to hold the device, especially in portrait mode, without accidentally tapping something on the screen.  Overall, I believe this device is a very good investment for anyone who wants to enjoy a tablet and all the great stuff available on amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: So glad I bought this!
Reviews.Author: Turtle615
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I bought the Kindle Fire HD 7 inch. I bought mine from Best Buy and it has been awesome. My husband has an iPad, but I prefer the size of the Kindle over the iPad. You definitely need to completely charge it when you first get it because it will seem like the battery life sucks. But once you let it charge, you're good to go.

Reviews.Title: A Great Item for a Great Price.
Reviews.Author: Nayara Pinheiro
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new kindle. It has a brilliant display, and all the basic daily necessary functions. I'm a college student and I couldn't ask for more. Definitely recommend this to anyone who needs entertainment, reading and browsing on the go!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Deborah Camp "Author of more than 50 novels. ...
Reviews.Content: I am in love. This is my first kindle and I chose well. It's fast and easy.  I use it every day for a number of tasks. It never lets me down.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: designgal
Reviews.Content: I just love my Kindle HD. The 7 inch size is very portable and fits my tote bags nicely, also gives more privacy than 10 inch screens when using it in public locations, train stations, etc..  I was an iTouch user, and I won't go back. The Kindle is very fast, easy to read and super easy to learn. The on-line instructions for moving my music, etc. to the cloud couldn't be easier. I'm not bothered by the few ads that appear when the device is opened. I find some of them useful, but one swipe gets rid of them quickly if they bother you. The value is great, has an excellent variety of features. Amazon Prime is a good deal, I'm still in the trial period and have used it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Ecosystem Tablet A++
Reviews.Author: PSP Fan
Reviews.Content: Will keep this review brief. Many people compare the kindle fire HD to the nexus 7 Google tablet. This is an error as this tablet has more in common with the Apple iPad. You might be asking yourself Why?The answer is simple. Ecosystem.Like apple, amazon is a self enclosed digital ecosystem. With its own browser, app store and media offerings. Keep this in mind when purchasing a tablet.Many people are dissatisfied that this kindle has no access to the Google play store However, the interface and offerings amazon has makes up for this. Having an amazon prime membership is reccomended to benefit from the steaming capabilities of this affordable device.

Reviews.Title: Much better than the old Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Crystal Dragon "Shut the &^%$ up Donny, you'r...
Reviews.Content: I give it 4 stars because Amazon didn't answer our Kindle Fire requests to implement a book sorting option.  Had it included this, I would have given it a full 5 stars. The crispness of the screen is amazing, it responds so quickly to touch, and it operates faster than the old Kindle Fire.  I would most certainly recommend this to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: Good so Far
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I purchased my kindle fire hd yesterday and just received it today.  I spent a little time playing with it.  It downloads apps very fast and I like that I can link my amazon account to it.  The only thing I have yet to figure out is how to download books.  I keep getting an error message each time.  So hopefully it's just some kind of wireless issue.  Love the shape and size and I like that it has a rubber backing.  You get a lot for 200 dollars.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Monica W. Phillips "mwph"
Reviews.Content: The new Kindle Fire HD has sharp color and text which makes it easy to read.  The 7 inch is easy to take with you where ever you go.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions
Reviews.Author: Heather Furbish
Reviews.Content: I only received my new kindle this afternoon so I can't say too much but there are things I love and hate already. Most have already been addressed by others.Pros:-absolutely beautiful screen! The colors are vibrant and sharp!-speakers are awesome! loud and crisp!-has really fast response time scrolling through the carousel and zooming-beautiful design-The camera is great! I called my mom on skype and she was baffled at how clear I was coming in!Cons:-I can't complain too much because I knew this before buying but WHY DOES THE WALL ADAPTER NOT COME WITH THIS PRODUCT?!!! I find this absolutely ridiculous and don't feel like shelling out $20 for the stupid plug.-the software seems kinda buggy...mine keeps shutting down for no reason. Pretty annoying and I haven't figured out why yet but I'm remaining hopeful that it will get worked out with updates.  Apps also take a little time to get moving and I really wish there could be support for some other browser because theirs seems super slow. I'm going to use it extensively this weekend and if the problem persists I'm going to call them and ask if it's a software thing or a defective product and will take it from there.-The volume rocker is super awkward...I can't press it without having to search for it because it's flush with the device.  I'm sure I'll get used to using it but right now it's pretty annoying.-Certain apps available through the amazon app store on my phone aren't available on here...a vital one for me is dropbox, which I can access off of my android phone through their app store but I can't get it for the kindle.  This really sucks, I'm a college student and me and my friends exchange files through here constantly and I access a lot of important docs through it.  I'll just plug it into my computer and load them on here but this is big bummer for me.Overall I would say I give it a B+ until some software updates come around but I wouldn't let that deter you, this is a beautiful device and a really great buy! I don't doubt that some upgrades are coming very soon...don't let me down Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle knew me!
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get my new kindle today! This is my first experience with ereaders/tablets and I am happy. After reading the reviews from others, its important to note no android devices have flash anymore (so that debunked that thought for me) also I plan on getting the cover so I wont be seeing the lock screen ads (which are super annoying and that is what you can pay $15 to get rid of), and the ad at the bottom is a ribbon that tells you what other customers bought, call me crazy, but I've enjoyed seeing them- and found some books and apps that I put on my wish list. It would be great if this was a feature we can turn off- though I know that amazon did it to keep the cost low and in the landscape mode it doesnt appear. I do wish we could personalize it more- but I also notice after using it tonight, I got use to the look.I really like amazon, have bought kindle books I've read on my phone, am a member of audible, and pretty much do all of my shopping through them. Not only did seeing the package in the mail make me happy, but when I turned it on I was impressed it had battery power and it said my name! It autoloaded my kindle purchases, all of my audible books, and it asked me if I wanted to save all of my facebook photos under the photo section. I am not a big technology person so I wanted something user friendly that worked with my life. I think this kindle is it.  I set up a skype account, downloaded an app that works with google chat (very easy for me!) and I'm going to start my first book on my kindle now!I'd give it 4.5 stars, allow us to lock out the other customer purchases ads and it'd be a 5 star! Even if was part of the parental controls- regardless I love it!

Reviews.Title: It's Legit
Reviews.Author: Deuce "Deuce"
Reviews.Content: Just got my kindle fire hd and I wanted to to try it out before I gave a review. I don't think the ads are that obtrusive, I am getting a case, so I will not see the lock screen. You don't see the suggestions when you switch the kindle to landscape mode. I love the integration with imdb. It makes finding things to watch, so much easier. I can read magazines without zooming in. Magazines do not take up the whole screen though, they leave a bar open so you can access the menu bar. The screen looks nice and the speakers are great. No outlet charger included is a bummer. I was going to give this 5 stars but, flash can no longer play on the fire. I was looking forward to playing flash videos. Oh well! Overall, this is a great tablet for $200! If you are a amazon prime member (which I am) then this is the tablet for you.

Reviews.Title: Kind of bummed
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about the Kindle Fire HD until I got one for myself and my daughter.  Now I'm. kind of hummed.  I had hoped to replace my Kindle Fire, which I love, with the Kindle Fire HD.  I thought I'd be getting the same Kindle Fire experience with better sound quality, better graphics, faster Wifi, more storage space, etc.  I had hoped to transfer my Kindle Fire aps to the Kindle Fire HD, and deregister my Kindle Fire so I could give it to a friend or sell it for a cheaper price.  What I didn't realize is not all Kindle Fire aps are compatible with the HD system.  I also didn't know I would lose my game scores as well as any virtual items I had purchased -with real cash -when I transferred the aps from one system to the other or attempted to sync the devices.  Hopefully Amazon can and will remedy this matter soon.  Until then I have to keep and use my Kindle Fire to access the aps and games I purchased that aren't compatible with the HD device.Like everyone else I am disappointed that Amazon did not provide a free wall charger with the HD device.  The wall charger costs $9.99 or $19.99 depending on purchase time.  It should be noted the HD device does include a PC USB for charging purposes, but I believe a wall charger is much more convenient for a mobile device.  With this said, I did find out later that my Kindle Fire wall charger can be utilized to charge my Kindle Fire HD.  I now have another reason to keep both devices.Finally, I am hummed that I have to pay $15 times two to remove unwanted advertisements from my daughter's device and my device.  Some people don't mind the "offers " but I find them to be intrusive and annoying.  They're like spam that can't be deleted or contained in one folder.  I also wonder what affect the advertisements have on the device and how much of my purchased space will be used before the advertisements are removed from the device.All in all the Kindle Fire HD has some great features.  It's pretty nice if you have never owned a tablet and you want to pay extra money for a wall charger and offers removal.  If you're looking to upgrade the Kindle Fire like I was save your money.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD 7 Great but...
Reviews.Author: Dan Mimms "TexDanL"
Reviews.Content: I got my new fire the day of its release and have to tell you it was everything that I had hoped for except...The entire quick start guide is little more than a one liner and the help section that is on the unit is almost useless. I give the Fire itself a 5 star but give Amazon a ZERO for not providing even a basic realistically useful owners manual. Oh they will SELL you one. The only time I tried to ask a question they tried to charge me for it.Let me tell you now, if you buy a kindle fire just go ahead and buy a non-Amazon guide book so you can learn a little about it. There are tons of hidden features that are mentioned NO PLACE in the provided minimal online guide they offer for free.The new kindle is great for what I wanted. It cruses the net just fine and reads ebooks well. I like the games and there are just a bunch of free to low cost neat apps for it. The picture is razor sharp and the audio quality is beyond belief considering that it is produced by tiny speakers. I got the Amazon Prime and it is nice too since I shop with Amazon a lot.I'm just puzzled and disappointed that Amazon is doing something as shady as not offering you any free support or operating instructions past basically push the start button and GO. While I'm not the most advanced computer geek out there I do work with and on them a lot. I own a nook and a kindle keypad so I wasn't clueless. Nonetheless my biggest challenge has been trying to figure out how to do the basic things that were simple on both the Kindle reader and the Nook.COME ON MAN!!! It wouldn't break your bank to GIVE the people that paid for your device just a LITTLE help in figuring it out!!!! Even when I give up and try to get something out of kindle.com in the way of information half the time it is down...

Reviews.Title: Anyone else having problems with their kindle fire hd?
Reviews.Author: D. Case
Reviews.Content: I got the updated kindle fire hd because my daughter loves the one we got her last yr. I didn't open until today as it was a gift. I was hesitant on keeping it because the kindle fires went on sale for 119.00 Monday. I thought about returning it and just going with the fire and saving money. After reading reviews and seeing how everyone loved their fire hd I kept it. Now I wish I hadn't. My camera flickers all the time. The pictures don't turn out. Why didn't they make the cameras like the Galaxy s3's? You can take a picture 2 different ways on them. When scrolling for books to purchase my fire freezes. I have to turn it off and reboot it. I can't leave off from where I left off. By the time I get to where I left off it freezes again. I had to have my husband fix the wifi cuz it kept saying not connected when ordering books, but when u checked it it said connected. I am taking it back tomorrow. I'm bummed because I now cannot get just the fire for 119.00. I bought four fires monday as gifts  and they all work awesome and mine is horrible. Kindle fire hd is all hyped up and not even worth it. Very Disappointed! What a waste of hard earned money!

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY
Reviews.Author: DMAN
Reviews.Content: This thing is a piece of crap, it works 5% of the time, the rest of the time it is freezinf up, if I could, I would get a refund, but I cant, I know own a $200 piece of crap that freezes every 30 seconds, it gets a 1 star because I could not give it a 0. I am very upset with this product and Amazon has done nothing to help it

Reviews.Title: NOT user friendly
Reviews.Author: Hilary Eppley
Reviews.Content: Although this product is much cheaper than the iPad, it is a far less superior product. I have been using the iPad and iPhones since they first came out and this product seriously lacks in user friendliness.The touch screen is hard to manipulate. I find myself having to perform a motion five or six times before I do it perfectly and get the action I need. Keep in mind, I am completely tech savvy.The ads are a BIG flaw here. The Kindle is so much cheaper than the iPad because corporate America foot the bill for you. There is an ad on the screen every single time you log in. I hate that.I really can't say much else because I never used it after I realized how un-friendly it was. I'm currently selling mine since I won it at a conference.DO NOT BUY. If you want an e-reader, then get the simple versions that don't connect to the Internet.

Reviews.Title: From excitement to severe  disappointment
Reviews.Author: Tiffany jones
Reviews.Content: I was originally thrilled to receive this device for Xmas, but that quickly changed. Surfing the internet is extremely limited due to the inability to use JavaScript and so many sites and features are unavailable. Typing is slow and tedious. The app  selection is poor and I find myself not even being able to have the basic applications. I am extremely frustrated and disappointed. Even now as I'm typing this review I'm getting frustrated. I have to explain to a family member that the gift is being returned or thrown in a body of water. I will be promptly purchasing an iPad instead. Don't waste your time or money!!!

Reviews.Title: Happy:)
Reviews.Author: Rogue320
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY NEW KINDLE FIRE HD! IT IS SO EASY TO USE! THE SOUND IS GREAT, THE COLOR IS GREAT AND VERY USER FRIENDLY! AND AT 200$, ITS A STEAL! I HAVE TO SAY, AMAZONS GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE MAKES ME A CUSTOMER FOR LIFE! I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER! THANK YOU, AMAZON, FOR MAKING AN AFFORDABLE TABLET AND READER!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD7 Very Good
Reviews.Author: ThelmaL.
Reviews.Content: I think this is a beautiful device to enjoy books. I don't mind the ads. They only come at the beginning and not during reading books. Sometimes I don't mind being informed about what's new on the market. Some people may want to pay to avoid these ads and I think its a waste to spend extra money. The ads are not bombarding as some people seem to think. The color is awesome and HD superb. Watching videos is just wonderful and the sound is incredible. You really do hear very clear dolby audio with excellent equalizer balance. I am reading more than ever and covering more books since I got the Kindle. And as a matter of fact I am reading those free classics I never wanted to read in High School. The books are just coming more to life on the Kindle. I have to say the first Kindle I received was defective. When I called customer service they responded quickly, helped me troubleshoot, and then agreed I needed a new one. They sent a new one the next day and a free return label so I could send back the defective one. I encourage to buy the adaptor to charge quickly. Too bad they don't just include it. But its only $9.99 when you buy the Kindle through Amazon. Not too bad. I have watched movies connecting the device to my TV via the HDMI port. You do have to buy this cable in order to do it. Everything is great. But the Kindle HD 7 is 13 ounces heavy. Not so light to keep holding when you read a lot so I bought a Targus 360 rotating cover. I can rest the Kindle on my lap while it is being held by this cover. And it protects the device from accidents. The Targus was in my opinion very good cover even though a bit expensive at $40.00.

Reviews.Title: Messy OS but perfect size
Reviews.Author: owloveya
Reviews.Content: I'll start with a list of pros and cons for some who may not want to read a lengthy review.PROS:*cost*size*speed*brightness adjustment (both for reading in-program and for OS); I will also mention Kindle's alternative color reading options here as their sepia mode is very easy on the eyesCONS:*messy OS; carousel*lack of hard home button*slim profile volume/power button*2 portsI decided to give the Kindle Fire HD a try for three reasons: size, price point, and because I already use the Kindle app on other devices. I've found the physical experience with the tablet to be quite enjoyable: I can use it one handed; It is not overtly heavy; and (perhaps most importantly) it's compact size makes it more portable than other devices I have used. It fits in my purse very easily. One of my major pros as a reader is when the brightness can be adjusted. Kindle's app is great for e-reading since it is a reader. It also helps if you're watching movies late at night and don't want to wake a spouse.On to the cons.  It seems I have a lot of them, don't I? First off I'll conquer the elephant in the room...it's riding a carousel. Kindle's carousel is ridiculous. I have tried cleaning items off of it, adding items to favorites, even investigating alternative launchers (which don't appear to be available for this device yet, without rooting it, which I'm not willing to do at the moment).... I think it looks disastrous.  What would be so wrong with a plain home screen with little icons of your apps and books? I don't need all 15 of my recently synced PDFs to pop up there indefinitely, or until I go and mark them as read and then remove them again.  The favorites option doesn't seem to work - I'm trying to bookmark a few like Pandora, Facebook and the like and I'm disappointed. Amazon really could stand to improve this feature.Here is another beef I have. I paid $15 so I wouldn't have lock screen ads, but I'm stuck with random, boring, un-customizable lock screen images? I call bullshit. I love photography and some of the images are pretty, don't get me wrong, but I want to know I'm picking up MY kindle, not Suzie Sweet Briar's. That's going to happen if there's a lovely picture I put on that lock screen staring back at me. (Yes, this is if I don't happen to have a case on it. I ordered one, it didn't fit. Different review.) The OS is the leader of your user experience. It doesn't matter if I like your e-reader app. If every time I pick up my kindle I cringe at what I'm looking at, I'm not going to use my device. Sigh.In so far as the physical cons, which comprise the rest of my complaints, they consist of the following: there is no hard home button. I dislike 100% touch screen items but because of the PROS I listed before I was willing to overlook this. I like having the feature where I can double tap to hit my home page. It will take some re-training to remember to look for the little home icon. It's annoying.  The slim profile volume buttons are also irritating - you either have to look or guess which ones you are hitting because they are in line with the device. Some could say this is a pro; I consider it a nuisance to either a)always use the menus or b)look at the side to figure out which is which. Either way I'm interrupting my reading/viewing/listening experience to do something with the volume. Final con...what the heck do we need 2 ports for? 1 for syncing and charging is sufficient. It's also on the long side of the device, which is odd, and makes for odd looking cases in some situations.As of right now, I'm going to give it another week or two and see if it grows on me, or see if I can get an alternative launcher to load...but even for the size and price point, I am really hoping all of these Apple Mini reviews are true. Best of luck in your shopping!

Reviews.Title: KFHD solid, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Jesus S. Mijares "MECH"
Reviews.Content: My first tablet was a touchpad, sadly Web OS had very good promise but it was a total lag fest. I rooted and then installed the android operating system; it kind of liberated the tablet. It was more responsive, but development of the community was slow because the touchpad was not that popular. Reading on the tablet was really good, but forget about reading in your bed this thing was heavy.  So I decided to sell the HP touchpad. Decided that I was either going to go for the kindle fire HD or nexus 7. I looked at both devices and I was impressed with the performance of both. But the nexus 7 was king in performance.  But what I really disliked was the screen and the storage space of the nexus 7.  So I knew I was going to use the tablet to the maximum so I went with the kindle fire hd because it offered more space. As it is now I only have 6.78 GB left after everything I have done to the tablet. Kindle fire HD "7" The reason why I rooted===================================I ended up rooting my kindle fire.  There are tutorials on YouTube and xda developers.  I always like rooting the cell phones and tablets I get my hands on. My hd2 was rooted so many times (rip hd2 best cell phone ever). If could I would root my ti-89 titanium.  So I could not resist myself I had to root my KFHD. Its good feeling that the community is there to help expand the horizons of the product you paid money for. That's the main reason I did not go for the ipad 3. There just so much you can do with the android platform.  There were a lot of apps missing from the kindle store so I had to root the KFHD.Performance=====================The KFHD is pretty snappy, fast I would say.  Sometimes scrolling through the carousel it stutters.  But for the majority of time it's really good. The silk browser is a total lag fest.  So just installed the dolphin browser and wow now that's fast.  Smooth scrolling and pinch to zoom in.It takes a few seconds for the YouTube app to load completely. Also Google maps takes a few seconds to locate your position. When I mean a few seconds like 10 seconds or less. I am not sure why this is happening.  After loading everything is fine.I put some movies files avi and they played fine. They played really nice with dice player.N64oid works really good on the kindle fire hd. Mario kart 64 and ps3 controller work beautifully on kindle fire HD.  Gaming overall is great on the kindle fire hd. I was playing dead trigger and I did not see any frame drop and overall enjoyable game. played mass effect infiltrator, asphalt 7 ($.99), shadowgun, and they were running fine. i will try later FPSE see how that goes.Display=======================I like the display colors pop and I like reading a lot on the screen. There is a lot of reflection with sun light so that kind of spoils the fun.  The movies look great on the display no problems here. Also games look really nice on the kindle fire hd. Overall I like the display.Holding volume down + power button at the same time takes a picture of your display.I kind of like the carousel but If could I would want my apps to just show on the main screen like normal android.  I just don't see the point to carousel.  But whatever the case adw launcher ex  is always there.Battery========================The battery last a long time.  I did not mind that they gave us a mini usb cable for the for the kindle fire hd. I used by hd2 charger for the kindle fire it charges fine and fast enough for me.  Why can't customers have the choice to change their own battery? The hp was like this, also the nexus 7.  Why are they copying apple?Sound=================Wow sound is legit on this device. Really loud. Overall really impressed on the sound. Headphone is really good too. Sound is not a problem. 5 stars.  No much to say other than amazon did it right.Camera================Camera is ok , its just whatever.  It nice that it is there. I downloaded from android market camera ics and you can take pictures and videos from the app.  Can control zoom in functions with the apps, also share via Bluetooth, and email via Gmail.Bluetooth================It limited to what it can connect. I could not connected to my ps3 Bluetooth headset.  I could not make it connect to my computer which had a Bluetooth usb.
