So I guess I ll need to find some devices and meeting the requirements of the KFHD7.Ads==========Ads don't bother me, but I wish they were maybe related to what I liked. But If I feel like they are in my way, since I am already rooted then I remove them manually. Was actually really funny I was showing off my kindle fire hd to someone, and as soon as I turned the kindle there was big titanic advertisement as my lock screen picture, so it was really awkward, I was like uhhhh  yeah I don't like titanic.  Maybe some gamer advertisements would be nice. Xbox 360 or ps3 gaming advertisements.Apps that work after rooting=============================Youtube  v4.1.23Gmail  v4.1.2Google earth 7.0.0.7386Google maps v6.12.0Google talkGroove ip liteCamera icsAutocad ws (looked really good on the kindle fire hd) for any engineers out thereDead trigger ( can play now with ps3 controller)Graph 89 free (like having a ti 89 titanium  but with color )Mass effect infiltratorShadow gun ( can play now with ps3 controller)N64oid (nintendo 64 emulator ( can play now with ps3 controller))Sixaxis controller now I can use my ps3 controller with kindle fire hdDice player to watch avi movies.Adw launcher ex works but if you hit home button it reverts back to the carouselAny app you can think of from the android storeOverall===========All I can say is that I like my kindle fire hd.  I really like that I put some physics books, math books, engineering books, carry them all and read on that nice display. I can then use an app like graph 89 and upload ti 89 titanium operating system on app, it kind of replaces my actual ti 89 titanium. I load some games and so far I like playing games with my ps3 controller. i watched rango, true grid, iron man 2, defiance, mission impossible, and all can say is I like the display and the sound. The performance is great but not perfect. Bluetooth left something to be desired. Rooting the device opens a lot of doors.  I would recommend the device; I would rate it over all 4 stars.  You get a free month of amazon prime.  I think I ll get the amazon prime membership was using my brother one.other notes============as jsh1120 pointed out rooting the device does void your warranty unless you can revert (in some cases you can). please research before doing anything. the youtube tutorial is fairly simple to follow, but if you have never rooted a device before this might be challenging.****Rooting the device will NOT kill your amazon prime instant video streaming capabilities******* amazon prime video streaming is working fine after rooting, i am watching my free movies just fine.update 10/6/2012=================i bought a mini hdmi to hdmi, the kindle fire hd looks really good on the tv, it amazing, i was able to play some n64 games with the ps3 controller in the big tv. brought some nostalgia memories.search youtube "kindle fire hd Rooted with google apps" i uploaded this video showing what kindle can do, please note is laggy because i was recording through vnc, and i had no camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: kindlelover83
Reviews.Content: I recieved this as an early birthday present from my husband. I own a K2 and love it for reading. I take it every where with me. I also own an iPad but never hardly use it. I love this Kindle Fire HD so much better than my iPad. It fits so much better in my hands of course, I feel the picture quality is better. ( I have a first generation iPad so this could be why, I am not familiar with the newest version). I would def. recommend this to others! You won't be disappointed. The ads do not bother me in the least. I am ok with the app store. I have an android phone so I don't feel like much is missing. All the biggie apps I use are available. Facebook, Pinterest, Netflix, Hula etc.

Reviews.Title: Lots less glare
Reviews.Author: Marsha "oufootballfan"
Reviews.Content: Hooray! There really is lots less glare with this version of the Fire. I gave my old Fire to my husband because the glare was bothering my eyes. Thankfully, he loves it. The glare is also better than on my IPad 2. And "yes" I am we'll aware that you can adjust the brightness on all of these items.There is lots more to like about this device, but others are covering it well.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Vivian Barnett
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the upgrades to Kindle Fire HD, especially with the dolby sound, bluetooth and HDMI out.  The few things I'm not thrilled about are bearable.  The HDMI plugs should not have been placed on the bottom but on the side opposite the on/off button.  That way I can charge and watch my movies with the case open or closed.  I ordered a swivel stand which allows me to work around this.  The internet connection may stop working at any time (while there is still a connection through my other devices) and it begins rebooting.  Once the volume would not turn down until I pressed the button and turned it off and on.  Some of the apps freeze, shut down and react strangely so I don't know if it's the device or the app.  (The same apps worked fine on the last Kindle).  I'm hopeful that eventually there will be OS upgrade that will eliminate the strange behavior.  Overall, I am pleased with my new Kindle Fire HD and I don't leave home without it.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE My Fire HD!!
Reviews.Author: Alz
Reviews.Content: I got my Fire HD less than a week ago and I'm already super happy I bought it. I would like to point out that you can go to YouTube on the Fire HD. Reading e-books on the Fire HD is wonderful. They also do have a lot of free apps and games. The sound is amazing and loud. The graphics are beautiful. And I did figure out a way to take pics with it, unlike what some reviewers were saying (they said you weren't able to take pics). All in all, this is a VERY good deal for the money and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a nice tablet. Just look for photo apps. I downloaded a photo app that allowed me to take pics with the app. That is how you take pictures with the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Device, Excellent Price!
Reviews.Author: Jill "Jill"
Reviews.Content: When you open the black, Kindle shipping box, you see sleek, beautiful perfection!An owner of the original Fire, I'm perfectly happy with it. I wondered what they could improve, at the $199  price point, that would be significant enough for me to care. WELL. . . . it turns out, quite a lot!  I'm not going to talk about any of the "tech specs" because hundreds have spoken of that already and you can read their reviews.The HD, screen size, duel speakers, lovely glass and  beveled sides, give the device a really luxurious feel.It feels almost like a small version of the iPad.I have a pretty extensive library of books (I think over 3,000) and a few apps, so when I turned it on, it took a while to load up everything and I thought something was wrong. Also I think initially the Special Offers took a bit to load, now it's VERY fast, smooth and responsive.  It seems to be more sensitive than the original.  I'm a long time Apple fan and have both iPad1 and iPad3. The touch sensitivity seems the same to me between iPad and the KFHD.  I like to use a stylus and I found that when flipping through the carousel the finger worked better, because using the stylus, it would open books that I wasn't trying to open.  With practice, I don't see that as being a problem, it's just a lighter touch than the original Fire.I like the special offers.  At first I was annoyed with the "similar to titles you purchased" items at the bottom of the carousel, but then decided I liked it, I have discovered many new book/authors from this feature in the Amazon store, so I've decided that it's a good thing!Kindle Fire HD, exceeded my expectations and I've very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet if you are a casual user
Reviews.Author: Eric D
Reviews.Content: I just got the kindle fire hd for fun really. I have a new ipad I use for productivity and studying, so I meant this to be a smaller way to read news and books, watch videos, play games, and browse the web. I find that it has performed admirably for everything I wanted to use it for.Pros:The screen is great quality, even next to my retina ipad. I actually feel like the viewing angles might be slightly better on the kindle fire hd.The device is thin and has a very good build quality. Very easy to hold with one hand.It is easy to get and consume content (of course, since this IS what amazon designed it for).Great battery life, great wifi reception/speeds, ease of use and setup.Cons:Side bezels are too wide in portrait mode, makes typing a little awkward.Silk browser is relatively slow compared to other mobile browsers. Apparently this device doesn't support flash, but I couldn't care less since flash is a dying platform and I'm used to it with my apple devices anyway.Number of apps is extremely limited when compared to full android play store and apple app store. However, general quality of apps is good.Overall, I am enjoying this device. Power users who want a great 7 inch tablet would be wise to get a Google nexus 7. But people who want something of good quality that is easy to use and great for reading, browsing, playing games and watching videos will really enjoy the new kindle fire hd. I actually typed this whole review on my new kindle fire!

Reviews.Title: First Time Kindle Owner and A Techie Cavewoman
Reviews.Author: A. Rose
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have never owned a Kindle before.  I don't own a tablet or a smart phone either.  Why?  Because I love, love, love paper and ink books and because a laptop is sufficient enough to supply with everything and more than a tablet or phone can do.  So, why did I buy this?  Free and cheap Kindle books, mostly for testing purposes.  I'm obsessed with indie and self pub authors, but there are so many bad ones that I like to try them out before splurging on the paperbacks.  Now that you know why I bought it, here's what I think of it: it's pretty freaking incredible.Maybe I'm just speaking from lack of experience, but I almost felt like this product brought me into the tech revolution a bit.  Within fifteen minutes of opening it, I started a free Prime movie and the color and sound were great.  It was not nearly as distracting to watch on such a small screen as I had expected.  I then tried out some music and while it's not as good as my Bose, it's pretty great for such a small device.  The Kindle books look beautiful and the touch screen is very responsive and easy to use.  I also managed to get a hold of a free Tetris app and then was informed by Amazon that I now had a dollar credit for an MP3 just for downloading it.  That was pretty amazing, so I decided to try out the shopping experience.  I, personally, do not shop for books, movies, or music anywhere but on Amazon so having a closed system to me is awesome.  They make it so easy to buy stuff.  That might seem like a negative to some, but I love not having to put my credit card in.  I love getting my product in seconds and without hassle.  And the ads ... what ads?  I don't see why so many of the other reviewers are complaining.  They're barely there.  Basically, when you leave it idle or turn it on there's a tiny, brief flash of ad.  That's it.  And if they're referring to the carousel at the bottom that shows books and movies and music, then I'm going to have to thoroughly disagree.  I don't see those as ads, but as suggestions.  They're not invasive and I find them very helpful.  I might sound like I'm gushing or that Amazon paid me to do this review, but I just want to be honest about it.Now, the bad part.  When I got my Kindle, packaged very beautifully in a black box, I saw immediately that I unfortunately received one with a screen defect.  There were some striations of color and what looked like a pressure thumb print that were obscuring the back light.  I called Amazon immediately and was disappointed to get someone from India.  I'm going to write Amazon a letter about having American call centers.  That's a huge problem for me and it really deserves to knock this review down a star.  If I wasn't so pleased with the resolution, then they would've have quite the badger on their hands.  They readied a new Kindle as soon as there was stock and I'm scheduled to get it tomorrow (I received the original on Friday).  I don't have to send back the damaged one until I get the new one which is awesome because I might've had a fit.In short: it's great, it's easy, it's for people who like to shop on Amazon, and the price is good for what it is

Reviews.Title: If you liked the Original Fire, You're gonna LOVE this.
Reviews.Author: M. guimond
Reviews.Content: I have had my fair share of tablets. Ive had the Hp Touchpad, Ipad 2, Motorola xoom, and the original kindle fire. Oddly enough I always preferred the Kindle fire to all the other tablets I had previously owned. The interface was simple and clean, Amazon's content was spectactular, and of course the $199 price. Well I am pleased to say that fire HD is so much better than the original fire. The design is more modern and attractive, easy to hold in your hands, feels very sturdy(something typical $199 tablets dont feel like). The new Fire HD has the best screen I have seen on any tablet display( minus the "Retina Display" on the Ipad3) On the original Fire's display the app icons were fuzzy and small, not anymore. The Icons are sharp, clear, and dare I say attractive? The new screen is BEAUTIFUL! Scrolling thru the main menu is so much faster, I have yet to experiance any lag during playing around. The original Fire was incredibly "laggy" but Im pleased to say that appears to be gone. Watching Movies on this thing is actually better than what I was hoping for. Images are clear, the new Dolby Stereo speakers are Excellent! Best sound ive heard come out of a tablet (and yes, better than Ipad). It honestly amazes me how they kept this thing still at $199. Which brings me to my next point, Ads. Alot of people have been complaining that amazon failed to mention that there will be Ads on the lockscreen on the device. While that is bound to irritate some, I find it to be helpful. Theres 2 specific ads that nobody should have a problem with. Theres one for a $5 amazon MP3 credit and one for $5 to spend in the amazon instant video store. What is so bad about that? Who doesnt want to get essentially free credits? I have yet to find the ads to be intrusive. The only place youll notice it is on the lockscreen and the adds can be anything from those free amazon credits to the lorax movie poster, to a new book coming out. I dont have a problem with them at all (like i said, theres options for free amazon credits) BUT for those who are really against ads amazon has given customers the option to opt out of the ads for $15. The only real complaint I have and to me its a pretty big one, THERES NO CHARGER! really amazon? you're gonna send me this lovely new tablet without a charger? Smart. Now there is a USB cord that will charge the device if u plug it into a computer/laptop but they didnt supply the power outlet adaptor. Since I had my old Ipad charger Ive just been putting the Fire HD usb cord into the Ipad power adaptor..seems to be working just fine. So if you do have power adaptors (and most ppl do since they are very common with smartphones) then u will be allset. It just baffles me that they didnt include a charger. Other than that it really is a great device. Its a BIG BIG improvement over the original kindle fire and the fact that its still $199 is amazing. Dont hesitate to upgrade or switch, you will love it.UPDATE: I just wanted to add that I have plugged the old kindle fire charger into the Fire HD and its working. So for anyone looking to upgrade your old charger will work

Reviews.Title: First Fire...not sure I want to keep it
Reviews.Author: RackOnInNC "RackInInNC"
Reviews.Content: Let me begin this by saying that I used to be an "early adopter".  I had to have it when it first came out.  I've stopped doing that, but in this case I wish I had bought the first Fire.  From using a friend's I was excited when they finally announced the second gen devices.  The original was simple to use and did most things I wanted it to.  This one is incredibly hard to figure out, even with years of techy experience and is more limited in its use.PROS -Feels solid and well built.Anti-glare screen is nice, and the screen is vibrant.  It's not Retina, but then it didn't cost like one so I'm OK with that.Some have reported it being slow and unresponsive, but I haven't had much of a problem except when in apps I know have problems from them doing the same to my phone.  Videos streamed from Amazon look really good.Book reading is surprisingly good for a backlit screen.  Page turns are quick and although they lack the book like "charm" of the Kindle reader page turns it is an acceptable substitute.Screen brightness is good and you can see the screen pretty well outdoors.  I have turned off automatic screen brightness though.  I find the values it chooses too bright in most cases and have mine set slightly less than 50%.CONS -No AC adapter included.  Would that have really been that much of a stretch to include?No flash support.  UPDATE: Well...no official flash support.  Thanks to the comment from TomT below I was able to install both flash and my preferred browser (Dolphin) in a few minutes.  Google Flash 11.1 apk and follow the xda developer links...will walk you right through it.  Now if I can get Google Voice working so I can use sonar I'll be a happy camper.  Have added a star since it was this easy.  That still doesn't negate the fact that it should have been included in the first place with so many sites still using Flash.The charge and HDMI ports are on the long edge rather than the short as is on my other Kindles (and the original Fire I believe).  When you want to do HDMI out to a TV you can only turn it one way if you want to tilt it up which may, depending on the case you buy,  totally defeat the stand in the case.  In the case of the Marware leather rotating case you can't close the case when charging because the ports are to the inside.Volume and On-Off buttons are flush with the case and almost impossible to find by feel.  Since the only visual cue for which way you are holding it is the camera lens this makes it difficult in a darkened room.No GPS.  This isn't a deal breaker, but would have been nice.  I suppose they thought since it needs wireless people wouldn't use it like that, but I could always turn on my phone's Mobile Hotspot to use Google maps IF I had a GPS.The ads.  I own other Kindles and have never felt the need to turn them off.  They were unobtrusive and didn't really affect my use of the device.  I even went for them occasionally.  The ones on the new Kindle are ridiculous.  Everywhere you turn they are in your face just waiting for an errant touch to purchase something you don't mean to and taking up screen space. People who care for children or the elderly should be extra vigilant for unintended purchases.Lack of many apps in the app store that I use daily on my Android phone and would use on the Kindle if they were there.  It's clear Amazon doesn't want to take any chances that you might stream something online that doesn't belong to them.  No TNT app, no USA app, no CW app.  I assume the others that I don't use like HBO and Showtime aren't there either?  No support for PowerDVD Remote and PowerDVD Mobile which would allow me to stream my own personal videos from my network rather than having to either upload them to the cloud or onto the device.  Can't access my Dropbox either.  I use my phone as a remote constantly when streaming from my HTPC to my TV and I was hoping I could use the Kindle that way too.Apps that work perfectly well on my phone throw error after error on the Kindle's "special" version. Examples: Words with Friends, no paid version and ads lock up the device.  Tweetcaster constantly throws the 350 connections per hour message and I am not a heavy user.  It throws this one when all I do is check it once in a while and have it set on manual refresh.  I ended up in Twitter Jail the first night I had the Kindle and I didn't tweet a single thing!  Never had this happen on my phone.Every app you download results in a "purchase" email from Amazon...even the free ones.  I have an avalanche of them in my inbox just from setting it up.  (Yes, I know this happens for phones as well.  I make the comment to point it out to those that don't know.  Amazon should have a better way worked out to handle this by now and since Kindle is part of their proprietary environment and since Kindle is a part of that this is part of owning one.)The Carousel? I hate it.  Everything goes on it as soon as you load or use it even if you don't want it to.  There may be a way to fine tune this, but if there is I haven't found it yet. I put a few favorite songs on the device for when I'm not near wireless and it showed each individual song on the Carousel. The UI is cluttered and as far as I can see there is no way to alter it to better serve your personal needs.  No way to clear the Carousel either.  You have to remove items one by one.  (If anyone knows how to change this please do let me know.)The main screen is obviously front loaded to get you to buy stuff..with the few things things that get around the spoon feeding of ads and buying stuff all the way to the right like photos and web.UPDATE:  I had not attempted to use the camera.  There is no software included to make use of the camera.  The User guide says you can download Skype and that it MAY work with other apps in the store, but there is no way to use it without downloading something and experimentation to see what apps might work with it.  Why include the camera if they aren't going to give you something to help use it?No alarm clock app included.  Now I know there are apps that will do this, but it's pretty much a basic inclusion on most mobile devices these days.Haven't decided if I will return or wait and hope Amazon offers some software updates that make it more acceptable.  It's a brilliant hardware upgrade hogtied by Amazon's watered-down version of Android and the lack of basic apps like camera/alarm that we have all come to expect.  I haven't tested the HDMI out yet, since my micro-HDMI cable hasn't arrived yet.  Will update this review next week when I get that.

Reviews.Title: Everything and More
Reviews.Author: throwstar24
Reviews.Content: The sound is AMAZING. The picture is AMAZING.  My boyfriend is on the road a lot and we both need things to pass the time.  The Kindle is perfect for when I'm waiting for his jobs to finish up.  A lot of times I can find wifi around the area and watch movies, or play games.  Some games don't need wifi.  We've sat out on the patio and watched movies, listened to music, and just relaxed.  The different settings on the kindle are very easy to access and I'm terrible with technology so that's saying something.  My nieces and nephews all want one now instead of the iPad.  My boyfriend wants one for the road for his job so that he can easier access the internet, his job calendar, his email, his contacts, etc.  It's perfect for business work and for leisure.  The overall structure is very good.  I bought the $3.99 CaseCrown Bold Standby Case in Black and it protects it perfectly.If you're deciding between the 7in and the bigger size then I would say you'd probably have no problem with the 7 in screen.  I think it's the perfect size and I've watched movies with the kids and my boyfriend plenty of times on this.  I can't stress enough how great the sound is.  Everybody was blown away by it.Basically this is the tablet for just about anybody.  The Kindle Fire HD has great sound, unlimited functionality, and great picture.  I would recommend this to anybody except little kids for the main reason that little kids don't need items like tablets or smart phones etc. HOWEVER, if you want to download the kids apps they sell special cases for those as well.  I downloaded netflix and I watch plenty of movies with the kids and there are plenty of games to keep their little minds busy.Hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: HATED IT!
Reviews.Author: trueworship
Reviews.Content: ATTENTION PARENTS!!  We received a REFURBISHED Kindle Fire because our older Kindle screen froze.  We were told that "the Kindle has been tested and is in working condition."  Not thinking this to be a big deal, we ordered the refurb'd Kindle and subscribed to the attractive FreeTime subscription through Amazon.  As some of you know, they promote this as an ad-free zone and the content is "age appropriate".Well, about a day later, a PORNOGRAPHIC book with the word "SEX" in the title appeared in my 6 year old son's FreeTime profile.  My SON, not my profile.  It was WITHIN the FreeTime app!  It was somehow not cleaned off of the device from the previous owner.  Not only was it on the device, it was somehow appearing in the FreeTime app!!!  A HUGE programming mistake on Amazon's part.If it could happen to me, it could happen to you.  Make SURE you do not get a refurbished Kindle if you are planning to subscribe your children's young and impressionable minds to Amazon's FreeTime service.After I called and vehemently complained, a rep walked me through deregistering my Kindle and reregistering it.  Guess what, the erotic book was still on the device.  There was no way I could have downloaded it while I was on the phone with the rep.  The only thing they offered to do was to send out another refurbished Kindle, so that the same problem could occur again.No, thank you!  Stay away from the refurbished Kindle.  Especially if you don't want your son to see the type of picture that was in my son's Kindle!  I am only giving this one star because I had to give it a star!

Reviews.Title: And How Am I To Charge This, We Asked????
Reviews.Author: Ramona
Reviews.Content: As with most electronic devices (jphones, iPad, etc), the device usually comes with a charger to plug into the wall.  Granted with phones and such you have to purchase car chargers but for the house charger, it's in the box.  Like directions, they too are in the box.  Well not so with the nice new Kindle Fire HD, no charger, no directions!  I purchased this for my 80 year old mother in law because she will be starting kidney dialysis soon and I we thought it would be nice for her to be able to read books, play games or watch movies during the 3-4 hour treatments.  When she opened it up with no charger and no directions, well let's just say I didn't gain any stars  with her.Seriously Kindle, you can't even give people a house charger when they purchase a higher cost electronic device like this?

Reviews.Title: Shame shame!
Reviews.Author: robin
Reviews.Content: Got this product for Christmas had it exactly one month and was having problems with the charging port..I have read so many complaints about this issue but they keep selling this product...why?  It is a great product if they would only address this major issue.  What good is it if we can not get it to charge.  Seems to me there should be a huge recall to fix this problem..buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire VS Ipad
Reviews.Author: Britnee Koszola
Reviews.Content: I was looking into buying an ipad, but once I read about the Kindle fire and discovered it was about 200 dollars cheaper I went with the Kindle. I love this product! I have had it for over a month and I do not even use my computer anymore! It is just as good as an Ipad and you are saving so much money! People just buy Ipads for the name, do not let the "brand" of this keep you from buying it!!

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Ashley Inge
Reviews.Content: I think the Kindle Fire HD 7" is a great gift item for just about everyone on your list.  This time around I bought it for my husband, whom I could never keep him off of mine.  He loves it and with him working on the road alot, it has come in super handy for lots of different things!!

Reviews.Title: Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: Catheter "animal lover"
Reviews.Content: So far, I am loving this device.  It is my third Kindle, and my first Kindle Fire HD.  I like having the ability to keep up with my book (and change the screen back light from white, sepia and black, plus font size), and switch over to check e-mail or Facebook, or check something on the Web.  I have watched one Netflix film so far and the picture was very sharp, and the sound was great.  It's an amazing little device, and the only thing I do regret is that the battery doesn't hold it's charge very long, HOWEVER, for all that this device does, I don't mind keeping it plugged into charge every night.

Reviews.Title: Nothing But Problems
Reviews.Author: Sleven Kelevra
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd new Kindle Fire HD in 8 months.  The first one I had, the left speaker went out.  I guess this is a somewhat common problem.  Customer service was EXCELLENT!!!  They quickly replaced it with a new one.  The second one I couldn't even get through the registration process because the screen would either freeze up on me, or these weird lines (which looked like a bar code at times) would gradually appear on the screen and cover 80% of it.  Again, customer service was EXCELLENT!!!  They quickly replaced it with a new one.  The third one has MANY problems.  It would suddenly start downloading apps that were already downloaded.  Sometimes this would happen while I was using the same app, causing it to close down.  Sometimes 2 apps would mysteriously start downloading.  Videos would say they were loading, but then it would just sit there and never play.  Downloaded apps would suddenly disappear and I would have to download them again.  Videos would start playing, then stop and my carousel would appear.  The screen would freeze up.  Just too many problems.  When I called customer service, we went through all the trouble shooting as usual with no success including deregistering and reregistering.  To their credit, they offered to send out a 4th new one, but at this point, I don't have ANY faith in this product.  I would say I use the Kindle less than an hour a day.  They've never been dropped, spilled on, sat in direct sunlight, or anything else that would have caused these things to happen.  I know other people have Kindles that work great, but mine did not.  I'm returning this Kindle Fire HD for a refund and not looking back.  Time to invest in a more reliable tablet.  Sorry Kindle and Amazon, but thanks for the GREAT customer service.9/27/2013 UPDATE - Well it seems like the usual confusion with big companies.  If you've read up above, you know about all the problems I had.  When I contacted Kindle customer service, they ultimately offered me an 80% refund.  When I called back to accept (after giving it some thought), I was told by a different agent that Amazon will not accept returns or offer ANY kind of refund on the Kindle Fire HD after the initial 30 days of the ORIGINAL purchase.  As you can imagine, I was not happy to hear this, so my only option was to have them ship me a 4th Kindle Fire HD.  After hanging up the phone, I was checking my e-mail and was surprised to get an e-mail from Amazon asking me "Did I solve your problem?"  I clicked on the "NO" link and was asked to provide details.  This is what I sent. - "I am VERY disappointed with the return policy for the Kindle Fire HD.  There needs to be a REASONABLE exception to the 30 day return policy, especially for instances like mine where I keep having problems with the replacements as well.  I have had 3 new Kindle Fire HDs in 8 months, all with different problems.  On August 27, 2013, I was told by agent Melicia W. that because of all the problems I was experiencing, I would be able to return my latest Kindle Fire HD for a pro-rated return of around 80% of the original purchase price.  When I opted to take this option after thinking about it for a couple weeks, I was told I could only get a refund after the 5th replacement.  I think that's absolutely ABSURD that you would make a paying customer go through a total of SIX defective Kindle Fire HDs before offering to refund their money.  Obviously I want a working tablet, so I'm having a 4th Kindle Fire HD sent out.  I can hardly wait to see what problems I will have with this third replacement.  This product should not have so many problems, and if it does, a simple refund would be appropriate.Unhappy and fairly disgustedWithin minutes, I received another e-mail from customer service asking me to call in to speak with one of their agents so they could issue me a refund.  What???  I was just told they don't issue refunds after 30 days.  Seems like someone else agreed that making a paying customer go through 6 defective Kindles is a bit excessive.  Each Kindle Fire HD I had came with a completely different problem.  To my amazement, I provided a few details and the FULL REFUND was in my bank account the next day.  EXCELLENT customer service and the right thing to do.With my experience, I would never purchase another Kindle Fire HD.  I think they need to revamp the entire tablet, even though I know most people had a positive experience.  With that being said, I just saw the all new Kindle Fire HDX tablets.  I am considering the 8.9" version.  From what I can tell, they have totally revamped these tablets.  If I decide to purchase one, I know what you might be thinking, but at the very least, I know I will get EXCELLENT customer service.  Thank you Amazon and thank you Jeff Bezos...

Reviews.Title: Amazing Reader
Reviews.Author: Geegaw
Reviews.Content: Moved up from a Kindle Paperwite.  Both amazing readers but the KindleFire HD offers so much more.  Never thought I would want a reader as I love books.  Kindle convinced me otherwise.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Patricia Kenworthy
Reviews.Content: I've had one of every Kindle so far.  They just keep getting better and better.  I was delighted to see that you can make the background black with white letters for reading at night.  It's easier on the eyes

Reviews.Title: Kindle lover
Reviews.Author: Cariann4title Mobayed
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle and it's very easy to use and I can take it anywhere so it helps provide my kids with entertainment. But the thing I like most was the amazons customer service the are awsome and go beyond the call when I need help

Reviews.Title: A Hot Disappointment
Reviews.Author: P. Stahl "PJS"
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and looking at other websites which warned about bugs in the Kindle Fire HD 7 I took a chance. It's my first Kindle and I thought it would be great for using at work on break and on vacation. I like the size, I like the HD, I like the sound but I find it very unresponsive, which is very frustrating. I touch an icon and for example instead of taking me to Amazon, it takes me to settings page for facebook. I try to type in facebook and it sends the message before I'm even done. If I hadn't gone past the return date I would return it. Those are only a few examples of problems I see with this Kindle. I clik on email, it does nothing, I clik on facebook it does nothing. I have to keep turning it on and off. Not happy.

Reviews.Title: Kid-Friendly
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of research on the best tablets for kids.  The Kindle Fire is by far the best product available.  Please research kindle free time.  It is absolutely wonderful.  It allows me to set time limits for games, video, and reading (although I always leave reading at unlimited).  It also blocks children from using the internet, camera, and any other apps that you do not want them to be unsupervised in.  Free time gives age appropriate games, videos, and book options to the children without me having to load them as well.  I could go on and on about how wonderful this is for kids!  If you are looking for a good tablet that is also suitable for children, this should be your #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: PROS & CONS
Reviews.Author: lns500
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire HD in May as a birthday present, and I LOVE it. I would recommend it highly, with the caveat that 'buyer beware' of what I see as a few (admittedly minor) problems:CONS:1) FORGET ANY IDEA OF READING OUTSIDE!  I guessed that it would be impossible to watch movies outside because of the glare, and of course I was right, but didn't mind. But what I did mind was how impossible it is to actually use the Kindle for reading at the beach. There is just too much glare, no matter how much you adjust the settings. Soooo, don't get this as a 'reader' if you plan on using it outside to read. It's not gonna happen....2) Ridiculous though this sounds, it is really difficult to find the volume control! I am not the only reviewer to have mentioned this. I read this criticism before getting my Kindle, and thought; 'what's WRONG with these people?! How hard can it be to find a volume control?!'  The joke was on me, however, as nearly ever time I go to change the volume, I'm farting around looking for it, as it's so well hidden, and you have to sort of 'aim' your fingers just right to make it function properly. (I know; this sounds ridiculous, doesn't it...but it can't just be 'me', as so many others have cited this, too).3) Before you adjust the volume, you have to 'unlock' the screen. In fact, the screen 'locks' CONSTANTLY. You have to continually 'swipe' at the screen to unlock it, and as far as I can see, there's no way to change the settings on the screen lock.4) ADS! I don't really mind that there's ads every time you have to unlock the Kindle (which as I just mentioned, is constantly) but what I DO mind are the video or audio ads, which suddenly 'blast'. This can be embarrassing if you're using your Kindle on public transport, or secretly playing scrabble on it in a meeting at work ;)  Joking aside, I think it's really intrusive to have video/audio ads blasting out when you unlock your Kindle, and unlike YouTube, you can't 'skip ad after three seconds'.  "Oh, just turn the volume down" you cry. Well....see #2!5) BE PREPARED TO DEFAULT TO FACTORY SETTINGS AFTER A COUPLE OF MONTHS! I know three other people with Kindle Fire HDs, and ALL of us have had the same experience; after the first two weeks, the factory applications (camera, etc) stopped functioning, and we had to default to factory settings to make them work again (the result being that we lost anything 'saved' on our Kindle if it wasn't also saved on the Cloud).  The good news is that, since then, none of us have had any problems with applications, so perhaps it's a teething problem with new Kindle Fires or something.PROS:1) MUSIC! It supports Pandora, Spotify, Tune-In, etc, etc, and the sound quality (Dolby, right?) is AMAZING. Better still, plug it into speakers, and it functions as a wonderful music player.2) MOVIES! Movie quality is FANTASTIC. I didn't think I could get into watching movies or TV on a screen that small, yet it's perfect for taking to bed to watch telly. I don't have cable hooked up in every room in my house, so it's great to be able to download shows and movies onto the Kindle to watch in rooms besides my living room.3) GAMES! This is a great little toy for playing all your favorite games (mine is WordFeud), and Amazon offers tons of free game aps in the Ap Store on the Kindle.4) Power lasts...for-EVER! I had been so used to charging up my Android phone every five minutes that it came as something of a shock to discover just how long the power lasts on the Kindle Fire H.D.  I'm talking DAYS and DAYS. Yes, DAYS! Even if you're playing music or watching movies constantly, you can expect a good 48 - 72 hrs before the power runs out, and even then, it charges so quickly (an hour or two) that the whole 'power' issue ISN'T an issue.So, overall, although there are a few 'cons' (the biggest being that you can't use it to read outdoors, which is a shame, but hey, summer is almost at an end), this is a GREAT little tool for the price, and I am very happy with my easy-to-use and no-nonsense digital companion. :)

Reviews.Title: Beware Of The Faulty Charging Port
Reviews.Author: xx12
Reviews.Content: All in all, the tablet was a reasonable price and it did what we wanted it to do.  However, within a year, the tablet lost its ability to charge.  We contacted Amazon who replaced the tablet.  Then, within 6 months, the replacement tablet also lost its ability to charge.  Amazon refused to replace it this time, claiming that it was beyond warranty and even admitting they knew it was a design flaw.  I attempted to get it repaired elsewhere, but this repair did not last more than a few weeks.  Now I have a tablet I cannot charge with all of my non-transferable books/games on it.  Amazon offered me a discounted price on a new one, but I'm not sure why I would waste the money considering I know it will crap out on me within a year.  Bottom line- avoid it.Update 2/18/14:  My other son received a separate kindle for his birthday this past summer (not from me!)  It finally crapped out this last week.  Same issue- wouldn't hold a charge.  Amazon is replacing it, but I imagine I will be left with the same issue in 6 months.It's really sad that Amazon is not owning up to this blatant design flaw.  Class action anyone??AVOID IT!

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet for what I need.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Flood
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet to actually replace our first gen iPad.  I wanted to take advantage of the Kindle Lender Library and the camera for use with Skype.  The Kindle Fire HD 7" is much smaller and lighter than our iPad, so holding it is a breeze.  I have had a few times where apps would stop responding, and the keyboard does not respond with the same speed and precision as my iPad.  I would have given the Kindle 5 stars, but the batter is very lacking.  I have done all the battery saving tips on the Kindle FAQ's, but the battery just doesn't cut the mustard compared to the iPad.  I use my Kindle for book reading primarily, and through reading and idle time, I have to recharge my battery every day and a half.  I miss the 4-5 day battery charge on my iPad.  All and all I am happy with the Kindle Fire HD 7".  I don't regret selling our iPad, but I do miss the battery life from my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Marian K. Graham
Reviews.Content: I love the fire HD, one suggestion would be to either include the rapid charger or make a list of suggested "also purchase" items.  You really need the charger, to charge by computer from 0% to full takes 13 hours and your computer cannot go into "sleep" mode while charging.To Kindle:  Get a flash player download!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worth $15 to go ad-free, amazing sound quality
Reviews.Author: Seta
Reviews.Content: I have been toying with the idea of purchasing the Kindle Fire HD 7" for a while, and what helped me make the decision was the customer reviews and this professional review:"The Fire HD's speakers are the most ear-bleedingly awesome tablet speakers you've ever heard" -- CNETThe sound quality is amazing.This is my second Kindle. My first, a Fire--which I still own-- was a gift which stayed in the box for almost a year before I started using it. Once I started using it, I fell in love with it and used it daily in many ways.I spent the $15 to go ad-free. Some people complained about this charge, but I felt is it worth paying. I calculated  how many times I would be using my Kindle Fire HD 7" based on how much I use my other Kindle. I divided that number into $15.00, to get a cost-per-use figure. For fractions of a cent, I am free of ads on the lock screen.

Reviews.Title: not what i expectedi
Reviews.Author: Karen Leone
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle fire hd five months ago. For the first three months it was good. My kindle gets out of synch every day which messes up the keyboard. I as able to view youtube before. They updated their browser and now I can't. My kindle freezes up. You can only get apps through amazon unless you want to roor.t it and negate the warranty. You also have ads on it unless you want to pay 15 dollars more. it's no more than a basic reader now. That's not what I bought it for..

Reviews.Title: Problem with where power plus into kindle
Reviews.Author: dissappointed
Reviews.Content: How the power plug on the unit is more external rather than internal if you knock it accidentally it causes the unit to have a problem charging.  I have had two kindles and had the same problem with both.  It usually happens around 6 months.  I do not have kids nor toss the unit around this happens while I use it when it is charging.  I finally had enough I know have an I-pad mini and have no problems.  I did like my kindle, but tired of ever 6 months having to fight with customer service to get a replacement and losing all stuff on the unit.  Just be careful. I also took it to the geek squad and they said it would cost more to fix than just replace.

Reviews.Title: great cheap solution tablet
Reviews.Author: Janssen R. Eilenberger "rayssen05"
Reviews.Content: when I first bought my kindle I loved it. I was torn between getting a ipad vs the fire and was thrilled with my choice, until it started going out before it was even a yr old! and I get for the price it wont last forever but I probably used it less than 36 hours and only for reading and occasionally checking email or facebook. Screen completely went out and froze then just never came back on. I was planning on buying one for my grandmother and mother for Christmas and glad i waited now!!! For as little time as i used it and never ever dropped or left out of a case this thing should have gone at least to a year!

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Matthews
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad but wanted a smaller tablet to carry in my purse...without payer the higher price for the iPad Mini.  The Amazon Kindle Fire HD is perfect.  Two problems for me are the turn on - turn off buttons.  They are nearly hidden and very hard to find.  Secondly, I am a Mac person, so I was directed to load a couple of programs on my computer so that I could sync the Kindle with my computer.  I soon found out that it wasn't necessary.  I use my Kindle for reading, mostly.  I also purchased the same tablet for my 9 year old grandson for a Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Small Size but Packs a Big Punch
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I already have a Samsung Galaxy Tab 8.9in but was looking for something a little smaller to carry around in my bag (without having to carry a tote with me). Was hesitant about forking out the money just to buy a smaller 'version' of the tablet but then saw the Kindle Fire HD on sale.  I debated a little and then went for it.  The Kindle came several days in advance of the estimated delivery date.  It took me a little while to figure out how it worked because the box came with the Kindle, a USB cable and a little card with a few arrows pointing out the power button and the volume...and nothing else.  It took me a few minutes to find a free Kindle book about how to use it, read it in about 20 minutes and I was back in business. I was amazing at how such a small device could deliver such performance. I'm not really a gamer so I can't comment on that but I've downloaded books, music and music videos to it and the clarity is unreal.  I was able to import my Outlook calendar into it (via Google calendar) to keep track of my appointments and the compact size literally allows me to take it with me everywhere. Fits in my smaller purse without hogging all the space, but don't forget to turn down the dual speakers when in public because the sound is incredible.  I am so glad I bought this because it's not just a small tablet, its in a class by itself.  I highly recommend the $44 Amazon slim case because you get all the protection without the bulk and read the blogs and forums out there on how to do what.  There are people out there that have already figured out the tricks of the Kindle trade and their advice is invaluable - Thank you to all you anonymous posters out there!  If you're waffling on buying this Kindle - just do it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: It does everything it promised to do.
Reviews.Author: Sevim Geraibeyli
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD is for those of us who do not need a small version of a laptop. It is all a matter of priorities - what comes first - an e-reader and some browsing and videos as a bonus or the other way around. I am a reader and I am completely satisfied with the quality of the product and Amazon/Kindle environment.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended even for little ones
Reviews.Author: Ace262632
Reviews.Content: Compared to most kid tablets, the kid and toddler options and parental controls are great.  The only thing you cannot do is control the volume.  Tried a few "volume control" apps but they still do not override it.  Otherwise I feel like it is a great useful teaching tool with the large amount of free learning apps.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problems.
Reviews.Author: Jolene Bell
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but trouble with the Kindles. This is my fourth one through returns due to battery problems. It shuts off automatically when you are using it and the battery stinks. I had just replaced it for the last time (I give up) and They had told me to charge it for 4 to 5 hours. After 5 hours it was still only charged to 36%.  While the people who assist you are sweet and prompt, In my opinion the product itself is a pain and a waste of money. I will not buy another one.

Reviews.Title: A Great Product
Reviews.Author: Richard Hildreth
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD for over a month now. The screen display is great and especially the sound. I have all of my favorite apps and about 10 books on board. I also have another 200 or so books on cloud storage. I have my music on cloud storage too. Most of the time I have wifi access, so when I want to listen to music it is convenient just to connect wirelessly to the internet and enjoy it. Speaking of the internet, the device connects very fast and brousing is fast as well. I have noticed in some reviews that some a few cons with the device. For instance, the power button is difficult to find. But, reviews of the previous Fire model suggested that people were turning it off too easily by accident. That problem has been addressed with the current design. Also, I believe that it has been developed to be used with a magnetic cover. The Amazon cover is a little pricy, but I purchased an alternative one that works very nice. When I close the cover the device automatically goes into sleep mode and wakes up upon opening. This eliminates any need for the power button and also really conserves battery life. And, a lot of people have complained about the battery. First, I turned off the automatic screen brightness so that I can control it manually. In "automatic", the screen is much more bright than necessary and really burns the juice. Also, make sure the wifi is off when not in use. Also, I think a lot of those who purchase a Kindle Fire are Kindle users. Kindles utilize E-ink technology. Those devices only use current with a page change. On the other hand, the Kindle Fires use LCD displays which uses power on a continual basis. Therefor,they require charging much more often than every 4 to 6 wks. For a tablet device, the Kindle Fire does pretty good between charges. It will last me throughout the day with considerable usage and I plug it in every night and have a full charge in the morning. Another negative I have noted is the lack of a charger. For the price and the quality of the device, I have no complaint with the lack of a charger. One can purchase a charger for a very reasonable price. I, like many individuals, have owned a number of electronic devices and have more than one 5 volt adapter laying around. Mine works great for my Kindle Fire. So, as you can see, this is a great device. Any negatives you might have in purchasing one are easily understood and addressed. Most negative reviews are the exception. It is a great multi media device with games, books, video, and educational apps. You will not regret your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Addicted
Reviews.Author: Linda Lamb
Reviews.Content: I had a cheaper version of a tablet that I used to check my facebook throughout the day. I was not able to check my email frequently because it wouldn't load and many games were unavailable to me. When I got the Kindle Fire, I was amazed at the speed and all that I can do with it. I will never buy another brand. I tend to be on my tablet 100% more than I ever was. I am completely addicted.

Reviews.Title: A very nice tablet, but ...
Reviews.Author: Westlake
Reviews.Content: This was my second Kindle product.  I liked it very much the moment I received it.  Everything lived up to my expectations.  The screen display was beautiful and clear.  With a micro-HDMI to HDMI cable, I linked it to my tv, allowing the tablet's screen image mirrored onto the large tv screen carrying the audios along.  It was an easy setup and worked perfectly.  However, a few days later, Kindle Fire started to drop wifi connections.  Once the connection was dropped, it would not re-establish connection on its own.  The only solution was to re-boot.  After re-boot, the same thing would happen again about twenty minutes later.  I was sure that the issue was not related to the router, as I had two other computing devices served by the same router.  Their wifi connections had no problem while Kindle Fire was experiencing trouble.I conducted an online chat with a superb nice customer service representative.  He was very patient with me trying to identify a possible solution to the problem.  At the end, I accepted his recommendation to re-set the tablet to factory defaults.  The reset wiped out all the apps I downloaded, the bookmarks, etc.  I also turned off my router for a while.  I was hoping that this would work.  But it did not.  The problem persisted the next day.It was with great reluctance that I returned it.  I would have given it a five-star rating if not for the wifi connection issue.  The ability to maintain wifi connection flawlessly is critical to tablets.  Hopefully, the problem was confined to the specific machine that I received.Throughout the entire proccess, I was greatly impressed by Amazon's customer centric business model.  I received the tablet promptly, got super-nice assistance from its representatives, returned it painlessly, and received my money back quickly.

Reviews.Title: One of the best purchases I've made in a long time.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Incredible. Simply incredible. Not a day goes by that I don't use my Kindle Fire HD. I'm a college student, and recently I've been struggling trying to move my huge collection of books and movies in and out every year. Now that I have a Kindle Fire HD, I'm slowly transitioning to digital media. And let me tell you, it has made a world of difference. All of the content I could want, whether for work or play, is (literally) right at my fingertips. I use it more than my computer now. The sound and picture quality are both superb as well. If our want ultimate convenience bundled with ultimate quality, and full Amazon integration, Kindle Fire HD is the only suitable option, not to mention the most affordable.

Reviews.Title: As good as it gets!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Alton
Reviews.Content: I am an Apple person through and through...have been for many years. But the more I read about the Kindle the more convinced I was that I had to have one. I'm a media professional and it seemed like the Kindle HD 7" might be adequate for making video presentations in people's offices.  I was so right.  This device is more than adequate, it's really nothing short of amazing.  Today is my last day to return it for a full refund.  There is no way that's going to happen.  The Kindle HD is one of the best purchases I have ever made.  The screen is amazing, sound awesome, features plentiful.  I'm even making free phone calls with an app I found, it's fully compatible with all of my media and I am thrilled.  Plus, I think it's worth more than the asking price, but don't tell Amazon I said that.  Need a tablet?  Get the Kindle HD... you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet/ ereader.
Reviews.Author: TheTrueSandyMan
Reviews.Content: I owned a first generation Kindle Fire and is was okay, just had some issues with speed, etc. This Kindle Fire HD, 16GB,is a great improvement. Faster, more responsive and a fantastic display make this Kindle Fire HD 7" a pleasure to use. I use it everyday for reading, surfing the net, email, etc. I hardly every use my laptop anymore...much easier to use the Fire!

Reviews.Title: I would not purchase this item again
Reviews.Author: Joette Licata
Reviews.Content: I bought it for Christmas for my 8 and 10 yr old and after 6 months it wouldnt boot up so we had to call customer service and went back and forth trouble shooting and they finally said ok we will send you a new one and emailed us the shipping labels to send them back the old one.  They used a third party shipping service to send it to my work address and we never got the package.  We tracked it and it said that it was delivered but with no signature on file.  So we called again and verified the address and we did finally get a new Kindlefire HD but it did not come on the expected delivery date.  I sent the old one back and kept the copy of the packing information and recieved an email stating that they had recieved the old Kindle however I have since recieved another email saying that they have not recieved it.  So I am confused does Amazon have it or don't they?  I tracked it and someone did sign for it but now I have to call them again to ask why I recieved the second email.  Overall I am not happy with the product nor the customer service.  Oh and the second Kindle HD seems to work ok but we have only had it a few weeks. This ordeal is leaving a bad tast in my mouth...

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Britt
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire HD as a Christmas present and it worked wonderfully till six months and now it has done nothing but give me troubles. I've tried to factory reset it (doesn't help), I've tried to reset it (by holding down the off button for 20 seconds,) that doesn't help either. No matter how great of a deal this thing seems to be, never get it! It will only work for 6 months (or less) and then it will stop working. Sadly, I purchased mine at a retail store instead of amazon so I can't get a refund. Therefore, if you happen to purchase this item think again, or purchase it on amazon, so you can get a refund after 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Annoying Quirks At A Great Price
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - I use both PC, Android, and Mac products in my house and they all coexist peacefully.  I also have a Kindle Paperwhite.I really want to like the Kindle Fire HD more than I do but I just can't get past some of the glaring issues.  On any other machine, it'd be a 3-star product but the Amazon price point pushes this into 4-star territory.I want to use my Kindle Fire HD mainly for reading graphic novels, comics, and books.  I also wanted a quick and dirty way to check email and do light web surfing and video watching.  Well, it's a mixed bag.  There is no native support for comic files which is odd for a product that is all about reading.  An app is available but it currently doesn't work very well so I'm waiting on an update to fix a few SW bugs.  I could not get my local mp4 files to play without a video app that I had to download.  I would have thought that just about each and every video file would be rendered playable but that's not the case either.  So, I'm at the mercy of a 3rd party to get me an app that allows me to watch my own videos.As for books, I like to make use of the "Send To Kindle" method where I send my mobi books to Amazon.  I can then download them to my Kindle Fire HD or Kindle Paperwhite and the book gets synced across each device.  The issue I have is that those mobi files are treated as "documents" by Amazon so they reside in another location on the Fire HD.  And the cover art meta data is missing.  This is not a deal breaker but it's annoying and distracting.  I can side load these books into the Fire HD and they will show up with the rest of the "books" but they won't sync to my Paperwhite if they're side loaded - at least as far as I can tell.As for magazines, I wanted to download my Zinio magazines since I have that on my iPad but the Zinio app is not available in the app store so I have to download and install directly from Zinio.  I'm willing to do this and it works very well on Fire HD but I find it annoying that one of the larger e-magazine services is not easily available on one of the latest generation e-reader/tablets.All is not bad though.  The device is well made and the Amazon prime streaming service works very well.  The sound and picture are excellent.  The form factor is good and it's not too heavy.  My stylus works great with it.  The price point is amazing for what you get.  The Amazon ecosystem is excellent.So, basically, it's a bit of a chore to get it configured the way I want.  I'll probably get it set the way I want eventually but I was surprised at how much side loading of apps and content is needed.  I consider myself pretty tech savvy and find it hard to believe that people will be entirely successful in loading their own content.  This effectively steers them to the Amazon marketplace which in the end, somewhat limits their choices.

Reviews.Title: I Really LOVE this Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Brian Driver
Reviews.Content: You know, there was a time when I thought I didn't want or need a Kindle.  And then, later, there was another time when I thought I couldn't imagine anything nicer than my black and white Kindle Keyboard.I can assume therefore, that there will be a time when I need the "next" thing, but you know, I just can't imagine what it will be. I am SO, SO HAPPY with my Kindle Fire HD 7" What do I start with first?NOTE: I'm just going to write about the reading feature of the Kindle fire...I'll address the other uses of the Kindle later (camera, watching movies, browsing photos, and email, the Dolby sound system, etc.)IMAGE CLARITY:I am totally impressed with the clarity of the image; this is definitely HD clarity. I have the 7" and face it: the up-side of the smaller size is that it really sharpens up the image. Not only is this an already beautiful HD quality, but it becomes even more crisp at the 7" display size.  I love what I see: covers are beautiful; magazines are gorgeous, games are bright and fun to engage in, and YouTube vids are as pretty as can be. I have not found any problems with viewing it from any angle.READING FONT/SIZE/COLOR/SPACING :And I am very comfortable with reading the screen when it comes to books. Kindle's done a great job with providing a decent range of screens for us to use for whatever light conditions I meet when I'm reading. I can use black on white, white on black, and black on sepia. Of course, there is also a variety of font sizes and type spacing available as well.TOUCH SCREEN/INTUITIVE CONTROLS:Then there's the touch screen. My old black & white Kindle Keyboard was pleasant and relatively easy to use, but this touch screen is a snap. There's a very intuitive screen with commands that cover what it is I need to do with easy-to-understand and learn controls. I have made the transition to the touch screen very easily, and I'm a 61-year old fogey. If I got it, you can, too.SHIPPED READY-TO-USEAnd I love the fact that the Kindle was ready right out of the box. No set up, no long tutorials, and no having to charge it to work it. It was ready to use immediately, and the controls JUST MAKE SENSE.PERCENT vs. PAGE NUMBERS:I'm very glad to see that Kindles are making the transition to page numbers...I don't really mind the "percentage" symbols as I progress, but there's something about those symbols that just makes it seem harder to advance. I think the biggest problem is that on most settings (especially with larger fonts, which people with eye problems use) it takes several "pages" to advance a single percentage point, Especially in a long book like, say, a Stephen King book. It may take a dozen flips of the page until you can advance ONE percent.  So I'm glad this is happening.WI-FI/16 GB/ADS:I'm extremely happy with the Wi-Fi speed...I have a slow internet service and would often have problems with my old Kindle...which I blamed on the internet-provider. But now the books and other content are downloading VERY quickly with the HD Fire. I'm quite impressed. I feel like the 16 GB storage (PLUS the Cloud) will be all I'll need.And, incidentally, I think the ads that occasionally pop up are of almost NO concern to me. I'm glad I saved the money by agreeing to get them...they don't get in my way at all. I barely notice them...save your money and opt in to this feature.CHARGING:As to the charging speed...although they do NOT provide the speedy wall charger that will shorten the charging time to 4 hours (now being sold for $14.99), I just use the wall charger I got with the Kindle Keyboard, and though it doesn't charge from almost dead batteries to a full charge in four hours, I simply plug it in at night. (NOTE: I will tell you that if you use the Kindle HD while you charge, it will take forever. While it certainly doesn't LOSE any charge when you do that it doesn't really gain anything either.)SIZE:Finally, I love the size of this Kindle...I know the iPad is bigger, and so is the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", I really like this size. (Though I'm limiting this review portion to books, I will say movies have looked great on this.) This size is extremely simple to pack into anything, and carry it along with me.It's a cinch to carry around, and I've found a carrying case through Amazon that I really love, the M-Edge Incline 360° Case for Kindle Fire HD 7"...here's the URL: B009QU6U0YIt's a terrific carrying case, and I'm very happy with it.I'll write on some of the other features as I begin to use and be conversant with them. Stay tuned...

Reviews.Title: Could use a few up dates.
Reviews.Author: Kay Pratt
Reviews.Content: All I can say is I really like my Kindle Fire HD 7".  There are a few things that could use some improvement.  First, it takes to long for Kindle to come up.  Second, the old Kindle had a light showing when the Kindle was charged.  Last, could tone down the back light.  White is way to bright and the next color is almost as bright.  Other then that I really like it!

Reviews.Title: Returning my birthday Kindle
Reviews.Author: Neelima
Reviews.Content: Short version:Good stuff:1. Reading experience2. Time left to complete the book3. Size and handlingBad stuff:1. Apps2. Kindle Owners' Lending Library - selection and experience3. Technical glitches4. User experienceLong version:I had an iPad (Retina) for over a year now, but always wanted a Kindle for reading. So I not-so-subtly asked my wife to buy the Kindle Fire HD for my birthday, which she did. Kindle is a really good product, and I'm glad it works out so well for several folks. But here's why I am returning it after less than a week:Setup:Good: The Kindle Fire HD 7" arrived with minimal set up required. I did have to go through a few steps of setting up accounts, etc. but overall it was a pleasant experience.Bad: email setup (Gmail) wouldn't work until I restarted the device a couple of times. Also, it asked for my Facebook and Twitter account credentials up front, leading me to believe these apps came in-built. I had to download them later (very confusing), and I still don't understand why it asked me for the information.Size and Handling:Good: 7" is definitely not the largest Kindle of course, but I'm surprised how natural the screen-size felt after just a couple of minutes (Remember, I am used to a 10" iPad). The best part was that it was super-convenient to hold the device in one hand for reading or using other apps. I have Yeti hands, so that definitely helped.Bad: The device does tend to get heavy after a while. Unless you have propped it up against yourself while reading in bed, the `convenience' wears down eventually.Screen:I didn't get much reading done outdoors, so I really can't give a fair opinion on the glare (or lack of it). But I did need to switch to a black background when reading in the dark, to avoid annoying others with bright light. Background color and screen brightness are now an integral part of most e-readers and tablets, so no brownie points there.Reading experience:Everyone says Amazon nailed this part, and I agree! First of all, I LOVE books and managed to catch up with reading after more than 2 years, so I'm on cloud nine already. I never managed to read much on the iPad for the 1+ year I owned it, mostly due to the unwieldy size (and I hate those iPad cases that get in the way, but my wife insists on them). I loved being able to carry all the books in the world in one small screen with me, and I burned through 2 books in 4 days.My favorite feature is the time left in the book, calculated based on your page turning speed. It helps me decide whether to soldier on for another half hour and finish the book, or to call it quits and come back the next day. That's the biggest thing I'll miss.One big reason I chose Fire over Paperwhite was the ability to read books with colors and images (graphic novels, maps, etc.). When Amazon eventually comes out with e-ink display for color and images, I'll be standing in line to buy the future Paperwhite.Kindle Owners' Lending Library:First of all, the Books store doesn't load successfully every time. It's the BOOKS app on the KINDLE, for crying out loud! (The one thing you're supposed to get right, Amazon!!!) And I don't have the patience to restart the device every time for the rest of my life.VERY DISAPPOINTED! I have Amazon Prime and I was really looking forward to free-riding on one book per month. However the selection available for free borrowing is abysmal (unless you're interested in tons of erotic chick-lit). And the experience of borrowing was messy too, unfortunately. The borrowing wouldn't work, the advice on Amazon forums (lots of it) wouldn't work, the customer service rep tried to apply a promo equivalent to the book's Kindle purchase value and that wouldn't work either.I know this is the exception rather than the norm. I was able to borrow books and get the promo later, but it was a big turn-off to go through this the first time around, and knowing there were so many people facing the same issues. Amazon could really try to improve its back-end systems. Bad, bad Amazon!Customer Service:The one reason I still use Amazon is their excellent, unfailing service. They did try to help me out with my Kindle teething troubles, but unfortunately for them most of the workarounds failed during the first few attempts. Thanks guys, for doing what you do, to keep us irritable folks happy.Apps:Another big disappointment. I knew going in that there wasn't much of a selection. There was no Gmail app for Kindle (come on!). But the overall layout and convenient accessibility of launching apps on the iPad was far, far better than the Kindle. The home screen carousel was a big letdown. Instead of having to scroll through 20 whale-sized icons, it would have been more intuitive to provide access to more apps on the same screen/page. Hope they improve this.Also, some of the apps for Kindle are of really poor quality, compared to iOS. Take Twitter for instance: the controls and navigation are clunky and usually group two different kinds of buttons really close with no visible distinction, and I end up going to Home instead of Back.Overall:I used my Kindle for everything, for the first few days. I keep it right by my bed, so I can look at it in the morning. However I updated some apps and cleaned up some unused stuff on the iPad one day, and I couldn't bring myself to pick up the Kindle the next morning. I rather chose to do my daily morning-surfing on the small iPhone screen instead. That pretty much sealed the decision for me.I stayed away from talking about audio and video quality, because we can all agree they're great on the Kindle. But they are excellent on other devices too! So is browsing, email, social media apps, etc. However if I can't bring myself to use this remarkable piece of technology, it doesn't matter how well it fares on the tech specs. And so I will be returning the Kindle Fire HD 7" which I begged my wife to get for my birthday.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: indrani basu mallick
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle . And I think it is the best gift for my father this Father's Day . He is not computer savvy at all and it was difficult for him to sit in front of the desktop to Skype with me . But now we see each other everyday thanks to kindle and he reads a lot with it . He is happy I got this for him . Kindle rocks

Reviews.Title: No regrets! I love my Kindle Fire HD.
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I had a really tough time choosing between a Nexus 7 and a Kindle Fire HD. I finally (in early June) chose the Fire HD when Amazon had a discount on them. As an avid Prime user and reader, I have no regrets! Reading books and watching videos through Amazon and Netflix are a breeze. The Internet browser works just as I'd expect (I've read complaints elsewhere...but it is as intuitive and workable as any other browser I've ever used). And I love that I can send documents to my Kindle--this is a big help for meeting preparation and carrying backup travel documents. I would highly recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7",
Reviews.Author: Brenda Adler
Reviews.Content: Works and looks GREAT!  No problems at all - so far!  I would definitely order a refurbished product from Amazon again!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Angela Drake
Reviews.Content: My sons and I each got one for Christmas.We use them everyday .We watch movies and play games and read book.The picture quality is amazing.If your going to get a fire defiantly get hd.I think the size is big enough to watch videos and suck but also small enough to take with you.It fits easily in my purse.Amazon has made it very user friendly it's very easy to set up and use. It has parental controls so my kids can't purchase things i don't know about or get on the web without me knowing.I defiantly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves her Kindle
Reviews.Author: SCAT
Reviews.Content: She says that this thing is one of the best gift she's gotten . I think she is getting old and forgetful .

Reviews.Title: Why did i wait so long to get one? Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: SFF
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting a Kindle Fire HD for a while. I would almost buy one but then back out because I'd read a bad review and get scared. Plus I have a smart phone and figured I could do anything on my phone that I could do on a Kindle.  Finally it was on sale at the local Best Buy and I got one. I could not be more happier with it! Here are the things I like about it...  The WiFi connectivity is AWESOME (it finds WiFi where other devices can't)  The HD screen has an AMAZING picture and the sound is great (watching Hulu+ is a great experience)  There are lots of great apps available (Hulu+, Facebook, Pinterest, lots of games, and so many more, and they all look amazing on the HD screen)  Reading books is great (I also have a Kindle Touch that I use to read on. The Fire can have a glare on the screen while reading, the Kindle Touch doesn't)  The battery life is better than I thought it was going to be The only bad thing I find about it is there is no wall charger but the adapter I have for my Kindle touch works so that's not a big issue for me. Right out of the box it was VERY easy to register and figure out how to use. I can however see why some people would want a users guide. You also get a 30 day free membership to Amazon Prime. I'm still figuring out all it can do but so far I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Dazzled!
Reviews.Author: Melody
Reviews.Content: Wow. When people say there's an app for that, they aren't kidding! I am brand new to the app world and I am dazzled by what I am finding. Last week I upgraded my old Kindle to a Kindle Fire HD 7 and oh my goodness, what a magical device it is. I spent most of Sunday afternoon getting familiar with it. It hasn't left my side since last Friday when it arrived in the mail. If you are thinking about getting a Kindle, this is the one to get! Perfect size, great sound and picture. Too many features to mention here.Best of all? I had been given a $50.00 Amazon gift card a few months back by a friend, so I applied that and got my Kindle at a greatly discounted price. So glad I didn't fritter that $50.00 away on random small purchases. I'm a happy Kindle camper! :-)

Reviews.Title: Completely Satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: DSK "Toughgrits"
Reviews.Content: I own the original Kindle Fire, and this is a very nice up-grade to my older device.  I am a wife, mother of two pre-teen kids, a teacher, and I am definitely NOT well-versed on anything technical.  Having said that, here is my review:1. I love the slimmer design. I never thought my Fire was bulky, until using this much slimmer Fire HD.2. The Kindle Free Time is great! My kids don't have any hand-held devices of their own, so they are always asking to borrow my Kindle or my Samsung Galaxy II.  Now, not only do they each have their own profiles with their own favorite apps, games, and books, but I can also control how long they get to use those games, apps, and books. I have reading set to unlimited, and games and apps to only an hour and a half.  It also cuts down on fighting over who's turn it is.  That alone is worth it!!!3. I use my Kindle for reading scriptures and other church manuals, videos, and magazines.  This slimmer design fits nicely down in my church bag, and is SO much better than having to take bulky scriptures and two or three other manuals. This is definitely my all-in-one church device! Downloading the apps from my church website was a breeze.  The app store also has plenty of other church related apps to choose from.4. I love the default email app the Kindle Fire HD comes with! It keeps ALL my various email accounts in one place. I can now at-a-glance see if any of my accounts have new mail. I have two gmail, two hotmail, and one yahoo.  It is great seeing them all in one space, and whatever I delete stays deleted--I had a similar app on my Samsung that would delete emails while I was in the app, but then those "deleted" emails would reappear the next time I accessed the app.5. I love being able to upload all my pictures from all my devices (from facebook too) to the Photo Cloud.  Now I can upload or email any picture from any device without having to figure out how to get that image to the device I am using.My original Kindle came from a large retailer.  I bought my Kindle Fire HD 7" 32GB from a popular homeshopping site.  They offered a bundle at a great value, that included the magnetic case (I love it!), cord, recharger, and ear buds.Cons?
