Well, I don't like sharing with my kids!! I am actually thinking about getting the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32GB just for me and let them have/share the 7".  I love Amazon and I love the Kindle line-up.  For me and my simple uses, these Kindle devices are great and Amazon makes them easy to enjoy with the multitude of apps, movies, TV shows, and the awesome cloud.2.

Reviews.Title: Overall performance is good
Reviews.Author: wei hua
Reviews.Content: It is impressive product I have ever had for tablet category. The most striking feature of Kindle HD is its high-quality display screen, very clear without dazzling. The only thing that is not so perfect is its battery. It'll be better if it can last longer time without need to be charged.

Reviews.Title: awesomer than an ipad
Reviews.Author: Condoviper
Reviews.Content: I was fighting with this once I had it. It was hard to transition from my iPod to an android tablet, but it's easy to use,the battery life is incredible; it's easy to carry around instead of a large panel and cheaper than Apple's tablet. The sound is crisp. It hasn't frozen at all for the 7 months I've had this and if there's an update the tablet will do it for you instead of needing to check the app store. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased but..
Reviews.Author: Big C
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Kindle Fire hd 7" tablet. I agree with many of the accolades mentioned by other reviewers. The purpose of my review is to draw attention to the inability to increase the text size of text on web pages. The text of web pages is so small it is difficult or unpleasant to read. You can use the pinch zoom feature to increase the screen image and zoom in, but this so annoying when you are reading because you have to constantly scroll. Other Androd tablets and smartphones allow you to increase the text size on web pages. I have added a customer image of a side by side comparison of web pages with my smaller smartphone and the Kindle hd. The text on the smartphone is considerably larger and easier to read than on the Kindle. I often find myself reading the internet on my smartphone instead of my Kindle for this reason alone. Hopefully if this gets enough attention the developers will add the ability to increase text font size. Otherwise, very pleased with my Kindle Fire Hd.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 7"
Reviews.Author: Darshell Howell
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire the books, the game, the web everything is awesome. Customer service is great and very timely. i will do more business with Amazon in the future.

Reviews.Title: Little disappointed..
Reviews.Author: C Westerfeld "happy grandma"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle, I love my original kindle for reading and I really liked my kindle Fire for Facebook and the apps. I was interested in the HD for the camera. It seems it will only take pictures if you are connected to wireless signal unless I am doing something wrong. I have tried to take pictures and videos at my grandkids ballgames and have not been able to get it to work. At home with a wireless signal it seems ok.The camera apps are not real user friendly either. Oh well live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Miz Mac
Reviews.Content: This my first experience with a tablet, plus I have grey hair. So I'm not very tech-y. I find it easy to use. I have taken it on a trip with me and found it easy to read and answer email and check Facebook. Downloading a book takes about ten seconds. It's cleverness still amazes me. It is everything I expected and more. Love it.

Reviews.Title: 7" versus 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought the KFHD 8.9 a month ago but decided to return it. I previously had a Kindle Paperwhite and really liked the size factor for reading, but I wanted the ability to read books as well as watch movies, so the KFHD 7" was really more what I was looking for. I watch movies and read in bed and the 7" had such a better form factor than the 8.9. I haven't noticed any difference in performance between either of them. Watching movies, reading, browsing the web, email all works well on this.I also looked at the Nexus 7. Why the Kindle HD? Brighter screen plus you can watch Amazon Prime videos and get to borrow a free book a month. It's the only Android device that allows you to get the most out of Amazon Prime.As far as not having the Google Play store, it doesn't bother me at all. First, if you really want a program, you can find it online and sideload it, so that point is moot. The more important factor is that Android doesn't have a great library of apps available for tablets anyway. However, the Kindle Store actually gives me more than I could get otherwise. USA Today and PBS app are two that come to mind. Do they work on other Android devices? Yes, but not all. They work on Kindle. I've also sideloaded Google Chrome, Maps, Gmail and even Adobe Flash. Just a few clicks after searching Google.I'd like to see it a little bit lighter, but it really isn't bad at all, and it is much lighter than the 8.9. The screen is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Awesome piece of technology
Reviews.Author: Kevin Beck
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about the Kindle Fire before I got it. I already have a netbook computer and a Playstation 3 for video content, which is what I use most, so I wasn't sure the Kindle could add much to my existance. I was wrong. This is probably the best piece of computer like equipment I have owned in many years. I am reading more books now than I ever have. I won't go into all of the technical details other than to say everything they claim about the system appears to be true. The sound is awesome, the video is awesome, the reading of magazines and books is awesome, the choice of apps is awesome, you can read PDFs on this. I am very satisfied and happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Daniel Young "oldgoat67"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a KF HD after having a couple of Kindle e-readers for several years. I really enjoy reading and the e-readers are great for that purpose. But I decided to step it up with the KF HD for the media consumption for which the Fire HD is built for. It is not a conventional tablet which I think some people are expecting it to be. It is designed to consume amazon content which it does extremely well. The web browser works well but is not as polished as an iPad. It has a great selection of apps available and the ones I have purchased have worked extremely well. I bought this solely for an entertainment device and it has excelled my expectations. With apps like HBOGO, Xfinity Player, Showtime combined with amazon prime I have an unlimited amount of movies and tv shows. The games I have played such as The Dark Knight Rises have great graphics and play well. The HD screen is beautiful.Browsing the web is ok and I haven't had any major issues.  So the bottom line in my opinion The Kindle Fire HD is a great device for consuming media, if you don't mind being some what being locked in to the Amazon eco-system. It is a great device for entertainment,reading books, games etc., however, if you are looking for a more computer type device, I would do my research and look into the other tablets available.

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: alwayslearning
Reviews.Content: I initially had trouble with my first Kindle Fire HD. Despite being fully charged, the screen simply would not turn on. Amazon and I worked to trouble shoot the matter, and it was determined that I would have to send it back. The customer service I received was great. I have not had any issues with the replacement Kindle Fire HD in these several months. As far as a product goes my only suggestion for improvement would be longer battery life.I do not stream video very often on my Kindle, in fact almost never. I usually use this tablet for reading and games like Mahjong. Neither of these tasks should drain the battery life as quickly as I experience. The clarity of the images on the screen is wonderful, and the sound quality is nice. Overall I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire purchase
Reviews.Author: Joyful
Reviews.Content: I had trouble in the beginning because I did not have a wireless connection.  As a result I lost almost a free week of Prime.  I had to purchase a wireless router and hook up to my computer in order to use most of the features.  On the first week I could only download books.  The first router didn't work, I took it back and then a neighbor bought me another later in the week and hooked it up for me.  The router was about $40.00 that I hadn't planned on spending.I am able to download movies now and enjoy watching them, but am unsure about subscribing to Prime at this time. I haven't downloaded much of anything else at this time. The wireless connection has slowed down my computer some, but I don't know if this has anything to do with it.I enjoy being able to read in a dark area now - much better than my original Kindle.  Am actually well pleased with the purchase since I have it working properly.

Reviews.Title: Lost my original in divorce. Happy to have another!
Reviews.Author: J. Peters "Just a Gal"
Reviews.Content: Great to get online using Wi-Fi almost anywhere in my house (3000ft, so have a couple dead zones). Not using for games so much. A little for books because  I still like an old fashioned bound book in my hand and library. Mostly using for internet.  Typing is easy. The apps are  great! Calculator, notewriter, anything one could want. Takes great  pics and you can instantly share  them.  Good colors, lots of menus to adjust sound, brightness, etc...  Not one complaint.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Eleanor Overby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the Kindle that I purchased first, we like them but the Kindle Fire with the HD is the best. We use them for reading. Have not looked at much else. We might someday.

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: Arlene Korte
Reviews.Content: I have the 9 inch fire hd and truly enjoy it.  My daughters old kindle reader died so I replaced it with the fire 7 inch hd and she rarely puts it down.  From games to reading she just loves it.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: MiaGirl
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this, I've had it over 4 months now and it goes with me wherever I go, The colors are beautiful and the sound is great  I love the versatility, and the fact that I can now get free library books on this because I'm an avid reader, Also its perfect for reading in the dark, when hubby is sleeping. As for outside reading in direct sun it does have a glare, but I usually sit in mostly shade or under a beach umbrella and  it works fine, especially if I turn the brightness control all the way up.  While I got it for book reading, I use it for so much more, The email app was easy to set up and it works great. I have all my favorite apps downloaded and they are easy to find. It is very sturdy and I have let my grand kids play on it hours after hours, from watching movie to playing games, The netflix movies seem to stream very well over my internet connection, and I actually found a software program that can transfer my dvds into the mpg4 format so I can transfer them over via computer, That is great for trips when we have no internet each 2 hr movie seems to take  about 1.5 gb of space, so I have room to leave a couple on it without worrying about space. The only slight flaw, is the power button, its very flush with the top so you have to feel for it. The battery at first seem to drain pretty fast, but then I realized I wasn't turning it off, just putting it to sleep mode, so if I hold the power button down a few seconds longer it shuts off and that really helps, also I do turn off the wireless when I'm just reading or playing downloaded games. So I would say depending what I'm doing it, I probably charge it every other day. Can't say enough, just love it.

Reviews.Title: I need one more thing.
Reviews.Author: Parsons Family "How you look at the world dep...
Reviews.Content: This was the product I was looking for.  We have had a Kindle keyboard for a while, and it served its purpose.  I wanted some limited tablet capability, and the Fire has done more than I ever anticipated.  It is small, convenient, and the sound is excellent.I could go on about my product satisfaction, but there is one thing lacking that really surprised me.  The least expensive Kindles have a way to sort and categorize books, and I thought that they all would.I have a large collection of books, and the only way to sort them is by title, author, or date of purchase (the latter is not always accurate).  I would have thought that, in order to keep the Kindle excellence going, someone would have developed an in-house app that enabled the Kindle Fire to do what the lower cost Kindles do.I have heard there are third party apps that attempt to do this, but a Kindle-originated app would have the best chance of fitting seamlessly into this great device.  I need to sort my books, rather than have to scan through hundreds of them.I hope Amazon will develop its own software to take care of this problem.  Outside of this one minor complaint, I love my device.  Even knowing what I know now, I still would have bought it, but please, Kindle developers, do us all a favor and give us a way to organize our book collections that is at least as good as the one on the cheaper keyboard monochrome models.One more note.  My wife and I share this Amazon account, and this is the husband, Bruce Parsons, making this review.  My wife, Carol, is still very happy with her original Kindle device, though she is looking at the paperwhite so she can read in a dark place.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: roseyposie
Reviews.Content: So, I was super hesitant about buying the Kindle at first. I knew I wanted it for a long time, but couldn't decide between the ipad or the Kindle because of all the different specifications. Let me just tell you, I am so happy about this purchase. Probably one of the best purchases I've made recently. I will say, the original one I bought, ended up having a factory error with the battery, but Amazon customer service was so helpful and immediately sent me a new one, which has not had a problem. Amazon's customer service and Kindle support info has also been the best customer service I have received in a long time from anywhere. It's hard to find customer service that is great these days, I feel like at least. Overall, the Kindle has plenty of storage space for my apps, is easily charged, and the battery lasts for several days (I would even say a week). I've kind of substituted it instead of my laptop since it's so easy to pull out and search the web, check email, or read a book. I'm probably going to buy my mother one because she loves it so much as well. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: Love this thing!!
Reviews.Author: Cathleen Gabrysiak
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting a tablet for quite some time and decided to go with the Kindle because it was AFFORDABLE and does everything any other tablet (I think...) would do. When I saw the box on my door step I ran inside ripped the box open and stared at it for 5 minutes trying to figure out how to turn it on (don't ask). I finally got in on and was SO impressed with the screen quality and I went on an app binge and got a ton of games that have since been deleted because no, I don't need a wedding cake game. I do, however, need the PacMan app. Anyways the only thing I have caught myself saying is "I wish this thing had a camera on the back" otherwise it does what I need it to do and that's that. I have been splurging on books which is quite the expensive habit, I read about a book a week on it. I really love this thing I bring it everywhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire can also be used as a phone.
Reviews.Author: christian
Reviews.Content: Downloaded the  free magicjack app on amazon to turn my kindle into a free phone.It uses the same number as my magicjack plus home phone service.Cool.It was fairly easy learning how to navigate the fire hd and it works fast with my internet connection.The sound is really good for a tablet.Looking for a bamboo case that fits the hd,but could only find them for the older models.Would appreciate any help finding one .Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD as mobile device
Reviews.Author: pnoise
Reviews.Content: I have no other mobile device, no tablet, no iPhone, no laptop.  I have no desire to have continuous connection to the world through the internet or IMs, etc.  The desk top PC is sufficient for me.I have the Kindle DX which I was happier with that I believed I would be but that should not have been a surprise as I am a voracious reader.  No longer had to make weekly trips to the book stores.  But, after 2 years, realized I need a low light reader since I might end up in a shopping mall in a fairly dark coffee shop.A friend talked me into the Fire HD saying if I was going to get another Kindle anyway, get something that offered all these other options in case you ever want them.  I have a wireless router so I thought I would give the HD a try.  I am glad I did.  I fairly often spend the night away from home and the HD gives me both worlds to the extent that I want.  I have my books that I can read anywhere in any lighting condition.  I can connect to the internet and get enough news to satisfy me and then handle important emails.  And I added a few games and apps that I use at home and away.The HD has given me that little more flexibility at home and on the road that I didn't know I was actually looking for.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Marie Carter
Reviews.Content: I bought the original Kindle Fire the day that it debuted back in September 2011.  Prior to that, I had a 2nd Generation Kindle reader.  I loved the Kindle Fire and used it every single day, taking it with me wherever I traveled.  I enjoyed almost everything about it, except for the Silk browser, which was slow and glitchy.When the Kindle Fire HD came out, I debated purchasing an iPad mini instead.  I am a macbook and iphone 5 user and I also own an iPad 3.  The reasons that I decided to go with the Kindle Fire HD were many - the top 3 being cost ($249 for 32G for KFHD vs $329 for iPadMini 16G), ability to use kindle-purchased content on any device (as opposed to the proprietary approach by Apple) and the fact that I can borrow 1 book a month for free from Amazon (vs. no similar offer from Apple).  I am a Prime Member and the Amazon customer service is truly exceptional.I have been using the KFHD for a couple of weeks now.  The web browser is fast and consistent.  I loaded many apps that work perfectly (Exchange, Mint, Documents to Go, WD2Go, HBOGo, YNAB, etc.).  I have bunches of magazines that are gorgeous on the device and I have watched videos on Hulu and Netflix and each experience has been excellent.  The sound is awesome.I am extremely satisfied with this purchase and congratulate myself for being smart enough to get the best value for my hard-earned money.  I am confident that I will continue to enjoy using my Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: As described
Reviews.Author: dorosjunk
Reviews.Content: I am new to tablets and do not even own a smartphone. After plenty of research, I decided to go with a Kindle Fire HD and have to say that it was the right decision. The screen quality and speakers are excellent. The 7" is a good, portable size and wouldn't want it any larger if the device is used for traveling. All functions that I was looking for are available - e-mail, internet, Facebook, calendar, books, games,...and so much more. Taking pictures is a challenge (due to only one camera) but possible - with a good quality. I barely turn on my laptop anymore!

Reviews.Title: Best Item Ever!!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: My parents bought me this for my 13th birthday. We have had 3 iPads (1 for me, 1 for my mom and 1 for my dad) and I have had a standard reading kindle (as far as tablets). Let me say if you are thinking about getting a Kindle Fire HD if you have an iPad or if you can't decide between a Kindle Fire HD and a iPad get the HD!!! Kindle Fire is the best thing I have ever received. The sound is amazing its even surround sound!!! The X-ray feature is great for reading and watching videos. I love being able to customize the font/margines/theme on books and the glow-light is a great feature as well. There is so many different things you can do on the Kindle Fire HD than the iPad. Worried about app availability? Think again there is tons of apps that you can download, there is even many special offers for free apps. The ads are not as much of a problem as I thought they would be. They just appear on the lock screen when you turn it on (how much time do you spend there?). I bought it from Best Buy and it was a great choice! I have ordered the amazon case and it should be in on Tuesday. The speakers are by far the greatest speakers I have ever heard. The Kindle Fire looks just like an iPad!! I do think that the Carousel is a bit hard to find your content. But, it still deserves 5 stars! My school allows us to bring Kindles and Kindle Fires to school, so I can't wait to show it off to my friends! In conclusion, if you are thinking about getting a Kindle Fire HD get it even if you have an iPad.

Reviews.Title: I thought it was good before I ordered - it's even better than I thought!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First off - anyone who has an Amazon Prime account, and or reads Kindle books - you're going to be so happy with a Kindle Fire HD.  All the video content that is available for FREE with your Prime account is at your fingertips.  I have used other Android tablets (Motorola Xoom, Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.7, and Google Nexus 10).  None of them allow you to watch Prime videos "out of the box" - you can get around it by installing some web browsers and then side-loading Adobe Flash - but it's not very reliable.  On the Kindle Fire HD the video quality and the sound are great!  All your Amazon apps are there .. all your Kindle books are there.  No, the Google Play Store isn't available, and most (all?) Google-branded apps are not available.  But you can still do a lot of things without any Google apps.  And yes, you can get your Google Mail.  It's very basic, but it does the job.  And all my music is up on Amazon's cloud.  I've purchased some MP3s from Amazon, but you can use the "importer" - it will scan your computer, and upload your music to the cloud - including the songs you got from iTunes.One thing to consider.  Your experience will only be as good as your WiFi service.  If you only have access to poor WiFi service you're going to have problems - with the Kindle Fire HD - as well as ANY WiFi only device.  In the past year I've upgraded my internet service from basic speed to higher speeds.  And I've gotten a dual-band WiFi router.  So for me WiFi flies on the Kindle Fire HD.I wasn't sure before I ordered it if I should get it - and had even prepared myself to send it back after 48 hours.  I'm glad I got it.  Just wish I had waited a few days to order the 7" .. the day I received the 7" Amazon cut the prices of the 8.9".  But, that's the way it is with electronics.  All things considered - I'm happy I got it and it'll keep me occupied for a long time!PS .. I've seen some reviews who complain about the ads.  Seriously?  There's an ad on the lock screen - and you click on offers on the top menu.  There's NO inconvenience whatsoever.  If you don't want the ads just pay the extra $15-or-so bucks to get rid of them.  But they're not in your face and they don't distract from the experience.And for a cover - I got the I-Blason cover - it's my 2nd one (I have one on my Nexus 10, too).  It's well made, it's sturdy, and the fit is nice'n'snug so that your tablet doesn't move around.  A great addition.Added 03/25/2013:  For those of you who know how customizable the Android system is - you're probably going to be disappointed with the Kindle Fire HD.  Unless you root it - there's virtually no customization you can do.  I haven't, and don't plan on rooting mine.  The home screen is the carousel - which is a slider showing the last apps/books/movies/music/etc that you've used.  When it sits on my desk at work it would be boring to look over and see that all the time.  So I got the TerraTime app and added it to my 'favorites' (that's the star the the bottom right corner of your screen.  TerraTime is the earth which spins - and shows night time and day time around the globe.  It has a lot of custom settings - and it spins so it's always moving.  Kind of like "living wallpaper" for Android - but there is no actual living wallpaper for the Kindle Fire HD.  It's simple, but it does the job of not having to look at the carousel all the time.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD!!
Reviews.Author: Rsk505
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it!  I was first torn between an Ipad or the Kindle but for the price of the Kindle you can't go wrong!  And I refuse to pay for 3G so the Kindle was an easy choice.  The screen and sound is amazing.  I don't know why people complain about the ad's, they are only there when you first turn your Kindle on and once you unlock it, they are gone.  I think some people need to have other things in life to worry about!  For the price of $199 you won't be sorry you bought this.  We can't put it down....we may need to purchase a second one :)

Reviews.Title: Possibly the best and most useful electronic device I have ever puchased!
Reviews.Author: Charm
Reviews.Content: I am so excited about my new Kindle Fire!  It does EVERYTHING that I need it to.  I bounced back and forth between purchasing an e-reader or a tablet.  Then, a Kindle or a Nook.  For me, the Kindle won hands down!  Initially, I really just wanted a e-reader but after looking at all of the Kindles and seeing everything the Fire HD could do, for me, it was a no brainer.  I got the one with the ads but the ads are unobtrusive.  In fact, I rather like seeing the deals available.  And the price compared to tablets which pretty much do the same thing, is great.  Especially when you factor in all the Amazon content.  I am an Amazon girl so this just works for me!I love being able to change the font and background when my eyes need an adjustment.  I love the amount and variety of content which is available for the Kindle Fire.  More than anything though, this device is so simple!  Even the setup is simple.  I literally took it out of the box, turned it on, signed into my Amazon account and it was ready to use.  I have never seen anything simpler.  The interface is intuitive; it is just not hard to do anything.I've been "tracking" Kindle since Amazon first presented it.  This device, by far, has exceeded my expectations!  I love it!

Reviews.Title: I thought my purchase of the first Kindle Fire, was the best thing i ever bought....i was wrong....
Reviews.Author: Angie Knapchuck
Reviews.Content: My purchase of the Kindle Fire HD IS THE BEST THING I EVER BOUGHT!!! It has everything I wanted from the first gen. KF that I missed! TEXT TO SPEECH....I LOVE! Being a mom of 4 young children I sometimes cannot find the time to read that I would like but with this feature I can listen to my books even while I'm doing dishes!! With the addition of the Bluetooth NO WIRES!!! AMAZON HAS CHANGED MY LIFE...how did I EVER make it through life without you?...lol Even WITH 4 young children I CAN BE A "READER" again! DEFINITELY A FIVE STAR IN THIS MOM'S BOOK....don't believe I have to ask or want for anything more than my KINDLE FIRE HE...oh and with the additional gigabytes ...I no longer have to pick and choose what I have room for...I am a mind changer. PERFECT FOR ANYONE AND EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: Fire HD is beautiful
Reviews.Author: Jb
Reviews.Content: I love my HD7.  Had to return first one due to defective battery.  It would not charge most times And when it did it drained rapidly; but it was defective and the replacement works fine. Biggest complaint is just what everyone else says.  Why didn't they include a decent charger/adapter with it?  After one return for battery and then another few days trying to use my iPhone charger in lieu of the absolutely useless USB cable that was included, I went to the store and bought the $20 fast charger, which works beautifully.  However am out the extra ten dollars for that since I did not order it at time of purchase for $9.99.  This is poor marketing at the least.  I don't feel I had my full month of free Amazon Prime due to all this.  Anyway, the tablet is beautiful and works great.  Yes the screen ads can get "busy" at times and I'd prefer the iPad mini.  But not at the iPad price.  You get a good value for a lot less money with the Fire HD.  And I must say I was very impressed with customer service.  They didn't hesitate to replace the tablet and did so very quickly.  All in all you get what you pay for.  Just be sure to pay the extra ten dollars and get the fast charger.

Reviews.Title: Kindle vs ipad mini
Reviews.Author: Don Wayner
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire for my mom and she can't put it down.Overall I still prefer my ipad mini which I would give five stars

Reviews.Title: I love the Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Renee M Clerk
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle, I have everything in one small compact tablet. My pictures, videos, magazines, books and movies. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Works great for me!
Reviews.Author: shelley_p2
Reviews.Content: I purchased this last week and I'm in love.  I'm not a tablet-pro, but I've used ipads and cheap tablets before.  I wanted something that I could use to surf the web, hook up to my tv via hdmi, and read books.  The Kindle Fire HD does all of those things.  The web browser doesn't have Flash (required by some videos), but I googled it and found a way around it.  That was the only (somewhat) challenging part of the setup.I have a droid phone, so a lot of the apps are the same.  I'm happy with the app market.  The tablet seems to have good battery life, it is sturdy, and it was around $200.  Personally, I think it's a steal.  If you don't want to spend the money on an ipad or ipad mini, I think this is a great choice. I did my research and read that tech support is great with this product, so that influenced my decision as well, although I haven't had any problems.So far, I've set up my apps, downloaded a free book, and transferred some music via usb.  The charger is the same charger that my phone uses (USB comes with the Kindle Fire HD and I used the outlet adapter from my droid phone), so this piece of equipment fits right in with my other gadgets.  So far, I don't see any problems and I would definitely recommend this to someone else.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Mrs.
Reviews.Content: excellent device. Great battery life and great apps. If you're looking for all the same apps as iPad get the iPad. I only use this for books and Netflix. It works great. I have put multiple movies on it and it really works for a long time, the battery life is outstanding and the sound is better than any tablet out there. I have a an android tablet, iPad and a kindle. By far the kindle has the best speakers. Loudest and best quality. The apps that are available are great. From reading some other reviews i was assuming i wasn't going to be able to find any of the apps i'm used to using, but that couldn't be further from the truth. I use the HBO app, Netflix app, movie app, and reading books and magazines. Everything I use to use my ipad for actually. Strong supporter of the product. If i had to pick something that i would enhance it would be that the battery drains unusually fast when hooked up to WIFI. Other than that it's a great product.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: steve sivell
Reviews.Content: Have really enjoyed the kindle. The only problem with it is keeping the rest of the family away from it.Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Dale Goodwin
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my wife and she loves it.  It is simple, fast, and screen is exceptional clear and crisp.

Reviews.Title: Speedy delivery
Reviews.Author: AccessoryGoddess
Reviews.Content: My daughter is in love with her Kindle.  Was expected to come on Saturday however it was delivered on Friday, pretty much the very next day! The speakers are amazing and the internet connection is strong.  Would HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Denise J. Ford
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning all the fabulous ways to use my new Kindle Fire HD.  But I was immediately sold on the clarity of a movie I streamed off of Netflix, along with the quality of the sound.  I was hesitant to change over from the Kindle Fire, but the more I learn about the HD and see it's benefits, the easier it has been to give up my Kindle Fire to my son.

Reviews.Title: Glad I choose it over the Ipad
Reviews.Author: Jan Cole
Reviews.Content: I was torn between purchasing the Ipad and the Fire.  After much research on both I bought the Fire HD 7.  And I have not regretted it one minute.  It will do anything I want it to do and was a heck of alot cheaper.  I read, shop, facebook, google, etc.  The only things I have found that the IPad is superior to the Kindle Fire on is that it can take pictures and type a doc.  I use my iphone for pics anyway and I have my computer for working.All in all I know I made the right choice and my Fire HD was a lot cheaper.Would do it again

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!
Reviews.Author: shiloh
Reviews.Content: The HD display exceeded all expectations I had. From playing games, to reading, to watching videos the display is flawless. I love the smaller size as I have small hands and found that the 8.9" was a bit bulky for me personally but works great for my boyfriend. (We own both) The smaller size is also handy for when I want to toss it in my purse and take it on the go. Lastly, the sound will truly surprise you. I was expecting to need to use my headphones all the time for good quality like i have had to do with all my tablets in the past but the speakers on this are beyond compare and have not even attempted to replace them with headphones. Will soon be purchasing a case that allows it to stand up as it will be handy when watching videos. I would highly encourage you to check out the Fire HD, you WON'T be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Love love love this little device.
Reviews.Author: Stuart Sampson "Rooster"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little machine. It does everything that was promised and it does it well. I was going to get the 8.9" but I decided to go with the smaller one because it will be easier to hold for extended periods. Turns out, I made the right decision and I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Richard R. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  Upgrade.  She had the first Kindle so I upgraded to the HD Fire.  My wife is a avid reader and absolutely love it.  Her only comment is the battery should retain the energy longer.

Reviews.Title: GREAT tablet !!
Reviews.Author: Birdy
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is really great ! I bought it mainly for games & accessing the internet. I didn't think I would like reading on it, but once I tried it, I was hooked ! It is SO much handier than reading a regular book !!  Movies & videos are very vivid & clear ! I did a lot of research, comparing various tablets, before I bought the Kindle, and all in all, I am thrilled with it ! I bought the fast charger & I would highly recommend it to anyone too impatient to wait for it to charge. You can use the Kindle while it charges, of course, but it's easier to use it when it's not plugged in. The are lots of apps, games & books available ( along with loads of free ones) , for it so I'm sure I will enjoy it for a long time !!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Sandra "Kindling"
Reviews.Content: I sold my 1st gen Kindle Fire (that I loved) and upgraded to this model.  I couldn't be happier.  Everything about it is better.  speed, function, storage.  I'm not into all the tech stuff.  I just know what I want from a product and the Kindle Fire HD does everything I could ever need.  There's also a ton of new apps that make internet usage a snap.  I don't need to know what goes on under the hood as long as it takes me where I want to go.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Deeney
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Easy to read books,watch movies or play games on. Love that it will read out loud or through earbuds. If you are technologically challenged you can still enjoy this gem!I only wish the battery life was longer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome...Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Kathy Roessner
Reviews.Content: This product is living up to it's advertisement. Enjoying reading everywhere, without a bulky book. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kids L-O-V-E them
Reviews.Author: Laura Weeldreyer
Reviews.Content: So these are not quite an iPad replacement but they are as close as my kids are going to get at a fraction of the price.I want to say right off that the kids got the regular Kindle Fire from for Christmas and we saw quickly that there were some features that those lacked that the HD had. Most specifically:1) A camera - the HD has a not so high res front facing camera which means that the kids can make video's, take pictures and use skype. This seems to me to be a no brainer in terms of upgrading. It just seems like the useful life of the Fire is extended by adding a camera2) Bluetooth - this feature again makes it seem like the usefulness of the Fire is extended. My middle kid wanted a laptop and she wasn't going to get one, I mean I love her, but not laptop love her:-). She got the Fire as a gift and then used her money to upgrade to the Fire-HD with my prompting. For her birthday we got her a case that included a bluetooth keyboard and get a word processing app (one app - all 3 kindles - that's quite a deal). She can now use her Kindle Fire HD to type papers, search the web and create content. The physical keyboard is a really nice addition and means that she has stopped bugging us for a laptop.I also want to say thank you to Amazon for making the entire process so easy. We got 3 kindle Fire's for Christmas and were able to exchange them (we love being prime members) easily. The ability to track the returns and new kindles made everyone happy and gave everyone something to look forward to. There were no issues at all with exchanging and I used the online customer service chat a few times and it was a real pleasure. Not sure if those higher up the food chain read these reviews, but the people I dealt with were great. Three new KFHD's and three happy kids.A few other cool features:1) The displays look great2) While I really wish that there was a "kids login" for netflix available for the kindle, that's a dispute between Amazon and Netflix. Netflix works really well on the KF-HD3) The kids like being able to access apps which I can control through my Amazon account and I appreciate that when I want to load an app it only requires me to log into my account on my laptop and do so once.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Why did I wait so long??
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: So far I am loving my Kindle Fire HD. I had held off on purchasing a kindle as I've had the app on my phone for years and didn't see the need for an actual kindle as the phone app worked perfectly for my needs.Then I started contemplating an ipad. In my research for an ipad vs. other tablets, I read through many of the other reviews for the kindle fire hd and decided for my needs it was perfect. Since receiving my kindle fire hd, I am glad that I decided to go with the kindle over an ipad or other tablet.The screen quality for the movies and television programs I've watched so far has been excellent.For my needs, this is a great product, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Larry D.
Reviews.Content: In a word, this device is awesome.  It is lightweight, the screen brightness adjustment is wonderful and I am very happy with the FIre HD.  The only thing missing is an easy way to move books to a Collection like the 'old' Kindle.  I appreciated being able to create a collection of 'books I've read' with the standard Kindle so at a glance I could determine if I'd read a certain book or not.  The Fire HD does not have that feature as near as I can tell.  Yes, there are apps that one can download and I have, but they don't operate as seamlessly as the collection on older models.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD vs. Nook HD unbiased review
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I have both, the Kindle and the Nook. If you are deciding which one to purchase like I was, then this info may be helpful. They are basically the same thing with minor differences.1) The Nook is more comfortable to hold than the Kindle. It is not as wide, so it is easier to hold with one hand. The Kindle is slightly heavier but it it easy to get used to. Both devices feel solid.2) The Nook and Kindle have a smooth interface.When I first received the Kindle it was difficult to navigate because the instructions are poor. After approximately 30 minutes I was using it flawlessly. The Nook has a home button so if you get lost you can press it. The Kindle controls most actions with the touch screen. The Nook has better graphics than the Kindle but the differences are minuscule. You may not tell the difference. The Nook looks better.3) Both allow you to borrow books from the public library. With the Nook, it was an arduous process. I spoke to several Nook representatives and they implied that they never heard of someone having problems with borrowing books before. They gave me numbers to call, I heeded their advice, and I still could not borrow books. I Googled it and followed the instructions step by step. I downloaded Adobe but nothing worked. With the Kindle it is easy to borrow books from the library. This is really convenient because I'm a student and I don't like carrying heavy textbooks around.4) Both browsers are fast but I give a slight edge to the Kindle. They also offer free videos for Prime members although a lot of the videos aren't any good. The Kindle has a greater selection of videos, apps and games compared to the Nook. The Kindle's sound is also superior.4) The Nook HD is cheaper than the Kindle HD. Furthermore, the Kindle does not come with a charger which I find to be ridiculous. It comes with a USB cord but your computer will take forever to charge it. I'm talking definitely over half a day and I'm being generous. Do not buy the Kindle without the charger; You will be disappointed. The Kindle comes with a free month of Prime which I found to be useful because of the 2 day free shipping. The Nook comes with the charger included.* I did not mention the advertisements on the Kindle with Special Offers because It is not a big deal. The advertisements are not disruptive and you may forget that they are there. The Nook does not have advertisements.Hope this helps. If you have questions I will update.

Reviews.Title: A love my fire!!
Reviews.Author: K. April Holgate "Take a look it's in a book....
Reviews.Content: Saying I love the kindle fire hd is is like saying I love to breathe!! For a book worm like myself this is an amazing product! I could use it for many things but reading is my main emphasis!! I live for reading and this is with me twenty four seven!!

Reviews.Title: OMG OMG OMG!!!  I LOVE my FIRE!
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: WOW!  I debated getting a Kindle Fire for over a year, and kept putting it off.  I really thought I was perfectly happy with my Kindle HD.  However, I received a lot of Amazon gift cards for Christmas, so I thought, "well, if not now, when?"  I am SOOOO happy I purchased the Fire.I am not technologically savvy, by any stretch of the imagination, but I LOVE this thing.  I am still learning, but I have downloaded books, music, Pandora, apps, kids' stuff, etc., etc., etc.  I take it everywhere with me, and have even fallen asleep with my earbuds in, listening to "serenity" music.  I am HOOKED.The ONLY thing I would like to be able to do is sort my books by category, or create "collections" similar to what I had with my HD.  Other than that??? I am in LOVE!

Reviews.Title: Believe the reviews!
Reviews.Author: Paul Bacon "Bookaholic"
Reviews.Content: My Kindle HD is even better than I expected, and I expected a lot based on the reviews! Just the right size for us with tons of capabilities. My girls love playing games (free from Amazon) on the Kindle! Great graphics!! They prefer the Kindle to our I-Pad. Internet browsing is excellent and I love the HD!! Reading on the Kindle is great also. An excellent buy at an excellent price $199 !!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I waited for quite a bit of time before I purchased my Fire but am kicking myself that I waited so long.  I just love it.  It is easy to use but would have liked a better explanation of some of the icons that were not intuitive to me.  It is a bit heavier than my regular Kindle but it does SO MUCH MORE.  Movies, tv and the web are a snap to use.  The sound and picture quality is just wonderful.  Got a membership to Prime also because there is just so much there that is so great with the Fire. So much to watch and read, how will I get anything done with the irresistable Kindle Fire HD. If you are considering a Fire HD, wait no longer to buy one and enjoy it now.

Reviews.Title: Oh my gosh !!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Henson
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start.  This is my second Kindle and I can't imagine life without it.  I read whenever I have a few minutes and being able to bookmark my spot, go check my email, go check in with Facebook, Twitter and whatever else I have going on at the time is AWESOME !! I can surf the web, text my kids, and play my favorite games. My husband wanted to get me an iPad for Christmas but the store was out of them.  I am so glad !! I love my Kindle Fire HD 7" !!!

Reviews.Title: Took the I Pad back and bought another kindle fire.
Reviews.Author: mommymom
Reviews.Content: For Christmas I got my daughter (4) and son (2) a kindle fire hd 7 to share.  Then in Jan my husband got me an i pad for my birthday.  After using both of them I returned the ipad and replaced it with a kindle fire hd 8.9.  I am going to break down what I like and don't like and will compare a little to the ipad for those who are trying to choose between the two.Ease of use: most things were covered by the tutorial when I first turned it on. I found it fairly intuitive to use.  My 4 yo used it with very little explanation. I like the carousel and how everything else is separated into sections by the tabs at the top.  I am an iphone user so it did get some getting used to to turn it on and volume up and down. Also my husband finds it harder to navigate than his iphone.  Also I hate having to tap the screen multiple times in a book to get the home button to appear (most the time it just turns the page).  I much prefer how the ipad has a home button.  I will say that my kids do better with the kindle bc they always hit the button on the ipad and would end their game.WiFi:  It is fairly fast, in comparison with the ipad 4 I found no difference between the two. Obviously no 4g avail on kindle 7.Durability:  So as I mentioned I bought this for my 2 and 4 yo. Amazon claims they are made to take a few licks. I did not put a case on it, I did get a screen protector. My kids have put it through the paces and it is still holding strong.  My kids have dropped it on a tile floor, jumped on it when it got left in bed, and have pounded it while using.  Other than a scratch on my screen protector it has survived without issue and the screen has not cracked.  Due to knowing how fragile the ipad was i never let it out of an otter box around my kids and have been told by many of my friends they break like glass.Camera: Well here the ipad does win out 100% The kindle has a camera but only front facing for skype. No video camera but you can buy and app I think. For me I found the ipad to cumbersome to lug around just for the use of the camera and I have my I phone so it felt superfluousness for me. If you really want a camera though you are going to want an ipad.Price: Obviously the Kindle is less expensive.  For me it was a lot less. This is because I have 2 young kids and do need the protection plan.  If you actually break your ipad that is 150-200 vs 89.  Also I did not need the crazy expensive otterbox for the kindle so that saved me money as well.  Then the price of the device is a about 140 less.Apps:  So this was something that I found myself very torn btw the ipad and kindle.  There are some apps you can only get on the ipad and for kids they are great. Also some of the apps you can get for both are free on the ipad but cost money on the kindle.  What I found was they are somewhat of money pits bc they always had another 99cents to be added.  I will miss a couple of apps that I thought were cute. Adult apps i really have no idea about bc i didn't even look at any. As far as my calendar, email account, I heart radio skype and facebook i found no difference btw the two.Kindle Free time:  This is an awesome feature and probably one of the reasons I took back the ipad and got a second kindle.  A lot of times  my kids are the one using the device, the majority of the apps i would download were for my kids.  So i found it awesome that I can put them in this area and they are able to get onto what they want and I don't worry about my stuff elsewhere.  Also the subscription gives a ton of books, apps, TV shows, and movies to watch.  You can also limit the time they are able to use it without having to set a timer and pry it away when time is up.  (This helps with my kids having to share the one kindle) They have their own profile and it downloads different content to them based on gender and age.  So my son is thrilled bc his is full of Thomas and my daughters has dora more but both have some gender neutral or crossover items.  A lot of the content is educational but not most of it. Also when using my ipad my son was ALWAYS hitting the home button and I had to put it on for him again and again.  It is password protected so you can't buy anything with out the password whether you are in the free time app or not. You can add anything you download into that childs specific profile too.Well that is it.  Sorry for the very long review but I found it hard to compare the two when I was shopping and really had to use the two to figure out what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: inlove
Reviews.Author: Starfish
Reviews.Content: I first bought a nexus 7. Had that for 2 weeks then it stopped working. Returned it for a kindle fire hd. I love it so far except for the app store is limited. Had some problems with a few apps and the kindle customer service was wonderful! based on just the customer service alone I love this product.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is nicer that the Kindle Fire if you watch a lot of movies or videos pn your tablet. It has very good graphics and is quicker at downloading apps than the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Best invention
Reviews.Author: margie tenley
Reviews.Content: I haves old kindle which I love but I bought  3 for my daughters for Chtistmas and they love them.  Later I want to buy me one. KIndles are great'!!!!!

Reviews.Title: amazing!
Reviews.Author: Rick Sunderman
Reviews.Content: I got this for my teenage daughter & she absolutely loves it. My wife says we need to get at least one more for us (but I want my own)

Reviews.Title: LOVE!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Frank Guerrero
Reviews.Content: My daughter LOVES her kindle fire. We are still exploring it. But can't complain. She downloads a lot of books to read.  The HD is so AWESOME!!!! If I didn't know better I would have thought this was a mini iPad. Overall money well spent!!!!

Reviews.Title: Loving My Precious!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeannie
Reviews.Content: This is such an amazing product!!! The best of both worlds...a tablet and an e-reader!!! I've had the original Kindle for years and was perfectly content with it. Yes, they kept coming out with newer models, but I don't feel the need to "upgrade" with every new model of things that come out. My husband wanted to get me the Kindle Fire for Christmas, but again, I thought no because the one I had was still working like a champ. Until....I watched the Amazon video and saw all the features it had on it!!! WOW!!! Over the moon with it, and haven't stopped playing with it since Christmas day!!! So glad I decided on the smaller one (7") and that I got the HD model. Incredible photos and videos!!! I also paid extra for the larger memory and to eliminate the ads. Best present I ever got!!!!Be sure to buy the AC power adapter cord - it's sold separately!! Lame, but it is what it is!Also, I got this case: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008J7EU9I/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i01  It's fantastic!! And inexpensive too!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Mastiff Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have gotten a better deal .. Now I can read books, surf the web, and watch movies in HD!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: my kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Genna Faye Hicks
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire, I am an avid reader and I love playing games now I can take all these books and games with me when I travel. A+ great product.

Reviews.Title: a lot of space and smooth running
Reviews.Author: maddog1989 "Northern Border"
Reviews.Content: it does not fit regular 7 inch cases.  you will need to purchase that.  free trail of prime so far is good.  at the start the streaming was a bit rough but it straightened it's self out.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Pleased I chose the Kindle HD tablet.
Reviews.Author: Fredddd
Reviews.Content: I searched, researched, and watched youtube video's about tablets til I was blue in the face.  Read positive and negative reviews of many, many tablets.  I do believe a lot of negative reviews are fictitious, maybe those loyal to another brand.?Anyway, I chose the Kindle Fire Hd.  And I am so glad I did.  I am an Amazon Prime member.  But that's not why I chose the Kindle HD.  I chose it because of the beautiful display, and to use it the way it was designed to be used.  Click a button, watch a movie.  Or purchase a movie and watch it.  I don't have to go through rooting devices,expanding SD or microSD cards or converting movies from my pc to the tablet etc.  I wanted the ease of just simply choosing and watching a movie.  And yes, using email, checking weather etc.The picture is stunninginly beautiful.  The sound is awesome.  The ease of use is what I was looking for.  It was all ready for me when it arrived.  Turn it on and you are simply a few clicks(taps) away from doing whatever you want.  I have had no lag, no reason for forced stops etc. Every single app I have downloaded has worked flawlessly. I am very, very pleased with this Kindle HD. I wanted one for home use to watch either Amazon or Netflix when my spouse chooses a horror or sci fi movie, I can't stand either. So, now I can simply choose something else while in the same room-add earphones/plugs and not a bother to the spouse.  And in case of electricity loss, or loss of wifi, I have downloaded a couple of movies to the device so I'm not totally without a way to watch entertainment(especially if the kids/grandkids are around).To be honest here, I also purchased an ipod touch 5th generation.  Yes, for what it is it is also awesome, but I do not have an account for their 'store' and don't plan on getting one.  But it's the right travel size for me. The sound isn't close to the quality of the Kindle, it gets better with the earpods..shame really.I like the Kindle HD better.  The picture is better, the sound is much better, and the ease of use as well.So, I may choose to travel with the Kindle HD.I also purchased the Kindle cover and I have not had a problem with it at all, and I really like that it turns off and on the Kindle when you open or close it. I did not choose a bright, frilly color, less apt to be noticed and stolen that way, I'm hoping.I won't be 'relying' on the Kindle for daily, all day use.  But for what I wanted it for, I couldn't be more pleased. It's an awesome tool for entertainment. Yes, the accessories that I purchased separately, all well worth the price so far. The Kindle is more than competitive in price even considering the cost of accessories.I haven't downloaded a lot of apps, some, but not a lot.  I'm not a gamer. But I did download the temple run game.  It works as awesome on my Kindle as it does the ipod touch, but is bigger and better looking and the sound better. Won't be using much productivity apps on the Kindle. A few.We'll see in 6 months how it has worked out, or a year from now. But so far, I am extremely pleased.It does seem like it takes a long, long time to charge using the usb charge connected to a laptop.  I bought the quick charger, like it better...I consider the money for this as money well spent.And, I plan on getting the bigger Kindle HD, soon!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Device, You Can't Go Wrong! Thank You Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Carmylita
Reviews.Content: UDATE!!! I still love this Kindle 2012 model, however read on. I have had my device 10 months now, at this point. My on screen keyboard is starting to flicker and disappear!! I am at the point of doing factory resets. I asked what they would do if it should fail, and was told they would "talk about a replacement" I researched the "NEW" Kindle Fire HD, yes they are making a new HD. I am NOT referring to the HDX. The new HD doesn't come in a 32 GB version, and they have removed the camera. I have 1000's of pictures taken with this device. I will not settle for a new one with no camera, nor will I settle for cheaper quality. Nor will I settle for under 32 GB! Please, go read the feed back on the new HD before you buy one. I will be saving my money for a Google Nexus 7, before I buy another one of these. I have a Kindle 4th generation reader, all my books will be transferred there. As far as my apps, I don't care, there are far more apps to be had in Google Play Store. I will not settle for a discount on a new device. I want my 2012 model. Sorry Amazon. New is not necessarily better. This is one customer who won't settle for less than what I have now.I bought this as a late Christmas (January 2012) gift, my entire family pitched in to help me get it. Living on a fixed income, I do not spend money lightly, so this was a thoroughly researched endeavor. I purchased it at a local Best Buy, along with a superb screen protector. I ordered the Honey Yellow leather Amazon case, directly from Amazon. I will leave feed back on the case separately.I studied every 7 inch tablet on the market for months before choosing the Kindle Fire HD. This is my first tablet. I currently own and use an iPod Touch 4th generation, with Retina display. My Fire HD puts the iPod display to shame.For those who give this Kindle Fire HD a lower rating  because there is no charger, or they live out side the US, this information is readily available on the internet, in advance of buying. One just needs to do a bit of research. READ THE FINE PRINT.I was aware there was no charger, it DOES include a USB charge cord for your computer, and my Fire came with about a 75% charge. I did not buy the charger simply because I went to three stores, and no one had one. I activated my Fire, which took all of five minutes. After activating I received my free month of Amazon Prime, and promptly ordered the charger with free two day shipping. So if you have not bought a charger, you may want to take advantage of the free two day shipping. AFTER purchasing and activating your Kindle Fire HD.UPDATE: While writing this review, I heard a knock on the door, and there was my brand new Amazon Kindle Power Fast Charger!! It got to me in less than 24 hours from Arizona to Washington, on my doorstep, for the same price I would have paid in the store. No gas spent to run out a look for one. I am amazed at that shipping! Thanks Amazon!Yes, you have to sign up for one click shopping. Which is no big deal. (Unless you have children who will be using this. Since I don't fall into that bracket, I can not comment on this detail.)I do not find the ads that everyone is talking about, even remotely intrusive. I will eventually pay to have them removed. Simply because I prefer that. Some of the ads are things I would love to take advantage of. I find the ads no different than surfing the internet, or Face Book, and seeing the ads there. It is simply not a big deal.I have down loded several basic apps, such as Face Book, and a battery charge indicator, I always buy the pay version of an application to avoid the ads and to SUPPORT the designers-developers of these applications. These people put a lot of work into the development and design of these applications, and desrve our support. Think of it this way; would you go to work with out pay, then give away what you designed, and receive nothing in return? They need our support.A little about myself, I am a 59 year old grand mother of 8 grand kids. Happily married almost 30 years, and, I love new technology.I am also totally deaf in one ear, and have about 50% hearing in the other. This highly influenced my decision to purchase this Kindle Fire HD. I can HEAR the speakers!! They are amazing. I just finished watching a movie, and it was awesome! My lap top has Dolby Home Theater speakers and they are not as good as the speakers on this Fire!Some foot notes here:I was able to bring the Fire to 100% full charge while sleeping. Plugged into my computer.The case fits perfect, but does need a better "clasp", and the case is more slippery to hold than the Fire is to hold with out it.There is "down" time, as it can't be used while charging. UPDATE: If you buy the fast charger there is no "down" time. The down time is caused by the user consuming more power than the USB cord can generate while in use. I hope this makes sense. See the comment left in my commets below this review.There are a lot of free books, apps, and so on, in the store, and many low cost books. It is a dream to read on.I have no issues with the screen flipping from horizontal to vertical. UPDATE: I have found quite a few free books and a lot of 99 cent books.Surfing the web is fast and easy. This is directly affected by what kind of router you have. A better router is going to give you faster speeds.Setting up a Yahoo e-mail account was a breeze.  Most set ups are self explanitory.A pleasant surprise; I can play one of my favorite Face Book games on this with out a flash player. That game is Fairyland. I also down loaded Words With Friends. I plan on getting other games as well, this grandma likes a few games, growing up with kids in the Nintendo age, gave me an appreciation of a good game.The camera can be activated for use absolutely FREE, by going to "photos" and clicking on the camera icon in the corner.THERE IS AN "OWNERS MANUAL"!!! Get to it by swiping down from the top of the screen. All settings will be there.The touch screen is wonderfully sensitive. My iPod has to be touched quite hard for it to respond. So the sensitive screen is a plus for me.The on screen key board is as well, sensitive and easy to use.The build of this Fire HD is incredible. Very well built. Some complain about the weight, but the weight is there because it IS very well built. The screen is made of Corning Gorilla glass.I had brief use of an Apple iPad, and I do not regret not buying the Apple product.I know this Fire HD is going to bring me many years of enjoyment.I, in no way wish to deminish the Apple products, but wish to explain my reasons for not purchasing one. They have another purpose and place in the design of things, and they did not fit my needs. As far as the Kindle "eco system" being geared to Amazon products, yes, it is, but so is the Apple "eco system" geared to Aple products. I do not find this an issue.I did not have to transfer data onto My Kindle Fire from a previously owned device, I have the privledge of starting brand new.I have yet to experience everything this Fire has to offer, and I will be updating this review in the future. As I said, there is much more to be discovered, that is not covered here.For those who are curious, this is built by Texas Instruments. A Long time company with an excellent reputation. I still have my first red LED Texas Instruments watch, over 40 years old and it still works!Many thanks to my family who made this possible. Thank you Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD...Read...Watch...Listen...With Extreme Pleasure
Reviews.Author: Scott D. Welch
Reviews.Content: I have never owned an iPad, though I have used them. I have also used various other tablets, such as the Samsung Galaxy and Google Nexus. I have owned the Toshiba Thrive 10.1" tablet. I must say, for the money, Kindle Fire HD 7" (without special offers) is the hands-down winner for my specific purposes.I am not a gamer, so I cannot comment on the comparison there. My needs for a tablet device, are, and the review reflects usage, as follows: reading while traveling; easy access of email (my yahoo, hotmail, gmail personal and my business godaddy accounts) which are all loaded, synched and ready to go; listening to my favorite few hundred songs; to watch the occasional movie; to be able to view my own photos and videos whenever I wish; accessing my facebook and twitter accounts; surfing the web when not in front of my Mac or my laptop.Yes, I know it may be limited, but those are my parameters. I originally thought my Thrive would replace my laptop but it did not. I believe that I will always have a laptop for various things I need to do. The Thrive was, in essence, my learning curve on exactly what I wanted, and needed, in a smaller portable device to use mainly while traveling. I carry my Kindle and my 15.6" laptop (with all cords, chargers and a variety of other items) in my Wenger 16-Inch Legacy Checkpoint-Friendly Computer Case.The Kindle Fire HD has fantastic WiFi capabilities; never an issue. Near a hotspot? Connect. Easy as that. I have not yet had it lose a connection. The device has fantastic optics; brilliant colors that are alive and pop. It is a pleasure to show my photos to others on the Fire HD. I did match it directly against the iPad, Thrive and Galaxy and the visual is better than the competition. Dolby Digital Plus definitely delivers the goods. The sound is great. And when you plug in a good (not cheap) headset be prepared to fill yourself full of high quality sonic. Word docs, pdfs, and spreadsheets have all been viewed successfully.When I got the Thrive one of the reasons is that I thought a 10 inch screen would be better to read books when I travel. And, in many ways, it is. But I am more than satisfied with the Fire HD 7" screen when I read. It is easy on the eyes and the form factor is also more comfortable when reading.I am getting pretty close to the advertised 11 hours of operational battery time, which is excellent. That means when flying coast to coast I am able to use my Kindle while sitting in the terminal, during the flight, sitting again during a layover, and then the continuation flight, without having to worry about running out of juice (and/or searching the airport terminal for the sometimes elusive outlet).As the Amazon Kindle PowerFast was on sale when I got my Fire HD, I purchased it. I am glad I did. At first I was a bit disappointed that it was not included with the device, but, at this price-point, it makes business sense that it is not. Amazon has delivered an outstanding device. Yes, it is all tied to their content, but that also makes the Fire HD very attractive due to all of that content.All in all, the Kindle Fire HD exceeds all of my expectations and I highly recommend it to anyone with the caveat that I have not used it with any games and do not plan to.

Reviews.Title: Awesome kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Trenton
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas gift from my mom. I love it. I have a ipod touch and I love it but I love this just as much. I am using it right now to type this. I love this. The things you can get for this is awesome (like,cases,skins,etc.) This is my favorite Christmas gift I got this year of 2012. My sister also received one for Christmas and loves it too. I would recommend this to any other 12 year old or any other age person. I have a charger for this that charges it pretty fast. But now I see the make a speed charger that cost 20$ and is not bad if you want you kindle to charge fast. The only thing I don't like is that you can't set a background on it but that doesn't matter. I give this a 5 star

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD!!!
Reviews.Author: Jenifer E Grant
Reviews.Content: I love the way this Kindle boots up almost immediately. Updating the settings or checking the device statistics is so easy. Being able to read at night with no light on or sit out in the sun and still be able to see the screen with little or no glare is priceless. Knowing I can jump on to look something up on the internet, check e-mail or even immediately activate the built in dictionary with ONE touch, right of the page I'm reading, when I come across an unfamiliar word is just amazing. The battery life is pretty good and it recharges relatively quickly too. I have NO complaints about this product. I simply love it and go NO where without it. :)

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: pybowhtr
Reviews.Content: It is great for reading and watching videos. It has a very vivid screen display. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: otto munch
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kindle with some Christmas money. I do not regret the purchase. Does more than I need and for a technology geek, I like it that way. Best tablet on the market. No cons. Only pros. HD, GREAT sound, and so much more. :)

Reviews.Title: Not sure if I'll ever be able to go back to regular books!
Reviews.Author: TD "Tricia"
Reviews.Content: Wish I would have gotten one of these sooner! I really waited because I though I really don;t need one. Now I just cant do with out it!Being a Senior who is technically challenged, I thought it would be to complicated. My husband bought it for me in Nov for Christmas; since he was tired of seeing all the book I was stacking up and storing. I started using it as soon as it arrived, getting the books from my library. Now I really don't have to wait for a series, since you can get it from so many different Libraries. I love the part where you simply touch a word and it gives you the definition instantly; and the light Oh My! I just can't say enough about this Kindle so far.After using the fire for four months now,the only things that I think need to change are 1, that they color the on/off and volume buttons. To solve this problem my husband used a white paint pen to mark them,it still wares off so it would need to be something permanent in the plastic itself.2.this is my first kindle,and read a lot of reviews on it.almost everyone remarked that they could read with the kindle fire HD in the sun or anyplace...so i didn't think my screen was anti glare,I talked to customer service dept.and they assured me it was the newer anti glare screen and compared to previous and others on the market it is the best out there to date.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for your money
Reviews.Author: cool dude
Reviews.Content: at first i was going to get a samsung tablet but when i saw how cool this tablet was and the price was great i knew this was the one. i do recommend you charge all the way up becauase it only comes half way charged and if you dont charge it all the way before first use, the touch screen really acts up. after you charge it up all the way it great and doesnt act up at all even at 2% battery. overall great tablet.

Reviews.Title: In love with my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Lillian E.
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 for Christmas. This one was for me and I am extremely happy with my choice. Great for watching movies, reading books, playing games, and browsing. Just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: Everything I hoped for and more!
Reviews.Author: Calindsey
Reviews.Content: I have been playing with my new Kindle Fire HD 32 GB for several days now.  First let me say that the battery life is phenomenal!  We were heading out of town when my Kindle arrived.  I charged it for about half an hour...not a full charge but it was maybe about halfway.  I let my daughter watch a movie on it while I was packing.  Then played with it for awhile before we left and all during our three hour drive.  So about 6-7 hours of use total and it held that little bit of charge.  On a full charge I can play with it almost all day.  My daughter's first gen Kindle Fire holds a charge for a couple of hours max.  This is a huge improvement.  The sound quality is excellent.  My favorite thing about it is the screen resolution.  With my daughter's older Kindle, the screen is hard to see when near a window or if you are in a car or outside.  I was able to easily see this screen while we were driving and could still see it with sunglasses on.  When watching movies on it, there are no glitches or pixelating on the playback.  The movies are smooth and clear...just like watching a DVD.  My techie brother who has an iPad was very impressed with the screen.  I have only played with the camera a little bit, but it seems to work well.  I do agree it would have been nice to have the front and rear facing...but I won't necessarily use this for a camera that much.  Would have been nice to use for HD video but will be difficult to do unless I'm taking video of myself. Overall this Kindle exceeds my expectations and is very much worth the price.

Reviews.Title: How did I live without this?!?!
Reviews.Author: B. Everly
Reviews.Content: Working in the wireless industry I am no stranger to electronics. In the past year or so I have found myself addicted to Amazon so when someone offered this in trade for an item I had for sale on Craigslist I thought what is there to lose. I already have a few tablets but all of them are 10" displays so this would take the place when I wanted a smaller display. Kindle Freetime was a big plus, my daughter is quite the fan. When I have handed her my android tablets previously I have found it way too easy for her to download games that cost me money, Freetime eliminates that risk completely. She likes the freedom of doing whatever she wants, I like not having to look over her shoulder. The display KILLS the iPad and iPad mini as well as the android tablets I have. The interface is quite smooth, but it is a bit different than a typical android device. Battery life is great, and streaming via the microhdmi slot to the television with Amazon Prime is really nice. I would like to see the ability to turn off the display while streaming over hdmi so there is not the distraction of the video playing over the tablet as well as the television, but all in all this is a great device. I am a huge critic of these type of devices and this one has won me over. Great job Amazon! You would have to be crazy to spend over $130 MORE for LESS in an iPad mini!

Reviews.Title: Perfect...For Me
Reviews.Author: RDC
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD works perfectly for me considering what I wanted it for; reading and watching movies. Having watched many hours of movies and tv on it using both Amazon Prime and Netflix, I have to say that the  Kindle Fire HD works flawlessly. At 1280x800 the images look great and the sound! Those little speakers are awesome.I wasn't sure how much I would like the Fire HD for reading since I have been using the Kindle Keyboard for the last few years so, I was going to hang on to the old one for reading just in case. You can now find the old one packed away in the attic with stuff I need to sale on eBay.I don't surf the web much on the Fire HD (I save that for working hours)but what little I have surfed was OK. I would like the bigger version if that was my primary concern. Amazon Silk is smooth and I guess it is 30% faster than the older version, but I don't know for sure. I do like the reading view that removes the images as they are usually a nuisance anyway.I bought the Kindle Cover and I am amazed at how it magically turns on the Fire HD when I open the cover and turns it off when I close the cover. Amazing and convenient. It makes the perfect stand as well since nobody wants to hold their Fire HD when watching a movie.The only drawback about the case is the hole that fits over the headphone jack isn't big enough. The plastic piece on my jack is bigger than the hole so the jack doesn't insert all the way. It is made for those little ipod type earbuds. So, I have to pop the Fire HD out of the case a little bit to make it work.Anyhow, I'm sure you are reading these reviews to help in your decision to buy, so I hope this helps. I don't own an iPad to compare it to, but there are plenty of other reviews to help you out there. Good luck with your decision!

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Patrick D. Kumst "PK from Jamrock"
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, and I highly recommend it to anyone considering purchasing one. The HD picture quality is sharp and crisp, and stereo speakers have amazing clarity. I bought an IPad3 for my wife a few months ago, and prefer the Kindle HD, hands down. Since purchasing the Kindle HD, I have used it to stream movies, tv shows, and surf the internet which it accomplished with ease and very speedily. One (and by far not the only) thing that makes it stand out from the IPad3 are the dual modems. The unit will pick up a WiFi network when the IPad will not (particularly one with a weak signal - like a neighbour' s). Critics claim that the Kindle HD is not a fully fledged tablet, but I have yet to see what it can't do. For sure what it is, is a great shopping tool for Amazon. If you are undecided, take my advise and purchase one. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Lisa Mattingly
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to anyone.  It is exactly as it was described on Amazon.com.  The delivery was as described also.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Todd A. Gulbranson
Reviews.Content: I purchased a iTablet before this not name brand and it was a nightmare. I turned around and took the other one back. Then I went online and purchased the Kindle I loved it. It set up easy and does everything I wanted it to do. But now I have lost it to my wife she has it at hand all the time. She does alot of reading and having address book on it was a plus. She has alot of apps on it now. Best thing you could by wife it's like buying a diamond.

Reviews.Title: Great Touhpad
Reviews.Author: Jamie Weiner
Reviews.Content: Mother-in-law had alot of confusion(popup, updates, etc;) with her laptop. This is much better for her simple, fast, and easy for internet, email,  reading, and so on.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Fiona
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD for about two hours.
