Reviews.Title: Great tablet at an affordable price.
Reviews.Author: JJN
Reviews.Content: My idea of the Kindle was a tablet that you use to read books online. After purchasing Kindle Fire HD 7", recommended by my wife, my opinion totally changed. I found it to be a versatile tablet for Internet, Email, Skype, Music, Books etc....Its App Store has a rich variety of different and fun applications and games that i found many of them very useful. The camera works great for Skype but not good for taking pictures. My recommendation is to change the camera to a two sided one or at least add a view finder on the back side.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Karen J. Szatkowski
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HD to upgrade from my original Kindle and I absolutely love it.  I like the fact that my Kindle and my first tablet are all in one.  If you've hesitated buying the Kindle Fire HD, please watch the Amazon Kindle Conference dated September 6, 2012, located on Youtube.  Amazon's innovation with Kindle has been phenomenal and the advances/upgrades they've made on the Fire are astoundingly impressive.  The unit is solid yet comfortable to hold.  The clarity of the screen and the speakers is the best I've seen on a tablet.  I don't think I could've made a wiser choice and I must commend Amazon for the quality of their products.  Kindle Fire HD is well worth the price with outstanding quality and performance.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!! but....
Reviews.Author: Patience Gray
Reviews.Content: I really really wish there was a way to customize the screen saver.. I'd like to put a picture of my kids instead of seeing random pictures... this is in my opinion the fire hd's flaw.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: crystal
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire that now I have to get the kindle HD.  I'm going to give my fire to my daughter when I get the new HD one. She is so excited because she has seen how this works and is no way interested in an ipad now. She wants this instead. She has a laptop but if I'm at her house with my kindle she puts her laptop down and loves this..Thanks amazon for me finding you and all your great products.  And Amazon prime is worth every bit of it. Thanks again. I tell everyone about you and I have gotten a lot of thank yous for telling them about you and the prime also

Reviews.Title: This thing is AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Amy Hurt "hurt"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I'm beyong impressed. The sound quality is excellent, the scene is so vivid and crystal clear. It's sleek and lightweight. It's super easy to navigate. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jennifer King
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD for my daughter, and she absolutly LOVES it.  The sound is so much better than the original Fire, the memory is doubled, and the Skype is also a new bonus!  I have the 3g version older model of the Kindle which I am quite happy with, but I must say, it has been fun playing around on hers.  Angry Birds is a blast to play on it,,,LOL!  I do wish the 3G was an option because we live in an area that makes it much more covienant to have when we are not at home.  Very happy with this purchase!  Side note: The other reviews I read before purchasing had alot of complaint about the ads and the $15.00 it cost to have them removed,  I dont know if Amazon fixed this problem, but we are not seeing any at all! Thank goodness!

Reviews.Title: Had 1st version& now 2nd
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I loved the kindle fire. Although not sold on the fact the new one is better.I  actually liked feel of other one in my hand better  even if this one is thinner& its suppose to be faster but seems slower to me. And all the ads take away from the experience. I heard you can pay to remove them?? How/help!! Plus new version no longer comes with charger!! Still a good tablet for your buck though.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE!
Reviews.Author: Angelique
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my kindle!!! Best thing ever! There is nothing that I would change about it. I brought my kindle so I could read PDF articles for school. I am able to do that. I find myself reading more now that I have my kindle. I dont have to keep the light on at night.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Sleek, beautiful screen, a joy to hold in your hand!Lightweight, like a paperback book...but thinner, of course.Just entered the WiFi connect passwords, so haven't used it yet,but wanted to give feedback & let you know how quickly it was received.Shipped from Houston (I'm guessing) to a SW suburb, so didn't expect to see ituntil Thursday (Oct 4th)...so thrilled to have it early.Amazon website is so easy to use and LOVE using it, so I'm sure I will love my Kindle, too!I really like to spend my  $$$$ where I enjoy & use the website(s)and receive great customer service.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: MissRN2011
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire had is my first tablet so I do not have anything to compare it to. I pre-ordered when I saw it was coming out I was very excited. I t was delivered as promised.I love that I can do just about anything on here. But I have noticed there aren't as many apps I can use on here also I hear a static sound when I turn on my kindle and as of today I noticed my sound going out when I listen to music and movies. Other than that I really enjoy it

Reviews.Title: Nice job on the display, Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Randall Magliozzi "GadgetGuy"
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle Fire HD and thought I'd share some initial feedback.Really like:* Display is super crisp* Interface is pretty easy to figure out (read/watch the demo!)* The ads show up really tiny at the bottom - it's not a bother at all - some reviewer made it sound like they were annoying but they're not.  Helpful and well placed.  Thanks.* Size - couldn't be smaller or largerNow I messed up activating this so my books are not download from my library.  But I'll hopefully have that figured out soon enough.

Reviews.Title: you will be fine depends on your options and ability to compromise
Reviews.Author: La Luz de la Luna
Reviews.Content: Ok, so despite all the great review that people had over this tablet. We all recognized that Amazon specifically didn't specify the operating system of its tablet on the website. My intention of finding an Android tablet was so that I can reload other paid apps that I had on Google store. So the great excitement of getting a new tablet soon bypass as I opened the tablet and recognized that the operating system was configured so that it will benefit the Amazon app store (go figure!) and there was no way I could have done to load the google app store down to the tablet. I am a student, all I needed was some dictionary and the office suite (documents to go that I paid). No way for me to re-enter the product key into the trial version.Hey if you find that you could not compete with other companies making tablets, don't make one! If you make one, we, the customer should be able to really OWN the tablet after we buy it. Not that we are strictly led to your limited market with whatever app that was a fraction of the play store. I know that documents to go is compatible with my tablet. I know there are many more medical dictionary (free apps) on play store. I hate this tablet due to the software now and plan to return it sometimes in a near future.Thanks Amazon!P.S.: I really love using Amazon buying my books and things like usual. I just hate this tablet and me being forced into one market. There was no longer freedom. That was what I hated.***Update on 7/18/13I am just now starting to love my kindle fire hd despite the fact that I couldn't customize the home screen a lot like with other common android tablets. Just a few days ago, documents to go full key was available for free on AMAZONappstore. I am happy that my problems is now solved. In the end, I am happy with the purchase/investment that I made on my kindle. Happily ever after!! ^_^

Reviews.Title: Only one thing lacking
Reviews.Author: Allen J
Reviews.Content: When receiving this amazing product you will have a shock. You spend all this money to find out that the adapter to plug in the Kindle is EXTRA? When you have an amazing product, something as simple as this 19.99 (excluded necessity) taints this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindel HD  Love It
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: My wife does not drive anymore and we live way out in the country.  That means that  I drive her when she goes shopping, doctor visits, and where ever she wants or needs to go.  Without  my Kindle HD I would be one lost person.  Now the hours of waiting fly byand I retain my sanity.  Thank YouMichael Lipsitz

Reviews.Title: This is advertised as 16gb but it is only 12.6gb out of the box
Reviews.Author: R. Farretta "autism360"
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special OffersI just found out that my 16gb kindle is only 12.6gb from the factory which means that I lost almost 25% of my storage capacity before taking the item out of the box!!!!!I asked if I could send it back and pay to upgrade it to a 32 gb model since I have only owned it 1 day but I was told no because I got it as a gift and have no receipt.I emailed customer service a second time and asked nicely for them to allow me to upgrade and was told no again. I actually like the kindle so far but feel like I was deceived since it is almost 25% less storage than advertised and it would have only cost 1-2 dollars extra for Amazon to add the additional storage when it was built to give the advertised storage capacity. If I had known it was only 12.6 gb of usable storage I would have opted for the 32gb.Since this was marketed as a 16gb model without disclosing in clear consumer friendly terms that it was only 12.6gb of actual storage and I am unable to upgrade because I got this as a gift I am not a happy camper. Would you be?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Loses Movies and Amazon won't fix
Reviews.Author: Stuart A. Lichtman
Reviews.Content: I have purchased and download movies to the device. But when I get out of wifi range, the device indicates there are no movies present. Amazon refuses to fix this obviously defective device that two hours of my time with their tech has not fixed.DON'T BUY!

Reviews.Title: Almost didn't get one
Reviews.Author: K. Collins
Reviews.Content: I always look at reviews before a big purchase and this was no exception.  Big complaints were about the ads.  Well, all I can say if the people that gave the Fire HD fewer than 5 stars based solely on the ads, then these people must have fairly miserable lives and look for ANYTHING possible to complain about.  It would be nice to have your own pic on the opening screen and the the screen ads are a little repetitive.  The ads after you open the Kindle, recommended based on your current selection, I think, are absolutely genius.  I love the recommendations.  I just finished a book a couple weeks ago (enjoying it very much, I might add) and lo and behold there is another 2 books in the series, I knew NOTHING about!!!  I picked up the second book for free thru Prime and will get the other later.  I wouldn't known about the others without the recommended reads,  SOOO, I am personally glad it's there.  I had the Kindle Fire 1st gen and loved it.  I was a little apprehensive about getting the HD after some of the negative comments, but I am glad I got this one. My favorite things that are better than 1st gen Fire is the wifi.  I get MUCH better wifi reception.  The battery, I would estimate lasts about twice as long.  It charges lickety split (from 15 to 30% in about 10 min).  I love the xray feature if you forget who a character is.  I watched a video ( which I never did on the Fire) and it was absolutely crisp and clear with no hickups in transmission.  I absolutely would recommend the Fire HD.  What a fantastic tablet!!!!

Reviews.Title: Superb customer service
Reviews.Author: Sharon S. Leung
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle Fire HD 7" when it first came out (Sep 2012). The audio did not work for the past 2 days, so I called customer service.  After some troubleshooting, it still did not work.  They shipped me a brand new one WITHIN 24 HOURS.  I called yesterday, and I received it today.  That's SERVICE!!  Very customer-centered service!!  Thank you, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Unexpectedly Changed my life...
Reviews.Author: Amos Desrosiers
Reviews.Content: I am a technofile and have been in the technology consulting game for over 15 years.I also hold the dubious distinction of having to select and support all of technology choices for the family (To the degree that I now have to wear a "No I Will NOT Fix Your Computer!" T-Shirt to family functions.My daughter has had a Kindle for a while now. She had the older black and white version. She is rough on her gear and went through four of them over the last 2 years. Because of this My thoughts on Kindle has been, "great idea, poor execution".This was my feeling until I had a credit on Amazon and decided to try out the Fire HD 7". I received it in the mail on the quick thanks to my Amazon Prime membership and I was off to the races.The form factor is solid, the capacitive multi touch screen is very smooth and responsive (as good as my Apple devices for sure)and its just under $200.00. It is also very solid and sturdy. There are NO issues connecting to all types of WIFI as I have had with some of my other tablets. It just simply works.Another thing that I really dig is how great movies look. I converted a 1080p copy of Prometheus to 720p MP4 using the free Any Video Converter and all I can say is WOW!! It looks and sounds great. The Amazon store is easy to use and it is also just as easy to move Ebooks (mobi files) over to my new Kindle.Now this is NOT an I-Pad but when coupled with an IPhone, I am never without a connection to the internet and always have access to new content and updates.I have had my Kindle Fire HD for a month and I am on my 25th book since then. In my youth I devoured books and now I am at it again thanks to Kindle.Another tip would be to download and install Calibre, it is an opensource app that allows you to organize and install books to your kindle. In my opinion it is the best way to manage your books.For years I have read nothing but technical manuals and study guides. I got more than I bargained for here and I suspect that others who at one time have enjoyed to read will too.Thanks Amazon, You are changing lives and culture!NO I DO NOT WORK FOR AMAZON NOR AM I PAID TO REVIEW THEM. :)I don't even write many reviews.

Reviews.Title: Yes..but
Reviews.Author: Chanel G
Reviews.Content: Got this as a birthday gift from my aunt she loves it! I love it and its not even mine . the only thing i would recommend is that it not be shipped in the exact Kindle box because people steal! would rather it be shipped in an amazon box!

Reviews.Title: Bought As A Gift...
Reviews.Author: John Christensen
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a friend who is a mom and was on a vacation driving her kids, and wanted a device her kids could use in the car to play games, watch videos, and just keep them occupied.  The mom is a big reader, and after they returned from vacation, she uses the Kindle, and the the kids have to beg for it!  The Kindle Fire HD 7" did the trick!

Reviews.Title: I love this little beauty!
Reviews.Author: J. B Kraft "lonestargazer"
Reviews.Content: REVISED 12/14/2012 to correct an error about the ads.REVISED 1/23/2013 to state that I was astounded when I watched the film "Taken 2" on it on how great the "surround" sound effects were out of just two teeny speakers. Just amazing!I am a prolific reader, both for pleasure and related to my profession as a a lawyer. This is the fourth Kindle our family has owned so far, and I have had it about a week so far, and here are my initital thoughts.My wife and I each have owned Kindle DXs -- wonderful devices in their own right. Mine failed (screen) about a month ago (after 30 months), but the Kindle Fire, after a year, had transformed my reading habits in bed at night. The DX, to be honest, was a bit too heavy for comfortable reading in bed, AND the external light required you to have it clipped in the binder, making the light uneven and the DX even heavier. The Kindle Fire (1st generation) was just right for reading in bed, and it did a lot of things dependably and well, but the Kindle Silk web surfing software was good but not great. I have been waiting to purchase a Microsoft Surface Pro tablet, which looks like it won't be out for a couple of months, and thought of just passing on a new Kindle, but the Surface's delay caused me to re-evaluate my needs. It seemed I really didn't need an iPad substitute, because the tablet would handle those issues, but I needed a new reader and a small one to keep reading in bed.I did buy the 32GB version because I have a LOT of books, but decided the larger screen was unnecessary in view of the upcoming Microsoft Surface or Ipad for my office. Amazon thoughtfully preloaded my collection into it, and after storing ALL 410 titles on it, I have hardly made a dint in storage. This makes if possible to store a movie or two, or even a few hundred songs. I'm using less than 3GB of storage on mine so far.INITIAL THOUGHTS(1) First of all, it seemed a bit iritating (and chinchy) that it comes only with a USB charging cable and not with a wall adapter. Then, I've discovered that my OLD Kindle Fire chargers do a very good job of charging this one -- in fact, I can't tell too much difference in the time using the fast charger, and they will keep the charge while I'm watching streaming video. It is easy to keep it charged in the car or in the various spots around my home and office. This turns out to be a good thing, because BATTERY LIFE IS A LITTLE LESS THAN I EXPECTED.(2) The "readability" of the screen is just astounding -- text is so crisp it appears printed. Much better than the original Fire in my opinion. I quickly scanned through all the fonts and they all look good. Screen choices are still black text on white; black on sepia, and white on black.(3) The high-def screen makes streaming movies look gorgeous and streaming has been fast and uninterrupted from Amazon and Netflix and HBO2GO.(4) As a lawyer, documents (big PDF books) are huge in my life, and the Amazon Cloud makes it so easy to load them (and music and video) on the Fire HD, it's amazing. Amazon also certainly improved the internal assumptions the device makes on displaying a PDF document, making them much more pleasing visually and easier (but not a breeze) to navigate through. This, for me, is a super improvement. The Amazon cloud player for this purpose is great and so easy to install and use.(5) There are a number of custom "techie" things you can do like swap out the Amazon Silk browser for an Android brouser -- chiefly if you want to see "flash" documents. I have not tried this yet, but with the 32GB version, there's no reason not to have both.(6) I got the simple (purple in my) leather case with mine, along with a plastic screen protector as a bundle. The case attaches very simply, and does a good job of protecting it (maybe not great --I have an Otter case on order if I take it out in the woods or park). The leather case puts the Fire HD in "sleep mode" when you close it magnetically. I also got a rubber tipped stylus in the hopes of minimizing smudges on the glass. It's possible that the plastic screen protector does interfere with the stylus (by not being as slick as glass). You may want to check that out if you're a stylus junkie before putting the plastic on there -- anyway, the rubber tip (think pencil eraser) doesn't quite "glide" over the plastic. Consequently I don't love the stylus, so unless you have an app that requires it, it's not a great addition. I still prefer my fingers to the stylus, but then I don't draw on the thing.(7) And the sound -- I'm a music lover with a huge music collection and these little speakers sound GOOD. And when you plug in some quality headphones or buds, the sound quality is exceptional. When I'm home, I now plug in my several hundred dollar Sennheiser and musical appls like Pandora or even listening to your Amazon music from the cloud really brings the music "to life" compared to the 1st generation Kindle Fire.(8) At night, when I finish reading, I can select some quiet music from Pandora, and then set the alarm clock feature to wake me the next morning -- you get plenty of volume for that.(9) I really like the operating system. It seems "snappier" than the original. Almost everything is intuitive if you are moving up from the first generation Fire, and I understand it is otherwise similar to most Android tablets.(10) When you have wi-fi, you can Skype or video conference with this baby. It's not beautiful, but it's adequate -- certainly as good as most smart phones.(11) "Read aloud text" disappeared from the Kindle Fire, but it's back on the HD and it's generally satisfying, meaning that I can put this on the seat by me in the car and turn the volume up and get by. It's not quite up to the voice of a great narrator, but it's useful if your eyes get tired. Now, if it would just work on an Adobe PDF document!QUIRKS AND DISAPPOINTMENTS:(1) No device design is perfect, and the Kindle Fire HD 7" tablet has some quirks. The first question is why put the charger input on the side where the cover opens? By doing this, you can't set the Fire HD on your nightstand or table in landscape (to watch a video) and leave it charging using the open edge of the cover as a "bi-pod" to stand it up for you to watch it. Maybe there was a profound technical reason, but this seems remarkably inconvenient as compared to the older Kindle Fire, which charges from the "top".(2) Another quirk is the rocker switch for volume included next to the power button on what is usually the "top" when in portrait mode for the device. It works splendidly as an adjunct to bringing up the volume slider in the app. However, the left rocker increases the sound and the right rocker decreases it -- which I greeted with all the joy of disovering the builder had reversed the hot and cold faucets in the shower in the new home you just bought. You can adjust to this quirk, but one wonders "who did this?" Is it some convention where the device was built in China?(3) I think they should have included a GPS chip so we would have real map-reading capability. It will "infer" location from your wi-fi, and it seems fairly accurate, but we are NOT always at with wi-fi access when we want to know the weather or whether there's a movie or a bar or a Starbuck's nearby. I get a 76 yard probability of error on my office location, which is certainly adequate for a small town. In a large city with a lot of free WAPs downtown, I would think it would be more accurate, but I haven't had a chance to test that theory.(4) There is constant "others who've purchased this item . . . bought the following".  You get this when you load an app or a book or movie and , below it Amazon helpfully reminds me that people who bought this app also bought these other fine products. YOU CAN TURN THIS OFF IN THE SYSTEM SETTINGS..(5) Finally, my biggest beef is now I am bombarded with ads when I turn the device on as a "splash screen". Now the only real complaint I have about the device (and I would have bought the Fire HD anyway knowing it) is it bugs me to get ads when I'm not shopping.  I understand there was a $15.00 "advertisers subsidy" to the price, and if so, I'll gladly send Amazon an additional $15.00 to turn it off AND let me put a splash screen I like on it.(6)Don't get me wrong! I love Amazon and think it is one of the single greatest game changers of my lifetime. I hate to shop, and it makes life so much easier and more pleasant to do so, when I can see the recommendations and experiences of hundreds of thousands of other people with products I am considering. But that is WHEN I AM SHOPPING! When I am settling into a new movie or a delicious new book, I don't care what other people bought at that moment, and I don't want to be distracted by these ads. Maybe you can turn them off, and I'll be looking hard for a way to do it. Clarifying, I DON'T MIND the ads when I open one of the "stores", but I don't want them all the time. That's just intruding on my peace.If you have an older family member who is technically afraid of computers, but who would love to be able to read a little email from their grandkids and see pictures of them, this bright screen and relative simplicity may be enough for them to overcome their computer fears and help them keep in touch.SO OVERALL:(1) Sceen readability for books -- A+(2) Screen for video -- A-(3) Sound quality -- A(4) Storage capacity -- A(5) Flexibility of use -- A+ -- simply incredible.(6) Operating system -- B (because of those damn subsidizing ads)(7) Battery life -- best guess is 4-6 hours with wi-fi on. If you want to read a long book and listen to music (you can do BOTH at the same time -- how cool is that?), but you'd better have a charging source available when it gets to around 25% or less.SUMMARY -- MUST HAVE! -- make your own decision on whether the ads are worth $15 to you. (By the way, the ads ARE very tasteful.)MUST HAVE!

Reviews.Title: Did my homework and it paid off
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before making this purchase. I bought this for both me and my wife and we both love it. My wife is a big reader and choose the Kindle over the Nook for a few reasons....first she was afraid that Barn and Noble would not hold in the market as well as the Kindle with book stores closing in the past and want to be sure that the purchase was with a company only growing in the next generation. I love it because of the great picture and sound...well worth the price. Would I recomend this product? that's not even a question....of course. 5 stars and I know Amazon and so does my wife, she knows where to shop.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I debated for a long time between the ipad and the Kindle. Frankly, I can do almost everything I can think of with the Kindle. That's why I chose it over the ipad. I already operate my away-from-wi-fi stuff on my Droid Razor, i.e. phone, car navigation, maps, etc. I just saw no point in forking over another $200+ for a bunch of gimmicks. Amazon's store has the books, movies and music I use the tablet for. Plus the Kindle easily goes online for web browsing around any wi-fi connection, the h-d really looks good, and the speakers are outstanding! Any help I've ever needed from Amazon - mostly having to do with the app on my Droid smartphone - has always been handled quickly and efficiently. If I ever have any issues with the Kindle, I'm confident they'll be handled the same way.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: D. Howard
Reviews.Content: I've had two Kindle e-readers before buying this. I upgraded to the Fire HD to include music on the device, to stream from my LoveFilm account, and for the backlit screen (I don't sleep much, and wanted to be able to read without turning the lights on).As you've guessed from the title of this review, I love this device. The screen is excellent, clear and vivid whether reading a book or watching video. The speakers are the best I've encountered on any mobile device, including my iPad 4, iPhone 4 or Galaxy Note. The sound is amazingly clear, even at (impressively high) volume, through both the built-in speakers or through headphones. Linking my existing LoveFilm account wasn't quite as straightforward as the instructions had me expecting, but still didn't take long, and the Fire HD handles the streaming video very well. It doesn't let you access the Google Play app store, pointing you instead at Amazon's own much more limited app store, but to be honest I don't find this a problem. I didn't choose the Fire HD because I wanted a ton of apps, I chose it because of it's seamless integration with Amazon's Kindle store and LoveFilm. If you're app-obsessed buy a Nexus 7 instead.I'd love to give this device the full five stars but it'll never get the last star until Amazon add the ability to group books into collections as you can on the regular e-readers. Without this feature, the collection on the device quickly becomes cluttered, and it's already hard to find the specific book I'm looking for. It makes no sense to omit this incredibly useful feature from their most advanced devices, and is one of the reasons I still use my e-reader as well (the other being the staggering battery life of those devices).If Amazon add the missing collections feature to make managing the device's library easier it'll deserve the full five stars, no question. But even so, if you're not going to maintain a large book library on the device then I can't recommend this enough.

Reviews.Title: even better then the older fire
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: I've had the HD fire for about a month now and I love it!! I had the original kindle fire when they first came out and i loved that one too, but the HD version is even better.  the screen and picture are almost as nice as my TV, most of the games i've played have looked nearly as good, but the videos are where it's at.  If you have a fire then you really need to spend the $ and have amazon prime the free shipping about pays for it's self but the tv shows and movies you can watch for free is amazing

Reviews.Title: 7" Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Sherri Leasum "Sherri Leasum forestwolf"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY FIRE HD. I was fortunate enough to win one and I love it. THE DOLBY speakers rock, the HD quality is great. It is a bit heavy but still very portable. No it is not an Ipad, but it IS a GREAT LITTLE TABLET. and Let me add this.. a good friend just got the Ipad Mini.. it is lighter, it is slightly faster.. MY DEFINITION IS A LITTLE BETTER and MY FIRE HD will find and HOLD a wifi signal faster and better than his Mini.. It comes down to A) price point B) which ecosystem that you are more invested in. C) what tasks you are needing to perform.. If you are using it for business .. go Ipad, if you have tons of stuff on Itunes and can afford the extra 200+/-, then go with the ipad. but if you are heavily invested in Kindle e-books and are a Prime member and LOVE FREE stuff given to you EVERY SINGLE DAY OF THE YEAR.. then go with Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: a godsend
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Stockton "professor barb"
Reviews.Content: I also bought this for my husband who can only use one hand. He is really enjoying it and is leaning many technical tricks. The IT support crew at Amazon is so patient and helpful to him too. This is his fourth Kindle and probably not the last.

Reviews.Title: Amazing! Better than iPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recieved the Kindle Fire HD 7 inch as a gift from my husband a month ago. I wanted to test it out for a few weeks before writing a review. So far, its amazing. I'll break the review into sections and try to keep it to-the-point. We also own an iPad, and iPad 2.(Style, Weight)The HD 7 inch is definitely heavier than an iPad but i find the outside design/style to be more appealing. The buttons are practically invisible, everything is sleek and nice to look at. It feels good in your hands and is easier to hold than iPad because of its smaller frame. Nothing sticks out and everything is smooth.(Operation)It does take up to 30 seconds for mine to fully start-up and be functional which is alot slower than iPad, but the way the Fire HD functions itself is much better. I love the carousel and how it shows your most recently used apps, games, web sites, and books. When you rest over the top of a particular book or app, the bottom row shows you similar recently purchased items by other Amazon customers which i find extremely helpful. The top navigation bar allows you to sort through Apps, Books, Games, Web, Newsstand, etc and once you choose a category you can then sort those by Cloud or Device. In my opinion (i love organizing) this setup is way better than the iPad. The settings are also easier to understand and access, by the top pull-down menu bar. It lets you access your most important settings such as Brightness, WiFi, Screen Lock/Unlock, etc within seconds. Makes it so much easier to adjust my brightness when im reading a book without even closing the book - in order to do that on iPad you'd have to go to the Home screen, Settings, Brightness and adjust it there, then back to Home screen and back to your book. iPad just uses alot more steps in order to function. There are many things you can change on the Kindle without ever leaving your book or app.(Store)This is my only complaint and the reason i only gave this 4 stars - my store is a pain to use. Wether im trying to buy books, apps, or games it takes several minutes to load... or sometimes doesnt load at all. The Fire HD boasts better internet speeds compared to iPad but i would not say thats true. I have high speed sattelite internet which words great on my Macbook, Android phones, and iPads and works terrible on my Kindle Fire HD. I often have to refresh the app store 10 times (or more) in a row only to find that it just wont work and ill have to come back and try again later.All-in-all i love this products and would pick it over the iPad or iPad Mini any day. I primarily use it for e-books but find im buying more and more apps and games as time goes on. Just an all around amazing device. I wish my app store wasnt so terrible and it was a tad lighter in weight but i can deal with it.

Reviews.Title: Kindlefire HD
Reviews.Author: Clayton W. Freeark "Clay"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent tablet, very versatile.  It is easy to use and fast to respond.  The screen is perhaps a little too sensitive for 80 year old fingers; I keep getting things I don't want at the moment, but I can live with it.  My wife and I liked the first Kindlefire so well we immediately bought a second.  My only complaint is:  The documentation, what little there is of it, is  woefullly inadequate and customer service, while prompt, is poor.  I have made the same inquiry three times.  Twice I have received completely erroneous information and the third time they answered a question I didn't ask.  Learning to use the Kindlefire is strictly a matter of trial and eror, search and experiment.  I never have found a way to delete stuff I no longer want and the camera function still eludes me.

Reviews.Title: Accessibility package in KF HD 7" not the same as 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Ohio Reader "Elderly, bookish person, omnivor...
Reviews.Content: I didn't need the complete accessibility package found in the 8.9" model which can be set to speak the names of all the command buttons and narrate system actions, but wanted text-to-speech and the great sound of the KF HD 8.9" in a package that fits my hands more securely. The 7" Kindle Fire HD performs just as well as the 8.9" model. The screen is many times more visible than that of the original 7" Kindle Fire from which I am upgrading. Just wanted to let people know that, at this time, only the 8.9" size has accessibility features that make it useable by the blind, so if that's the use contemplated, the larger version is obviously what you would need. Not sure why they wouldn't put the complete accessibility package in the 7" KF HD. Perhaps there'll be an upgrade eventually. During lengthy reading sessions, both KF HD models feel more secure in the hands with a genuine leather cover. I tried a couple of cheaper types of cover (shiny and then rough vinyl) and found them slippery and finally downright unpleasant when hands began to sweat. I strongly recommend the Powerfast charger that allows plugging the tablet into an electrical outlet. It only takes about 2 hours to fully charge the tablet whereas plugging the USB cable into the computer takes all night and is not always the best thing for your computer's power supply. Also, this time I chose the 16 G memory rather than the 32. With everything always available on the cloud, there's no need to store a lot of stuff on the tablet unless you're going to be away from wifi for extended periods. Additionally, I found that the #3 format for Audible books sounds just fine on the Kindle Fire HD and requires much less download time and storage space. Am I sending back my 8.9" tablet? No. It's being passed on to a friend who has lost much of his sight and can appreciate all of the accessibility features and the larger memory.

Reviews.Title: Amazing but buggy
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: I owned the previous kindle. As a 19 year old college student, I love to read constantly, so the kindle is a perfect product for me. I get to surf the internet, read books, enjo picstures and even have my textbooks in pdf with me on the go. I love this product and I sincerely think that Amazon did an amazing job by pricing this incredibly useful product at such a low price.The only problem is that it seems buggy because there are some problems with audio and the display.Regardless, this is a great kindle and I love it

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: jmadison62
Reviews.Content: I was reasonably happy with my older Kindle Fire and was not really in the market for a new one. I saw an advertisement for the Kindle Fire HD, talked to a couple people who had purchased it, and decided I had to have one. I am so glad I did. I have Amazon Prime and have gotten more value from it (streaming videos, etc.) than I did before this device. I have found I really do not even need to use a stylus most of the time, which is very convenient. WiFi is the way to go for ease of use because transferring books and other media via USB might be a little confusing for new users who do not have it.

Reviews.Title: A Newbee
Reviews.Author: ANITA
Reviews.Content: l am a newbee to electronics and having great fun with my first innovation  to the computer. Very easy navigating to the features. Having big fun. I'm 64 year young

Reviews.Title: my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Patricia Robair "Pat Robair"
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Kindle.  I just keep upgrading.  I love my new Kindle HD.  I don't think people realize how much you can do with it.For less than 2.00 you can download a camera....with editing tools!  The App Store has so many apps for this device and many are free or just .99! I love the calendars, planners and Word Pad.Everything is easier and better than with the First Generation Fire.  You can access email and FB from your opening screen.  I have yet to explore all the added features.I does need to be charged almost daily but that just may be because I use it more than I used my first Fire.Pat Robair

Reviews.Title: Fire Roasted Apples!!
Reviews.Author: RichardC
Reviews.Content: If I could give my Kindle Fire HD Fat 32 a higher rating than five stars I would! Great product guys! I synced my computer to my Fire and off to school I go. Save your money....Buy the Kindle....You can accessorize well with the difference you would have paid with the Apple Mini. Get More...Pay Less. I love it!!

Reviews.Title: A Huge Improvement
Reviews.Author: Alexander Canovas
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade from my first-gen Kindle Fire this past Thursday, and received my Kindle Fire HD on Friday (3.99 One-Day Shipping is totally worth the money). My biggest complaints from using the first-gen Kindle Fire mostly revolved around the high number of software glitches; Silk, Facebook, Twitter etc. would glitch and shut down at random, which made for a really subpar user experience.If Amazon's goal with the Kindle Fire HD was to fix all of the issues that the first-gen Kindle Fire had, then it has succeeded and then some. The updates to the KFHD's book reader software are particularly awesome, and it's nice to see that Amazon did not just rest on it's laurels in its most highly developed software. The e-mail software is also spectacular. It far exceeds my Android phone's e-mail client, and I really enjoy how simple it is to use. I use ActiveSync Exchange for my work e-mail and it's just awesome.The camera is really great as well! I downloaded Photo Editor, which I use as a front-facing camera to take embarrassing candids of my family, which has been a ton of fun. Skype is also really wonderful; the image quality is great as long as your connection is good!The speakers are quite simply the best tablet speakers out there right now. The sound is fantastic and rarely grainy or distorted.I think the biggest area for improvement would be the selection of apps available. Now that the hardware for the KFHD is top notch, Amazon really needs to step up it's game in securing rights to offer more apps, although this has gotten a lot better in the past few months.I opted to include special offers, and I'm happy I did; the ads are beautiful, and mostly appear at the lock screen when the KF wakes up from sleep mode. Don't waste your $15 on getting rid of the ads.Keep up the good work, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: All I Need in a Tablet
Reviews.Author: Nik D. Click
Reviews.Content: Last year I bought my wife the Kindle Fire as a gift. We use it daily for a multitude of tasks. It has virtually eliminated our laptop from our lives. I found myself using my smartphone to do the same and decided to upgrade to myvown Kindle.The Fire HD is a step forward in almost every way from the original Fire. Crisp screen, better ( not perfect) touch recognition, more internal memory, improved interface and sound.Some gripes remain. Battery life has not been kind to us. Perhaps it is because we use our Kindles daily for long periods of time to read, stream video and browse the web but we have to charge them CONSTANTLY. The browser/Kindle also tends to lock up and crash and the Kindle will occasionally "forget" the Prime membership attached to my account, causing undue charges. Amazon is always good about clearing these up, it just becomes a nuisance.I would buy another Kindle Fire HD in a heartbeat. I practically haven't let it out of my sight since I received it. Despite the flaws, it is still an amazing value and provides my household everything it needs in a tablet. I don't mind letting my children handle it as it is sturdy and should something happen to it, I'm not out $800. I would not give up my Kindle for any other tab out there.

Reviews.Title: pleased wife
Reviews.Author: Marshall
Reviews.Content: Bought the kindle fire HD for the wife so she could facebook and play games. the sound is outstanding in my book,and it keeps the wife entertained as well as the son with the games she has on it.

Reviews.Title: MY NEW TOY
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special OffersI love my Kindle fire HD RECOMMEND IT In Fact I have recommended it to all my friends.  Love the reasonable prices and REALLY Love all the FREE BOOKS Love to read same with games havent tried the movies yet

Reviews.Title: Kindle hd
Reviews.Author: Richard Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought a kindle, my favorite thing ever; and I liked it so much I bought it for a couple for friends. So I tried the other greatest thing ever, my new Kindle Fire HD. It is my favorite thing now that I have ever had. Hope to keep the prime membership too. This is the coolest thing I've ever had and I'm pretty old. This was so worth it! Didn't know what you called ads were recommendations. I was ready to pay the $15.00 to be ad free but don't want to give up suggestions that I might be interested in. Amazon has been right so many times on my interests, I won't be second guessing them anytime soon.Rich

Reviews.Title: Brilliant, intuitive, and sounds amazing!
Reviews.Author: Pamela F. Kaplan "pfkaplan1"
Reviews.Content: I am so thrilled with my purchase of the Kindle Fire HD... that I pre-ordered the 8.9 inch and when that arrives will give this 7" to a family member so they can enjoy.  this is the best tool ever. I've had an android phone and was thrilled when I discovered the power of android.. this is android magnified in terms of what can be done. the video and screen colors are vibrant, the sound is better than my tv!, and very very functional. I recommend!Only reason I downgraded to 4 stars is because can't do attachments with gmail. ....at least I haven't figured out how yet.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Madison
Reviews.Content: This is such an awesome tablet, and if you are thinking about getting it, don't think anymore, just buy it!! It is so easy to read. You can change the background, font, and size. It also includes text-to-speech, which means, it can read to you(for mostly younger kids). Their are millions of books, music, movies, games and more! It is so awesome and it is worth every cent you pay! Buy it today!

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: kristen
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my kindle. Its very easy to use and I use it for everything, email, pinterest, facebook, reading, and netflix. The only thing i don't really like about it is that unlike a tablet you can't personalize it w a background and screen saver, but its not a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" 16gb -- Love it!
Reviews.Author: deb217
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special OffersI have every generation of kindle ereader (as well as the 1st generation Kindle Fire). I debated between the Kindle Fire HD and the Paperwhite 3g (I chose the Kindle Fire HD 16gb). By the way, I still carry my Kindle 3 3g or Kindle Touch 3g with me everywhere. So they haven't gone by the wayside. I also own an iPad so I don't need the Nexus (The Apple Mini might be worth taking a look).Here are some reasons I like the Fire HD:1. I can adjust the screen brightness to fit my comfort zone.2. I love the ability to listen to a book with text to speech.3. I love the whispersync and immersion. This alone is a good reason to get the Fire HD. You buy the book FIRST and are offered a reduced price on the audible edition. The audible edition loads automatically on the book. Then you can choose to listen and/or read the book. The text is highlighted and pages are turned automatically which is handy when you are busy doing something else.4. I can watch the purchased movies or the Amazon Prime movies on my Kindle HD or connect it to my tv with a HDMI cable (sold separately).5. I can purchase music and use this device to listen to my music.6. Books with illustrations and color pictures are shown in HD and with clarity.7. Photos can be uploaded.8. With the camera, I can skype with friends (where there is wifi).9. I like the bluetooth to connect to bluetooth devices (keyboard, headphones, speakers, etc).10. The recommendations don't bother me -- if they do turn the Kindle to landscape and you don't see them). I find the recommendations interesting. They are not distracting to me.I don't buy the game apps. So cannot speak to them.Bottom-line, I'm glad I chose the Fire HD. With the $20 difference in price I feel I made the right choice for me. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: aMaZiNg
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I already owned the first kindle fire and loved it, but my husband started reading the Hunger Games Trilogy on it and I realized how valuable it really was to me.  I ordered the new kindle fire HD the day they announced it and it was the same price as my previous kindle fire. Amazon is amazingly thoughtful with their pricing and quality, as well as their customer service.  I love the HD. It is even faster than my kindle fire. The stereo sound is fantastic, the picture is so perfect that I actually watched a movie on it.  With the HDMI, we can hook the kindle fire HD up to our television and play movies we get with Prime membership. It also has Skype.  We can share music, movies and books since we have two kindles. I love everything about it and am so glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: The reader that reads
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the brilliant color first. I was also impressed by the videoes and the flexibility of being able to hook the Fire HD to my Tv. I was impressed that I could press words on my Bible scriptures and get the meaning of those words.I was impressed that everything that was loaded on my kindle reader was available to me on my Kindle Fire HD. But what impressed me most about the Fire HD was the ability of the Fire HD to give audio to all the books in my library. The reader that reads

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Cynthia McQuillin
Reviews.Content: I had already owned a Kindle for reading. I am able to read my granddaughter books in color now. We watch movies together. It is really like a tiny TV in your lap.I love having access to the web since I just had surgery, it is amazing! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing alternative to iPad
Reviews.Author: Ruel Cortez
Reviews.Content: This is my first kindle after using apple products for a while, my last device was iPod touch 2nd Gen. I skipped buying 1st and 2nd Gen of iPad and was planned to go ahead with iPad 3 due to high resolution screen and better hardware. I did not care much with 4G since I have Wifi both home and work.Due to its initial SRP, this made me wait for sometime then suddenly I bumped to Kindle Fire, it was fraction of the cost of iPad and I was supposed to buy one already but my friend told me a new version of which is Kindle Fire HD was due to be released by 14 September.  I waited for a while then I it was a great decision. I bought this amazing product from Amazon. This is perfect size for my need since I need to read pdfs/e-books and normally on the bed, the weight also did not burden my hands since its light. Most importantly the screen is HD at 1280x800 despite its size at 7" compared to Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 which is only 1024 X 600. The dual core 1.2GHz  with 1 GB RAM is responsive, scrolling through pages, icons and web pages is silky smooth. Compared to other Android devices this is fully modified by Amazon which benefits Amazons and users fairly in terms of additional layer of security against Malware and viruses. Though the only issue is that it won't allow you to easily install third party apps such from GooglePlay, but frankly speaking Appstore from Amazon will surely give you tons of relevant apps for your needs. Speakers are good with their exclusive Dolby Digital Plus decoding but not loud (unless you install SpeakerBoost, Free and official Kindle Fire HD app you can find from Appstore. Playing graphic/processor eater game such as Ashpalt 7 runs smoothly without any issues. HD videos from Youtube or Amazon Videos plays really well and in "real" HD. Facebook runs buttery as well. I can confirm there are very few times that it lags or some apps stopped working, but is not big deal for me. Bottom line is you wont regret buying this cool stuff, instead of getting a cheapo generic Android device which costs around US$100, add few more bucks then you get this. A great alternative to iPad. very handy and amazing audio and video. Highly recommended! Will probably get one for my daughter as well..

Reviews.Title: Love this item!
Reviews.Author: Sarah E. Lopez "danavybaby19"
Reviews.Content: I was one of the first generation Kindle users and I loved that one and I LOVE the Kindle Fire HD.... The resolution is clear and MUCH better quality than I had expected. Additionally, it was A LOT cheaper than the IPAD that I had been looking into recently and the download time is much faster. I think the only 2 complaints I have was that 1) the Kindle took a LONG time to charge using the USB cable into my computer and I had to purchase the powerfast wall charger separately but it was a VERY reasonable price of $9.99. 2) it was not 3G compatible like the original Kindle I owned. I was able to download books while riding in my car but you have to have a Wi-Fi connection. Overall, I LOVE this product! If you are an avid reader or just love to watch movies and have it stored in ONE location in a smaller form, this item is PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: Another use (maybe)
Reviews.Author: Pappy
Reviews.Content: Bought this device on short notice to schlep a DVD slide show around.  The CS guy at Staples where I bought mine downloaded a free app which would permit running the slide show from the Videos file folder.  Saved me lugging around my laptop and shared the show with many friends on a recent trip.  Cheap at $200 and easy to pass around at the dinner table.Note of caution for those shopping for a travel case in lieu of the cardboard container the device came in - (attn: Amazon) numerous aftermarket mfrs of such cases advertise them for the Kindle Fire; actual test fits in several stores reveal that the Fire HD is about 1/2" WIDER than similar models IDed as fitting the Kindle Fire!If you can handle the ads, this is a nifty tool at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: Amazon's new toy
Reviews.Author: Calvin "The one and only."
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 7" is a great new device, but not without some flaws. First the price point for what you get is amazing. It's a economy tablet that packs a punch. Watch videos, listen to music, look at my pictures, play games, check email, and search the web are some features I use the most. This handles all those tasks very well. The hd movies on Prime come out crystal clear and sound is definitely an upgrade from the original Fire. The device is responsive and hardly lags unless it's due to wifi connection. Overall it's a great device, but here are some negatives that dropped it from being that perfect tablet. It's an amazon tablet. I have prime and cloud, music, and audio books from amazon so all my content is on the cloud and helps since I got the 16GB. I loaded a few videos and now im left with about 5GB left. For others, this 16GB may not be enough...go for the 32. The way amazon shows how to hold the kindle with the camera to the left, makes some games show upside down. Also the power buttons/volume are hard to find. Some apps do not work for the Fire HD yet, but hopefully they will soon. Another thing I wish they had was a photobooth type app. There's no camera app on the device, so it would have been nice to see a photobooth at least. Nevertheless, this is a great buy and I'm starting to use it a lot more than my macbook(15" heavy to lug around) when i'm at the house or at work. In conclusion, it's a really good device and well worth the money. If you are an amazonian, this should be your device of choice(or the 8.9")!

Reviews.Title: Good buy, great value
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a tablet that does everything and will make you toast in the morning, look elsewhere. If your looking for a tablet that delivers a truly awesome experience for multimedia, this is it. Great price, really happy with it's capabilities thus far. 4 stars only because I'd like to see the Kindle open up to allow Google Play without having to root it.Amazon has the same zen as Google. Jeff B - Keep it that way and don't lock down all available content. We get that you want to control some of the delivery methods for media, and we're cool with that. But at least allow us to use Google Play for other apps and content we can't get from you. Great tablet though, stoked you made the option available to remove ad's for $15.

Reviews.Title: Best Kindle Yet
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: This was a companion upgrade to my Kindle touch and 10" notebook. Now I have both in one. HD screen and sound are top-notch. As usual worked perfectly right out of the box. Had everything set up from wireless to my cloud in under five minutes.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive
Reviews.Author: V. Goins "Zombieland Rule #2 - Double Tap"
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD yesterday and spend last night setting it up, downloading apps, movies, music and books.  And I have to say that I am very impressed.  The sound that comes out of this little tablet is incredible.  The screen looks great playing videos, whether they are HD or SD, although HD looks better.  The free cloud storage is great because you don't have to store everything on your device and can quickly add and remove content.  I'm not in love with the interface for accessing apps and content, but it works ok.  The power button and volume rocker are in a good place on the side of the tablet.  The tablet works best for me when holding it in landscape mode instead of portrait.  The only real complaint I have is that the device does not come with a charger, just a USB cord.  Luckily, the charger from my older Kindle does work, as charging via USB port on your computer is slow.  Overall, I am very happy with this tablet and would buy it again.  I may eBay this one and upgrade to one of the 4G models when they are available.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!!!
Reviews.Author: Mary-Ann "mag89"
Reviews.Content: There have been so many reviews already, I simply want to add my impressions.  The screen is wonderful, crisp, clear and vibrant.  USA Today's Day in Pictures looks beautiful.  My husband and I listen to audiobooks together, and had to use a docking station with the original Kindle Fire.  This has plenty of volume for us to listen...we even turned the volume down!  As for the ads...I have no problem with them at all.  I guess that is a personal preference, but I got $5 for video from one of the offers, so I'm not complaining.Update 9/19:I see so many negative comments about the ads.  They are NOT intrusive...yes, they are there, but do not get in the way of what you are looking at.  I have to say, the "customers also bought" method used by Amazon has led me to discover new products, books, etc that I may never have enjoyed if they hadn't pointed the way.  So, I am one customer who actually WELCOMES the adds.

Reviews.Title: Already like it differently than Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: xyppy
Reviews.Content: I have both tablets and the Fire HD will be staying home.  Why?  Because I'll use it for entertaining myself and occasionally check email.  I've already cancelled the ads because they were too annoying and the slide screen was confusing when I quickly wanted to unlock the device.Pros:The reader having so many capabilities including text to voice, immersion reading, xray.  I'll definitely be using this reader versus the kindle app on my Nexus 7.Audible immersion reading.  Very cool feature.  Just finished "Among Others" using it.Video is much nicer than the predecessor and having xray available is outstanding.It's faster and a bit smoother than it's predecessor.It's seems to be more comfortable in landscape mode than the predecessor.  And it does landscape mode automatically.  I had to load apps to make the Nexus 7 do this.The music player is great.  I love being able to access all my music from the cloud so easily.Cons:The ads.  Get your $5 mp3 coupon and then spend $15 to cancel the ads.While I'm glad there are buttons on the side, they're not intuitive.  Especially having the on/off below the volume control.Extremely easy to make purchases.  This could be a con or a pro, depending upon how much money you want to spend.I still have to side-load the NY Times app.  Doesn't make sense that I have to do this.  But that's why my Nexus 7 will travel with me.  It's a worldly tablet whereas this is for the home.----Overall I've got no remorse for buying this device.  I was very happy with the original Fire but this device makes it seem primitive.  Definitely worth upgrading.  Comparing the Fire HD to the Nexus 7 is sort of like comparing a motel room with an unfurnished apartment.  Both have their pros and cons and serve different purposes.

Reviews.Title: WOW! This is a Media Powerhouse!!!
Reviews.Author: Gouron
Reviews.Content: I LOVE these speakers... seriously. I went from max volume close to my ear to being volume shy when I upgraded my kindle Fire to the HD. This device is almost TOO loud, and this comes from someone who can only enjoy his music loud. I rarely turn the volume up past the 3/4 mark. I am in love with this display and functionality! I can rapidly switch between apps which comes in handy when you decide at the last second to thumbs up/down a song on Pandora.In fewer words, I am very impressed. The added audio book store is a great idea! I LOVE audio books! Unfortunately they don't have any free ones to download, but as someone who ALWAYS looks for the free route, I can accept that some things aren't always handed to you.I'm also a huge fan of the HDMI output port since I enjoy streaming movies from my laptop. I now have the luxury to stream HD movies from my $199 tablet! No more hauling the laptop/power cord around to hook up to the TV, all I need is already sitting comfortably in my hand. Not to mention the amazing flawless streaming due to the dual band dual antenna wifi connection... GREAT Idea!!Like I said, this is easily the most ideal device for fans of media, and at such a killer price! I feel like I legally robbed amazon... Can I get in trouble for that?

Reviews.Title: Great device....for the price
Reviews.Author: DaveA
Reviews.Content: I was ecstatic to get my new Kindle Fire HD today! Overall, after using it since this morning, I can say two things. 1) It's better than the original Fire by leaps and bounds and 2) It has lots of hiccups, that range from annoying to downright infuriating.I figure I'll start by talking about what is "wrong" with the kindle fire hd. For one, there is noticeable lag almost everywhere except the carousel. When you press an icon, especially for the silk browser, nothing happens! Sometimes it takes a few seconds for anything to launch and you're left thinking it didn't register the touch. HOWEVER, I know this will soon be fixed by software updates so don't cancel your order yet---the 1.2 GHZ processor in this thing can do better, but the software is holding it back! Next, I can't see any difference in wifi performance. My iPad is faster in every aspect, and the range is just as good. The silk browser is still a disaster, and now THERE IS NO FLASH SUPPORT! I thought the browser was slow, but at least scrolling and pinch zooming was more fluid. Again, hopefully things that will soon be addressed by a software update. Next, the volume buttons are ill placed. They are at the top of the device, very tiny and completely flush with the device. Every time I wanted to press them I had to actually go look for them. They may grow on me but be prepared for searching for the volume rocker. Speaking of the exterior, the design strikes me as odd. The bezel on this thing is massive and frankly seems like a waste of space. The Fire seems boxier too...kind of looks like a little iPad. Lastly, those darn bars. On almost all movies I watched I got two massive black bars on the screen! Why can't amazon optimize Prime content for the Fire?? Cmon. You already have precious screen real-estate and not all of it is even utilized....and there isn't an option to zoom in to make it fit. Really, really annoying.So, what makes the Kindle Fire a great device? Well for starters those speakers!! I feel immersed in videos and they get incredibly loud. No complaints there---well done Amazon and thanks for being an industry leader with dual speakers for tablets. It's about darn time. Next, the screen really does look great. Glare seems to be reduced, but it's hard to say definitively. Either way, it's a good screen and I have no complaints.Overall, the Fire is good but not great (yet). The software bogs it down and little quirks here and there add up to a somewhat frustrating experience. Yet I can't help but love this tablet. It's packed full of neat features (like X-RAY, which I thought was handy, esp. on cartoons where it shows who is voicing each character!). I've heard many people say the Nexus 7 is better. I've used the nexus 7 too and the software is much more fluid, but the google play store has no good movie/video content. No Two and Half Men, no Big Bang Theory, no Family Guy, no South Park, no Modern Family. It sucks. With Amazon's library, you're pretty much guaranteed your favorite tv show or movie is there!Should you buy this: YESWill you be disappointed: MAYBE, BUT NO DOUBT THIS DEVICE WILL ONLY GET BETTER WITH SOFTWARE UPDATES.

Reviews.Title: Pros & Cons - What I wish I'd known before I bought it ...
Reviews.Author: Indiana James
Reviews.Content: Reviews are useless without context, so let me tell you a little about why I bought this device: My experience before the Kindle Fire HD was with Apple devices supplied by my work (which is one reason why there are so many iPad comparisons below - plus, lets face it, a lot of people who read this review are trying to figure out if it's worth it to spend the extra $100 on an iPad Mini), and a Kindle Touch.  I really enjoy using all of these devices, but since I try to keep work and home separate, I wanted a device of my own and was hesitant to shell out the $300+ for an iPad or iPad mini.  After doing a lot of research, I decided on the Kindle Fire HD 7".  I made that decision based on a number of things: 1) I'm an Amazon Prime user; 2) I watch Netflix and Hulu, 3) I checked the Amazon app store to make sure the main apps I want/need were there and they were; 4) I like that I can buy content on Amazon and watch it on essentially any device, and 5) I'm a huge audible audiobook user.I've now had the device for about 3 months and used it extensively.  Here is my review:Overall: Depending on why you want this device, it's either a great buy or a mediocre buy.  If you're using it just to consume media (music, videos, books, etc) it's fine.  It can be great, in fact, if you stick to Amazon's services and/or Netflix and Hulu.  If you're expecting something that can potentially function as a replacement for your laptop, like an iPad can, - look elsewhere.  In the areas where iPad falls short of a laptop, either the iOS or a great app usually makes up the deficit.  That is simply not the case with the Kindle Fire HD.  I'm not unhappy with it per se, but I could definitely be happier.  Bottom line: this is a media consumption, social networking and shopping (from Amazon) device. If those are your purposes, it's an overall good buy.  I don't play games much, so I can't comment on that.The two biggest complaints I heard and/or saw for this device when doing my research are the ads and the buttons being hard to find.The ads: I turned off the carousel ads via settings (because they bothered me) but I still get the welcome screen ads and it's not worth the $15 to turn them off - I don't even notice them anymore.  This really is a non-issue.Th buttons: I almost never use them. There is a volume slider in every app I've seen and I use a Kindle cover that puts the device to sleep when I close the cover flap. When I do use them they are never hard to find.  Also a non-issue.10 Pros -1) Low entry price.  You can buy a Kindle Fire HD 7", a nice leather case and about $25 worth of media/apps for less than the cost of an iPad Mini.2) It's built well.  This was a surprise.  I liked my Kindle Touch very much, but it did feel like a cheap toy when I first pulled it out of the box.  I didn't have that feeling with the Fire HD.3) It's the perfect size.  I have an iPad 2 and it's too big to read on, just uncomfortable.  My iphone, on the other hand is too small to watch movies on for the most part.  This is a perfect medium option.  Perfect for books, acceptable for video.  I'm not going running with it anytime soon, but I do listen to music on it when I'm stationary.  It even fits in a cargo pocket4) It has GREAT sound (far outperforms similar tablets on this point).  My wife and I would occasionally sit in bed and try to watch a movie on the iPad, but even with no kids in the room it was often just about impossible to hear the movie on the iPad speaker.  We simply don't have that problem on the Kindle.  I knew this before I bought it because I watched a video on a Kindle Fire HD at a crowded Best Buy during the peak of the Christmas shopping season and heard it just fine.5) I don't use this feature, but Kindle lets you set up profiles for kids restricting time and access to certain apps.  I have 5 kids and I think this is a great feature.  I just personally choose to not let them play with the device.6) It's great for reading.  Some people complain about not holding an actual book, but I have yet to meet one of those people who has tried reading an book on an e-reader with a case.  The case makes all the difference in the world.  It gives you the feel of a book, especially the leather cases and the satisfaction of closing it when you put it down or finish.  It's dumb, but it's true.7)  I love the way it interfaces with Amazon's music, books, prime video, photo and audible services.  It's seamless.8) At the time I purchased it (Christmas 2012), display resolution was almost double that of competitor tablets in similar price range. To my knowledge, there are still no devices in the $200 price range that can touch Kindle Fire HD on display quality.9) Battery life - I feel like I use this device all the time and I only charge it once a week.  My iPad and iPhone need charging once a day.10) As an Amazon Prime member I like the device a lot.  When I need to buy, I always go to Prime first.  I can usually save money and almost never pay shipping.  When you have five kids, the convenience factor of being able to shop online, not pay for shipping and get it in 2 days (sometimes 1) is impossible to overstate.  This device makes it almost unnecessary to logon to Amazon on my actual computer.  I wish I could say that I'd tried to shop elsewhere with the device, but the truth is that aside from groceries - I buy almost everything from Amazon via my Prime account.10 Cons:1) Streaming video from sites besides Amazon prime, Netflix and Hulu is sketchy.  I don't think this is a bandwidth issue - my internet is a very fast package and it works fine on my other devices. On YouTube for example, my iPhone does better on 3G than Kindle does on wifi, even with resolution turned down to low quality. I also tried comparing iPad w/ wi-fi to Kindle w/ wi-fi on YouTube and there is no contest. iPad killed it. I think this may be a google compatibility issue, because it works fine on the sites listed above. In fact, Kindle at times outperforms my iPad on Netflix.2) Privacy - Apparently, Amazon collects info about which sites you visit via the built-in Silk browser so they can push more relevant content to you in the ads. This idea bugs me and there aren't any available alternative browsers in Kindle's App Store. You can choose to encrypt your data, but it slows things down when you browse. The talking point in the marketing collateral above says "designed for the web" or something to that effect, I think that's true from Amazon's perspective, but not from the consumer's.  It's designed to capture data from the web to help the company sell products to the consumer.  It's absolutely not designed for the best consumer experience when browsing the web - if it were, they'd give you a choice about which browser you'd like to use.3) App availability - You don't have access to every Android app or the Google Play store. You do have access to thousands of apps, as they get approved by Kindle (including one free app a day, which I'll admit is pretty cool). You can circumvent this issue somewhat by installing an unapproved app that gives you access to a different free app market, but a lot of them don't work well (those using Google services, for example) and none of them are specific to Kindle Fire.  For the most part, this limitation has been no big deal - I've almost always been able to find the app I'm looking for or something equivalent, but there have been enough exceptions to be annoying.  Also for iOS there are iPad and iPhone variants of apps. The iPad versions tend to be more fully functional and often outshine the full website for whatever service you're using. In the event that no iPad native app exists, you can install the iPhone app.  But when used that way, the apps "feel" like iPhone apps.  Most of the Kindle Fire apps I've used "feel" like phone apps. E.g., they are less functional and designed for a phone sized screen.4) Amazon's "skin" or interface is overlayed on top of Android and it is pretty restrictive in both functionality and interface. Frustratingly so, even for someone who is used to iOS which "advanced" users tend to complain about because functionality is limited. I'm also an advanced user, but I'm willing to put up with a more restrictive OS if, and only if, the OS is designed well enough that I don't miss the "advanced" features. For example, on iOS, I use my iPhone and iPad daily and I have NEVER missed having access to the file/directory structure (and if I did, I could get it by simply plugging the iPad into my computer). On Kindle I miss it pretty regularly and I simply HATE the carousel display. In fact, if I could turn off the carousel display I might be a lot happier.  I have never been tempted to "jailbreak" my apple devices and wouldn't be even if they weren't the property of my employer.  That's not true with Kindle.5) Google services don't work with Kindle Fire. Google Finance, Drive, Docs, Reader, etc. will not work on Kindle - at least not via any Apps that I've found.  I haven't tried to browse to them directly via the browser. Gmail will work, via Kindle's native mail app.6) No rear facing camera or flash. Not a huge deal, but annoying nonetheless, especially with a device with such a great display - I would like to take pictures without either being in them or guessing what I'm aiming at.  With Kindle Fire, you either guess and check or put yourself in the picture.  Also, I don't want every pic I take added to the cloud and/or previewed in the Carousel.7) I had to download special apps to do things it should do out of the box - certain video formats, for example, require an app to be installed.  Mild annoyance and one you face with most devices, but still an annoyance.8) There is no button (except power and volume) that is independent of the OS. So if something freezes, you can't just exit out short of killing the power or rebooting and it does freeze occasionally.  I really, really miss the button at the bottom of most other devices.  This is most noticeable when you're trying to watch video and it's stuttering.  You can't even get to the pop-up menu to get to the "back" arrow or home button.9) I despise the autocorrect. It's hard to describe exactly how annoying this feature is. The corrections are often wrong and I can't turn it off. I did figure out that I can add things manually, but who wants to have to do that?!  A lot of people claim that you can't replace a computer with a tablet, but after having done so for my work for almost a year, I disagree.  With the Kindle Fire, however, I can understand the claim.  I hate typing on this thing because fighting the autocorrect is a constant annoyance.  I didn't think this would be a big issue because I wasn't planning on doing any sort of document editing with it - but it's turned out to be quite a pain even with emails.10) Reading at night, even with brightness turned all the way down can be retina searing. Oddly, Sepia mode seems to be less taxing on the eyes in a dark room than Night mode.  There are apps you can use to turn it down even further, but I shouldn't have to install a special app to read comfortably on a device that is at least on the surface designed to be an e-reader.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Ralph Furlong
Reviews.Content: I have had a Kindle reader since the second iteration or the original.  I still have it and I still find it the easiest to read a book on when you are in bright light.  It is also the easiest on my eyes.  I spend several hours a day on a computer screen, so it is nice to get a break from the glare of a screen.Still, I wanted to see how the Fire HD performed and if it would give me enough computer functionality so that I no longer needed to take a laptop with me when I traveled.  I have an IPAD, and it will pretty much do most of the functions I want, but it is still a bit bulky to carry.  So, I opted to try out the Kindle Fire HD 7" unit.Here is what I like:1.  The unit is smaller and much easier to hold while reading in bed.  This is something that I do a lot at night and the IPAD was just too big and awkward to accomplish this task.2.  The display on the unit is incredible!  It still does not compare to the original Kindle for reading a book on though.3.  The sound is very good compared to the IPAD.4.  There are several apps that help to make this a more productive device.5.  The unit does support Bluetooth which makes adding a keyboard easy (trying to type long documents on the screen keyboard is a real pain!!6.  The ability to add SAMBA support so that I can access storage on a network.7.  Dual band Wi-Fi, both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz are supported.Here is what I do not like:1.  Lack of animation for page turn when reading a book.  Come on, the Kindle app for Apple has this feature, why not the Kindle Fire HD??2.  Lack of animation for most apps.  Example, the Weather Channel App for Kindle does not have any animation (clouds moving, trees blowing, rain falling, birds flying, etc.) that is available on laptops or on IPADS.3. The inability to load Android Apps from Google.  There are so many more apps available that just are not on Amazon.4. Volume switches are difficult to use as is the power switch.I paid the extra fee to have the unit free of ads and I am very pleased with that even though it seems strange to have to pay to keep ads off.I would recommend this unit if you are looking for a small entertainment device that supports some tablet like features.  So far, this appears to be the best bet if you do not want to carry a laptop but still need to get some work accomplished.  It certainly is MUCH easier to get through Airport Security!!!

Reviews.Title: Really nice tablet, but not very deaf-friendly
Reviews.Author: Christopher Roe
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a little over a month now. It's a good tablet. The hardware's decent. Fit and finish are nice. Performance is solid. I like the size. It's a little bit heavy. Price was right. I don't really have anything bad to say about it as a tablet. Problem is, it's just not the right tablet for me.Being deaf, there are a couple of extra bullet points on my desired feature list for a tablet:1. The native media player should ideally support captions or subtitles. As of the time of this review, only the Netflix app has this functionality. YouTube videos don't display captions or subtitles, but I think that's true for most mobile devices at the moment. Amazon's own video content doesn't have captions or subtitles yet. I don't know about Hulu, since I don't have an Hulu account. So, if I want to watch captioned/subtitled videos on the Kindle Fire HD, Netflix is the only game in town at the moment.2. Since the Kindle Fire HD has a 720p front camera that works with Skype, I had hoped I would be able to make use of it with video relay services over wi-fi.
