As of this moment, none of the VRS apps (Purple VRS, Convo Mobile, etc) are available on the Amazon app store, and sideloading them didn't work either. These apps work just fine on the Nexus 7, Galaxy Tab, and other Android tablets, so the problem is likely specific to the Kindle Fire HD's custom Android build.None of the points above make the Kindle Fire HD a bad tablet. Right now, it's still new and Amazon is still working its way through captioning its video content, so odds are the picture will be different 12 months from now. I'm just mentioning them in case other deaf people are interested in the Fire HD.Oh, before I forget: HDMI out works great, but doesn't actually pass subtitles/captions through to the TV. I mention this only because it's a bummer for deaf people and I'd like to save other deaf people the trouble of spending money on a HDMI cable and then looking like an idiot after hooking it up to the big widescreen living room TV and sitting down with a bowl of popcorn. ;)One other wrinkle that slightly complicated my relationship with the Kindle Fire HD is the fact that I'm a heavy user of Google products. Gmail, Docs, Drive, Chrome, you name it, I use it. It was slightly disconcerting not being able to use any Google apps on the Kindle Fire HD. Again, that doesn't make the Fire HD a bad tablet, it just means that if you're heavily into Google stuff, this probably isn't the best tablet for you.What the Kindle Fire HD does supremely well is deliver Amazon content. It's a really good tablet that's enjoyable to use, and if you're happy with primarily consuming Amazon content, you won't go far wrong with one of these.I gave the Kindle Fire HD to my hearing wife earlier today. She'd been monopolizing it over the past several days because she really loves casual games, and the Amazon app store has quite a number of those. She'll also get more mileage out of the music, audiobooks, and Amazon video downloads than I will, so the tablet's definitely staying in the family.I'm probably going to get a Nexus 7, an iPad Mini, or a 5th generation iPod Touch to replace it. That's not a dig on the Kindle Fire HD, just a statement based on the fact that these other options are a little bit more deaf-friendly at the time of this review.

Reviews.Title: Works great, I actually love the special offers
Reviews.Author: iloveamazon
Reviews.Content: Some people complain about the special offers, but I like them.  Many of them are just free music, movies, etc. that Amazon offers you.The device is a great bargain, and I would recommend anyone who wants a tablet and has a budget to get this one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome device for its intended use...too heavy
Reviews.Author: Gordon G. Harter
Reviews.Content: I have had the 7" Fire HD for a week. I read a book and a half, and surfed the web for hours. It is a great device for what it does. It should be seen primarily as a consumption device, as opposed to a creation device.As a Kindle reader, it does a great job, night and day. Since it is back-lit, as opposed to edge-lit, it produces some eye strain after reading for couple of hours or more. The is typical of any backlit device, such as your computer screen or TV screen.I have seen some knocks on brightness. I my experience, the brightness was infinitely adjustable manually, but in auto-dim mode, it was too bright in a darkened room. So stick with manual brightness controls, if it's too bright.The (web)  browsing experience is great! Their browser, Silk, is light and fast, and renders beautifully. It's cloud-based server-side  acceleration is really noticeable. I wish other browsers worked that way.My two knocks on the device is that:  it is too heavy; and its battery life is not that great. There is no comparison to an iOS-based device, in my humble opinion.It's too heavy to read one-handed. And, if you try, your fingers are too close to the touchscreen, and you are constantly advancing the page, or highlighting, without intending to do so. I found myself constantly paging back or forward to return to my place, or tapping the screen to clear highlights. I read a lot while lying down, and found it gets old rapidly, when you have to rest the device on your chest. It feels relatively heavier than my iPad, given its size.I realize it is heavy because of the battery. My iPad is too. Yet I would have to recharge my Fire every other day, where the iPad will go days, with comparable use. I found the getting in the habit of plugging it in at night was a helpful idea...The keyboard (on-screen) is not as good as the iOS devices. I have both an iPhone and iPad to compare it with. The keyboard on the Fire doesn't seem to predict what key you are trying to hit, nor predict the word you are typing, as effectively as the Apple products. Therefore, it is not as strong an input device.But to sum up, it is a GREAT tablet for the money. It is best seen as a media consumption, as opposed to a content creation device. It's too heavy for one-handed use. And don't forget your AC charger...it is worth the money, and you will use it often. Just get in the habit of plugging it is every night, and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: A great little tablet if you realize it's potential.
Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Kindle Fire HD for the last couple of weeks and I am impressed with this device for the purpose that it was intended. If you are looking for a full blown tablet or a mini computer, you will be disappointed with this device. It does utilize email and internet access, but it is primarily a media device that was intended to use Amazon content. The HD video is fantastic and the sound quality is superior to most tablets, but is is primarily for the use of Amazon media. Although Amazon Android applications are usually compatible with other Android devices, Google android applications are not compatible with the Kindle Fire. In addition, not all of the Kindle Fire applications are compatible with the Kindle Fire HD. If you order applications from your computer, for the Kindle Fire HD, the web site will let you order and say that they can be downloaded to the Kindle Fire HD, but they won't download whether they be free or paid for applications. To be sure that applications will be downloaded to the Kindle Fire HD, you must order them from the device, and not from the Amazon store on your computer. I have talked with Amazon Tech support on this issue and it is an on-going problem that can be avoided by ordering appplications from the device rather than your computer. HD content will be increased as developers offer new and upgraded applications.All in all, this is a wonderful device if you get it with the purpose that it was intended. It is primarily for the use of Amazon media, and is very useful if you have a Prime acccount that offers a lot of free media. This is not a full-blown tablet, and it is not meant to be.Update 11/05/12I have been using the Kindle Hd for a couple more weeks and have reduced the stars to 4. At this point in time, much of the content such as games is greatly reduced because of the incompatibility with HD. When ordering from the device, the choices are greatly reduced. Hopefully, this will be improved in the future, but it doesn't do much for customers at this point. This is my first Kindle, so I didn't really have any expectations. For those that have prior experience with Kindles, this device will be a great improvement in so many ways. For those that are looking for a "cheap" tablet, they will be greatly disappointed. Although the Kindle HD has huge improvements over previous Kindles, it is definitely not meant to have the functionality of a tablet. Even though this is an adroid device, Google apps are not supported. You can buy Amazon android apps that will work on any android device, but apps for the Kindle devices cannot be bought anywhere but on Amazon. Apps from any other source are not supported. Since many of the Amazon apps are not supported on the Kindle HD, this can be fairly limiting. Still, for the price, this device is well worth the price, and I would not consider returning it. I am hopeful that Amazon will update more apps to be compatible with this divice. I will update my review as things change, but I currently have an Apple IPad 7" on order. I do enjoy the greater functionality of the Ipad. I also have a 10" IPad and a 10" ASUS android tablet that I enjoy. I did not buy the Kindle HD to replace any of my tablets, but I am a bit disappointed that more apps are not supported on the Kindle HD by Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong--best value in tablets.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: Although the Kindle Fire HD doesn't strike me as a "dramatic" improvement over the original 2011 version, it's nonetheless a step up (make it two if your primary interest is music).  Its main competition is the comparable Google Nexus 7 (the recently announced Apple Mini should be placed in a different category due to its higher price and larger screen).  Although the Google is marginally thinner and noticeably more lightweight, the Fire HD seems streamlined in both areas compared to the original edition. The sound has greater "presence" and enhanced stereo imaging (despite speaker ports that are virtually invisible), though audiophiles (and bass players) should not plan on selling their full-fidelity speakers or headphones just yet.Besides improved onboard sound, the Fire HD has external volume controls (one of my main irritants concerning the previous edition).  And it offers Bluetooth connectivity (an important consideration given the influx of Bluetooth speakers as well as adapters permitting wireless operation of conventional audio equipment). Above all, the image quality is "state of the art" (it looks as good to me as my wife's Macbook retina display), so this is an ideal tablet for streaming movies from Amazon.  And if you're member, be sure to download the Netflix app for an even greater selection.  Finally, as the household insomniac, I have a device that's perfect for reading books in the dark.Fire owners on a budget will minimally require a case-cover.  After trying various faux leather covers, I found that a soft, pliable  skin cover offered the best combination of protection, convenience and value Poetic Protective TPU Skin Case for Amazon Kindle Fire Solid Black.  As yet I haven't found the same design for the Kindle Fire HD, so patience may be the best strategy for now (the alternatives can be pricey and less practical). As for covers/films for the touch-sensitive screen, they're more trouble than they're worth, requiring constant adjustment and of no real use (imagine a pianist insisting on covering the keys of a Steinway with plastic laminate!).Needless to say, the Fire HD is the tablet of choice for regular Amazon visitors and members with Prime.  And given the amount of time consumers (myself included) devote to technology, an owner might even welcome a smaller selection of "apps" to choose from  (frankly, I feel overwhelmed by the thousands of Apple apps and Google games).  I'm content to have the 8-10 games my grand-kids seem to like best and, for myself, "TuneIn," a spectacular radio app that instantly streams my local 24/7 HD jazz station--without subscriptions, fees, a password or any sort of identification. Granted, the more expensive Nexus 7 from Google offers a GPS, but I'm happy with my Garmin (and neither will make navigation through the maze of games and apps any easier). As it is, Amazon offers hundred of apps (including daily free ones)--already too many, at least for those of us who use only one at a time.If you're new to tablets, try not to become prematurely frustrated.  Where there used to be buttons and knobs, you'll now discover imperceptible sliders and switches, none raised from the surface of the device.  A tablet is somewhat like a musical instrument, except easier to learn.  If, after a couple of months, you're still having difficulty, turn to the often surprising intuition of a youngster.  If that doesn't do it, consider investing in an Apple product as a last-ditch effort (but be prepared to encounter, at one extreme, plenty of "Apple snobs" and, at the other, even more "Apple haters," both of whom can be insufferable for anyone who tries to review an Apple computer or iPod).  For that matter, as Apple products become increasingly complex, attracting more periodical literature along with "tomes" devoted to every Apple update, the old wisdom about the company's famous user-friendliness (who needs an instruction manual?) is becoming increasingly untrue (where are you, David Pogue?).But there's still hope.  When I had questions about the Fire HD, I posted them on Amazon's discussion board and received immediate, genuinely helpful answers from other Fire owners:http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/forums/kindleqna/ref=cm_cd_t_rvt?ie=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx1GLDPZMNR1X53Sometimes it's not a bad idea to "follow the crowd," especially when it comes to the intricacies of constantly changing consumer technology.  But when all the circuits are jammed and the instruments frozen (it happens to everyone), be sure to have, close at hand--a book.[Later: I've encountered only one annoyance so far with the Fire HD.  Bluetooth pairing can often be a tricky, frustrating and time-wasting exercise--so I've learned to have an audio cable at hand after five futile minutes of seeking wireless connectivity.  My favorite small speaker is the recently discontinued Motorola EQ7 (with 4 JBL speakers). The iPod Touch 4th gen and the newly released iPod Touch 5th gen (awesome technology) instantly "Discovered" and soon "Paired" with the EQ7.  The Fire HD simply refused to, or was incapable of, Discovering the EQ7.]

Reviews.Title: Not quite as claimed and comparison with iPad
Reviews.Author: K. Marn
Reviews.Content: The screen is just as reflective as iPad, the sound quality may have wider stereo field but quality wise is no iPad. The image quality is skewed towards warm and not as crisp, again is no iPad. But serving primarily as reader, it serves very well, but initial impressions is battery life is not what as claimed. As a mediaplayer it is as good as it gets, no need itunes. Overall an excellent product, I will give iPad mini a miss. This is just so much more user friendly. Dont like apple dictating what I can do on my device, this is a liberating change.

Reviews.Title: Glad I upgraded from Kindle Fire 1....
Reviews.Author: OKchic
Reviews.Content: I just got my Kindle Fire HD today and love it!  Surprised to see negative comments. I liked my kindle fire but this is is a definite upgrade!  The screen is much sharper, less glare, and looks great. As others have said,  the sound is great. On earlier Fire, you had to really listen to hear a movie with volume all the way up. On the Fire HD,  you can hear easily with volume not much past half way up and has nice sound. The email is much improved in this version. I usually read on my Kindle keyboard but books look so much better on this new Fire that I will be reading on it. The glare cut down and the sharper text is all easier on the eyes than most tablets. I listen to my books on my daily commute and then read when I have time to sit and read. The text to speech on the Fire HD seems nice and easy to use. I am watching a tv show right now from Netflix and it is working wonderfully. I am loving this tablet so far and am already a regular Amazon customer. The ads don't bother me at all. They are the screensaver. Who sits and stares at that stuff? Great product,  Amazon. Keep improving things to suit the customers!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect tablet for my family
Reviews.Author: Melissa Hollingsworth
Reviews.Content: We are huge iPad fans but my 8 yr.old likes this because its smaller. I like the smaller size as well because it easily fits in my purse. Excellent HD display and very user friendly. The games, movies, and music selections in the Amazon store is great. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent  tablet
Reviews.Author: Faith C
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift from my husband. I was so thrilled to get it and even more thrilled once I turned it on and started to use it.  It's very easy to use and the apps available seem endless, not to mention all the great books I can load onto it and read. Amazon is wonderful and so is my Kindel Fire HD.It has a very clear screen, wicked sound, and is addicting. I suggest getting the fast charge power adapted. The battery time is great, but I read and use the tablet so much that it runs out of juice.I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Very happy..
Reviews.Author: GrammaO "floriduh gma"
Reviews.Content: I have a ipad 1 my husband has the ipad 2...I had been using the ipad for reading on the kindle app. I like that now I can get books for free that I had been paying for. Also the ads don't bother me and I'm impressed with the screen clarity . The kindle fire hd is  more comfortable size for reading than the ipad, and at a great price!! I' m actually surprised how much I like it!

Reviews.Title: Big improvement over first edition
Reviews.Author: Joseangel Guerrero
Reviews.Content: Better screen, sound, speed, menus, capacity and shape/comfort. Offers and ads are easy to by pass and some are actually interesting/nice to look at.

Reviews.Title: Great first tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet ever, I bought it mainly as a color e-reader, for light browsing and listening to music. It does these things well and I am still learning the many other things it can do also.A few things I like:the beautiful screen, excellent sound, the sepia background for reading books is very restful on the eyes,long battery life, easy to use, lightweight even in it's case, 7 inch size makes it very easy to take anywhere,I can use it outside in the sun with the brightness turned up,Text to speech sounds great, lots of free and inexpensive apps in the Amazon store.The ads don't bother me at all and I like the carousel, also the little star for favorites.What I don't like: it did not come with a  wall charger, no collections, and a hard to access power button, (I bought a MoKo case with the wake/sleep feature so that takes care of that problem) butall in all it's a very nice tablet for $199.

Reviews.Title: Christmas comes Early
Reviews.Author: Lj005
Reviews.Content: The New Knidle Fire HD 7" is so GREAT I could not wait to get it for my Daughter (By the way she is 33)She got it today and is OVER THE MOON !!!!  The quality is GREAT!!!  It feels so good to spend your moneyand get something so Good!!

Reviews.Title: Definitely!
Reviews.Author: N. Pugh
Reviews.Content: Got the Kindle Fire HD 7" on 9/20. I used the original Fire for the past year & loved it for movies, TV shows, email, web, etc. The new one is even better. Let me say that I also use an Apple iPad. I like the smaller screen for video & games. The new HD is sleeker, feels more like a tablet in interface, and the HD is stunning. Angry Birds never looked so good :) May ditch the iPad at some point & order the 8.9". That would save $26.25/ mo. I pay  for the iPad data plan. I bought the amazon leather cover with stand ($44.99) for my new Fire - it's a big improvement over the Splash cover I used for my original Fire. It's equivalent to the Apple Smart Cover in quality, function, & cost. Thanks, amazon!

Reviews.Title: Text to Speech and Immersion Reading Video - Sounds Great! Thank you Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Lori "ColoradoMama"
Reviews.Content: I found this video on YT, today and wanted to share for those that appreciate TTS on the new Kindle Fire HD.  Now if Amazon adds Book Collections Sync to the Fire HD, we will have a super EReader Plus!+Link would not add to this review, so look for Kindle Nation Daily dot com or Kindle Nation Daily on Youtube and click Immersion Reading and Text to Speech Video.  It is a sample of both.

Reviews.Title: twice as good as the first fire
Reviews.Author: Nicholas LaPoint
Reviews.Content: I love this new kindle it has improved sound and runs smoother the first.  great buy for the price asking for it

Reviews.Title: Better than the original
Reviews.Author: DB in VB
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tech geek like some reviewers who like to give it 1 star because of auto correct error or some other minor issue beyond my pay grade. I'm a simple consumer who has owned both fires. The picture is better, it runs faster and the sound is great. Get the kindle case with the speaker cut-outs, it's well worth the expense.  I have shopped from the kindle and it is so easy and user friendly. The Netflix app is slow but that just may be a Netflix issue. The prime movies stream effortlessly. If you are an avid Amazon shopper than this is the tablet for you, If not then you will not like it. The adds on the lock-screen aren't that bad (they need to be aware that kids play with the kindle also and should allow you to disallow certain types of adds), just unlock and they are out of your face, i don't see it worth paying $15 unless you are one of those people that just hate advertising of any kind anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Definite upgrade from the 1st gen Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: S. Busch
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the HD screen! The UI is smooth and definitley more refined from the original KF. The fonts are sleek and sexy. The hardware is svelt and much more stylish than prior. The bezel is a bit bigger, but i think it actually works for reading even better; it gives you something to hold on to with out touching the screen to turn a page by mistake. The HD camera is AWESOME! Works great with Skype as well as several apps i have that utilize cameras to take pictures. Facebook intergration is smooth and easy to work with. The ads on the startup screen are really not an issue at all... lets be honest, who stares at the start screen anyway? Your wake it up swipe and away you go. If the ad has something you like, then awesome. If not, no biggie. It would be nice if somewhere on the ad screen was the time as i sometimes just push it to see what time it is, but thats splitting hairs.  The only issue i really have with it is when it portrait mode on the home screen. I am not a huge fan of the "customers also bought" recommendation part on the bottom. Not that its a deal breaker for me, but some of the things they are showing down there arent the greatest if you have kids using it. Maybe just a filter to ensure its "G" rated below. I dont buy smut, but i dont want to see that others are buying graphic romances etc... let alone my kids. Beyond that its a great improvement Amazon! hi-5!

Reviews.Title: Oh WOW! Oh My! THIS KINDLE FIRE HD IS AWESOME!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dr. "I travel nationally and internationally ...
Reviews.Content: I am not the impulsive type.  I study, I prowl, I search for the best possible deal, being a frugal New Englander by origin.Not so Kindle Fire HD.I have owned my Kindle Fire for barely 2 months.  While I was in San Francisco last week, the power adapter died. I have liked the Kindle Fire, definitely the best Kindle yet, but I missed my iPad, and I was definitely thinking of a new one or of a mini.So I got back to Miami on Friday, and I order the replacement, and they ship me a new Powerfast rapid charger instead, as they were out of the original power adapters. I am chatting with the technician, and he mentions that the new HD was shipping today.Huh, I think, I've been seeing the ads.That's when I made my mistake. I start browsing the 7 * yes SEVEN * reviews on the new one on Amazon, and that got me reading the CNET reviews. I don't know what possessed me. Maybe it was the Dolby Digital. Maybe it was the RIDICULOUS download speeds with the new dual band dual antenna. Maybe it was the wimpy specs on the mini. Whatever it was, I found myself ordering a new HD, and I got a Powerfast for only $10.00 with the order, and a Roo case (that's what is on my Fire now and I love it) for $1.38 more. So I'm happy.So it arrives tonight after work.I am so blown away!  This thing is AWESOME!  This is so good! I love the sound.  It absolutely startled me! I mean I JUMPED when I first heard the quality and volume of the sound. Imagine, GOOD QUALITY Pandora without ear buds!And it is so thin and light!  Holy cow, a few ounces makes such a difference! the Fire feels so thick and clunky by comparison.  This thing is a PLEASURE to hold and it is light as a feather. And EASILY slips into a trouser pocket!AND THAT SCREEN! I cannot believe how much better that polarized HD screen is!  IT IS RAZOR SHARP. DEEP COLOR SATURATION. Crsip, crisp, crisp. Love it.And the software that they have put on the new Fire HD is yards and miles above the Fire.I feel as though I have just gotten a MAJOR upgrade.I am very happy! The e-mail app is great, all the apps are better, and they are all faster, all more rich, all with better features, just better, better, better.I am so happy!I have downloaded a few apps, and even the big ones come in after only a few seconds. This sucker is fast!  NO LAG IN NETFLIX, no lag in Pandora, no lag in radio stations. It is FAAAAAASSSSSSTTTTTTT!So, while I am usually very staid, very erudite, and very reserved, I really have to say, this is a HOME RUN as far as I am concerned, and I am just in love with this little tablet!Way to go Jeff Bezos!Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Really Love the Updated Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: SLN
Reviews.Content: I own the original Fire and must say that the Kindle Fire HD is a vast improvement over the original. I am really enjoying it and am glad that I upgraded.I especially like that I have all of my media in one small package: books, Audible books, games, music, and video entertainment.  I have detailed some of my favorite features and some things I do not like.:Some of theThings I Really Like:1. Free access to digital subscriptions of print magazines I subscribe to, such as The New Yorker, Time Magazine, Sunset Magazine, Cooking Light, Wired, etc.2. Easy access to HBO Go, Amazon Prime, and Netflix.3. The ability to switch between reading and listening to a book using Whisper Sync for voice.4. Bluetooth connectivity so I can connect to a keyboard or external speakers.5. The new HD screen, Dolby audio, larger storage (16 or 32MB),  and improved battery life.6. Ability to use Skype.Some of the Things I Don't Like So Much:1. Having to pay $15 to get rid of the ads although I do like being able to turn them back on (then off again) to make sure that I am not missing a great deal!2. The appearance of suggested purchases when holding the Fire in portrait mode. Even though you can get rid of them by turning the Fire to landscape mode, I would like the ability to be able to not see them in portrait mode. It is easy to click on one by accident.3. A small thing--the lack of a charging light on the Kindle itself. I turn off my Kindle to charge it and would like to easily be able to identify that the Kindle is fully charged.4. Slightly recessed power and volume buttons. I find it difficult to find them by touch.5. The lack of a PDF version of the KF HD User Guide in the Docs section. So far I have been using the online help, but I like to read through the entire user guide to get an idea of features. I find the online help and help on Amazon.com cumbersome to use.Overall, I feel that this is a worthy upgrade and am glad that I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for what i needed
Reviews.Content: i had the original kindle fire i absloutly loved it although i would have loved a web cam. When i found out the new one would have what i needed and more i jumped on pre ordering it, i love all the new capabilities for facebook with espically with pictures. but for me the web cam was most important because my husband wil be deploying soon and i wanted to make sure i can keep in touch with him easily and so my daughter wouldnt be pushing buttons on my laptop. i finally got to test it today and its amazing sound is great picture is amazing. really the the new kindle fire hd made me fall in love with kindle more then i was before. thing is i resurched for what i needed and and found it in kindle. i know its not ipad i dont expect it to be. the kindle fire hd is what i needed and so much more.The only thing i could have asked for that it didnt come with is a wall charger. but thats ok. :-)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Just Plain Awesome
Reviews.Author: Eagle128
Reviews.Content: I have read all the reviews since yesterday and really am quite disappointed in seeing so many negatives. Wonder how many are written by jealous Ipad and Nexus owners.This new Kindle just blows away the competition in my opinion. Yes it has a learning curve,but I have my Email, my music,my books and Internet apps that I use and I'll tell you what, it is just plain awesome. Silk is not slow contrary to what some have written. Just invest in a decent ISP and it is as fast as my I7 2600K speed on the I'Net.Music is another thing completely. Unless you are deaf, their is plenty of volume. Go try the same music on any laptop or netbook, and then tell me it's not better. I own a $2000.00 laptop and it cannot transmit the same sounds as this HD Fire does.The folks on here that have given a 4 or 5 star rating are the true owners. Yes there will be problems anytime a new device is developed and released, but give it and the engineers a break. I don't believe Amazon ever had the intention of competing with Apple's IPad . It is a tablet in it's own right and completely removed from this KIndle. It also costs 2-3 times more, so how can you compare it?It is stated in the lead up to this release that this device does not support Flash, but I guess some people can't read. It is a computer folks but not in the sense that it doesn't possess the ram or the processor for laptop or desktop work.It just wasn't designed for that. Buy a laptop if you need all those goodies. I have all 3. A Kindle, a desktop and a laptop. I don't expect the $2000.00 laptop to do the things my overclocked desktop does either, so why expect it out of thistablet.Ok reading. It is great. Yes I had a Kindle Fire (original) and it was terrible. SO much glare and I couldn't adjust the brightness enough to use it in dim light. I am talking about reading in bed. This Fire HD is again fantastic for anyone wanting a really great reader. No it doesn't pretend to be an e-ink reader. Lot of difference between e-ink and LCD screens.Internet. All I can say it is fast and connects immediately from 50 feet away from the router. I set up my Mediacom Email in about 5 minutes using the other provision found in settings.So, bottom line, it is a great tool for taking on trips,planes or whatever. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting a great inexpensive tool.Those of you that have experienced problems with the hardware, remember it was mass produced and their are bound to be a few bad units. Return it to Amazon and get one that works. You won't be disappointed.UPDATE November 13,2012I am now on my third Kindle and 2nd Fire HD. My opinion has not changed from the above review. My daughter now owns my 1st Fire HD, so I bought another one. These devices are just the most for your money. People that don't like advertisements need to turn the Kindle to Landscape and viola, no more ads visible. The only ad I ever see is when I open the case, and I don't even see it because I swipe the bar and I am on my way to whatever I want to do.My wife has a Kindle Touch and she loves it. Al the Kindles in my opinion are great devices.Get you one and you'll never read a hardcover book again.

Reviews.Title: so far I really love it.
Reviews.Author: Allen Ashley
Reviews.Content: I recieved the fire HD today via ups, because I get things on the day of release due to being a prime customer( posting this because someone was questioning how such valant reviews could be done when it was just released)  Well I have had the original fire since the release date last year, and although its not the Ipad, which i do not own, for the $$ paid, I believe I have been able to enjoy my moneys worth in the past year.  I have updated to the HD fire today only because a very ill friend in and out of the hospital needed something to occupy them.  I decided I would gift the old, and purchase the new.Well I had approximately 3 hours just to play, or "test" things to do.  I do not claim to be the most computer literate person, but other than the ads, which are annoying at times and tabs,  I really think there has been quite the improvement to the fire.1.  external volume control  ( alot of people complained, amazon listened)  is it functionally great... no, but it is there and you can quickly control the volume, rather than just being able to increase or decrease the volume after touching tools, volume, then adjusting the volume.2.  Yes it has a front facing camera, unsure how to just take a picture like you do with an I phone etc, but found under facebook, touching photo, and playing with camera icons, the camera does come on, you can take pic, video, etc, and it will go to the appropriate icon on the kindle fire. as of yet, have not found another way to activate the camera.(but sure there probably is)3. All purchased, or free aps of the day... came preloaded or cloud available...4. the tablet itself is thinner, and lighter..... ( a nice feature, but never found the original one to be too heavy, I have a case that  goes landscape.upright, and reading postions, so this was never a problem on original, due to the case, but the Hd is definately lighter.. (little irritated that the "color"  choice for the case wont be here until 10/3.... even though like previous posts, the listing stated released on 9/14. so when ordering I thought I would get it just like I did the Fire hd, and the charging adapter(day on release)5.navigating around the device is faster responding.6.color, definition is definately improved7. "amazon" is definately the Link to shoppping/browsing shopping... but quite frankly most of my final purchases online are thru amazon... so this does not bother me.... that they are the warlord for the device. I get my stuff in the time promised 99% of the time,I pay no taxes, shipped free 99% of time and received ontime.!! and usually the price of the item is no more than "w***art , and sometimes cheaper... therefore less costly because no taxes, and my gas to go get it)8. cant wait to test the hdmi. port  to my T.V. option( I think this is a nice feature) 9. DO NOT LIKE.... no "light:" to know its charging, but with a few times of playing realize it is charging when you plug the adapter in, and an "ad" gets put on the screen..... dont like it... but I dont care, cuz at that point I want it to charge, and usually putting it down then.10.  THE FIRE H.D.  supports the text to speech for those that need or want to be read to by the computer.11.  The fire arrived 95% (guess) charged...  in my 3 hours plus of "playing the battery life diminished by less than a third, and I tried videos, facebook, camera play, internet search, set up facebook, skype, e-mail judged book "reading and layout" and tested text to speech.. and played some games......  I BELIEVE THE BATTERY LIFE IS IMPROVED!!!12. EVERYONE keeps comparing this to an Ipad..........  Its not, wont be!! and it didnt cost  like an I pad!!  BUT......... I found wifi to connect, and stay connected to be flawless for me(and I live in the country)  Found all features to run quite smoothly, and in $$$ comparison.... believe the HD  gives you your moneys worth.13.  I guess I am not disturbed by the "quirks" or misgivings some others are griping about.. Like I said, I am not a "techie"  but I can find my away around the internet, and the machines, and in all accounts so far am not displeased with the functional aspects of this device..14,  Its a 199.00 tablet, that downloaded my music library in less than 5 minutes. easily chose what apps I wanted on the device from the cloud, effortlessly connected to my home wireless network, and exceeded my expectation for what I thought improvements would be.15, I DO NOT work for amazon, apple, or any other techno type company.  I am a 50+ year old that easily manuevered aroung the new Fire... found,and saw many improvements.  I own a Iphone, and cant fault the product either.... but truly for the 199.00 I can fully put all apps, reading,internet,and staying connected to others and browsing without any major type delays/ or mental hardships.BOTTOM LINE.....I believe for the $199.OO YOU WILL KNOW you have a worthy device, but ............. it you want apple..... spend the $$$....... I find for the overall expierience,and the pocketbook............ that you can basically have a "cost effective device, able to perform the "basic and above type basic functions without a giant pricetag

Reviews.Title: Very Decent For all my media needs update 9/22/1
Reviews.Author: Debbie "Debbie"
Reviews.Content: update...I was pondering if I was going to buy the 8.9 also wouldn't it be worth it to get a tablet instead.  The answer to that in less than one hour was NO.  I purchased the ASUS infinity and its going back.  We put the Kindle HD and the infinity side by side and played the same video...Hands down the video quality of the Kindle HD was SO much better!!!  Also the tablet either crashes or randomly hangs up that its just too frustrating to deal with.  Its going back and I will impatiently wait for the 8.9 Kindle HD.  The ICS is just not all its cracked up to be, I have never had my Kindle's crash EVER.I very seldom write reviews but I had to jump in because of all the negative (1 to 3 star reviews over not having a charger??)  Those reviews had my wondering what I had gotten myself into having gotten rid of my Kindle Fire which I had for only 2 months.  My 2nd question was if I wanted to hold out for the 8.9 screen, but having gone into the store and them showing me what that size would approx. be I decided that the Kindle Fire HD is the best for taking with me on planes and traveling.For those looking for a comparison to IPAD, did you really think you were going to get an IPAD??  From day 1 even with my original kindle fire I was looking for a decent ereader everything else was a bonus.  I did find myself playing alot of word games at night before I went to sleep and less reading though ;)So yesterday after reading all of the silly negative reviews I was checking those complaints.  Videos looked awesome, as well as the sound was awesome.  No you tube??  On my unit there was a link under my web apps that said youtube...click it tried a few videos everything worked, so I am not sure where the no you tube complaints are coming from.  Facebook is also there logged in and looked just like the original kindle fire facebook.The only problem I have is when I try to turn the unit to have the page display correctly I often find myself having to turn it several times before it is to the right side I am looking at which I didn't have that problem with my original kindle fire.With all of the complaints about the ads I started getting nervous I did not want my viewing to be obstructed.  yes I saw that ad on the lock screen and I thought this is what everyone is complaining about??  With the original Fire the complaint was you couldn't customize the lock screen.  I honestly have not noticed any annoying ad problems.  When I was watching on Hulu last night I was annoyed about the constant ads every 4 to 5 minutes now that would be annoying on the FIre but I just don't see the justification.  Think about it, if you are on Facebook there is a side bar constantly of ads.  I really don't know of many sites anymore that don't have ad support of some kind.I know I am going to have just as much, if not more fun with my new Kindle Fire HD and I am sure there is going to be much improvements to the apps as it moves along just like any new product that comes out

Reviews.Title: A review for Low Vision individuals.
Reviews.Author: okiedan "Pro Bono Publico"
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire HD 7 inch screen.  A review of the functions related ONLY to using the device as a reader/audio device. (see customer images)If you do not have low vision this review will not be of interest to you.This review is specifically for individuals with low vision.  Definition of low vision is those of us who have difficulty viewing regular sized text or who have eye conditions that cause you to have difficulty viewing text of any size.  I specify this just to insure that those who read this review understand that I am focusing in on this issue.Now as to my new Kindle Fire HD 7 inch screen.Out of the box:It took me about two minutes to get online via WiFi and download three books and two audio books.  All from Amazon and Amazon's sister site Audible.com.The case, charger, usb cable are all great.  The case fits perfect and has two small screens to allow the dolby digital audio out......The user interface is easy to navigate.I began by downloading two books from my online collection.  I wanted to SEE what the text looked like and how well the text to speech actually worked.  The books downloaded just fine via WiFi.  The text to speech worked just fine and I was able to increase the text size to the largest font.  The largest font however is a 10 on Amazons scale which is a little small for me.  I have emailed Amazon and inquired about the 8.9 HD font size.  It is my hope that it will have a larger font capability.  EDIT UPDATE:  Amazon has just emailed me and stated that they do not know or can not specify how large the font will be on the new 8.9.  So I will just take a chance and hope the 8.9 has larger fonts.  thanks amazon for the fast response even IF the response told me nothing new.  The page turns were just fine and since you can adjust the speed of the text to speech I could further refine the Fire so that it turned the page just at the right moment.  As far as the visual aspect I notice far less glare than the previous Fire.  The speakers sound fantastic.  Even the robotic voice sounds better in stereo!  :)  Well done Amazon!  So with the text to speech enabled I was able to sit back in my easy chair and truly enjoy a good book....almost adjusted to my eye needs.Text to speech is also just a tap on the screen and off you go.  IF you have purchased the Audio book it converts over to the pro reading.The advantage of the Fire over say the iPad running apples free voice over is that it is far easier to activate text to speech on the Fire.  I had tried the Kindle app on the iPad 3 and it does not offer the same ability to activate text to speech.  On the iPad you still have to turn the pages but on the Fire the page turns are automatic.The integration with the Audible.com web site is flawless.  I `purchased' one of the free books and linked audio book and all went as it should.  The audio sounds wonderful and goes right along with the book.  Once again the text was enlarged to the largest font.All in all I am pleased with my new Fire and anxiously await the larger screen.  I look forward to hopefully streaming Netflix, HBO Go, and all amazon prime videos.  I also have synced my iTunes music up to the amazon cloud so my music is sitting there ready for me when wanted....all on one device.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: dibbers "linda"
Reviews.Content: Just got my 'new' Kindle Fire today! :)) I'm soooo happy.I was thinking on getting a tablet, but after playing w/my new Kindle Fire, I don't need one!It's so amazing that I don't have words to describe it. I sync up my music to my Kindle. I have Kindle PC & I sync up my books that I got some time ago. I setup my email on it. My home page, too.What else can I do w/it? Who knows, but I'm going to have fun w/my 'new' Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: If you liked the Kindle Fire - I think you will really like the HD.
Reviews.Author: Jason Moulenbelt
Reviews.Content: It is faster, the wireless is quicker - it is laid out better (more intuitive - uses some of the other standard layouts of other products).  It seems more stable than the first generation and a bit lighter and easier to hold.  It seems refined rather than a slab of silicone in your hand.  The Xray feature and lookup feature while reading is awesome.  If you have a prime membership the fire HD REALLY shines - you can watch a ton of free movies and the like.  It is a lot of fun.There are a few nits to pick.  No screen saver - when in the locked it goes to an add. I didn't buy the kindle with ads and it bugs me a bit that there are ads.  Also, when you touch any book in your library - you automatically get 'suggestions' for what you should buy.  I want to be able to turn those off.  These aren't huge nits - and they can fixed in a software update - but a little annoying.With all of this said, I can't call this a 'tablet' per se'.  It should be seen as an Amazon delivery device.  If you love your Amazon content - and don't mind being restricted buy the apps you can download (they have to approved Amazon Apps - not all Android apps can be used - unless you side load them) - it is a great device.  If you want a tablet in the purest sense - get something else.  I love my HD and am not sad about the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Still learning but VERY Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ramblin' Rabbi
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD about a couple of days ago and I have been very pleased so far. I have never owned any type of tablet so I cannot do any big comparison of features, etc. I did look at a nook tablet and the Fire HD is much nicer.Suffice it to say, it does what is promised and does it well. I was able to sync my google calendar by syncing my gmail account. It carrys my theological library so I don't have to lug a number of books with me when I go to meetings and I can watch stream movies when I want to by wi-fi. The picture and sound are great. And I can read leisure books whenever I want.I can look at and use ms word documents. I plan on upgrading to the pro app so I can edit my documents too.I have not been bothered at all by the special offers. After reading other reviews that talked about how intrusive and horrible they were I expected to end up spending the $15 to get rid of them, but I'm not even going to bother. Who knows, I might even find a good deal on the offers one day.The silk browser has worked great so far. I have not used everything included but if it works as well as everything else has so far, I'm sure I'll be more than pleased.Thanks Amazon for making a great, affordable product.

Reviews.Title: Much better than the original Fire and a great value!
Reviews.Author: Andiamo345
Reviews.Content: I received my 7" Kindle Fire HD on release day 9/14 and have had a few days to play with it now. I waited a few days to make sure I was going to like it before packing up my old Fire to send to Amazon (for hopefully $83 in credit)!Updated with a few additional notes after trying out some additional features...The good:- Incredible improvement in the screen, brightness, clarity and depth of field (I think the laminated touch screen eliminates the old looking into a box feeling of the screen on the original Kindle)- Overall feel of the HD is very solid, and the design and styling is much improved over the original. (I need to find a good case though as the back is very prone to picking up fingerprints!)- The speakers sound good, volume is much louder than the original although the sound quality is what you would expect of tiny speakers.- The volume button is a welcome addition although I find it very hard to find and operate by touch. I still appreciate that it is there.- The software also runs much more smoothly in this iteration than in the original Fire. I expect that the improvement to Android 4.0 helps here.- The UI design is much nicer than on the original Fire, the black background and menu options look great.- New notification options are nice, quick settings for Brightness, wifi etc... and the ability to swipe away notifications (as found in Android 4.0)- Magazine reading - page turn animations and pop up of articles with a double tap - very very nice!- Functionality of the HDMI out is very smooth and includes full mirroring (as opposed to only video out). Full mirroring means you can see exactly the same thing on your TV that you see on the table screen. Get a Micro HDMI to HDMI cable for a few bucks and you can play games, watch movies or even read magazines and books on your tv... (not that you would but you could)The Bad:- While the height in Portrait mode has not changed, the width has increased significantly. It would have been nice to be able to use cases from the original Fire with the new HD. However the increased width does make it easy to hold the HD comfortably while reading.- The device feels thinner and lighter but not as svelte as the Nexus 7 from Google. However it is comfortable to hold for extended periods of time.- Lack of customization - As an Android user I am used to having the ability to customize wallpaper, add widgets etc... none of this is possible on the HD.- Lack of apps in Amazon app store - Most of the apps I use regularly on my Android phone are available, but the Amazon app store is limited. Some popular games and apps are not available. I have gotten around this issue by side loading some of the apps from my phone (In device settings on the HD choose "ON" for allow installation of 3rd party apps, backup the .apk file from another device, then use dropbox to upload from the old device and to install on the HD) I have found this works for some but not all android apps. For example I could get Instagram to install on the HD but it would not run.- No Flash support - others have mentioned this, and it is a result of lack of support in newer versions of the Android OS. I-pdad and other I-devices also do not support Flash. There are apparently work around's that involve installing other browsers (Dolphin HD)but I have not had a chance to try those yet.Neutral:- Much was made of the adds on the HD, and I can say they are very prevalent. Adds are one the lock screen and recommendations on the home screens. However so far I have received $5 in music credit and $5 in video credit, so I am glad to suffer through the advertising. I will not be paying $15 to remove the advertising.- No charger included with the device, Amazon is acting like Apple here and asking you to purchase one seperately. However, I have found that any number of USB chargers I have laying around work fine to charge the HD.In the end the HD is a worthy replacement for the original. It features great hardware and access to Amazon's great content in an easy to use package. I wish it had more customization options but for consumption of media there is no equal to the HD. And for $199 you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Incredible for amazon content!
Reviews.Author: A.L
Reviews.Content: If you have an amazon prime account, then there really isn't a reason why you would buy any other tablet. Great price, great screen, very intuitive UI, nice sound and vast content available.Big improvement over first gen kindle fire. A few performance issues but I bet they'll get fixed soon.

Reviews.Title: Reviewing this on the Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Lupe "Lupe"
Reviews.Content: I Love my Kindle Fire HD. The screen quality is amazing and the sound is very loud. This is one of the rare tablets where I don't need the music to be at 100% to hear what is playing.I love what Amazon did to the interface for their store layout, clean and looks very polished. I love buying all my content through the fire. Immersion reading is so useful as well. Showed this to a few friends and they loved that feature. Great job. Overall all, if you were a fan of the original fire your going to love the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Very good upgrade
Reviews.Author: suzatm
Reviews.Content: Out of the box the device is plain - not flashy but has a look of quality.  I like the wider width compared to the first Fire.  It is very light weight and the more softer contours makes it easier to hold.  The buttons took a little searching to find they are also black and not very well defined on the device.  Turning it on was simple after I found the switch and setting it up and registering it was very easy.Wifi - I am very happy with the improvements made to the wifi on the HD compared to the original Fire.  My bedroom is on the third floor and on the original Fire whenever I was in my room I would only have one or two bars on the wifi indicator.  The HD has had solid all bars showing no matter where I stand in my room.  Definitely an improvement.HDMI - I really bought this device so I could hook it up to my tv and watch the Prime VOD shows and movies.  This worked excellently last night.  It was easy to hook up and operate.  There was no constant buffering or freezes - I am very happy with the performance.  Watching on the device itself the picture was very clear with good color and the sound with the dual speakers was very clear.As a reader?  I bought the original Fire when it first came out and was very disappointed in it.  The brightness level could not be taken down to almost dark which meant that even at the lowest setting it was still too bright to read in a dark room.  The other disappointment was at how "closed" it was.  I wanted a reader I could load all of my books from the many different sources out there.  The Fire would not let me do that so I ended up giving my Fire to my sister and purchasing an IPAD which allowed me to have ibooks, Amazon books, Nook books and with a wonderful app - Bluefire Reader-all of my epub books.  On the IPAD I was able to dim the light real low so that I could read without eye strain in dark rooms.  The IPAD is now my main device which I am very, very happy with.  The Fire HD which I bought more for streaming the video content still has the problem with being closed to other reader apps and I still can't get the brightness low enough to read comfortably and without squinting in a dark room - those two things are what have made me rate this a 4 instead of a 5.Browser - I never liked browsing on the original Fire and I didn't like doing it on the HD last night.  I got kicked out of some of the things I entered and - it was so slow in opening things and moving around - even on Amazon's website - that I gave up.  It is not the device that I will use when I want to research things - again I think the IPAD wins in that arena.Game Apps - I haven't explored these yet but I do know that I liked the ones that were on the original Fire. I'm not expecting anything different on this device.I tried the Xray capability on the book I was currently reading and found that it will not work on all books.  I got a message saying it was not available for the book I was reading. So this appears to be a hit or miss capability.I'm still playing with the device but this is my first impression after one day.  As a streaming device - excellent so far.  As a reader - it is a great experience when you are not in a dark room. The font is very crisp and clear - the page turning is very quick and seamless.  With the black of the bezel when the settings time off you truly are able to lose yourself in the words and you don't even see the actual device.  I can see using it as a reader in the daytime, but at night I will switch to the IPAD with the lowest light setting on.  If Amazon would fix the light settings and would just have confidence in themselves and allow the other reader apps to be installed - I would be very happy to rate this a 5+.  I have the IPAD and the other reader apps installed and honestly - I still purchase more Amazon books than Nook and ibooks.  Amazon - don't worry about the competitors, please allow them in. The Fire would be an awesome device if you opened it up.All in all I do not regret the purchase.  It's a good upgrade and a good start on the HD product - future upgrades can surely bring it closer to perfection.

Reviews.Title: Huge step up from original Fire
Reviews.Author: M. Heard
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from the original Fire.  Amazon has done a great job presetting up the Fire HD with your account information.  Huge improvements: screen, speakers, power button, etc.  12.6GB of usable storage on the 16GB device is another big improvement. Largest improvement was the much needed volume rocker, thank you.  Lows: no power adapter included.  Great buy at the price.

Reviews.Title: Might want to wait on this purchase...
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Sutcliffe
Reviews.Content: Love amazon and love the first kindle fire. Not so much with this one.Pros:Beautiful screenGreat speakersCons:Getting constant launcher not responding. Would you like to close? Error messages.Hanging and taking longer than it should to do tasksNot sure why but finding I have click or swipe several times to get the device to do what I want it toNo flash so no you tube or sites with flash content which I do not understand since the first kindle fire does play you tubeNo wall charger just USB charger cordMust pay $15 to get rid of obnoxious ads that are every whereFavorites on main screen replaced with hidden adds disguised as recommendations even if you pay the $15 to remove the other adsTaking 10 seconds to minutes to load cloud content

Reviews.Title: Finally, a tablet for my Amazon needs
Reviews.Author: Robert Madison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I pre-ordered the 7" HD Kindle fire and received them yesterday via UPS. Contrary to the many reviews I've read about the annoying ads and lack of a charger, I found that the ads are extremely limited (only seen 9 offers and 1 was for a $5 music credit) and only popped up when the screen was locked. Also, while there is no wall charger with this Kindle, we received a mini-USB cord which serves us better. I also would recommend purchasing the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7" Standing Leather Case if you can spare the extra expense. The case has descent padding and puts the kindle to sleep and wakes it up when you open and close the case and also saves you the trouble of having to push the strangely frustrating sleep button.This device is a must have if you're a prime member and do a lot of shopping around Amazon's ecosystem but if you're looking for a tablet that functions like a computer, you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: As a first gen Kindle Fire owner...
Reviews.Author: ravager814
Reviews.Content: ... I have to say KF HD is vastly improved over last year's model. Having said that, it isn't a Nexus 7, nor is it purported to be. But if you read the customer reviews, you would think it is an atrocity that Amazon has slightly subsidized the cost of the Kindle with advertisements. The thing is, these ads are no different then when you go on Amazon's website, and if you REALLY can't stand seeing an ad when you turn on the device, you can pay 15 bucks to turn them off, on your lock screen. Amazon wants to sell you content, not hardware. People don't seem to get that. Then you have the idiots giving it one star because there is no charger included. But it does come with a high quality USB to micro USB cable, which is worlds better than the POS charger they included last year. I bundled a "high speed" Amazon charger with my purchase, and they knocked 10 bucks off the price. So for 10 dollars more, I get a very well made charger, that I can use for more than just charging the Kindle.My mini review:Build Quality: I think last year's model seems sturdier, with the Gorilla glass and compact feel to it. It also fit nicely in my hand. But the HD is no slouch. It has a nice, rounded design, much like the iPhone 3GS, which makes it more pleasing, aesthetically. The glass is polarized, and not as reflective anymore. This makes the screen easier to see. 4/5Screen: Those extra pixels really make a difference! There are rich blacks now, and the touch interface is much improved. However, it IS an Android device, and so you know it will be laggy at times. Reading books is a real pleasure, now. Very little eye strain. 5/5Ports and buttons: A big slam on the KF last year was the location of the power button, and the exclusion of an external volume control. The button of the KF is on the "bottom" of the device, it was not recessed and soft touch, and it was pretty easy to accidentally turn it off. Why they didn't have a switch, like on the Kindle 3, is a total mystery to me! Anyway, this has been changed with the HD. The power button is now almost impossible to turn off accidentally, because it is so well recessed into the unit, and is also now at the "top" (in portrait) of the device. The only problem now, is that sometimes it is hard to find! And it also is right next to the volume rocker. Still, that is a huge improvement. The ports have also changed. For one thing, the micro USB is much better made, meaning there will be much fewer instances of the device not being able to charge unless you wiggle the connector, especially when you take into account that the USB cable included is very high quality. There is also a mini HDMI port as well. Take THAT, Nexus 7! So with a 10 dollar cable you can plug that bad boy into an HD television. Hopefully HBO Go will allow that, someday. 5/5Audio: You aren't going to get a better sounding tablet, period. The stereo separation is fantastic, for a 7 inch device. I was amazed when watching Netflix last night, when I could hear the sounds, seemingly a foot to the right of the device. Superb. I also have some music in the cloud, and was listening to Live Rust, like it was a portable radio. The volume is noticeably louder, and clearer. I do think they should provide an equalizer, though. Nevertheless, full marks. 5/5Browser: You are better off side loading Dolphin HD or Chrome. Silk is still not that great, and using that browser gives you "trending" advertisements. Not a fan. 2/5The (much maligned) interface: I'm not a huge fan or the carousal, and I DO think it cripples the Android experience too much. To make things worse (for some) when you choose an item in your carousal, you get "similar titles" displayed on the bottom. These don't really bother me, since I like to see what other work is out there from an author or artist. I believe there is a way around this, by using Go Launcher (side loaded) or something similar. 2/5So, all in all, I am very happy with my purchase. I will probably side load the Google Play store, Youtube, and several other apps. I will also consider rooting, but I like the Amazon eco system, and I fear that will be degraded if I do. I suppose I will install Go Launcher, and see if that works for me. I didn't cover the more technical improvements, since you can just see that in the specs. As an owner of the new iPad 4G LTE, which I love, I can see how the HD will still fit into my life. It is nowhere near as bulky, and has a similar battery life. As a reader, except for scientific papers, I find the iPad to be a less-than-enjoyable experience, but it is a real pleasure with the Kindle Fire HD. Many of the shortcomings of KF 1.0 have been addressed in the HD. I'm not thrilled that I have to spend 40-50 bucks for a new case, but I know it will be worth it.Overall rating: Nifty device. 3.5/5 RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, especially for reading
Reviews.Author: Edwin G. Bjore "Journeyman"
Reviews.Content: Only had it for couple of days as my first tablet.  It's been a great experience.The screen is great--clear, bright colors.  Best of all, I can read books even in direct sunlight.  I had feared that screen might be unusable in bright light, but it is still readable.The apps are fun, and eMail is easy to read.Only thing that I wish is that they had a full tutorial about how to use it, so that some of the less obvious things, like use of the dictionary while reading, would be easier to find.  Easy once I know how, but it took a bit of searching the user manual to find it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HD: First Impressions From a Rookie
Reviews.Author: Marie McC
Reviews.Content: This is my first Fire or tablet of any kind. I previously owned a K2, KK and Touch. Here are my first impressions with less than 24 hours of use.The device is very smart looking and a nice size to hold. There is no bezel like on the Touch. The gorilla glass covers the front from edge to edge, and the back has a silky feel, making it almost slippery. Get a good grip on it if you plan to handle it without a cover.Power up is instant. The power switch is flush with the case. I haven't been able to find it by feel and have to turn it over and look for it every time. The display is beautiful. My photos look great on it.Response is very snappy most of the time. Occasionally it's unresponsive, requires several taps or there is a lag. You can adjust the sleep setting (number of minutes of inactivity to put it in sleep mode). Oddly, the choices ranges from 5 to 15 minutes or more. I wanted to set it at 10, but that choice isn't available. It will not wake up from sleep with a touch to the screen. You have to press the power button again.If you've never had a tablet or a touch device, prepare for a steep learning curve. Prepare for a little frustration while you learn how to use it. The menu system is pretty good, but you'll still need to know where to look for things and where to tap to call up hidden menus. It is not absolutely intuitive all the time.Read the Fine Manual. Read the Fabulous Manual. Read the Fantastic Manual. There's a good User Guide in the device, but it's buried under four layers. To access it: (1) swipe down from the top of the screen to get into the Quick Settings menu. (2) tap More. (3) tap Help & Feedback. (4) tap User Guide. It's a lot more detailed than the KFHD pages on the Amazon website. I was unable to Favorite the User Guide to get it on the home page. You have to have wireless turned on in order to access the User Guide.Speaking of wireless, this device goes by the Airplane Mode On/Off designation rather than Wireless On/Off. You have to swipe down from the top of the screen to get into Quick Settings in order to change it.Don't be shy about calling Amazon for help. That's what they're there for. You can access Amazon help through the Help and Feedback tab. There's a Customer Service tab which will allow you to call or email Amazon Kindle help and leave feedback. It couldn't be easier.Transferred a couple of mp4 videos from the computer via the USB cord to the Movies folder on the Fire. The videos did not show up under the Videos tab on the Fire screen. I emailed Amazon and was advised to use the Gallery app. There is no Gallery app on the new Fire HD, only on the 1st generation Fire. The answer is in the on-device User Guide (but not on the web page!): On the new Fire HD, there is a Personal Videos app which will play the mp4s that you transfer to it. Only videos downloaded from Amazon will display under the Videos tab. Once I launched the Personal Videos app, my two videos were there. One was a movie that I converted to an mp4 from a DVD. The other was a slideshow created with specialized software that I saved as an mp4. They both played with no problems and looked GREAT!The Fire is not a replacement for the e-ink reader if reading is your main usage. I sold my Touch, even though I loved it, because first, I thought I might end up not using it once I got the Fire. Second, I like the idea of the front lit Paperwhite, its higher contrast and the time-to-read feature so I wanted to upgrade. The Fire reading experience is very different from the e-ink reader experience. Strictly for reading, I prefer a dedicated e-ink device. Also, after handling the Fire for a short while, I found it a little heavy for comfortable reading for long periods of time. I will definitely be ordering a Paperwhite as my primary book reader. Having two devices is not redundant.Books uploaded via USB obtained from non-Amazon sources will show up as Documents, even if you save them to the Books folder on the device. I find that user unfriendly and would rather have all books show up under the Books tab (just like books from any source show up as books on the e-ink reader), and I left feedback to that effect. Covers of "documents" didn't display, even though they are really books and have color covers. I hope that can be fixed in a software update.Despite the occasional frustrations of not knowing where things are and how it all works yet, I'm really enjoying the Fire HD. The only mistake I made was having ordered the one with only 16G of storage. Now that I've had a chance to use it, I can foresee being mad at myself for cheaping out on storage space. I'll be exchanging it and upgrading to the 32G version, so any of you looking for a deal on a new Fire HD should keep an eye out on Amazon's Warehouse Deal pages!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Janet S. Bettis
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire HD 7" in today.  I have noticed a few very good advancement versus the Kindle Fire that my husband will now get as a hand-me-down :) 1.  The screen has better resolution and it shows. Very crisp on everything I have put to it!  2.  My Wi-Fi on my older Kindle got three bars and this puppy gets the whole enchilada.  Wow, it downloads and plays back very quickly. 3.  The sounds is soooooo much better.  I played some music from my cloud.  No hesitation (better Wi-Fi antennae) and sounded so much better than my older Kindle.  Loaded a movie which downloaded quickly, looked and sounded awesome.  The headphone sound was superior to boot.  I downloaded everything from my cloud (which is a BUNCH) and still have a lot of room to grow.  Now, only one thing I can complain about at this post:  The last menu item on the upper bar is way too far to the right of the screen thus is it cloudy.  Clear that one up, Amazon!  I am so far very happy with my Kindle Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: Sharon's 2nd Kindle
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Thank you for replacing my Kindle, however, I thought I was getting a new one not refurbished.  As my original was new.

Reviews.Title: Device with known ongoing defect - Terrible service and policy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "dannym60610"
Reviews.Content: This device has a known defect - it will basically crash randomly once in a while and you need to turn in back on. Just search "kindle fire hd crashes" and you will see what I mean. There is even a thread on Amazon describing this - not sure if Amazon will keep the link in this review (http://www.amazon.com/forum/kindle?_encoding=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx1D7SY3BVSESG&cdThread;=Tx34UVRK1RMGYZQ)In any case, my device started exhibiting these issues after about 8 months. After speaking with several kindle support reps in various countries (but not a single one from the U.S.) they finally reached the conclusion that my device needs to be replaced. But under these conditions:1) If I don't return the old device, I need to pay $244, which is what my device cost in May 2013. While this is a moot point (because I would return the defective device) I doubt the device currently costs anywhere near that. In fact, the 32GB version I own is obsolete.2) The device I will be getting is actually refurbished, not new.3) The warranty on the new device will be 90 days. Given that my old device started having problems after 8 months, what good is a 90 day warranty on the replacement item?If one buys a new item with a 365 day warranty and the manufacturer realized it's defective, I expect to receive exactly what I bought - a new item with a 365 day warranty. From Amazon, I would have expected even more - especially since they get almost $100 back from me each year on the Kindle Free Time feature.In 6 months I may just end up with the new version of the iPad mini...

Reviews.Title: This rating is for the "refurbished" one...
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: My original Kindle (purchased a little over a year ago) was great and aside from freezing up occasionally, I had no issues with it. Well about a month ago the charging port came loose and it wouldn't take a charge. The extended warranty covered a replacement and they sent me a "refurbished" one. That one lasted about (2) weeks before it locked up permanently. I received my 2nd "refurbished one today. We'll see how long it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Works great but seems to be prone to problems early.
Reviews.Author: Clarence R. Chagnon
Reviews.Content: I am in the process of having my kindlefire replaced after 4 months of use. The screen wouldn't rotate and after going on Amazon chat to try to fix it, they are sending me a replacement. I will say that I have had good service response from Amazon whenever I had an issue with one of their products and it has been easy to deal with them. I am hoping that the new kindlefire will last longer than the first one but I am assured that any problems I may have with it will be addressed promptly. It's just the hassle of going through the replacement process which means I have to re-download everything I had on the defective one. Other than that, I really like the product and will continue to shop at Amazon. Service means a lot to me and being a Prime Member was one of the best decisions I made from a consumer standpoint.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy with product replacement
Reviews.Author: rock and roll.
Reviews.Content: I received a replacement and it doesn't work. My first one doesn't charge. I know I need to return one, but I don't feel I should until I get a working kindle that will charge.

Reviews.Title: refurbished, like new
Reviews.Author: TooHonest
Reviews.Content: I received my recycled kindle in a very short time from when it was ordered. It was an upgrade to replace one that had charging issues. By going the refurbished route, I saved money. The kindle itself has the same warranty as a new one and works wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Had a problem...but Amazon came through again!
Reviews.Author: Loved it
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kindle Fire HD 7" for a year or more.  I recently had an issue and as usual Amazon resolved it and kept a happy and satisfied customer.I bought my Kindle in February of 2013 and 5 days after the warranty of one year, it froze.  I was very upset and called.  Although it took 3 phone calls, when I finally got the right operator, and it was replaced for free.  I have been a customer of Amazon for many years and love their customer service.  After the first call I thought that maybe their customer service had changed.  I am relieved to say, once you find the right operator (I assume the ones who have been there longer), the issue can always be resolved.Thank You Amazon for your customer service.

Reviews.Title: My third Kindle
Reviews.Author: Bobbe
Reviews.Content: It is a joy to use.  Very user friendly.  I take it everywhere to read, check emails, etc.  I do wish the battery lasted a bit longer.Other than that... I would not be without it.

Reviews.Title: Its on fire alright !!
Reviews.Author: NitWit "Carl"
Reviews.Content: This thing is great. Just what we needed. Great viewing screen, good sound, well designed. The kids love it, so do the parents !!! This is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Where Have You Been All My Life?
Reviews.Author: Brian Kirk
Reviews.Content: What is not to love about this device. It is so great for reading books, surfing the web, watching videos, listening to music, playing with apps.

Reviews.Title: amazing device for my needs.
Reviews.Author: Rene
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I have the money to buy a iPad without hurting my wallet. So why did I buy myself a Kindle?To start, I didnt want all the things that the iPad comes with. I honestly wanted a simple Tablet for movies, magazines, and at times, books. I searched day by day on all the Tablets that might meet my requirements. I even checked out the Tablets that no one knows about. Finally i bump into the Kindle when opening my Amazon account for a different purchase. My god it was love in first sight. Im so freaking glad I got myself the Kindle HD.Just remember, its not a iPad. Yes the Kindle has problems, but the problems doesn't yank at my nerves. They really are small problems like small lag when the screen changes position.

Reviews.Title: My kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: I bought it to read books/ magazines on .. but it does so much more.Its lightweight and easy to fit into my purse. I hardly even use my laptop anymore!Amazon customer service has also been very helpful with any questions I have, and quick to respond.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Doug Johnson "Wolf"
Reviews.Content: My first one came with a crack and would function sporadically.  One call to Amazon customer service and an exchange was on the way, no muss, no fuss.  This is my first touch screen device, so I don't have much to compare it with, but I got to say, It is a lot of fun.  Kind of hard to put down at times, with with the books to read, audiobooks to listen to, games to play, the ability to "surf the web", and the massive selection of apps (a lot of which are free).

Reviews.Title: useless after 10 months!
Reviews.Author: Bexley's Mom
Reviews.Content: I'm so disappointed! Despite sporadic use and pristine care, this Kindle Fire is useless. It scrolls pages on it's  own, blurs them together which makes reading or web browsing impossible. I am unable to see the bottom half of ANY page. I keep my kindle on my nightstand in a protective cover. It is only charged when the battery is nearly dead and unplugged when it is finished charging. It has never been dropped, or been spilled on. It is hardly used and still looks brand new! It has not even left the house! I will be returning this. I am hopeful Amazon will honor the one year warranty and not give me the same grief as other reviewers of defective Kindles have mentioned here.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Jeanette
Reviews.Content: The customer service department is great at amazon. however the new one still does not work. It does not turn on or will turn off on its own.

Reviews.Title: Still A Great Value
Reviews.Author: Glt68
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these this year, as an upgrade for my niece and nephew who had the first generation Kindle Fire. It seems to be quite a bit faster, with a great screen image, and they are fans of the camera. The only complaint is that the power button does not light up to indicate the charge status. The old version would glow amber when charging then turn green when charged, this model does nothing so you need to either charge it over night or leave it in stand-by mode so you can check the status. With all the family members liking these Kindle's, I should be in some sort of a frequent buyer club as these are numbers 8 and 9 that I have bought so far. These refurbished units look just like new, there are no indications whatsoever that they were ever used previously.

Reviews.Title: Professional review of Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Christie Wilson
Reviews.Content: I give it the worst possible rating, Amazon, because one star was the lowest rating available to me at this review site. Because, Amazon, this is the SEVENTH Kindle that has been sent to me. The seventh! Shall we begin the sordid tale? One I have told to countless customer service reps, in countless countries, from countless call centers? Yes, let's.My very first Kindle I received as a Valentine's day gift - a LOVE gift, Amazon - from my husband, because he caught me drooling over my sister's Kindle HD several times and he was worried that much saliva would damage it.
