I should have known right then that something I wanted that much would not be a good thing for me to have. Lesson learned, Amazon, so thanks for that! That very first Kindle quit working within three months. The replacement you sent me quit working within a month. The third replacement within a week. The fourth within an HOUR. The fifth within TWENTY MINUTES.Are we sensing a pattern yet, Amazon? All of that after having been reassured time and time again by various call centers and customer service reps, all outside of the USA, that I was getting NEW Kindles and not refurbished. Despite being assured this, Amazon, I am just as assured they were refurbished junk due to lint trapped under the screen of Kindle #2, scratches on the screen of Kindle #3, and dirt under the casing of Kindle #5. That, together with the abysmal packaging - dirt, poor re-taping, scrapes and tears in the cardboard, etc. - speak USED and ABUSED to me, Amazon, particularly since Kindle #6 was a brand spanking new one, sent to me direct from online ordering.How do I know this? Because, Amazon, the call center supervisor I finally was able to get a hold of told me that all of the other reps I talked to should not have assured me they were brand new, that all replacements were refurbished, and had me place an order for good ole #6 direct from your very own little website! Too bad that good ole #6 was the DOWNGRADED Kindle. You know, the one with cheaper casing, no front-facing camera, all the extras taken off of it. Because in the scant seven months I'd been gnashing my teeth and wailing over your disappointing to say the very least product, you, Amazon, decided to add a few more pixels, a scant few more bells and whistles, and what I'm assuming is dust from the very tushie of Tinkerbell, considering that putting that X following the HD part of the Kindle justified you increasing the price another $150.You can understand my vexation, can't you? That the product I had paid the fullest price for, plus the added injustice of your exorbitant and nearly useless extended warranty that neither the retail store your product was stocked with - I assume by you, Amazon - nor indeed by you yourself, Amazon, was willing to stand behind, was now no longer being produced. But hey, we'll take off the goodies and give you a cheaper knock off of the original it'll all be good customer service and you'll be happy, right? Wrong, Amazon. So very, very wrong.Realizing at once it was not the product that I had in good faith been told was the EXACT product I had originally purchased, I didn't even take it out of the plastic wrapping. I called up the good ole Amazon helpline again, and once more shared my sad tale of Kindle Fire HD woe with its myriad forms and failings, perhaps a bit more heatedly - a friend who was with me at the time compared it to a nuclear meltdown, but I think it was more napalm level, myself - and was assured yet again that a supervisor would call me back within 15 minutes. I waited three hours. Three HOURS, Amazon. No call. I will admit to losing my cool with the next poor customer service rep from yet another call center in yet another country. It was probably approaching nuclear. I demanded a direct transfer to a supervisor and was told yet again it was impossible. Impossible for just such occasions, yes, Amazon? So that the buck can be passed on and on and you never have to directly deal with an aggrieved customer right, Amazon? Despite all fervent assurances and against my better judgement, but more likely because of the raging headache my semi-nuclear meltdown had brought on, I once again agreed to be called back by a supervisor. The wait would be no more than 10 minutes this time, I was informed. Care to hazard a guess on how long I waited? No? TWO DAYS. Two days, Amazon. No call.Perhaps fortunately for those poor souls just trying to do their job, I am not one of those people who can sustain my anger for more than a day at most, usually not more than a few hours. After two days I was determined, but calm. Once more I called. One more time I repeated my oft-told tale. Well, actually twice more, because at last I had gotten a customer service rep who did what I asked of her. She personally ensured that a supervisor called me back. From Malaysia this time. He walked me through ordering another Kindle online, my seventh now. Assured me it was brand new. Showed me screen grabs of the page when I was unable to access it because the ordering page for my version of Kindle HD was no longer being sold online.By the by, you do realize that at this point, because I had no time between the failings of the last three Kindles and the arrival of the replacements, that I had FOUR Kindles in my home, three of which were useless paperweights waiting to be sent back? In sheer price of shipping alone, if you had just sent me your fancy, fairy dust sprinkled, brand new Kindle HDX - in which I'm just betting, Amazon, you've addressed all these problems with your now defunct previous Kindle HD - in the first place or issued me a voucher for a new one off the shelf of Best Buy or a FULL refund on the junk you sent me, you would have ultimately saved money, don't you?Regardless, I received the last one I ordered and shipped back others. Alas, the 'new' one was in the beat up, torn up, re-taped dirty package. Another refurb. Lucky it is for you, Amazon, that I was tired of fighting, it was the same product I originally purchased, and that it has actually been working. I have prayed over this ridiculous thing every time I turn it on and I am keeping what I do on it to the bare minimum until it's proved itself as more than a three-monther.If this Kindle fails ... well, I'm afraid, Amazon, that your faithlessness and unwillingness to stand behind your defective product will have done me in. Not to mention your passing me around your call centers like a slightly insane, annoying in-law that comes to visit and stays too long with her ridiculous demands. It's not me, Amazon, it's you. I'm sorry, but if it fails that will be the end for you and me - and anyone else I can convince that you are the ultimate bad acquaintance. It was brief and unsatisfying and rage-inducing. All toxic in any relationship, don't you agree, Amazon? It's better this way. My friend? The one who saw the nuclear meltdown and its wintry aftermath? She's already sworn you off.You really should have just stuck with books.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet, but not for power users
Reviews.Author: terthen
Reviews.Content: Quick pros and cons of the Kindle Fire HD for anyone thinking about getting one (although admittedly this review is a little late given the HDX is already out). My comparison is with the Nexus 7, as I was choosing between these two.PROS:- screen is crisp and clear- audio is the best of any tablet I've used- I found myself using the Kindle Fire HD to watch more movies than I did with our iPad given the above- great build quality- Amazing Amazon customer service--actually had 1 Kindle with a bad battery and Amazon immediately replaced itCONS:- While the "major" apps are mostly there, I really missed the Google Play Store- Overall the Silk Browser was slow, made me search for other browsers to use but had to sideload these (and these other browsers like Dolphin and Chrome were buggy when sideloaded)- Not easy to multitask with this, especially missed the app-switching button on stock Android- Stock email app is nowhere as good as Google's Gmail app (which you have to jump through a few hoops to get it to work on the KFHD)Overall, the Kindle Fire HD is a very nice tablet but I would recommend it more for those with Prime who want to watch movies, listen to mp3s, and casually browse the web. Essentially, this would be a great tablet for the less tech-savvy or for my mom--and the amazing customer service really helps even more there!  I think these were Amazon's goals and they did a great job at it.  But for the power users who like to customize, for the developers, or for those trying to use a tablet to make them more efficient, the Nexus 7 easily wins here.

Reviews.Title: Very, very surprised.
Reviews.Author: R N Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this thinking that we could Skype with one of my daughters, play some games, do a little web surfing..... didn't know I could connect to my credit union and pay bills, compose documents and spreadsheets, take pictures, check, bid, and pay for my auction items and a lot of other things with this 7" monster.  My whole family uses it, loves it.  We check the weather forecast every morning before we leave home, check emails, reply to them..... The only thing I haven't done yet is print from it, but I can send things to the cloud and download them to my laptop (which is getting kind of lonely lately) and print from there.  My only regret is that I didn't get one sooner.  Great product.  Great sound.  Super fast delivery.  Zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: Bad for Web Browsing and short battery life
Reviews.Author: Marisa Iverson
Reviews.Content: My old Kindle stopped working so I decided to upgrade to the Kindle Fire so I could read, watch videos, and do some web browsing. I wish I would have spent the money to get an iPad. Two of the activities I want to do on the Kindle don't actually work that well. I like to watch Netflix on the Kindle but the battery runs down really fast and I have to charge it after one evening of use. I also bought the Kindle to browse the web but A LOT of pictures do not load on the Kindle. The browser software sucks! I try to use Pinterest and it has to restart at least one time each session. Overall, I wish I had bought an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Problem
Reviews.Author: Kathy Brooks
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire But had a problem with mine but called the company and they sent me a new one and I send back the defective one

Reviews.Title: Its GREAT but it BROKE TWICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is very cool. I love it and I would give it 5 stars but, there are a few things that bring it down to 3 stars.!!!!! I am not sure if these problems were because it is a "Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD" or not, but it might be better to by new than refurbished. !!!!!1) the battery life is not the greatest. it goes for about 10 hours with the screen at half brightness until it is out of battery. if it's not being used, it will "run" for about 20 hours in sleep mode.2) When my Kindle came in the mail, it worked fine... until I noticed that when it was plugged in, the touch screen didn't work. so I sent it back(Amazon has the BEST CUSTOMER SERVES) and within 2 days I got another one(I had it sent the original Kindle back). and then after about using it for 2-3 hours, I noticed that now the headphone jack didn't always register that there was headphones! so I sent it back and got my money back(a full refund).

Reviews.Title: family-friendly child friendly
Reviews.Author: Marisol Cuevas "Sol"
Reviews.Content: All is great battery duration software speed but it is not compatible with Adobe flash player :(. Some video websites can not be viewed.

Reviews.Title: love it**** want another*** put it back on sale soon ok?
Reviews.Author: SheShops2much
Reviews.Content: I live in rural Wyoming and my television and internet are provided via satellites. My house looks awful with 4 dishes hanging off but there is no cable service and dial up is a joke. I purchased 2 acer tablets and paid $300 each. They stank before this Fire HD, but now they really stink. I bought this Kindle Fire HD after buying a regular Kindle for my husband who loves to read. The little e-reader was neat but it was not enough. Fire is fast. For my internet service I get 2 choices, slow and a little slower. Once when I upgraded to faster speed we used all our data for the month in an afternoon watching movies. Can't buy more data.I have prime membership because I love the 2 day shipping to my door. But with the Fire I get all my stuff in one place and I can borrow a book from time to time. The set up is the easiest ever. Fire is really intelligent. My husband also loves music and all the cd's we have purchased on Amazon is stored in our Cloud. The sound is amazing for such a little thing. WOW! We have Bose everywhere in our house and vehicles, (it's a 70's childhood thing) but this little monster is clear as can be, zero distortion, zero freezing, zero anything negative. Videos are awesome to watch. I can't wait to get one for myself. Everything about it is nice, the display, the ease of use, the amazing sound, the touch screen,My only problem is this, when I got it for my husband a few days ago it was $40 less expensive than it is today and of course I want one too. So come on now Amazon, put it back on sale for a few days, I already have the animal print case...it's in my cart...I get paid tomorrow... come on now.....

Reviews.Title: Good Reader, Slow Browser
Reviews.Author: leucydan
Reviews.Content: The display is excellent, sharp and clear, very vibrant colors.  Excellent for reading and watching videos, photos, etc.So as a compact reader, easy to handle I would give it 5 stars.But since it connects to the web, I use it to check emails, read newspapers and so on.  I don't like the Kindle version of many subscriptions, for example the NYTIMES Kindle version is badly formatted, not all photos are included and it carries over many articles from previous weeks.  So I subscribe to the digital web version so I have "all" the daily paper, no more, no less.  The Silk Browser is slow and hangs up often, also doesn't support Java..so many clips of videos I come across during web browsing DO NOT PLAY. I have used a third party browser, Dolphin, in the past to correct this but now Amazon appears to have thwarted this as I can't find this app available anymore.So, if you want to work on the web often, the Kindle Fire HD Wi-Fi is barely adequate, but it will work...3 stars for thatBut if you mainly want a great screen for reading books and watching videos, it's hard to beat...5 stars.  Total is 4 stars, because the browser is weak.

Reviews.Title: Needs work on the battery
Reviews.Author: Animal Luver "Ret. AF SSgt"
Reviews.Content: I got it in August.  I love it and use it daily almost around the clock.  Most of the time it is kept plugged in because the battery charge doesn't last long.  I bought a power fast charger, and when I used "power fast charger" the screen message called it a low power charger.  The other thing I noticed is after a long usage the Kindle heated up, like the old laptops and netbooks used to do.After talking to the Kindle service people (all overseas), we came to the conclusion it is defective.  Yes, they are send a replacement next day.  In my opinion, I believe it needs to have a battery which will hold a charge longer,

Reviews.Title: kindle is ok
Reviews.Author: Laura J
Reviews.Content: First, I am a newbie to the world of tablets and netbooks so, bearing that in mind, while I like kindle fire HD I am disappointed in the lack of options for use offline unless one pays money for various apps. I am also deeply disappointed in the various apps that require weird and totally unnecessary permissions (come on now) . Having said that, I still rate the kindle highly as I was sort of prepared for the above before I even bought it. I have seen many people's negative reviews  of all the ads. I have actually been pleased with most apps, even the free ones not placing the ads in conspicuous places so I actually have little complaint with that.Kindle customer service has been excellent. They completely replaced my kindle for a minor unfixable problem and my 2nd kindle works great. I've had about 10 encounters with them and each one resolved my issues quickly and with tact, efficiency and simple niceness considering my newbieness.I have heard horror stories about the kindle freezing. I have only truly experienced that once, don't know what happened but a quick forced restart worked to unfreeze it after reading through solutions on the kindle user forum which is easy to access online. No further problems. I did have my charger simply stop working and I'm still not sure about that but it was cheap and working now. May need to review it separately since it is a separate component.All in all, love reading on it, watching videos on it, even the 7 inch screen is ok but if you really like videos, recommend the 8.5 inch one.Apps seem a little lame so far but I admit I choose the free ones or cheap ones since I am gunshot about paying for an unproven app. Still searching for a decent drafting/paint program and a better note program although the free note program I found wasn't too bad but the paid sketch app I found requires you to sign your life away, not happening, again disappointed in that.Privacy seems nil on these devices but what do you really expect?Anyway, still happy and still trying new things.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire is great!
Reviews.Author: Susan Oehlke
Reviews.Content: It met all my expectations plus. Did not know it had the web, which is great.Also a great picture taker.

Reviews.Title: Not as Good as I was Expecting
Reviews.Author: Cherryln D. Parker "shopper"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD doesn't do everything I'd hoped.  Also, it was advertised that the battery lasts 11 hours and it lasts maybe 6 at the most if you're not using the internet.  The Kindle Owners lending library is kind of a joke as there are no really good books in there that can be borrowed for free.  Certainly you can purchase them.  There are glitches with borrowing books from the local library as well.

Reviews.Title: I love my Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7!
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader "book lover"
Reviews.Content: I've loved all my Kindles; would be lost without it.  The Kindle Fire, however, seems to have more glare to the screen than my previous original Kindles, which was one reason I could read them anywhere.  I would like to order a stylus in order to easily turn pages as the screen gets rather smeared from my fingertips.  I understand a stylus is available for the Kindle Fire but I don't know where to find one.Avid Reader

Reviews.Title: KINDLE
Reviews.Author: idreyona jackson
Reviews.Content: I like this kindle because I can listen and buy a lot of musics. I can also play games if I wanted to. I pray that I get this Kindle Fire HD7.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet in a handy size
Reviews.Author: Lfmiller
Reviews.Content: I've had Kindle for PC for about 5 years. I thought people who pay for a Kindle with e ink or touch screen or whatever were nuts. Kindle on my laptop is so much easier on the eyes. A friend loaned me her 2 year old Kindle Fire with ads for me to use a few months during a long recovery from surgery. It came with a month's free trial of Amazon Prime. I discovered that owning a Kindle has its advantages. I could download free music, apps and games (not a good idea. They're addictive time wasters, but fun). With Prime there were even free videos, tough I didn't try those until later.It became clear I'd better look for my own Kindle Fire and give this friend her Kindle back, so I cruised Amazon for pricing. Since I was using a perfectly fine used 7" KF with ads, I saw no reason to buy new. Money's tight.I tried to order a few offers for $74 or $80, but by the time I reached checkout the deal was gone. Looked into the differences between KF and KF HD, and figured I was happy enough with KF 7". The sound was fine. The display was fine. But I couldn't get a decent price. Took a break and figured I'd have to go back to my laptop Kindle app, until I happened on an offer for a gently used KF HD 7" for a reasonable price. It didn't have a cord or a charger, but it had a soft case. I bought and have used it happily 3 months. I decided to get the HD model because of a well reasoned review of the HD compared with the iPad and other Kindle models.For a week I had two Kindle Fire units-one earlier model and one HD. The standard display was fine. The KF HD display was excellent. The sound was good on both units, if a little better on the HD. I've never found the ads to be a nuisance. In fact the HD ads are gorgeous. Sound is subdued. I tried enhancing it with a KF speaker peripheral someone gave me. Doesn't make any difference. Sound is clear of static, and volume is adequate on the unit itself. Bought a hard case like the one I'd liked on my friend's borrowed KF. Used, it cost $3. It's great. Both units are easier to operate with a stylus. The T9 prescriptive text is a chore to get used to. But for music, movies, soundtracks and of course books, this Kindle Fire is great. It's easier to use than the iPads I've played with and way cheaper. Try and find an iPad for under $140. Not happening unless you mess with those freaky auction sites claiming you can get an iPad for $28 or something like that.A few other things to know: the 'fast' charger isn't any faster than the regular chargers on offer. My Kindle Fire charges in about 4 hours. It holds a charge in continuous use for 6. Some other chargers may be advertised for use with Kindle Fire, but plugged in, they give an error message "weak charge." Toss them or return them and get a working charger. Use a stylus and you don't need a screen cover. You don't have finger prints on screen. Most reviews of those complain about how hard they are to aapply, how they cut glare but dim brightness and clarity. Why buy HD and bank it's fire with a glare filter? If you're outside, play outside, enjoy the fun. Don't whip out an e-reader to watch a movie or read. That's indoor fun, rainy day fun. Bring a paperback to the beach. If it gets wet or sandy, who Cares? Use some sense.Only problems I've experienced are with Amazon Prime. Where I live they can't really honor their pledge for faster delivery. They can give you 'free' delivery- for $89/year. I tried Prime because it offered a video I long wanted to see 'free.' It wasn't. Prime is only worth the cost because of the free videos and you don't have to find enough product to make a $25 free shipping order. Not all Prime book offerings are in fact Prime (with free shipping). Until I got the Kindle Fire HD, I didn't see how I could benefit much from Amazon Prime. Since then, I've used its privileges a lot. But I check over the order carefully before checking outSo if you don't need great HD graphics, the Kindle Fire is your best bet. If you try the Kindle Fire HD, you won't want to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!!
Reviews.Author: Karrot
Reviews.Content: This is my third (and most likely) my last on for awhile. My first one was the kindle e-reader, then I got the Kindle Fire and was happy that I could read magazines in color.  No sooner after that the kindle hd came out and I wanted it.  Unfortunately, I was not in a position to get it.  Then, circumstances changed, and I was able to purchase the "HD" and it was reduced.  That was perfect timing and I'm am so very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: I gotta be able to read
Reviews.Author: kathleen
Reviews.Content: My work situation requires me to live in on alternate weeks and we do not have wireless. I download from home and bring my books with me on Kindle. It beats the 5 pounds of books I used to check out at the library and bring in a separate bag.  I also downloaded a few games. it's convenient, as everyone already knows, but for those of us who have to live at our jobs for several days, it saves on packing and overdue fines. I need to read every night or I have trouble getting to sleep and believe me, when you're not at home, you need all the help you can get. Kindle helps.

Reviews.Title: Best thing since sliced bread
Reviews.Author: Cynthia K. Manning "Devereaux fan"
Reviews.Content: I love this.  Especially when I am working out on my stationary bike in the basement. The format is easy to read and there is less eye strain.  I can peddle 45 minutes without even knowing it. I had been putting it off getting one and I wasn't sure I would like it when I first got it.  Definitely changed my mind.  Finally up with the times and my Mother (she is 80) and Sister.

Reviews.Title: Where's the WiFi?
Reviews.Author: Amazon User
Reviews.Content: I had a fifteen-year-old laptop that was able to get on public WiFi ffrom my home. But this item of what is supposedly leading edge technology tells me it's out of range. It only works if I walk over to the WiFi location, which I'm not about to do. I'm very disappointed in this item. And I can't return it because I had to open the packaging in order to check it out. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Almost awesome...
Reviews.Author: Shruthi
Reviews.Content: It works really well, compact, convenient and easy to watch videos anywhere. But I really wanted to use kindle fire to watch NFL games on my NFL Rewind subscription...I can seem to download the app. Is the kindle fire compatible with NFL rewind?...if YES..please help me figure it out...if NO...it should be. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon's Customer
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it takes a while to load or comes up that there are errors but not sure if that is the tablet or my wifi connection.  Other than that I have been pleased.

Reviews.Title: Difficult Navigation
Reviews.Author: Dianka Moton
Reviews.Content: Customers should know that the navigation of this device is very difficult. You also have to download every app on this device. If you are use to Iphone, Ipad, or anything of that sort, this is nothing like it. For Instagram you can not post anything all you are able to do is look at other people's posts.I did not like that what you last viewed was on the screen and also did not like that you could not rearrange the apps on the main screen. There were no instructions on how to use the kindle and the settings on the kindle was very limited.I have used an ipad numerous times and like it a lot more than the kindle. The quality of this item was below my expectations.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 7" 16GB I received had serious problems.
Reviews.Author: gpabruce
Reviews.Content: Many, many hours spent with Amazon tec's to no avail. The device I received probably had serious manufacturing faults that could not be resolved..

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Tripp
Reviews.Content: Got it for my Mom, and she loves it!  Now she can sit in the den with my Dad and play her favorite games, check her email and Facebook instead of having to go into the other room where her computer is.  She is his caregiver and she is now able to sit with him, but enjoy her fun things as well.

Reviews.Title: Nice product, but only if you live in the USA.
Reviews.Author: Chee Seng Yoong
Reviews.Content: I bought this product thinking that it would a be good alternative to the current batch of android and IOS products. It is definitely good for reading and downloading books , but as I bought it to be used out of the USA, it was not much good for any thing else. For example, I can't use it to download apps and music from the Amazon Store as I do not have a US Visa card. I know there are ways to get around it, but it is tedious and costly too. I should have waited for the Nexus 7 or the upcoming new ipad mini. In summary, if you are outside the US, and don't have a UScredit card, don't buy this device, unless you just want to download books.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Awesome!
Reviews.Author: STAR
Reviews.Content: I tell you the truth I was looking to make the best selection of kindles when. I have to say I purchased my Fire Kindle HD a year ago and I am so so happy I made the right choice in doing so. I Was Concerned about the touch screen feature.This is nothen close to a difficult touch screen. I absolutely adore my kindle HD.I surf the webpage & you can download available banking apps to pay bills.you can add your own email manually if its not listed. I was awful about checking my email, not anymore :). There is a lot of free app games etc. Free Pandora apps for music & 99cent mp3 music. Most of your books have a audio read on it even though they give you the options to purchase an additional audio read to your book,whether it reads or not. The free read feature is on the kindle & the additional audio read is different from the kindle read. Free youtube variety of every thing to music & recipes, hair styles, make You name it. Free apps for Wi-Fi free ph & txt service. This was the best selection for me. My Husband ordered this one of the cheaper in quality readers from Amazon. He was safely  disappointed after he saw how much more the fire kindle HD offers, and how easy & fun it was to use.You can read in the dark with no problem. This is it.... Go buy it don't wait any longer than you have to. The customer service support is wonderful! I hope you enjoy it as much as I have.

Reviews.Title: You cannot play facebook games on the Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Bruno
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD specifically for the purpose of being able to use it for facebook games....and it does not work for that!

Reviews.Title: What a toy
Reviews.Author: dennis kay
Reviews.Content: I saw this Kindle Fire HD 7 on sale for a price I could not resist. It is everything I hoped for and more. Great screen quality, to me it looks as good as an Ipad Retina. I buy books from Amazon, but also borrow free from my local library. Also, free magazines through Zinio. I can surf the web, check my mail, and it syncs my calendar. Music from Pandora, movies from Directv, HBO GO, Sho Anytime.My Kindle won't replace my laptop or desk top, but a great little tablet.

Reviews.Title: Set up is a breeze! Great color!
Reviews.Author: SummerRose
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle Fire about 20 minutes ago and already have it hooked up to wireless and set with my email address and necessary information. My books from my other Kindle transferred to this one without me having to do anything. For a techno-idiot, this is a wonderful thing! So far I'm thrilled. I may add other comments later on, but right now I'm quite impressed with my Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Great service and product.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle and I'm thrilled with it. Most notable was the service  I received when my Kindle quit working. The Amazom Service group should be a standard for the industry.They are OUTSTANDING!!!

Reviews.Title: $200? How generous.
Reviews.Author: Douglas Sanders
Reviews.Content: Lets get the bad out of the way first. I hate to bad mouth the Kindle Fire HD but its okay because this was the only problem. Gaming on the KF HD wasnt smooth or fluid. Games lag and barely playable. I wouldnt recommend it for gamers out there. I give the KF HD a 5star for everything else. WIFI is FAST and RELIABLE, EXCELLENT PICTURE with COLOR, CONTRAST, DETAIL and SOUND is like HOME THEATER with DOLBY DIGITAL PLUS. A truly amazing product on its own but for the price what a steal. A device this good I am anxiously awaiting for its successor.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Bonnie says... "Bonnie says..."
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. I have deliberately not used the e-mail function and have not loaded games. Both of these are time-wasters, when I really got the KF for entertainment. I can do e-mail elsewhere. I'm using my device for reading (of course), and watching movies and TV shows from several apps: NetFlix, HBO Go, Showtime Anytime, etc. I will also use it for radio, music, and more.My only complaint is the need to have access to WiFi to access content that is not already downloaded to my device. I am stranded if I am somewhere where there is no accessible wireless. I'm spoiled by my phone, that accesses data by WiFi and by my phone carrier. I wish there was an option to add my phone carrier to my KF - not for phone calls, but for access to data. I'd even pay Kindle more, if something in addition to WiFi could be available to deal with this issue.

Reviews.Title: longtime kindle owner
Reviews.Author: choosyfloosy "choflo"
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime kindle owner.  I read constantly.  I have eye implants after cataract removal so I, personally, own a kindle keyboard with the black ink display which is less likely to irritate and tire my eyes than backlit screens.  plus me and touch screens, not too compatible.  I bought this for my daughter who reads a lot, too, and is pretty conservative moneywise.  I got this so she could stick it in her purse and read on the bus going back and forth to work, afterall I have 1500 books she can load and read with no cost involved.  I just would like to say, this kindle fire hd was amazingly easy to set up for her.  I downloaded some books, some videos, some music, some apps, since my daughter in law has a kindle fire hd on my account and all of these things are available from our cloud.  this is a wonderful thing.  I told my daughter it is Christmas/birthday this year, maybe next year, too, since she had a "cow" about the money.  I consider it one of the best investments I have made for a long time.  only the cost of the kindle, a cover, and a fast charge socket were involved.  and I was surprised to find how easy it was to set up, touch screen fears are quite eased now.  if you have a family member who does not have a kindle, just get one for them.  you will feel really good, I promise!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Top Notch
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Bought the Kindle Fire HD for my daughter. She loves it. This device is perfect for a child. Its essentially "child proof" we've password protected most things and she's able to just play with it and we don't have to worry about her doing anything bad to the device or getting into inappropriate content on the internet.The only downside I can see so far is we've had several random lock ups since getting it, and we had one so bad we had to do a full factory restore soon after purchasing it due to a hard lock up that wouldn't allow the store button to be pressed. I can't attribute these locks to anything outside of my daughters use of the product so I'm not going to put the blame on the device and just chalk it up to being used every day by a 9 year old.All in all its a very solid product and very appropriate for children.

Reviews.Title: We love it!
Reviews.Author: Noah Fence
Reviews.Content: I had an old Kindle and was reluctant to spend money on a new Fire HD but when the sale was on, I decided to go for it.  I'd been wanting something I could use to watch all those Prime instant videos on while lying in bed, so I could get my money's worth on Prime.  Since they were on sale I got one for my "hubby" also.  Didn't think he'd like it but he loves it even more than I do.  The clarity of the screen is amazing.  Sounds great too.  Easy to use.  A couple of quibbles:  Since both are registered in my name, if he wanted to read a book I'm reading, then the Whispersync gets messed up.  Also, why the heck won't Amazon throw in the adapter for the wall charger?  The PC cable takes forever.  I'm going to try using my phone charger to see if it will charge the Kindle.  Hope I don't break it!Kindle Fire works great with Youtube.I hope the Prime Instant Video library grows.  It's difficult to find anything and not well organized now, though.Overall, this was a wise purchase on my part.  I suspect it will go on sale again.  Wait until it does.  I paid $159 instead of $199.  Special offers don't bug me.

Reviews.Title: My Experience
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire hd ? can I say about this technology I'll start w/ keeps everything that u r familiar w/ in 1place 4 convieance a basic portable computer at your finger tips . As far a communications goes w/ family n friends their r many apps available 4 that purpose - Amazing how much the technology has changed throughout the yr' s - on a negative note ? I don't like it doesn't allow flash program - N no instructions came w/ the KIndle at all - 2 me strange n a disappointment not knowing where 2 begin I was completely lost - when charging the device expect 2 wait a little over 6 hrs. - when the post man delivered it he drops w/ no care in the world apcalutly no respect- the kindle was 50% charged already  n the other negative thing it doesn't come w/an adapter 2 charge it -has 2 b purchased separately.

Reviews.Title: I'm having fun
Reviews.Author: zzmz "crazy to cook"
Reviews.Content: I am still learning the ins and outs , but so far I'm very pleased. It's a way to waste waaaaay to much time, but it's fun-

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: coffee
Reviews.Content: Terrific tablet.  Enjoying it very much.  Great for reading books.  Look forward to having it for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet On The Market For Kids
Reviews.Author: Steve Taylor

The only thing that I have an issue with is the ads that come up when you first turn on the Kindle and in-game commercials such as the ones that pop-up on Words With Friends. Although I have not seen anything offensive, that does not mean there will not be in the future. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: So much better than a PC...
Reviews.Author: theschlingel
Reviews.Content: I truly love this product... it is faster than my desktop, and doesn't spend time telling me what IT wants to do... it just allowes me to decide what I want to do... Internet, games, apps... even the evening news from Las Vegas, and of course the books.  This has become my new PC, Phone (Skype), and TV all rolled into one, and the sound is fantastic.You can add a word processor, print to a wireless printer, watch movies, the possibilities are seemingly endless.I got a Logitech bluetooth keyboard for the ability to type for real, and boom.... a total personal entertaintment, business, media center.Who needs the hype of I pad when Kindle Fire HD rocks so hard.... I am a techno challenged person... and got it with lightning speed.... my 68 year old mother has one too... (but with the bigger screen)  she's even more techno challenged than I and is really loving it.... she uses it all day.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Violet1760
Reviews.Content: I've had my kindle for 8 months now and the first month it was fine. But after that I noticed the battery drained fast and sometimes wouldn't even turn on! I called customer service and the first time they were helpful and sent me "new" one. Except I quickly realized it was not new it was refurbished and worked worse then the first one ahhhh! So now my money was spent for nothing and it was the worst experience!If you are looking for a smaller tablet I guess for school don't get it. It worked well but only for a short amount of time. I'm really disappointed in this product. Definitely don't recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Birthday gift ever!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Pena
Reviews.Content: Received kindle fire for my birthday. This is my second kindle- my first was the original kindle. I love the HD! I have enjoyed a few movies and have been taking advantage of the Weekly Kindle deals. Have been introduced to some new authors I would have never heard of. I got prime time and have enjoyed the free shipping as I often send gifts to my grandsons in San Diego- very convenient. I am thrilled with my kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: Love them!
Reviews.Author: kim dinger
Reviews.Content: my son and daughter both look their kindles!  Even my daughter who is mentally challenged was able to operate her Kindle.  We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: A good thing
Reviews.Author: Madam Mel
Reviews.Content: Does what it should, does what it promised, works flawlessly.  Really amazing camera.  I am pleased with this purchase.  Whoopee.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bryce Samuels
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle fire. I received it as a birthday gift and love the size. There are many apps, the screen resolution is on point and the battery life is amazing. I started downloading books and the screen is very easy on the eyes for long periods of time.

Reviews.Title: "Low-cost", not reliable
Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the screen slightly small, so consider the 8" version.Secondly, when I'm scrolling slowly through a website, the screen wigs out and starts zooming in and out rapidly.Thirdly, when I try to hold down my finger for something for which I want a definition, the device likes to highlight the sentence beneath the one I want (and I have small fingers; I don't have this problem whatsoever with Apple products).Fourthly, the power cord is in the most annoying place of the whole device. If I want to stand it up sideways, it can't be charging at the same time.Fifthly, Amazon wants consumers to buy their power charger for $20 because it charges at maybe half the speed when plugged into a desktop, for example, which is lame.Lastly, I can't read PDFs and watch some media. I have to download extra stuff and mess with the device in order to get these things to work, and they still won't.Overall, one gets one's money's worth in this device; besides the "low cost" (since accessories and options will take out chunks from one's wallet), it is a very mediocre device that almost relies exclusively on Amazon-based content and apps.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Daniel D May
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a great media device. I appreciate the clear pictures, video, and sound. There is a slight glare on the screen and the power can volume buttons are hard to find in the dark. It's also kinda heavy. I did buy it to try reading eBooks and catch my self looking up the Paperwhite 3G regularly. I don't need all the extras, this is basically a tablet PC running a Droid OS.

Reviews.Title: somewhat happy with my kindle
Reviews.Author: April Zornes
Reviews.Content: I have had  to replace my kindle 2 times now both with the same problem and I wasn't very pleased about that but I was happy that they replaced it for me both times with little fuss other then the technical issues I had I'm very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Good for the Novice
Reviews.Author: Charles Lewis
Reviews.Content: So far I am happy with the Kindle Fire HD.  The picture quality and sound quality is excellent.  I am still learning how to navigate thru it as I am not the most computer savvy person.

Reviews.Title: GREAT !
Reviews.Author: Efi Paka
Reviews.Content: A very nice easy and practicle tool for evrey person that likes to read watch movies etc...The design the app's and the interface makes it a pretty usefull tablet.reccomended!

Reviews.Title: Slow and clunky with other negatives
Reviews.Author: stingray "new credit line"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this product but the longer I had it the worse it got.  The portrait was slow or improper when adjusting views from vertical to horizontal. Inputs on the silk browser took multiple entries a times to actually work.  Battery life was also horrible with usage causing the kindle fire to lose charge even when being charged on the computers usb port.  Amazon also does not include the proper charger for the kindle fire hd in the original purchase price.  I  also believe the kindle fire needs more on board memory.  (wait for a new release of a better tablet)

Reviews.Title: Wireless reception
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed on receiving Wi-Fi signals. I compared the Kindle Fire HD with my wireless phone and it could not pick up the same signal with significant strength to use the Internet or email. Resorted to using the telephone. Amazons advertising For Kindle Fire HD led me to believe that "dual band Wi-Fi, dual antennae" was something special and I would literally fly on the signal strength. Another thing is that it takes forever trying to locate a signal, so be prepared to see a lot of spinning circles while it makes up its mind.

Reviews.Title: Short battery time.
Reviews.Author: Elinac50 "elina"
Reviews.Content: The battery doesn't last long and unless you buy Amazon's charger it takes ages to reload it. When buying ,that fact is not stressed, it is suggested without a clear explanation about the battery short lasting  time.

Reviews.Title: Required charger not included
Reviews.Author: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kindle we purchased.  The first unit, a Kindle Fire, came with every thing required to start using it including a charger.  This unit which is the Kindle HD arrived without the required charger.  After searching the original PAGES of ad material, we found that the charger is listed as an optional item.  This is absolutely absurd.  If the charger is not included, a big red flag should let buyers know.

Reviews.Title: Love at first swipe!
Reviews.Author: Sognatrice "sognatrice"
Reviews.Content: I am a dedicated Mac user with a laptop and an iPad. I also have a Kindle keyboard that I love and use all the time. Hence, I did not "need" a Kindle Fire HD. However, in a moment of weakness, when I saw that Amazon had discounted the price last month, I bought myself a new toy. The next day, I thought of cancelling the order, since I did not acually "need" the gadget, so the expense was superfluous -- but it had already shipped. Now that I have grown accustomed to having a Kindle Fire HD, I can't imagine how I ever lived without one. My iPad has become little more than a bookend in recent weeks, as the Fire has become my go-to gadget for almost everything. To justify having two tablets and reconcile their similarities and differences, I decided in the future to use the iPad for work (I am a college professor and literacy specialist/consultant) and the Kindle Fire for play and recreational reading. That has been a good decision so far, as my iPad is a bit heavy and cumbersome to carry around in all the time, so I can just leave it in the office to use when I am on campus. The Kindle Fire HD fits easily into my handbag, and it is great to have it with me in the event that I want to take advantage of unexpected blocks of downtime.The only thing I regret is not digging a bit deeper money-wise and buying a Kindle Fire equipped with 3G or 4G wireless access. I made the same mistake when I purchased my iPad. The price difference is substantial, and it would have been hard to justify in the case of the iPad, because I would not carry it around as much. But now that I am bringing my Kindle Fire practically everywhere, it would be great if I could gain internet access from every place I could pick up a cell signal (I don't have a cell phone). Still, even without the 3G or 4G feature, this tablet is one great little gadget. Attractive, easy to use, with lots of free or very low cost applications available on the Amazon website. Oh, and the audio quality is spectacular. Really. Finally, I am enjoying reading some of my e-books and magazines in color formats. That is something I can't do on my old Kindle keyboard, which, like the iPad, has been gathering dust since the moment I unboxed the Kindle Fire. If you are thinking about a purchase, I give this gadget a rave recommendation:)

Reviews.Title: Top of the line reader
Reviews.Author: Mike Mcdonald "Trombonist"
Reviews.Content: I started off back in 2011 with an original Kindle (which turned me into a voracious reader), then bought a Kindle Fire, then a Kindle Paperwhite, and now this...the Kindle Fire HD.  I just got it when it was on sale for $159, and glad I did.  Significant improvement over previous Kindles.  I can now read with backlight, view movies and check my email, among many other things. Brilliant high def picture, and the ereader is sharp and not hard on the eyes.  I love it!!

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: Biggest disappointment is that the battery does not hold charge anywhere near the 11 hours advertised.  I have rebooted it several times as suggested and I turn on the airplane mode most times and still the charge goes down very quickly.  Usually have to recharge each day and most of what I use it for is reading because if I use it hooked to the internet it discharges even faster.  My old basic Kindle would hold the charge for much longer.  Kind of a pain in the butt.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded, and I still like that 7" size.
Reviews.Author: Everyday Kay
Reviews.Content: I use my Kindle Fire every single day of my life. As a Prime member, I love watching videos on the super-fantabulous screen, and I like being able to stick it in my purse. I use other devices for documents, most of my communication, and picture-taking, so I want a tablet strictly for entertainment.The new Kindle Fire HD is awesome. The sound is a 200% improvement, though I got along fine with an external speaker or headphones on the original. I've downloaded some puzzle-type games, have access to my books and watchlist (and email and documents if I really really NEED them), so when I think Kindle, I think "Playtime!" This can do a lot more than I ask of it, but we have a symbiotic relationship -- it seems so happy when it's entertaining me.I like having my original Kindle Fire as a plaything for the household, and at these prices.... well...If you aren't an Amazon Prime member, you really should consider it if you have a Kindle Fire of any kind. I don't even watch TV anymore because I have gotten so accustomed to watching without commercials. Amazon Prime rocks.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: woodwkr
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Read two books the first day.  This is easy to use and bright indors or out.  Enhanced books are interesting with the video clips by the author.  i need to figure out how to get rid of the comercials that show up with some apps.  That is a negative.

Reviews.Title: Booboo
Reviews.Author: Ronny Chambers
Reviews.Content: Works great, screen easy to view in any condition. I would recommend to purchase. Great for games and watching movies.

Reviews.Title: Blew my old kindle out of the water
Reviews.Author: Jtru22
Reviews.Content: I recently replaced my first generation kindle with a certified refurbished kindle fire and I absolutely love it. Works perfectly. Display is amazing. LOVE the function where it learns my reading speed and tells me how long I have left in each chapter.

Reviews.Title: No Google play = missing too much
Reviews.Author: ike
Reviews.Content: I got this on a super deal. Got the Kindle, smart case, and 25 amazon gift card for $140. I had a nexus 7 before it and liked it much more. Kindle screen looks very nice but the Amazon restraints is too much. Without rooting and such, not having Google play on an Android tablet is too much to over look. Ended up buying a Galaxy Note 8 and am very happy I decided to sell my Kindle and upgrade. If it had Google play it would be even with nexus 7 first Gen.

Reviews.Title: A Great Device--Not Perfect, But Does the Job
Reviews.Author: P. J. Neary
Reviews.Content: So this is how it came down to the wire: Kindle Fire HD, Google (Asus) Nexus 7, or KFHD 8.9.  The larger screen on the 8.9 tempted me, but I really wanted something that travels well.  The reason I picked Kindle over Nexus was very close--geez, I did an Excel spreadsheet  and everything.  KFHD plusses: speakers, Amazon ecosystem, more storage for the price (esp. with the $30 off deal earlier), HDMI out.  Nexus plusses: better form factor and weight, full access to Android apps, GPS, bit more CPU power.Very close, and in the end the ability to pick up the 32GB KFHD for $199 was just too tempting.  OK, so I am already wired into Amazon's ecosystem, and as a Windows Phone user, no stake in the Google Play world.  (Let's not soil this discussion with talk of those i-devices, OK?)  I have not run into a case where I can't get an Android app I need on the KFHD, but I will allow that this might happen in the future, in which case I think I can manage rooting the thing if I have to--it's kind of an ugly process, but I've done worse!  (I really couldn't care less about Jellybean vs. Ice Cream Sandwich vs. whatever other silly confectionery name is next.)Living with it now for a couple of months, I have to admit that it is very handy to have--forget bringing that silly laptop on vacation, or dealing with your phone screen to browse the web, this 7" size is a perfect compromise.  Rip some DVDs and save to the device for those nights when there's nothing on the hotel room TV (the extra storage helps).  I still use my old e-ink Kindle because you CANNOT READ this device in the outdoors, at least until the sun hits the horizon, but then it's nice to have when the sun is all the way down and you want to keep reading.  The speakers are nice, but take some of these rave reviews with a grain of salt--this is not an audiophile experience by any means.I'm still glad I made the choice I did, altho Google came out with the new Nexus7 about a month later, and that might have swung me back over.  Never mind.  I hope Amazon's next KFHD keeps upping the ante, because this is a great space to have this much computing power in.  Keep slugging it out, you guys!

Reviews.Title: Run
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I convinced my husband to get me a Kindle instead of a competitors tablet. I am so sorry now! Spend the extra money and get something better. If you're using it just for an e-reader it's fine but to stream tv, not so much. My screen will freeze, not play at all, or sometimes play sound with no picture. I don't think the web browsing it super user friendly either. I've contacted Amazon a couple of times about this problem and it's magically is ok for a week or two. I fully expect to have to replace it. I wish I could just return it and get a different companies tablet.More than likely I'll just give the replacement it to one of my kids.

Reviews.Title: Perfect, if not for charging issues...
Reviews.Author: C. Morley
Reviews.Content: We LOVE our Kindle! The color is amazing and the touch screen works amazingly well. We've never had any issues with the operating system. The only problem is that we have some charging issues. We had to return one and get another because it wouldn't charge at all after about 5 months. Amazon had amazing customer service and they sent us another very easily. This one has it's own quirky charging issues as well... It seems like the Kindle has to be turned off and not in use to properly charge. This is kind of annoying, as you'd think you should be able to use it while plugged in but that's not the case. We would buy another because of the price point but I really wish Amazon would deal with their Kindle charging issues before they release the next one.

Reviews.Title: I feel like I am two years old again
Reviews.Author: Anthony Falsarella
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wide variety of android apps, then go and look at another device. I am deeply disappointed that only 12 of 50 apps I use for travel and photography not to mention my regular banking app are not available for the Kindle Fire HD. You think you are 2 years old again by the way amazon has restricted what is available in the way of apps. I wish I had known of the app restrictions before I purchased this item.EDIT August 22, 2013: After one day of owning the Kindle Fire HD, I have decided as I find it to be a bitter disappointment in a product.Unless it is Amazon approved content don't count on using it on this device. I will look at a real tablet or iPad as I am not as restricted by them.

Reviews.Title: Not What I Expected!
Reviews.Author: Autoracer44 and princess13
Reviews.Content: It totally let me down , is not what I expected after seeing the commercials comparing it to IPads, whoever thought that having one camera that faces the screen was a good idea should be fired, how about if you want to take a pic or a video, you have to pray that the subject is in the frame when you snap the pic or have the person stand there until you get it right, you better not use it if is a once in a lifetime opportunity to get the shot, because it will be like shooting craps, my kindle fire is way better in my opinion, but I bet you that in a few months there will be a new Kindle Fire HD with 2 cameras for sale, so those of us that bought this round will have to buy the one that has a camera on each side, just saying either wait for the next round or get the IPad!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: A premium feel without the premium price but not quite there yet.
Reviews.Author: ranetides
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD for almost a year (Christmas gift last year) and after getting over the initial novelty of it I can honestly say that I still really like my tablet.I originally had a 3rd generation Kindle (known as the Kindle keyboard) e-reader and I loved it, it was fantastic! Even after Amazon came out with the Kindle Touch I still held off because I didn't think that the original Touch had the premium feel that I have come to expect from the Kindle hardware plus I was waiting on the internal light. The original Kindle Fire was exciting in terms of its ground breaking feature set at that price point but at that point I was still anti-tablet and to a point I still am. Tablets; Contrary to popular opinion cannot replace laptops.When Amazon unveiled the new line of Kindles with the Fire HD and the Paperwhite I was very excited. I immediately found a friend to buy my 3rd gen Kindle and I was set to buy a Kindle Paperwhite (which I still might) when my girlfriend told me that I was not allowed to make any large purchases until after Christmas. According to her, "you never know what Santa will bring you", so I held off. I loved the new Paperwhite and would read all the reviews that I could and every time we were in Best Buy I would play with it while my Girlfriend would play with the new Kindle Fire HD. She was also in a holding pattern because she wanted the new Nook HD (her old Nook broke and she wanted a replacement).She likes tablets and I did not but after playing with the Fire HD in best buy multiple times I began to like it more and more. The screen is fantastic and I am a movie buff with a large collection of movies. I looked at other options like the Nexus 7, Nook HD, and the Ipad Mini (under-speced and over priced) when it was released and decided that they were not what I was looking for. This was going to replace my e-reader and while I could get the Amazon app on the Nexus 7 it was not the engrossing reading experience that I was looking for. I settled on the Kindle Fire HD.Pros:The Kindle Fire HD has a premium look and feel with a nice use of metals, glass, and the rubberized coating on the back is quite nice. It feels solid in the hand.The screen is beautiful and crisp for videos and reading.The speakers are very nice and easily the best of any tablet.Amazon uses a heavily skinned version of android (in this case 4.2 jelly bean) and the UI (user interface) is very easy to use and fairly intuitive with most everything within plain sight.The battery life is solid.The reader centric experience is great. They do put reading in the forefront and the software options that are given to the reading platform are extensive and fantastic.Cons:The tablet is just a little heavy for long reading sessions (if you have a case it's easier because you hold like a book).No GPS is a bit of a letdown. While sitting at a café in the city it would nice to use my tablet (bigger screen) for mapping as opposed to my phone. Although your position can be found via Wi-Fi it is not as good or reliable.No cellular option for the HD 7.There is no real multitasking. Multitasking by default (the old android way) is not multitasking.There are minor issues with the UI and software that should be tweaked. At the end of each book they jump you right in to a review page which I think is nice although this page is not well laid out. The text boxes are small and there are minor glitches that come up and are very annoying at times. The keyboard is too basic and should be look at as well at the spell correction. There are other minor issues and some lag as well.All in all I do like this tablet a lot and if you are a reader and/or you are an Amazon Prime member than I would say this is the one for you. There are some draw backs and I would say now that Barnes and Noble has added Google Play Store access to its tablets, cut the prices, and are spec for spec almost on par with the Kindle Fire HD line they have become a very compelling option for a solid all around tablet that does reading very well.The Kindle Fire HD line is not in my opinion the all around computing tablet. It lacks some basics (GPS and better apps selection) that are necessary for that moniker but if you are looking for a solid tablet for reading, surfing the web, watching movies, listening to music and you want it all at a price that is more than reasonable unlike some others that I will not mention (Ipad Mini) then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Experience With This Product
Reviews.Author: Programmher
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to receive my Kindle Fire HD. I enjoyed the first generation Kindle Fire and only upgraded after my screen broke and the repair would have cost at least $99.00.The order process and delivery was easy and fast. I received my Kindle Fire HD in a timely manner. I charged my device and began using it.First, my Kindle Fire HD got very hot while charging. Wasn't sure if this was supposed to happen, so I continued to try and use the device. After a couple of hours of use, my screen stopped responding to my swipe commands. It was stuck, I couldn't swipe left to unlock the device, and it took me 45 minutes to successfully swipe and unlock the device - after I'd restarted it and rebooted it twice.After I reinstalled my apps after the 2nd factory reboot, I proceeded to try and purchase some add-ons. My transactions went through and my account is pending the debits, but out of 3 transactions, only 1 actually posted to my Kindle account.At this point,I contacted Kindle Support.Both Kindle Support agents were very patient and helpful. The initial offer was to replace my device; but, after reading some of the reviews and living through an extremely frustration couple of hours with this newer version, I have decided to return the device and get a refund for the price of my Kindle. The Support Agents also assured me my bank account would be refunded the charges that did not post to my Kindle account.I am now researching other devices that will allow me to read my eBooks without the frustrations I had with the Kindle Fire HD. One expects an occasional glitch but the several issues I experienced with a device that is supposed to be the leader in its category just really soured me from purchasing a Kindle in the future. Unfortunately, after reading some other reviews, I am not alone in my disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Good - almost very good
Reviews.Author: Ronald Albury
Reviews.Content: The Very Good:I bought this table for my granddaughter.  I especially liked WhisperSync and Imersion Reading.  I had a little trouble linking up my Audible account with my Amazon account (necessary for these two features to work), but Audible was EXTREMELY helpful and I soon got that ironed out.The Good:This tablet is definitely geared for media.  It is not set up to be your general-purpose Android tablet.  I knew that when I bought it, and frankly I kinda like the Kindle interface.The Bad:I know tablets can be fragile - so I bought a kid-proof case for it.  However, before I could even get the case on the tablet, the screen cracked.  Now, it was my fault - the tablet fell off my chair onto the floor - but the fall was no harder than I've have with other tablets before and they held up just fine.  Now I have hairline cracks in the screen.  I don't know if the glass was pre-stressed or just thin and sensitive or what.  They have been making bullet-proof/shatter-proof glass since I was a child (and I'm 60) ... they couldn't put stronger glass in a tablet, which they know is going to get a lot of handling?UPDATE:I bought the tablet from BestBuy because I wanted the extended warranty to be handled locally.  I took the Kindle back to them to discuss options on the cracked screen.  I learned the following:A) The Geeks in the Geek Squad confirmed for me that they have a MUCH higher incidence of Kindle Fire HD's coming back with a cracked screen than any other tablet.  Their assumption is that Amazon went cheap on the glass in order to keep the price low.B) The Best Buy "Full Accident Replacement" plan is not all it was presented to be.  I didn't understand how they could make any money the way they presented it, and I guess I should have pressed.  They knew that the tablet was for my granddaughter and talked me into a 3-year accident policy so she would be fully covered.  It turns out that any time you bring the tablet back with accidental damage, they will fix the problem but it also terminates the policy.  In other words, my $90 3-year accident policy provided the exact same results as a $40 1-year policy - I got a new tablet with no coverage.  I can see this makes sense to them - they'd go broke if they didn't have some sort of limiting clause in the coverage.  I just wish I had understood it better because the odds were that my granddaughter would break it in the first year (and it turns out I broke it in the first week) and so I feel like I spent and extra $50 for nothing.  I don't blame them for the clause (although it is buried - it took the Geek Squad about 5 min to find the clause and show it to me), but I'm unhappy that it wasn't explained properly to me when I was being pushed to purchase the 3-year plan.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: Would have liked to keep it if I could have done more w/ it. I want something more comparable to a pc.

Reviews.Title: Ugh!!  I Love Amazon BUT...
Reviews.Author: jdfig
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon and was super excited to get my first table...the Kindle Fire.  My ONLY objection is Amazon doesn't play well with Google and wants to trap me in the Amazon ecosystem.  As an example...I am a heavy Google user (browser, e.mail, docs, cloud drive, etc) and unfortunately...Amazon doesn't like that idea.I expect a table to be a larger version of my Android phone without the telephone part.  I want to use my 2-Step Authentication to log into my Gmail account and Amazon tries to force me to use their embedded e-mail application which kinda sux.  I wanna use my Google contacts...but Amazon tries to force me to use their Contact database..which kinda sux.  For my needs...I NEED everything to sync seamlessly between my laptop, my phone & my table...and unfortunately...the Kindle Fire falls short (unless I root the fool thing which I don't wanna do).Maybe because I love Amazon so much...I decided NOT to return my Kindle Fire...instead giving it to my 13-yr old son.  Since I gave it to him today...he has used it so much playing games he has had to charge the battery 2x.So...the good part...the Kindle Fire is a great device for most uses I would imagine...the screen resolution is awesome...the features are awesome...and of course...Amazon is always awesome.  Too bad the Kindle Fire didn't work for me...I suppose I'll order the new Nexus 7 very soon.Thumbs up Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: I've never had so much trouble with a product!
Reviews.Author: Emily Mangus
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 replacements so far and I've only had it for 8 months. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone!! The reasons I've had to send them back is because they've been sooooooo slow and I have to shut it down several times every day for it to even half way work and even then it still freezes up and not just for a couple seconds. So to sum it all up I'd never buy one again.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Angela Wyant
Reviews.Content: Nice size, great picture for Netflix and the speakers are nice and loud. Skype works great can't wait to Skype my children.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Susie "Rapid Reader"
Reviews.Content: The battery on this product does not last more than 3 or 4 hours when reading, and it continues to eat battery life voraciously, even when in "sleep" mode.  When I called customer service, the man in India kept repeating that I must turn the Kindle off completely when not in use, and that I just needed to order a "quick charger" so that I could rapidly recharge it.  When I stated that the advertised battery life was 11 hours, he kept saying "each device is different for battery life depending on how it is used."  I only use it for reading!  I learned right away that I could not use it for checking email or facebook because it eats the battery in even less than 3 hours.  Just now, I picked up my Kindle Fire HD 7" to read, and even though it showed more than 50% battery when I put it to sleep last night, it was too dead to turn it on this morning.  So, it ate up 50% of battery life while it was asleep.  This is so inconvenient to be unable to read when I want.  My old Kindle keyboard held a charge (with approximately 90 minutes of reading per day) for almost ten days!  This one won't last a half a day.  I am very disappointed in the product and in the customer service I received on the telephone.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Joan M. Lewis "georgiagirl2002"
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire. I have not had time to examine all the features. I use it for reading. Great for people who need large print. You can select your font and size.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Like I need more stuff
Reviews.Content: Never owned a tablet nor android device so getting use to that. It's not considerably different than an apple iOS. The HD quality seems hit or miss. My iPhone is in HD, but it seems to take better pics than the kindle. Luckily, I don't use either device for taking pics.The ads are ridiculous, but easy to ignore. You would think paying nearly $200 for a device would mean you don't have to be subjected to constant advertising. Get on it Kindle.I've had this tablet less than 24 hours so I'll update if anything drastic happens.

Reviews.Title: Simple and perfect for my 75 year old mother
Reviews.Author: johnny daytona
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom because she likes to play card games on computer, check her e-mail, and get on Facebook. No she can do it in seconds instead of waiting for her PC to boot up. I set up the Kindle with some Apps I know she will like. The interface is simple and easy to understand. I have a Nexus7 and it has a lot of stuff I just don't use. Great gift for someone very young, elderly, or just not very tech savy. I was not bothered by, or didn't even notice the Adds of Dread everyone complains about. I just hope it lasts her a while, and that she will find some books and movies that she will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Had an original Kindle for the past two years and then bought this one.  I absolutley love it!!!!!  It is very easy to use and the people at Amazon are wonderful in helping with any concernis I have.

Reviews.Title: New pleasure
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Love my KindleFire. Use it for games , reading and music. Looking forward to exploring other uses. Have recommended to three other people.

Reviews.Title: Great for the whole family
Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD. I use it everyday and everywhere for multiple things. In the car for music or to quiet a screaming child with Freetime. My husband uses it to play Grumpy Bears! I mainly read with it but I also shop, watch movies, tv shows, listen to music, jot notes, check my email. You get the picture...its a portable computer that fits perfectly in my purse!!

Reviews.Title: I would be lost without it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Words can not describe how much I love this product. I know I don't use it to its full potential, because I use it almost exclusively as an ebook reader (although I do have a few games on it which I enjoy at times). Considering how many books I read in a years' time, this device also saves us considerable space in our house, as I had several bookshelves full of my reading material, and more stored in boxes because I didn't have room for them on the shelves. This alleviated much of the storage problem...we have space for things other than books!Technical stuff: The screen is sufficient for reading, it is comfortable to hold and page through, the battery life is sufficient for my purposes (I've not tried any other tablets, so I can't compare...I know it works more than well enough for my purposes).

Reviews.Title: well worth the money
Reviews.Author: J. Gulash
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD is a very impressive little tablet.  It compares very favorably vs. The iPad mini both in value and hardware performance.  The only downsides seem to be in personalization options and in the quality of some of the apps.  But all in all I am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD Camera
Reviews.Author: Gail L. Rudolph
Reviews.Content: Does anyone have a tip on how to use the camera on the HD?  You have to be in front of it to take a pic, and then you block the pic!  Am I doing something wrong, or  is this just a really bad feature on the Hd ?  I LOVE everything else about the Kindle HD, but I would really love to be able to use the camera feature.Any help would be GREAT !!TY!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Michael Steven Prete
Reviews.Content: eVEN AT THE $199.00 PRICE, THIS EASILY BEATS THE iPAD FOR M ONEY FOR YOUR DOLLAR, AND ON IT'S OWN, IS AN EXCEPTIONAL DEVICE.

Reviews.Title: Multi-purpose
Reviews.Author: Trina
Reviews.Content: Now I can read, surf the net, watch movies, listen to music and more all from one device. It's small enough to fit in my bag. Love the HD.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Dana
Reviews.Content: I had a different Pad and it was a total disaster. I didn't expect the this much quality and excellence from the Kindle. I am more than happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Best thing I have ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: Mitzi H.
Reviews.Content: Best thing I have ever purchased. I love my Kindle. You can get all kinds of books at low cost or free in the Amazon Kindle store. I have had mine over 6 months and no problems. There are also all kinds of free apps. With an HDMI cord you can use it as a streaming device. I could go on and on about all the good things, but why not find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: kurtgrip
Reviews.Content: my first foray into touch screen. EXCEEDS MY EXPECTIONS! Easy to learn and oper ate. Even a dummy like me can enjoy this technology. No more books!

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Janet R. Davis
Reviews.Content: This does more than I expected. I didn't know it would get email but it does and I love that.

Reviews.Title: I'm Enjoying the World of Kindle Fire HD 7
Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: I'm just experiencing the world of 'kindle fire'  so there's more to the product but I am enjoying the "ride"

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HG7
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: I have never had so much enjoyment in any device, I love it Love it Love It.I take it everywhere better than an Ipad so clear and such a great size.

Reviews.Title: What Would I Do Without It
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I know that everyone loves the I-pad.  I probably would too if I tried it.  However, I can't afford to spend a few hundred, if not more, dollars on something like that.  So, I settled with the Kindle Fire HD.  For me, the Kindle Fire HD serves me well.  I don't have any problems with it freezing up or anything like that.  The app store has a lot of good apps.  I do wish it had the camera on both sides of the tablet instead of just the front side, but it's not that big a deal for me.  I love reading my books on it and my son and I both love playing games on there.

Reviews.Title: Better than I thought
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: ***Update***I bought this Christmas 2012. It has now been replaced 3x due to device issues and factory-restored once. I haven't even owned this product for a year. While Amazon CS has always made sure it gets replaced, at this point it's ridiculous.It took me years to break down and buy a Kindle product. I'm a reader and I thought you just can't replace books with technology. It's wrong, it's not right, it's horrible (heavy readers will agree to this line of thinking).And then I bought one last Christmas. Best purchase I ever made.Readers on the fence about this! Listen! I know it feels like selling out but it's not!I don't have to pack my kids up to go to the bookstore. I don't have to worry about the used bookstore having what I want and for a decent price. Once I finish a book in a series, it's available right then to get the next. I was so blind to technology! And I'm 27! I don't own and never have owned an iPhone or an iPad so I can't compare those to my Kindle Fire.But this. . .this is worth every penny for the ease of new books alone. The apps are great, my kids enjoy the games. I even got sucked into a few myself (Plants vs Zombies, Tetris -ah Tetris, the Kindle version is wonderful-, Cut the Rope).Don't get me wrong, I still go to the bookstore. But it's to look at new books and get ideas. I do have some issues sometimes with my Kindle holding a charge, even after having it replaced for that reason, but it's a minor annoyance and not a derailment.I waited so long. Don't make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: MYRNA SECONDO
Reviews.Content: I've had two android tablets and neither one even compared with my Kindle Fire HD 7".  The wireless is great, the pictures are much better than I expected. I read a lot and was buying my books thru Amazon anyway so that was not a big change. Again, very happy and love this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Melissa Clark
Reviews.Content: I bought this one a whim because Amazon was running a deal I could not pass up. I love that I can both read books and stream videos on my device. It seems to be very sturdy which is key in my house since I have a 2 year old who loves to play with my phone and my husbands ipad. My only complaint, which may not be related to my device and rather my wifi, is that the streaming has yet to be true high definition. The 2 things I have tried to watch were pretty grainy. But again, that could have been my Wifi at the time. Other than that, I love it and very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: kindle for my wife
Reviews.Author: nathan baggett
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle for my wife, for mothers day. She loves everything about it. It's a very good product for the money. We took a 12 hr road trip to Daytona Fla after we got it with our 1 year old, and being able to download from you tube onto the kindle saved us. Mickey and Jake are life savers. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a good tablet.

Reviews.Title: too locked down an not enough free worthwhile apps
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: great tablet if u never heard of google play store before. i wish they would strike a deal with google cause the lack of items in the amazon app store sucks. also dislike the fact that so many apps cost. whats the use of having an app store if u have to pay for everything but lack a wide variety to select from. otherwise the display is wonderful an the wifi is very strong. greaf storage but nothing to store on here but my music an pictures

Reviews.Title: my new best friend
