Reviews.Author: dia daze "dia daze"
Reviews.Content: i have both the regular kindle and now the fire, I adore it, picture quality is perfect it beats ipad bb playbook windows tablet and anything else. easy to set up, easy to get apps and pretty much does everything but cook for me <3 super duper awesome price super fast shipping i am so happy i got this it acutally linked my first kindle to it what a great product

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Out There
Reviews.Author: GameGurl "RedBone"
Reviews.Content: Me and my toddler love our Kindle Fire HD. He enjoys Freetime Unlimited (free apps, games, tv shows) and I enjoy Amamzon Prime (reading free books, watching movies). We both like it so much I may have to get a second one for myself. The movies and games looks great on this screen. It fits in my purse perfect and is very light. I think this combined with Amazon prime is a steal. I feel like I get my moneys worth out of it everyday.

Reviews.Title: great picture and tons of books available
Reviews.Author: William R. Gallagher
Reviews.Content: easy to use and a bright clear picture, I watch movies thru Amazon Prime andget books thru their lending library, lots of choices

Reviews.Title: I love the Kindle, but hoped would work faster when searching internet
Reviews.Author: Jane Barlow "Earlybird"
Reviews.Content: I think my wishes are unrealistic, as I do tend to want it all.  The Kindle is perfect for downloading books and reading.  I tried to use it while travelling in place of my laptop, and it is a bit slow and tedious for internet searches.  it did however serve the purpose, and I was able to make reservations & search for tours, etc.  I think I just have champagne tastes on a beer budget!!

Reviews.Title: Great anniversary gift!
Reviews.Author: Jeanine Doelling
Reviews.Content: Our friends visited us just before our anniversary and they had gotten a Kindle Fire HD just a couple of weeks earlier. My husband was so impressed he bought me one as an anniversary gift. I love my Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Curtis WIlliams
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy reading you have to get a kindle. Very easy to use and serves more then just a book. Also if you travel a lot there's nothing like finishing a book and being able to get a new one in no time.

Reviews.Title: Convenient and fun
Reviews.Author: Deanna Hart "dolly clothes seamstress"
Reviews.Content: I have had a lot of fun playing my word games, Facebook, Mahjong, and Draw Something! This newer version of the Kindle does not have the light indicator that shows that it is fully charged, but allow at least 2 1/2 hours. The ON/OFF button is black in the black frame. I would like it to be more visible -- at least gray, to find it easier. It will come with me on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Years ago I bought one of the first Kindle models  when they first came on the market. It was a wonderful device. I received several gift certificates recently and bought the new Kindle Fire HD. All I can say is, WOW! The quality and fit and finish is awesome! I love how fast it is and how much it does. Leaps and bounds ahead of the old Kindle. So glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Helen Rich
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire HD  because of all of the things you can do on it , watch movies . e-mail, games etc.The 7 inch size is perfect for me - the sound is great , pictures are very clearThis product has exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: sale price less than two weeks
Reviews.Author: sharon hannah
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HD but to see it on sale $40 less two weeks later is frustrating beyond belief.  Contacted Amazon and they made it right.  Great customer service

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Sandy Williams
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT!!!  Even I can navigate it easily...very user friendly.  The sound is great and the pictures are clear.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Nicole Bales "NikkiBee"
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire. I shopped for months before buying this tablet. It has the best sound of any available at Best Buy and Office Depot. I went to every tablet and tried out the sound at max volume. The picture is fantstic as well. I prefer Android operating systems (this is a special version for Amazon) so I primarily looked at name brand tablets with Android. I chose the Kindle for the sound quality, image, and convenience of buying books/movies. I was hesitant to get locked into a company for all of my content but I've had a great experience with my Prime membership. I get to watch tons of movies and shows for free and can buy the most recent season or rent movies. One of my favorite things is reading magazines on my Kindle. The image is great and reading them is surprisingly intuitive. I was also nervous about reading on a backlit display. I actually love it! No more adjusting and readjsuting a reading light every time I move. Overall, I love it. The price was great, the product is great and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: cindy bower
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my kids and they love them. We have had no issues with them and they use them daily!!! They play tons of apps, watch netflix, and download books to read. All in all a great purchase! I love that I can set limits to how long that they canplay them! If it were up to them they would be on them all day. The only complaint I have heard from them is they with Hay Day was an app that they could get on them.My kids bought saved for them and bought them with their own money so I wish we would have waited since they are now $40 cheaper and the very next day after I bought them best buy had them on sale for $40 cheaper...would have saved $80!!!

Reviews.Title: Best of my pieces of electronics
Reviews.Author: Mercedes "Mercedes"
Reviews.Content: Between my husband and I, we have 4 laptops, an iPad, an iPhone, an android phone and now this Kindle Fire. This is the BEST of my pieces of electronics because of the size, the weight, the speed of the internet and the pre-loaded applications on the device. I primarily use it for reading and haven't yet watched videos on it. I'm not sure how I ever got along without it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is awesom.
Reviews.Author: Silverpenney "Sp."
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife to replace her regular kindle. She has hardly put it down and has told me how much she loves it. It does everything so thank you Amazon for this product.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: D. Somerville
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife. She was used to my iPad. It is much smaller, but serves its purpose for browsing the Internet. Also it's wifi range is far less than the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD - why did I wait to buy?
Reviews.Author: Walt in Calif "Walt"
Reviews.Content: At first I put off buying the Fire and settled instead for the Original and then PaperWhite Kindles (yes, that means I currently have 3 Kindles). The Fire appeared in an email special and at the special price I couldn't put off buying it any longer.  The Fire HD is a world apart from the other two Kindles.  I didn't realize how much color would enhance my reading and the added feature of text to speech  is a God-send (the PaperWhite dropped text to speech) for low-vision "readers".  The feature I appreciate most (along with speech) is the magazine subscription service.  It appears to me that Amazon is supplying what customers want rather than what would enhance their bottom line.  I can't guess what the next iteration of Kindles will provide.  This one has replaced my PC to a large extent.Negatives?  I wish for a longer lived battery, but when Starbucks installs wireless rechargers (now in progress) there won't be a need for that.

Reviews.Title: Quality Product
Reviews.Author: B. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I primarily use the Kindle line for movies and books, and limited web browsing and few other apps.  I actually prefer it to the iPad with a few exceptions:  there are some apps iPad will always do better but those are advanced musical and recording apps.When it comes to what I use the Fire HD for, movies and books.  This thing is great.  All in all it shouldn't be compared with other tablets because its designed differently.  If you use Prime or the Amazon ecosystem, then I would totally buy this device.Wifi is %1000000000 times better then apple products also.  Ok, I'm probably a little high on the percentage wise thing, but I NEVER EVER buffer with Fire HD, and my iPad mini is always buffering.

Reviews.Title: Ipad Mini vs. Kindle Fire HD --- Kindle Wins!
Reviews.Author: michelle snowden
Reviews.Content: I am a true blue Apple user, so I ordered a new iPad Mini (from ebay).  Long story short, the seller did not ship the item.  After lots of hesitation, I ordered the Kindle Fire HD.  I LOVE IT!  The graphics are amazing!!  I signed up for Prime and have already watched a couple of movies.  I would highly recommend the Prime membership.  The kids have downloaded a few games and I have borrowed some books from my library's ebook selection. I still think Apple products are easier to navigate (sometimes I feel like I'm getting a little lost in the Kindle Menus, Settings etc) - but not really a big deal at all. A lot of reviews make a big deal about the "ad screen" but it REALLY is no biggie!  You see that screen for about 2 seconds before you unlock the device.  Not worth $15 in my opinion.Overall - VERY happy with my purchase and I feel confident saying this device is AS GOOD or BETTER than the ipad Mini - and you save $200!!!After a bit of research, I ordered the HDMI cable (B009W9RXVOI have not received it but I'm looking forward to watching the Prime movies/TV shows on the larger screen of my TV.

Reviews.Title: Pros and cons but an overall good value
Reviews.Author: michael t heckman
Reviews.Content: I've had my kindle for about six months no and honestly its 50/50. Cons: Just got a new one in the mail after the first crapped out due to battery issues. Too much use is not a good thing. Plus they want you to buy the high speed charger from them to "avoid that issue". Upon purchase they don't even send you a wall plug, only a micro USB accompanied by an add for their charger as if to say "figure it out on your own and give us more money". Limited viewing for certain sites, trouble transferring files(also money tactic) restricted hdmi output on certain sites and files. There are more complaints I guess but I don't have time. Pros: relatively fast processing, tabs on tabs slow it down very little with a decent wifi connect, fun pointless games and apps, good res and color on screen, easily accessible settings menu allows you to adjust brightness volume web setting all available while running any app, and the main selling point for me, price!! Conclusion, it's a fun reasonably priced web toy for fbookers bloggers online shoppers ect. As far as doing anything useful with it? Not a single day to day practical application.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: C Cox
Reviews.Content: If I had known how much I would love it, I would have bought it sooner! Love reading on it. Was not sure I would like the un-book-ness of it but I do. It is light and very easy to use. I bought the Amazon leather case for it in fushia. Love the power saving feature that puts it to sleep automatically when you close it. I check my email, Facebook and surf Pinterest daily with my Kindle Fire. I confess I don't chat much on it but that is just because I am so much faster with the keyboard on my laptop. For travel, it works great. Just have to find a wifi if the hotel doesn't have it. I couldn't be happier with mine.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Brenda Depoortere "brendek"
Reviews.Content: overall I really love my kindle fire.  I had a problem with the screen on mine and Amazon had a new one sent out the day I contacted them - Excellent customer service!  The reason I did not give this a 5 star rating is the inability to play any video that requires a flash player.  Amazon advertises this as a great option to the more expensive ipad.  They need to give us a viable option for videos.

Reviews.Title: my portable entertainment center!
Reviews.Author: J. D. MCJURY
Reviews.Content: this past weekend, i received my kindle. i began loading and downloading. in one place, i havebooksitunes with 700 cd'sHBOGOSHOWTIMESIRIUS XMYAHOOFACEBOOKand a bluetooth headsetthe picture and sound are awesome\\

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: D. Faught "4pawsluvr"
Reviews.Content: Really loving my Kindle Fire Fire HD tablet so far! The size is perfect for taking pretty much anywhere. Haven't had any issues or problems with it so far. Would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable and Buggy
Reviews.Author: Shontella Terburgh
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad, iPod and 3 kindles throughout my household.  My 'ifamily' works great. it plays musics on demand without the annoying 'loading' prompt that I often get when trying to play music on my husbands kindle.  Even though I am playing it from the device and not the cloud I still have that 'loading' prompt when trying to access his music.  I have lots of adtracking pop ups that interrupt while trying to start up the kindle and here is the worst part.  I bought this kindle in March of 2013 ....and now will not turn on.  No damage; it just quit working.  My daughters Kindle .... same story ; only it was 8.5 months after I bought it. I had warranties on it,so I was able to have it replaced quickly.  But REALLY??????!!!!  I am now filing a claim on this kindle because it just "'quit'".  I am so disappointed in this whole line of junk.. It was cheap but you know the saying : '"The cheap pay twice'" So if you have the resources invest in an iPad, or any' i' device as far as my experience goes.  I like amazon as a service provider but not thrilled about their manufacturing venture.

Reviews.Title: No instructions received with my Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Peter R. Acara
Reviews.Content: Though the unit is compact, there were no instructions on how a beginner can start usingthis device.  I would like to have a "step-by-step" instruction for beginners like me, to aid me in understandingthis educational tool.Please don't assume that "everyone" knows everything about the "Kindle Fire"!

Reviews.Title: Replacement of my kindle.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Rivenbark
Reviews.Content: My first kindle had a heart attack and died, but it was still under warranty,  You guys replaced it and it was shipped by jet.This kind of service is unheard of so needlessly  to say, I was impressed.Thanks guys.Elizabeth Rivenbark

Reviews.Title: Really Impressed
Reviews.Author: Dyanne Neale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this for our daughter for xmas and it just stopped working. We called the customer support and after a series of tasks it was determined that we would need a replacement. They sent one out at no charge and we had it within 2 days of talking to them. Very impressed with the customer service and the new unit is working great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: GPM68
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I must say I am impressed.  The graphics are stunning and the sound from such a small device is jaw dropping.  I was very impressed with the first video I played.  Streams beautifully from my WIFI.  Plenty of Apps available to make this my primary mobile entertainment center.  The only thing I can say negatively so far is the lack of a real charger.  It only comes with a USB cord and as soon as you plug it in, it tells you all the limitations of charging with it.  You have to buy a charger for an additional $20 to plug into a wall outlet.  Foul Ball Amazon!!!!  Other than that, this device is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Another Winner for Amazon
Reviews.Author: J. W. Mullins
Reviews.Content: I've owned my Kindle Fire HD for almost half a year now. And even though I loved it the day I received it I wanted to wait before reviewing it so the 'new tablet smell' had worn off. As a comparison we also have a Nexus 7 and a Ipad 2 in our household. And while I'd prefer not to I don't think I can write a proper review without a little comparison to the other two.The quality of the screen and the media abilities make the Fire HD hard to beat. Amazon sells it at an amazing price and it can often be found at less than $200. That is little money for a machine that does a lot of things. How can they afford to sell it at such a price? Because they are making a bet that a new buyer will use it to consume media they buy through Amazon. If you are already making heavy use of the books, music and movies through Amazon Price then this tablet is for you. Be forewarned that it makes buying stuff even easier than the website though.The screen is fantastic, showing good, vibrant colors and great resolution. The touch screen is very responsive. Amazon also used what they call 'Gorilla Glass' for the screen making it very tough. How tough? It has survived my 6 year old, 5 year old and 1 year old without a single scratch. This is the only tablet I own that I didn't feel the need to put a screen cover on for protection.Reading, the new fashion way. I have no read so much in years since after getting into tablets. And if you are a ready the Kindle has a lot to offer. The screen is good making the letters crisp and dark. Amazon provides the ability 'to borrow' certain books from its store each month. There are also more magazines/periodicals available on the Kindle than any other tablet. I do find the table to be a bit wide for one handed reading, but it's not heavy. It does lack the light feel of the Ipad and Nexus even though they are similar in size. The volume buttons are decently placed and not easy to accidently hit, unlike my Nexus.If you are after the latest apps the Kindle Fire will leave you a bit cold. Amazon offers a good deal of apps and the Kindle uses a modified Android OS, but the selection is tiny compared to the Google Store and even more so compared to Apple. If you want a tablet to do everything fairly well I don't think the Kindle Fire is it. This device is made for the media consumer and used, web browsing, Facebooking, photo sharing and the like are much easier done on the other tablets. I purchased this device mostly to use to read magazines I couldn't get on other tablets, and so my kids could watch movies during plane rides and long drive. For that it has excelled. A

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle, Hate the charger
Reviews.Author: S Sutton "muse"
Reviews.Content: Just purchased kindle with ads last week when it was on sale.  I do not dislike the ads or find them distracting, instead they clue me in to other books I may be interested in.  I am new to the Kindle device and was wavering back and forth between getting this one or the paperwhite kindle.  I may have have made the wrong choice.  I bought the kindle to READ BOOKS and the battery life runs out all too quickly, they say it is 11 hours but it does not seem like it lasts that long.  The trickle charger it came with-usb to kindle cord-is awkward and slow.  I had it hooked to my computer for a night and half a day to get full charge.  This is inconvenient when you are in the middle of a good book.  The similar kindle I got last fall for my grandmother came with a wall charger and that was infinitely better.  The additional cost of the wall charger forfeits the benefit of the sale price I got. The only other complaint is the glare on the super shiny screen is also distracting from the reading.

Reviews.Title: Charger
Reviews.Author: NOT HAPPY THAT I HAVE TO PAY FOR A CHARGER
Reviews.Content: For the price that I paid for my Kindle Fire HD I can't believe the charger doesn't come with it.  You all need to rethink that one.

Reviews.Title: Not very happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Frank Wojcicki Jr
Reviews.Content: Not happy  with it.Tough  to  operate,  needs manualCost $$$ for everything.Buttons are hard to use.Maybe it's I am  old to understand .However will not give up on it.

Reviews.Title: only one problem
Reviews.Author: weeble
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire.  My first one quit charging and after finding the problem and what it cost to be fixed , I bought the second.  I'd like to see the charging plug changed, to stop the constant plugging and unplugging from making it disconnect on the inside of the Kindle.  I was very careful and did not force when connecting, but it came loose from the board on the inside. This area is too fragile!  Please make this stronger on systems that have to be charged.  I really love my Kindle!

Reviews.Title: High quality, but limited ability
Reviews.Author: Celestialsky29
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a device that connects you to the internet, some games, and your email, then this will work for you.  However, if you are looking for a tablet that you can download the apps that are available for Droid or Iphone, this isn't the device for you.  Amazon has a very limited app base, and therefore the majority of the apps are not there.  For example, Candy Crush, Sirius radio and Bodymedia.  If you want to access anything the requires Adobe Flash, you can't do it.  This device operates on Linux, which nobody supports anymore, so you can't watch video on internet web pages.  For example, if you open your local news website, and there is a video report about a crime, you can't watch it.  You can't update your device to watch it, there is no way to do that.  If I would have known this, I would have saved up more money and bought an Android based tablet.Now, to the device.  The picture is excellent, the load time is super fast, the charge holds well, and it charges fast.  I bought the Powerfast Charger, and it works awesome!  You can plug your device in a wall, and it is fully charged within 4 hours.  The Kindle Fire is a great size.  It is a tad heavy for reading books for a long time, but it isn't bad.  The books load fast, are easy to purchase, and easy to read.  There are settings to make the font bigger and to change the backlight color.  I like how you can read a book anywhere, regardless of the lighting in the room.In terms of a Kindle, it is awesome, with a fantastic picture.  However, if I would have known that you had such limited ability in terms of viewing things online, I wouldn't have purchased this.  So, if you are okay with having limited ability, then this is perfect, because the price is great in comparison to a tablet!

Reviews.Title: Have purchased several of these as gifts
Reviews.Author: KaliMau
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to read books, watch some online videos and play games then this tablet does it all. No need to spend 3x as much on a white one.This is an entertainment tool and as such it does exactly what it advertises. Lots of apps to choose from and the battery is better than expected. Buttons on the side are challenging to use, but you grow accustomed to that.

Reviews.Title: What's not to love about a Fire
Reviews.Author: D. Trento
Reviews.Content: I have bought 6 Kindles and never had a problem with any of them.  Gave three as gifts.  The only problem I have with the Fire HD is when you are charging it there is no indicator as to when it is fully charged.  That's the only thing O would like to see changed.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely worth it!
Reviews.Author: Dianne J. Hamilton "Djaye"
Reviews.Content: I'd wanted a Kindle device since the first model, but even more after the updates to the device.  I owned the Blackberry Playbook and while it was a decent tablet - it took a lot to get my Kindle library and other games not native to the Blackberry store on that device.  After discovering GoodeReader side loading app, I was able to get to where I wanted to go, but if I'd been less technically savvy, it would have been a nightmare.  I experienced none of that with the Kindle Fire HD.  I opened the box, fired it up, synced with my Amazon account and voila....magic.  Love the ease of use in setting up, it helps that I already had the Kindle app for my pc and Blackberry, so getting access to my games, books, audiobooks was a snap.  Love the display.  Love the fact that not only can I read my books, I can also listen to them when I want.  Before I used my iPod exclusively for that.  No more.  The display is absolutely gorgeous, sound (for me at least is very good) and I can watch movies from my Dropbox account from this device.  I could only wish for that on the Blackberry Playbook.  I could go on, but for the money - in my humble opinion - this is a quality buy.  I do know there have been issues with the original Kindle over heating, etc.  I'll have to monitor the situation and write a follow review should I encounter that problem.  The case I ordered for my device has venting on the back for the speakers.  I'm hoping that helps alleviate some of the overheating issues with the previous model/case design.  All in all however, I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Second one
Reviews.Author: Auburngrad08
Reviews.Content: I got one for christmas, and this one is for my wife.  We love them, and such a wonderful deal for the money.  Neither of us truely needs an Ipad.  She has a traditional one for her books, and this one is for books, magazines, movies, travel.  Perfect size and great battery life.  I got even a better deal buying it on sale.  Sometimes the 32gig might be nice to load even more on, but that is what the cloud is for.  I have not even come within 5 gigs of filling this one up.  Its the perfect size for us.  The best for traveling, and sounds are very good from the speakers.

Reviews.Title: No more problems with kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Bruce a Gardner
Reviews.Content: Bought a refurbished one and maybe I should have bought a new one? The kindle books and video work great, But Silk stops working about every five minutes. It keeps sending  you back to home page.  Finely kindle kept re-booting and now a new one been sent to me. Amazon support was great! I hope new one is better?New one received , what a difference !! Works great!! very easy to use.Thank You Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Still Learning
Reviews.Author: Barb Burke
Reviews.Content: I have only had my Kindle Fire HD for a couple of months but I love it.  My home computer was on its last legs and I just wanted something to check my emails, read, listen to music, etc.  All of it works so beautifully and very easy to use.  I am still learning how to use all of the items available to me but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7
Reviews.Author: Lisa Simms
Reviews.Content: I WAS REALLY HAPPY WHEN I PURCHASED MY FIRST KINDLE FIRE. LOVED IT! SO WHEN THE KINDLE FIRE HD CAME OUT I WANTED SO I PURCHASED IT. THEN IT JUST STOPPED WORKING. CALL AMAZON IT WAS REPLACED WITH NO PROBLEMS. THIS IS MY 3RD KINDLE, IT IS GIVING ME SO MANY PROBLEMS I AM REGRETTING HAVING PURCHASING THE KINDLE FIRE HD. I AM HAVING PROBLEMS WITH IT CONNECTING TO THE INTERNET.THE SCREEN JUST GOES BLACK WHEN I TRY TO CONNECT. CAN SOMEONE HELP ME WITH THIS. pLEASE

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD is great... If you dont mind all the RESTRICTIONS!
Reviews.Author: Kristal Sandoval ""krissibabiixoxo""
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that overall the Kindle Fire HD is a decent investment... If you're primarily using it for books and games. Amazon has put waaayyyyy too many restrictions on what you can and cant do with it or put on it. If you're like me and like to personalize your phone and tablets DO NOT buy the Kindle Fire. Its pretty much stuck in stock mode unless you do all the extra work to root it and I just dont have the time to sit and tweak it. I mean it doesnt even give you the option to install your own wallpapers... Anything Google is restricted (although Google Play supports Amazons apps) and majority of Amazons apps arent even compatible with the Kindle Fire so it restricts you from downloading even those. Amazons Apps are rarely ever updated and me personally I look forward to the new cool updates... So this is also very irritating for me. You pretty much have to pay for EVERYTHING including $15 to have Amazon remove ads off the device!! I am already bored with it and passing it on to my 4 year old, she enjoys it more then I do and it keeps her entertained, I am moving on to a tablet and considering that there is a Kindle Fire App for the tablets I can still enjoy my books with the freedom of personalization.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: CZee
Reviews.Content: I did months of researching the Kindle Fire HD vs. the iPad mini. I am so glad I chose my Kindle Fire. Not only did I order it late on a Friday afternoon and it arrived Monday, but it came with a ton of free extras, including a month of Amazon Prime. The Kindle Fire is highly customizable and the graphics on streaming videos on Netflix and HBO Go are crystal clear. I LOVE my Kindle and I tell everyone I can.

Reviews.Title: liked it
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Ewing
Reviews.Content: I feel it needs more free apps as well as more kindle apps. I think you could use a paperback manual

Reviews.Title: Not better than the original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to replace my original Kindle Fire because I wanted a Kindle Fire I could use when outside and the description claimed there was "less glare."  I returned the item the day I received it because the glare was just as bad with this one as with the original Kindle Fire.  This one does have a little bit better picture, good sound, and is lighter,  but you still can't see it when you're outside.  If I didn't already have a Kindle Fire I would probably get this one, but don't buy this one to replace your current Kindle Fire thinking you are going to get a picture with less glare.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: This is great, I love it more than I expected that I would. If there is a complaint so far, it is where thy put the power cord hookup and helm. The are at the bottom if you have uhh our screen sideways. And if you need to charge or have it hooked up to anything you have to hold it or lay it down. It would have been better if it was on the other side. And that really is my only complaint so far other than the battery does not last as long as they say,but then I have been using it a lot more than they probably expected. Otherwise than my usage,the battery does last longer than I thought it would. This is great and just as I expected it would work.I am still loving it. For me it is just the right size, to play my games and get on facebook. Took it with me to my brother-in-law's and my nephews played with it. They didn't have internet so I wasn't worried that they would buy anything without me knowing. But after getting home and looking through it and the free play I realised that there isn't really a way to keep them from doing in game purchasing. Not without turning it off for yourself. I will have to look into this and play around with it some more to be sure. Other than that I still love it and don't really have any complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my kindle fire hd. It does everything it is advertised to do. I have over 40 apps loaded on it and use it every day. I did not completely understand the Kindle/Android opperating system when I first purchased it. I was under the impression that I could load any android app on the kindle, but found out quickly that I could not. Amazon has somehow limited the operating system to only be able to use certain android apps. I did download [...] app and have access to over 300,000 apps.If I had to do it over again, I would probably have bought a Samsung Galaxy II because it is a true android device, has a rear facing camera which kindle doesn't, has gps, which kindle doesn't, has upgradeable micro sd 32 gig expandable memory, which kindle doesn't and has access to Google Play with over 700,00 apps.Also Kindle has the cloud, but doesn't tell you that the cloud only works if you have wi-fi connected.But, all in all I like the Kindle Fire HD and it is a very good, stable, great product. I would just advise people to do their research before they buy. One thing good about my purchase was, I only paid $129.00. I bought the kindle at Fathers Day for $179.00 and signed up for an Amazon/Chase credit card and got a $50 gift card from Amazon which I was able to use for the kindle purchase.

Reviews.Title: Yes!! ,but...
Reviews.Author: soda
Reviews.Content: I am *so* glad I traded a (refurbished) 8.9" in for a (new) 7"!! The refurbished unit was like new btw. But having grown accustomed to my previous 7" 1st gen Fire, this is just right. There are also minute differences on the keyboard, etc. between the sizes that I was already used to. I think the 8.9 is too big and heavy; and this one is just right :) Love Fire in general, and enjoying all the new functions, especially the audiobook/ebook synchronization, as well as the new standard text-to-speech voice which is certainly improved on the original. I am also for the first time typing on the bluetooth keyboard which paired perfectly once I figured it out and types amazingly comfortably (by Amazon), plus the original (leather) Amazon case (in blue); the difference in price between the sizes allowed me those extras (and a charger). Works great. Also there is a phone app so you can make and receive calls. 5-Star performance! :)Update:  I returned this unit for a refurbished non-HD (gen. 2) Fire. I just don't think the HD adds anything (the screen of my original Fire is perfectly responsive and visually; it doesn't have the slight pauses or glitches of the HD. I reasoned the 10-point touch screen & HD-quality "video card" (or whatever a Fire has) takes more RAM and software to operate, hence possibly accounting for the difference from my *perfect* 1st gen. unit. I watch Netflix and HD-quality YouTube videos on my 1st gen. and honestly don't see a difference. I also know the refurbished units are just as fine and functional as new ones. I got two more cases with the deal, one being a duplicate of my favorite which is hard "fabric" that completely zips around unit and has no "straps" (Marware beige) Marware jurni Kindle Fire Case Cover, Beige (does not fit Kindle Fire HD)  Most of the new features like text ebook/ audiobook synchronization (immersion reading) are included in the new (2nd gen.) software and I'm hoping the new text-to-speech voice software is as well. They are not HD-dependent. Of course I am sacrificing Bluetooth functionality (keyboard, separate speakers), HDMI-out for a larger screen, and one App that allows you to use the device as a phone; probably the microphone is missing too, and of course the camera is (mine was too dark and grainy anyways, not nearly as good as a built-in laptop cam for example). So, no Skype on the non-HD if those features matter to you (the phone App was neat).My main beef was the screen, again in the HD 7" Fire was yellow, with less contrast (for text ebooks) than my 1st gen. which I far preferred. Mostly I use my Fire for reading ebooks, and that was what was important to me. I keep my half-way brightness setting, and it's always sufficient. Secondly I browse websites and videos, and my 1st gen. is nimble & quick and perfectly capable. So I'm hoping the 2nd gen. I have now ordered will have the hardware designs I prefer with *some* of the new features (software). I can only hope for the quicker, brighter screen; I know the interface has been updated to the new standard which I found equally useful to the original. It is shipping now... :) As a small last insertion, the Kindle (ebook reading software) function, in the updated version, covers the text of your ebook with the menu enabled at the top, more like the Kindle White. The old Fire doesnt do this; it does, however, do it on the bottom. This will be the same between the HD and 2nd gen., so just a minor irritation. Btw, I received the sale price of $169 here so the difference in price between the HD and non-HD unit was a non-issue.I removed one star for the more yellow, darker screen with less ebook text contrast.

Reviews.Title: I loved my kindle fire hd, until it crashed and froze on me not once, but twice!
Reviews.Author: Patrick McCarty
Reviews.Content: I used my fire for 6 months with no problem.  Then one day while downloading from the local library site it froze.  I read all the ways to fix it and none worked.  I called the next day and it was replaced immediately.  I was not impressed with the customer service or that it was shipped in it's black box.  The customer service rep was very uninformed when I asked how to prevent it happening in the future they could not answer.  When the replacement came it was obviously a refurbished model, it lasted for 2 hours and crashed again.  Again customer service could not help me answer why, I stated I did not want a refurbished model, was told that was what would be sent and no answer on how to prevent it.  The 2nd replacement is working fine, however I am concerned that this one may crash again.  I have used a kindle for 4 years, and prior to this never had a problem.  The visual etc on the fire is great.  I also saw that this happens more often then I thought.

Reviews.Title: kindle had to be replaced after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Brenda Thomas
Reviews.Content: I had been very happy with my kindle..love easy access to all my favorite apps. I love to read on the go. Purchasing books is a breeze. I purchased a rotating cover for it which was a great purchase. I even purchased a $75 military screen protector to keep my kindle safe. After 6 months of use, I couldn't get it to turn on. Luckily it was under warranty and they sent me a new one. However I had to return my faulty kindle to Amazon including the $75 screen protector. When I called yo inquire about a new screen protector, I was told Amazon could do nothing except give me $10 credit towards an Amazon purchase. I was disappointed in this. I had done everything to keep my kindle protected. I bought a cover and a screen protector. It was a default with my kindle. It wasn't anything I had done to break it. I think it should have lasted longer than 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD comparison
Reviews.Author: nijah chinngonsalves
Reviews.Content: As a Kindle Fire owner, I was excited to upgrade to the HD. After using it for a couple of months I have found some things I like and some I don't like. I like the added storage - better for more movies and apps and now room for my music as well. I love the dual speakers. I also like the USB connection. I don't like the on/off button - really hard to find when using it in the dark. I also miss the lighted on/off switch. Plus the switch doesn't light up when it's charging like the Kindle Fire so I'm not quite sure when it's done. I'm also not very fond of the ads that pop up, but I just ignore them. Have not tried any of the other features like the camera. Overall pleased with the product and glad I purchased it. One other thing that happened - when I re-uploaded all of my games some had changed and all of them had lost my previous scores or levels - had to start again from scratch.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Melissa Womack
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle, I take it everywhere I go! When my dad was in the hospital for 2 weeks it was always in my hands.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Katie Did
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this Kindle Fire! It is easy to hold, has true-to-life color, is easy and fun, even for this 68 year old, to learn how to use it. Purchasing or borrowing books, accessories, games, using the internet, etc. are all there.  I have only had it for a month and am still exploring the exciting range of uses. I take it when I have to sit in a waiting room or riding in a car as a passenger. I read with my Kindle in bed, sit it near me to watch a movie or listen to a book when exercising, sewing or cooking. I love it's portability, clarity, price and quality and highly recommend it as a gift to yourself and or others, young or older. This is a gift to myself that keeps on giving!

Reviews.Title: love the kindle
Reviews.Author: Kaitlin Robinson
Reviews.Content: its the best tablet .i just love the apps and books and more.my mom and dad wants to buy one now.i will tell my family and friends to buy a kindle instead of others tablets.you have a better watterty on your tablets too.you took care of mine when my first one had trouble.thank-you very much. Kaitlin R. Robinson.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it.
Reviews.Author: Lefty
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, who had a regular Kindle Fire, and she has been extremely happy with it.  She wouldn't go back to the regular Kindle for anything.  She carries the Kindle HD everywhere and constantly praises its features -- except the oddity of the screen being upside down for the carrying case -- if you open the carrying case like a book.  The screen display can be flipped, using the internal software, but it is odd that the carrier has to be opened like you are opening the BACK of a book for the screen to be right side up.  Overall, a great product.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Janet C. Boyd
Reviews.Content: Hesitated about buying a kindle, but after my husband bought one and I tried it out.  I decided I had to have one.  I have shared what I know with others and sold them on it.  Especially when you can get the web and emails on it.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle fire HD for 7 mos I LOVE IT!! I relax by my pool listening to Pandora playing words with friends,facebook,read the news,watch my hometown news that my cable doesn't provide. i watch hulu I just love it and my family is tired of hearing me say it!!

Reviews.Title: Very fast and good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Devika A. Bose
Reviews.Content: I purchased a refurbished kindle but I believe at times you can get a new one for the same price on sale. I did not want to wait so I went ahead with my purchase. I own an iPad 4 but it is too big and expensive to cart around. The kindle has excellent sound and is fast and responsive. The picture/screen images are good. It is user friendly. I would recommend purchasing the charger, cover and protective screen from amazon as the prices are best and you have the best choice.Its good value for the money. My kindle came in a box like new and if you get a good deal I'd recommend a refurbished one.

Reviews.Title: improvement over kindle 1
Reviews.Author: LEH
Reviews.Content: I like the new Kindle fire HD.. I am just a bit disappointed that a charge cord did not come with the fire. Boy was I surprised when I took it out of the box. But overall a vast improvement over the first generation.(Faster and volume is louder). I also wish there was an instruction booklet that came with. Some things required a lot of searching on the internet to figure out.. It should at least come with the manual as an app on the Kindle fire, not just an introduction letter. Anyway other than a few minor grievances I am happy.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!!
Reviews.Author: guess101 "guess101"
Reviews.Content: I just brought one of the kindle fire hd today it was on sale plus i had another $20 off coupon. What i have figured out so far that google + and the kindle do not work together which sucks, but you deal with it. it was easy to setup, i linked my facebook, twitter and gmail up didn't take long. I just which when you close an app there was a close button. i have downloaded a few games already and it's all been working great! granted it's only been a few hours since i had it lol.my mom has one too and she does have one issue all the time with the wireless connection not wanting to connect and i have to reset my router each time and then it works. and her kindle is the only device in the house that has problems connecting, but maybe there is an update that is needed on her kindle.i will keep updating this comment as time goes on. but before you buy anything always do research this day and age there is no excuse not have the knowledge you need when buying anything. this is basic tablet surf the web, play games etc...if you are looking for something that is more like a like laptop to do work with this is not it. but its great device to have on had for the basics. my nephews are 6 &3 and they each have one to play games on it, and they love it.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to the iPad
Reviews.Author: James Brewer
Reviews.Content: My wife has been using an iPad to read books for a few years now. Her biggest complaint has always been its too heavy. I bought her the Fire Hd just because having 2 ipad 4's in the house i just couldn't spend the money for another ipad and buy the mini. I honestly thought i was going to regret this purchase. She absolutely loves this thing. Granted she doesn't play games on it or do anything else really except read books but she literally does not leave the house with it. The thing is always in her purse. Im glad we got it, it definitely wont stop me from buying iPads in the future but I know now I will only have to buy 1 for myself and my wife can just get a new kindle.

Reviews.Title: Love it!  2nd Kindle... recommend!
Reviews.Author: Angejeeper "coffee lover"
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire, waited to purchase the Kindle Fire HD so that I can Skype while traveling.  It's great!  It's much more sensitive than my first Kindle Fire, and I would like to find a vertically standing case for it for ease of reading when I'm on a plane.  Overall, the Kindle Fire HD is a great deal, I can download data to my cloud and share it between my devices.  I travel 2 weeks/month for work and this is a great device for travel since I have to carry my work laptop.  It's compact, but it has everything I need; internet access, streaming videos (excellent viewing with the HD!), music, books, movies, email, web, weather, Skype!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: dislike about this product
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Warren
Reviews.Content: This product did not come with a charger.  Never heard of that before, no charged with new product?I like the my Kindle fire HD, I even purchase the speical program for $79 anually,  But when I ordered the travelhome charger for it, it doesn't work after the second use.  Now I have nothing to charge it with, unless I buy a accelerated charger for another $20.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Crow "Satisfied customer"
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire Hd and use it everyday. I'm still learning about all the features but it is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: love it , love it, on it all the time...only a few issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "scifi lover"
Reviews.Content: Love reading on it, buying books and music is very ez . Use it all the time .  The experience is great.*needs to provide push notification for sounds. ....and update &fix; the ones that do work..as they are not dependable; sometimes they work,& sometimes they don't* what is the deal with #You Tube not allowing play on many music vids for mobile devices????*needs more availble android apps* THE CALENDAR AND CONTACTS DON'T SYNC COMPLETELY***needs the ability app toBETTER MANAGE FACEBOOK BIZ PAGES & THE FACEBOOK MESSENGER APP*** but i love it!  If the above issues worked i would not need my phone :-)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: bARBARA wAHLBERG
Reviews.Content: I like this product a lot and my grandson is learning quickly how to navigate. This is his first tablet type item to own. I would have given it a 5 star rating except for the fact that there was not even one page or paragraph included with the expensive item that tells you how to operate it. Nothing. Nada. You can read about it on the Kindle itself but it was not as helpful as it could be . HOWEVER, you can of course PURCHASE a separate book that explains how to navigate around on the device.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: Haven't gotten to play with everything yet but so far so good, hopefully it has the storage capabilities I want and then it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Glad I shopped around
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Curran
Reviews.Content: I researched all the tablets for at least 6 months before buying. My sons have the Ipad, so I knew I wanted a smaller tablet just from playing with theirs. I mainly use it for books, but have watched movies, played games, use a planning calendar  and calculator and I have not come close to using up memory, thanks to cloud storage as well as 32 GB. I do wish it had camera capability, not just the front facing. My daughter compared mine to her brothers, then bought a Kindle also.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: William N.
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful product. I read much more "aggressively" with this device than the older Kindle (1 - 2 books per week). I also have a 2011 Motorola Zoom with Andriod 3.x OS. Observation suggests that the Kindle size and weight are more comfortable in most situations for both my wife and myself.  Our grandchildren also seem to prefer the smaller, lighter Fire.The device is incredible easy to use and the function and features of the Fire meet all expectations as described. I purchased Amazon Prime with the Fire and  - 1. Zero regrets, money well spent; 2. Amazon understands how to monetize digital technology. Between them and PayPal I need to pay attention to my purchases.I wonder about the life cycle of tablets after moving from one Kindle device and smartphone to another over the last 2 - 3 years. It seems best to me to consider the price as a sunk cost over that short time frame.If you're thinking of buying a tablet, I would heartily recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: a girls best friend
Reviews.Author: tess
Reviews.Content: i love this kindle fire HD, But i love my Kindle fire as well. it's just so much fun. i can check my e-mail, read news play games watch movies and read books. but with the Kindle fire HD you can plug it in the TV and watch or play anything. it's just so much fun. i wouldn't  want anything else. i have the amazon prime and it makes it so you can shop and get a lot of things with free shipping as well as watch lots of movie get free books. very happy with my kindle fire HD. it is better than my kindle fire, but like i said there both great you can just do more with the kindle fire HD.  thank you amazon. there customer service is the best as well.

Reviews.Title: This thing is awesome, but I have a couple of gripes...
Reviews.Author: smalleststorm
Reviews.Content: It's hard for me to complain about my Kindle Fire HD; I got it for free, through a promotion at my bank.  I can say with certainty that it was made with just about nothing but entertainment in mind.  The screen and sound are phenomenal, and I've found so many free (and AWESOME) games that it has supplanted my phone as my primary mobile gaming device literally overnight.The CONS I have found are as follows:Occasionally the keyboard pops up on its own.  I have to drag the menu down and press "back" to make it go away.  This is particularly irritating during a fast paced game (in Temple Run 2 or Iron Man 3 it's a kill order)The fact that I have to pull down the menu to navigate; I'm used to my android phone having at least a couple of static buttons.  Home and back buttons that are quickly accessible would be a plus, though I can see how people might have to worry about accidentally tapping those buttons.For such a high-powered device, I've found it to be a little bit laggy.  Iron Man 3, as mentioned above, has become my go to game.  It's got extremely good graphics, and I can understand that can cause a bit of jumpiness.  I'm going to try it on a iPad tonight and find out which gets better results.  (As a side note, am I the only one astounded by the fact that our mobile gaming platforms now outshine the PS2?!)Really?  No official youtube app?  No official hotmail app?  I have to side load and cheat the system on day 1 if I want to have a usable youtube and hotmail?  I mean...really?And lastly, not a gripe, but more an announcement.  The interface is a bit beyond me; I have yet to figure out how to put a website permanently on the carousal, and I hate having to switch back and forth between device and cloud storage to pick an app.  The front page only contains that one carousal, and it is constantly changing based on what apps you've installed/used most recently.  Why not have a second carousal, that you swipe down to, where you can have things permanently stay regardless of cloud or device storage?  I mean, since there apparently aren't official youtube, hotmail, or cracked apps for this device, it would be nice to access those websites quickly and easily.Huh.  Guess I CAN complain about something I got for free.  I'm a bit disappointed with myself...

Reviews.Title: OMG Love it
Reviews.Author: Madz "Madz McD"
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago i put an ipad mini on layby at my local big w and i just couldnt pay it off cause i really didnt want to go through installing itunes and dealing with it. But the other day as i walked into big w to place more money on my ipad, i saw the new kindle fire finally selling in australia. I thought to myself YAY, as i cancelled my layby and brought the new kindle.The one thing i noticed first was the price difference. In australia an ipad mini is around $360 for just the 16gb wifi only. Whereas the kindle fire is only $230 (so that already is a $130 saving). i just couldnt justify spending more on something i wouldnt be satisfied with.As soon as i got home, i opened it and just looked at it for a little bit. I loved the back of the kindle because it made it look softer. I also noticed where the camera was on the front and that there was no camera on the back (which i liked). I just cant see myself taking pictures on the kindle, but i love the idea that i can skyped with my family now.The next thing was the display of the kindle, or the layout of the main page. At first i didnt like that when held in portrait, it showed what other people had brought when that app was selected, but after going through the settings i found how to turn it off.The coolest thing i found was that you could go onto the amazon website and look at apps than send them to your kindle fire (when connected to wifi) and all i had to do was sync. i also love that i dont ever have to connect my kindle to a computer to use.After having the kindle for just over 2 days i havent found anything i dont like yet. but i am still experimenting.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Claire McCown
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  I bought it for my husband and had the daughters give it to him for Father's Day.  I have the Kindle White and now we can share e-books. The Kindle Fire is superior to the White in capabilities.  I already have an I-POD so I did not need all the extras.  He can listen to audio books, have wi-fi and watch movies. It does not have the battery life that the White does.  The White battery lasts for 8 days, which is something I like. I imagine that we will trade our Kindles back and forth.  If I want to borrow his Fire to play an audio book, he can use my White.  Both will have the same books.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the help I received from Amazon with my Kindle trouble. I am also happy with the machine I received in the mail.

Reviews.Title: in love
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: Just do not know HOW I ever lived without one!  it does EVERYTHING a desk top computer does & so much more! PLUS, its easier to carry than a computer!  You would be happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Has software issues
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I like the concept, and I like reading, watching movies and surfing the web on this device.  Unfortunately, mine has software issues.  It is prone to random resets, and when you turn it off, it will either give you an option to shut it down by touching an icon on the screen or sometimes the screen just goes blank.  When it just goes blank, I have found that the unit keeps draining the battery for some reason.  The volume changes on its own (goes lower) when I watch a movie with the speakers.  If I hit pause then play, the volume then goes up again, for a while.  Also it randomly beeps at me multiple times when I first start watching a movie, for no particular reason.  Bottom line, it's usable, just has some disappointing issues right out of the box, that I hope don't get worse.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!!!! You can't get a signal anywhere!!!!! I bought it for travel and it is useless!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Teacher
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat technology-literate but had never had a device like this and it takes some getting used to. It is not entirely user-friendly and it took lots of phone calls to Amazon to understand some of the features. That is a feat in itself, as they do not put their contact info where one can easily find it. I'm not sure if they even put it on this website. I had to go to Google to find their phone number for customer service. I keep it with my kindle. The images and print are small and cannot be altered. You can temporarily increase the size by moving your fingers on the screen but it goes away and you have to keep changing it. They said there is no fix for this. I also have trouble using certain features on the kindle compared to the computer. I can't listen to music samples or view movies using my Amazon Prime membership. I am not sure yet if those things are possible or if they are simply difficult to figure out. There is a huge learning curve with this item. I almost wish I had waited for the next version to come out and see if some of these issues are addressed.The price dropped by $20 after I got it and I had to spend money on extra accessories. They give you a USB that only attaches to the laptop computer so I had to shell out for a wall adapter as well. I got the case to make it more portable, but it's still pretty hefty. I also got the warranty in case I dropped it. Ca-ching, ca-ching, ca-ching. I spent well over $200 by the time I added on all the necessary extras to make it really worthwhile (screen covers, stand, car charger, wall adapter, stylus, etc., etc.). So, don't think that the advertised price is all there is to it. The stylus really is necessary as it sometimes does not recognize a finger swipe. I found some package deals on Amazon for these accessories so it pays to shop around. I did feel that this was a better value than an iPad or other brand.It gets me online, I can listen to music, watch videos, read ebooks, check email, surf the web, etc. I'm sure it does a lot of things that I haven't figured out yet. Good luck with that. The emanual is rather skimpy. If you can invest the time to learn everything and spend time calling for customer support, then it should be fine. It doesn't completely replace a pc but it does more than my cell phone which is not a smart phone by any means. I have a "Stupid Talk" from Wally World. This gives me more (which is more than none) media options for travel and convenience. I got the Prime membership which has its own pros and cons. I did a lot of research before buying and there is no way to know everything (after all, you can't ask what you don't know). Overall, I do like it and use it a lot. In fact, I am using it more and more as I get to know it. I just thought it should have included more accessories and that it should be either easier to use or easier to get help to figure it out. If you are really techie, then perhaps you will understand it better and have better luck. It would be nice to have the larger size, but that would weigh more and take up more room...which, for portability is a consideration. It's smaller to transport than a laptop but not as functional. Then again, it isn't meant to be or there are things that I haven't learned yet.Just find that customer service number (google it) and keep it handy, lol. I practically had them on speed dial for a while. It is a cool tool to have when away from the home computer if you don't have a smart phone. If you do have a smart phone, not sure that this would also be necessary? I guess it all depends on your needs, budget and level of technical expertise. Case in point: I wrote this review from the kindle and had to come back on my pc to edit. It uses autocorrect and changes things such as numbers and symbols. You have to really be on guard because it will also sometimes change words! I can't seem to find a way to turn that feature OFF! It has some other items that also behave that way. You can lock the orientation as it keeps turning even when I don't completely turn the unit, flipping the text around. Bottom line: it takes time but not everything is as one would expect. By the way, it comes with a camera but post-purchase I discovered that this is for Skyping, not really for taking snapshots. Perhaps the next version will take care of that from what I have read.

Reviews.Title: Great reader and tablet
Reviews.Author: balmorhea
Reviews.Content: Enjoy reading on this device, books, newspapers and magazines. Videos are smooth and sharp. Good Internet with wifi. Battery requires charging more frequently. Sound is good.

Reviews.Title: Completely amazed !!!
Reviews.Author: LuvMyKindles
Reviews.Content: Many sleepless nights - I can not put the Kindle Fire Hd down, there is always something else exciting to find in the free books or apps.  I had one issue, called in for support and in 2 minutes I was up and running again. It was the most pleasant experience I have ever had with customer support.  WOW!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: I was disillusioned with the camera.  I guess I thought it would be two way.  It is very difficult to take photos.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: My wife has the original Kindle Fire.  I got this one for myself.  It is so much faster and clearer!  The Dolby sound is awesome as well!  The only thing that could be better is selling it with a charger.  it comes with a USB cable to plug into the computer to charge, but that can be slow.  Overall, am very glad I purchased it!

Reviews.Title: Still Trying To Justify This Purchase
Reviews.Author: Irene R Ballinger
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed that my Kindle Fire didn't come with an instruction manual.  It probably does a lot more than I am using it for, so I am still trying to justify the purchase.  I am 65 and trying to keep up with technology, not any grand-children in the area to teach me, LOL!  I would only recommend this to someone that is computer savvy.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Device
Reviews.Author: Xander
Reviews.Content: This is the tablet to turn to. It is so versatile. There are fun games and great, useful apps (not to mention a free app each day); great speakers for any music you download or put onto the device, an incredible screen display for shows and movies, and not to mention the great platform for books (probably the reason you turned to the Kindle).First to the books: - The X-Ray feature is awesome: you can click X-Ray at any point in your book (while connected to the internet) and you will see defined terms, names, and other points in the book where that term is mentioned - greatly useful and convenient. - Immersion reading is great: the service where you can read a book and listen to an audiobook at the same time. It's innovative because the book highlights itself as it is read by the audiobook. Additionally, it syncs your place no matter which medium you use. If you listen to just the audiobook for a period and then jump to the book, the book will turn immediately to where you left off on the Audiobook.Now for movies: - A similar X-Ray service is present for movies. At any time, you can click on the screen and IMDb pops up with the actors that are on screen in the present scene.Fun and handy if you're trying to remember that actor you know you have on the tip of your tongue. - The screen is incredible and boasts full 720 HD. Great for all the videos on Amazon Instant.  I highly recommend this device to anyone who is looking for a tablet for great functionality in several respects: Great HD screen, incredible speakers, awesome programs.Also, I'd like to add that I highly recommend having or getting Amazon Prime while you have this device. You will be able to get free two-day shipping on so many items on Amazon.com and an ever-expanding and great amount of free TV shows and movies (not to mention a brand new slew of them from Viacom including shows from MTV, Nickelodeon, and Comedy Central - shows, I might add, that are no longer on Netflix!). Amazon Instant Video (as the Amazon Prime video service is called) is building up to compete with Netflix and Hulu Plus, and it's really a great service for the money! Also on Amazon Prime, you get a free book every month with no due dates. In other words, have the book as long as you want! But only one per month.And one final word. DON'T PAY TO GET RID OF SPECIAL OFFERS!! Special Offers only appear when you click the unlock button. They appear right before you unlock the device and NEVER after. The only place to see them is on the "Offers" tab of the home-screen carousel. They are not intrusive, they are not annoying. Also, the special offers include decent book suggestions and daily deal offers, free or discounted App downloads, new shows or audiobooks, and sometimes even completely free, no-strings-attached Amazon MP3 credits. Seriously, don't be foolish and pay to remove ads. They are overall a great service, especially considering the fact that the device is cheaper because of them.All in all, an excellent device. Do your homework and research different tablets for your specific desires and needs. But this truly is a useful, fun, and versatile device.

Reviews.Title: I don't remember life before my Kiindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Nevermore
Reviews.Content: I've had this baby since Sept of 2012. I first purchases the Kindle Fire and within a week I exchanged it for the Fire HD. To say this has become an essential part of my life would be an understatement. There isn't a single day that I don't use this. I resisted getting an e-reader for years, I find caved and I'm so happy that I did. As someone who has used Amazon for the better part of 10 years, it was no brainer and I'm thrilled with my purchase.Keep in mind, I'm not a techie.  I've never been one of those consumers that needs  the most technically advanced anything,  so for my needs the Kindle Fire  HD is perfect. Perhaps some other devices have more bells and whistles for but an average user this definitely does the job. So for me the pro's are numerous.PROs:The size:  I don't need a larger screen. I find reading magazines or books quite comfortable. For me the portions are ideal. It fits easily in any of my handbags. I love having access to my favorite reading materials (books/magazines) at my fingertips without having to lug them around. This was one reason why I resisted e-reader for so many years, because I thought I would miss the experience of real books, umm frankly, I don't.  ). Also, this baby has taken quite a few falls and I've had no issues. I use various Kindle covers to protect it (purchased from Amazon of course).WiFi: I easily find signals to jump on. Financially I don't want to commit to wireless plan so for me the free WiFi is more than sufficient.Apps/Games: I've synced all my emails to this device so I can easily check them. My Google Calendar is also easily accessible. As for as complaints about not having access to a million apps, who freaking cares. There only but handful whatever that I've needed, I found. I'm not going to bellyache about 2,000,000 apps available elsewhere, that I probably won't ever need anyway. First world problems, folks.Video: I've downloaded both Netflix and Hulu to this device and they work without issues except for the occasional buffering issues. Between those two apps and having Amazon Prime membership, my TV/Movie needs a pretty much covered.Offers on the lock screen: Some people complain about having to pay to remove this feature. I've actually enjoyed some of the offers and taken advantage of them. When you turn on your device it's there for half second, I couldn't care less enough about this to pay to have it removed. It's a non-issue in my book.HDMI: One of the reasons I chose the Kindle fire HD was for the ability to watch videos/movies off my kindle onto my TV. I ordered this HDMI cable (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004286VMW/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1). Sometimes depending on the video image may not be as crisp, but that's okay.Amazon Customer Service: The one time I had technical issue early on with my device, I called and they walked me through some steps and my Kindle was back online. The fact that you can speak to live human being anytime of the day, is simply awesome. I find the representatives knowledgeable, friendly and beyond helpful. Amazon Customer Service ROCKS!CONs:Silk Browser:  okay I will admit that it kinda sucks at times and I've had to have it restart on many occasions. It's annoying. So I side loaded the Dolphin browser, which is better, but frankly I've had numerous restart with that as well. Whatever.The Fast Charger: Okay the USB plug that comes with the device isn't sufficient to fully charge the Kindle, so you really have to end up buying the fast charger.  $20 bucks yeah that sucks but you need it for this this thing. I was able to get $10 credited back to me by calling customer service. Not only that I charge my cell phone with it to. #scoreVolume & off buttons: I'll admit because they are so flush against the device (and so close together) it can be a little annoying. I don't use the Volume on the device, I simply access this feature through the drop screen. I also have a cover that turns the device on and off so I avoid using the actual buttons. But if this can be addressed in future updates, that would be great.Spending Money: Okay that's not Amazon's nor Kindle's fault. Because of the obvious tie in and by signing up for Amazon Prime, I think I've ordered something at least every single week, since I've had this baby. Shopping is beyond easy. Browse, click, purchase. It's almost too easy. *shakes fist at Amazon*So needless to say, I'm a very pleased with my Kindle Fire HD. Forget American Express, I never leave home without my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: help instructions
Reviews.Author: linda
Reviews.Content: I like everything.  I think the help could be improved by giving more "friendly" instructions.  Everyone isn't computer savvy!  More details needed on how to use the Aps.

Reviews.Title: enjoying it
Reviews.Author: Howard Billie
Reviews.Content: I am reading more now that I have it.  I love the lighted back ground and that I read in the dark without a lamp.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Lafreda S. Doctor
Reviews.Content: It has the functionality of the original kindle fire and paperwite all in one.  I recommend it to anyone wanting the functionality to surf the internet, download apps and read books.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Susan Farabee
Reviews.Content: I like the kindle but it shows internal error or it will freeze up and then you have to shut it off to get it running.  I have had it replaced but the second one isn't that much better.  I just think that it should work better than this.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: lexibearlove
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle fire because another tablet of mine broke, and wasn't completely satisfied. I don't really like the display, and how you have to go through so much trouble to do something as simple as delete an app. I found cheaper tablets with better reviews than the kindle fire did, so I was bummed that I could have gotten something better with my money. Although I did like how crisp and clear the screen is, and I found the sound amazing.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!
Reviews.Author: Sly
Reviews.Content: ~I've had mine for months, it does so much I hardly ever log onto my laptop.I stream Netflix on it directly or to my TV.I love that it reads to me my favourite bookhttp://www.audible.com/pd?asin=B00374O7ZU&bp;_ua=yAnd I can read along with it with a 3rd edition copy I found online that is so much like the 2nd edition I've had for over 30 years http://www.archive.org/stream/outlineofhistory00wellrich#page/n5/mode/2upI can take care of all my email, shop at all my favourite shops, read & post on forums, ect, ect, ect.I keep finding cools things it does & all at a cost of $200. Is remarkable!!!Also, the customer service is close to perfect!!!Eta... I forgot the consSo for the only cons have been downloading documents and many games that say they will work on the KFHD don't.

Reviews.Title: Better than original Kindle Fire--worth the upgrade
Reviews.Author: Mother of three
Reviews.Content: I've had a Kindle Fire since they came out and I have bought them for my kids and my mom for  Mother's Day.  We all love them, but this HD version is much better.  I traded in my regular Fire and received a $61 credit, as it was in perfect condition.Improvements:Speakers!  The speakers are about 3 times louder than the regular Fire and have a nice tone.Camera!  You can Skype or take pictures.  YAYMore games!  You have a larger selection of games that will work on this version.One issue that isn't a problem any more, but that I was disconcerted about initially, is the fact that the Silk browser that's included doesn't support Flash.  BUT if you download Dolphin you can use that to run Flash. (*For instructions on how to do this see the review from "Peter" at this link:  http://www.amazon.com/review/R2VS58X8MUVXSC/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm )  It's easy to do and works well.I bought the ad-free version since I don't like ads.  Be aware that a charger does not come in the box.  I would recommend buying the quick charge version.

Reviews.Title: this is what my wife says
Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife and she uses it all the time instead of opening her laptop for quick stuff. Good color and easy to use. As expected. All the kindle books came over. Had to get a browser for web surfing.

Reviews.Title: What's not to love ....
Reviews.Author: Notorious Spinks "Notorious Spinks Talks"
Reviews.Content: about my Kindle Fire HD?  I love this device and the sound is great.  I was contemplating getting an iPad mini but I think this one works just as well.

Reviews.Title: Second Kindle
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: My first kindle fire hd lasted 5 months and quit charging.  This one, my second, is picky about charging.  Other than that, I'm very pleased.  I like the kindle ap on my iPad as well and I am very glad the two sinc.

Reviews.Title: I only wish I got the bigger one!
Reviews.Author: TMC in IL
Reviews.Content: I have used the iPad and I have used the Kindle. Personally I think the Kindle is more responsive, lighter weight & seems to connect better to our wireless internet. The only drawback to me is that sometimes it just shuts down an app (mostly facebook) but then so does the iPad. I would recommend getting the larger screened one but this is good for the main reason I got it which is ebook reading. However, it is SO much more.

Reviews.Title: Locked down and limited by amazon
Reviews.Author: L. Ng
Reviews.Content: Realized this is an access point for amazon content only. This is not a tablet, this is just a portal to amazon. If you want more functionality than that, this is not the product for you. Because of the limitations, I would not purchase this product again, and I am unhappy with the one I have.On the plus side, the HD screen is very clear.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Paine "ThrillerLover!"
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire and thought it was the best thing ever. I certainly surpassed the other book seller's Nook tablet, which a family member has. But I was too tempted by all the neat things offered by the Kindle HD and am SO glad i spent the time and money to get it. The photos are much, much better than my 12mm camera and my iPhone camera. I use Skype a lot with grandkids and overseas sister; the reading screen is adjustable and really easy to read. It is so fast, and I just can't say enough about it. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Edward West
Reviews.Content: Awesome , very user friendly. I've used IPad and I much prefer my Kindle Fire HD. I can even access my home and work computer with the LogMeIn app.

Reviews.Title: Works well.
Reviews.Author: Ron Smith
Reviews.Content: The Kindle works well, the one drawback I see is the huge amount of advertising and additional purchases that are presented continuously!

Reviews.Title: what would I do without it?
Reviews.Author: Eleanor G. Hoenig
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my Kindle Fire 7".  I had difficult surgery and was hospitalized then in bed at home, my Kindle was my life line.  Reading books, playing games, following Facebook, watching favorite shows on NetFlix I did it all using the Kindle.  Unfortunately I lost it and went into withdrawal until the new one arrived.  The size is perfect to fit in a purse or tote on trips.  I have given several Kindle Fires as gifts to friends who are always thanking me.  The price is one of the best things about it.!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: xrayshelly
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD. It is very intuitive and easy to learn. I use it for surfing the web, music, reading books, and playing games. I can also watch movies, take photos, make videos, and Skype with my friends. It does it all! (at a fraction of the cost of the iPad too) What a wonderful device :)

Reviews.Title: It's AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Matsumoto
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my kindle fire hd. The free games are AWESOME! You can take it anywhere you want and you can lock your screen so nobody can use your kindle unless you tell them your password. There's Skype, the internet, calculator, and hundreds of more apps!

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: Nanajan
Reviews.Content: I love this kindle fire. had the kindle keyboard first. this is amazing. it does so much. will take awhile to learn all the wonderful things it does but it has been an easy thing to work with. very easy to get around. love the lighted screen.

Reviews.Title: Daughter was thrilled!
Reviews.Author: Chiffonade B. "Chiffonade B."
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kindle as a gift for my daughter.  I attempted to purchase a Nook from Barnes & Noble and 24 hours after purchasing it, I returned it.  I could not download the e-book I purchased and when the main office told me to "Return and re-purchase the book" I thought "That's what I get for not trying Amazon first."  My daughter loves this Kindle, the zebra cover and the book I purchased for her.

Reviews.Title: Glad I let my husband talk me into buying the Kindle Fire...
Reviews.Author: Marie Brasher "book worm"
