Reviews.Content: Prior to this purchase, my favorite gift from my husband was a power screwdriver (I'm kind of a "hands on" person).  I'm enjoying the color and am overjoyed with the clarity of the pictures (I can even watch Netflix on it).  I'm looking forward to getting my magazines on it soon.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: This kindle is great. I hardly ever use my home computer since I got this. You can use it anywhere in the house. I use it mainly to check e-mail, surfing the net , games and music. It's a great product. I also like this size easy to take with you.

Reviews.Title: I'm in heaven!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Annie "Amazon Annie"
Reviews.Content: I did not really want a tablet because I have a desk top computer that is so fast and awesome. I decided to get this because my ereader died on me and I did not like the brand. I kept seeing the Kindle on Amazon every time I logged on and decided to get the paperwhite. I only wanted an ereader to take with me to appointments and anywhere I had to wait. When I looked at the difference in prices and saw what the Kindle Fire could do, I thought for a little more I could have a tablet. I am blown away by this. I find myself using the tablet more than my computer for most things, because I can carry it around the house with me, watch a movie while I cook or have it read to me while I clean. If I went into all the things I love about this tablet it would take hours, so I will just tell you that you will never be sorry if you buy this. It is so fast! So responsive to touch! So handy! I use it for entertainment, a contact keeper, an appointment calender, I Skype with my brother in Florida, and I am reading a book about using all the features because there are so many it's mind boggling! This was worth every penny and I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: So in love!!
Reviews.Author: United Indie Book Blog "Rose's Book Snobs"
Reviews.Content: My husband got me the new Kindle Fire for my birthday and I have not been able to put it down! I love reading books on this thing and surfing the web and watching videos is super simple and easy.The only thing that I don't really like is the touchscreen keyboard, it glitches every once in a while and closes and then opens up depending on what website you are on or what your doing. I have pushed this Kindle too its limits and I have not had any issues so far.I used to have the older Kindle Keyboard and I liked it but you would have to read with a light on and now I can read in bed without keeping my husband up! I also like that it has more storage. I just wish you could personalize it a little more with a different background and stuff like that. But other than that it is a great piece of technology!

Reviews.Title: Seems Awesome
Reviews.Author: jenna
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire yesterday. Based on other reviews I saw, I also purchased the wall charger for $9.99 and it charged up quickly. I am very impressed! I am coming from an old Kindle that "just" had the book function. I did not even notice the ads that other people found annoying. Just like older models, there are ads when the Kindle is off and at the bottom of the page. To me, it wouldn't be worth $15 to get rid of them. Websites loaded quickly and the touch screen seemed very sensitive. So far, I am loving it.7/7 update: Despite other reviews, I find this Kindle hard to read in the sun. with sunglasses or not. Makes me miss the old model, but I do like having the features of a tablet. Dropping 5 stars to 4 stars. I am able to read in the sun, but there's lots of adjusting angles.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is ON FIRE!
Reviews.Author: Wm O Writes
Reviews.Content: First you need to understand this is not a computer(neither is the IPAD or NOOK).  If that is what you are looking for, purchase a netbook.It is an entertainment device.  Great for reading (even in the sun), displaying movies on your TV (even provided 5-channel sound), surfing the web (add search engines other than silk)and game playing.  It opens you to the world of TED Conferences, PBS Specials, TV show re-plays, TWIT, pod casts, etc.; on something bigger than a cellphone screen.One of the concerns is the attachment to Amazon content; that attachment is why the unit costs as little as it does (Remember that IPAD's are connected to Apple).  Also having Amazon as a source maybe a good thing; numerous content.  However, with a little downloading one can use other than Amazon content (even Google is available).  You see computer people are known for providing us open access (it is what keeps the USA free!).

Reviews.Title: Like it and learing to use it
Reviews.Author: Judy Genao "Judy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this and have to say I like it a lot, it's great to take around and play and keep yourself busy. It does not support flash player so if you are looking for this it doesn't have it or can you down load perhaps but by the time you figure it out it will take time. The touch screen is good but not as great as an IPAD meaning it response time is a bit slower and you have to touch the screen a times a bit more to get you to what you are requesting. The front camera is a front camera no rear camera so keep this also in mind in case you are one of those that loves taking pictures with your tablet or IPAD. Again this is great to take with you not an IPAD so for simple needs this is great.

Reviews.Title: I am mainly a reader
Reviews.Author: gerluck
Reviews.Content: I do not like the Kindle Fire as well as my old kindle because the way the books in my library are listed it is much more difficult for me to find the book I want...I miss the keyboard when I play Scrabble.I had gotten the Fire because I wanted to be able to view illustrations in books in color, but so far have not found that a real convenience...

Reviews.Title: Happy, but.....
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kindle Fire since Christmas.  This is my second Kindle (the first not a Fire).  I thoroughly enjoy it though I am having to recharge it constantly, especially on weekends when I do a lot of reading, approximately 4-5 hours and some playing of games, like solitaire, nothing with a lot of graphics or sounds.  I only turn the WiFi on when needed.  During the week, I may have to recharge every two to three days.  I'm concerned the Fire will not be the reader for me during long layovers and such during my travels.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Jan Boardman
Reviews.Content: I really, really like my Kindle Fire HD 7" I am disappointed that I can't download books. etc other than thru Wi-FiI paid less for my Kindle reader and was able to download from anywhere.I do miss how the Kindle reader let me know If I have already purchased a book. I also hoped the Kindle Fire HD 7" would keep track of what books I'd ordered.

Reviews.Title: Almost a home-run--great hardware; software needs atttention
Reviews.Author: D. Smith
Reviews.Content: For the price, it would be very difficult to get a better piece of hardware than this.  Yes, there are some better-executed pieces of hardware out there, but not at this price.  It does what it is intended to do, and I love to see a company put attention to just getting the job done rather than filling it up with all kinds of unnecessary features.The software, on the other hand, needs some serious attention in 3 areas:1) Compatibility with Google Play.  Admittedly, this would require Android certification, which I understand could impact the price.  But I would pay a couple dollars more for more freedom with apps.  Either that, or improve the offerings on the Amazon store and make sure they work flawlessly.2) Stability.  The first weekend I played with the device, I got it to crash (not just an app, but the tablet) several times.  All while just doing normal things like shopping or web-browsing.  It occasionally "hangs" with no indication of what it is waiting on.  The web experience isn't quite as blazing fast as we are led to believe.3) Usability.  Amazon has done a great job integrating their shopping experience with the tablet.  It is clear that this is what got the majority of their attention--and why not, as Amazon is all about shopping?  However, Amazon is also all about books, and KINDLE is all about reading.  I *expect* a nice way to organize my reading material, but there is none.  Zilch, Nada, Nothing.  You get the carousel, which is kind of cool at first, then just annoying.  It commits what I consider the principal mortal sin of a UI: it gets in the user's way.To summarize:  For the price, it's really hard to do better.  But if you want a Kindle to be a KINDLE (focused on reading) rather than a shopping tool, maybe just stick with the lower-end pure Kindle readers.  If Amazon will make organization easy and make the carousel optional, then we might have something really amazing here.  There is no reason the hardware can't do it.  And there is no reason the software can't be written to do it--Amazon just needs to see it as a priority for something bearing the KINDLE name.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Fun!
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I took a long time to decide to buy a Fire. I was pretty sure I wouldn't like it. I already had a Kindle Touch which I love, and and Kindle 2nd Gen and couldn't imagine what use I would get out of a gadget that streamed movies and played games. That is what my laptop is for! I bought it in April and I fully expected to keep it a few days and send it back.I was very wrong. I'm in love with this thing. The Kindle Fire HD is one of the best things I've ever purchased. Movies are gorgeous and the sound is really good for something this small! Games look great and are fast. The web browser is fast. Reading books on it is not as comfortable as on my Touch but it's definitely okay. Being able to change the brightness and contrast helps. Reading out-doors not so great, but that's to be expected with a shiny screen. It's also very easy to figure out right out of the box. The pull-down menus are pretty easy to figure out as are the settings and how to change them. The ads are completely non-intrusive and only appear on the sleep screen. I appreciate the "Offers" tab so I can check out the specials. I LOVE the "customers also bought" feed at the bottom of the screen. I thought I would hate it and turned it off at one point but I turned it back on.I should say that I'm still exploring the capabilities of the Kindle Fire HD and finding out what it can do. I don't use it for photos or documents. I don't Skype on it or use it for e-mail or Facebook yet, so I can't comment on how it works for those things. I'm perfectly happy with it as a device to watch movies, play games, shop at Amazon and read on at this point. The battery drains pretty fast when I'm streaming videos but otherwise really lasts, even when I forget and leave the wireless on!I have zero complaints about the Fire HD. I can't put it down.Edit: Not a complaint so much as an observation. I downloaded a game a couple of days ago, (Jewel Legends:Tree of Life)and noticed that the Kindle heated up quite a lot when I played it. The longer I played the warmer it got. I guess the more graphics intense games might over-work the system. Have not had that problem with Plants v Zombies or Bejeweled.

Reviews.Title: I bought the Kindle thinking it opened up access to the Android store....
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Hammons
Reviews.Content: Clearly I was wrong, Kindle Fire only contains apps that are built on the Android platform made specifically for the Kindle and available through the Kindle Fire store...few apps, and no Google Play...I suspect it the platform isn't going to make it.On top of the limited access issue, I also find that device a bit all over the board from a usability standpoint.  It doesn't seem to be organized very well, no hierarchy to the organization.  In all fairness I come from an Apple background where user experience for the OS is a science, but I think this device is trying to figure out if it's a tablet or an e-reader...and really only doing the e-reader effectively...which isn't how it's sold.

Reviews.Title: Much better than the original Fire
Reviews.Author: Photographer
Reviews.Content: I have the original Fire that I was mostly happy for reading, checking email. But web surfing was only acceptable after 18 months. Some of the sites are very slow to load. I was on the fence between Fire HD 7 and Galaxy Tab 2 7 with the choice went to Fire HD. The main reason for me was HDMI although I would also like micro SD support.Web surfing is better but still no comparison to my desktop.The screen is significantly better than the original Fire. Colors are more accurate and the dynamic range is much much larger. Pictures are now more natural looking with a gradual transition from dark to bright, much closer to my calibrated monitor.I am not bothered by the ads, actually not sure where the ads are. No access to Google play is not a big deal for me. I only have a few apps loaded and that's all I need.Finally, I decided to stay with 7" size. I just can't see to need to use a 10" tablet. 7" is just about right for carrying around and big enough to properly display everything I need. If I need larger display, I have multiple monitors and TVs to do that.Edit: May 12 2013 updateThe rating was changed from 4 stars to now 5 stars because of the two following findings1. I found a way to install Chrome on Fire HD. Chrome is much faster than Silk. It can take advantage of the larger bandwidth. So the original comment on web surfing is no longer applicable.2. I was also able to install DropBox now after a little bit of searching.

Reviews.Title: Really Impressed!
Reviews.Author: Juan Arevalo
Reviews.Content: First let me say, I have played with the ipad on a few occasions.  The Ipad, to me, is just a bigger version of the iphone but without the ability to make phone calls.  I read the reviews before purchasing the kindle fire.  I am really impressed with the kindle fire.  At first, the screen play on movies was a bit pixely(for lack of a better word).  This happened for a little bit when first bought but after a while it did not happen any more.  The screen plays in HD and is fantastic.  The sound on the Kindle is amazing.  I was sitting on my patio watching a movie.  I KEPT pausing the movie because I KEPT hearing something behind me.  About the fourth time I paused the movie, I realized the sound was coming from the movie on the Kindle.  Surround sound?  Not sure but WAS shocked then delighted by the quality of sound!  Oh, the features take a little getting used to, and i'm still figuring things out.  Overall, I Love my Kindle Fire.  My first tablet and I am happy I made this purchase.  It was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price
Reviews.Author: Lance T
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and bought a cheap router for my home. I set up the wifi for when we travel around so we don't need a monthly service for it. So for about $200 my wife has a portable computer which she can access her music and all our tv shows as well and twitter/facebook too. HBO on demand through cable as well. All of this for a one time fee. How could you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: not enough stars
Reviews.Author: Homer R. Dalrymple "Hank"
Reviews.Content: I need a couple of more stars to rate this product, picture, sound and quality all in one device.  my only negative comment wold be to make the buttons for on/off, sound etc. a different color for us older folks to find them easier.  A really great product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: S. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I am loving this Kindle in most ways.  I really appreciate the adjustable back lighting.  However, I wish that I could set the print size in the same way as my old Kindle.  The thing that I most miss, however is the way I could put my books in folders by a given author or series so that I didn't have to scroll through all my books all the time.

Reviews.Title: Best next thing to an Ipad
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Grundner
Reviews.Content: I wanted a lighter tablet for reading and viewing video in bed. I already have an Ipad 3 which is great if not a tad overpriced. But Apple has always overpriced their products. So, I wasn't about to buy an Ipad Mini, again way overpriced. I bought my wife a Kindle Fire. (original) and wasn't at all impressed.  Too slow to respond,and quirky.But I read reviews for the Fire HD, and most of them were very good.So,I took advantage of the Mother's day discount (even though I am not a mother) and bought one. I am not at all sorry I did. It runs smooth,has a good interface,and best of all was at a reasonable price.The display is fantastic. Yes, it is geared for Amazon consumption, but you should already know that if you are considering buying it. I considered a Nexus 7, but decided to buy a Fire HD because I already have a lot of media from Amazon. I don't regret buying it, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Device
Reviews.Author: michael tallon
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter absolutely loves this kindle!!!Beats the IPAD hands down....and $400 cheaper too!!I think I will buy another one for myself.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: TraMaine Vornes
Reviews.Content: worth the purchase.  it does exactly as it is advertised to do.  Its much thinner than expected.  I guess thats a bonus.

Reviews.Title: I absolutly love this product.
Reviews.Author: Sonja Govey
Reviews.Content: It is small enough to carry in my purse so I have a book to read, a game to play or with wifi able to check my email where ever I am.  Makes reading so much easier.  User friendly but does take some getting use to but be patient it will not take too long to get the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Pat Reynolds "katt556"
Reviews.Content: I am more than pleased with my Fire HD,I love it. This device truly delivers on all points,I always have it with me.If there were one thing I would change it would be being able to upgrade memory.  Katt556@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE BATTERY POWER
Reviews.Author: Street
Reviews.Content: I have two of these Kindle Fire HDs.  Both suffer the same issue of terrible battery life.  On a full charge they last about a quarter of the time my ipad will last on a full charge which quite frankly is pretty poor.  Also, I had to have the first on replaced as the original one I received had defective sound right out of the box.  Another issue I have with these Kindles is the OS.  The way everything is laid out is not intuitive and straightforward as Apples OS.  It's better than the ipad in the fact that you can view the contents of the Kindle Fire HD in windows explorer on your computer, something you cannot do with the Apple OS.  However, I hate the fact that when putting ebooks on the Kindle you have to reformat it into Amazon's specific format for it to show up properly on the Kindle.  That can be very annoying and time consuming when you have a lot of books.  Lastly, I have gone through MANY chargers.  The Kindle is VERY picky with what will work to charge it.  It's total crap that it doesn't come with a charger, HUGE negative there, and when I forked out the money to buy the Kindle fire chargers, 2 of them would not charge it!  I am forced to use my IPAD's charger!!!  crazy.  Overall it's a decent little package with a great screen for $200, but the negatives I listed just make it something I would give to kids, nothing I would use personally.-------6/2013 UPDATE--------So the second Kindle Fire HD I have died.  Froze at the welcome screen and nothing I did could get it to boot up.  So Amazon had to replace this one as well.  Funny thing too, when I took it to the UPS store to send the broken one back with the prepaid label, the guy at the UPS store said, "you would not believe how many of these people have brought in to return."  Due to this I have dropped my review from 3 stars to 2 stars.  So far I've owned 4 Kindles Fire HD's. 2 defective, and I'm just waiting for the replacements to go.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Dee W.
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a Christmas gift for my son, but I strongly recommend getting the protection plan and screen protectors, plus a secure case- its an investment , not a toy!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: DemonShadow
Reviews.Content: This is the First EReader that i have personally owned and i couldn't be happier.... well besides all the book that i want free and all the time in the world to read but neither of those are going to happen. so probably the best thing that i have bought in the last 6 months if not longer.

Reviews.Title: Good but...
Reviews.Author: Mario Forestier
Reviews.Content: The design and use is what I spect to have when I bought it. But I dont understand why Amazon took out the Play Store from his Android.If it's to sell own products...I really think that it is not necesary to do that, Android users love to feel free to use any App; that is an Apple politic !.Please think about that and brake the Jail.

Reviews.Title: Love it , but.....
Reviews.Author: Nancy M. G. Douglass "nmgrove260"
Reviews.Content: I spent days comparing 7'' tablets and had decided on another until I was convinced to take a 2nd look at the Kindle Fire HD. I'm very happy I did. I have been enjoying it a lot. The ease of use, not too difficult to adjust as I have been an iPad user for 4 years. The screen resolution is really nice, have already watched a movie. This is the perfect size.  I'm a little annoyed that there is suddenly a $20 mother's day promo code 3 days after I placed my order. If only I had procrastinated, I would like it that much more.

Reviews.Title: I made a great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl A  Nelson
Reviews.Content: The size is perfect. Clarity in the detail on the screen is great! I have just started using this and I am sure that there is so much more to discover.

Reviews.Title: absolutely
Reviews.Author: D. M. Herrig "the book lady 3"
Reviews.Content: love the Kindle Fire.  This is my second Fire also. I got the first generation Fire last Christmas when it came out and was never disappointed and now I purchased the new Fire and love it even more.  I would add a front facing camera but that's the only thing I can think of adding to this Fire.  It plays, music, goes anywhere on the WEB, has books, you can download just about any app you like to play games. It's much improved over the flagship model but then each item has it beginning and then hopefully gets improved upon.  My next kindle Fire will be the 8.9" version in a year or 2.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Gina Sharp
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire HD is just Amazing. I love being able to download, and play my games from Facebook and Amzaon cloud. The Dolby Audio is loud and clear, and the picture quality when I watch Movies is great. I also love having Skype to connect to family in other states. It is so easy to operate and just the right size for traveling. This is one of the best devices I ever purchased.

Reviews.Title: It's all that & more!
Reviews.Author: Brucer
Reviews.Content: WOW! Glad I purchased the K F HD7"! Tried the KF7" for 1 mo & decided to spend a little more $ to get the HD version. My wife has iPad. My Kindle runs neck-in-neck with it. Totally user friendly. If you want an iPad, get it...but for the money, Kindle Fire HD wins hands down!I also like the 7" version over the larger version--weight-wise, carry-ability.It's hard to believe they could improve on this product, but if they do, I'll be considering upgrading.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Boannah
Reviews.Content: I have not completely navigated my way around the device yet, but what I have, I absolutely love it.  I had originally purchased the 8.9", but I have small hands. So returned it for this 7" inch model and it's great!I do wish an informational booklet that I could take with me had been included, but online tutorial works well when I'm home.I do advise getting a cover for the device, it makes it a lot easier to hold.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Annette M Preston
Reviews.Content: I like being able to download books for free with a Prime membership and return them when I'm done reading.  Also, I can surf the web, play Words with Friends, and watch episodes of NYPD Blue.  The sound is great too.  I am going to Europe in a couple months, and this will be great to take on the plane.

Reviews.Title: My Preconceived Ideas Were All Wrong
Reviews.Author: Lillian Ammann (Lillie) "Lillie"
Reviews.Content: I've used an e-reader since the Rocket ebook in 1999, and I've always believed I wanted only an ebook reader with no other features. I don't get out much, so my computer is convenient for everything else.I've had several Kindles and was happy with all of them, but I had recently played around with my brother's tablet. When my last Kindle died, I decided to replace it with the Kindle Fire. I chose the smaller one because I was concerned about my arthritic hands holding a larger device for long periods. The 7" is just perfect for me. It's light enough that I can hold it to read, but the larger screen compared to the Kindle makes for easier reading. I love the color, something I never thought would make a difference to me.Oddly enough, high on my favorite list is the ability to review a book as soon as I reach the end. I have written reviews of every book I read on a readers social media site, but I have seldom put in the extra effort to come to Amazon to write a review. On the Kindle Fire, as soon as I come to the end of a book, a review page pops up so I can review it while it's fresh on my mind, and I'm reviewing everything I read.I didn't realize when I placed my order that I was ordering that the device had special offers. I've always thought I would not want to be subject to advertising when I was reading. However, I discovered that the special offers are discreet and no distraction at all. I've even found myself going to the special offers page a time or two to see what's on offer.The only negative is that the battery doesn't last very long. However, with the PowerFast charger, it doesn't take long to charge the battery.I think folks like me who have always used a dedicated ereader and never even used a touch screen will be pleasantly surprised with the Kindle Fire, and people who are used to smartphones and tablets will find everything they expect in a device.Update 11/8/13: I still think the Kindle Fire is a fantastic product, and I use it occasionally for games. However, I have gone back to my Kindle Keyboard for reading novels. The arthritis in my shoulders, elbows, and hands has  worsened since I've been using the Kindle Fire, and even using the device for a short while increases the pain significantly. I can tolerate it for short periods to play a few games. However, I simply can't hold the Kindle Fire long enough for reading. This won't be an issue for most people, but I wanted to mention it for those people who might have similar problems.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire mostly living up to expectations
Reviews.Author: RB Beatty
Reviews.Content: So far I've enjoyed the machine.  I love that I could pulldown a high-power financial calculator for 5 bucks, along with tons of free apps and online books.  Free Full Facebook app is much appreciated, and email is functional.  But...no Adobe Flash, and no 'non-geek' workaround? And no Google-Play access? Limitations are minor to me in the balance but maybe a huge turn-off/deal killer for big media users.

Reviews.Title: needs a better battery
Reviews.Author: Craig Maxwell
Reviews.Content: The only problem i have with it is the battery life is short. It only lasts for 4-5hrs with constant uses, 2-3hrs if i am watching a movie on it. Fix this and i would like it.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for a decent price, but...
Reviews.Author: Shasta
Reviews.Content: Alright, so here's the deal.(Too long; didn't read)TL;DR version: There are much better tablets and E-readers out there, this one isn't very user friendly.It's a decent tablet, at a good price.  It has really great computing time, it is smooth and the pictures are insanely high quality, just as advertised. However, this device is probably the most troublesome device I've ever owned and I will explain why.The ads: Now normally, I really don't care about the ads myself, they are more of a minor annoyance than anything at best, but when you start putting advertisements for your books and charge a $15 just to get rid of them, that's going too far.  Yes I've heard all the arguments for the ads, "Oh it's not that big of a deal!" Or "It isn't like you see them that much." both of which are wrong.  It is true that the ads are not big of a deal, but the fact that you pay upwards of $170 for one of these only to be a walking consumer who's only purpose is to spend more money, that's basically a slap in the face.  As for the "You don't see them that often", you are constantly bombarded at the bottom of your screen with a "Customers also bought!" sort menu.Now while the advertisements are the minor part, I'll move onto the some other issues, because not everyone dislikes ads as much as I do.As for things like basic features, you're not allowed any customization for your kindle, you cannot change any aspect of it.  In addition to this, you're forced to use apps that have been submitted through their App store (That is to say, you cannot use Google play on your kindle unless you go through special measures, which in itself is ridiculous) As for the search engine that you use, the default search engine is Bing.  I mean come on, the top most searched item on Bing was "Google" for upwards of 28 months straight.You know, I hate bashing products, but for $200 you can get a much better product.  I've been researching into the Nexus 7 myself, and will most likely return my Kindle for a Nexus, and as much as I dislike Apple, I'm sure that even an Ipod would be more user friendly than this.

Reviews.Title: I love this Kindle Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: Laura D. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about my kindle fire HD, and the amazing kindle support. I had problems with the touch screen jumping all over with the first one, and after confirming there was a problem with kindle support, the next day I had a new device delivered by UPS. I seemed to have the same problem, but speaking with a different rep was told to disconnect any external power, and after that it worked fine. She made sure it was working and then I was on my own. After getting off the phone I switched to a different charging cord and no problems, so I must have a faulty charger... Simple to navigate, great for music, haven't watched any videos yet. The big problem I am having is getting my games transferred from my old tablet, hopefully team lava will help.The cloud drive is incredible, and transferring docs from the drive to my kindle is a piece of cake. The only thing I do not like about this device is that the charging cord come out of the bottom, not a good place if you want to operate it in a stand while charging.

Reviews.Title: it is a nessicary accessory.
Reviews.Author: James M. Morrison
Reviews.Content: if you don't get the charger, your kindle won't charge.  things like this aught to come with the device.  but any way for the company to make extra money off the end user, is very smart for them.  btw, it will charge ever so slowly if you leave it plugged into your computer, however, the charge won't keep up with using it at the same time.  like if you use the high speed plug.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I do love my new kindle. The only complaint I have is the screen is so reflective that I have to be in the dark to use it. My kindle touch has a non-glare screen and it's much better. Don't understand why they didn't put a non-glare screen on the Fire.

Reviews.Title: So Easy to Use...Best E-Reader I have Used!
Reviews.Author: Grandma with her cell phone!
Reviews.Content: My first E-Reader was a Nook. I liked it alright, but it was not very 'user friendly'. Last year, my daughter received a Kindle. She let me do a little bit with her device, and I knew I would one day want to get one. This year, I am planning a very long trip.  I knew I would want to have my E-Reader, but I also wanted to have a device that was Internet capable. Since my Nook was not Internet capable, I decided to 'splurge' and buy a Kindle Fire. I absolutely LOVE it! It is so easy to use, and Amazon makes purchasing it (as well as books, movies, tv shows, etc.) also easy to purchase for this device...you cannot go wrong! I would recommend this item to anyone...and I would also recommend they get it through Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect!
Reviews.Author: Karen D Kirkendoll
Reviews.Content: Only wish it had dual camera to take frontal pix, otherwise I love my Kindle Fire HD!  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Fire!
Reviews.Author: peggy macko
Reviews.Content: I loved my regular Kindle and my new Kindle Fire is even better because I can not only read on it, but check e-mail, go to Facebook, or even play games with my grandson!

Reviews.Title: Kindle 7 inch hd fire
Reviews.Author: silent echoes
Reviews.Content: Actually this was a purchase for my wife.  We are both very senior citizens but found it was not difficult to have it up and running.  One does not have to have grown up in the tech generation to use this device. She gets her email, searches the web, down loads books etc all at a fraction of the cost of the tablet I own. Excellent choice for very portable and really function-able item

Reviews.Title: UPDATE
Reviews.Author: LizzieB
Reviews.Content: So, I posted my review too fast.  After using my HD device for a week, I am very pleased.  The ads do not distract like I thought they would.  I don't even notice them anymore. I would certainly recommend saving the $15.00. The fast charger helps a lot as it does not take as long to charge. And the number one reason I recommend this device, is the great customer service from Amazon. The price cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely fantastic product and service
Reviews.Author: James Dominic "JD"
Reviews.Content: I haven't the space to give a detailed review of the tech specs of this product, but I firmly think this is a great product from Amazon. The space of 16GB is more than enough for my books and documents, as well as music and streaming online video. I think I personally would have been better off with a slightly bigger capacity model, but I really don't notice it as much as I thought I would. The product is very well designed in many ways and performs extraordinarily well. I was afraid the processor would be too slow, but was pleasantly surprised to find it was more than enough. The only two things that are mild downsides to the product are [1] the lack of access to the Google Play store and apps (I've managed to install Google Maps anyway, so no harm done, ultimately) and [2] some of the inconveniences with the automatic Sync when wireless turns on.The first is less inconvenient than I thought, as Amazon has many good apps of its own (many of which are the same as Google Play or overlap). The only real problem is lack of certain Google apps, like Maps, but which you can find ways to work around. I would appreciate a partnership to share apps between the stores, but it probably won't happen. The second problem is merely annoying. When you turn wireless on, the Kindle automatically syncs with Amazon, which can cause slow response time for 10-20 seconds. When a software update is being downloaded, it doesn't let you know that this is occurring but this slow response time becomes more noticeable for a longer period. It would be nice if one could pause or otherwise be informed of what the Kindle is doing during this. It can be easily remedied by going to Amazon's Kindle support page and downloading the update to manually install it on the Kindle.I would suggest to Amazon that their new software update include a feature to see the progress of and pause the download of these updates, rather than have them occur surreptitiously in the background, as well as to be able to disable these automatic Syncs.ADDENDUM - Just as an aside, I found that I had a dead pixel on my first purchase back when this model was released. It really wasn't a big deal, but I called Amazon and was immediately shipped overnight a brand new model. That's a new standard for customer service quality. And that's part of the benefits of buying this product from Amazon - the company is trying head-over-heels to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: Ammending my previous review of 1 star to 3 stars
Reviews.Author: L. Lively
Reviews.Content: Previous 1-star review: This is a nice product with a great screen... as long as you don't want to sync it with your gmail calendar or contacts.  I received my kindle fire HD yesterday and have been on the phone with tech support twice and read hours and hours worth of forums trying to get it to sync with these features.  Tech support just told me that apparently as of April 1st, Google has changed their settings so that this is no longer an option.  This is incredibly frustrating, as this was a feature that was advertised as possible when I bought the kindle fire HD and was the main reason I went with this device.  I am going to return it today.  Huge bummer.New 3-star review: after three hours working with various tech support people and finally being transferred to the developer, the nice gentleman I spoke with was able to get my kindle synched with my gmail, contacts, and calendar despite all three previous tech people I spoke with saying this is impossible.  Now my kindle works great and I'm happy.  It's easy to use, looks nice, and does the trick at a fraction of the cost of an ipad.  Why only increase my review to three stars? a) one of the reasons it wasn't synching was because my brand new kindle was shipped with software that is three versions old according to the developer I spoke with (he was equally perplexed as to why new kindles are being shipped with very outdated software). They should ensure that their products are up-to-date so we're not wasting our valuable time getting our new product up to speed.  b) the bigger, better kindle fire HD lost some of the features I liked on the kindle reader.  For example, when reading a spanish novel on my kindle reader I was able to hover over a spanish word and link it to a spanish-english dictionary.  This is not an option on the new kindle fire (double-checked with tech support) and spanish words can only be linked with a standard spanish dictionary (no english translation).  Seems weird that the more expensive version doesn't have a simple feature that the kindle reader has.  c) The ever-present ads on the home screen are very in-your-face.  I don't like that the "you might also like" icons are almost as big as my own personal apps I've downloaded.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love!!!
Reviews.Author: max618
Reviews.Content: I received my fire as a gift.....I didn't necessarily need it because I already had a laptop and such...but I decided to try it. The stipulation was made that I didn't have to feel obligated to keep it, if I found it unnecessary we would return it.WOW we are not returning this!!!!Most thoughtful and unnecessary joy bringing gift I have ever received!!!Books are much more fun in color with this (passed my old (I mean OLD) kindle on to an excited family member...double bonus)!Easy reading no fatigue screen, fun apps, great picture for movies!Don't know how well super techie people would like this, but great little tablet for the rest of us!(Like it much better then my friends iPad, hers is huge and bulky, expensive, and I hate the whole Apple takeover thing :(

Reviews.Title: Not everything its hyped up to be
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I have purchased the kindle fire HD 7". When I got it I downloaded some of my stuff into it,a few books,and then I wanted to go online and set some of my favorite websites.Well... I didnt particularly care for the silk browser so I wanted to download Chrome like on my phone....nope that wans't happenin easily and it can't be synced either. I have Chrome but it locks up the device when I watch something on youtube,and it is not synced. I have other apps on my phone that I use dailey and wanted to have them on something bigger so its easier to work with when I need the info in those apps....nope cant get those from the google app store....kindle dosn't support any google apps....strike 2. At this point I'm frustrated but I still like my Kindle fire HD. What really tossed me over the top was that I'm a model aviation flier and I seen 3 apps in THE KINDLE APP STORE regarding model aviation. So....I downloaded all 3 apps and tried to used them....Upon opening them I found out I have to have a Pocketmags account. So I tried to subscribe and it couldn't be done through the kindle fire...so then I went online and looked it up and had no luck .So I went on the amazon site and searched for pocketmags to see if I can subscribe though there to use the apps since I got in through the kindle store and it says that ITS NOT COMPATABLE WITH THE KINDLE FIRE HD 7". So I called up and the fellow I spoke to said there not supposed to be in the store and they are not gonna work cause they don't deal with pocketmags.Well....I'm frustrated enough to write this review and Im seriously thinking about returning the fire and getting a Samsung Tab2. Unless your only gonna read,watch movies YOU download or give it to your kids to plays games on,I seriously dont think it all that. Is it bad ...no...is it really worth the $200 for the 7" and the 300 for the 8.9...well...if your gonna read ALOT watch movies ALOT and play games..then yes...If you need the internet and you need to do personal things and want to do your reading and use it as a reference device sometimes, then definatly not.

Reviews.Title: My overheating Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: dannetta clayton
Reviews.Content: The first 4 months I had the Kindle Fire HD I loved it. These last two months have been horrible. It is overheating within 10 minutes of use, it is hot to the touch and the screen freezes. I normally can wait a few minutes and when it cools off the screen will unfreeze but only to freeze again within another 10 minutes. However, recently I've had to do a hard reboot (holding the power button down for 20 second) to get it to work again. I've emailed customer service and their suggestion was to do a hard reboot. In my email to them, I had already told them that I'd had to do that. They also suggested that I call them. I haven't done that yet but I guess I'm going to have to. I sure would like to know if I just have a bad one or many of them do this.

Reviews.Title: New user
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Cecero
Reviews.Content: Bought the Kindle for Skype.  I love the size for transport.  Downloading many free and inexpensive apps for grandchildren. Internet and Face Book excellent.  Disappointed with ability to take pictures. Not a front face to camera. I should have asked this question. It takes pics but not user friendly with dark button . Photos clear and can't be uploaded from FB. Size of screen is acceptable. Easy menu. Lots to learn yet. So next review may be I Love It. Photos can be downloaded from FB. Sorry typo. The free support via telephone is wonderful. They walk me through my ignorant moments. They are very kind.

Reviews.Title: Best Thing That Ever Happened To Me!
Reviews.Author: Emmanuella Pulleva "punk_rocker88"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a computer in 3 years. I was going to libraries, friends' houses, any way to check my email and pay some bills. I don't know how I lived without my new Kindle! Now I play games, watch movies, apply to jobs, write my family, Skype across the world. I love it! Such a great price and an awesome product. I haven't had any issues with it. The speakers are awesome, play great sound and are pretty loud. The graphics are incredible. Most apps are free. I DON'T KNOW WHY ANYONE WOULD GO WITH A DIFFERENT PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: Competition for all tablets around
Reviews.Author: karis jones "K.Jones"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is Amazon's greatest tablet/e-reader. It has a sleek, quick and active peformance and is excellent for the price. The Kindle Fire Hd was my 5th tablet after some of the Ipad family and the Windows surface. I have been reveiwing tablets for a few years now and the Kindle Fire HD has many different qualities then the others. It has fast internet performance, large storage space (32GB/16GB), breath-taking speakers (equipped with Dolby Digital) and a bright screen for reading ebooks which from my opinion does best. Therefore I HIGHLY recommend the Kindle Fire HD for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Super Kindle
Reviews.Author: avonne
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle...and I am so glad that I purchased this tablet....my first experience with  a tablet and I love it. Great picture quality, music sounds perfect and it's so compact.

Reviews.Title: i love this!!
Reviews.Author: valerie stinson
Reviews.Content: i have not been able to read for the last 10 years due to some double vision issues left from a brain tumor. it was uncomfortable to read real books due to the angle they had to be held to see....on my second book!! excited to have access to something that takes me away! :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and excellent customer service
Reviews.Author: Rose M. Lubarski
Reviews.Content: I think your product has a definte "wow" factor.  I could not believe how quickly I had someone call me when I initially had a problem (which was easily fixed).  I have been promoting this product to all my friends and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: I can read again
Reviews.Author: Sharon Brodeur
Reviews.Content: The reason I purchased a Kindle is because I have Wet Macular Degeneration in one eye and dry in the other with cataracts in both.  I was only able to read on my computer which I couldn't take with me.  Now, I have gone through 2 books and am on the 3rd in less than a month.  This is just what I needed.  I have another reader but was unable to download books or even go into the App for their bookstore.I can also go onto FB and get my mail if I am away from home.  The battery life is really good.  I haven't gone into any of the other options yet.  I had read a review from someone who said they couldn't take any books off their Kindle HD.  I have no problem deleting things.  There were a couple of items on that I didn't want to read and they came off just fine.I can read my Bible anywhere and I must say thank You for all the free books I can get.  Thank You so much for making a product someone with limited sight can use.  I have been recommending it to people who have this problem.  Hey, I even use it for church.  (In place of my hard cover Bible).  I can't wait til the United Methodist Hymnal becomes available on this product.  Right now, I can't sing in church unless I take my LapTop with me as I have found all the songs in different places on line.Please, continue with improvements and upgrades, I would like to be able to download the song lyrics on my new Kindle.You now have a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: S. Jones "sjones301"
Reviews.Content: I really love the Kindle Fire HD.  I am not a big apple fan so wasn't interested in an ipad, had considered a google tablet but read mixed reviews on some aspects of it, so I decided on the Kindle Fire HD. I did have some concerns.  I had tried one out at a kiosk at a mall around Christmas time and it seemed clunky (slow, screen freezing) and some of the reviews are negative with comments on charging issues and inability to connect via Wifi.  Still, I took a risk knowing I could return it thru amazon.Delievery is perfect when ordered thru amazon, it is already setup for you on your amazon account.  Email, facebook, twitter apps all easy to setup and default to your login's so you just tap the icon and you are in your account.  Netflix App - works great.  A coworker and I were on a business trip, he with his ipad, me with my kindle. I watched several netflix movies over the hotels Wifi (some freezeups as it streamed but nothing beyond minor annoyance).  His ipad couldn't stream anything at all.  We were in adjacent rooms so we should have been nearly the same distance from the wireless router.I've also downloaded a number of movies via Amazon and they play back great. First one I downloaded the HD version and it looked great, but true HD costs $1 more.  Next movies I downloaded were SD movies and they looked just as good.  I also like that I can connect an HDMI cable from the kindle to my TV.  I do this in hotel rooms on business travel - super cool.  On airplanes the small screen is just fine and the sound thru headphones is great. SD movies also download a lot faster. HD took about 8 hours, SD took about an hour.  Just plan ahead of course.I find web surfing to be sufficient on the silk browser. If you try to tap links too quickly before the page fully loads it might lock up and have to be restarted. Don't know if this is the fault of the browser or the kindle. The biggest hurdle is the smaller screen but zooming in is intuitive and fast.the only true negative I would say is I'm not thrilled with Amazon prime's options of free movies. I didn't realize at first you could only stream them, not download and watch later.  And their selections are not much different, certainly not any better, than Netflix.  I will likely cancel amazon prime.  What IS the differentiator over Netflix is the options for downloading just released movies that were recently in the theater. You can get those without amazon prime.  Trust me, I really wanted to appreciate amazon prime but if you have a Netflix account it is not much different (well, the free two day shipping I suppose but I rarely need something that bad - not worth $80 a year).I will agree that lack of any written directions is odd and although I consider myself tech savy, accessing some things was not obvious. I did figure it out via reading posts online. Others have complained about the power button and volume tabs being flush with the device so they are hard to find.  Trust me, get a cover/case for the kindle and most of them have touch points that make it pretty obvious where the buttons are.  I'd think even without a case you eventually learn. I found it frustrating at first too and after 5 weeks the buttons are a breeze to find.I think a front and rear facing camera would be an improvement, but I have taken a lof of pics with the camera pointed forward, just have to know where the button is to take the pic on the screen.  It can be awkward but do-able. I post a lot more pics on facebook now!I would highly recommend this product.  Ideal if you want it for light web browsing and entertainment (movies, tv shows).

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Napier
Reviews.Content: Excellence for reading & movie viewing.  Convenient - and speedy - access to email and web.  Near perfect size.  Speakers are unparalleled for a device this size.

Reviews.Title: Avid Reader
Reviews.Author: Dana Witthar
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is great for reading.  With the easy change of font sizes and back ground color, reading in any light level is comfortable and easy.  The sound quality and HD picture is good for watching movies too.  If you are looking for a multi function device that is easy to use and has lots of useful apps, the Kindle Fire is for you!!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: gmaleen
Reviews.Content: Awesome, it was more that I expected. Im very happy with it. It is my new toy.I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Likes and dislikes.
Reviews.Author: Carol J James
Reviews.Content: I love the size. It is easier to take along. I love the speakers! I wish you could put back grounds on where the carousel is. A mute button would be nice

Reviews.Title: Exellent
Reviews.Author: Space Girl "Space Girl"
Reviews.Content: Enjoy it very much, can read, surf the web, bank, email, skype and a lot more than I thought and watch movies and play games if I want...

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7 From an Older Geek
Reviews.Author: PMRisher
Reviews.Content: I am something of a techno-junkie, having an iPhone5, four iPods, a laptop, a workstation with dual monitors, an older Kindle, and a Verizon "hot spot."  I have also owned a Galaxy 10 tablet which I have passed along to my daughter because I wasn't using it.  With all of these "toys," why would I buy a Kindle Fire HD 7?  I was looking for a real personal computing device.  The criteria was 1) something small enough for my purse; 2) very easily readable, bright screen; 3) easy connectivity to personal and corporate email/contacts/calendar; 4) something on which to keep my favorite photos; 5) something that would allow me to download selected iTune music library and podcasts; and, 6)easy navigation and an intuitive, touch-screen interface.  Finally, cost was a factor.  I was looking for a good value.So what I have learned in my five-days of Kindle HD7 ownership?  First, it is hands down my favorite "tech toy" and I am very impressed.  My iPhone5 has a nice look and feel, but it is not a pleasure to use.  For someone of my age (63), the screen is too small to be comfortable to read, and I dislike the lack of the easy navigation of an Android device.  On the Kindle Fire, I was able to quickly set-up my email accounts, both personal and corporate.  I use the Amazon Cloud for personal and business storage and all of my documents were immediately accessible.  I was able to find a reasonable selection of apps.  I was able to convert my music from iTunes to MP3 and store them on my Kindle Fire.  I also was able to transfer my favorite photos. Connecting to Netflix was straight forward and the stream rate excellent.  The Kindle navigation is easy and intuitive.  The Kindle Reader is particularly good and you can adjust not only the size of the font, but the actual font type.  I paid the $15 and had the ads on the lock screen removed, which for me was a good investment.  When on WIFI, the transfer rate is incredibly good.  The music quality is also decent.  I purchased a compact case and it fits easily in my purse.  When I have been in doubt about how to do something, I easily found good instructions on the web.Now, the downside (and there is always one).  The Amazon Store for apps is limited when compared to the big-brothers (iTunes and Android).  I was pleased that most of the apps I use frequently were there, but had so few downloads that the ratings were meaningless.  I also found some slick apps after looking up reviews on the web. The other negative, is that many of the apps are not free.  Beyond buying the Office Suite, I have never had to purchase apps, but for the Kindle, I am having to pay for things that should be free. This will probably get better.Another annoyance is the carousel - now there may be workarounds of which I am not aware, but out of the box, this is the experience. If you listen to a song, access a book from your library, or use an app, it is added to the carousel.  If you want to remove it, you have to do so manually and individually.  The size of the carousel images on the 7" screen mean that only 4 images are displayed, so there is a lot of wasted swipes to get to something.  The workaround for me was to add my most used apps to the favorites and by-pass the carousel all together.  My recommendation to Amazon (and this could be done during an software upgrade) is to provide an option to adjust the size of the carousel images (large, med, and small) and also provide an option of selecting which type of applications or files are automatically displayed.  I would also like to see the option of just having a "tile screen" like you have on a smart phone or Windows 8.The final caution about the Kindle Fire HD, especially when run on a home network is the ease in which you can shop on Amazon.  Amazon is one of my favorite companies and I have purchased a variety of products over the years.  I am not someone who typically just browses for retail products.  However, with the Kindle Fire, it is easy to go from watching a video, looking at the news, reading a book, to shopping.  With 1-click and Prime (free for 1 month) you could easily be the proud owner of stuff you really didn't want and can ill afford.At the end of the day, another reviewer said "you get what you pay for."  For me, I believe that this will prove to be a good investment.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: henry
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my KINDLE HD!! Definitely better and cheaper then Apple Products (Kindle Fire HD) >>> I LOVE my KINDLE

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Renee Booker
Reviews.Content: I am loving the Kindle Fire. I purchased an off brand tablet thinking it would be able to do the same thing. I was sooo wrong and im glad that I decided to buy the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Brown
Reviews.Content: Got my Fire HD on Saturday and I was excited but then the automatic rotation started acting up. I was on the phone with Amazon for an hour and it could not be fixed. However they are being nice enough to send me another so after I get my next Kindle I will write another review barring any more problems.

Reviews.Title: Packaging sucks, but the Kindle is great!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Small
Reviews.Content: The Kindle isn't sent in a shipping box. Just its own box so my first one must have been banged up b/c it kept freezing and black screening (we've all seen the UPS videos).Amazon sent me a new one and it's AMAZING. You can do everything on it. I use is mostly to edit PowerPoint presentations. But it is really limitless and such a great deal. To give you a concept of my usage I have Adobe to read documents, office to edit and create, LOTS of games, I haven't downloaded a video yet but I do stream and it looks  beautiful. The only negative is there is no YouTube App for Kindle so to watch any videos on YT you have to be online. I'm very happy with the speed and capabilities of my Kindle! The shipping packing sucks though.

Reviews.Title: Great Device!  Kindle Fire HD ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: xStuntman
Reviews.Content: I have been a die-hard iPad/iPhone user for years.  I have both, but wanted something in-between the two sizes for convenience.  My son even works for Apple.  So, I was torn between the iPad mini and Kindle Fire HD.  Since I love Amazon and order from them daily, I thought I would give the Fire a chance.  I am so glad that I did...I cannot keep my hands off of it.  At lunch, I either watch a documentary, or use Text-to-Speech feature and have a book read to me.  The only down-side is that I find myself browsing selections too much.  I have purchased books that I have wanted to read, but never found the time.  Now, I can listen anytime....when not on the clock that is......Now, I have to break-it to my Son that I bought a non-Apple device.  Love the Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: If you love manga, you need to purchase this now
Reviews.Author: Artemsia_of_Caria
Reviews.Content: This is a review for manga enthusiasts, for those of you looking for a productivity tablet or e-reader, there are other reviewers who talk about it in more detail.So, I know that $200 for a fancy manga reader seems pretty ridiculous, but hear me out. A typical volume of manga is about $6 (if you're not reading them illegally on the internet of course). A volume purchased on the VizMedia Manga Reader* app is $5. Between Naruto, One Piece and Bleach, this device easily pays for itself. Also, as nice as it might be to have an actual paper volume, those things take up a lot of space on your bookshelves.Most importantly, the HD is gorgeous. I have never seen manga look so beautiful. Just the cover of One Piece (which is not the most artful manga imho) looked like an exquisite work of art. I just got my Fire yesterday so I haven't gotten to read Ao no Exorcist, Tegami Bacchi or other art-heavy manga yet.Essentially, ink can only be so sharp on paper, but with the HD the image is clearer than it would ever be in print. Also, colors fade from paper but these colors will stay sharp no matter how many times you read the volumes. Also, the zoom maintains crispness so you can appreciate those little details in Zoro's Rengoku Oni Giri, Itachi's Susano'o or Byakuya's Bankai.I know some people only read manga for story, but for me it's both about the art and the story so having such beautiful images really makes this baby take the cake.Also, the wifi is super fast so you can read the chapters easily when they first come out (rather than waiting the day or two for the Jump release) although I never find the images on internet manga readers to be as crisp as on the Viz app, especially when you zoom in.Bottom line, if you read manga every day (like myself), get this product. Oh, and there's also a CrunchyRoll & Hulu+ app for anime although I haven't watched anything on it yet.*This was actually slightly a pain in the butt to download. Basically, you need to search for it in the App Store under "Viz." However since this is probably more of a problem with the app store rather than the device, I won't know off a star. If you're a Shounen Jump fan, you're going to want this since you can subscribe to Jump which does a simultaneous release with Japan. Also, like I mentioned already, you can buy volumes for a less than paper. Besides, you wants to carry around a bunch of volumes when you can carry hundreds of volumes in this little baby.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Augustus J Smith
Reviews.Content: I was originally hesitant to purchase a tablet of any sort.  As an avid reader, nothing held the allure as a book in hand. But the Kindle is so much more. In the short time I've owned it I have used it for email, social networking, catching up on my favorite shows, listening to music, texting, games, and of course reading. And at half the price of a mini iPad. So absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: One of the best things I've ever spent money on! The list of videos, audios, games and other apps is quite impressive. The video screen is fantastic! I could probably go on and on for quite some time, but I suggest that you check out other reviews, too. I have avsolutely no negatives to lay on my Kindle! Battery life, looks, performance -  all 5 stars! I would suggest considering "AmazonPrime" for $79 per year - definitely worth more that its price!

Reviews.Title: I can't even turn on a computer!
Reviews.Author: Lois Vella
Reviews.Content: I'm not a high tech person by any means, but I really love my Kindle! I admit, I don't read books on it, but I use it for everything else!

Reviews.Title: Superior item, easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddy(.)(.)
Reviews.Content: This is super fast and easy to use. I will probably be buying the larger one in the future. Apps are nice and easy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Texas Nana
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if I would like the kindle fire or not because I thought I was only going to be able to use it for reading. The kindle fire hd has so much more use than that. I have added several useful apps and I can even connect it to my big screen TV and watch it on the big screen.  I have also added an app that is synchronized with the docs on my home computer so that I can edit them when I am away. Fun!!!

Reviews.Title: Best distraction tool ever
Reviews.Author: Barbers
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a distraction tool for when our son goes for a hair cut, starts acting up at a restaurant, or needs to be calmed down.  We also bought it so we could download apps such as Pandora, which he listens to all night while sleeping.  The quality and sturdiness are great.  It has all the features we ever wanted and is cheaper than most MP3s nowadays.

Reviews.Title: Still Out
Reviews.Author: Anita L Crane
Reviews.Content: I'm still "out" on my review. I failed to see the option to purchase the black charger plug, and had no way to charge my unit.  I had a generic plug,but cannot get the tablet to charge past 1/3 capacity - even when left on the charger over night.  So of course it is always out of battery, and I cannot use it for long and then am prompted to plug in the charger. I have ordered the plug now, but it is taking a week to get here. Must be backordered.Please be aware of this when you order this Kindle. YOU MUST ORDER THE QUICK CHARGE PLUG!! THE TABLET seems to work well, display is nice, but I have a hard time getting to "home"...and as there were NO INSTRUCTIONSIN THE BOX!!!!! (I think i might have gotten a returned unit) that was not repacked for deliver), I'm not sure I'm doing this prompt right in the first place.Amazon book issue:  I also find that when I preview a book, and then purchase it, both books stay on my history, and then I get asked again and again to purchase and must go back to step one on my account to reinstate the book I purchased.I am always on my Apple laptop, and am a photographer and use many professional programs...but this was surprising to me.  I am trusting that the charger plugwill solve most of my issues with this product.I'll be back with more info next week.Neets

Reviews.Title: A Great Device
Reviews.Author: a.samuel penn
Reviews.Content: We love the clearness and the ability to read in the dark.  It also does everything an i-pad does without the expense.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Qualtiy of the HD  and soud are awesome and I love being able to Skype with my daughters.  Still learning some of the features of this product vs my Kindle keyboard and have purchased the manual which was very helpful.  Only disappointment so far was I found games I love (Thread Words) did not transfer over and there is not an app for this game on the Kindle Fire HD.  I found some of my favorite games, but had to purchase them again.  Would recommend purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing.
Reviews.Author: lovingmommy100
Reviews.Content: I have considered a kindle fire hd for a long time, and finally decided to buy one. I have had it for 3 days and I am in love. This is definitely a product worth buying!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations in every way.
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Build quality and overall usefulness/operation is beyond what I expected for the price. For technical books, Amazon's e-book prices are often significantly lower than they would be on B&N; for the same book. This made the choice of the Kindle very easy for me.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Lynn Frantz
Reviews.Content: I had to replace my original Kindle after many tears because I dropped it.  I bought the Kindle Fire and I love it!  I can read, watch videos, check my email and Facebook, and play Scrabble.  The apps aren't as good as those for the "bigger" tablet, but I don't care about them.  The only thing I find that Amazon said that was not accurate, is that my Fire charges faster than they said it would!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: D.H. from Florida
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. Has been very good and no problems so far. Is great for travel, down time or waiting for an appointment. As if that ever happens!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: LoveMyLhasa
Reviews.Content: I use this for everything. I didn't think anything would replace my old kindle for reading and thought that I would be settling for less if I bought this over this IPAD.  Well, I was wrong about both!! Is have the small 7" Kindle fire 2nd gen. The size is perfect. I can actually type on it faster than using the holder-keyboard that I purchased with it..although the holder allows me to place it at a better angle for typing, typingprovides extra protection, protection and turns the kindle on automatically when I open it. Now my laptop feels like an inconvenience and I rarely use my desktop at home anymore! I am 57 and don't play video games,mostly handle emails, surf the web, look at pictures , listen to music and now wonder how the IPAD could compete with my little Kindle Fire.  I bought one for my 15 year-old nephew. He loves and my sister says that she sometimes forgets that she has a son since he got his kindle (not sure if that is good or bad though).Also, I bought a a portable BRAVEN Bluetooth speaker that connects easily to the kindle. Although the kindle speakers are great on their own, the combination with the BRAVEN is magical!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Cornog
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my husband for Christmas. He loves it! He hasn't put it down since. Great product!

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: R. McGavran
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy reading and checking email on my Kindle Fire.  It is light weight, easy to use and fits nicely in my purse!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Dominique Lundquist
Reviews.Content: got this for my 9 year old he loves it. he does games and reads books on it. I like that he doesn't squint to see the screen and the size is great. haven't tried movies yet but the picture is great. I do recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Cathy Rogers
Reviews.Content: We love our Kindle Fire HD It has met our expectations. My Grand daughters love there's. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for daughter who reads a lot...
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Patricia S. Nystrom "nyss"
Reviews.Content: She loved it!  Now I have to get one for myself!  My old Kindle is still working, but I may have to give it up anyway.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Serrina Corey
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and a great parental controls. I just wish it came with the adapter. Good kids games but stinks that you have to have a credit card in order to even get the free games. Good thing I have one!

Reviews.Title: Finally Got a Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Virginia
Reviews.Content: I've wanted a Kindle since they first came out and now I've finally purchased one of the highest quality yet! There are only a couple things I was a little disappointed with. I would really like to be able to change the background for one. Not a big deal though. And I shop online a lot from more stores than just Amazon. On a few different occasions when I would go to zoom in on a product, it would lag, halfway download, and wouldn't let me scroll up and down past the selected area. I would have to zoom out again and go to a different area. But I will just do my online shopping beyond the Amazon store on my computer. Also you can't watch videos from outside sites without getting frustrated. Again, I will do that on my computer because I didn't buy my Kindle for that sole purpose. On the other hand, Netflix is so convenient to have on the go! And YouTube works great too. Having the web on my Kindle was just a bonus. I purchased a second one for a gift and as she was sitting there exploring on it, she said, "I didn't realize it could be a 'whatever you want it to be'!" Very impressed with how far the Kindle has advanced!

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: mer
Reviews.Content: It does almost everything a computer does. It is like an ipad but cheaper. Different settings to accomodate any situation like volume brightness and many more.

Reviews.Title: Very nice!!!
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't ask for anything more!!!  This is just about the fanciest thing I have ever owned......wonderful surfing speed, so many dog on movies to chose from with prime. I just love  it!!!

Reviews.Title: Does the job!
Reviews.Author: Devie
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something simpler and cheaper than a tablet, I would definitely go for the Kindle Fire HD. I absolutely love its little features. I am very happy with this purchase. It acts as a tablet and it does the important job.

Reviews.Title: kindle review
Reviews.Author: Katryna
Reviews.Content: This kindle is awesome. It does everything I need and more. The one problem I have with it is the charger. Where you plug it into the kindle it does not always stay charging.

Reviews.Title: Kindle!!!
Reviews.Author: Qemaun Jackson
Reviews.Content: I love this little tablet! The size, the clarity, the ease of operation were made just so well!! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife. She loves it! battery lasts a very long time and screen is well lit and clear

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: KWright
Reviews.Content: User friendly product I love the fact you can Swype no more searching for letters and pecking much clearest worth the up grade.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle Fire! its user friendly and has a beautiful screen. The reaction time of the screen is also great.

Reviews.Title: better than my laptop!
Reviews.Author: Holly Schambach
Reviews.Content: If I knew how great this device was, I would've bought it a long time ago!  Surfing, reading, social media, and games are an ease.  I would recommend the power adapter for faster charging, but my kindle 's battery life is awesome.  I even decided to continue my Prime account because of the perks!  Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: ana
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tablet something like the mini ipad but after I received my kindle fire is just more than I was expecting I just love it the internet is super fast the touch screen always respond good the sound is amazing even better than a laptop and the screen resolution is unbelievable I just love my kindle

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle...except one thing.
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7 inch for about 2 months and it is a great tablet/e-book reader. Surfing the web, watching movies, and reading is awesome.The speakers are so loud and booming! The only problem I have with my Kindle is that it often lags. But overall, I think this beats the Barnes and Noble Nook, the Apple iPad Mini, and other tablets at competition.

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Robert Fee III
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of kindles since my father bought the first generation and when i got the 3rd i was so excited now i have moved myself on to the tablet version and i do not regret it one bit. it is an awesome tool and great for reading books, i prefer this over the Ipad for sure mostly because it isn's so expensive and i still get my kindle on.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I had a regular Kindle and loved reading books on it, but decided I wanted to try the Kindle Fire HD.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Kali Fyre "Kali"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 7"! I love having access to the kindle owners lending library, document reader with cloud storage that I use to ease the load on my laptop. Still checking out the available apps, but I find something new that I like every day that I use it!

Reviews.Title: My Cute New Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: C. J. Nellis "CJ"
Reviews.Content: I traded up to the new Kindle Fire HD 7" and I am sending my original Kindle Fire to my oldest daughter and I am also passing my Kindle 2nd Generation to my Granddaughter.  I know they will love them too!  I couldn't be happier with my new HD 7".  I am still getting used to the new HD because even though it's very similar to my last Fire, it has many great improvements that I am still learning about.  One little glitz I'm working on is that my contacts did not transfer over so I'm now rebuilding my list.  I also had the "Special Offers" removed.  I dislike commercials and would rather pay to have them removed! Thank you for creating such a great tablet.  CJ

Reviews.Title: Terrific Reader
Reviews.Author: D. Womer
Reviews.Content: Easy to read.  Upload books in seconds.  Fast.  Battery lasts long time before requiring a recharge. Lightweight  my wife loves it too.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Elmoulk77
Reviews.Content: My wife give me a Kindle Fire HD 7 inch as a gift and I have waited this long to make my review so I could use it for awhile. There doesn't seem much that it can't do. The graphics are terrific, the sound for something so small is unbelieveable, reading with the adjustable font is a breeze and if I get tired of reading it can read to me. There are many apps to choose from and it will take sometime to read through all of them. One problem I had was though was going to pages and finding some had all the graphics and others had nothing but text. I studied its settings for quite a while, gave up and called support. It seems that new version of Kindle you must go into the Silk brower menu, scroll down to advanced settings and make sure all the boxes have an orange check mark in them. Once you have made that adjustment everything works fine. I am adding that in case anyone else is experiencing that particular problem. That is easily resolved. Also another very minor issue was the virtual keyboard. It is very sensitive and it took me awhile to get that straight so I wasn't always hitting the wrong letters. That was just a matter of getting use to it. I found buying a case for the Kindle to be challenging. I found, for myself, the case that has grooves to hold up the screen to be a much better choice than those that just fold back and keep sliding flat. The cases are all pricey so I would definitely recommend the ones with the grooves. I find myself using this device more than my laptop. All in all this is a spectacular deal especially with the Prime Membership. I am very pleased and I am thinking of purchasing one for my wife since she is monopolizing mine. Good work Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I love the Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Senthil K Panchatcharam
Reviews.Content: I waited a while to post my review to get used to the product. This is my 2nd Kindle which succeeds my Kindle with Keyboard. I wanted a smaller device that is neither big like the IPAD that i own, with color and touch that allows me to view:* my corporate email* watch movie with Dolby (both netflix and Amazon Prime with X-ray that shows the inside information).* read during travel with all the fancy stuff like x-ray, dictionary look up* Listen to music that i have added to the device - did i mention it has 16 GB to store large files* View Word, PowerPoint and other popular files that comes in as an attachment with the pre-loaded softwareI even side loaded some apps that were not available on Kindle Store, without needing to root my device, such as Dolphin browser.You cannot beat the price  for this device for the value it offers such as in-built speaker with Dolby, amazing screen resolution, 10 point touch, small form factor - i could slide in to my winter jacket easily.The only minor annoyance  that i have is reading during the night for longer time, despite setting the background to sephia, with low brightness, the weight becomes a factor as you get to notice the wrist pain after reading for more than an hour. If you are reading only for 20 minutes no issues.Highly recommend this device!
