Reviews.Title: I love my new toy.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I would tell anyone who is thinking about buying a Kindle Fire 7" to just do it. Ever since I took the Kindle out of the box I have been amazed at the style of my kindle, my ability to have a light weight computer in the palm of my hands. This device is so much better then a laptop computer. So stop thinking about buying your Kindle Fire just do it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: I_Heart_Amazon
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD.  The 7" is the perfect size for me; very portable.I can read books, surf the web and play games.Battery life is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: I Love my KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: C. M. Cann "red-eyed traveler"
Reviews.Content: I was a "hard sell" to switch over to a tablet device.  Swearing that I needed the physical "feel" of a book in my hands.  Well that has been quickly forgotten, my Kindle HD is VERY comfortable, light in my hands, has many adjustable positions & I don't have to worry about having a lamp next to my bed anymore with the lit screen, it's way better then I expected.  The charge lasts a very long time, you can read tons of formats(magazines, papers, books, comics etc.....)  not to mention all the games and TV/video.  All in one device.  I am a believer.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love it!
Reviews.Author: Jude585
Reviews.Content: After constantly playing around on my sister in law's first generation IPAD every chance I got, I had been considering a tablet for quite some time.  I didn't want to pay the IPAD price, however. I travel a few times a year, so for the convenience factor I wanted something bigger than my smart phone, but smaller than a laptop that I could have books, games and magazines on for those cross-country flights. I was eying the Kindle Fire when it came out, but never pulled the trigger.  I'm glad I didn't, because now there's the HD version.I was a little leery of a 7 inch tablet, but I can say without a doubt, I love the size.  It fits in my purse so it ranks high in the portability factor.  Part of my hesitation of buying something smaller was I didn't want to have to fiddle with the screen to enlarge the size.  Not to worry:  my email display on the Kindle is LARGER than the IPAD and the keypad is very easy to use.  Internet is fast and easy too.  Video?  One word:  gorgeous.I also do not need a lot of storage as I do not need every newfangled thing which comes on the market.  I have downloaded a few game apps, about a dozen or so "other apps," a handful of pictures, some music and about 5 or so books and barely put a dent in the storage space.  (My so called smart phone would have been "full" at the first app I downloaded.)  I also did not know how I would like reading books on a devise.  Well, I made a small adjustment--I switched the background from white to sepia.  Made a huge difference and I can read in the dark without the need of a book light.  And the size of the devise feels like the actual size of a book.Battery life?  For the amount I use it, (quite a bit on the weekend and from time to time to quickly look up something during the week) I only need to charge it once a week.  (I think the Specs say the battery life is about 11 hours, so it's fairly accurate.)  The only drawback is it takes several hours to charge.  Once I bought the PowerFast adapter(?) and got into the habit of charging it overnight, it was not a problem.I was hesitant to get on the tablet resolution, but now I am sold. I didn't want to pay the price for an IPAD (or the Mini) and I am so glad I didn't.  I actually prefer this over the IPAD. I am seriously considering getting rid of my data plan for my smart phone because I barely use it any more.  (I just have to get over my "what if I need to look up something when I am not near WiFi" bit.) I also think this may be something my 75 year old father, who won't touch a computer, would be able to use much more confidently.  I am also a frequent Amazon customer, so it is effortless to manage the devise through the website.So, if you don't need or want all the bells and whistles of an IPAD, this is a great, easy to use alternative--at a much better price.  Another added bonus:  if you have a Discover Card, you can use your cash back bonus when ordering on Amazon as well.  I was able to get it at an ever better price because of it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: lisa "lisa"
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire!  I had a Nook Color and really liked it but the Kindle screen and interenet access and use is so much better.  It is also easier to borrow books for download from my local library.

Reviews.Title: Everything I excpected - and more
Reviews.Author: J. Karabasz "abayrose"
Reviews.Content: I've waited to buy a Kindle, even  though I've WANTED an  e-reader since they appeared.  If my Kindle Fire represents the state of the technology - WHY did I wait so long.It has become indispensable....for everything from email to the morning newspaper to professional writing to social media to keeping a 3 year old busy at a restaurant.....oh right - and reading ebooks!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Calvin Weaver "Cal Weaver"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th and favorite one thus far. We have a wireless network at home so no problem with connection. The battery lasts much longer then previous versions. Didn't get the 4G model since I'm retired and most of my reading is done at home as is all of my downloads. Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Carmen M. Walker
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle Fire for my daughter last year, and she loves it. When I started looking for a tablet of my own, nothing compared to the Kindle editions. The cheaper tablets were just that cheap. The Kindle is easy to use, and the HD quality is superb for videos. I haven't used the camera yet, but I do like the 16 GB memory and excellent sound. Thank you for a wonderful product that fits all of my needs!

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD for my 12 year old son.  He loves it.  He uses it every day.  It is easy to navigate and with Amazon Prime, the possibilities are endless!  I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product
Reviews.Author: S. Harrington
Reviews.Content: I was not looking to buy the Kindle Fire HD 7 as I already had a Kindle e-reader 3G. However a friend showed me her Kindle Fire and was so enthusiastic that I asked my husband to buy me one for my birthday. I am pleased with the "upgrade." The picture quality is great! All my books from my 3G were already downloaded on to my new Kindle. It is very convenient to be able to get my e-mail no matter where I am. I did not give it five stars because it is confusing trying to figure out how to down load items from my computer to the Kindle. I wanted to download my address book so I would not have to enter my contacts manually. I followed all the instructions but have not been successful. It is also frustrating trying to find an answer to my problem through the kindle help site. Otherwise I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: In LOVE!
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: Hey all!So like many of you, I spent hours researching the best tablet for my dollar. After reading multiple reviews and comparison charts, in my mind I had viewed the Kindle as my least favorite. I had read the CONS associated with the Kindle (the lack of apps, the "ads", a front facing camera only, lack of maps/GPS apps, and a slightly inferior processing speed), and was instantly turned away from the idea of Kindle... until I tested it out firsthand.I went to a couple different electronic shops and started with the Google Nexus 7, which was my first choice based on what I'd read. Although the GPS features and processing power might've been "better", I found the interface to be completely confusing and counter-intuitive. I quite frankly didn't like the feel of it, and the screen seemed smaller and cramped.Despite being an Apple user, I just didn't like the iPad mini either, especially for the price.Finally, I decided to go ahead and check out the Kindle. I loved it right off the bat! Just as many of the user reports have said, if you're looking for a tablet for videos, reading, and general web surfing, this is the tablet for you! I was able to find ALL of the apps that I'd ever want for it, and didn't have any problems with the "ads", which are mostly thoughtful suggestions about other apps, books, and videos that may interest me based off my collections. The processing speed is incredibly fast, and the book and video quality is crisp. You can tell that Kindle focused on keeping the viewers & readers happy, and it most definitely paid off.In addition, I genuinely enjoy the Amazon ecosystem. I can access all my books, movies, and songs from any device, be it my phone, tablet, or computer, and love the added bonuses of Amazon Prime's free videos and book borrowing. I was pleasantly surprised to see the few forgotten amazon songs that I'd purchased on my phone months ago appear instantly on my Kindle Fire HD. Free Cloud support is as good as it gets!On top of that, I had an initial issue with my Kindle synching to my German Amazon account (instead of my American account). Within 2 minutes, I was on the phone with a Kindle Support Technician who walked me through the process of resolving the issue. I couldn't have been more impressed.All in all- make sure to personally test and play around with all the tablets. Despite specs and reviews, you have your own unique needs and preferences, so make sure to invest the time to take a look for yourself. I'm extremely glad that I did!---GENERAL NOTES:APPS: I've become more and more impressed with the availability of apps on the Kindle. Maybe my expectations were low to begin with, but since opening it from the box (Feb 2013), I've had access to everything I'd wanted, including- Twitter, Skype, EverNote, Flixster, Netflix, Bodybuilding.com, MyFitnessPal, Spotify, Pandora, and all the latest popular games like Ruzzle, Temple Run 2, and Minecraft.SCREEN: My husband is a movie / tech buff, and was the first to comment on how clear the quality of video was, even when streaming from Amazon's Cloud or Netflix. I personally found the size and quality superior to the Google Nexus 7, which was slightly cramped, especially when viewing videos from the internet browser.SPEAKERS: I'm an apple fan, but I'm constantly complaining about the speakers on Apple products, even on my Macbook Pro. The Kindle Fire HD speakers are located on either side of the tablet (when horizontal), and will knock your socks off! I was extremely impressed with both the quality and volume capacity, which was an unexpected bonus."ADVERTISEMENTS": There has been a lot of debate regarding the ads on the kindle, but to be honest, I've found some great apps, books, and movies as a result. To me, it's seemed no different than Netflix recommending other movies based on your interests, and I've grown to like and appreciate the ads as a result. Funny though, because I initially thought this would be a show stopper for me, since I'm extremely anti-advertisements.USER INTERFACE: Although initially I felt the interface to be lacking that "open" feel of an operating system, I've become extremely fond of the simplicity in navigating across media selections, web browsing, storage, and settings. The carousel customizing is as effortless and as intuitive as an Apple product, and is always a welcomed sight upon logging in. This was probably one of the biggest deterrents for choosing the Google Nexus 7, which confused me to no end, despite having owned an Android phone in the past. Amazon has done an incredible job at keeping its tablet simple with a high quality, no-lag interface.PROCESSING: I'm notorious for opening multiple tabs and multi-tasking across games and videos (yeah I know- ADD much?), and have been EXTREMELY impressed with the Kindle's ability to not only keep up, but perform without lag. Of course it's still early on in my ownership, but I'll re-visit this review after I've had a chance to load it up with additional apps and media.CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Amazon is second to none. They put their customers first, and I've read about it time and time again. When I first registered my Kindle, I had mistakenly registered it with my German Amazon account. When I logged in, my entire Kindle was in German. Within two minutes, I was on the phone with a technician who was able to resolve the problem. There was no wait, and they even followed up to make sure my issue was resolved. I couldn't have been happier, and have nothing but confidence in their priorities towards me as the customer.OVERALL: Phenomenal tablet, especially for the price, and truly unbeatable customer service!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Cyberwolffe
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly because I wanted something to play with and can't justify paying the monthly bill for a smartphone since I very seldom use a cell phone.  It's a good product, but I wish I had done a bit more research on it before I ordered one.I like the fact that I can put my music from iTunes directly on the device without having to convert it to the mp3 format. The screen is clear and the few movies and TV shows that I have watched on it have a good quality picture.The things that I don't like about it is that it doesn't have an equalizer to adjust the music playback on the device.  I am also disappointed that I can't access the Google Play store on it without rooting the Kindle which is something I don't want to do.  One of the reasons that I bought my kindle was that I had heard it was an android device and there are games that my friends play on their smartphones that I wanted to play with them.  Most of the games won't work on the kindle even if I can find a site to download the .apk file to sideload to it.  If I had known that it was a modified Android operating system, I would have probably gotten a Nexus tablet or android based MP3 player.  I might have even spent the extra money and gotten an iPad or iPodI bought this with the Amazon Store Card and the card is part of what I don't like about this device.  I didn't realize until after I had already received my Kindle that I couldn't order magazine subscriptions with the store card.  I also wanted to order Prime for my Kindle, but can't pay for it with the store card either.  I know that it isn't necessary to have the store card to have a kindle, but for me personally, it is part of the whole package.I would recommend this to people if they ask, but I would also tell them what I don't like about it and let them make up their mind about getting this or something else.

I'll be dangerous.Updated on 06/06/2013I finally synchronized my kindle to my Smart TV and it's amazing, especially with YouTube. I'm able to bring a YouTube exercise and documentary viewings from my kindle to my TV, in seconds. I also purchased a Bluetooth keyboard cover for the kindle and it's like a mini laptop. I like the size, the portability, the sound is great (considering the size), I love that I can read, or surf,or watch a movie, and get the news and weather where ever I go that has WIFI! Reviews.Content: Love this :) easy to use and if you are a prime member, you get to watch free newer movies and rent books

I was able to load all of my vacation pictures on it and view them, the screen made the photos look tremendous.The Kindle was an invaluable tool on my recent trip to the Philippines.

Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a gift for my wife, she reads all the time.  She has enjoyed the books and has downloaded several games for the grandkids.

I have gotten other apps when I go to my daughter's house (they have high-speed internet).  I now can't seem to leave the house without it.  It is really easy to use and so far (I have only had it about a month), I have had absolutely no problems.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Danette M Ash
Reviews.Content: Love this Kindle.  Bought it to take with me on vacation.  Easy to use and plenty of free Apps and Books.  I keep finding more to do everytime I turn it on.  Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Ever!
Reviews.Author: Kyle Thompson
Reviews.Content: My Kindle is great!  I use it everyday and everything works perfect.  Streaming movies on a device has never been so easy.  It is super fast and works so much better than any laptop I've ever used for internet and movie streaming.

Reviews.Title: Waited for the 32 GB Version to come out
Reviews.Author: James D Yowell Jr.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased wih this product.  It does much of what I need it to, however my main complaint about it is that you lack access to the google store withou "rooting" the device.  This is a significant drawback to me as I do not want to "root" the device and potentially break it but I really want to be able to use the device to its full potential which means having access to more apps than in the limited amazon catalogue.  Yes, I realize I should have gotten the Nexus 7.With this said, the Fire has benefits that the Nexus 7 does not.  Having played with my neices Nexus 7 I find the picture quality on the Fire HD is superior, plus you can't beat the ability to plug the Fire HD into a high def television and watch its content on the television.Overall, it is a amazon content delivery system.  I find I spend more money in the amazon store than ever before, but I do not necessarily find this as a negative.  I generally enjoy what I am paying for and amazon makes it very easy to buy digital and non-digital content through the device and they do so usually much cheaper than brick and mortar stores or other alternatives.  As long as the price point is good, I think I will have no problem with this at all.So in short:  Negative - No access to the google play store, no rear facing camera (just the front facing camera)  Plus - Most everything else

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: momofgus "rhodasmom"
Reviews.Content: I really like this Kindle.  Larger than a Smartphone and much easier to see.  I bought the Kindle, and put virtually everything I use on the S. phone, on my Kindle.  I got rid of the S. phone and got a Tracfone and one of their value plans off the Internet that gives you triple minutes for the life of the phone.  Between my husband and myself we are saving $100 a month ($1200 a year).  The savings can be used for whatever I want, plus extra $$$$ for more Amazon purchases.  We feel we have not given up anything, but gained.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed
Reviews.Author: Audrey Webb
Reviews.Content: I was out to buy an Apple IPad Mini, but after reviewing both products with Amazon's provided information comparing the two, I decided to go with the Kindle Fire HD 7".It came fully charged and ready to go - I like that a lot!  I was able to download other apps that I will need right away, due to the convience of my Amazon Credit Card.Thanks Amazon for making my purchase easy and quick.  I ordered it on Monday night and had it by Wednesday morning.  Great job.

Reviews.Title: LOVE my new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kindle. The battery last a long time too! Perfect for all my needs as a medical college student :)

Reviews.Title: Love my Fire HD
Reviews.Author: S. L. R "Camera Nut"
Reviews.Content: I have had a kindle for a couple of years, bought the case with the built in light for night time reading,  I loved it but now that I have the fire HD, my old Kindle seems so out of it.  I keep it with children's books and games for when my great-granddaughter is here,  I just love the fire but have not used very many features on it as yet.  I do a lot of reading whenever I can and usually when I go to bed.  One of my favorite features is that I only need to touch a word it learn the meaning.  I love the built in light feature.  Much better than having to have a separate light that does not light up the entire screen.  Eventually I will try some of the other wonderful features but right now, just love reading on it.

Reviews.Title: What real ppl want to know before buying
Reviews.Author: liz
Reviews.Content: I have the 7" kindleHD wifi with ads.  The ads don't "pop-up" and are hosted in the menu section or as a sort of screen saver.  Are they worth removing?  I don't think so, they don't really bother anything.  Is it easy to use?  YES! you can download movies/tv/music, if your a prime member you can stream tons of movies/tv for free over your wifi.  I did notice if you have a slower connection or poor contection it does stop a lot also there was some "buffering" but a lot less then on my computer.  The picture quality from amazon movies is great.  The sound is excellent, surround sound quality, which makes up for the occasional buffering.  Books are easy to download and read just like on any kindle and the app store has several great apps and games many for free.  I did note download times where much slower then I expected but not too bad.  The Carousel feature, to me is annoying.  If you use any app, go on a webpage, or read a book it automatically gets put into the carousel screen for easy access.  This feature, to me, makes everything seem jumbled and I really wish it wasn't there.  I also wish they would make a deal with apple so that you could get your itunes music or movies but that will probibly never happen.  As far as cost, I feel it is the best price on the market for what's as close to an ipad as you can get without having to pay 3x more for an ipad.  The kids love the games, I love Amazon.com, TV shows, and kindle.  What I don't like, is it doesn't have as much battery power as I'd like it to have lasts only about 3-5 hours, no data without wifi, and doesn't power off when charging.  It does not come an acutual power cable to plug in to charge it only a USB cable so you have to either buy an adaptor or hook it up to a device (like a computer) to charge.  I use my iphone charger adapter.  I also find you can get less expensive cases via amazon.com for phones, ipads, kindles, etc.  The best things about this device are the price and sound, and yes it is worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Fiance LOVES it!
Reviews.Author: Whoatheregrly
Reviews.Content: I've had a nice Samsung Galaxy Tablet for the last two years and I love it. I've been beating my fiancé off of it for the last few months because he's on it more than I. For Christmas I got him an Android MID and it was good, definitely of lesser quality. Everything was good with that until my toddler jumped on the bed landing on top, softly, but hard enough to crack the screen. We sent it back and I promised my fiancé I would replace it...one day.Since we have been dating, I keep breaking his electronics :(Now our son has taken over the job apparently ;-)I have been ordering Amazon Products the last few weeks as I have a Store Card!! And was staring at the homepage and realize, $199  for a good tablet that you know is going to be good quality, (I've heard excellent things from my friends) really wasn't too much when I think that my tablet (which by the way was a gift) was over $250. Without much more thought I placed my order and planned on keeping it a secret until it arrived.Now, normally I can keep surprises just that, a surprise. But after each minute I was getting more and more excited. I ended up waking him up from his nap 10 minutes later saying "You're gonna love me forever!" ;-) Knowing he already would, he replied with "And? What else is new?"After I explained what I had done he was still waking up and was just like "Yeah, uhuh, okay, cool, thanks" just like a man. ;-) An hour later however, he asked, can you pull that up again and let me look at it? HAha, he stocked Amazon checking out the features every day waiting for it to arrive. Those two days passed so slowly!!Needless to say, he loves it! No longer all up on my devices, but now I can't get him off his own!  Great quality, amazing picture, BOOMING sound (he's a music OBSESSER!) and it has ever thing he likes.Only complaint is that you cannot have the Google Play App. I understand it's an Amazon device, but I have a Google phone and can download the Amazon market and apps still, they may want to think about having a little more reciprocity.All-in-all, love the tablet, love the price, great buy!

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love
Reviews.Author: Jo Kime
Reviews.Content: I am so enjoying my new kindle. It took me a while to decided which kindle was right for me. I asked many friends what they liked best before purchasing. I believe I made the right decision. Its a nice size and I can use it for everything from browsing the internet to face book or just reading a book or my bible.I have downloaded my bible & study books for my women's group on it.The only thing it doesn't have that would make things easier as far as study books is page numbers.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Jackie Huston
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire HD, there is one things that bothers me if you are watching a movie it skips some time and when playing a game it also skips and turns off. Not sure why? I'm still getting to know how everything works.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Linda Johnson
Reviews.Content: So happy with my Kindle Fire.The colors are so crisp and sharp.The books are there immediately.Buy it,enjoy it & spread the word.This is the best one yet

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: My mom and dad hot me a kindle for Christmas and I was so glad I have had my kindle for over a month now and there are some ups and downs to the kindleSometimes when I play games on my kindle my kindle will shut off for no reason also if my kindle needs to be charged I couldn't watch Netflix for more than five minutes without it shutting off.Also when you go on the internet it burns the battery out of the kindle. I also liked that when I got my kindle I got free month of Amazon prime which was a bonus. Even though my kindle is great it didn't come with a charger. I also didn't care for my background because it's aall ads. But, the picture on the kindle is great and so is the camera.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE it!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Casey Ferkul
Reviews.Content: No one could regret this purchase unless your one of those people who are never happy with anything! My laptop is now collecting dust unless I need to do banking even paid bills on my kindle! Love being able to get books whenever without having to go to town! The only thing I've found is that the on screen key board messes up one in a while but I'm thinking it s because of the screen protector possibly. The picture is amazing!! Even the sound isn't half bad! Love love love thank you for making an amazing product for a extremely reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: Ignorant and impressed
Reviews.Author: PGHPIRATE
Reviews.Content: Certainly know little about compters but I like this product very much. To learn how to use, I used my desk top to pull-up the helpful info at the Amazon site and tried it on my Fire. Get a HDMI to micro cable to hook up to HD tv and sign up for amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: Like So Much We have 2 Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: OTC Survivor
Reviews.Content: When I started out I tested the Kindle Paperwhite, 3gWifi, Fire and Fire HD.  I know crazy but this was going to be our anniversary/Santa presents and intended long term to cut down on all the books we have laying all over the house.  The value of the donations have become less and less.  I also had to look at impact for budget.  For some reason the the 3G was slowed down and not delivered, so quickly eliminated the paperwhite and next went on to the the regular Fire.  I liked it, there were a few issues that did not excite me.  So I figured I would give that one to hubby ---he kept saying all he wanted to do is read books.  Next I turned on the HD, pulled down some free books and games and did test drives.  I loved this little gizzmo.  It was the answer since I could not afford the IPad or Sony Tablet at prices being sold on Black Friday or afterwards.  So on Anniversary offered the two units to show hubby.  I had already sent the paperwhite back.  The 3 g had been received that day but did not look at.He liked the Fire, but when he saw the clarity of the Fire HD he was hooked.  So I called Customer service and explained I wanted to upgrade ---no problem.  I sent the Fire back and we had two Fire HDs in 2 days.  The only problems we have is with we the users.  To save money we shopped Half Price Books, a Ministry Book Store and others and bought used books to read. So for $1.50 to $2.50 we have been reading most of the recently released books --at least a year fresh from original release.  Amazon has advertised that it had all these great books under 3.99.  To us that is not true.  There are a lot of bodice rippers and low end mystery thrillers written by authors unknown all using method or template writing.  Yes we can find the great romances and literature where the copyright has expired, and are reading some of those again.Also what we have discovered is that the price of e-books of the current novels available in paperback ---Walmart offers them $2.00 cheaper and if I go to Costco, I might even save more.  So what is a great idea of being able to purchase books in the middle of the night and those books being of authors we love and we would save money ----is not so.The Kindle HD is great but it is a ripoff with the cost of the books versus your local market.  At this point I am thinking I should have waited and bought us both wifi tablets with an extra keyboard and a reader application.  I do want the mobility, I want the apps for recipes and shopping and such....so am asking myself was this such a wise move.  A small pc is onsale for only 30.00 more than what I paid for the kindle.  I know the tablets are higher.Learning how to use the Kindle HD was confusing because we could not find the instructions, two of the guides we downloaded were useless (I am a business and technical writer, have had experience with such documentation)---so many of those guidebooks suck real bad.  Because I have been on disability--I have been out of tech world since 2007, so we have been experimenting and guessing how to bring up specific menus and such.  And no we don't plan to watch movies or such on it --we have direct TV and we don't travel.It is a great product. Great quality.  I think it is much better than many of the current ereaders out there.  The catch is the price of the books---crazy as it seems paper from local stores is cheaper than the ebooks.  Totally crazy.Update: PS we bought both Fire HD units at Amazon. Hubby wanted me to emphasize that his ereader he really really loves it.  This man always has a book in his hand literally.  Now the challenge is keeping new reasonably priced books in cloud for him and I to read.  I am already 4 books behind him.  I am trying to look for books $5.00 and under.  Some came out this week.  And there were some sales and price drops on a book we have been waiting to read for quite some time.  So we had some electronic book price saves last night.  Including a special diet recipe book I was interested in.  Hey Amazon, I wish there was some way to say (at least for some books) that we were finished and would like to sell back at a price of 1-5 dollars (depending on original prices).  We don't need the digital clutter again and in reality you can't tell it is "used" and can sell it again.  Just a thought.  Hubby does like the mobility of carrying his ereader in its little case along with his business pouch.  He reads at lunch or while waiting for someone...and at home it is in his hand from time he rises til the time he falls asleep.  No it does not go in the shower.  And I have taken it from his hand when sleeping so he won't drop on floor.  at 74 he is still working.  But he has said his dream is to retire and just beable to have book after book to read and a small herb and salad garden to tend.  I have already loaded some books that were free on subjects of gardening.Note to Prime Product manager.  The free offer made with much celebration that you can check out one book a month to read---I personally think that is insulting.  There are books we want to read and keep and many read and release.  Wish the offer could be expanded for such avid readers.  For example he just finished the first series by Julien May each costing 9.99 (that was part of santa present).  Now we want the next groups that range in price from 6.99 to 11.99.  A total of 9 books.  So could quickly reach a $100 dollars to read.  Here is the problem.  You are offering the edigital version of Sorcerer's moon as Hard Copy at 2.99 and the eversion at 7.99.  If I have prime....my shipping may be zero ---so here you make it more advantagous to buy a hardback even though you have a great piece of equipment to read a digital book!!  If I want them used, I can get some of the volumes for as low as .01 or 04 cents.I briefly read yesterday that there has been some type of settlement related to price fixing of book prices and now publishers and sellers must follow formulas or such.  The article tride to explain it but just made me more confused.  For now I guess we will be buying both hardback and digital.  That is okay when doing my medical and genetic research I like writing and marking in the books and most of them are not available in digital formats.  Usually I can find several scientific papers that cover the subject to use as source documents.Thanks I just wanted to put in examples about the pricing issues we face.  Other than that we love your Fire HDs.I have used the web surfing and we may branch out.using our own wifi in house.  I may just save up for a tablet that I can use to document research as I read in other places than office.  Then can load into the megabrain in the office.We do love your product.  One other change ----we recommend that a link be available that when first turned on the link to the user's guide be a popup.  This would have saved us hours and hours of frustration during this first month.  Since we just found it, will read.  Maybe we will use more functions.  Without a guide in the package or online and no logical quickline when you turn the unit on---you made us feel we had to go buy user guides and so many of those are poorly written ripoffs!

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Virginia Hassell
Reviews.Content: Got this as a christmas gift and really love it. Lots of information at my finger tips. Downloads are pretty easy to do. Had to look up instructions on line to find out how to work it. Very little instructions with it. I guess if you have had one before you have a general idea of how to work it, but for someone that hasn't had one before it is confusing. Once I got the hang on it, it is easy.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: SailorGirl86
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is I love my kindle fire. My hubby has the more popularly known tablet (a kind of fruit) and I think this one is much more practical. It does everything I need it to do. The graphics and sound are great. The book reader is very easy to use and even has decent apps. It's compact yet the screen is very easy to see. Did I mention the book reader? I cannot say enough about this device. Amazon has outdone themselves.

Reviews.Title: Beats The Ipad Hands Down !
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have an Ipad 2 and now the Kindle Fire HD 7 Inch.  I must say that prior to getting the Kindle that I was an avid Apple guy.  After getting the Kindle Fire HD 7Inch and playing with it, I really think it beats the Apple products in price, adapatability to other HDMI/SD hookups and wires (you don't need THEIR special gadgets to hook up), cost of movies & books, video quality, and definitely audio quality.  I would rate it a 10 if it had internal wifi capabilities but other than that it's a smooth and user friendly play all the way around.  Highly recommend it!  Thanks Amazon!  Can't wait to see what else is up your sleeve.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Ginger L Jarchow
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed my new Kindle Fire.  I do wish there was some type of instructions included, because some of us "older folks" do not have the basic computer knowledge to operate this things most efficiently.

Reviews.Title: One of the best tablets around
Reviews.Author: Josh Maiyer "J. Maiyer"
Reviews.Content: I received a Kindle Fire HD 7" for Christmas, and after a brief period of getting to know the device (and sending it back for a replacement once I realized the screen was faulty - on that note, it must be mentioned that Amazon's support staff is great and made the whole process painless) I've fallen in love with it.Pros:-Great quality screen-Fantastic price-Better audio than you'd think a tablet is capable of-Easy to use UICons:-This isn't a $199 tablet, really - it's more like a $250 tablet when you pay to get rid of the lock-screen ads and buy a wall charger (which is nearly essential, since the USB charging on this thing is S-L-O-W.)-The Amazon App Store is, well....I think "anemic" would be the most polite way to phrase it.  You definitely can install non-Amazon apps, but it involves changing some settings (and obviously introduces some risk, since Amazon doesn't review non-Amazon apps for malware or the like).  This is somewhat mitigated by Amazon's free-app-of-the-day.  Some have been mediocre, some have been great, but either way it's a good way to try some things out and expand your app library.Verdict:I think the Kindle Fire HD is going places - that is, the app store ecosystem is the biggest thing holding it back right now, and that's only going to get more robust as time goes on.  Buy one if you're looking for a small-form tablet and it's around your budget point.

Reviews.Title: New / Replaced
Reviews.Author: Bert
Reviews.Content: Both the wife & I had purchased above Kindle, I was having trouble with mine, putting Apps in. Called Amazon told them the problem. They said they would ship out a new one right away. Within 2 day's I had a new unit.I had time to send my other one back w/ the shipping tag included. I'am very satisfied with Amazon & the staff.  Bert

Reviews.Title: great tablet.  good value.  solid buy.
Reviews.Author: ChewyGranolaBar
Reviews.Content: In this price range the current contenders are Nexus 7, Kindle Fire HD 7, Samsung Tab 2, Nook HD.  If you want an in depth comparison you can easily search the internet and there are quite a few very good reviews comparing these tablets head to head.  But the general gist, TLDR of most of these comparison reviews-Screen- Nook>Kindle>Nexus7>TabProcessing Power- Nexus7>Nook>Kindle>TabGeneral Recommendation- Get the Nexus7 if you want to do "stuff" on your tablet and want the latest and greatest android experience and get a kindle/nook if you are hooked on the amazon/bn ecosystem.Now onto my Kindle Fire HD 7 review...Why did I get the Kindle Fire HD 7 vs the other tablets in this price range?  Honestly, just for two reasons... the microHDMI combined with the very sharp, vibrant screen.  The Nexus 7 can do everything the Kindle Fire can do (a lot of things little bit better, a few things a little bit worse).  But the Nexus7 can't connect to televisions with HDMI (although there is a workaround involving either a special tv or the purchase of some more hardware).In general what can I do on a tablet that I can't do on my Android phone?  Pretty much nothing. I can watch movies, read books, read magazines, surf the web, skype, play games and text all from my phone, just like I can from any tablet including the Kindle. So if I can already do everything on my phone what separates a tablet from an Android phone? THE DISPLAY.  So not only is the Kindle display better than most tablets at this price range, but you also have the option of making the display as large and as sharp as the best television or monitor at your disposal.And with that thought process I decided to purchase the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 7.  After a lot of use and a lot of tinkering, I found this machine to excel in many areas as well as have deficiencies in some.--Positives--Screen- advertised as "the most advanced" 7" display, the Nook definitely outclasses the resolution of the Kindle, but the Kindle screen is still very sharp and 720p streaming and movie watching is a dream.  Text is bright and clear. Viewing angle is very good.  Glare is very good.MicroHDMI- I'm not sure if the Kindle HDMI outputs 1080p when hooked up to a 1080p capable TV since the screen on the Kindle only goes up to 720p, but 1080p movies look amazingly sharp when streamed from the Kindle, definitely a HD experience.  I have not been able to hook up the HDMI to a surround sound system to test if it streams surround sound, although I have heard that if you stream your movies from Netflix or Amazon, you only get stereo sound through the HDMI.Speakers- "room-filling stereo sound" is what Amazon advertises... I'd like to add in that it has to be a fairly small room.  But despite the borderline false advertisement, the speakers with Dolby audio are awesome.  Don't expect some kind entertainment center sound or even mediocre external pc speaker sound, but these are the best speakers I've heard on a tablet by far.  Great for when you are watching videos with someone or just want to listen to music without headphones.  The one negative about the speakers is the positioning.  The speakers are located right where most people would place their hands in landscape mode.  If you tend to have a death grip on the tablet then your hands will muffle the sound.Form Factor/Build Quality-  This thing is solid.  Feels like a quality piece of electronics with adequately thick bezels to place your thumbs without touching the screen.  This is especially important for two handed holding of the Kindle.  Kindle is comfortable to hold with one of my medium man hands although smaller hands might not deal well with one handed holding.  The tablet is not "pocketable."UI- Heavily modded Android that cuts all the fat.  The Kindle UI successfully simplifies Kindle operation to let users easily do what a Kindle was made to do... read Amazon books, watch Amazon movies, use Amazon apps to search the web, read email, navigate social networks.  This UI is perfect for people that just want user friendliness and don't want to fuss with much else when they consume their media.WiFi- To be fair, I don't think my internet connection is even fast enough and my wireless router new enough to take full advantage of the Kindle wifi.  But even so, I have noticed that the range on the Kindle is very good, much better than any other wifi devices I own.Amazon Prime-  Very large content collection as well as features not found anywhere else such as x-ray for movies and books (sort of a running index of characters or actors as you read or watch), whispersync to sync whatever amazon content you are doing with all your other devices and immersive reading, which is pretty much the Kindle reading to you as it points out what words it is reading.  It isn't necessary to have Amazon Prime (it is very competitively priced, but still an extra expense), but the Kindle was designed to consume Amazon Prime content.--Negatives--Processing Power- With quad core processors being the processor of the present, dual core processors are looking a bit long in the tooth.  Kindle plays games well, runs apps well and multitasks well enough, but compared to the quad core competition the Kindle definitely is not zippy and definitely is not as future proof as other faster tablets.  But if all you are doing is reading or watching movies, how fast does a processor need to be?  A single core processor can read a book fine and the Kindle can handle HD movies without too much of a sweat.  So really unless high graphical gaming or a lot of multitasking is your main concern, the Kindle is fine.UI- simplicity for profit has a cost... and that cost is totally neutering Android.  The Kindle excels at selling Amazon products and ONLY Amazon products.  The Google Play store is locked out, almost all of the Google apps are locked out.  The UI is not customizable, you can't add widgets to the UI, a lot of popular apps are not available from Amazon and there are a lot of advertisements.  You can bypass most of this with a lot of tinkering, rooting, sideloading and work arounds, but as of the writing of this review you still cannot get the whole unfiltered Android experience even with these efforts... although you can get very, very close.Form Factor- while the form factor was a positive for handling, it is a negative for aesthetics.  The less bezel the prettier is the trend, and the Kindle looks positively retro in this respect.Keyboard- Just not good.  The touch keys are responsive, but the keyboard itself just isn't well optimized for the tablet form factor.  It wouldn't be a big deal if you could just go to the Amazon app store and install a new keyboard that suited your needs, but unfortunately that currently isn't possible.  For some reason Amazon wants you to use their keyboard and only their keyboard even if it ruins your text input experience.  The auto correct is also lack luster.Hardware Buttons- The power button and volume rocker look very nice on the Kindle.  They are the same color as the Kindle back and flush with the device.  But by looking good the buttons give up some ease of use.  It is difficult to feel out the buttons on the Kindle for use.  With a lot of use I have learned to gradually adjust, but still annoying at times.--Conclusion--For media consumption, I think this tablet is an obvious choice.  It is a JOY to watch movies/tv, read books/news/magazines, surf the web with this tablet.  If you want to play graphically intense games and want cutting edge Android features, then this Kindle might not be the choice for you.

Reviews.Title: Totally Enjoy
Reviews.Author: 2dogmom
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Kindle Fire HD 7".  I'm still getting used to using it and finding out about what it can do all the time.  One thing I don't really like is that when the screen goes black after a bit, you have to push the on/off button to get the screen back.  I'd like it to be a touch screen.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars!!!
Reviews.Author: devin
Reviews.Content: I love it it's great for content except I was hoping for more games but a big plus for prime members!:) great tablet!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Momo
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire! It is light and compact and I can take it every where with me. I didn't have any problems setting it up-the instructions on the device where easy to follow. My 15 &7 year old granddaughters have a kindle and we enjoy playing gamestogether....

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Neo
Reviews.Content: Upon thorough research and countless articles I decided to purchase the KFHD 7", Do not regret it.  Initial setup was seamless as only Amazon can provide.  Having extensive experience with all operating systems and most tablets on the market I came to the realization that a tablet was a luxury and not a necessity.  Which is why I recommend this table to someone who pursues a content tablet with Amazon services.  The most surprising aspect of this tablet is its audio, the Dolby surround acoustics are incredible, they will make you forget and wonder if you're listening to your tablet or external speakers.  Touch screen response is smooth and envies nothing from tablets three times its price.  Everything it does, it does well, it will provide you with a different tablet experience.  A strange thing to say, but real, considering the big name tablet devices in the market have been implementing the same formula for years now.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: kevin l harding
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HD has met expectations 100%  Being primarily interested in a book reader that also has internet / video capabilities this has been a good purchase. Ten inch tablets are simply too big to feel like a book. I will lie lie in bed reading so a large device would be a hindrance. The seven inch model is just small enough to handle like a book for reading. I carry it with me on motorcycle rides for net access while in a hotel to keep a watch on weather and to text family as well a stream a movie or Skype. It has been an all around "swiss army knife" tool for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: lindakeata
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Fire HD!  The screen is easy to see during bright sunlight. Very easy to load books. Not hard for a senior to figure it out! Goes on the internet with no problems. You can pull email, read news reports, surf, etc. I have gotten many free books, and some from 99 cents, up. Charging is easy enough. If you read a lot, the light is a must! The colors in the Fire HD are vibrant! I read a lot of books and it was not hard to get used to using the Kindle Fire HD. Very convenient to carry around, with many books on it!

Reviews.Title: My new kindle fire
Reviews.Author: downatdc

Reviews.Title: Get it! Give your sister the old one
Reviews.Author: T. Chase "T-72andCounting"
Reviews.Content: I really didn't anticipate buying a new Fire.  I got one of the first ones out and was perfectly happy with it.  I also bought 6 Kindles: 3 keyboards, 2 touches, and an original Fire--and gave them to relatives whose budgets are tight and who like the same books I like. They stay registered to me so we save a lot by reading the same books. Plus last year my son gave me a fantastic new iPad for my birthday.  Did I mention I love all this techie stuff?Admittedly, lugging around the iPad for reading is heavy and the original Fire's battery doesn't last as long as I'd like and it's heavy as well, so I sometimes I brought my original Kindle Keyboard for reading in doctor's offices.  (OK, I admit to being a septuagenarian and having to spend a lot of time in doctor's offices).So cut to the chase.  I read great reviews on the Paperwhite.  Generous son gave me an Amazon gift certificate for Christmas.  So I got a Paperwhite.  I HATED IT. Returned it in 48 hours.  I hated it so much wouldn't even foist it on a relative.  So there I was with a nice $200 credit.  I used it to get the Fire HD.  OMG how it has changed.  I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT.  It's sleek and not as heavy as the old Fire.  The back has a nice grip to it.  The ads are unobtrusive--really, I can't understand the complaints about them.  It's pretty.  It's easier to use.  I just throw it in my purse (IMHO no case needed--doesn't scratch) and off I go.  Hot spots are so common I don't worry about 3G availability, and I usually have several books downloaded. Controls are way easier to use than the original.So now, up in the cold Northeast, my sister has a nice original Fire to keep her cozy as she snuggles under tons of quilts in frigid weather.So if you have an old Fire and are wondering whether to get the new one, don't you have a nice sister or brother or aunt or uncle you can give the old one to?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: The Fire is fine, but Kindle FreeTime needs improvement
Reviews.Author: CA Mom of two
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a xmas present for my 8 year old daughter.  I was particularly attracted to the Kindle FreeTime feature -- she could have her own (less expensive) tablet, but I could strictly limit what she could do with it and for how long.  Without having to be looking over her shoulder every second.  And mostly, its great.  But there are still some areas to improve.  For example, if you bought the Harry Potter books from Pottermore, planning to put them into Kindle FreeTime for your kid to read them -- forget it.  Even though you own them, and can put them into the Kindle Fire, you can't put them into FreeTime.  Doesn't seem like it should take an engineering genius to figure this one out.  Two other things to note: music is not part of FreeTime.  So if you load music on your Kindle Fire, you cannot listen to it in FreeTime through the normal built in music player.  You can download an app that plays music, and add it to the FreeTime.  But when your kid's app time runs out, and the music is still playing, they cannot get back into the app to turn it off...  Also, though the device is my daughter's, I want her to be able to share it with her brother without eating up her own app time.  So I made him a profile.  But to go from one profile to another, they have to first exit FreeTime, which requires the parental password (i.e., me).  It would be better if it was like those Windows interfaces with user profiles -- each kid has a password for their own profile (so little brother can't use big sister's app time!), they can switch without my involvement, but I have the master password that controls entering or exiting FreeTime.  So its basically good (except for that Harry Potter thing), but has room to improve.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Williams
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas and loved it immediately.  I waited to review it, because glitches and problems generally show up after the excitement has worn off.  I've had a couple of thoughts of "I wish," but nothing that would make me lower my rating.  Here's what I like--and what I don't:This screen is absolutely beautiful.  I wanted it mostly for books, but videos and content are flawless on it.  The books are beautiful and crisp, too, with plenty of options to change brightness and color.  This cuts down on eye strain.  There is a glare, in bright sun.  This is worse than a regular kindle, but not as bad as most tablets.  I was expecting much worse, with the HD screen, so I've just put it down as the best possible at this time.I wanted this because I'm in college and constantly needing books.  It's faster, easier, and cheaper to download kindle books than to try to buy them in a physical copy, especially when I need  some of the more obscure titles for my classes.  I still have books that I want for myself in hardback form, but nothing beats kindle for college!The build is sturdy, but light.  I don't feel like I'm going to break it if I touch it, but it's comfortable to hold.A lot of people complain about not being able to get Google play content and try to find workarounds, but I don't need that, so it's not an issue for me.  I'd rather buy from Amazon, anyway.  Past experience has taught me that their customer service and quality is superior.  If you aren't like me and you want to be able to access absolutely everything in the world on one device, it might be a drawback.  For me, it's not a problem.  I haven't come across anything I need that Amazon doesn't offer--usually cheaper and/or better then the other guys.I am not very techno-savvy, so it's a plus for me that this device is easy and ready to use right out of the box.  I signed in to Amazon and had everything I've bought in the past at my fingertips.One MINOR drawback is the memory.  You'd think 16gb was enough, but it's only enough if you keep your content in the cloud.  That's fine, if you aren't traveling, but if you find yourself without wifi access you cannot get to your content.  I downloaded a season of a tv show, knowing I would be without wifi, and it really ate up the memory, slowing my kindle fire down a lot.  After watching, I removed the episodes from the device and the slowdown disappeared.  I found myself wishing for more memory, then.  Most of the time, though, I rely on the cloud and 16gb is fine.  I just have to remember that small limitation.  (If I were buying one, I'd go with the 32gb model, personally, and have a little more room to download content for the times I'll be without access.  This was a gift, so I cannot really complain.)  I love the cloud and use it for most things, anyway, so it's a minor issue.  The only time memory is a problem is when I'm traveling.  For some, that might be a bigger issue than it is for me, as it's a portable device.  On my daughter's tablet, which has expandable memory, we are able to download a lot more content and take it with us.  Entertainment is never out of reach, even without internet.  All in all, though, my kindle is easier to work, has a better screen, and is organized better.  Everything has drawbacks.I haven't found anything in the three weeks I've had my kindle fire that would make it anything less than a great value.  I definitely recommend this device.  It has been very helpful and entertaining.

Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Kindle Fire.  I have borrowed a book, downloaded Prime instant movies, and all works great.  The HD is very clear and wonderful. I love the size and convenience of being able to hold it easily in my hand and read a book on it or play games.  The 7" size is great.I was disappointed in the fact that the only way I can take pictures is with the single lens camera.  I was disappointed that I can't take pictures unless the screen is facing the object.  That is really awkward trying to take a picture of something other than myself. Play games, surf the web, listen to  tunes, watch movies, read books and magazines, etc.................  It does everything.The sound quality is quite good with the Dolby speakers.  The video display is really amazing.  My vision isn't so great, but the screen resolution makes it very easy to use.  There are lots of settings for the device as well as settings in the various applications allowing a great deal of customization.  It takes a little while to learn all the ins and outs, but once you figure out where things are, you can zip right along.  The Kindle Help Forum is a great place to visit to get your questions answered and learn all kinds of tips and tricks.I highly recommend the Kindle HD 7".

In all honesty I don't see what the big deal is about that. Yes there are ads, But you know it keeps the over all price down. I hardly see what the big deal is. at first I was a little off put but after using it for over a month I find that it really doesn't affect use at all. actually I have found the "recommendations" useful at times. However not coming with an adapter to plug it into the wall would be a bit difficult if I didn't have one from my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: We love the Kindle Fire 7" HD!!!

Reviews.Content: We bought two Kindle Fire 7" HD's for our sons who are 12 and 11 and they just love them! I own the KIndle Keyboard and love that also! I use the Fire when  they go to bed and I might have to get myself one soon since the boys don't really like to share!They do everything with this that you can do on an IPAD! I am so glad we decided to get them, if you are planning on getting one make sure that you buy the SquareTrade warranty when you purchase it, I forgot to get it and they only let you get it 30 days after you purchase it and I realized it too late. Anyway buy the Kindle Fire 7" HD you will LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: I love my Amazon Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Rama Rao "Rama"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this little devise for the last three weeks and loving every second of it. I bought this little gizmo for reading Amazon.com books, watching TV shows/movies, and downloading music. You need to have access to wireless internet or connect via Wi-Fi network to download books and music from Amazon.com. Watching streaming movies and TV shows needs wireless connection. In order to read books or listen to the music that is already downloaded on to your Kindle, you don't need to connect to the internetThe Kindle Fire HD has a great monitor and the contrasts and richness of the color makes things look more realistic and fun using it. The home screen features a list of items running across the top such as shop, games, apps, books, music, etc. A helpful carousel of icons shows you a list of items you've recently used or opened, so you don't have to dive back into the menus to look for it again. The Kindle Fire HD is running Android. Amazon has changed a few things from Android about how the operating system works. If you are looking for an alternative to the iPad or tablet, this is worth a try.  Kindle Fire HD is more a devise for media consumption than a tablet. This is sold at close to cost price but Amazon.com hopes to make up the difference by selling books, music, magazines, movies, and streaming TV shows. Access to certain cable networks is in the works, and the A&E; deal was cut few days ago.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Inez
Reviews.Content: Love LOVE it!  Just taking a bit to get use to since I've been on Apple products.  Looking forward to sitting down with my new kindle and finding new things!

Reviews.Title: WOW! Completely surprised! A GREAT first tablet!
Reviews.Author: gundeeosu1986
Reviews.Content: This was a family gift for Christmas and we have 2 boys, ages 7 & 8 and this is our first tablet.  Right out of the box I was surprised at how simple it was to operate and get used to the interface.  I purchased the 32 GB instead of the 16 because we would be using the Fire mainly for educational games and books.  I opted to get Amazon Prime as well around DEC 20 due to a late gift need that had to get here before Christmas.  Holy COW does that make a difference in content access!  I would highly recommend going with Prime for the sheer volume of free movies and TV shows you have access to.  I LOVE being able to pull out the Kindle Fire HD, access Amazon, find any item, order it and know I will have it in 2 days... and be able to do all that in under 5 min.  Oh yeah - AND watch all of the BBC Sherlock shows with a beautiful HD picture!Now for the device itself:The screen resolution is incredible - crystal clear.  Streaming video and app downloads are extremely fast.  There are a few lags with YouTube videos every once in a while but I would still give the speed 5 stars.  Touch sensitivity is excellent. The sound from the speakers is really nice - not tinny at all but could still use a bit more bass which really is a nit-picky comment because the speakers are the size of your thumbnail!  I have cranked it up to max with no distortion.One recommendation to Amazon and to new users:  DISABLE the predictive keyboard!!  What a frustration that has been!  Didn't really "catch" that it was turned on as the default which was VERY annoying because this setting carries over into EVERY APP and every website you try to access.  Amazon:  You should ship it with predictive turned OFF as the default.I had a feeling we would like the Kindle Fire HD a lot... did not expect how much I would LOVE this thing.  Home Run Amazon!  If you are looking to buy your first tablet, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: great gift

Reviews.Title: I couldn't be happier! :D
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I got a 7" 16 GB Kindle Fire HD for Christmas, and I couldn't be more pleased with it! First of all, as a self-proclaimed bookworm, I was a little skeptical at first to get an e-reader because I just love having the actual book in my hands! But, what's great about the Kindle is that you have all your books in one place on the go! I was planning on getting the Nook at first, but after the Kindle Fire came out, I knew it would be the better choice for me. I can store my iTunes library on it, my apps, photos, videos, movies, TV shows, and of course, books/magazines all in one little device! I would definitely recommend this product to a friend because I am in love with my Kindle! Reading on it is great too. I also like that I can get Wi-Fi and Pandora on it. It's great for doing research for homework as well because it's really compact and the internet is quick on it! I also think the battery life is really good and doesn't die out too quickly. Overall, a 10 out of  10 for the Kindle Fire HD; it's a great product that hasn't let me down!

Reviews.Title: love it!

It uses the same charger as my phone so it is easy to keep charged in the car or at home. Has good battery like for reading or playing games.
