Reviews.Content: Bought this for my eight year old. The whole family is enjoying it. Should have bought three more.  Excellent. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Just as hoped
Reviews.Author: Barn
Reviews.Content: Wanted primarily a reader as I have an iPad already.  Love my iPad and won't give up, but the weight of the kindle, clarity, and it's easy to order books from amazon have made it a favorite. Slips into purse nicely and not heavy. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Vivian
Reviews.Content: Love this. I gave it to daughter for Christmas. Faster, clearer than my non-hd fire.Just wish charging plug came with it, very inconvient. Had trouble with re-bootbut Amazon geek got it working in just a few mins via phone, thank you geekette

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: rob e
Reviews.Content: Using to somewhat replace a Samsung tablet(couple years old).  Talk about the screen clarity and good sound.  With the Prime this combo is fantastic.  Purchased 2,  and both family members are happy(i get the samsung now).  For a small device this is more than adequate for music listening quality but realistically I still use a stereo.  Teenager goes back to her room and likes the sound better than her MP3 speakers.  If music is what you like, really consider the Rhapsody app.  multi year subscriber to Rhapsody and the combo of the app and the device are great.Con:  only con is no wall charger included...foolishly purchased the amazon one but really don't need.  one family member uses and the other one uses one from other device..Both charge.Daughter considered this and the Google Nexus 7, after research and product comparisons she chose the fire.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sandra T. Seiler
Reviews.Content: It's everything I expected and more. Great deal for the price, does a lot more  than I ever expected. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Pretty incredible
Reviews.Author: Hrothmund of Astora
Reviews.Content: I already had the first kindle with no back light or color....what an improvement! The HD is amazing and very capable of watching full length movies on. I read quite a bit also and one thing i love doing with this kindle is running Pandora while reading a comic or book (love that you can do them at the same time). Reading comics is super convinient with the panel viewer which enables you to tap each panel at a time making it magnified so no more "i can't even read this" moments. Really nice product, no complaints. Everyone should have one.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Jean Guite
Reviews.Content: Gave the Kindle Fire HD 7" to my daughter for Christmas.  She was VERY surprised.....and yes she loves it!  :)

Reviews.Title: Ameswon Improvements
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Natale Jr. "Naguche"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife who wanted an upgrade from her Kindle Fire. She loves it! We handed down the Fire to the kids!

Reviews.Title: Can't Get Enough of Kindle Fire HD!!
Reviews.Author: Melissa R. Grams
Reviews.Content: I'm addicted to my Kindle Fire HD! It's an amazing product for the price. It's like having a miniature laptop that fits neatly in my purse. I thought I would never give up actually holding a book in my hands to read, but this has changed my mind. I still love books, but now my favorite books are going a shelf for display and my Kindle Fire is my constant companion!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: brian gilbert
Reviews.Content: love this product. the hd color is outstanding. i would recomend it anyone.  there is only 1 thing , it takes longer than expected to charge and does not indicate that its charging.

Reviews.Title: Hard to put down
Reviews.Author: KDM83
Reviews.Content: Got this as a cheaper alternative to a second iPad. So glad I did. I use mine for reading, games, movies, and internet. Never used any of the more expansive functions on the iPad so figured why pay the extra money for them. This does everything I want it to do and does it well.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: C. Crowson "cjcrowson"
Reviews.Content: It was the Kindle Fire HD or the Nexus 7 and we are big Amazon users so I went with the Kindle Fire HD and I am so glad that I did.  I love it.  It is easy to use and has a lot of great options.  I can connect with my local library and get free e-books that are for the kindle with no problem.  I got the free  month of Prime and we have watched movies, read books, magazines,  skyped, listened to music that I had transferred from my computer,  used the camera, dowloaded contacts, emailed, searched the web, bought from Amazon... Truly impressed with the device and the battery life, the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Does what its supposed to...
Reviews.Author: C. Sterling "conair"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great size, fast downloads, instant net flix watching, great web and free apps, music anywhere, nice speakers, has DOC support for word docs, HD really niceCons: Sometimes web pages dont allow all content, have to open the laptop only happened a couple of times

Reviews.Title: Greatest tablet!
Reviews.Author: Tbg2006
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my sister for Christmas she's 11 and loves to read and play games! It's perfect! So sleek and the quality is great the picture is so crisp and has many apps! I'm an amazon prime member and I linked her kindle to my acct where she can stream the instant videos straight to her kindle! The only downfall is it comes with no charger but it had a USB cord to hook up to her computer! Her regular phone charger is the same type so she was able to use her cell charger to charge her kindle or the USB can be plugged into the head of the iPhone charger and charge as well.I loved her kindle so much I decided to get the fire HD. I did a lot of research between the HD and the iPad mini and I kept coming back to the kindle! It does everything the iPad does and the pixel is actually better! The iPad mini is 129 bucks more and only has .9 inch bigger screen and the back camera. I didn't need the back camera I have an iPhone for pictures, besides it's pretty stupid to carry an iPad around taking pictures.Can't wait for my kindle fire HD to arrive! Hope this helps but I would def go with the kindle over the iPad!

Reviews.Title: oh my gosh!
Reviews.Author: Jasmyne Laryssa
Reviews.Content: i never knew how AWESOME a tablet would be! I am a paper book lover but have fallen in love with our Kindle.I bought this as a gift for my three kids (10, 7, 4) but have to confess that I am the one who carries it in my purse and watches videos before I fall asleep. The HD is fantastic and the wifi connection is zooming. The Prime feature is worth it because it offers some programming that is not on Netflix and plus there is free 2-day shipping  on Amazon purchases.Honestly here is the bottom line; I hate how technology tends to sperate us from the real world all the time. However, Christmas morning after my kids opened up their Kindle we drove over 2 hours back home. I had downloaded the book The Phantom Tollbooth (one of my favorites from childhood) and I read it to the kids the entire way home. We laughed, talked about the story and created a wonderful memory and THAT is why I give the Kindle 5 stars. It didnt take away from my relationship with my kids but enhanced it....and we can play Bad Piggies ;)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: gcchar
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift so I haven't used it much yet.  The online guide is very clear.  I wish I'd gotten one with more memory because after downloading some apps I don't have much time to play games or check email.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Michael Artz
Reviews.Content: Does an excellent job with books and email.  Web Browser is adequate but has some issues with some websites.  Overall an excellent product.  Good with movie viewing and cloud support.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C. Hammell "Carolyn C. Hammell"
Reviews.Content: I really do love it.  It book marks a place when I have to stop reading and is there when I come back.  A lot easier than carrying around a bunch of books!  The print is so clear even in dim lights.  It fits exactly in my purse so I can read while waiting in doctor's offices and for planes.

Reviews.Title: Amazon is the best!
Reviews.Author: Margaret J. Hall "dowehall"
Reviews.Content: As usual Amazon gives the best service and always has the best prices for whatever you chose to buy!  We love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: SC EReader
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is everything I expected it would be. It is user friendly and the size is one of its best features. I will highly recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Theresa Richey
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Love it!! Asked for it for Christmas  so my husband bought it for me. Loads of fun. Great sound and picture.Just wish it came with some apps already down loaded on it (such as games and books other than dictionaries)

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: pickle
Reviews.Content: Kid cant/wont put it down for fear someone else in the house will pick it up. May need to buy another.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jchaul "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 7" is fantastic. It's fairly easy to use and it's colorful and so much fun! I love being able to read at night without a light on. Also, the fact that you can change the background if you want. The only complaint I have is that there are no physical instuctions or guide. I had to ask my 14-year-old how to shut it off. And when you read a book it doesn't tell you how to get out of it. Once again my 14-year-old told me to tap the screen and that worked. (those items may just be my ignorance but none the less a little frustrating) But overall I really like it! I would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: My kids love it!
Reviews.Author: Natalie Renee Carlton
Reviews.Content: These were a huge hit on Christmas, the kids love them! They've already found tons of free apps and couldn't be happier

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Tina Van Leuven
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he loves it.  What a fantastic picture.  Fun to read on.

Reviews.Title: I barely use my laptop now
Reviews.Author: James Chadwick
Reviews.Content: wasnt sure if it would perform the day to day tasks as well as my computer, but I hardly use my computer now.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Arlene
Reviews.Content: I got it for myself, but my kids has taken over it, I may get another one. We all love it, use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: Maryann
Reviews.Content: My husband got this for me for Christmas. As usual I read all the reviews before asking for the Kindle Fire as it had the best reviews! What can I say? AWESOME comes to mind. This brings reading to a different level. I have to be "in the mood" to read and have several hobbies. In the past few years reading has taken a back seat to my other hobbies, interests. With the computers, ipads, iphones, games,facebook etc.. Hubby wondered if the Kindle Fire would be worth the money. Let me tell you, If I could I would give it more stars. Reading is so much more fun now, and yes, I am reading more. I can take it w/me anywhere and while waiting in doc office or anywhere, I just grab my Kindle Fire HD and start reading where I left off!!  Not only am I pleased over the things it can do. I am so glad I got the HD!  So cool !  I would recommend this in a heart beat, you will not be disappointed! So worth the money! (as a bonus Amazon has great customer service!!)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" 16 GB Review
Reviews.Author: housweet
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet that I've owned and kept. I previously had ordered a 10" Coby, but returned it because it lacked the Apps I was looking for. It also had a very week camera. This Kindle Fire HD is my second, as the first one had a defective camera. Amazon was great and sent me out a replacement in a couple of days. The base price of this tablet only covers the tablet and a USB cord. There is no USB home charging plug. You will have to buy your own case, screen saver, stylus, and a App to make the camera work. This was done to keep cost down and to make you purchase them through Amazon. Some of the items I purchased through Amazon, others I bought elsewhere. Amazon had a ton of Apps for this tablet, so there is no problem finding the ones you need. Some are free, others have a small purchase price. I'm totally satisfied with this tablet and received great reviews during my family Christmas party. Note: Some of the Apps like Facebook are limited and takes some time getting used to. I'm sure in time better Apps will be available for that and others. Netflix works great as does Pandora, Skype and the camera takes decent pictures. The battery seems to hold a good charge and drains according to what application your using. The unit seems to pick up the wireless signal with little problem. If you get the one with the advertising for $20.00 cheaper, it's no big deal as it's only on the backround when you go to unlock the tablet. It looks like a keeper to me. The only problem I have with Amazon is that they ship it in the manufactures box that's no bigger that the unit itself and leaves little protection for the unit. I believe that's why my camera didn't operate on my first one. So don't let the little things bother you and pick one of these up today, before the price increases.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Aaron Cooper
Reviews.Content: Very user-friendly, graphics seems great, moving between applications is easy. I've never had an Ipad, but I can't imagine spending almost twice the money for that when this Kindle seems like it has the same capabilities.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: jujushoes
Reviews.Content: Nice little tablet. Great speakers and hd picture! Don' t buy for the camera, really not very useful except to Skype.

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: Shelly Howard
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 year old son vs purchasing an IPAD, and he loves it!  i would have to say at this price point I would have like to received the wall charger with the Kindle Fire, its been hard keeping it charged.  He wants to play on it constantly, so the accelerated charger would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Great Price
Reviews.Author: R. E. Boris "videographer"
Reviews.Content: I have stuck with Amazon for years and they keep giving me solid reasons to feel good about my association. The Fire HD is great and makes me feel equally happy with my older Kindle too, (the first one, with the keypad). I use the new Kindle daily, but I use my older Kindle more now than before. I love to read and explore and now I have "two" ways to feed my habit!You are invited to compare and pick apart the details among the new crop of tablets out there all you want. I took my time and then chose with conviction.  I Pad is lovely but costly, and there are many others that seem to dazzle and also want my business and offer inventives. But I concluded that the Kindle Fire HD includes  the features I want (and can use), is smartly designed and is affordable, too.And, as I said, I'm already sold on the Amazon style of cyber business and feel comfortable looking to them,  first, for my online purchases. The new tablet just makes that association that much better.Its been nearly a month with my Kindle Fire HD, and there have been lots of questions, but so far all have been answered to my full satisfaction. In short:  I am 'not at all disappointed' with my purchase.  And I can be a real curmudgeon about stuff that doesn't measure up.How's that for an endorsement?Bob

Reviews.Title: Adding my five stars to a previously wonderful product, that has been improved to make it every bit better.
Reviews.Author: bookreader
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my kindle and feel the biggest noticeable improvement for myself was the addition of the dual-band wi-fi connection.  My prior kindle although wonderful had issues with keeping a clear connection in certain spots not so with this one.  Very happy that I switched over.  Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: kitty
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas and no regrets. I love it and she loves it. The quality of the HD is excellent.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Gloria Ducharme
Reviews.Content: Best Christmas gift i ever bought myself.way worth the price.Easy to operate and so much fun. I would highly recommend this purchase.

Reviews.Title: OMG...Talk About a Good Deal!!
Reviews.Author: Dwranny "Dwranny"
Reviews.Content: My grand daughter got this instead of the EXPENSIVE Ipad she wanted; but, let me tell you...she has NOT put it down since Christmas! She has customized it and started taking pictures...which are exceptionally clear and bright. There is a flash on it too! The size is appropriate and it has a great deal of FREE APPS on Amazon to download. Its not as fast as the larger Ipod or a computer; but the speed is not cheezy either. A cloud printer works well with this device too. I am glad she loves it and we found by comparing features of this tablet to the Ipad, we came out good! It serves our purposes with a portable hot-spot device and gives us that lightweight portability needed for home, fun, work, and school. Save the money and go KINDLE instead of IPAD...but then, again, that depends on your personal preference. In fact, I may be going out soon to get myself one! Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: OMG the best Kindle yet!!!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Berry
Reviews.Content: Crisp clear screen....very responsive, this is the best Kindle yet....I just got this for Christmas and I love it!!! I love how you can do WAY more than just read on this Kindle. You can do your email, Facebook, surf the web, listen to music, you name it, you can do it!!! This is the best product that Amazon has put out in the Kindle arena, and I am so glad that I got this baby!!!Christopher Berry

Reviews.Title: Why yes, I do get a new kindle every year!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: So, I had the first generation kindle.  I resisted the urge to buy the second one but then caved and bought the third e-ink one.  I still have that along with the first kindle fire, a kindle touch for my husband and now this new kindle HD.  I can say that yes, even though I own the first Kindle Fire I am happier with the new Kindle Fire HD.I cannot believe how crisp the screen is or how clear the movies are (yes, I have amazon prime so I get to stream those, plus the movies with the Netflix app).If you're going to just read books or magazines the last generation Kindle Fire works great.  If you're going to use this for more of a media tablet though then get the upgrade.  Just for the sound alone its worth the extra money.  That was the main thing that bothered me about the first gen Kindle Fire is while I had a beautiful color picture the speakers were weak and hard to hear.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Chasregis
Reviews.Content: Great tablet but didn't come with a charger.Purchased a charger on Ebay  for $2.95 ...problem solved!Don't know why it didn't  come with a charger?

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: juanr
Reviews.Content: I was a owner of the first Kindle fire, unfortunately it was stolen and Amazon was unable to replace it due to the fact that anyone can say such a thing and get a new Kindle for free. I understand though, I hold no grudge against them for that. I have just recently gotten this new Kindle and it is a stunning device. I have owned it for two days and during that time I have noticed absolutely no lag in the device or those pesky ' force closes'. Before I continue I would like to state that I am 15 years old (just in case any of you wonder if your teenager would like it) I am a heavy gamer but I also take my education very seriously. Yet another reason why my mother and brother decided to get me this device.When I first opened the box I immediately noticed it's sleek shape and larger boarders. Thank heavens for those, the grip is much easier and the smooth back keeps me comfortable during long periods of use. The system itself is exquisite. It moves smoothly and apps work wonderfully.Upon turning on the device after setup you can see ads on the screen. I honestly don't know why people complain so much about this. How long do you really look at your unlock screen anyways? Besides, the Ads are quit interesting if I do say so myself. Everything I had on my previous Kindle was found in my Cloud and I was extremely grateful for this, I didn't have to hunt everything down again. The camera is not as great as advertised but wonderful nonetheless. The power and volume buttons are indeed hard to press at times but it' s better then always accidentally turning off your device. At the bottom of your home screen you can see recommendations, I think that was a fabulous idea. I find books, games and apps much easier and more suited to me much faster then wondering aimlessly in the store.Next, the speakers. Amazon has the right to brag. My brother has an IPad 2 and even he was impressed by the stunning quality of the speakers. Clean, crisp sound without that annoying hiss you heavy in other devices. I honestly find' t expect them to be that good. It makes gaming and movie watching beyond amazing. I usually have an equalizer app I install to get better quality from my speakers in other devices but here, there was no need. The app actually made it sound slightly worse. It' s called Player Pro. Try it for yourself and you will see the difference. Theses speakers need nothing done to them whatsoever.The screen too amazed me. Once again compared to my brother's IPad I could see basically no difference. The HD display is crisp and bright. Colors are vivid and the darks are actually dark. When out in the sun the direct sun (Florida the sunshine state!) I could still see everything perfectly. Even though I could see many reflections on the screen the apps and books were still strongly visible.The original Kindled were all about books and I'm happy to announce that they still kept that same style going on. The books look stunning. The letters are so clear and there was no strain on my eyes at all, even when I was reading in the dark. The white on black feature helps make reading on the eyes much easier on those conditions.One thing I truly love is the Silk browser. Wow, it is fast! Even compared to my computer it was fast! Not even my mom' s Mac book pro could compare to it' s sperm! I do all my Internet surfing on the Kindle and I will continue to do so in the far future. One thing that bugged me about it though was the fact that I had to go through a different page to view my bookmarks. I would much rather go to it first but it's no biggie. Just one more click of a button.Also, on the home screen I really did like the swipe down for favorites but I suppose the bottom is better due to the fact that I can see it everywhere I go.The Kindle keyboard is a loveable yet frustrating thing at times. I personally like the layout and all but I have an issue with the auto correct. When I add a word to the dictionary and I spell the whole thing out I would prefer if it wasn't changed. This can hopefully be improved, it' s a small bug but very irksome at times.Now, back to gaming. I tried out the new Need for speed on the Kindle and was once again blown away. Graphics for almost every game was stunning. The speakers give a nice boost to overall improve your gaming experience along with the HD display. Also, the fact that apps don' t crash (none so far anyways) is just another reason to love it.Now, as a student I have a plethora of homework that has to be done. I' m not even going to bother going on my computer anymore. If you're even slightly tech- savy then you should have no problems doing your work on this device. The flash player is missed though, but once again no biggie. It can be downloaded from a third party source.As far as battery life goes, it' s great considering all the heavy use I do on this device. Just for today I was gaming (not those small little apps either, I was racecar driving!) watching videos a, on the Silk browser, reading and much much more. I got a good 8 1/2 hours on my device with auto brightness and never once turning off the WiFi. Also, speakers were on full blast.I am dissatisfied with one thing though. My charging cable does not work properly. When I first plugged it in it showed that It was charging then it wasn't then it was...you get the drill. At first I thought it was the charging port (thank God it wasn't' t) so I plugged and unplugged. still the same thing. I made sure everything was properly connected but alas it was the cable itself because I tried a different one. I am currently using the cable for the previous Kindle fire. I hope this can be fixed. I am going to call customer support and see if a new one can be sent in.Well, there you have it, a review from a teen's point of view. I hope this helped all the parents out there debating if they should buy this product.I am thoroughly satisfied with this product (the cable not so much) and I will update (if I figure out how) any problems or improvements that have been made to this device. Sorry for any grammatical errors you may encounter. I am still learning the ways of English and considering I wrote all this from my Kindle with this slightly bothersome keyboard please forgive me.

Reviews.Title: Reading again with the back light that helps aging eyes.
Reviews.Author: Beverly Breakey "Beverly Breakey"
Reviews.Content: Thank you for this product which will last me a lifetime. I enjoy reading at the end of my day, and now it's even more enjoyable

Reviews.Title: Great for what I was wanting
Reviews.Author: Lydia D
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift from my husbands parents.  I simply wanted a tablet to use mainly as an e-reader, but occasionally for games and internet access.  It is perfect for those purposes in my eyes.First, I love how easy it is to read books on the Kindle.  The contrast makes the words easy to read without straining your eyes.  Its the middle of winter here so I haven't had the chance to take it outside and see how much, if any, glare it has when read in the sun, but other reviews have said it is great in the sun.  My husband even said the books are much easier to read on the Kindle than on his I-pad.  The contrast simply isn't as great at he says reading on the I-Pad strains his eyes after a while. It also fits perfectly in your hand so you can hold it with one hand and use your other hand for other things, something an I-Pad is simply too big to do with.Internet access is great.  I've never used it off of my home internet, but it runs extremely well on there.  I don't do much on the internet so it does what I want.  I wish Facebook was easier to navigate on the Kindle, but honestly, I'm not that concerned about it.  If I need to I'll get on our desktop to see things clearer or a picture in larger form.  I don't use it to watch videos on the internet as I think the screen is too small for that being spoiled with a 55 inch tv.I enjoy playing games on the Kindle.  They look fantastic on the HD screen and they are a great time waster for me now that its cold and wintry outside.The Ads that everyone complains about don't bother me.  I never look at a lock screen longer than it takes to unlock the screen so they can put whatever ads they want there, I honestly will pretty much never see them long enough for them to register.  The suggestions everyone complains about at the bottom of the screen don't bother me at all.  They have actually helped me when I'm stumped as to what book or game to get next.  Its helpful since it suggests books in the same genres that I have been reading so I don't have to sort through all the books on Amazon to find the next book I want to read everytime I finish a book and haven't yet decided which book to read next.  I really think people are being too touchy when it comes to complaining about the ads and suggestions.  I really don't notice either unless I want to.The only downside I can think of at this time is the charger.  The one they give you is essentially useless.  I was going to buy the wall charger anyways, but while waiting for it to get to me, I had to wait 8+ hours for my kindle to charge to 80% from 30%.  Honestly I think that is deceptive and Amazon should be ashamed.  They should at least give you a USB charger that charges decently, especially for people going on long trips where a computer is the only constant source they have to charge their Kindle.  I hope Amazon rethinks this profit plan on their chargers because you should at least give people something that works.Overall I would recommend this product to others (In fact I already have to my mom).  Too many people are trying to compare it to the I-Pad, which it was never meant to be.  It is not an I-Pad nor is it meant to be in direct competition with them.  It is a great e-reader and perfect for people like me who don't do very many complicated things on the internet.

Reviews.Title: ROCKS!!
Reviews.Author: B. Kaiser "Miss Book"
Reviews.Content: Wouldn"t trade this in for anything in the world!! Best Christmas present I have EVER gotten! EVER! I love to read and it saves on money, gas, space on my shelves, but also has internet, games, books for my kids, movies, holds pictures and documents and a whole lot more, ALL IN ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Weekapaug Groove
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter. she loves it. I like the price of this tab, considering getting one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Christmas
Reviews.Author: Edward F. Manka
Reviews.Content: Great Gift for Computer Teaching Daughter.5 children in the family and third Kindle.Great shipping and fast.  Buyer in Pa. and daugher in NC no problems.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is great for the family
Reviews.Author: Alex W. Jackson
Reviews.Content: met expectations; good value at this price point. would recommend it to another - good display and sound, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: allison castro
Reviews.Content: Great product!  I love this gadget and look forward to spending more time on it to figure out what else it can do.  It would have been nice if a written manual would have been included as well!

Reviews.Title: Ipad Mini Challenge
Reviews.Author: Apple
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Fire HD. It is just as it is advertised to be and more. I ordered the 32 GB so I could download moremovies for traveling and the charge is longer than the Fire.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Anne Little
Reviews.Content: Love the size and convenience. It fits in my purse and is always with me. Books and movies readily available.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire is great
Reviews.Author: Tammy Briere
Reviews.Content: First time to own a kindle, Having a good time learning how use it and using it. Its easy to download the books from thelibrary. Having a good time watching the movies and TV shows.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade from my regular kindle because I got tired of straining my eyes to read since it has no back light.  This kindle is great and very easy to use.  I guess the only compliant I have is it's not as easy to see outside in the sun.  You get a lot of glare from the sun on the glossy screen.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: sonny
Reviews.Content: Great product. Girlfriend loves it. She is using it nonstop day and night. The graphics on it are excellent and it is fast and very responsive to the touch. I would recommend it as a gift for anyone. I will be buying a few more very soon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7
Reviews.Author: cmsmith65
Reviews.Content: It's ok...seems have to be charged way too often...Used for reading, and will watch movies now that I am member of Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: IT WAS BOUGHT AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY DAUGHTER AND HER FACE JUST LIT UP WITH THE BROADEST SMILE EVER, NEEDLESS TO SAY IT WAS PERFECT AND SHE LOVES IT.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: pattis
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on tablets before I chose the Kindle Fire HD. I am older, so some of the newer technology leaves me a bit confused, but it is so user friendly and FAST!!! I enjoy reading on it because I don't need any other lighting  and the font is so easily changed. I would recommend this product to everyone if you are looking for a good tablet.

Reviews.Title: Better than the original Fire
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this as a replacement for my original Kindle fire on the Geek Squad warranty. I am very happy with the Kindle Fire HD. The screen is vibrant, the speakers sound good (for a tablet), and I like the home-screen layout better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: V. Pfander
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD as an early Christmas present and I think it 's great. I have the original Kindle, and the Kindle touch and have always enjoyed them for reading. I decided to try the Kindle Fire so I could also play games, go on the internet, etc. There are tons of free apps. It's got a great picture for videos/movies and games. Also has great sound. I'm very pleased with it. My husband has an ipad, and the Kindle Fire HD is just as good, if not better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Sony Man
Reviews.Content: Great Product, was glad to get the extra GB to store more movies and songs. Be sure to get the extra charger with it

Reviews.Title: Bye Bye Paperbacks
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: OK - I was sure I would NEVER read a book not made of paper.  Was I wrong!!! This is the BEST.  I can read in bed and not disturb my hubby.  I also play games and am in the process of getting movies.  I also have young grandchildren who love to play the games.  I like this better than my daughter's IPad.  I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Amanda J Dodson
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle fire hd! I have played on it everyday since my husband got it for me for my birthday! I definitely recommend getting one if u haven't already!!

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Bill in Hawaii
Reviews.Content: The colors are bright, seems easy enough to use.Very surprised how sensitive to the touch it is.Just barely swipe your finger and it responds.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for an even better price!
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: WOW! There are many people on here that resemble one Mariah Carey, DRAMA QUEENS, that want everything perfect and want it now! The buttons are flush with the device, there is no charging indicator, geez, are you kidding me, whinners all of them. Want perfection, almost, go overpay for an iPad mini, you get a great device with great features, that has minor flaws in the Kindle Fire HD, for an even better price! It is virtually the same as the B&N; Nook HD, so I would recommend that as well, but this Kindle Fire HD is great!

Reviews.Title: love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Jill A. Folz
Reviews.Content: I took a long time researching different reader/tablets.  the kindle seemed to be the best fit for me because I use Amazon a lot.  I' m extremely happy with my choice.  I love the style, quality, speed, & feel.  I thought the ads might be intrusive but they are fine.  the screen & sound quality are amazing.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Got this for my 18 year old daughter
Reviews.Author: B. Bornschein
Reviews.Content: My daughter is a big movie and book fan and this Kindle Fire HD looks and works great for both! She LOVES it...I would definitely recommend to other people if you want a great tablet at an awesome price.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: judy s. harmon
Reviews.Content: I have the regular kindle with the keyboard. I wanted something I could do more with. I like to play games; it was difficult to do on the black and white kindle. I wanted High definition for games as well as wi-fi and a lot of memory. This covers both. The hi-def is great for videos and games.I hoped I could download videos and movies from my home with the 4g capability. I can only get dial-up service where I live so that really is disappointing. I still cannot download movies or videos at home. I need to go where wireless access is provided to download anything.I did not realize the movies stream instantly when you order; therefore, I am not able to keep obtain movies or videos unless I purchase them and download elsewhere.If anyone has any suggestions, please let me know. Also, I do not have a library where I live as it is a very rural area.I love the Kindle Fire HD anyway even though my use is extremely limited. I have a new grandson; can't wait to start downloading books to read to him. He is almost 4 months old and anything colorful catches his eye.All and all I say this is a great product. I'm still very happy with it.One problem I have noticed is it does not seem to react to your touch very well. I have used my index finger and tried a stylus; it doesn't  seem as sensitive to touch as say your cell phone or other touch sensitive electronics.

Reviews.Title: I'm so glad I bought this!
Reviews.Author: Velecia Anderson
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to have a tablet, but money wasn't available, so I purchased the Kindle to sort of take the place of the tablet.  I must say that I am very surprised in what I have.  I am truly enjoying my Kindle Fire HD!  The picture quality is the greatest!  There are so many features and apps, and I'm learning new things everyday!!!!  I'm soooo glad that I bought it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: My Constant Companion
Reviews.Author: Sloane
Reviews.Content: A year ago I thought e-readers were totally unnecessary. I love to read and read about 50 books a year. I was convinced holding the actual book was an integral part of the experience. In March of 2012, for my birthday, I received the basic Kindle. I never looked back. I LOVE e-readers. About two months later I bought myself the Kindle Fire.One or the other is always with me. I love the games. I love watching movies on it--another thing I thought I would never do. I love the ability to sync between the two.I have found no negatives with this product.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Susan Stalkfleet
Reviews.Content: The HD is great & sound too. Easy to use for everything, books, movies, games & web!!!!I would sugesting buyinh a HDMI mini cable to hook it to your HD TV for movie viewing at home so the entire family can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Great all-in-one device
Reviews.Author: Carol Smith
Reviews.Content: Met all my expectations. Easy to use, even for someone like me who is a little technology challenged. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Perfection in a small package
Reviews.Author: DJM
Reviews.Content: Combined with the Amazon leather case this is an amazing value.  Fast, functional, with a brilliant display, this new Kindle Fire HD is everything I need in a small easy to carry package.  Amazon hit the mark with this one.  Most of the android apps will work,  and perusing the  Amazon apps page a lot of them are free for the taking.  Battery life is good to excellent and the optional charger works well. The molded leather case is perfect and puts the Kindle to sleep when closed.  In summation a great buy for a top performing tablet.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: chad aiken
Reviews.Content: my wife absolutely loves her kindle fire hd. It was the best xmas gift for under $300,she cant put it down.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was going to get a Galaxy III phone - but realized, I don't really need a new cell phone, what I really wanted was something that would give me access to the internet, play music and carry books and games to keep me amused. Especially the books - I'd already purchased quite a few books that I read using Kindle for PC.  The thing is, I live in Peru, and it's difficult to find English language books here - so the Kindle did exactly what I needed, gave me a way to go lay in bed and read a few pages before I went to sleep.Also really glad I waited until there was one available with a camera!  Love that I can skype with my mom with it, and with the use of the proper apps, take pics and video.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: My husband got me a kindle as a 1yr wedding anniversary gift on 12/14/12 and I'm in love with it! I've been enjoying reading, watching YouTube, watching Netflix and surfing the web. Simple and easy to use with great capabilities. I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: My husband got this for me for my birthday last month, and I absolutely love it!  I can read a book, surf the internet, check e-mail, and play games all on this one handheld device!  The only downside is that because I'm on it a lot, the battery needs to be recharged frequently.

Reviews.Title: the greatest
Reviews.Author: Monica Michael "monica michael"
Reviews.Content: omg i brought this for my son and it is great ty amazon merry christmas as usual you live up to my expitations

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: MLW
Reviews.Content: I started out with my first Kindle last year. I got the Kindle Touch instead of this mainly because of the price difference. I am so glad I waited to get my Kindle Fire this year. A few people I know had the first one and it was nice, But this one is way nicer in my opinion. I did have a slight issue with it at first however. I bought one at Best Buy and within a few days I had a screen issue even though I had hardly used the thing and was really careful when I did. I called Amazon the same night and it was immediately resolved. I had a brand new one within 2 days of my call, and all I had to do was send in my defected one with a shipping label that they paid for. The new one has been working great with no issues at all and I couldn't be happier. I had considered trying a Nook HD before buying this just to give it a try and, I will never buy a tablet or e reader from any other company after the great service I received from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Buy at least 2 of these!
Reviews.Author: Book Worm 101
Reviews.Content: Well, I really wanted the Kindle Fire HD because it has everything the Kindle Fire SD lacked.  Even though I'm a Prime Member, I was too impatient to wait 2 days or 1 day shipping from Amazon, so I went to my local Best Buy to purchase the Kindle Fire HD.  I was a little skeptical about the quality of KF HD.  I was blown away when I started using the KF HD!  The sound & picture quality is incredible!  The buttons for volume and power are hard to feel but that became a non issue once I put the Amazon case on it.  Everything on the KF HD works great.  We use Skype on a weekly basis with no flaws. I love the IMDB integration on the KF HD (I've been referring to that website for several years).Kindle FreeTime wouldn't set up the correct way, so I contacted Amazon Support.  I had to reset my KF HD in order for the FreeTime to set up parental controls.  So, far FreeTime works great.  My 3 year loves when he is on "His Kindle".  I have my other 2 kids with their own profiles as well.  The time limits allows them to have to share.  Once their time is up, the kindle FreeTime locks them out and they tell me so I can activate the next child's profile. The Kindle FreeTime comes with set items that you can take off depending on your child's age or gender.  My kids enjoy playing games that we play (where's my water, free flow; etc) and I added those games to each child's Free Time (which I already had on my account.)  Keep in mind that once you deactivate your FreeTime, you do not have access to the set items unless you already have them on your account.I don't read books on my KF HD, I prefer to read books on my Kindle Ink Reader.  I read daily for hours and love to get lost into a book.  And the ink reader feels like a physical book.  When reading on the web on the KF HD, I find myself zooming in to read.The only (personal) problem, is that I had to share my KF HD with my husband!  Ummm...He took it all the time!  I had to ask to use my own Kindle!  I will be purchasing another KF HD for my kids.I am an Apple Girl (for 3 years)  and a Amazon Fanatic >>(for 9 years now!) and I think that the KF HD is a solid, affordable tablet that is great for kids and adults.  With that being said, I purchased the iPad Mini the day it was released and I love it!  I love that all my apple products sync together.  I had to put all my notes, reminders, lists; etc. that I had on my iPhone into the KF HD; which was more work then checking back between my devices to make sure I had everything.  I prefer the iPad mini but that is just my personal taste.  Both the KF HD and iPad mini are great devices just different depending on what you are using it for.  If you are a business person, then I can tell you that the KF HD is not for you.  Try other Tablets that will fit your needs.For the price, Kindle Fire HD is very affordable for those who are Budget Savvy.  I don't like the whole Apple vs. Amazon's debate.  Both are solid tablets and I love both Companies.  I totally recommend the a Kindle Fire HD over those kid based learning devices that cost the same as the KF HD!  The KF HD has everything those devices have and more!  As a mom of 4 kids; ages 12 & under, I can tell you that kids will eventually get bored of those kid learning devices or out grow them.  Kids will not have that problem with KF HD because there is unlimited learning available and it is displayed on a beautiful HD screen with vivid colors.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: WILLOW
Reviews.Content: I have only had the Kindle Fire HD for 2 days but I love so far, if anything changes I will update.  I ordered it directly from Amazon and received it the very next day which I thought it was extraordinary!  The only thing I had an issue is I had to spend an extra $20 for the plug in charger (usb plug to attached to a computer for charging was included with Kindle) when my plug in charger for my phone worked for it perfectly so I basicly bought it for nothing, it would just cost more to send it back so nothing I can do do I'll save it for an extra, I just don't think it should've have been a separate charge, no other electric items I have ever gotten sold the charger separately but what can you do, right!?!  Otherwise I am a happy camper!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Ken Ura
Reviews.Content: Terrific product.  Extremely easy to set up and use. Video quality excellent.  Linked automaticaly with the content from our older Kindle.  Exceeded all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: cool technology - great price
Reviews.Author: Barbara E. Kruger "Babskin"
Reviews.Content: For my purposes, I can't see why I would buy any other tablet.  Completely satisfied at this point.  Only problem is short battery life.

Reviews.Title: BEST YET!
Reviews.Author: Ciara
Reviews.Content: Everything is great about this kindle. This is my first touch device and I love it! Great sound. Great picture quality. Easy to use. And, kindle freetime unlimited for my kids goes beyond anything I've seen thus far. I'm so in love with. I primarily use it to read books and play music. The web is great also! Oh yeah, looking into being a Prime member. The free month was AWESOME! I miss it! I enjoyed having access to a many of FREE movies and tv shows...

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Biro
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kindle Fire HD!!! I loved my first Kindle Fire but the speakers were horrible. I do use mine more for viewing videos and movies so sound is very important for me. The new Fire HD has an amazing pic, and great sound!!!! Glad I upgraded!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: This is such a great price for the amout of stuff you get. Fast internet, downloads, great HD picture and a ton of apps and games.  I love this and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Price
Reviews.Author: Rawle Hedrington
Reviews.Content: once again got to love amazon for selling a tablet with great features for under 200 dollars. a great gift for anyone

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Regina Roberson
Reviews.Content: Love it. Glad I purchased the H D. Read reviews and it's what I expected and more. I am an avid reader but this device has more functions useful for the entire family. Hope you enjoy yours.

Reviews.Title: Given as gifts.  They loved them.
Reviews.Author: nikki stewart
Reviews.Content: Given as gifts.  Everyone loved them.  Use them all the time for all kinds of things.  Would give more as gifts.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Ron "kroywr"
Reviews.Content: The new kindle fire is more than worth the investment.  The HD and dolby sound give a superior table experience

Reviews.Title: Kindlw fire HD
Reviews.Author: R. Gregoire
Reviews.Content: It is a great product as a christmas present for my wife. This will replace a kindle touch that she now uses.

Reviews.Title: Bargain
Reviews.Author: S. Turner
Reviews.Content: I did research before i choose the Kindle Fire HDi do have a Kindle Touch 3G already,i really like theeasy start up and go abilites it has so far.Everything seems exceptional especially theDolby Audio its better than my Laptop.I strongly recommend this for anyone thatwants to upgrade their Kindle, or just doesntwant to pay the price for a Ipad!

Reviews.Title: great item for the money.
Reviews.Author: R. Bozzuto
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the kindle fire. I don't use my laptop that much anymore as the kindle does pretty much everything. I wish I was able to have a wireless print option. It doesn't use flash either which is a drawback. I didn't want something big and clunky such as the Ipad. You put it in your coat pocket and nobody would even see it I usually keep the case on mine but its still hardly noticeable.It does tend to hang up from time to time which isn't usually a big deal. I just restart mine or sometimes it needs to be turned off for 1-2 minutes.The use of media is great on the kindle although I cant run netflix for some reason but it's not a biggie since I recently purchased a wdtv unit in my bedroom. Id rather watch movies on a larger screen anyway.I love the autocomplete feature when I'm typing it makes typing a snap.  It uses the same feature when you search the net.Its similar to using a smart phone since it uses droid tech which is great.Its great for keeping at your bedside when you want to look at email, Facebook, ebay etc. If your looking for an alternative to the ipad take a 2nd look at the kindle.

Reviews.Title: I'm really loving my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Wes Nestor
Reviews.Content: Never had a kindle before. The video and sound are amazing for such a small thing. I just wish I could get more than one book a month from the free library.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Kim V
Reviews.Content: Why did I wait so long to order one of these! I love my Kindle Fire! The quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Michael Mattivi "PM Mike"
Reviews.Content: Love this product.  It does everything my sister's IPAD does but it is easier to carry and costs half as much.

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Patty Rose
Reviews.Content: Received this as a gift from my husband.I Love it. Movies play without skipping. Lots of apps and free games and books to download. The font size is great giving many choices.I would highly recommend. I ordered a case and will review when I use it some.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the best
Reviews.Author: Larry C. Copeland "copelarry"
Reviews.Content: I have seen alot of other peoples tablets of all different brands.  The Kindle Fire HD is by far the best I've seen and I'm so glad I chose it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Hiromi Capelle
Reviews.Content: I was scared to purchase but I took a chance and now I'm very happy I did.  My wife and I both love it and were both over 60 years old.  I was able to connect it to my computer using my router.  I did not have to pay anything extra and feel very comfortable using it.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire, and I gave this one as a gift.  It works well and the person who received it, loves it.

Reviews.Title: Great new toy
Reviews.Author: lynette oerther
Reviews.Content: I had no idea what to look for when I was purchasing this item.  After consulting some more tech savvy friends, I decided this was the right purchase.  The only thing that my husband wishes for is that it would support one of the Adobe services.  He was unable to access something that needed it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely surprised at the quality of product.
Reviews.Author: rita moore
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my son as a birthday present and after seeing all that it can do and the capacity that it has, I'm really sorry I didn't get one for myself. :)  Will have to later!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire hd!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Schroeder
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love it.  Easy to use, clear screen, great sound, and is the perfect size to hold without tiring or take on the go.Only problem is my kids like it too and I don' t like to share!

Reviews.Title: Better than I imagined...
Reviews.Author: HRN "~ heather"
Reviews.Content: It's so pretty - I won't share it with anyone!!! I look forward to getting really into using it.  So far the only problem I have had is with youtube :(

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product without Qualifications
Reviews.Author: LG
Reviews.Content: Referencing the Kindle Fire HD 7", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB  -  This latest purchase, for my lovely bride of 35 years, is an outstanding tablet-product.  Although many of my friends use either iPads or Samsung tablets (one uses a Nook), I can find no significant differences or deal breakers, excepting as noted in this review concerning devout Apple users.  So, as a semi-technical consumer:1) the quality and build is great and it feels very solid;  2) reading books and full-color magazines is easy on the eyes, even in widely different lighting conditions, and navigation tools are well thought-out;  3) streaming movies (we use Amazon Digital Library movies, Amazon prime movies, and Netflix movies using a wireless “G” home network via Verizon FIOS internet connection) is trouble free on this Dual Band Wi-Fi unit (just as seamless as on our TV/Roku combo) -- meaning no dropouts or buffering issues during HD throughput—even when streaming movies to 2 devices in our home ;  4) the screen appears very sharp, with really good color and contrast, and runs without hesitation (redraw speed?—I’m not sure of the correct term).  To my eyes it clearly appears to be TV-HD quality (perhaps due to the size difference compared to a TV) and is a pleasure to watch.  5)  The sound, using either the built-in speakers or a Pro35 headset is outstanding considering that this is a hand-held device!  Great technology here!  6) The new Fire Main Menu system works fine, but is a significant change from prior Kindles.  I believe that the older Amazon “Collections” menu option should be immediately integrated into the this new system to get up to only 4 stars on this single feature—Major Menus.  However, Amazon, along with every other manufacturer, should be chastised for allowing hundreds of digital books and other media access on handheld devices without a robust, extremely SORTABLE-BY-USER-CHOICE, directory-type system.  Each user has reasons for looking up books and movies by category, type, year, size, etc., and no one has developed a great menu system with multiple lookup-sort choices that seem to sort well.  The stop-gap measure seems to be the ever-present “favorites” item on everything.  This isn’t a deal breaker, but I’ll withhold praise until a User Group moves Amazon to upgrade this wide-spread annoyance on their line of products.Using only a few game apps, maybe 500+ books, and various sources for streaming movies, I’m unsure of the need for 32 GB.  The 16 GB may have been fine, but there was little price increase between the two, and upcoming apps may make amount-of-memory an issue, so I opted for the 32 GB.From my experiences, I know that there are many different, and widely known technical specifications that favor an Apple product, Samsung product, Nook, or a Kindle to a technophile.  And, I certainly understand someone knocking all Kindles if they are Appled up (iMac, iPads, iPhones, Apple Movies, etc.).  However, the greatest value for my money — returning a high-quality product that satisfies common uses for the dollars spent — has been in the Kindles.  The Fire HD continues this assessment.My bottom line:  If the user-valuable technological advantages indicated a move to an iProduct or a Samsung, I would have done it at this point.  Vast choices of streaming video, and loads of free books, are potentially available for every major platform.  However, I found this product was excellent for my purposes and I would purchase another Kindle Fire HD again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Lady of leisure
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with my kindle after returning an HKC tablet I bought from Walmart for exactly $94.01 less. I had something to compare my new kindle, I mean it was a cheap ridiculous tablet as oppose to say an Ipad but still. My main purpose of getting a tablet is firstly, to watch movies on the go (my commute is about 4.5 hours a day). Reading books, listening to music/audio books, browsing the web all come second. I initially bought the HKC tablet to buy movies from google movies to download and watch later. BIG MISTAKE. Google is still having problems with that app working on some of it's tablets. Being that I already have amazon prime and tons of TV shows/movies on my cloud, it made sense to chalk up the extra money to get a kindle. I got the kindle Saturday, it's Monday and I think I spent the entire weekend reading, watching movies etc without leaving my house once. The fact that I can also shop buying anything from cat food to biscuits using my kindle is an additional bonus. The clarity and sound from this little gadget? Amazing! The ease to shop or browse? Wonderful. I read some reviews that mentioned the tablet not being easy to navigate but for me I didn't find it to be the case. It is similar to using a MAC vs. a PC- I mean, you're used to your apps being set up a certain way but Kindle's unique to kindle. True, I prefer to create folders of apps I use frequently, combining similar ones e.g my games in one folder on my home screen because I'm anal about organization. Kindle doesn't let you do that and it took a little getting used to. I think the only con for me at this point is that the apps amazon offers doesn't compare to the google ones. Not even close. It's an annoyance in a way but I still have my smartphone with android OS so that takes care of that. Barring that, the kindle is close to being my one-stop shop, exactly what amazon intended. I'm hooked and this thing is 'my preeeeeccciiioussss" <-(in my best gollum voice)ETA:(12/19/12) I figured out how to get my beloved apps from Android on to my Kindle which makes this lil' technological contraption exceptional for what I need. I'm hooked.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: DI
Reviews.Content: I bought two of this item for my boys in order for them to have their own tablet and at same time reduce the pressure on my ipad. For a price of just $199 and for what it is loaded with, i think this is the tablet to beat. It is easy to use,has a lot of  great applications you can purchase for it and is a great tool for reading.I will surely recommend this item for any person wanting to purchase a tablet.As at this time, my kids have not be able to determine if the  kindle has a blue tooth.One of the dislike is it has no blue tooth capability, though this does not take away anything  from it's functionality.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Jessie Contreras
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. It is fast and light weight. I would recommend it to anyone to have as an iPad alternative.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: jodom51
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter as a gift and she was in heaven.  Great company while she waits on her husband at train station.  Loves to read and play games on it.

Reviews.Title: I Like It
Reviews.Author: Laura T.
Reviews.Content: It's a really great alternative to other tablets. This version is a lot more ad-heavy than its predecessor. There are ads on the home screen, any time you scroll through your gallery. It makes it very easy to purchase things on Amazon (good or bad).It has really great speakers and graphics. I love the audio book capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the little things
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HD!  For web browsing and buying movies it has replaced my laptop.  I plan to transfer all of my music from my iPhone to my kindle fire which will take away the need to use my iPhone to listen to music at my home.  I also have yet to use the mini HDMI port to stream movies directly to my TV.  I will update this post after I have done this.  For my needs I would take the Kindle Fire over the iPad.  This is because I have a laptop that functions for work and other high end computing.  The Fire I use for media purposes that do not need a lot of power that is offered in far more expensive iPad.  Also the size of the Dire is much more appropriate for my uses.  I will say however I prefer to use my kindle touch as an e reader because the kindle touch is much softer in the eyes.  The Fire HD in all of its glory is still like reading off a computer screen which I do all day at work.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: darla
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my mom. She loves it. I was worried it would be too complicated for her, but she has picked up on the programming quite fast and has had no trouble with it. I have the 1st Gen Fire and she has learned tricks and tips that I cannot use mine. I did order it without the special offers.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Shanan Winters
Reviews.Content: After receiving a broken Nook HD, not being able to get another because they had no stock, and then going through a nightmare return process, I decided to jump ship and go with the Kindle for my daughter.  She LOVES it.  I do wish it had the multi-profile settings out of the box like the Nook (instead of having to install the Free Time app... which was annoying).  But that hasn't been a hinderance.  The screen is bright, the battery life is long and the book & app store is easy to navigate and purchace from.  I'm considering getting one for myself now :)

Reviews.Title: A Real Hit
Reviews.Author: J. Fuller
Reviews.Content: I have pretty much purchased every version of the Kindle except the 4G versions.  I had several concerns with the original 7-inch with the well known W-fii issue.  By now I assume that was long resolved and so when the newest HD was offered I purchased it.  Two problems right away,  1 of which Amazon support helped me fix quickly.  Thanks Amazon support.For whatever reason, often when I went to check my email it was show a connection failure error.  I repeatedly would delete and reestablish only to come back later and find this message.  I'm not sure what the problem is but I returned this to Amazon during the return period.  I purchased an 8.9 inch and so far we haven't identified this problem.  Feeling a little more confident I picked up another 7 inch now and am testing.  Overall though I have to say I'm sold on Amazon and the way they stand behind their products and support.I do highly recommend these devices but to get the most you really need to be a PRIME member.

Reviews.Content: I own several different devices including the new Nexus 7, the latest iPod touch and a generic Android tablet.  The Kindle Fire HD is my favorite. Reviews.Title: Love it! VPN works with the Kindle Fire HD if you know how to
Reviews.Author: IndieHeart
Reviews.Content: I have lived with my new Kindle Fire HD for about a week now and can say that I am very well satisfied with my purchase. I chose the Fire HD over the Galaxy Nexus because I was looking for an inexpensive media tablet to have fun with. I spend my entire day doing technical support work and don't want to do it when the day is done, so I wanted something that doesn't require any level of geekery to operate. Because I am a Prime member, I was also attracted by the Kindle Lending library and easy streaming of Prime Video.Will it go everywhere with me when I'm not planning on needing to do any work? Yes. A hearty yes. I need books everywhere I go! (My iPhone is fine in a pinch when I need to pick up a Kindle book, but not for long periods of reading). I am also able to sideload my own videos for those times when I will not have a wifi connection for streaming. Fantastic screen with excellent resolution, even at an angle, so viewing doesn't have to be a solo endeavor.Absolutely fantastic sound! I am so glad that I got the Fire HD instead of the basic Kindle. I hate wearing headphones. The sound is not only full for something coming from such small speakers, but the volume you can get out of it is substantial. I can hear over my treadmill and from several feet away when I set it up to stream video while my TV screen is occupied with WII step aerobics.The new gen Kindle Fire HD also supports VPN. Kinda sorta. So let me give you a tip on the VPN support...except for Cisco AnyConnect, at the time of this writing, the VPN clients available in the Amazon store for the Kindle do not work with the Kindle Fire HD (yes, even though it leads you to a long list of VPN apps when you go to Settings > Security > VPN). AnyConnect is a great app, but it only works with Cisco routers, which are usually used in a corporate environment. If you use an online VPN provider, you will need a non-proprietary VPN client.I spent hours looking for a VPN client that doesn't require root access to the device and finally found FEAT VPN. It is not available in the Amazon store. Do yourself a favor, search for it on the web, install it, and go. You'll save lots of frustration if you don't have to install and uninstall all the possible options in the Amazon store. You will need the certificates (the same ones used by OpenVPN) from your VPN provider during setup. If you use HMA for VPN, I let them know and they updated their wiki, so they even have the steps laid out for you there.I got the chance to use Skype with it the other day and found it adequate to the task. I have never been able to use Skype well on my wifi at home on either my iPhone or my netbook. Too much buffering would generally put a kabosh on it. However, the dual wifi on the Kindle Fire really makes a difference.I am also digging the text to speech for books. I find it annoying when I have to put down a book to do the dishes, etc. Not anymore. My bathroom hamper serves double-duty as a Kindle stand so that I can read in the bathtub. My life is now perfect :-)Will I be taking the Kindle instead of the netbook when I need to be able to do work when I am traveling? No. Even with the very nice bluetooth keyboard I purchased for the Kindle, I would not want to write a long document with it. Remote access to my home PC (yes, there's an app for RDP access) is also terribly slow. Do not expect a Kindle to take the place of a laptop. It is fantastic as a media table, but it was not designed (and can not be expected to) replace a PC.Recommended apps to make your use of the Kindle Fire even better:ES Task Manager to quickly close your running apps if the unit starts processing slowly (because apps continue to run in the background after you close them like all Android devices)Dolphin Browser (has Flash support -- I like it better than the Silk browser)You may want to check out SnapPea for alternate app store and device backup

Reviews.Title: This machine will change your life..
Reviews.Author: Wayne "I never studied while in college. I ju...
Reviews.Content: Hereafter in this review, I will refer to the Kindle Fire HD 7", which I have recently purchased, as the "KFHD".BE AWARE (as I was NOT, which caused me to to buy, and then have to return for replacement, several items): the "Kindle Fire" and the "Kindle Fire HD" are two different machines that require their own specifically designed cases, screen protectors and other "accessories". Just be aware of which version the accessory is made for.This is really one of the most exceptional pieces of electronics that I have EVER owned.It does SO many things, right out of the box: you can read books (books download in seconds), listen to music (songs download in about 5 seconds), use email, subscribe to magazines, watch personal videos, watch movies(stored on your device or stored on the internet), make Skype phone calls and Video Calls, listen to Audiobooks, shop at Amazon, surf the Internet, store and look at your personal photos, and look at your personal Microsoft Office documents, PDF's and other file formats. Amazon Prime customers can "borrow FREE books", watch a limited number of free movies and TV shows.THEN you start adding apps to give further functionality to your KFHD, MANY of which are free ... or have free versions. The KFHD is an Android operating system Tablet Computer and therefore the number of "Apps" available to expand the functionality of the KFHD is just astounding.Most "paid" apps are only $0.99 ... although I DID pay 4.99 for Microsoft Office Pro which allows me to edit MS Word documents, MS Excel spreadsheets and  Power Point presentations. I've given my KFHD the ability to take handwritten notes, be an alarm clock, play games, be a calculator, have a calendar scheduler, play chess, turn into a still camera AND a video camera, be a stopwatch/timer, look at the weather, and display information about the signal strength of available WiFi hotspots. And I've JUST begun, as I've only spent about $10 on apps!!!Much of what the KFHD does requires a WiFi hotspot. So I bought a WiFi hotspot device and subscribed to a 4G network. So, I am now in CONSTANT contact with the internet. and am just astounded in what a difference this haS made to my life. I live in an EXTREMELY rural area. It is 10 miles to the nearest McDonalds which is the only place in more miles than that that has a WiFi hotspot. I used to store ALL of my books on my Kindle Keyboard. Now, I read a book and delete it. If I decide that I want to read it again, I simply tap on the book and it downloads in seconds and I can read it again.Many Kindle books are now linked to Audible books. So you can visually READ your book while it is simultaneously being read to you with the text being spoken being highlighted in a light gray.The sound of the KFHD is much better than my Kindle Keyboard, but if i am SERIOUS about listening to my music, then I use the 3MM Audio Out plug to plug into my 130 watt per channel Kenwood with four foot speakers and rattle the windows. The KFHD plays MP3 files which are digital ... like CD's ... so the sound quality is nothing less than astonishing. I've even bought portable external speakers to go with my KFHD and MP3 file player.Which Leaps and Bounds cheaper than the Apple iPad, this machine is a fair chunk of money. You will DEFINITELY want to buy a case for YOUR KFHD. Also, a stylus is a VERY desirable accessory ... unless you particularly LIKE wiping your greasy fingerprints off the screen.The 16GB model is $200 and the 32GB model is $250. The larger KFHD has other options and is accordingly more expensive.Speaking of memory, this is the ONLY real complaint I have about my KFHD ... In fact, I consider this to be a SERIOUS oversight on the part of Amazon. NONE of the Kindles have a slot to plug in a SDHC memory card ... like the NOOK Tablet does. I can DEFINITELY see a use for such a card. Movies are BIG files and a memory slot in which you could select which of your memory cards to plug in would be very nice ... VERY useful, and is the ONE SINGLE thing that keeps me from giving the KFHD a full five star rating. Without a doubt, I feel cheated over the lack of such a slot.Don't hesitate ... go get one NOW. You WON'T be sorry. Make a change in your life!I just wish it had a slot for a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Got as a gift

Reviews.Content: I got it as a gift, And was thinking it would be a waste.How wrong I was I love it and can't put it down.I have a great computer, it's a Mac book pro (loaded.And yes there's times when I need to use it, but for the most part my kindle does most everything I need to do. and it's nice n small EZ to carry.if you're thinking about getting one, get it you'll love it

Reviews.Title: Kindle First, Tablet Second
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If you buy this device with the expectation that it's an ebook reader and video player first, and a tablet second, you will like the Fire HD. If you want a fully customization Android tablet with access to Google Play and full integration into the Google ecosystem, you will be disappointed. This is not the tablet for you.This is a Kindle after all, and it excels at providing a good reading experience. The display and video quality are top notch. The Amazon appstore had a good selection of apps and just about everything you'll want is there - as long as you keep your needs simple.For me, I use it most for reading and watching video. Besides that, the web browser is decent and I use Facebook, Twitter, email, and Google Reader. For these basic tasks it works just fine as a tablet.Built quality is excellent and the battery life is good.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Larry W. Thompson
Reviews.Content: From the limited time I've had to work with my Kindle, I'm extremely pleased.  The graphics are awesome, the size and weight is just right, speed is phenomenal.  My wife is jealous and she has an iPad 2.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD is a delightful user experience
Reviews.Author: Blueberrymom "Kate"
Reviews.Content: I think in this day and age of everything being reviewed everywhere - from hotels to technology gadgets to doctors - you'll find a lot of nitpickers out there, so it's tempting to be concerned that a product isn't everything it is hyped to be. But in the case of the Kindle Fire HD, it's just a terrific device. I don't understand the naysayers. This has to be the best $200 I've ever spent. Even my husband who spent north of $500 on his iPad has a tech crush on my Kindle Fire!I'm a mom of young kids, and the "Free Time" program is perfect for managing my children's screentime, which I limit carefully. This feature alone - combined with its price point of only $200 - is the reason a mom should consider the Kindle Fire over and iPad (for the Dads) or the Google tablet (for gamers). I can set an allotted time by child, and I can pick which games and apps the child can use during that time. There are no more tantrums or fighting over the iPad - and what a welcome relief that has been.I used to haul a laptop upstairs wrap up the day's work and web surfing, and now I just tote my Kindle Fire tablet up instead. There's something nice about not having your work laptop tethered to you 24/7. The Fire keeps you connected but isn't ringing like a phone and isn't reminding you of work. It's an entirely pleasant experience.I'm an Amazon Prime customer so this is a dream to me. I order whatever I want with such ease - who has time to boot up a laptop when you just need to buy something quickly?I look forward to future enhancements of this device. In the meantime, I will be buying my mother one for Christmas because she's interested in a tablet but she's overwhelmed by the iPad.The Kindle Fire HD hits all the right notes; I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Compared to the old kindle fire....
Reviews.Author: cloudi
Reviews.Content: I got the old kindle fire as a gift a few days before this one came out.. I obviously returned that one and purchased the new one. This is a MAJOR upgrade.  It is so much faster and everything just looks and sounds better.  I enjoy it because I like Amazon.  I like to be able to shop and download music from there because they usually have the best price and if they don't, it's only a matter of time before it goes on sale! I use my kindle to read, shop, use some apps, and watch netflix and videos.  For all of those functions, I love it! I wouldn't recommend it if you were looking for a tablet pc to edit documents etc. This is more for entertainment purposes and you're basically buying into the ecosystem that Amazon offers, which is much better deals on everything! I also own an Iphone and you can just download the music to your computer and add it to your itunes.  I would much rather go through that process than waste extra money on overpriced music and videos! If you're a frequent Amazon-er, I would recommend getting a kindle over something else. :)

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Aidan
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a gift for my aunt. It is a huge improvement over the original Kindle Fire. Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good book reader and something to surf the internet as well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Content: I love this thing.  Better than the Original.  Well worth the price compared to other tablets of this size.  The HD quality is amazing

Reviews.Title: Amazing

Reviews.Title: Love it!

I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: What a Wonderful Gift for ANYONE who reads
Reviews.Author: J crump

Then one day I not only looked at the kindle but read all about it and decided to try it out.  Best decision I made all year. But downloading to my computer and then transferring to the kindle was very easy.Wi-fi access is great. Didn't need my laptop when traveling - the kindle more than filled the need for access to my e-mail and internet.  This is a great gift for the reader in your life.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
