It has an android OS, but incomplete, cant' even play SWF/ Flash video  or animation from websites.You cannot organize books into categories, nor share from personal docs, nor copy and paste for your own records info from books, nor from yourpersonal documents transferred into kindle.Only three options for reading pane, would like to have a blue (or darker type) print on black background for easy on eyes effect,  paperwhite much better for reading, except no color, no audio,  is slow and does not allow copy and paste.I am disappointed, especially when there are tablets for ~$200 now days that will offer the same kindle reading program, plus the other benefits of a full Android OS 4.0

Reviews.Title: You want the HDMI port!  Spend the extra -- get the HD!
Reviews.Author: Rene Rains "Rene Rains"
Reviews.Content: Being an iPhone owner, it took me some adjustment to get used to how the Fire works organizationally (Amazon's Carousel was totally foreign to me), but now that I've had my HD for a few months, and I am really enjoying the heck out of it!  The image quality is so SHARP that if it was on a big screen, it would look real.  The sound quality is so clear and distinct that at times it sounds like it's coming from behind you, or beside you, rather than just from the device (the tiny speakers have a bigger volume than my Toshiba laptop).  My favorite quality, though, is the ports.  I spent about $6 and ordered a cable from an Amazon vendor so I could plug it up to my HDMI port on my TV.  It is so much nicer watching a video on the television where everyone in the room can watch it with you.  If you do this, MAKE SURE you buy a cable that is MICRO PLUG (not macro -- there is a difference and macro WILL NOT fit) to HDMI.  I bought the 10' cable so I could plug it into the TV and sit on the couch with the Fire so if desired I could pause what I was streaming.  While streaming from my wifi to the Fire, there are times of slight distortion where the pixels are visible.  This is minimal, but is actually due to my internet because if I am not streaming through wifi but watching something that is on my Kindle, there is NO distortion whatsoever -- crystal clear picture.  While my Fire is hooked up to my TV and I'm streaming through wifi, if any distortion appears on the Fire, the distortion is more prominent on the TV.  But overall, this is VERY minimal, and usually just lasts a fraction of a second.  If you are streaming an Amazon video that has xray, and your Fire is plugged up to the TV, this xray information will appear on your Fire but will not carry over to your television via cable.  I bought the wall plug when I ordered the Fire so I could get it half price, and that is what I use to charge it.  I've never charged it using just the supplied USB cable, so I am unable to judge charging times.  If you're using an extension cord, the wall plug does get a little warm after being plugged in for awhile, and since I'm a little bit freaky about the house catching fire, I do not advise leaving it plugged into an extension cord while you're not home (have not noticed this heat if directly plugged into wall socket).  Something else I advise:  get a stylus.  They seem ridiculously priced, but I found a 3-pack on sale at a store and passed two out to fellow Kindle owners.  The stylus is great!!!  You can "touch" small items, and your screen stays fingerprint free!  I do not have a screen protector but I do have a case.  When buying a case, there is a difference in size in the regular Kindle Fire and Kindle Fire HD, so make sure the case you buy says it will fit HD!  My only real complaint is Flash.  I've tried to watch some flash videos, and I get the message that flash does not support the browser (which is Silk).  I have tried downloading the Flash player in other versions, but have been unable to find one that works.  This is something I would like to resolve, but it's above my computer knowledge.  I know I need to call Amazon (Amazon's customer service department is fantastic!), and I'm sure they can tell me how to resolve this, but I just haven't found the time yet.  I did not pay extra to have the ads removed, but the ads ONLY appear on the Lock screen, and as soon as you "swipe" to unlock it, the ad is gone.  The ads are not bothersome at all -- save those bucks to buy a HDMI-to-micro cable.  Here's one more trick.  I try to rook things around to save a few bucks.  The regular Kindles (e-readers) are free 2-day shipping, but the Fires (tablets) are not.  I knew I was going to buy Amazon Prime so I could stream, so I first bought Prime for $79/yr on one transaction, then I went back in and bought the Fire and wall plug on a second transaction so I could get Prime's free 2-day shipping on those items (since I pre-ordered the Fire, the plug was shipped earlier and I received it before the Fire).  I did end up "losing" about 3 days worth of Prime subscription because I ordered the Fire about 3 days before release date and my year of Prime started immediately upon order, but ended up saving in a long run because of the free 2-day shipping.  In short, buy the HD (not the regular), a stylus, and a micro-to-HDMI cable.  One more thing.  My friend has the first edition Fire.  She lost her charger while on vacation but had a charger to something else that fit the plug.  Now, her Fire won't charge.  Her brother is smart with electronics, and he told her that just because the charger fit doesn't mean it would work, and he told her she needed to buy another Fire charger and it would probably start charging again, but she hasn't done that yet.  A co-worker ordered a Fire (not HD) recently and didn't buy the charger because she said her Nook wall charger fits it.  I warned her what may happen.  Don't chance it, people.  Your Fire may blow up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: D. McGee "photog"
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad and iPhone.  I was looking for something to buy my daughter who uses her iPhone for email, games and internet.  Such a small screen!  She also loves to read and find interesting videos.  Wala - the Kindle Fire HD7" with Prime subscription!  So many free movies, tv shows, books, the internet and within seconds she had her email set up!! She loves it plus not heavy holding while reading in bed! no light needed... should I go on?  I am a hit with the greatest Christmas gift ever!  If your needs are those listed above - the iPad, not the answer, the Kindle Fire HD is!

Reviews.Title: Met all expectations
Reviews.Author: DebDurham
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 7" met all my expectations.  It was easy to learn.  Directions are self explanatory.  The navigation is easy to follow.  I can stay connected with e-mail and facebook when traveling.  It's fun to own this product.

Reviews.Title: I FEEL "YOUNGER THAN SPRINGTIME"
Reviews.Author: BZW Hardy
Reviews.Content: I will celebrate my 90th birthday on December 22, and I bought my Kindle Fire, HD for myself.  This is my third Kindle and I expected my new toy to be fun, but it is much, much more.  I am so delighted that I need not be disconnected from the world simply because I am old...I have my lovely Kindle Fire HD to travel the world over with me, even now.I am a retired book buyer and manager, so I have long appreciated the old and new friends I have visited in the literary world with my Kindles.  This new one gives me so many more experiences.Thank you Jeff Bezos and your colleagues.Betty W. HardyRockland, Maine  (I retired North from Houston, Texas )

Reviews.Title: 2nd Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Clare Mckinlay
Reviews.Content: Have always loved my 1st Generation Kindle but the Fire Hd is fantastic.I love everything about it and would recommend it to everyone.I have limited vision and can enjoy my books in whatever size of print I need in different lighting conditions.Good size and not to heavy to hold.I am no electronic wizard so I just love the product for what it is .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Mike DiBernardo "DIBO"
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Amazon customer and have been very impressed with quick deliveries and product quality, On Nov 26 I order the Kindle Fire 7" HD and on Nov 29 it was delivered to my home. I really like the features of the Kindle. My son has an IPAD and I feel the features are very similar. However, after one week, a line appeared across the screen. I did an online chat with an Amazon rep at 10pm on Thursday Dec 6, who told me to hold the on/off button for 20 seconds and try it again. Unfortunately, that did not resolve the problem. They said they would ship me a new Kindle and have it to me by Monday Dec 10. On Friday, Dec 7 at 2pm UPS was knocking on my door with my replacement Kindle. I received a new kindle in under 24 hours. They didn't wait for me to return the defective kindle before the new one was shipped. Now that is outstanding customer service. I will now try my 2nd Kindle and hope that the "line" does not appear on this device in a week. Amazon, you are great and I will keep buying from you.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Rodd Heacock
Reviews.Content: I did not expect the Kindle to be this nice and useful. The screen quality while playing a move has completly impressed me for the price of this thing. Really worht the price you pay

Reviews.Title: Like Kindle
Reviews.Author: Natalie Miller "N.Miller"
Reviews.Content: I really like it a lot. The only thing I dont iike is it doesnt have a light to show if battery is fully charged. and its hard to turn on and off.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Herrick "rita"
Reviews.Content: i can't put it down and i am amazed at how many free apps, books ans games are available for download

Reviews.Title: So Amazing!
Reviews.Author: lillirose51 "lillierose"
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt my favorite digital device.  After thirty years it is no longer possible for me to go to sleep at night without reading for a while first, but the arthritis in my hands is so bad that holding even a paper back for more than a few minutes was causing significant pain and numbness. The Kindle completely solves this problem for me (especially with the separately purchased cover that allows me to prop it up). But I'm so glad that I decided to go with the Fire HD, rather than the Paper White or original reader, as I am really enjoying watching Hulu Plus and Netflix with headphones during those times when it would disturb my husband (who works from home) to have the big TV going.  The images are amazing! The apps all work seamlessly. Indeed the Hulu Plus app on the Kindle Fire HD is better than on our Samsung Smart TV, providing better buffering. What a great purchase.  I use it every single day.

Reviews.Title: This is great and is far superior than the Nook
Reviews.Author: Sheila
Reviews.Content: I wasted money on the Nook. Service is poor and they charge to take care of problems. They charge to return and are expensive. So I gave my Nook to my daughter and bought the Kindle Fire 7"I loved the Kindle Fire HD so much that I figured to return it and buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 instead. It cost a little more but is well worth it. I am using it now while it is charging...I just got it in my mail and could not wait to use it= I love this one, it is not as heavy as I thought, the screen is just the right size, not too large or too small, and I will never return this.Am glad I did not keep the 7" although I loved it. I would have been sorry if I had kept it because the larger one is so much better and I was able to afford the small difference.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL!
Reviews.Author: Always 3
Reviews.Content: We are techno-dinosaurs, so weren't sure if we'd like a tablet.  We got Kindle Touch as gifts last year, and quickly found out how easy-to-use & useful it is, so we thought we'd give the Kindle Fire HD a try.  It's great!  Easy to use, and boy is it handy for checking emails--even I could figure out how to set that up :-)  We'd recently "unplugged" from cable TV due to cost, and have been on "free antenna" service for the past couple of months.  We got Amazon Prime, and were thrilled to find that some TV shows we'd been missing are available, free, for Prime subscribers.  I got a Bluerigger HDMI cable to go with the Fire, and have plugged the Fire into the TV to watch the shows.  The clarity of the picture is outstanding--actually better resolution and "watching experience" than we got from our cable provider!  What a great device, and at a price we could afford.  We'd recommend this to absolutely ANYONE looking for an affordable, easy to use tablet.  Get Prime; you won't  be sorry you did.  ******* UPDATE, NOVEMBER 2013:  I've had this Fire for almost a year, and it's become indispensable.  We don't miss huge cable TV bills, and Prime video adds new offerings all the time.  I also check email and Facebook much more frequently than I did on computer, because it's so convenient.  I got my partner a Fire HD 1 month after I got mine.  No issues, problems or glitches.  Amazon customer service is truly amazing, too--they've exceeded my expectations each time I've had questions or concerns.

Reviews.Title: I Love the Kindle Fire HD!!
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to a Kindle Fire HD.  It took a long time for me to come to the decision to do this because I couldn't imagine I would actually need it for anything other than reading which I could already do on my old Kindle.  After having the Fire HD I must say I can't believe I waited so long. This is so much fun.  It does connect to the internet at a remarkably fast speed.  If you are considering a Kindle take the Fire HD into consideration.

Reviews.Title: How did I live before this?
Reviews.Author: Mela
Reviews.Content: Seriously, I'm such a convert.  I never had a tablet before, I played with my mom's Kindle Fire and wanted one just for the e-reading capacity.  When news of the Fire HD came out I knew I wanted to try that - I use it almost daily.  Reading, listening to music, checking and replying to email, maintaining my calendar, watching movies, and of course playing games.  Downloads are ridiculously fast - I get books in under 30 seconds.  I've also enjoyed the use of the cloud, I've put my videos and music up and then download onto my kindle - super easy and wonderful.For people concerned about the ads.  I thought based on other reviews I'd have nonstop ads interrupting my reading / enjoyment.  This is not the case.  There's an ad that takes up the screen when I wake my Kindle, and that's it - I ignore it and slide the unlock.  If you have ever used a computer you already have selective memory and know how to ignore peripheral ads.It's a great product and I love that I can read at night with out book lights or bugging others.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: VERY happy with my choice of the kindle fire hd!! Love Amazon and this was the right tablet for me! My daughter loves it too, just wish it wasnt so easy for her to purchase whatever she wants!! I do have free time but im watching her while she is on free time and she hasnt tried to buy anything yet, so not sure if thats working to block or not. The graphics are amazing and the options of different backgrounds for your books is plus!! Didnt like that I didnt get a charger and also didnt like that i had to buy the camera, little things that really dont change how great the kindle is, but these little things should really just be included, just because.. Other than those I havent found anything else negative about it. Its so easy to use and anything is at the touch of a button. Very fast and good range with wifi!! Just dont drop it!!

Reviews.Title: no real difference
Reviews.Author: stevenm1213
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift. The person is extremely satisfied with it. When I picked it up to play around with it I found that the only real changes where the camera and the screen. There is no camera on back and you have to pay for a picture taking app. I don't recommend buying the hd if you own the fire there isnt much of a difference.

Reviews.Title: Meets and Exceeds Expectations
Reviews.Author: Bucco
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that I fall right in the middle when it comes to consumer electronics.  I will never be accused of being an early adapter or tech nerd, nor do I still watch standard definition TV or use dial up.  If you are on the fence about making the leap to a tablet, you can not go wrong with the Fire HD.  I purchased the product when it first came out, and decided to actually use it and put it through the paces I would need to have it handle before writing this review.First, the picture and display is wonderful.  From other tablets I have seen and looked at, it is only surpassed by the new ipads that cost 2-3 times as much.Second, it is easy and intuitive to use.  Don't let the fixed ads scare you.  They are only on the start up page and no where else.  If you absolutely can not live with it, simply use the opt out option when ordering.Third, the touch screen works well and I have had no problems.Fourth, the sound is great for such small speakers.  I have streamed many shows that are in stereo and they sound great.Fifth, the web browser and speed works fantastic as well.  It has no problem picking up wi-fi in any area it is available.  The included skype app works perfect as well.Sixth and last, if you are an Amazon Prime member, the Fire HD is a no brainer.  The seemingly limitless amount of content at your fingertips is amazing.  Not to mention ordering things to be shipped from Amazon is easier as well.Overall, I could not be happier. Yeah, some geek can sit and disect it and pick someting apart that the Fire HD may not have, but at the end of the day if you just want a simple dependable portable device for surfing the web, playing games, watching streaming content and skyping with family and friends the Fire Hd is the best deal out there.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: au812
Reviews.Content: I have been debating on an E-reader for awhile now and was waiting for the new Kindles to make a debut!  I am loving my new Kindle FireHD.  I can't read fast enough!  I love it as an E-reader and as my go to web browser!  I am not an electronics freak, so I worried that I wouldn't catch on quickly, but it was super easy to get up and running.  I am learning new things about my Kindle all the time!  Great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Good, but not Perfect
Reviews.Author: LMacey
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle last night and I've started forming my opinion. Let's go through some major features:SCREEN: This is where Amazon put their money, obviously. The color saturation is nice and the pixel density is great. The bezel makes holding it a breeze. It's also very sensitive ... maybe too much? I've accidentally pressed buttons just by brushing them as I move my finger to scroll. Regardless, it's definitely a good screen for the price range.BUILD: I bought a case for mine, so the backing doesn't get put to much use, but it is nice. Unlike other reviews, I don't see a problem with the siding - you get what you pay for; don't expect iPad quality for Kindle price. The screen is nice, but I get the feeling without a case it would shatter easy. Also unlike other reviews, I'm not bothered by the buttons for power and volume. They're easy to find and use, and subtle enough to look good.PERFORMANCE: This is where I ran into a problem. When I first opened my Kindle it didn't take long at all to start. This morning it was lagging a bit. I was not impressed. If that's what a couple games do to its speed, I shudder to think what a movie would do. I also seem to have difficulties watching some Youtube videos. I'm not sure if that's the Kindle or not. The games run good, though the advertisements do get in  the way sometimes. I had to download an app to get a better idea of my battery life, though. Once again: not impressed - that should come standard. Web browsing is decent, not too fast though. But let's be fair, it's a tablet, not a full-sized computer. Overall it's good quality.CAMERA: Oh, dear. Umm... major letdown . I knew it wouldn't be a good one, being only 1.3 megapixels  but this is sad. If the screen is where the money is, I think the camera was an afterthought, if that. Amazon, you seriously couldn't have sprung for a bit better? I think my Tracfone has a better camera on it, I'd have to check. The video quality is grainy at best, and it's almost an insult considering how much went into the screen. It's passable, considering its only use right now is Skype. Still, I feel a bit ripped off.That's all for now, I'll update as I go along and learn more.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Margaret Swink
Reviews.Content: Took me awhile to get used to the New Kindle but now I really love it. The pages are backlit and bright so no need for theliitle pull-up light.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: PJN
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about this purchase but now that I have it, I am really enjoying it.  I have not watched any movies or TV shows as of yet.  I am still learning my way around it.  I do enjoy the free games as I learn too.  I am sure the more I learn my way around this thing the more I will appreciate it.  Very happy with my new Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: A fine artifact
Reviews.Author: G. M. Callahan
Reviews.Content: As I learn more about the capabilities of this item, I am more impressed. Ease of use seems to be good, and I like the resolution and the ability to access movies, tv shows and the internet A very good product, indeed. Wish I could intuit more, but am hampered by experience and skill. It's more advanced than I am.

Reviews.Title: splendiferous device
Reviews.Author: psybercowboy
Reviews.Content: Being an amateur bibliophile, I never thought I would enjoy using a Kindle.I had downloaded the Kindle app on my android phone, but the screen was too small.However, the Kindle Fire screen size is perfect, and I can read books WITHOUT my reading glasses, and the display font is only set to 10. (that may seem large to young eyes, but it is at least small enough that I don't have to turn the page after 2-3 words). <slight exaggeration ;-) >

Reviews.Title: Loving my Kindle...so far!
Reviews.Author: J. Gale "Schnauzer Lover"
Reviews.Content: I am not tech savvy, still having a flip phone...so my review is based on that kind of background!  I found the Kindle Fire easy to use right out of the box!  I am still learning things, but for what I purchased it for, it definitely serves the purpose!  I was disappointed that it did not come with a wall charger (it only comes with a cable for hooking up to another device, i.e. my laptop...and that is how I charge my Kindle).  I did end up buying a generic wall charger thru eBay.  I am also disappointed with only being able to read one book a month from the lending library.  Why is there that limit???  I wish Amazon would make that an unlimited use, really!  I did watch a Netflix movie on my Kindle and the picture quality was awesome as well as the sound quality!  Reading is awesome too!  I do have a notebook computer, but for travel purposes....mostly to check on my email, maybe read a book or watch a movie.....the Kindle Fire is PERFECT!  You will need a stylus, and the Kindle does NOT come with one.  So, if you're like me....not tech savvy, you will want to make sure you get a wall charger, stylus, cover and I would suggest earbuds too!  For the price, you cannot go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mike Hammer
Reviews.Content: I have a kindle touch but when my wife got a Kindle Fire HD and I had to set it up for her I realized I had to have one as well.We have friends with the apple and I see very little that would make me pay that much. I am able to do everything they can as faras I can see and for much less money. I tether it to my phone and use like I do my laptop and is still a great reader.We travel a lot and this is just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: Sir Percard
Reviews.Content: Awesome little device.  Not an iPad killer, but definitely worth the money.  Video is great, nice solid feel.  Power button and volume rocker are not optimum, but not unusable.  Need to order another one because my son keeps taking it :)

Reviews.Title: Love It! Love the lighted screen, and the many apps that are available.
Reviews.Author: B. Meaker "peppermint patty"
Reviews.Content: My primary reason for ordering the Kindle Fire was simply to have a built-in lightedscreen for reading at night. It was perfect! I also enjoy listening to relaxing musicwhile reading. Being able to listen to Pandora is perfect, not to mention the optionof viewing movies, checking e-mail, and fb. I am very glad I ordered it, and woulddo it all over again!

Reviews.Title: New toy for an old woman
Reviews.Author: Arlene Claxton
Reviews.Content: I am delighted with my Kindle Fire.  I love brain games,casino slots and other apps that are available.  I also kept up with the news while the Presidental campaign was on-going.  I know there is a lot more I could do but I have to wait on a grandchild to explain things to me.  I can't wait to see what else I can do.  I already spend hours on my Fire so I expect it is going to get a lot dustier around here.  One more thing, the prices are right on apps and books, thanks, Amazon.Arlene Claxton

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: IceBabee
Reviews.Content: I have looked at many reviews for many tablets for awhile, and decided to buy this one.I am so glad that I purchased the Kindle!It has a beautiful picture,excellent sound, and all around nice made tablet!Apple has nothing over Kindle in my opinion.......!Also I ordered this and I received 3 days later! AWESOME!I highly recommend this tablet for anyone  :)

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD! I had the original Kindle Fire and upgraded. The HD is faster loading and the speakers are amazing! I would recommend this to anyone who wants an e-reader/tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: MaryKP
Reviews.Content: I purchase this as a gift for a friend who's very hard to buy for. She loves it. She has wanted one for a long time but wouldn't spend that kind of money on herself. She has so much fun with it and uses it all the time!

Reviews.Title: My Daughter loved it!
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: It was a birthday present for my daughter who has been using it every day since. She also uses it to watch movies through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love My Fire HD
Reviews.Author: N. H. Turner
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire HD for a while now, and I've been doing a lot more reading since I got it. The Fire HD makes it easy to sit back in a comfortable chair and read for a while. The color display is necessary for many of the books I read, and they look great on the Kindle Fire HD screen. I bought the Fire HD mainly for reading, so I haven't done much web surfing or anything else with it. One problem I ran into with an arts and crafts book was that the book contained a couple of basic sketches that I was supposed to trace and then use for a project. I have the Kindle reader app on my notebook computer, so I opened the e-book to that drawing, taped a sheet of tracing paper over the display and traced the picture. That was somewhat awkward, but it worked out.I've subscribed to a couple of digital magazines that get delivered to my Fire HD; when I opened up one magazine up and saw the page view I was afraid I had made a mistake by subscribing but I quickly discovered the zoom capability, which makes it easy to read the fine print.Although I have been accustomed to organizing my e-books into collections and that feature isn't available on the Kindle Fire HD, I still think the Kindle Fire HD is a fine product.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: cowan98
Reviews.Content: Got for my child who is nine and we have been very, very happy. Great battery life, fast connection, great HD and sound. They price is amazing! We will buy more for Christmas gifts!

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: MRC3491 "MRC3491"
Reviews.Content: We love this product, fast and the picture is awesome. I highly recommend this product, you can't beat the price compared to ipads

Reviews.Title: "SOUNDS" good!
Reviews.Author: wei
Reviews.Content: The new audio system works better than I expected. I have a pair of earphones of $100+ worth and I had always want to wear them for any audio. You know what, I now prefer to watch videos/listen to songs with the built-in speakers on the Kindle Fire HD. It's kind a small improvement from the hardware perspective buy very convenient. Like it and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my first tablet!
Reviews.Author: jrwgeneseo "Jax"
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting a tablet/e-reader for a long time and I finally decided to let myself spend the money. It is worth every penny! I had no idea there were so many free apps and books. I have downloaded a good number of the classics already. (And I am quickly becoming an Angry Birds addict.) I am so happy with my purchase. There is so much to do!

Reviews.Title: HD to The HD
Reviews.Author: STaylorJuly
Reviews.Content: At first, I was not feeling the new K. Fire HD, but after I was able to set up my watchlist, and download my books,music and apps. I feel in love. the sound on here is much, much better then the old Kindle Fire, and the pictures are more shaper. This has become a favorite in my house.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price kindle fire better then Ipad mini
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jay"
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle fire HD the picture is amazing and the sound is like you have a surround system in your hand.I received as a gift . I have amazon prime so I get the free videos and books. I was going to get the Ipad mini but at $130 more with a less resolution display and sound its not worth it.I also love the cloud feature I could keep my music,books and docs without using space on my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THE KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: CMiller
Reviews.Content: When I got my first Kindle Fire HD it was a gift for opening a checking account. Now it has become a part of my everyday life. YOu can search the web read a book or listen to music on this device. I love it so much that when it was taken from my car last nite this am I have already went online to replace it!!! I am now waiting for my new device! Rock on Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: llajoye "llajoye"
Reviews.Content: This product is better than I expected! Its perfect for reading books, Facebook, watching movies and so much more. The sound is impressive and it is just fun to have.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Diane Delille
Reviews.Content: I just Love my Kindle! The picture is crystal clear. I love that is has a camera. The gameplay is smooth and I've never had a problem hooking up to wireless. It's an inexpensive alternative to a much more expensive tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Gary D. Friudenberg "Gary"
Reviews.Content: I have both an ipad 2 and a kindle fire.  I use the ipad 2 for college to include pdf editing and highlighting.  The apps for the ipad better fit this use for me.  For videos and music the kindle fire blows away the ipad.  I also shopped for a new ipad and the screen and video was better on this device.  Also one thing that a lot of people do not consider is audio.  The audio is superior on the fire.  I am also able to use the kindle lend book option and enjoy reading on the fire.  Very great book.  It took a little time to figure out how to install and access personal videos, but once I did it was easy.  A lot of great apps to for the kindle fire.  Love the home screen and find it awesome.  THE PRICE THE PRICE THE PRICE cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: backtooldies
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to purchase this Kindle Fire HD as I have a Kindle reader.  This has been thebest purchase I have made.  I still use my reader but even my husband uses the Kindle Fire HD.I would recommend the Fire HD to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Lin26
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire is great for watching movies listening to music saving pictures reading books in the dark checking emails facebook everything a computer can do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Michella Williams
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire reads well, easy to use. light weight and affordable. It is also easy to navigate. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Amazon hit a homerun with this one!
Reviews.Author: S. Weldy "sjweld"
Reviews.Content: I really didn't NEED a new Kindle, my original Fire was working fine and I still had my Kindle Keyboard. I just decided I wanted the new HD so I bought it. I am SO HAPPY that I decided to get it. I was never unhappy with the picture on the Fire but WOW, this picture is very clear!I have page numbers in my books again AND, the very best as far as I'm concern......Text to speech!!!  The speech is much better than it was on my Kindle Keyboard. It doesn't sound computer generated and actually has some tone to the voice.The only things stopping me short of 5 stars is that I wish the Text to Speech didn't shut off if the screen rotates. I often listen to my books when I am cleaning or doing other chores. My kindle is in a bag over my shoulder and does sometimes rotate. There may be a rotation lock I could turn on though, not sure. Also, so far, I haven't found anywhere to change the voice from female to male. I feel a male voice reading is more soothing. The female voice isn't bad though.I haven't had my new Fire (HD 7") for very long yet, but I am certainly happy I bought it!Oh, the browser seems faster too!

Reviews.Title: My first kindle
Reviews.Author: Sparks
Reviews.Content: I got from my husband as an early Christmas gift. This is my first kindle product ever. I'm not sorry we got it. I've read several reviews and am confused about why people find the offers so annoying. I find some of them very useful and take advantage of them. Also why are people upset it's Amazon oriented? Kindle is AMAZON!! If you have a prime account it's awesome. My only question is the battery life. When I first ordered I didn't understand about the charger but called Amazon (great customer relations here) and they gave me credit to buy for the 9.99. I then ordered their persimmons case (awesome). I use this every single day. Now I ask myself why I never got one before. The movies, music, books all are great on this device. This device has endless possibilities. I'm sure I'll enjoy this for years to come. One more thing to point out here, the way the airlines are now charging for overhead bin space you can put this in duffle bag under your seat and no charge!!! The only thing I think I would have liked more clarity on is do you charge battery before using or did it come precharged. This particular point was not covered so I used it out of the box and not sure I should have. Some electronics require you to precharge for hours to set the memory for the battery life. Buy this product you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD.  My only disappointment is that I cannot purchase the Apps because I am not in the US.  I feel cheated that I was allowed to buy the Kindle with a non-US credit card, but now I cannot purchase the apps with the same credit card.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This Kindle HD surprises me every day with what you can do with it and Prime. I think it is well worth the $$. Amazon shipped it right away and their web site has alot of info to offer along with free games and books and apps. You will enjoy your new Kindle HD.

Reviews.Title: Best gift ever
Reviews.Author: T. Thompson "uglykitty77"
Reviews.Content: I have been nagging my husband for a Kindle for over a year, and he finally surprised me with the Kindle Fire HD 7" as an early birthday present. My husband is not into new technology devices and he almost bought me a nook instead, but I insisted that It must be a Kindle, not because I used any of their products before, but because I used to work for Amazon years ago and I deeply respect the way they operate their business. with that being said; I never wrote a product review before so here it goes:As for the tablet itself; I love how easy it is to use, I managed to figure it out instantly -even though I never used or owned one before-.I also managed to hook up all my accounts and upload pictures, files and music in no time. The screen is crystal clear and the graphics are amazing (except for Netflix movies I'm not sure why).The price is very reasonable as a matter of fact I'm buying my son one for Christmas.The only thing I dislike about it is the downloading time for apps takes from 15 to 30 minutes to download and I'm not sure why? Maybe someone can point me into the right direction to why it takes so long to download?Overall I LOVE my new device and I highly recommend it to any one and any age.

Reviews.Title: Best electronic device ever!
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: I love books, so I knew I would love the e-reader part of Kindle Fire HD, but all the stuff I am finding out I can do with it amazes me!  I'm a stay at home person and live in the country, so I don't have all the electronic gadgets that a working person needs for business.  I feel connected to the modern world! Can't keep away from it!  Love the crisp color pictures and sound.  I'd like to get something done if only I could get my face out of my Kindle Fire HD!  Great price.  Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Judith Day
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery from Amazon. At first it was a little difficult after having the Kindle Fire. I could not transfer some of my games and lost my progress on them, that was a little upsetting. With a little practice it is a wonderful product. Using and reading the forum has been a wonderful help. I will be using Skype to talk and see my son in Flordia.

Reviews.Title: im loving it
Reviews.Author: cathy
Reviews.Content: i really enjoy it cant hardly stop being on my kindle fire hd the sound it good and the picture are wonderful and the whole this is a must have

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: We love our new Kindle Fire HD.  Easy to use and easier to see than my old one.  I would recommend it to people who are visually impaired like me.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 7" fills the bill nicely!
Reviews.Author: Joe Rottenborn
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire HD 7".  Although already having an Apple iPad 2, I purchased the new Fire to read my Kindle e-book, Unstack the Odds: Zap! the Achievement Gap So ALL Students Can Access College AND Graduate!  And the book looks great on the Kindle.  The multicolored ink is attractive on the Fire's screen, live links can be accessed online in seconds, and paragraphs are shared easily via Facebook or Twitter.  I really enjoy reading on this e-reader.But the Kindle does so much more.  I've already purchased several songs, Paul Tough's new e-book, and a Rolling Stones' music video easily from Amazon; all were delivered instantly, showing up on my Kindle in no time.  Amazon had it right to position the new Fire as a "doorway" to access--and promote--all its products.  Furthermore, on a recent airplane trip west, the Kindle fit, albeit snugly, in my sportcoat patch pocket and provided access to the internet--and my e-book--on the road.  Battery life is long, lasting all day between charges.  Most unexpectedly, the new Fire screen displays downloaded iPhone photos beautifully: what a gorgeous e-photo album it is!  Features to improve?  Drop the incessant Amazon ads--free, not for a $15 extra charge.  Ship with printed directions--particularly, to access your own wireless, which took me three hours to complete.  Also, provide (at no cost) an electric connector for recharging--I use my iPad's, which is compatible--and refine the touchscreen highlighting function so you don't get one more word than you intended or drop the initial word when sharing.  And, of course, make the desktop appear more like Apple's iPad!  But for a $200 Android tablet, the Kindle Fire HD 7" fills the bill nicely!

Reviews.Title: Just amazing
Reviews.Author: Alexander G,S.
Reviews.Content: I needed an e-book reader as I love reading, but hate carrying books everywhere, but I also wanted some games and movies etc. when I'm not reading I could still use it. This is absolutely perfect to me, I love all the different text options for when I read. I get dizzy when staring at bright screens for to long and I like the brightness and text settings a lot, it makes the reading easier on my eyes.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle HD Rocks!
Reviews.Author: Holly Kuehn
Reviews.Content: I was so happy when my Kindle HD arrived in the mail that I spent all night playing with it.  It does everything I want it to and I am very impressed with the stereo sound.  Great speed, a breeze to operate, and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: perfect for whatbI wanted!
Reviews.Author: HCarolan22
Reviews.Content: I love it! Got the HD 7" and i really dont have any complaints! I wanted something other than my laptop/phone to use apps like Pinterest & reading at night after my husband is ready for the lights out. Also enjoying the free month of amazon Prime as well. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: 2 thumbs up for Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Paula J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I preordered the new Kindle HD, and I couldn't be more pleased with my upgrade. (My daughter is now enjoying my first Kindle). I will also be extending my Prime membership!

Reviews.Title: Loving My Kindle Fire HD!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark W. Roy-Brooks
Reviews.Content: I've had my HD for about a week now, and I am very impressed with it!  My Gateway laptop finally died, and I was looking to replace it without spending a fortune.  I decided to give the Fire HD a try. Well, I am very happy with my choice! Ican surf the web, watch t.v. episodes and movies, practically everything I could do with my laptop. Only thing I can't do is play a video game like World of Warcraft, which I only did occasionally anyway. I figured if I was going to play a game, I'd use my PS3 or XBox360. One thing that did bother me was that at first, the Kindle wouldn't support Adobe Flash, which left out a lot of videos on the web. Well, I got onto the Kindle support blogs, and within three minutes of posting my question, had the answer how to download a browser that does support Flash. I also love how portable it is!! I find myself carrying it around with me all day, lstening to Pandora, or watching a tv show while eating my lunch. Well worth the inexpensive price!!-

Reviews.Title: Amazing HD Display
Reviews.Author: Kathie "kam"
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time kindle user.  I started with the kindle keyboard which I absoblutely adored (I still use it to read outdoors).  When the original Kindle Fire was announced, I immediately pre-ordered.  Same with the new Kindle Fire HD.The new HD display is simply stunning.  Amazing graphics, great for video.  Books are clear and crisp.  And I read all the time and the new Fire HD isn't hard on the eyes at all.The battery life is much improved.  My old Fire needed to be recharged daily, the new HD Fire lasts much longer.The response time is snappy.. books and apps load quickly.  And browsing the web is also very quick.I absolutely love it!All that said, there are a couple things I miss which were on the original Kindle Fire.There's NO light when the device is charging.  Seems like a small thing, but I like to know that the connection is made and the battery is charging.  To check, you have to turn it on and check the battery display in the upper right corner.And I really miss the old "bookshelf" on the home screen.  I've always loved the carousel and that's still there, but I can no longer scroll down to find my "favorites".  I have to click the icon on the bottom of the screen.  Very small differences... just shows how attached I was to the original Fire.Overall, this is simply an amazing device.  I love my Kindle Fire HD and use is every day.  I work in IT and have an iPad 2... I much prefer the Kindle Fire HD.  I personally like the slightly smaller size better.  And there is absoultly no price comparison.  I highly recommend the new Kindle Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7' 16gb
Reviews.Author: Chuck Davis
Reviews.Content: I loved the 1st Kindle Fire and was thinking of getting the new Kindle Fire at 159.00 but i decided on the Kindle Fire HD 7" instead. The HD screen is very good for my needs and love the dolby sound and the speaker work great for my needs. I haven't watched any movies on netflix or amazon prime videos yet. i use it mostly for web surfing and reading web articles and youtube. I don't use much apps on this device but i use it to buy amazon product thru my amazon prime. its a good device for the price and if you use Amazon Prime and Prime videos its good device. One complaint is the flash doesn't work on some sites. Battery life is good. I only use it for 2hours at a time but there is always 85 to 90% left after i use it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle  Fire HD
Reviews.Author: S_Lane
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this for my birthday and I LOVE IT! The pictures are crystal clear, sounds awesome and so user-friendly. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Chloe
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD 7" for my birthday and I couldn't be happier with it.  The screen is crisp and bright, making playing games, reading or surfing easy.  The only thing I don't like is that I wish it had picture taking capabilities, and the ability to change the background.  Other than that, the content is awesome.  I don't mind the ads on the lock screen.  It's not worth the $15 opt out fee.  Overall a great product.

Reviews.Title: It's all about the router
Reviews.Author: Phoenix Omega
Reviews.Content: Initially, I gave the KFHD a lukewarm review.  Using the Internet was painfully slow.  Streaming videos was out of the question.  I could watch only a few minutes of a video before I would get kicked off the Internet by my router, and even then, the video was poor quality.  Even downloading apps was an exercise in frustration.  Mostly, the device was good for reading books, which could be done on a cheaper Kindle device.All of that changed when I replaced my old router with a new, high-speed, dual-band router.  Now, I am very excited about my Kindle Fire HD!  It's starting to replace my laptop for tasks like browsing the Internet or checking my e-mail.  I love using it to listen to Pandora radio, enjoy YouTube videos, or watch Netflix or Amazon Prime videos.  The video and sound are great, especially when I use a pair of nice over-the-ear headphones.The Amazon app store helps make this device fun.  I've gotten several free games.  Most of them are demo versions or have in-game ads, but I can't really complain when getting free entertainment.  With the touch screen, game play is enjoyable and intuitive.Of course, I still love the KFHD for reading.  The glowing screen is perfect for reading in bed at night without having to turn on a light and disturb my husband.  Downloading old, copyright-free books is easy via Amazon.  I also have Amazon Prime, which allows me to choose a book each month from the Kindle Owners' Lending Library.  The library is not as extensive as I would like, but it has some good choices.My biggest complaint about the KFHD is the "on/off" button. It's black, flat, and very difficult to find.  I always spend at least half a minute looking for it.  I understand that the virtually invisible buttons make the device look sleek and futuristic, but I would prefer a colorful button that's easy to find.To sum it up, this device is everything it's cracked up to be... as long as you have a good, fast router.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's meant to do
Reviews.Author: Bob "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I tend to research things a lot before buying them.  I waffled back and forth between this and the nexus 7 for a while, but eventually I went for the KFHD 7" 16GB tablet because I am a Prime member and wanted something that would stream instant videos from Amazon.  My receiver had a free HDMI port so this worked out well for me.  The nexus 7 doesn't have a micro-hdmi, and while there are ways around that this was just better for what I need.  I have a dual band n router which works wonderfully with the KFHD.  I haven't had a movie drop or skip yet.  I have played some online games on this and have yet to get the boot or experience much lag.  It's great for books.  The battery life seems slightly better than my wife's old KF.  The screen looks great.That being said, it is noticeably slower than the nexus 7.  My mother in law let me use hers for some time and it is a sweet device.  It is more responsive, faster, and has a ton more app options than the KFHD.  In the end, if it wasn't for the prime membership and streaming content you can get with the KFHD, it's no contest.  The Nexus 7 is better.  However, for me the KFHD does what I want better than the Nexus 7 would do.One star off for the crappy processor and borked/forked version of ICS.  I hope they end up releasing a forked version of JB at some point.  It really is that much better.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "-Sami"
Reviews.Content: This is the first Kindle Fire I've owned and I think it's great! Easy to use, nice interface and the screen is clear and responsive. The sound quality of the speakers is amazing. I would definitely recommend the HD to anyone considering buying one.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: tara
Reviews.Content: I got my new kindle fire HD two days ago. Now that I have my books and games on it I love it.It took place of my first kindle fire. What is different about the HD vs the kindle fire, is that you can put music on it. I found out you can put music on it from if you have itunes for an ipod. Great idea coming up with all the new features that the kindle fire HD has to offer...I would tell everyone that I can and could to go get a kindle fire HD... It really is the neatest thing ever. Thank you amazon...

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Patricia A Healton
Reviews.Content: I am using this to replace an HP Touchpad with a 10" screen.  Was afraid the screen would be too small for watching videos but I was very wrong.  I love this thing for videos and for reading books.  It is all I ever really wanted to do.  Now I have access to the Prime videos and Netflix.  I would not trade this for anything.

Reviews.Title: Was waiting to get tablet, this one sold me
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting ever since the original iPad to get a tablet, and finally with the 7" HD, Amazon got me to buy one.  In the couple of weeks since I've had it, I've been really happy with the screen and since I'm a Prime member, this made getting the tablet almost too easy.  So far the only issues I've had deal with the fact it's Amazon's product and app store, so I don't have easy access to YouTube like I have on my phone...but I can still browse there and watch the video's, so it's not a huge deal.As for the lock screen ads that some people have issues with, so far they're no bother to me (although the ultrabook one is getting a bit old), and the ones that give you deals for Amazon purchases have been great, and I think I've taken advantage of most of those deals.Basically, if you're an Amazon Prime member, this is the 7" tablet to get.

Reviews.Title: Love it almost as much as my husband....
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I got the new kindle fire HD for my birthday last month from the first hour I had it I fell in love I haven't used my laptop since also the great free appba day feature has saved me so mush hair pulling at appointmenst with my grandson he@ loves it and its harder for him to accidently`purchase  stuff we don't need. If u are looking for a great gift for someone u love go for it this thing is a winner

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" even better than I had hoped!
Reviews.Author: R. MIller "RJMiller"
Reviews.Content: This is now the 11th Kindle Fire and 1st HD I have purchased.  I am VERY satisfied and more than a little bit surprised at the improvements.Yes, I know everyone include Bezos said it would be great... but surprisingly it is!I have MANY different computer/tablets including 2 windows tablets which I use for production.  I spend more hours with the Kindle Fire than I do with any of the others (except my developement machine... gotta earn money to buy toys).  My wife has the Kindle HD (she couldn't wait till November) and does not leave home without it.  She uses it at work (she is a nurse educator) for research, teaching of staff as well as patients and finds the new screen a significant improvement since more people can see the screen from the side than the older Kindle Fire.The bluetooth will hopefully allow it to be used with webinars but have not found software allowing this yet.  Hopefully there will be software to allow Webex, Lynx, etc to do this.  RJ

Reviews.Title: I like my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Daff
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet so I don't have anything to compare it to. I know that I just wanted something with a screen that's bigger than a cell phone and lighter then a heavy laptop to carry. This did the trick. Something portable to browse the internet, check email, stream videos. I'm happy with my Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Has all the features I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Erica Alyson "Erica Alyson"
Reviews.Content: I got the original kindle fire when it came out and I loved it, but I missed the text to speech. This device has text to speech, and a camera with skype capabilities. I like the size of it. However it is wider so not as friendly to hold but I like how thin it is. I love the device, and love using it. I mostly use my kindles to read and this is my third kindle I wouldn't go with any other reading device!

Reviews.Title: To my supprise
Reviews.Author: Herman L. Robinson
Reviews.Content: When I received my new Kindle Fire it was larger then I thought it would be amd much brighter. I love it

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Venna
Reviews.Content: I love this kindle fire, it is slick and even though the screen in the same size it has the feeling that it is bigger. I like the keyboard and how it seems to be more defined.  The screen itself is more responsive then my other one and the speakers are amazing. My old Kindle fire had speaker problems so I am glad that they took the time to fix it with the new one.  I also like how when the Kindle is in a case when you close it, it becomes dark and when you open it up it becomes light again. That is going to save some on the battery as well. It is just an awesome unit. I haven't gotten to try out the camera yet due to the software isn't out for it yet and I haven't been able to try the microphone either yet. But we will get there. Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: Great Media Device
Reviews.Author: Robert A Messemer III
Reviews.Content: We visited family out of state and had a chance to try their original Kindle Fire.  After a few days with it we really enjoyed it.  I bought the Kinda Fire HD the day after I got home.Pros:  7" is a great screen size.  It's large enough to still enjoy a movie on Amazon Streaming Video, Netflix, or Youtube.  Small enough to not feel like you're dragging along a laptop.It's quite loud for such a small device, this is good when the audio is a bit low on some videos.It's Android based, so with a small option change I was able to run ConnectBot for SSH access to servers.  Nice touch leaving that option available to customers Amazon!Great library of items from Amazon, and you can download samples of books to verify that they're readable/legible.When you register the Kinda Fire HD you get an email address that you can send files to wirelessly transfer them to the device.  I was not told about this before I bought it, and it's a neat feature.Cons: It's still a tablet, without a keyboard some things like note taking and long time use of text input are a pain. This should be obvious to the buyer, and isn't worth losing a star over.

Reviews.Title: short and sweet
Reviews.Author: kdurahm
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect all around media player.  I personally like the 7" format.  Not too big and clunky and not so small you cannot view comfortably.  I do not think you can go wrong with this and especially for 200 dollars!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price...really good regardless of price
Reviews.Author: Jason Rodriguez "Comic Editor"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my Kindle Fire which I loved but it had its problems. It was sluggish, especially after continued use, the web browsing and email experience was terrible, and the volume and brightness controls were difficult to use. The upgraded Fire takes care of all these problems - it's a lot faster, the sound is great, and resolution is fantastic, especially for books. I don't even mind the ads, honestly. The home screen offers already got me a $5 MP3 credit and a $10 general credit...I hope it'll eventually link up with Amazon Local Deals. And the carousel deals are even fine, as I kind of like having suggestions based on what I'm reading, watching, and playing.But performance is clutch here, and now that Silk and Email are actually usable, this becomes a pretty damn good tablet. The HDMI out (so I can pipe it to my TVs) and bluetooth (so I can link up a keyboard) make this a portable set-top box and bar-friendly writing machine, respectively. Hulu+, Amazon Instant, and Netflix - perfect for a family that canceled cable. I just hope they get MLB.tv soon. And X-Ray is pretty great for movies and even for books with large casts of characters (although it would be great if there were some way to recall scenes in books...although I'm not really sure how that'd be done).It's a great $200 purchase and a great purchase, period. Very happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: An awesome upgrade to the previous Fire
Reviews.Author: ki11abee
Reviews.Content: I owned the previous fire and only complaint i had was the lagginess. This model not only upped the ram but also the processor. This is not even counting the amazing Retina like display it comes with too. Everything just looks so brilliant and vivid, especially the magazines. Those somehow on the older Fire, it was just not cutting it. Videos? Wow even better. If you owned the 1st gen and debating whether to get it or not, DO IT! you wont regret it. Im sure the cheaper 159.99 version boost in speed also is nice, but the screen HD display is a winner for me hands down. Its true, the glare is very minimal and fingerprints aren't even a problem either. The battery last a super long time and its very hand friendly as opposed to a bigger sized Ipad. The promotions ads also aren't even a big thing and i almost paid to get rid of them, but they are not a issue at all. Also, I bought mine at Best Buy so you can even check it out in person if you really need to be sold on it.****MY ONLY small COMPLAINT****(But i show the free easy solution)You have to pay extra for that stupid charging adapter that should have came with it in the first place. Charging it with the cable on a PC will drive you nuts as it take for ever to completely charge. Okay, they way i managed to charge it fast and not pay for that adapter.....USE YOUR APPLE PRODUCT CHARGING PIECE!!! It fits and works with no problems. And since most people have iphones, then you are in luck. Otherwise you have to invest in that $20 part.Aside from this little thing, its an amazing product hands down, and a must own upgrade over the previous Fire!

Reviews.Title: My first Kindle, and I love it!
Reviews.Author: B. LAWS "Linux enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I ordered my 16 GB Kindle Fire the day before it was released and chose one-day shipping. I got it the day of release.The Kindle interface is wonderful. It is very easy to navigate.The display is crisp, clear, and bright. The web browser makes sites easy to view.I was pleased to find out that my previous Kindle purchases (I "purchased" free Kindle books via the Kindle app on my iPod Touch) were already available in the cloud.Today, I bought some magazine subscriptions on my Kindle Fire HD. "The Nation" is so far my favorite. It is very easy to flip pages and view the article in text mode.I also downloaded some apps via the Kindle app store. Facebook looks amazing on my Kindle. I am disappointed that there is no Tumblr app on the Kindle Fire HD, but I can view Tumblr just fine in the Silk web browser, so not much loss there. And I am pleased that Skype is on there. I have an unlimited U.S. landlines/mobiles subscription with Skype, so this comes in handy. The sound quality of the Kindle Fire HD makes Skype a joy to use on there.The only thing that disappoints me is the fact that Amazon's OS is a stripped-down version of Android. I would give this review six stars if Amazon allowed you to run the full Android experience. There are some Android apps which don't work on the Kindle, and some of these apps are among my favorites such as Tumblr and CSPI's "Chemical Cuisine".Other than that, I am pleased with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: E.G
Reviews.Content: First off i want to say that the delivery was just as promised. I received my Kindle on Friday the 14th as scheduled, I love that of Amazon! I purchased the KF for my 11yr old son, but as soon I tried it I loved it for myself.The size is perfect, alot thinner, fits great in my purse.It works great, the screen and sound is so clear and it is fast. The screen is so clear, i love watching movies on it.My son is loving every bit of it. The downloading of games is fast and just the clarity of the sound and screen alone amazes me. There's two small things that i didn't like though; no charger (only USB charger) and no camera. You have to purchase the charger separately. I would of loved being able to take pictures beign that the clarity if so perfect. Hopefully they improve on that. Other than that I have no complaints. The KF HD is great, I would recomend highly.

Reviews.Title: Great device, great customer service!
Reviews.Author: abba
Reviews.Content: Got the Kindle Fire HD on Friday through Pre-order.  Think it is a great device (below), but had some problems with charging....It would charge (Battery Indicator on screen showing green filling up, and then stop and re-start if I re-adjusted the connection).  The battery after a full charge also did not hold anywhere near 11 hours, probably 5-6 hours tops.  Anyone else having battery/charging problems at all...maybe I just got a bad one???  But called Amazon and got shipment for a replacement device scheduled and Amazon has GREAT customer service.Mainly love the fact that docs are now integrated on the carousel with uploaded cloud docs showing up!  This is what I was needing the Kindle for, reading uploaded PDFs, and so glad that it is now integrated which I had heard the original Kindle did not do, so I did not bother getting the original Kindle Fire....With the Desktop Upload Cloud App, now reading docs on the go is SOOOO easy!!!  So surprised I have not seen any other reviews mentioning this, as this was the quibble on many people not enjoying the Kindle 1st gen.  I also see uploaded pics on the cloud integrated as well.  Thanks for addressing this concern Amazon, you got my purchase for sure!!!Graphics are so crazy good on this device too, been watching HD videos through Prime and love it!This is also my first tablet of any sort, and I love the interface, its so easy for anyone to figure out...definitely glad I waited for this and did not need to buy an expensive ipad, as this more than suffices for what I need it for.

Reviews.Title: Fire Worth Playing With
Reviews.Author: Michael Cavacini
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a great multimedia consumption device. For $199 you get a gorgeous HD display, arguably the best speakers on a tablet and easy access to all things Amazon. Is it perfect? No, of course not. But this device is a huge step forward, and, for the price, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Not all apps that are compatible with the Kindle Fire are compatible with the HD
Reviews.Author: Mark A Barrick
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kindle Fire since it came out and got the Fire HD so I could give one of my children the original Fire.  I love the Fire HD but noticed that several of my apps that I use regularly on the Fire were unavailable on the Fire HD, notable News 360 and Scanner 911.  After further digging, both apps are considered incompatible with the HD.  So, this is just a heads up, don't get frustrated like I initially did when you cannot find some apps in the app store, not all apps that you can get on the original Fire are compatible with the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Amazing device!
Reviews.Author: TLEM
Reviews.Content: As a loyal Amazon Prime member and Kindle owner, I had to have this right away, and was not disappointed!Its graphic user interface is seamless and intuitive, and the thing sounds great!Using my mobile phone as a wifi hot spot, I can take my books, music, movies and other content wherever I go, and I can shop anytime and any place.Love my Kindle Fire HD!!

Reviews.Title: Flash  - easy workaround
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: From the kindle browser, navigate to getjar.com then download the dolphin browser from there.  I now have dolphin browswer on my Fire HD, which allows flash.  Not that I anticipate much need for it.  I like the silk browser, but if for some reason I'm needing flash, I can switch over to dolphin.As far as the Kindle HD itself, it's taking me a bit of adjusting because it navigates differently than the old fire, but so far I love it.  Screen is beautiful, sound is awesome for a tablet.  It looks much better than the boxy original fire too.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with a minor annyance
Reviews.Author: Chick
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to the HD and like it so far. Video and sound are very good. Also bought the Marware cover and can't understand why the design has the USB and HDMI ports where they cannot be used when the  cover is used as a stand and the camera is at the top of the screen.

Reviews.Title: still overheated
Reviews.Author: Crimsonphoto
Reviews.Content: This is the replacement Amazon sent me because the one i had for four months started overheating I've not shipped either back yet because the new one as soon as i turned it on it overheated and shut down i would appreciate it if someone could contact me about this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great for avid readers, but...
Reviews.Author: Brian Hurtado "Vapor.Dragon"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife, when her computer gave up the ghost. Let's get one point very clear: This is NOT a tablet computer, in the regular sense... With that stated, here are the pros and cons, from our perspective:Pros:Beautiful displayClear beautiful soundFast operationEasily connected to a WPA2 wireless (secured) networkCons:  *Web browser will not interface with banking institution...In fairness, part of this lies in the fact that my bank has not written support for Amazon's browser. However, a browser needs to meet certain specifications in order to be considered 'secure.' We are talking, after all, about our money...  *Not configurable to tasteWhile I fully understand that the ads are there to compensate for a lower price, let's place some perspective on this: the price difference is $15.00. For me, that's 1/2 an hour at work. For many, it's much more than that. What do you get, in exchange for your $15 discount? You get a lot of Amazon 'educated guesses' on what ads they think would most entice you into purchasing more products through them. I, personally, do not consider the fact that my wife cannot configure her browser as she wishes it to be, even if the extra $15 were paid.  *The interface may be BASED on Android, but this is not an Android tabletThe Kindle is to tablets what Verizon is to wireless communication devices: proprietary control designed to push you toward purchasing more product controlled by the 'owner' of the operating system. Just as Verizon bastardizes the Android operating system to make sure that they are in as much control of your usage as possible, Amazon has followed suit with the Kindle and actually prevents any true customization. Again, this is not a 'Tablet PC.' This is a book reader with great display and extra features.  *Purchased keyboard/carrying case was not even recognized.I am an electronic gadgets junkie. I am also an enterprise deployment engineer for a major computer solutions provider. I can script and automate most administrative functions of of an enterprise deployment of a business computer OS installation, and make it compatible (out of the box) with multiple platforms. If I have to fumble through several screens in order to try (and fail) to connect an USB keyboard, how is the average user going to feel?  *Any app you use is automatically added to your carousel.While for many people this might be a god-send, neither my wife nor I consider this a feature. We consider it a nuisance. Kindle simply wants to make far too many decisions for the consumer. We are not sheeple in this house, and are quite capable of thinking for ourselves...  *Either charging or keyboard, never both.The Kindle provides only one USB (micro) port, which means you can never use an external keyboard, and be charging the unit, simultaneously. for those like my wife that don't like virtual keyboards, this is definitely a drawback. For something that is billed as being as useful as Amazon claims the Kindle to be, there are some severe limitations that prevent this unit from being classified by anything other than a glorified book reader.Summary:  While the Kindle is not a bad product, in and of itself, it did not fit our needs. Neither did it fulfill our expectations (based on advertising descriptions) of a tablet PC. I have built every computer I have owned, from the motherboard up. I am not technically impaired. With the Kindle in my hands, I felt very much like I was begging for the right to make decisions for myself, and still being declined. This very well may be useful for people that do a lot of reading, but it is definitely not worth the $300 we ended up spending. It took less than an hour to decide to send this back.Perspective:  It is not my desire to belittle the product. The two stars are not indicative of the product, but more how the product failed to fit our specific needs. Others may have a different experience, based on their specific needs. However, We are very solid to ourselves when we stated that the Kindle is definitely not worth the asking price.

Reviews.Title: Bump in the road
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Willis "Tom Willis"
Reviews.Content: I've been buying from Amazon for years. Would have been hard for me to think of a delta to mention. But after years of bliss it's happened. For the first time in my relationship with Amazon I'm questioning where this is going. Thanks to my initial disappointment in the Kindle Fire HD.Great:HD videoQuick Navigation with user interfaceSound (better than I expected)Good:Battery lifeEasy to navigate around the OSLight weightUGLY:No flashCharge timeDon't expect to be able to use all the Android market apps you loveNot a good web browsing device (same as above with websites)1 click purchase auto-enabled and doesn't seem to let you shut it off. (Careful before you put this in your kids hands!)Family friends recommended Kindle, vs iPad or tablets, for use with kids and adults. But they didn't have Fire HD. I don't know if something changed. Right now it feels like someone got this wrong. It feels like Amazon was afraid to embrace the full abilities it could have. That they need to corner just their app store...Honestly right now I wish I would have bought another 7" tablet and just downloaded the Amazon apps to it, instead of getting the limited, dare I say timid Kindle Fire HD. It feels like a controlling relationship that never wants to go out for some spontaneous fun.We have a four hour flight with my 3 year old daughter tomorrow. I've got some movies purchased, games installed, and will look at some books for her too. Fingers crossed she likes this. She loves playing with my old droid x. And my wife already asked why I got this after getting her a galaxy 3. She prefers that in every way so far.Update on 1/19/2013.We've had the Kindle Fire HD for a while now. It worked great for prime movies for our 3 year old on or vacation. She loves it. She's still a bit more comfortable using some of the kids apps on an android phone, but it's probably just easier for her to handle at 3.The text to speech is really absurd. I need to look for other software options because what ever is imbedded in the Kindle is not worth having. I can't imagine visually impaired readers using it, I'm sure they would have higher quality software available to them.Batter life is great. Sound is great.At a family gathering I was jealous of the new iPads and iPad mini's. I still wish I would have gone with a price comparable Samsung tablet at this time. Still hoping to see some improvements to the OS. The kindles web browser isn't terrible but it's not close to the top either. The Fire HD provided just enough comfort for my 3 year old that I decided not to return it. But I also don't feel like I own a tablet. I own a kindle e-reader that has ability to play movies from prime.

Reviews.Title: Great Addition To the Kindle Family
Reviews.Author: Steven Wood
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is taking the eBook Reader world by storm. This device allows you to read your eBooks, magazines and newspapers. However, it is much more than that. You can also surf the net if you are connected to Wi-Fi, and you have the option to download and watch your favorite movies or television shows in high definition. Additionally, you can download and play your favorite games. Amazon also now offers the Kindle Fire HD that is 8.9 - inches and an 8.9 - inch version that also offers 4G.This eBook Reader has an LCD, high-definition 7-inch display, measured diagonally. Additionally, it offers the best resolution on our lineup at 1280 x 800. This screen will bring your movies to life while still allowing you an excellent reading experience. Weighing in at 13.9 ounces with a 7.6 x 5.4-inch facade and a 0.41-inch thickness, the Kindle Fire HD is still small enough to throw in your backpack and take just about anywhere with you. This device also comes with a 1.2GHz dual-core processor and dual-band, dual antennas. This allows you to download your content much quicker than older versions could. Additionally, the Kindle Fire HD comes with Dolby audio as well as dual-driver speakers, which creates a surround sound effect.One of the great options that the Kindle offers to its users is its dedicated content server. This allows you to shop on Amazon.com and download any book you like at any hour of the day. Amazon currently offers over a million different book titles that you can purchase. Additionally, it offers a lending library for its Prime members. Being a Prime member requires you to pay an annual fee to Amazon, but you will have several perks such as borrowing eBooks from the lending library with no return date. You can also stream videos instantly on your Kindle Fire HD.Amazon also offers you the ability to download textbooks for students. Currently, it has over 150,000 different textbooks available with more being added every day. Using the Kindle Fire HD for textbooks is a simple way to keep all of your books in the same place, without taking up a lot of space in your dorm room or backpack.Amazon offers over 208 different newspapers, which are available for download on your eBook reader. Some of these newspapers include The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, USA Today and The Washington Post, just to name a few. Additionally, you have the option to download magazines as well. You can choose from over 400 different magazine titles. The digital magazine subscriptions are much cheaper than a mail subscription, and you can download your magazine almost instantly and begin enjoying it.For those of you who enjoy reading and keeping up on blogs, the Kindle Fire HD will help you to do that as well. Amazon offers thousands of blogs that you can become a part of using your eReader. You can find a Kindle blog on just about any topic that interests you, including news, entertainment, sports, science topics and more. Some blogs are free to join, however many also charge a monthly subscription price of a dollar or two.Memory/Battery Life:9.8/10Because high-definition media files are larger than average, the current Kindle Fire HD comes with your choice of either 16GB or 32GB of memory to ensure that you have enough space to download and enjoy your favorite content. Amazon also allows you to store anything that you purchase through its site on the Amazon Cloud at no additional cost.The standard battery life of the Kindle Fire HD is 11 hours for surfing the net, reading or watching videos. However, battery life is also affected by other factors such as downloading content and your preferred settings. You can choose to charge your device by plugging it into your computer with a USB cable or plugging it into a wall outlet.Additional Features:9.8/10Because this eReader also functions as a tablet, it comes with an LCD display. You can select the brightness of your screen; however, you do not have the traditional gray scale levels that are on the older Kindle models. The LCD screen offers you more choices when selecting the best brightness level for your eyes.The Kindle Fire HD offers a host of new features never before available on an eReader. This new eBook reader offers X-Ray for both movies and books. The new X-Ray feature allows you to tap the screen during movies and it will bring up the list of actors that you are currently viewing. It also allows you to view other movies in which the actors star in as well. X-Ray for books allows you to look up character information such as biographies and information from Wikipedia.Summary:The Kindle Fire HD is a completely new experience for eBook readers. The device allows you to view your movies in the best quality HD we have seen on an eReader, while also allowing you the best options for reading. The new X-Ray feature for searching information on actors and searching Wikipedia for book information allows the Kindle Fire HD to really stand out. While it does not offer specific gray scale options, you do have the ability to choose the brightness level that is most comfortable on your eyes with this eReader.

Reviews.Title: just great
Reviews.Author: Luis Adrian Diaz Garza "Megrez"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD, it is just awesome, great for reading, watch movies and with fantastic dolby stereo sound

Reviews.Title: Awesome Device
Reviews.Author: HardyBoy64 "RLC"
Reviews.Content: With the risk of sounding overly dramatic, I can state that the kindle fire changed my life. I love having the accessibility to videos, books and my music at my finger tips.
