I strongly disagree with another reviewer who stated that the kindle fire was complicated. I'm not technologically savy and I have found that it's a very user-friendly tablet. I purchased the 32 GB version and I don't have any regrets at all. I can have any book at my disposal and I have loaded nearly all of my CDs onto this device. For the price, this is the best tablet out there and I strongly recommend that you purchase yourself one. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire replaces Ipad 2
Reviews.Author: Chow
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was blown away by the screen resolution quality of the Fire HD I purchased for my husband, so I bought a second one for me! It replaces my second gen Ipad. Is it a clone of a iPad? No, they both offer different capabilites, but as a consumer consumption device, it fits my idea of a tablet. What i like about it: I like the small size and lighter weight vs my iPad. Yes, the iPad mini is out now, but its way more expensive and I dont need thousands of apps from iTunes. I am a long time Amazon book customer, so obviously this tablet is about Amazon books foremost.  Its nice to see that there is a large selection of apps now available through the appstore. Didnt used to be that way and was a deterrent to buying one.  It works fine on my home wi-fi. One quirk i noticed that there is a bug where when i switched back from sepia mode to white background, the background stayed sepia but the lettering turned black instead of the darker sepia coloring lettering. I frankly liked it a lot better. The white background tends to have a yellowish tinge to it, so the sepia colored background and black lettering is easier to read. Getting around on this unit is a little clunky compared to the iPad, but I suspect I will get used to it. I do like the reader feature on the e-magazines and websites where available. Lack of a notebook was puzzling so I use my Evernote for notes. Printing via wi-fi? Not an option but will find an app that will allow me to do that, I am sure. Email was simple and easy to set up. Skype is available to face to face video calls. No back camera like the iPad. Battery life is impressive. I used it all day yesterday including a 2 hour video, interent , mail etc, and still was only down to 50% this morning, so very very nice. So bottom line, you want a book reader? internet capabilites? email? Skype? then this unit will fill the bill and half as expensive as the iPad plus i have 32gb of memory instead of the 16gb I had on my iPad. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: Fire love it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got my kindle fire last month and I love it!!! I have already read a lot of books on it. Thinking about one for my daughter and my mom for X-mas. :-)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD = Kindle Fire + awesomness
Reviews.Author: Bebe Deimos
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say too much about the Kindle Fire HD, since almost all has already been said. I will just give you my highlights of the comparison between my original Kindle Fire and the new Kindle Fire HD:The improvements that I like the best are:1. The display is just incredibly amazing vs. the original Kindle Fire. Did I say it was amazing? Yea, I did. It is AMAZING!2. The battery life is much better with wi-fi on or off (in my emperical observations about 25-50% better).3. You can actually determine what your side-loaded videos are without playing them. The picture is much bigger and hold-touching the picture brings up full details. Yea!4. 32 GB of data storage (actually more like 29 GB, where did the other 3 GB go? :)).5. Smoother and faster response due to the processor upgrade.The improvements I like least:1. I miss the light on the power button. Now I'm never sure if the device is charged without turning it on.2. I actually liked the outdented power button. Yea, I did hit it accidentally a few times, but it was much easier to find when I was sleepy and done reading for the night.3. The recharge USB connector on the left side instead of the bottom. I use a Marware case and with the old Kindle Fire I could just plug it in. Now I have to open the case and plug it on on the left. Please move it back to the bottom?4. To me the volume buttons are useless.  Actually maybe the power button is useless too? This is a touchscreen device, there is a volume control easily accessible on the screen.  Maybe power can just be done by having a touch power off (big for when I'm sleepy :))? Touching the screen could then turn it on (at least for a few seconds until you unlock? Then just a charge light would be needed. I would really like that.Just as an FYI, I got the 32 GB version because I like to sideload videos and I paid the extra $15 to get rid of the lock screen ads.One last comment, I really liked another review where the person stated there are other much better general purpose devices out there, but I use this device for entertainment and content consumption, so for me it is the best device on the market. I guess I am an Amazon content fan-boy, but it works great for me, so I'm sticking with it!

Reviews.Title: Loving my Fire HD
Reviews.Author: The Tinman
Reviews.Content: I've had my fire had for just 2 days and absolutely LOVE it! :-) The display is gorgeous, and despite what some people say about the shortage of apps...I have been finding everything I need, and so far I have found what I want for free. It is so easy to use, I will be getting one for my parents, and I know I will have no problems finally getting them on line. My parents have troubles with computers...but I will set up the apps they need and I know they will love this tablet. I was having trouble deciding which tablet to go with, but having already owned a kindle 2nd generation, and loved it, I chose the Fire HD 7 inch and am so glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: S. Adams
Reviews.Content: I was the satisfied owner of an original Kindle Fire and traded it in on the new HD a few weeks ago with some hesitation derived from some of the more credible one star reviews (of course I discounted the obvious troll entries and those related to the marketing departments of Samsung and Apple).The upgrade has been worth it.  The improved display, the much better sound and the somewhat better Wifi all contribute that verdict.  The only negatives are:* No Flash - not Amazon's fault and hopefully this will be fixed eventually - all new Androids are affected. I guess I could add another browser.* I miss the LED on the on/off button that told me if the old Fire was charging or fully charged.  Of course some people hated the very sensitive button/LED located on the base of the old Fire so maybe they had to move it - still a LED would be nice.* The server seems slow at times.  I have bought apps that have taken over 6 hours to appear on the Fire HD even though they were listed immediately on "items you have purchased".  This was never a problem on the old Fire.* Items deleted from the carousel have sometimes mysteriously reappear.* The commercials are not unduly obtrusive.  However the display of a line of suggestions, based on what others have purchased, which appears below each Amazon item in the carousel, can sometimes be annoying as it clutters  the interface.  It would be nice to be able to turn them off after the first viewingAll in all a winner.

Reviews.Title: LOOOOOOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: LVojtko
Reviews.Content: From the moment I got the box in the mail, my Kindle hasn't left my side. My children love it as much as I do. Big screen, light weight, tons of apps and books.

Reviews.Title: The Amazing Kindle Fire!!
Reviews.Author: Chloe "Chloe"
Reviews.Content: I got the 16 Gb Kindle Fire HD for my birthday. My first impression when I pulled it out of the box was nice and sleek device. This is my first e-reader and I enjoy it! In fact I am writing this review on my kindle right now!This Kindle works great on the Skype app. It down loads apps and books fast and has great quality in everything. I like how you can choose fonts and font sizes. That is really helpful.The ads aren't intrusive as some people say. I mean how much time are we gonna spend looking at the lock screen?I can't find a thing wrong with my Kindle Fire and I strongly recommend it to anybody wanting an e-reader of this sort! Although I haven't had it for long I can tell you one thing- this device is amazing!

Reviews.Title: So Far so Good!!
Reviews.Author: I. Gray "Ready for fitness!"
Reviews.Content: So. The Amazon junkie that I am just went out an bought the Kindle FireHD 7". Love it already. I can watch videos streaming online and the WiFi is just superb compared even to my Gateway laptop! We've watched a couple of movies on here and I never thought I would feel as comfortable watching movies on a small screen but the resolution is great. You get right into the movie and its no issue. My only con is that every-time I look at anything in the "Cloud" it appears on my carousel. I hate this as I constantly have to "remove from carousel" books I don't want anyone to know I'm reading. Also there is one book I can't remove from carousel at all.Coming from the Kindle Keyboard the ads aren't a problem but the recommended for you gets in the way. I am really happy with my purchase and look forward to getting more use out of this.

Reviews.Title: please ... I Love It
Reviews.Author: debi j
Reviews.Content: what's not to say ... this is my new buddy it does so much more that i ever thought it could do, oh this is by far the way to go, no more setting up my laptop on the counter, it's the kindle, and my favorite thing is how i can get my magazines on the kindle, no more piling magazines, no more cutting out recipes, and have all my favorites that i get now fab-o ...

Reviews.Title: Very Nice-Early Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with my Kindle Fire HD 7", the dolby audio sounds amazing while watching a movie and the graphics are just sharp. I received my Kindle HD as a gift and I am very happy, the battery has lasted for nearly 2 days and that's after watching a couple of movies and web-browsing or playing games. Thanks Kindle for putting out such a great product.

Reviews.Title: Real deal!!!
Reviews.Author: Thunderhawk
Reviews.Content: I am "technology person" and I do not know how to start off with some, good enough, big words for Kindle Fire HD?!?!?It is awesome, and after using it for hour or so I cannot believe how far Amazon went i every aspect with it?!I own a lot of techie stuff and my house is full of them, but for the first time I felt like my 4 year old son when I buy something that he really wants! :DTwo things that I can point to and which are amazing on this device - screen and sound.This, combined with the Amazon's state of the art service and offers is THE REAL DEAL!Furthermore, the size is just right for the traveling and it is easy to have it around at all time.So far I have only really nice words for Kindle Fire HD since it fulfils my expectations and it excels at least 50% more than I could imagine such a device will do.Price?Don't be silly, it is worth much, much more than that :D :D :DP.S. This is why Amazon has Buy with 1-Click option!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brenda "Brenda"
Reviews.Content: I love it just as I did my old Kindle. The Kindle Fire HD is great if you enjoy doing more than just reading a book.  If you are new at using a touch screen this is a good way to learn and notebooking will become easy for you. Comes with NO user's manual but all is in the Kindles Help application on your Kindle Fire. I like it. I even downloaded a game and I usually don't play games, I am a serious reader.  If you just want to read and nothing else this is a more expensive way to go.  Otherwise, the regular Kindle Reader will be great for just reading books. A good tip for the new user (that I didn't know, because I was to anxious to get started) Read the wireless set up first then you will know which wireless address is yours. You will need to know your SSID and Password before setting up your wireless. I am not real techie so had now idea.

Reviews.Title: From kindle fire to fire Hd
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I gave my fire to my mother in law and purchased the HD this is more than I expected for $200.00 just using my blue tooth Sony head phone over wires is a big plus, videos and sound are so much nicer. I have been having so much fun with games video and music I haven't read any books since receiving it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for $200.00!!!
Reviews.Author: patches
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet not expecting much, I was wrong,the picture sand sound quality are excellent!  Web browsing is fast,I watched a few movies and videos on it without a hiccup. This tablet is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Thrilled with my Fire
Reviews.Author: LongGone
Reviews.Content: I have never owned another tablet, so I can't really compare the Fire to anything else. But I really do love it so far. Its like a bigger version of my smartphone, with more options and better sound. The picture is exceptional, and I love the case I bought with it to use as a stand. Highly recommend this product. I'm so excited to be reading again! I've always been a big reader, but over the years I've found many excuses not to pick up a book. Too busy, no time to buy one or get to the library, I keep forgetting it at home, etc. I love that I have a portable, compact item I can stick in my purse and have any number of books at my fingertips. My Kindle Fire is definitely my new favorite thing!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Internet Portability
Reviews.Author: E. A. Summers "Liz"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire version 1 for my mother but had it shipped to me for setup.  Fortunately, it DID make it to my mother.  She loves her Fire!After having a Kindle gen 2, and then an HTC Thunderbolt with the Kindle App...and being so comfy with the Thunderbolt Kindle App that I was reading on it 100%, I sold my Kindle gen 2.Was waiting for a Fire that had HDMI output and the HD did so I bought.  It is beautiful and I like it!Now... I live in rural northwest Montana and by choice have no cable or SAT TV.  I also have no wired DSL, but use Vmobile Hotspot on my Thunderbolt and a MIFI device for internet.  Currently, only 3G.  4 stars because the 3G streaming is marginal vs my ROKU box which does fine.  I'm guessing the ROKU has built in capability for buffering/memory ??  I tested at the same time(s) on each device.  When I go to "town" where there is 4G, the Fire streams and downloads like "fire".  I should have 4G at my home fairly soon so just a waiting game.  Not sure I will use the HDMI as the Kindle screen is wonderful and it is just me so will probably just watch movies, etc. on the Fire.I still read most on my phone but since the Fire gives me access to the lending library will use that as well.Sound is excellent...LOVE the sound...how did they do that???The Fire is just large enough that I am happy with most sites via Web vs my phone which is too small for most.  I have bookmarked favs and like the mobile access to them.I think that sums it up.  For me, the Fire HD is the exact right size with all of the wireless stuff I want, i.e. internet portability in exactly the right size.  Between the Fire and my phone, I am mobile-y happy!***EDIT 10/18/2012I continue to be very happy with the HD Fire after nearly a month's use.  I have not had a single issue with anything not working correctly.  I am enjoying video, music and quick access to the internet anywhere - my phone is a Wi-Fi hot spot or if I'm in town, I have lots of options for wi-fi connecting.  I often have some items queued for download and while I'm grocery shopping, they automagically come to the Fire!  The more I use it, the more comfortable I am with the navigation.Reading:  Although I typically am still using my phone for reading...just habit, I have sampled magazines and cookbooks and very much like how they appear on the Fire.  I have a case which allows vertical and horizontal "standing" so it works very well in the kitchen following a recipe.I did unsubscribe from ads and do like not having them - well worth the extra $15 to me.  The screen saver and recommendations at the bottom of the screen do not bother me and I have often found other things I "need" :) - I will probably not remove them when we are able.In addition to just being very happy with the device, I still feel like it is a bargain, especially as an Amazon Prime member.

Reviews.Title: Big step for Amazon.
Reviews.Author: D.Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD is a strong competitor for tablets like The Nexus 7. And a good competitor for  the iPad also. It shows what Amazon is capable of. The new look feel and feel of this is 10x better than the original one. Even though I had the original for a year and still like it. This one certainly beats it with its new and greater specs and some new features added. Its a win. There's much more I wills like to explain. The device only has a couple of flaws and they're not even a big deal. Like the ad thing on the lock screen. Its nice crisp pictures but its not the nice pictures I wouod like to see. I wouldn't mind the pictures that was on the original Fire. That is really thing that bothers me. Others like app store. I would like to see a selection like from the Play Store on google but I don't really mind I can live with that. Also the camera, I am happy there is one, yes, but you can pretty much say there isn't one because you can only use it for Skype and only Skype. I guess Amazon hasn't developed Albany feature for the camera to use for fun. But its still a good addition for skyping. Overall those are really the only things that I have a problem with. Everything else added and new is great and still love the selection of movies and books and music. I might even get the 8.9" one and give the 7" to my dad and have the original just saved somewhere. I plan on collecting all of them. The device feels good n ky hands and it might be n the heavy side, but its not something of an escuse to complain about. It works faster in. In comparison to the original but its not all that fast and can get a little laggy. But only on Internet. Wleverything else outside of that works fine.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire is Awesome
Reviews.Author: S.Ludwig
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire it's awesomeThe kindle fire can do many things.  It has games, entertainment, top apps and more. It also has music, you can search any music artist that you like of any other songs that you wish to purchase, like Bruno Mars, One Direction or Katie Perry . It also offers a free sample of the music to listen to so you can see if you like the music. You can also purchase books or if you're a prime member of Amazon, it allows you to borrow one book a month.My experience with this is awesome, I love taking it on vacations, family car trips, and to school for assignments and reading.  When you are on family trips or vacations, it keeps you entertained with music, books, games or T.V.  There is also a parent password lock for any parents that don't want their kids surfing the internet, purchasing books, movies/T.V., music or apps without permission.My opinion is it is good for ages 10 and up also if you're looking for something cheaper than an IPad and does most of the things an IPad can then this is for you!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: upgraded and glad I did
Reviews.Author: Monica Bowman "mommyof4"
Reviews.Content: We traded in our Kindle Fires to upgrade to this and the 8.9 coming in November. My son got this one. He is very happy with it. I like the fact that it is slim and the screen is fantastic. The ads on the lock screen are not a big deal. The very first one gave him a video credit of $5 for free. Thank you Amazon. We have had it for one week and very happy with it and I  can't wait for mine. I would recommend getting a case which is a better design than the one we had for the fire. For the price it is well worth the extras you get. We haven't played around with the camera yet but I am sure he will get around to that soon. He really likes the Skylander app which allows him to add characters that he has with the wii game. Anyways, we are very happy.

Reviews.Title: Especially Love The New Sound
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Have been looking at reviews and thought I'd add my 2 cents. We'll get the ad situation out of the way first. Sorry but I just don't have a problem with them. Do I look at many of them? No. Have I bought anything from them yet? No. But for me here's the thing, I don't care what's on the sleep screen, don't know what else to say about that. Different strokes so no need to argue the point.I too missed the battery indicator light until someone mentioned the app Battery HD...now this is a very cool app. If you haven't tried it at least DO try it. You can check to see how much battery you have left for different situations before you leave home so you don't go ballistic when you're away from power and get the "warning". One lady mentioned no clock but if you go to settings and set the clock it appears at the top of the screen between you Kindle Fire name and the WiFi indicator, horizontal or vertical screen. I'm hoping to warm up to the volume controls and the power button. They ARE a little difficult to operate. I love, love, love the fact that I can listen to a book or music or a movie without having to use ear buds. Sound on this thing is great.Bottom line, I do or will love it and without a doubt will sell it and get the next generation when it comes out. Just love having the latest tech....what can I say?

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Becky G
Reviews.Content: It is perfect for everything I need: surfing the net, shopping, reading books, enjoying videos and entertaining my kiddos during the long car rides. All in one small package. The picture and sound are great and the browser speed it fast. Plus it is uber affordable.

Reviews.Title: It does what I expected it to do and looks great doing it
Reviews.Author: voltzgj "Greg"
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of the negative reviews, and it seems like people just didn't do the research before purchasing.I knew going into it that this fire would be more ad subsidized but that is ok with me because it can offer up some good ideas, and maybe even something I never thought of before.The addition of the HDMI, Camera for skyping, and placement of the power switch all are for the better.The only downside is that I still can not use watchESPN.com :(

Reviews.Title: A keeper
Reviews.Author: sstonick "cyberspastic"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD thinking I would compare it with the Kindle Paperwhite when it came out and keep my favorite one. My plan was to keep the one I liked best. Well, now I can say that the Fire HD is not going back, regardless of how I feel about the Paperwhite.The screen is absolutely beautiful. I can really tell the difference when reading (I had the first Fire). The text is crisp and clear. Videos look great.I also have an iPad but I find myself using it less while I use the Fire HD more. I like the portability and just about everything I do on the iPad I can do on the Fire HD.My one complaint is the design of the volume rocker and power button. They are definitely low-key, but to the point where they are hard to find. This is a minor complaint, though.I like this tablet and I think most others will too if their needs are like mine. It's a nice little item.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased first time tablet buyer
Reviews.Author: Travel Fan
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, so I really don't have anything to compare it to. I just wanted to say that so far I am very happy with this product. I also own a keyboard kindle which I have really enjoyed. However, I found myself craving color and the option of using this as a simple way to check my email and to do very limited web browsing when I am on travel. I have had this device now for a couple of days and have been trying out the various features while testing the battery life. I was concerned with some of the reviews regarding the glare and weight of the device. Personally, I had no problem with those. I actually enjoy the weight of HD because I have a better grip and it feels more natural (kind of like a book). I found that I had difficulty gripping the keyboard kindle because it is so thin. I also took the HD outside, directly into the sunlight and found that with a few adjustments to the brightness/background settings,reading was quite pleasant. In fact, I rather like the ability to be able to change the background color on my books. With that said, I do miss the battery life I have with my other kindle but realize that with a tablet there is a tradeoff. All in all, after having read the reviews, I never expected this to be an Ipad and am actually quite happy it is not. This Kindle is ideal for those who want something with a little more punch than an e-reader, but not the excessive and pricey features of other tablets. I am looking forward to taking this on travel with me.

Reviews.Title: Daughter loves her Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Peendog
Reviews.Content: My daughter lost her Ipod Touch and was looking for a replacement. I have owned the original Fire and suggested she try the Fire HD for the same price as the 8GB Touch. She is very happy. She grabs her HD as soon as she arrives from school to check her facebook, Skype and email. She talks with her friends in China on Skype. She listens to music from our cloud player or youtube (Amazon needs a Youtube app). She loves watching moves from my prime account (10 devices on one account is awesome). She was able to download any game that I have already purchased on my Fire. She even uses my Galaxy S3 as a router while away from wifi. It is a great replacement for the Ipod Touch and a perfect first tablet for a child.I am looking forward to replacing my Fire with a Fire HD 8.9 in November.One complaint is the price of the covers.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Rosetta Malvese
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying I have the ipad  3 and kindle fire 1.  The Kindle Fire HD is a huge improvement from the previous generation.  The screen quality is way clear and sharp. The video play is smooth and clear and it seems like they have expanded the prime selections somewhat from several months ago.  Prime is a must if you have the Fire.  The browser is improved also but not quiet there.  For the money it is backed with value. It does everything my ipad does at a smaller more affordable price.  I love the new book organizing with the suggestions based on what you read posted at the bottom. Some have complained about that but it is a cleave marketing tool.  Some have also complained about the app selection. The app selection is the largest of all the book readers and has expanded greatly since I got my kindle 1 when it was first released.  The Nook does nit have half the amount and what they do have they charge a lot per app for.

Reviews.Title: What It Has Is Nice....But Some Glaring Omissions
Reviews.Author: Chris K. Opfell
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle Fire HD 7" for my wife. We thought it would be like other Android 4.0 devices in that it would do voice searches and basic dictation using apps like Dragon Flex T9. Since it does video calls in Skype, it has a built in Mic. However, the mic will not work with any other apps. I called Amazon support about this and CSR said she was not aware of this issue. However, after doing some research, she indicated that the Mic in the Kindle Fire HD was not enabled to support Voice apps at this time. This is really disappointing and I am just sitting here scratching my head debating over whether to return it and wait until the Apple Mini comes out or hang on to it and see if there is some software solution from Amazon.Given that the Fire HD plays movies well, with fast buffering, and does sound appreciably better than my iPad 3 with the stereo speakers, and the screen resolution is about as satisfying, I would really like to keep it. But, my wife says that the lack of Voice capability is a "deal breaker" so, be warned. If only Amazon would enable the Mic so it can work like other Android 4.0 devices........

Reviews.Title: This is a review about the packaging and the power adapter
Reviews.Author: avmaniac
Reviews.Content: Just got my Fire HD today. Pretty happy about the performance of the machine. There are plenty of other reviews in that regard so no need to repeat. What I want to point out in this review is how impressed I am about the efforts Amazon put into to save the earth. The whole package is mostly made of paper and recyclable material. You can tell they have put some thought into the packaging design so it doesn't take lots of space, or filled with plastic bags yet the content is still being protected. There is still plastic in the packaging, but it was kept impressively minimal.The other thing is what most of people complained about: the power adapter. Amazon provides only a USB cable in the box. It can be plugged into your computer or any USB charger you can buy for less than 10 bucks anywhere. This is definitely a step toward the right direction. Think about it, over the years, how many different chargers you have collected with the electronic gadgets you purchased. After the electronics become obsolete after six months, those chargers will just end up in the landfill. Using the standard USB charger benefits the consumers as well, it's exchangeable and can be easily replaced so you don't have to spend a fortune if you lose your original one. This is definitely a trend I like to see.We all love our gadgets and will not hesitate to pay for the next newer better models. They are hard to resist. But at least we can try to be responsible consumers.

Reviews.Title: A killer tablet at a killer price - revised 9/18
Reviews.Author: J. Williams "genuine, bona fide, geek"
Reviews.Content: I am on to my third Kindle now. I have a Kindle Keyboard 3g an original Fire and now the Fire HD. The new Fire takes everything that was great about the old one and improves on it.The Screen? Fantastic and every bit as good as an iPad frankly. The new multi-touch is way better than the original as well. Reading is truly excellent and HD movies and shows are top notch.The speakers? Just amazing for a device this size and easily the best speakers on any tablet device and a significant number of lap tops.The speed? Perfect. Scrolling is smooth and fast with no delays or redrawing for any action.The WiFi? Wow! Super fast and quick to connect. I'm sitting on a Delta flight and things are as quick as expected. Big improvement on any other tablet.The Kindle OS is much improved and a lot slicker this time around. Music sounds great through head phones and battery life appears to be excellent.Simply put you cannot buy a better device at this price anywhere. The Kindle leather case is a worthy addition too. As an aside the special offers are unobtrusive and paying $15 to get rid of them makes no sense.There are a couple of issues with text entry but nothing dramatic. If you have an original Fire the 7" is still worth the update. Cannot wait until a case with Blue tooth keyboard is released.9/18 update===========The advertising has just managed to hand me $10 in credit. An ad asked me how I would like $5 towards MP3s and I got it just by swiping the Advert and saying "yes please!"Then another appeared offering $5 towards a movie rental and it was the same deal; just swipe and say yes.Off I headed and paid for half an album I wanted and downloaded a movie rental in HD of a movie I intend to watch tonight while traveling. Those that paid an extra $15 to get rid of the Adverts just missed out on $10 of free stuff.Yesterday evening I tried out streaming over hotel WiFi and the Fire HD is definitively better than the original Fire or my laptop. The original Fire cannot hold a stream going and keeps buffering. The Fire HD kept a stream going for over 30 minutes uninterrupted and then only had odd buffers that lasted less than a second every so often at the end. Even my laptop couldn't do that.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Todd Leatherman
Reviews.Content: I got my new Kindle Fire HD yesterday. I spent 3 hours with it and for the most part I like it.Pros:Blindingly fast responsivenessFast downloadsGreat soundFairly simple to useGreat graphicsCons:The on/off and volume buttons are hard to findPower cord only hooks up to a computer, no wall adaptor (luckily I had my wall connector from my old Kindle, which worked fine)Ads when you turn it onThe interface took some time to understand. It doesn't seem as intuitive as some other tablets I've used, but it may just be my unfamiliarity with it. I'm embarrassed to say I spent about half an hour trying to find the settings. They are in the pull down menu from the top of the screen; there is no icon for it. The beginning instructions showed me that, but I forgot. It is a bit hard to hold. I'll be getting a case very soon. That should resolve the finding the power button and ease of holding issues. I'd heard it was Facebook integrated, but there wasn't an icon for that either. Pulling it up from the internet browser gave me the tablet/phone interface I'm familiar with. There are ads when you turn it on, but they aren't obnoxious or obtrusive.The carousel on the home menu is great. It automatically adds your most recent applications to the front. Adding and removing items from your carousel and favorites is dead simple. I have to admit, I'm not really a music guy, but the sound was fantastic! The screen resolution and responsiveness of the touch screen were incredible! Once I spent some time with the interface I found it easy to use and really quick to get from app to app. The picture quality blew me away. The downloads are also lighting fast. I started to load up my favorite apps and was done in less than five minutes!Overall, I'm very happy with it. I know I'll be spending countless hours reading, facebooking, playing games with friends, and watching shows and movies. I'm looking forward to enjoying my Kindle Fire HD for years to come!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: sparky
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD today, and it is fabulous. Great improvement over the Kindle Fire. Graphics are crystal clear. I have not experienced any "scratching" while navigating through the carousel, movie playback is outstanding, I was able to skip around to different scenes in a movie with instantaneous playback.the Xray for Movies feature is genius. and significantly enhances watching the movie.Others in my family have a nexus 7 and the Kindle Fire HD is a serious competitor.The page turning feature in the newstand section is nifty! a great implementation for reading magazines.There is significantly less glare on the screen which makes a huge difference when reading books and watching movies.They Skype app using the new camera worked really well and the picture was perfect.Accessing the web was not that much faster than the Kindle Fire. The default search engine was Bing - which I switched to Google.I use Amazon MP3 and i had access to my 1400 songs instantaneously via the cloud service.

Reviews.Title: changing my tune..
Reviews.Author: Donald Graham
Reviews.Content: i was very impressed with this device at first, but that feeling has quickly changed. the Android OS is very buggy and unstable like most Android devices that i have encountered. as an E book reader it works fine, but if you are a power user and attempt to use this thing as a tablet you will soon feel the pain and constraints of this thing. i was happy at first because i could hook up HDMI to my TV, but after several app crashes and reboots, i feel like i am testing an unfinished product.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Amazon Content Device, Worthy Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Stanley Fu
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a tablet to replace a notebook or desktop and looking for ways to enhance your office productivity, this is not the product for you.  If you want a tablet that provides endless amount of entertainment and media options, delivered to you quick and simple while always looking for new book, movies, or game suggestions that might interest you, the Kindle Fire HD is absolutely perfect.  Regarding the first point, given that this is the 2nd generation of Fire tablets I feel that this device should no longer be docked a star for lacking things like the full Google Play store.  Amazon has fully established that this is a different beast, and really focuses completely on delivering a massive amount of media to the user.  In that regard, it excels.As an owner of the previous Kindle Fire, the new version is an upgrade in every facet.  The resolution is higher and the screen looks far sharper and clearer, delivering a much more pleasant quality across the board, whether it be reading books or watching HD movies.  The sound output has significantly been upgraded, so that finally there's a portable device that can put out sound that everyone in the room can hear, something my other portable devices or laptops can't do.  The faster processor and additional RAM onboard has resulted in a far smoother, snappier UI.  The carousel now flips through your recently used content without the lag in the original Fire, making it easy to pick and choose applications without missing any screen presses.  Need more memory to load your own content?  16 or 32 GB is far better then 8 GB, where I felt limited as to what I could load on my Fire.  As for the device itself, while the width of the device is increased slightly, the thinner size and additional bezel actually make it more comfortable to hold in both portrait and landscape modes for reading or viewing content.  For current Fire owners, the upgrade is well worth the money as the Fire HD just delivers a more complete and pleasant experience because of the upgraded hardware.  Technical spec listings are great, but all people need to know is that Amazon has released a far more refined version of what they wanted to do last year, and it definitely shows when using the device.The UI is also tweaked from the original Fire, as this comes out as version 7.1.5 versus 6.3.3 on the old Fire.  The categories at the top have been revised to focus on content, adding links like Shop and Audiobooks to the menu.  Below the carousel where "favorites" used to automatically sit now show suggested content.  Recently on a news webpage?  It now shows trending articles.  Recently played Angry Birds?  It now suggests other games like Where's My Perry or Cut the Rope.  Just watched Thor via Amazon Prime Streaming?  It also suggests Captain America and Iron Man.  Like I said, Amazon is trying it's hardest to send content your way, and the Fire HD delivers it without being too obtrusive.  I could do with the small text at the bottom left corner telling me to read Harry Potter for free with Amazon Prime, but that's a minor annoyance that could go away depending on how that changes with my usage patterns.As for Games, it doesn't seem like too many of my existing games support Amazon's new GameCircle feature that adds achievements and friends.  I see Jetpack Joyride, Cut the Rope, and Temple Run with it though and its kind of neat for those that play a lot of games on the device.Yes the web browser defaults to Bing search.  Yes, you can easily change it to Google from the Settings. :)And finally... while yes, there are ads on the lock screen, I also was able to receive a free $5 Amazon MP3 credit.  I can live with a few Ultrabook or Titanic movie ads in return.  It might not be as elegant as the images of records or patterns like on the old Fire, but if Amazon wants to give me more free credit periodically, I'd gladly take the half second to glance at the ads before unlocking my device.Overall, an incredibly fine device.  Amazon has a winner here, especially if you already find yourself checking your Gold Box every day and adding items to your wish list or cart while watching for price drops.

Reviews.Title: like my old fire better
Reviews.Author: Tracey
Reviews.Content: I wanted to wait a few days before I posted my disappointments to see if they would lessen over time. They have not.I'm not one to notice better sound, HD etc. I do like the side charge better than the bottom charge as well as the top controls versus the bottom controls. The new fire is much clearer and is noticeably more crisp. I would not however trade these for the features they could have fixed and the things they changed.1-FULL OF ADVERTISEMENTS. I don't want pop ups every time I turn it on.2-My main page favorites are now hidden under a tab so they can advertise. See dislike #1.3-Still no feature for sorting/ organizing my books into categories. That was something I was really hoping for.4-Charging cord is USB only. You must buy an AC adapter.I want my old one back.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy "REFURBISHED"
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "sistercon"
Reviews.Content: This is my second refurbished Kindle Fire HD and I do not recommed them. I sent the first one back because it wouldn't recognize that the internet connection was on even though it clearly showed it was connected on the top of the screen. I would have to turn it off and then turn it back on to work. Also the speakers had a popping sound even when turned off. The warranty was good and the people I complained to were very helpful. I got a replacement within 2 days. I've had this one for a couple weeks now and it too has issues. When reading or doing any task it will suddenly shut down for no apparent reason. The picture is excellent and the sound is much better than my first Kindle Fire. I am going to send this one back and I'll not get another "refurbished" because they obviously did not fix the original problem in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL
Reviews.Author: Tim Collins
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE, after a few months with this device it is slow, randomly turns off and freezes. It may be more expensive,but buy the iPad

Reviews.Title: Did not work properly. Returned it.
Reviews.Author: Tanya Landry
Reviews.Content: Received when I was told. Opened to start using and right away the screen was froze. Reset and tried again. Worked for awhile then froze again. This happened all to frequently, like every time I turned it on. I guess "certified refurbished to work like new" doesn't mean what I thought it meant. I returned it within 2 days of having it. NOT HAPPY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Its great, but warranty isnt....
Reviews.Author: Binky784
Reviews.Content: I was totally enjoyed when I received my refurbished Kindle Fire HD 7".  But unfortunately my kid dropped it.  There is a nice crack in the screen afterwards.  I called to see if I could have it repaired, but was informed that my one year warranty is now voided since there is physical damage to the device.  And they don't repair physical damage.  I have to send back my working screen damaged kindle in order to purchase a reduced price of another certified refurbished kindle for $89 or purchase a brand new device discounted for $119 and then I can purchase the extended warranty that is offered with new device purchases only.  I used to be a loyal amazon customer but after this I will purchase all hardware devices solely from a physical local store; that way I can get REAL warranty coverage for my device.

Reviews.Title: replacement
Reviews.Author: glowash
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for my defective Kindle Fire HD.  My previous Kindle Fire HD kept shutting down so I called Amazon and they sent me a replacement.  My old Kindle was near the end of my warranty and I was happy to hear that they would replace it.  So far the replacement is working great.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: erinstarr
Reviews.Content: People do not realize.. amazon warehouse deals does not mean it's damaged. It goes through testing and certification and lists every little scuff. I always look at warehouse deals when I want something

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: paco castillo "airpaco"
Reviews.Content: love this kindle and the free stuff that it comes with,if you have prime membership  and great price for my taste

Reviews.Title: Will Fail After 2 years
Reviews.Author: Joe Z
Reviews.Content: Loved this Kindle Fire until it suddenly failed with less than 2 years of normal use.  Warranty was void after 1 year.  Now it's a brick and won't turn on.  I don't know about you, but I have plenty of other devices that work well past 2 years.  I won't be buying another Kindle.  Having a $200+ device fail completely after 2 years is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: I love and hate it all in one.
Reviews.Author: DeDe
Reviews.Content: I saved up and got this two years ago as a Christmas present to myself and I was not disappointed. I love it and use it every day, thing is- the one I currently have is my fourth one. Two of them froze up during automatic upgrades and the third started to cut off on its own, all the time even when it was fully charged. But customers service was excellent and the return processes were easy, IF YOU HAVE AN EXTENDED WARRANTY, they replaced all within two business days.I still use it and love it, l just know there will come a time to return this one and I s don't know if my WARRANTY will be good when ever that time comes.

Reviews.Title: Replace Kindle w/refurbished one
Reviews.Author: Patrice Cornick
Reviews.Content: My Kindle died and could not be fixed.  Amazon's Customer Service helped me one to replace it at a reasonable price; walked me through how to return the broken one for credit towards the refurbished one I purchased.  I have had the new one for weeks now and am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: not so happy
Reviews.Author: pearlene jewell
Reviews.Content: If I had known this products was not a dependable item I would not have bought it, don't waste your money just go with the Ipad to start with, it has been replaced twice and still does not work

Reviews.Title: Broken Already
Reviews.Author: Pat McGinnis
Reviews.Content: The little plastic tab that is the power on button broke off so I have tape over it to keep it in place! I wwould love to get a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Deal
Reviews.Author: janel barton
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter saved her money for a year and chose to buy a "tablet". We reviewed the best options for her age and what she wanted, as well as what we wanted for her. This was the perfect choice! She loves it!

Reviews.Title: Replacement Kindle
Reviews.Author: Judith A. Sandage
Reviews.Content: My Kindle quit charging after about 10 months. I called Amazon, they had me do some testing and different things to try, it still wouldn't take a charge. They sent me a replacement within a week. I am so impressed with their customer service and I love having a working Kindle again.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Holly J
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. It's the first e-reader I've owned. I use it to read books & magazines, watch videos, and surf the internet. Love that I can access my cloud storage wherever I am so that I can manage my sewing business and Etsy shop any time I need to without having to haul around a larger tablet or laptop. My Kindle tucks neatly into my handbag.

Reviews.Title: I loved the device so much
Reviews.Author: Christopher Paul
Reviews.Content: I loved the device so much, that I bought 1 for my daughters 6 months later. Its been a year and 4 months and now it won't charge. At first it was sporadic, but now it doesn't even register that its plugged in. I tried it with the superfast charger and the USB, no luck.  When I contacted Amazon, they tried to sell me a refurbished one for 20 bucks less than I can get it for new.Even though its a defective product, Amazon won't stand by it. I understand that there is a warranty period, but honestly, a tablet should last much longer than that. My husband has a Samsung Galaxy Tablet that is older than my kindle and it works fine.  I won't be buying any more kindle products. They may be cheaper, but if you have to replace it every year or two, its not really.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire Family
Reviews.Author: Jodi Hunt
Reviews.Content: I got this from my husband for my birthday. It replaced a Kindle fire 1st generation. (He is still using that one.) I love the kindle. I did have one problem with it and called Amazon. They went through the steps and replaced it with no problems. This second one is good.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: LilWoolf "LilWoolf"
Reviews.Content: I have quit using my computer (lap top) since I received this Kindle.  It is amazing.  Small enough to fit in my purse. I take it on cruises and sit in the lounges (or by the pool) watching the world float by as I play games or chat with friends.  I JUST LOVE THIS.  Best purchase I ever made!!!  Amazon Prime is FANTASTIC also!!!

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy a Refurbished Kindle!
Reviews.Author: P . Powell
Reviews.Content: I would not suggest any refurbished Kindle to anyone.  I had such horrible luck with the two that I received.  The first one lasted 4 days and the second one lasted 2 days.  I was not impressed with the Refurbished Kindle's at all.  In the end, I got a refund for the entire amount and purchased a tablet instead.

Reviews.Title: Great Except for Long-term Battery Life
Reviews.Author: RockyPalomino
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle Fire HD. It has been everything I've expected and needed it to be...but only for one year. Once it hit the one-year mark the battery has not held a charge for long. Same thing happened with our daughter's Kindle Fire and her mother-in-law's Kindle. Fortunately for them, they both had purchased an extended warranty and got their units replaced. Something to consider, especially since the batteries are not easy to replace, and are not even sold by Amazon, but are available through a third-party vendor. Not so sure I'll get another Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Performance issues
Reviews.Author: TN Quilter "TN Quilter"
Reviews.Content: I have only had my Fire (upgraded from Touch) less than 6 months, and I am already having "issues" with it!  It has been replaced once already and now it will not connect to Wi-Fi.  This is becoming a hassle!!

Reviews.Title: The tablet thats all profit. $99 day after makes a cheap e reader. Will never buy again ever. No external memory slot.
Reviews.Author: WoodHog
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra $200-300 for a real tablet.This is day after thanks sale priced $99 entertainment & sales marketing tablet.OR a dirt cheap book reader alternative for meStill with no external memory slot its basically overpriced junk.You will be backing up your own homemade files & books on a computer. Purchases end on a storage cloud.You only control a small portion of this tablet.Being forced to watch advertisements or pay more to turn off the ads.Once again it has its issues.The internet drains/consumes the battery life severely.This tablet refused to connect to the internet with errors.After resetting the tablet to factory defaults a prime screen advertisement appeared forcing me to click on a free trial I never wanted just to proceed with fully starting the tablet after resetting factory defaults.That's just nasty.I had to go online into my account & decline the automatic billing for $99 after the 30 day trial ends.

Reviews.Title: Poor Device
Reviews.Author: Megan Heinze
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write negative reviews, however, I'm highly dissatisfied with my kindle fire. I've had problems with the device charging. I received a replacement kindle once already because of charging issues. Now that my replacement kindle is no longer charging and I'm just out of my warranty, Amazon will not fix or repair my device.  I would not recommend this product to anyone.  If I would have realized how quickly this device was going to die, I would've spent a little more money for a higher quality brand.  I'm not hard on my electronics and I've never experienced a company that didn't stand by their defective product.  When I called customer service, the representative seemed more interested in selling me a new kindle than helping me fix my current kindle.  The only option I was given was to buy a new kindle.

Reviews.Title: REview of Kindle 2  HD7 refurbished
Reviews.Author: Judithann
Reviews.Content: The device eats power.  It is also not as touch sensitive as it should be. I cannot listen to music with headphones.  I must use the device as a radio.  Games do not upload quickly.  I cannot access my email app.  I have to reboot very often and it doesn't always solve the problem.  Enough said.  It is far more multidemensional than my first Kindle.  But it has come with its own frustrations and I think Amazon is not doing justice to the Prime members or providing the best product in this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Third time charm?
Reviews.Author: Patricia L.
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire when it is working properly. This is my third one; the previous two returned under warranty for various problems. Maybe the third time is charm.

Reviews.Title: I don't like it.
Reviews.Author: Gina M.
Reviews.Content: I keep getting an error message saying low on storage so I can't play games,or read books & yet it's a 16 gb. Very frustrated. Can't seem to get any help on how to fix the issue as I work odd hours. I don't think I will ever buy a Kindle again very sad :-( :-( I did like that I was able to get my email messages without any issues.

Reviews.Title: 2 Refurbished replacement don't play any videos and they lag
Reviews.Author: KRISTI
Reviews.Content: both refurbished kindles received will not play videos like youtube.  I feel the should be refurbished like new. I DID pay for two and I did return the my originals ones to you.  What should i do?

Reviews.Title: not worth exchanging for refurbished
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Randall
Reviews.Content: I spent $111 on a kindle that works OK but I still have to prop the cord just so or it won't charge. I also had to unregister it 3 times and reload all my apps after each start just to get 11.5 of the 16 g I was supposed to have. The tech on the phone said "Is that good enough?" Really?? I just said sure and hung up. I should have just bought a new kindle.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Marylou Gehringer
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement Kindle. I was not told that the replacement was a refurbished model which did not work straight out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Not all I'd hoped for.....
Reviews.Author: Kirsten
Reviews.Content: I haven't been super thrilled with the Kindle. I bought 3 Kindles for my kids for Christmas and have had problems with 2 of the 3. I have been sent 3 replacements for 1 of them. I was excited about my kids being able to read on it and maybe do a little homework.  They are able to read and down some of the books they are interested in and play a few games but thats about it. Microsoft isn't compatible with the device there for they must type their book reports on our computer. Quite a few of the apps they wanted aren't available on the Kindle. I'm wishing I would have got them Android Tablets instead.

Reviews.Title: I'm on my 4th replacement in a year
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have literally had my kindle replaced now to where I am on my 4th replacement, this is an atrocious buy I have had NOTHING but problems it has no real power and no I don't use it for work just recreation, it is almost useless...very irritated I wasted 200.00!!!

Reviews.Title: Shuts down at will!!!
Reviews.Author: Bimak
Reviews.Content: This is my worst investment ever! The device shuts down at will, even when the battery is fully charged. The battery does not last as long as claimed. I guess I got what I paid for. Bottom line, never buying anything factory refurbished from Amazon again, EVER! I must state though that this is the only Amazon purchase I've had an issue with.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Estella
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire HD has beautiful color.  Touch screen works well and apps are very easy to download.  Holds oodles of books.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire HG 7#
Reviews.Author: Denise Drost
Reviews.Content: We have had numerous problems since getting it.  Now it won't even turn on.  My son is afraid he'll lose all of his games he purchased.

Reviews.Title: Dead just after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: Kristi O.
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle Fire, but as soon as the warranty ended, it died.  Now I am stuck with a useless device and 2 very unhappy kids.

Reviews.Title: Major design flaw!
Reviews.Author: Catie S. "Crunchy Mama"
Reviews.Content: Originally purchased for my son, who is 9. The version he has was the original with the charging port on the side. Something about the way it was designed, the port keeps failing internally so that it won't connect to charge when you plug it in. My 4 and 6 year olds have the one that plugs in at the bottom, never any issues. We've had to return this kindle 3 or 4 times now for a replacement. We're currently waiting on a refund which will take about two weeks after amazon receives the returned (again!!!) kindle. And we aren't even being refunded the full $199 that was paid for the defective kindle. I'm so over Amazon and their outsourcing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Deborah S. Stacy
Reviews.Content: I love this device. I am bedridden, without a computer, so this is what keeps me connected to the outside world. I also use it for games, which keeps me occupied, and keeps me from going crazy.I've had this for more than a year now, and only have two problems with it. The first is that eventually it stops charging, but this is negated by Amazon's excellent customer service, and the fact that they stand behind their products, so when it starts having charging problems, I just call them, and they either fix it, or replace the device!However the second problem I have found no solution for, which is why I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5. The cord is much too short, and won't work with an extension cord. Amazon, you REALLY NEED to make a longer cord for this. As I said I'm bedridden, and can't get any closer to an outlet, and the cord is too short to allow me to continue using it while it's charging. Please make a longer cord!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't make sense
Reviews.Author: Mr.Awesome364
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my son and put took it away while he was on punishment. To my surprise, when I returned it to him it would not charge at all. This is the second time in the year he's had it it would not charge.  The first time Amazon sent me a replacement charger this time they offered to sell me a brand new Kindle. Huh? If you know there is a problem with your device once the battery drains why try to sell me another one of the same product.  Never again.

Reviews.Title: Replacement was atrocious
Reviews.Author: Robin Howell
Reviews.Content: The product was defective out the box. My original brand new kindle only had a charging issue which is still not resolved but the replacement display was flickering had multiple vertical colored lines and continued to freeze.  I felt and feel that amazon should have done a better job checking out the refurbished replacement before sending it to THIER customer.  I don't understand what your warranty actually warrants if this is the type of service we get

Reviews.Title: great !
Reviews.Author: felicia
Reviews.Content: this is a great product, bought it for my boyfriend for a Christmas present. i searched for this version because the newer version didnt have a camera. only could find a certified refurbished one and you cant even tell its refurbished! came in a new box and everything. to this day he doesnt even know is certified refurbished! great buy!

Reviews.Title: Spend your money elsewhere!
Reviews.Author: TurtleHerderX3
Reviews.Content: It was good while it lasted...which was 13 months. Then all of a sudden it stopped charging. Amazon tells me tough luck, buy a new one. Way to stand behind your product! Don't waste your money, unless you plan on buying a new one every year!

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: china
Reviews.Content: I like the slim shape an color. I love it I can use it at work with the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: Wi fi issues
Reviews.Author: dylan
Reviews.Content: This wouldn't work with my home wi fi or hot-spot... The issue was with the kindle and how it was refurbished.When I called to complain, costumer service couldn't solve the problem and then instead of just replacing it started asking for log downloads and info about my internet provider and router, even though I had no problems with my previous kindle fire and my iphone or Macbook.After spending more than an hour with various tech support and needing to answer more than three emails I decided to return the device.I was surprised and disappointed with Amazons product and customer care which for the first time let me down!

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: Nurse83 "MBE,RN"
Reviews.Content: Never again will I purchase a refurbished product, certified or not.  It had not been updated, had problems from the minute it came out of the box.  I could not get my previously purchased books from my Kindle (bought in Dec 2012, I think) to download.  I was on the phone to numerous techs ( who I would give 5 stars to the tech dept).  Finally, my 30 books were put into the device, but this device is loaded with at least 10 dictionaries from every language in the world and you are unable to delete any of them.  They take up precious space.  So I had 16GB of space,supposedly, add my books, type in my email address, Facebook info and the device said it was full and I needed to delete apps as nothing else could be added.  I had no games, videos, pics, movies, etc.  If you look at the fine print on the technical page that describes the device on the Amazon site, you will see that there is only 10GB of space for the owner.  Everything else is filled with apps from the factory.  No way this could be used by an entire family.  So back it went and I bought a new Kindle paperwhite that will hold many books and will use my computer for anything else.

Reviews.Title: Sorry to be disappointed in this
Reviews.Author: MN Momma
Reviews.Content: We bought our 7 and 10 year olds each one of these for Christmas 2012.  The things we considered were price, size, age of our children, available features. The price versus Apple was definitely a factor, but the thing that tipped the scales was the Freetime app and the unlimited Freetime option. We are thrilled to be able to set how long they can be on the device and what they can access. We do our best to keep track of what they can access and this app helps tremendously. I have recommended it to others.The problem we have encountered has been the quality of the device itself. We had to have both of them replaced a couple of times. I am so glad we had the extended warranty (which we don't usually buy!) the port that the charger plugs into seems to loosen and then you cannot get the device to charge. We don't let the kids plug them in, they have to have us do it, so I know it isn't anything they are doing. When it comes time to purchase another, we will not be buying a kindle. :(I will say, with the exception of one person, the Amazon customer support has been great to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Certified Refurbished Kindle Fire  does NOT meet expectations - 3 times!
Reviews.Author: Maureen Cooper
Reviews.Content: I received on of the original Kindles as a gift last year.  because of a problem in the design, after a few months the power cord would no longer connect to the Kindle.  When I called about the problem, I was offered a "wonderful" opportunity to receive a replacement kindle for a greatly reduced price. The explanation was that I would receive the replacement kindle at this great price because of the design flaw with the original Kindle.Needless to say I was shocked to receive not a new, but a refurbished kindle in the mail.  However, it was a newer model and I did save a lot of money.  Except - now I am on the 3rd replacement kindle within a few months.  Each replacement kindle has had a problem.  The current kindle (my 4th), powers off anytime I shift position.  To read without constantly restarting, I have to continually restart!  Same problem the last one had!  Save yourself the trouble!  Just haven't had the time, or the energy, to go back through the process again.  Save yourself the trouble and just by a new kindle!! Or maybe a Nook would be a better choice . . .

Reviews.Title: Best service any where !!
Reviews.Author: I love this game.not a lot of lock out time.f...
Reviews.Content: This little device is better than my samsung galaxy tab 2 and 4, awesome graphics and sound, tons of free games and books, extremley long battery life.The best in customer service, very fast and very customer oriented, AKA, they treat you like you're the best thing since sliced bread... Yes like a celebrity.. And free shipping and returns ( not that you'll be returning your new HD, never )

Reviews.Title: Not Durable
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheUSA
Reviews.Content: I've owned 4 Kindles so far and they all perform very well.  The one major drawback is the power cord connection.  It is not durable at all and you have to be very careful not to move the Kindle while it's plugged in. I had to replace 3 Kindles in the last 2 years and thankfully it was under warranty.  I don't have the the new version HDX Kindle yet so I can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: LUZ-DEL-ALBA SOTO
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 7.  I have an I pad but when i seen how much more i can do with the Kindle Fire, I had to get it.  In my home we have 3 devices.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Trauger
Reviews.Content: This was a great price!  Hours of entertainment for my daughter!  It was an awesome Xmas gift!  Glad I purchased it!

Reviews.Title: The Jury is Still Out on Kindle
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: The (first) Kindle worked well for awhile, but then one of the speakers stopped working.  Earbuds worked on both channels, but not the built in speaker.  The folks at Amazon tried to resolve the problem, but eventually decided that the unit needed to be replaced.  The replacement process was very smooth and prompt.The second Kindle unit works well, but now has started to lock up when using the Kindle Reader.  I have had to reboot multiple times, and I'm not sure the problem is resolved.  This is particularly frustrating right now because I'm traveling a lot, and would like to have a working reader for the long flights.To their credit the Chat and Phone help desk people have been very helpful, and extremely patient and courteous.

Reviews.Title: suck it ipad!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy Meade
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle for reading or surfing the net.  I never use our ipad anymore.  I prefer the kindle!!  Easier  to surf the net.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Buy & as good as a New Item
Reviews.Author: D. Reich
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a deal and have reservations about items being a refurbished item, well, check out the Certified items at Amazon, I bought a Kindle Fire HD 7', it looked and has ran as good as any of the new items I previously bought! Plus it is warranted to meet or exceed any new item being sold, my unit is exactly the same as a new item! I highly recommend the refurbished Kindles, and Yes you do save some money as well, check them out and you'll see why so many do buy refurbished items here on Amazon, a great Price, looks and feels like New and saving Money to boot! You really can't go wrong..... ~Dave in CA

Reviews.Title: So Frustrated when I use this: Freeze Issues, USB Cable Issues.
Reviews.Author: Vanessa L Terrazas
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Kindle Fire HD 7inch for a little over a year now, so I think I'm qualified to give a fair assessment of it. First, I choose Kindle Fire because of all the great positive reviews, price, and ease of downloading items from the Amazon Store.I travel alot of work and use the Kindle mostly during these periods of time.  I'm not a heavy user and only have 5 books downloaded, 1 game, and three movies. I use it mainly to check email, Facebook, and access other areas of the internet to keep me occupied when traveling.My main issues with the Kindle are these:1.  The USB cable has to fit a certain way in the Kindle in order for it to properly charge. Trust me, I know how to but a USB cable into the Kindle, but once in, I may have to prop the Kindle on top of a book or maniuplate the cable somehow to charge. I've tried other cables and the same thing happesn.2. The Kindle freezes on me ALOT!!  While clicking on links (even in the AMAZON STORE) I have to click on a URL several times to get the link to unfreeze or I have to wait several minutes.  This happens all the time. I don't understand how people cannot find this frustrating.I see people using other tablets with no problems.  They swipe the pages, click on links, and charge without any issues.Just really not happy with the product. It has to many issues to offer timely entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 32GB
Reviews.Author: Chester Conger
Reviews.Content: Bought Kindle Fire HD to act as a replacement for iPod Touch 4th Gen. I wanted to have my music library and have a screen that I could read. The iPod touch is becoming way too small for my eyesight. It's a age thing. Uploaded an app for music player and a calendar. Both apps kind of stink compared to the standard iPod apps. The Kindle has great sound for the size speakers and the Kindle flip cover works great for turning on and off the Kindle. Am I unhappy, not really. Could the andriod apps be better?, You Bet.I will be looking for a better calendar app and a music app and life will be great.Super display and the quick start from sleep mode is excellent

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mrs Sera Minchin
Reviews.Content: I am happy that I chose to buy this kindle as I like photography so the books are great in the colour format. Thanks amazon for a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Kindle vs Kindle Fire HD vs Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Donna M. Weigel "Donna Weigel"
Reviews.Content: I had a kindle before the Kindle fire ( and I waited for the HD version) that I loved but was becoming limited since I also wanted to convenience of checking email and going on the internet, following links in a ebook etc.  I was so in love with my regular kindle and was a reading fool on that thing. I had a relationship with it. Let's face it, I slept with it more than I have any man. Lol.  Giving it up and moving on was not an easy decision.Kindle vs Kindle Fire HD vs Fire HDX.Kindle:  Love the light shining on the book rather back lit.  It is far less stressful reading.  The gray background allowed me to read forever easily.  I loved how easy it was to organize books. However, it had become limited.  I couldn't really surf the internet, magazines and pictures wouldn't work on it well and it was black and white.  Pretty sure you know the rest.Kindle Fire:  I don't by the first of anything because it will improve and become cheaper.  The biggest issue with the kindle fire was it didn't have a reader and I do use that often.  The front page was a bookshelf which is ok but couldn't organize like the reg kindle.Kindle Fire HD:  I hate the carousel on kindle fire HD.  It's a circle of icons in which the last thing you opened goes up there.  Want it or not.  You can delete from the carousel but something else will pop up there that is on your device. It has a set number of icons it wants there and it will keep it filled.  Grrr.  I wish it would just go away.  I liked how I could organize my books on the regular kindle.  That said, there are apps that make that happen so it makes life easier. You know there HAS to be an app for that!  Over all the organization isn't bad. It's simple to use.  My six year old can use it no problem. But then again, kids are born knowing these things today.  Being back lit vs light shining on the book isn't as easy to read as the original kindle was.  The back light can be adjusted way down which is a plus. I don't think this is a big issue to most people.  I'm dyslexic and having dimmer light on the gray background rocked!  I could be a reading fool.  I can't read as long on this.  As I said though for most people that probably isn't an issue.  After my withdraw from my original kindle I love this one.  SO much more you can do with it!!  The battery doesn't last like the original but we are doing WAY more with this one than just read.  AND naturally there is an app for that!!!  There are battery savers that shut down what isn't needed and does make a difference in battery life.  Considering with I do however I think the battery isn't bad. I play music and a game at the same time or music and read, music and read.  I am asking a lot! I was use to the other battery lasting for weeks.  One plus is my phone charger works for the kindle.  I'm just overall too happy with the upgrade to Kindle Fire HD.HD vs HDX.I got the HD with Ads because I didn't care to pay to not have them. I'm really glad I did that.  I like the ads.  There were some movie and TV trailers that I would have otherwise missed.  Product ads you never know but they aren't annoying at all.My son bought the HDX.  He loves it.As far as I can tell the big difference is with the HDX you can have Wifi and cell towers.  Oh and the live help.  I asked if I could upgrade because it came out right after I bought my HD. The answer was no, I would need to sell it myself.  I'm glad I didn't. I don't need to use cell towers.  Some might where they live but I don't.  As for live help, once you learn your kindle do you really need that?  I didn't for the price difference.  Last I knew it was a good $200 difference.  I'm sure the price will go down, the HD will be priced at peanuts and it will all balance out in time.  It seems about a year is when the big price change happens.Good luck with your new decisions!

Reviews.Title: the things my granddaughter likes and dislikes about her kindle
Reviews.Author: Clinton Thompson
Reviews.Content: this was gotten for my granddaughter and she is not to happy with it.,.She thought it was bigger and have 2 cameras not one.She does like the fact that she can talk to her father on Skype she says she can live with it for now ,its all her mother could afford for now.

Reviews.Title: No problems!
Reviews.Author: Igotthejoy
Reviews.Content: Got these for my kids because refurbished was cheaper. They looked just like new, and came in new Amazon packaging.

Reviews.Title: After 3 attempts
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give 5 stars,but the Kindle had to be returned 3 times to finally get one that works perfectly!  It was especially sad the day after Christmas when I had to call and find out I needed a new one....again.  The amazon customer representatives I spoke to each time were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: I like it but
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle fire but it is different from the previous type of kindle I had so I have had to get use to it. I do find that this Kindle does not hold a charge on the battery as long as my other one did. I find that I am Charging the battery every day where with my previous Kindle I only had to charge the battery about once a week. I do like the way that it has a background light and that you can change colors on the backgorund.

Reviews.Title: After 16 mos of continuous use...
Reviews.Author: V.P.
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say,after having owned this model since its first release day in sept 2012, that I still reach for it over the iPad time and time again. Sound quality is still superior to the newest generation iPad w retina display. I love my kindle fire hd after 16 mos ( decades in technology years) of continuous use.

Reviews.Title: not recommended
Reviews.Author: john larsen
Reviews.Content: So limited in services.  Make sure if your using it to watch sporting events or other interests that it accepts those sites or apps. I found too many limits.  I'm eating a case and glass protected but just not efficient. I'll use the old reader for books but this  needs a lot of work.  Amazon player bites and needs some work.  Wait two months, tech and prices should be right for a better device

Reviews.Title: This is a decent tablet despite it being a refurbished device
Reviews.Author: Suntop Kinseeker
Reviews.Content: Have you ever wondered what Amazon does to the Kindles(tm) when they exchange them? They use the working parts and make a refurbished device. It works like any new one, but it is not brand new. This means that it is 'like new'. If you're looking for a cheaper Kindle Fire HD(tm) for a child, a relative, a gift to someone, or your husband/wife you cannot go wrong with this. This device is either a 16GB for $129.00 w/offers $144.00 without offers or a 32GB for $159.00 with or $174.00 w/o offers. However, they are not that intrusive if you want to pay $15.00 for it to be shut off to make it a unsubsidized Kindle Fire(tm). If you want to only see special offers when you want to, you'll have to pay for the ability to control it.Some complain about the "customers who bought this also bought" under the carousal, I do not know why it's a problem since it is really not intrusive. This is a great starter Kindle(tm) or a toy for the techno-geek in all of us. The only thing is there is no MAYDAY button and help is only by e-mail/site/phone. I have to say that Amazon's Kindle(tm) team is par none to any other tech support. They are the only customer service that is excellent with helping you and they do not talk down to you like some of the other companies.The 2013 version that replaced this as a new device has a sharper display, more color rich, and doesn't have a camera/mic but a slightly higher speed processor. This has the front facing camera and mic so you can Skype. The cost difference is $40.00 for the new HD 16GB. It is $10.00 more for the 8GB version. 8 GB is a lot for a book reader however if you are a gamer, then you should buy the 16 GB version, or buy the 32GB version of this which is $159.00/$174.00 with/without offers. If you have an older kindle that is broken you can trade it in for this kindle with a 20% discount ($103.20/127.20 16/32GB) There's one more thing, Amazon's Kindle Support is the best. Amazon goes above and beyond to satisfying the owners of Kindles. In addition, the regular customer service is just as good. In a world of customer disservice, they are by far the best. Kudos Amazo!Pros:Sharp resolutionDecent WiFi speedSturdyClear audioEasy navigationQuick responseLight weightCons:No 5W charger which is $14.99 or the 9W  $19.99 or you can get a 3rd party charger that is 21 watts (2 2.1 Amp slots) that is excellent for $13.20. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00D8YYFR4/ref=oh_details_o08_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1Heavy but that is not really badThat's it and I suggest the 21 Watt charger if you have 2+ Fires in the family.

Reviews.Title: Good reader.
Reviews.Author: fauxghee
Reviews.Content: Good reader,nice camera,video capable, MP3 player, lots of storage, web capable. It' like a really capable smart phone that doubles as  reader.
