Reviews.Content: Would never buy another one.  My mistake was not realizing this is a Kindle with some wireless internet capabilities, not a tablet with Kindle access.  Very cumbersome to use, no instructions included at all.  In retrospect I wish I had spent another $100 for a Galaxy tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle/Hate the Carousel
Reviews.Author: An Honest Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle but would rather have a standard Droid layout than the unorganized looking Carousel. Other than that, I prefer the Kindle to my iPad because it's smaller  and handier to grab on my way out the door.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: s c
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire hd. it does everything my laptop does and it fits in my purse for on the go. I would recommend this device to anyone. And the Amazon Customer Support is very prompt and efficiant. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Happy to Have My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: Yes, I would recommend a Kindle. Why did I choose this rating of I love it ? With the Kindle I am able to do just about everything I do on my desk top computer. on line, play games, job search, face book, check on library E-books, emails, google this google that, and the Kindle is small enough for me to carry in my purse. It has become more difficult for me to read print with out a light being right on the page/paper. With the Kindle I can read much easier, AND I can change the font size, and make the screen larger if needed. I have down loaded books to read so that I have something to read while on the bus. And the Kindle IS much lighter in weight than a book or books. I am glad I got the Kindle. oh and I can take pictures. Happy to have my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I owned a Kindle Fire for a couple of years and was very happy. Then I ordered the Fire HD 7" and cannot believe the difference.The pictures are fantastic and the quality of the product is amazing. Would recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD
Reviews.Author: cindy
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say is that I don't know why I waited for so long to purchace this device!!!  I had ( still do ) a kindle keyboard that I was reading with and then finally bit the bullet and got the fire when it was on special.  It is so much easier to read on.  And the best thing about it is that I can read at night without turning on the bedside lamp.  Hubby loves this feature just as much as I do!!

Reviews.Title: third time is the charm
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: after using my first kindle fire hd for 6months or so i realized that some of the functions didn't work like they should (volume and power buttons) so my kindle was running the battery low constantly due to the fact that i could not shut it off.finally decided to call and see what they could do, they exchanged it with no problem and i was on to kindle #2, worked well for 2 or 3 days, after charging once or twice i went to use it again and it would not turn on. called them and told them the problem, they sent a power adapter at no charge to try (did not help the problem) so they sent another replacement. kindle #3 i have been using for about 2 weeks with no issues so far (occasionally gets warm but nothing drastic so far) runs great and charges fine. all buttons work. i'm very impressed with amazon's customer service in trying to make customers happy with these types of problems.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Apple Williams
Reviews.Content: I am really loving it!  It has many features to download that's almost up there with an IPAD for less expense.  It meets my needs so far. I have not found that I need to download too many other apps at present.  Great deal!

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Victory A. Glenar
Reviews.Content: I had the reg kindle and used it to read on mostly. With my new Kindle fire HD I use it for for everything reading email, scanning the internet, as well as reading E Books. I am so very happy with with my new kindle I bought one for my son. He games on it as well as all that I do on the kindle. I would highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD for the quality as well as the price!!! A+++++

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire is a sweet tablet
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H.

Reviews.Title: So nice!
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: I have a samsung note which I adore because it will let you write on it like it's a sheet of paper. But it does not support flash (who cares? Well, you will because that means no amazon streaming video.)I really wanted the prime instant FREE video deal, so that's why I bought the Fire.  I did not get that it would be as small as it is---I LOVE IT! Yes, this is the one you will want to take with you all the time.  Thank you, Amazon.  It's so bright and beautiful, it's amazing! Now, Jeff, if you could please just make it take notes like the samsung note I would be in heaven.The OTHER BIG THING is that if you live in Outer Mongolia, which is apparently where I live, you will not be able to stream at a speed to make the instant video work.  I actually live 2 miles from the center of a large metropolitan area, but somehow that also equates to O.M. (aka Outer Mongolia).  OK, so I thought I could just download these free babies over the hour or whatever it would take---wrong.  The Amazon deal does not let you actually store any videos for free, only stream. So, off to McD I go to watch videos---I am not kidding!Keep that in mind if this is your sole goal for getting it.  On the other hand, I love mine and THAT was my sole goal for getting it.  I JUST LOVE IT!!! I'm embarrassed by how much I love it! I don't know if this is so or if it is coming, but it seems like if you had a blue tooth, you could just use this as your phone as well---and if the next paragraph could also be implemented. (see next paragraph)I would love it so much more if it came with a fast version of whispernet like the kindle and you could just use it whenever and wherever.  Love it even more if if had a battery compartment.  C'mon, how hard would that be and what a great selling point!!!!!!!!!!!  Is anybody listening---please make it run longer---make it solar! Make love last!And can anyone tell me if you can lock it?  You can lock the samsung note, and that is pretty darn important in case you lose this little guy.I have had this now for a week, so I am updating:PROS:1) so small, so light, easy to take everywhere. I bought a kindle when they first came out and hated it. But I read all the time on this one. I pull it out when I am waiting in line at a drive thru. It is the coolest little guy. So user friendly.2) Screen is to die for---brilliant.3) You get videos for free from Amazon, but (see above) only if you can stream4) This is not just an ereader or movie watcher, you can also search the web if you have wifi accessCONS (I am mentioning these, but I would not let any of them deter you from getting this gadget, I LOVE MINE):1) Prime free video access is limited to CERTAIN videos, not everything, and you cannot store and watch later, you have to watch when you download and have a very good wifi to get them to stream2) The thing takes longer to boot than I think it should, I want it to pop right up (Picky, I know. Sorry, Jeff)3) I want an Amazon button---I want to be able to go straight there. The only way I know to do it right now is to go to the web button and go that way---don't want to do that, don't think I should have to. I KNOW Jeff will agree4) It needs a little keypad on the first page to let you put in a lock code, like Samsung note.5) I do not understand how to know what is going on with the wifi connection. There should be some place to go to troubleshoot that. If you swipe the right bottom corner on samsung, it will let you see a lot of your settings. The Fire puts this somewhere else and among the setting is nothing on the wifi connection. I know there is a little icon on the upper right, but earlier today it was saying I was connected, but I could not go anywhere on the web, so it was not.6) Like all of these devices, it dies right in the middle of what you are doing---needs a battery compartment!  YES, it does!77) The inside keypad needs numbers on the first screen (see Samsung note) because we all use numbers now in our passwords8) If you could get the writing app Samsung uses, as I said above, it would be KILLER!

Reviews.Title: I like it, but...
Reviews.Author: Kah
Reviews.Content: After receiving my first Kindle Fire (1st Gen.) for a Christmas gift, I instantly fell in love.  It became a tool I used just about every day.  I still do, but... After just over a year, the charging connection became loose.  I had purchased an extended warranty so returned it to the store and upgraded to the Fire HD 7". The first one I had also had charging issues, Amazon replaced it for free. The second one had volume control issues.  The main volume control would go all the way to the top and it would beep whenever it felt like it.  I would pull up the volume and turn it down but it would just go back up again by itself.  Amazon replaced it for free.  The third HD 7" arrived in the mail about a month ago.  The first day I had it, it turned off by itself three times.  That problem has not repeated.  I recently downloaded an audio book to listen to.  When I started to play it there was so much static I could not hear the words.  I plugged in headphones and could hear just fine so I think the problem is the speakers. It crackles during game sound effects too so it's not just that one book.  I expect Amazon will replace it again without any hassle.  While I will continue to use my Kindle (I really like so many things about it.), I will never again BUY a Kindle.  The quality of this product has shown to be horrible.

Reviews.Title: Why you might upgrade to larger size, plus a couple things that could be better
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: My wife got a big iPad and I got the medium Kindle at the same time. After 10 months of use, I absolutely love my choice. It was less than a third the price, and I think it's better for reading books. Here are the reasons why you might like the Kindle Fire HD better than the iPad: Videos play more smoothly; any mobi-format file can be read aloud with passable precision by a pleasant robot voice; it works seemlessly with Amazon purchases so if you use it rather than the iTunes store, you'll want the Kindle; the free app of the day is far better than anything free in the iTunes store; it's far easier to return stuff, complain about stuff and get refunds with Amazon so if an app doesn't work or a magazine subscription doesn't work right, no worries. I love the way graphic novels and comic books are treated on the Kindle, with each panel enlarging and slightly rising off the page as you read it and a simple swipe takes you to the next one. That said, if you read a lot of graphic novels or comics, you'll want the 8.9" Kindle because the 7" is just a tad too small for detailed comics -- I still read a ton on it, but it could be better. (That said, I prefer the 7" size overall because it's so much easier to carry around.) Here are two things I don't like about it: If you listen to audiobooks using the Kindle, it's impossible to scan forward or backward. Say your brain wandered and you didn't catch a few sentences to you try to move it back a tad, this is easy with an iPod but it's extremely frustrating because the screen buttons are small and overly sensitive. The other shortcoming, which is minor, is that I'd like to be able to play an audiobook while scrolling along with the ebook version -- I'm not talking about the Whispersync function where audio/ebook versions are paired by Amazon, but rather when they're NOT Whispersynced. This is not possible. All in all, love it love it love it. I especially like Readability.com, which converts any online article into a Kindle ebook file and emails it to my Kindle for easy reading at my leisure.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic All-in-One Device
Reviews.Author: L.M.
Reviews.Content: I'd never even touched an iphone or ipad before getting my Kindle, but after I saw how much these little devices did for a reasonable price, I had to get one. You can read books, play games, access the web and get apps for your favorite sites, check your e-mail, watch netflix, listen to music, etc. It's easy to use and extremely functional. The small size makes the product easy to carry around, but the screen is big enough to watch movies or play games with ease. I have had a great time on my Kindle. It makes it possible for me to have my e-mail on the go (as long as I have an internet connection to hook up with). Sound quality is great. I have nothing to compare the HD screen with, but it's very clear. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a tablet without the huge price tag. Also, since the Kindle is from Amazon, you get access to all the apps Amazon puts out. The selection is not limited and you can find tons of free apps. Many of the books and apps with a price are under $3.I really wish they included the charger though. For the money you put into this product, bundling in a $20 charger shouldn't be a big deal. I'm currently sharing one and am hesitant to spend that much money. It seems like that should just be included like when you buy a computer. I guess the USB cord charges it when you hook it up to the computer, but if I recall correctly, I got a message on my Kindle saying it would charge slowly.

Reviews.Title: A month later, I'm happier with it
Reviews.Author: Gesualdo
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire HD arrived this morning, just a little over two hours ago, and so far, I'm not very happy with my purchase. I'd read enough reviews that I felt confident I was getting a good product that I thought would be useful. I thought I was getting a regular tablet with the bonus of being able to watch my Amazon videos on it. But as a convert from a more traditional Android tablet, it seems like this one is missing a lot more than I was prepared to give up just to get that one little extra.The one pro I have found so far: the HDMI port. That will make it nice for hooking up Amazon prime to the bedroom TV without having to set up all that stuff on my laptop.#1 on my con list? No charger. Really? Luckily, I happen to have one laying around the house from when my previous tablet bit the dust. Who sells a rechargeable product without a charger? And making one available - just $20 dollars more - is really in poor taste. Amazon, if you're going for the "amazing customer experience" that my management teacher keeps talking about it, UR DOIN' IT RONG.And then I couldn't find a free GMail app in the store. Or YouTube. Right now, I am really regretting my decision not to buy a Nexus.I bought this tablet for two reasons - reading my textbooks for school and watching videos in bed while my other half is sleeping. So far, only the textbook option is looking viable, and I'm not even completely sure about that yet - I need to have Google Drive installed so I can load my book pdfs that I scanned.I'll keep fiddling with it to see if I can configure it the way I want it, but so far, I'm not happy. I'll post an update if my attitude changesUPDATE 9/15/13I've had my new Kindle Fire HD for 36 hours now and my review stands.I was finding various workarounds for the apps that are not available through the Amazon store, and it was really looking like I could be happy with my Kindle. And then I discovered the fatal flaw. I can't watch my Dish DVR content because the Dish Anywhere app is not available and it does NOT work in the browser. I'm in college and working full time, so I like to watch TV on the go. With this setup, there's no way I can do that.Moreover, Google Music does not work in the browser either. I'm sure Amazon would prefer I simply use the Amazon Cloud Player, which is a very nice app. However, the storage over at Google is so much more generous. Amazon will store only 250 of my thousands of mp3s - unless I pay, of course. Because I am a musician, I always keep a wide variety of music available. Google music was perfect for that (and free!) and it, too, is now unavailable.I was about to raise my rating to 3 stars and potential, but now I'm tempted to lower it. Dish and Google Music are big deals on my tablet.UPDATE 9/17/13Okay, I'm willing to concede a star. My Google music is still not available, which I don't like, but everything else seems to be working out fairly well. It's doing what I need it to do and it's more or less humming along. At this point, I'm happy enough with it to use it without [much] complaint. It seems stable, which is a big plus. Now I just need to wait and see if it develops problems. If not, this is how my review will stand.UPDATE 10/17/13I'm conceding one more star. While I'm still displeased about not having access to my Google apps - because, you know, Google owns me - this is otherwise an excellent tablet. It's stable and fast and easy to look at and use.I've been pretty diverse about what I use it for.*I watch video a lot. I figured out how to make Dish work. YouTube nicely plays in the browser. It's nice to be able to watch my Amazon videos. Amazon has even developed a beta version of a video player that works around the flash content that no longer plays on Android devices (thanks, Adobe!). The video player didn't work very well, but it would be tolerable for short video (1-2 minutes). Keep working on it, Amazon. I'm looking forward to watching Blue Bloods someday.*I'm trying to work on some memory issues, so I play Mahjong a lot. The game is buggy, but that's a problem with the game, not the device.*I do a lot of web research. I think the Silk browser works great. By far, the best of all the mobile devices I've had. One of the best parts is that it plays nice with my school's courseware and also with textbook publisher sites, so I can do schoolwork on my Kindle.*I read textbooks for my classes. I haven't tried using a Kindle textbook (yet) (do those even exist? I thought you could buy them, but you still have to use a regular computer to read). Basically, I bought and dismantled an older edition of my textbook. I scan the pages into PDF form, upload, and then use the Kindle reader to do the reading. It's a little labor intensive, but I can do the scanning while I'm doing something less productive - like watching TV - and then I can read whenever and wherever I happen to be.*Facebook works really well - better than on my phone. In fact, I use Facebook almost exclusively on the Kindle. The exception is when I want to upload photos. The camera is on my phone.*The Calendar app is probably better than the standard Android app. I find it easier to tell my various calendars apart.*I'm not so fond of the email app. It's okay. The native Gmail app is just better.*I like using the Amazon cloud player for my music, but 250 songs doesn't cut it. Google offers so much more storage space for free. On the other hand, since I buy my music exclusively from Amazon, everything I buy is automatically available immediately. It just makes me sad that I can't afford to keep my large-ish CD collection handy without having to transfer the actual files to the Kindle.I was happy enough with this one to buy another for my technophobe hubby. He loves it. It's way faster than his hand-me-down laptop and easy to understand.FWIW, I didn't pay the extra to get rid of the ads. And as annoyed as I get about looking at ads in my face all the time, having "special offers" on my Kindle Fire has been tolerable. It's one screen, just as I'm unlocking it, plus some unobtrusive icons that display when certain app icon have the focus in the carousel. There's nothing that moves or makes noise.

Reviews.Content: Technology is great, isn't it?  Amazon has captured my brass ring with the Kindle Fire HD.  The 7" model fits into my handbag and is ready for reading, browsing, shopping, games, e-mail and more.  Thank you, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: connie
Reviews.Content: I am lovin'  this Kindle.  I also have the Kindle Touch, but the Kindle Fire HD far exceeds the Touch.  The color is sharp.  It is very easy to move around within it to find whatever I need.  I am far from being considered "tech literate" but I have not had to call even once to get help...so far. lolThis Kindle has many more features that can be implemented with ease.The only problem I have had was that all of the books I read and did not read yet were put together into the device".  I had to separate the already read books and put them back into the cloud.  When you read as much as I do, this is not an easy task.  I am still trying to sort them.

Reviews.Title: We love it
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: We love it. It's for my 8 year olds birthday. Easy to use. Games and reading. We bought it on sale so it was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Adam Starnes
Reviews.Content: Bought for 8 year old daughter who absolutely loves it. I love the fact of so many educational games available that make learning fun. Putting all of her books on it making it easy for her to find. Great product.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE Fire...
Reviews.Author: Sue Wanner
Reviews.Content: ....is very new to me + I was more than a little concerned about learning how to navigate...especially using an unfamiliar keyboard...it's been relatively easy to become comfortable with...easy to get answers to any ?s along the way...

Reviews.Title: Happy Wife, Happy Life!
Reviews.Author: Chad Demmitt
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my wife and she absolutely loves it! Seems like it can do everything an iPad can do at a fraction of the cost.As for the negatives.. It doesnt come with a charger! If you want one, be prepared to spend an additional 20.00 for a 'rapid charger'. Your only other option is to plug it into a computer, which is extremely slow AND only charges if the PC is on. If the PC hits sleep mode or stand-by, it doesnt charge. What a joke!My other conplaint involved the speakers. They are absolute garbage and distort incredibly easy.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Product
Reviews.Author: Nancy  Carney "nanzbro"
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire HD!  There are 2 things that made me give it 4 stars instead of 5. First, the location and size of the on/off switch. The locations is somewhat awkward and the buttons  are to small. Secondly, you can not personalize the front with your own pictures, instead, all i see are ads. Would really like to see that change where you can put what you want on the front.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: RAMESH
Reviews.Content: I love this its great, the HD screen is very sharp and clean. Lots of apps to chose from. Battery life is very good between charges. Great product amazon. I am hoping to get another soon

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: cpinnock
Reviews.Content: I had my original Kindle which I enjoyed, but I love my Kindle Fire even more!  I like having the ability to download apps, and for the price it's a definite winner for me!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Jeanie Reagan
Reviews.Content: WOW!  As a great grandmother I wasn't sure I could learn new tricks very well, BUT I am truly enjoying my new KFHD.  Would recommend it the everyone - even my grandchildren are impressed with their Nana.  Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Few avi files aren't playing on the device and Amazon App Store has very limited apps
Reviews.Author: Biranchi Panda
Reviews.Content: Few avi files that I'm able to play on my other devices aren't playing on Kindle.Aamzon App store has very very limited apps. This is a big red for Kindle if you intent to use at as a tablet.

Reviews.Title: My 7 year old loves it!
Reviews.Author: Justa Thought
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 year old daughter's birthday.  It works perfectly.  Has great sound and picture.  It is so easy to use the 3 year old is catching on.  My 10 year old is mad because he has the older version without the camera.  As they say..."good things come to those who wait!"  It has been great.  She watches movies and plays games.  So far it works great add in Amazon's amazing customer service and you have a great gift.  My son's older version has had to go in to amazon because the port that you use for charging was defective, but they handled that quickly and it was a piece of cake.  I'm not sure why anyone would buy an ipad if you are using it for entertainment.

Reviews.Title: buy it
Reviews.Author: Justine Yingling
Reviews.Content: Love the kindle Fire HD!! I would highly recommend people to buy it. Basically the same thing as an iPad but so much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Just wish you could change that robotic omans voice in to SAM ELLIOT's :) >3
Reviews.Author: lyn sleeper
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle HD :)  Happy,Happy,happy! Thank you! Keep up the good work, I tell all my friends about Amazon.com Still wish you could change that woman's voice and still think Sam ELLIOT is the perfect candidate!

Reviews.Title: So happy!
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: It's the right price and has everything I want. Can watch movies, read books, surf the Internet...I only wish it had a better camera--but honestly that's not what I'm using it for anyway.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for travel
Reviews.Author: AZDANCER
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to finally make this purchase and I'm very glad I did.  I just returned from 2 trips and it was so much easier to take my Kindle Fire than lugging a laptop.  It is perfect for reading books, staying in touch via e-mail or simply playing games.  Well worth the money, even with the extras I ordered (MicroShell case & charger).

Reviews.Title: First tablet I've ever had, great experience
Reviews.Author: Reader Cat "Reader Cat"
Reviews.Content: I decided to get a Kindle Fire because I am already an Amazon Prime customer.  All my previous purchases of music and book were still in the Cloud, and I just clicked and they appeared on the HD.  You can also access Facebook and the web easily.

Reviews.Title: Issues with kindle
Reviews.Author: Tri Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I got the first refurbished and then it turns off once in the while when it gets hot. I asked for a replacement and it gets worse. It turned off every time it gets hot. I sent it back the second one and keep the first one because i get no choice. I won't buy anymore kindle product after this kindle is broken.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Lujac
Reviews.Content: I have had a Kindle Touch reader for some time and really enjoy using it.  I especially like the fact that I can visit the Amazon store using 3G from anywhere.  However, there are many features I like about the Kindle Fire which are not available on the Touch.  I love being able to download photos on it, check my email, use the internet, which I couldn't do on the Touch.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Nikyta
Reviews.Content: As a huge reader, I've had my fair share of Amazon Kindle products. I didn't feel the need to upgrade from my Kindle Keyboard to a Kindle Fire especially since the Fires are essentially tablets (which I already own one), I felt like it would be a waste to buy it when all I'd be using it for is reading. A few weeks ago when the Kindle Fire HD 7" went on sale, I bought it on pure impulse. I wanted a new Kindle back in June and was leaning towards a Paperwhite but a friend said I should hold off because a new one was probably coming out in the Fall so I did. When I learned the Paperwhites didn't have speakers or audio capability I decided not to buy one because I regularly listen to audio books with my Kindle Keyboard and was disappointed when I learned that the Paperwhites didn't have that option. The day after I learned that, the Kindle Fire HD 7" went on sale and I felt like it was a sign that I should get it. So, I did. Just in time for my birthday, too! :DI've had the Fire HD 7" for exactly a month now. In all honesty, it was rough transitioning between a Kindle Keyboard to the Kindle Fire because there's just so much stuff on the Fire to go through. I also had an issue with the fact that my Fire kept turning on by itself to the point that it took much longer to charge than it should have (since you can't necessarily use the Fire while it's charging or it charges even slower than the basic cord allows). I couldn't figure out why it kept turning on when I wasn't doing anything until I realized that my Fire was still trying to sync my personal documents (I have an extensive library). Between how much it was charging and how often I was using it, it took a full week before I was able to charge it completely because that's how long it took to sync completely (I'm assuming). If this is happening to you, I would leave it alone until all your books and personal documents are visible when you are in the cloud section of the Books or Personal Docs tab. The longer I used it, the longer it took to sync so try not to do anything the first few days after you register the device IF you have a lot of content in your library.From then on, I really loved my Fire. I didn't think I would adore it this much because I wasn't too excited about having a Kindle in color but now that I have it and been using it consistently for a month, I'm glad I bought it. There's still some issues with it, mainly the fact that sometimes when I open books or personal docs, they don't show up on my carousel no matter how long I read them or have them open. It's almost as if the Carousel is frozen even though the Fire is still operating correctly in all other ways. When this happens, I can't use the 'remove from device' feature on the carousel otherwise it just stays on the carousel no matter how many times I try to delete it, only the 'remove from carousel' feature works and that's slowly. I'm not sure why this happens and I've searched the web enough to know that it doesn't seem like anyone else has this problem. Although, others have had the reverse happen, where books show up in the carousel but not in the books or personal docs tabs, which is NOT my issue so I couldn't figure out a way to fix it. I just let it fix itself, which could take a day or two. I think it might have to do with my constant adjusting of the brightness and then letting it fall asleep only to change the brightness in the morning to a higher quality. I'm not sure but that was the only thing that all three incidents had in common when I thought about it. It's not a big deal so I don't feel the need to call customer support (yet) since everything else on the Fire still works. My only other issue is that I wish the carousel was completely revolving. I have a lot of books on my carousel and it gets frustrating when I'm looking for a book and don't see it when I finally reach the end, only to have to scroll all the way to the left to get back to the beginning. If it was revolving, it would be so much easier to get back to the beginning. If someone has an idea of how I can get to the beginning without scrolling forever (without deleting anything from the carousel) please share! I've tried opening tabs and such but that still leaves me at the end (the right) of the carousel. Hopefully there will be an update that changes this soon and I know others might not like it revolving so maybe Amazon will give its users the option of having a completely revolving carousel or its current one. A lot of my friends don't like the carousel but I love it!So, the Kindle Fire HD 7" gets 4 stars from me. I love it, I adore all its features especially since I can hook it easily up to my TV to watch videos with it. I adore the fact that I can read on it at all times including when I turn the lights off and I love the fact that the screen is so crisp and I can adjust the brightness as much as I desire. There's a ton of things I still have to explore but I'm a happy camper because I can read easily on it AND the speakers are amazing. Listening to Spotify and audio books on it (in addition to reading) definitely made this a good investment!

Reviews.Title: good product but limited internet search capacity
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: i have had the kindle fire hd for several months and will soon be replacing it due to its limited capacity to view web sites.  Because the silk browser is considered out of date at some web sites and because firefox is not available in the kindle app store, i am in need of a more flexible device.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tiffany White
Reviews.Content: I ordered my first Kindle in the beginning of this year.  I loved it and it worked great until it stopped charging.  I spoke with tech support for my Kindle and they offered to replace my kindle due to the charging issue.  I was happy to be getting a replacement as well as being happy with tech support - they were very nice.  I was disappointed, however, when my replacement Kindle arrived.  Obviously it was a previously used Kindle that I am assuming was refurbished because when I opened the box, the kindle was dirty.  There was dirt packed into all the little groves and crevices, the screen was dirty and the back of the kindle was filthy as well. I have never had a problem with anything I ordered from Amazon before but I think I would much have rather just ordered a brand new kindle than top receive a filthy one as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Amazon does not have a manual for this item.
Reviews.Author: K. Erickson "the shopper"
Reviews.Content: If you are like me and find that you learn and retain information by reading, you will be frustrated by the fact that there is NO manual that you can get about your Kindle Fire.  I finally found one at my public library and that helped me a great deal.  It is titled "The Missing Manual", and is specifically about the use of the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Goff
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife for her birthday.  She absolutely loves it. She can't seem to ever put the thing down! Which is bad for me I guess hahaha. All in all it is a great machine.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: Dolores
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Kindle ever since they came out.  I had a literati for a couple of years my niece had given me.  I really like I can check my email, facebook and look up things on the internet.  I enjoy watching the free movies from Amazon when I am away from home.  I too, am glad I waited till this one went on sale for $159.  A great price for a great piece of machinery!

Reviews.Title: Not too old to learn new tricks
Reviews.Author: Timothy J. Buck
Reviews.Content: Although this doesn't belong to Timothy, I will write a review.  It took some time to figure out how to register it to my account, actually had to create an account.  It is taking time to figure out all the apps and how to work through them.  I said I would not like to read books on a tablet but one I made a cover for it, it feels like a book and I am enjoying not having to worry about losing my place because the bookmark fell out.  I have replaced my outdated clique which is no longer supported and my paper address book and now everything is in one place.

Reviews.Title: Still new
Reviews.Author: Claudette S "pianist"
Reviews.Content: I'm still getting used to all the features.  Have been reading books from previous Kindle reader, have looked at a movie, searched the web, etc.  Lots to get used to and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: This is great
Reviews.Author: joan Yanda
Reviews.Content: I had to have help setting it up-----but I just finished my first book on it, and I can truthfully say, kindle goes with me every where.  I love it.  Such a deal I got on it.  I just ordered a cover for it, I definitely want to protect it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for many uses
Reviews.Author: Patricia C Merrifield
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this tablet. It has great clarity of picture and sound. picks up wifi well. I bought it for my husbands use and would like to get one myself. I would like to figure out all that it is capable of doing. However, I have managed to do the basic things,but I could have used more direction on how to get the most out of it since I am the one that sets it up for him and shows him how to use it. Great product!

Reviews.Title: Use it constantly!
Reviews.Author: M. Treppa "ozmkt"
Reviews.Content: Have had charger issues. Also, prime videos can not be viewed in Canada. Other than that, I have no complaints. Use it constantly for reading, Facebook, music and radio. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire!!!
Reviews.Author: Nancy L. Beary
Reviews.Content: I'm reading more than I've read in years.  The screen is so easy to read.  The only negative is that it needs charging a lot. I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Janet A Olson
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it.  I got games on it that my Grandkids can play also.  I love the lighted pad and that  is so good as I like to read in bed before going to sleep.

Reviews.Title: special offers
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire but was shocked that I didn't even get s charger for it let alone any "special offers". The only thing offered to me was a month of "prime" free and when I took the offer you charged my account 80.00  so I would not recommended your special offer to anyone but will tell them about my experience. At least if I had purchased the kindle fire in a store I would have gotten a charger with it.

Reviews.Title: So Bummed!!!
Reviews.Author: vicmont
Reviews.Content: I have spent weeks reading reviews and asking around which tablet to buy.  I was so excited about receiving this, watching for the UPS truck to come everyday.  I received this yesterday and I haven't been able to get a WiFi connection since.  Every time the WiFi connects it shuts itself off.  I have tried connecting to several different WiFi's including my HotSpot and the same thing.  It takes forever to connect and when it does (if it does, and it has only connected a couple times after dozens of attempts) you can see the WiFi Off/On button switch itself OFF!  I have reset the device to factory settings twice and still not working.  I know it's not my Router and WiFi strength because other devices act just fine.  This just stinks!  I will be sending it back.

Reviews.Title: If you have kindle fire don't waste your money on the HD
Reviews.Author: d.peoples
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire HD isn't much different than the kindle fire. Was hoping to do more with the HD but so far that hasn't happened. Disappointed and wishing I hadn't purchased the HD

Reviews.Title: DID NOT WORK, NO INSTRUCTIONS
Reviews.Author: Robert Brinton
Reviews.Content: Received this unit which had no instructions in the box.  It would turn on but the touch screen did not work.  Returned it for a refund, which I received in a prompt manner.  Think I will wait awhile to replace this item.  Generally I do a lot of buying on Amazon and recommend them highly.

Reviews.Title: MORE THAN I THOUGHT
Reviews.Author: BDJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter is helping to navigate the new Kindle. I'm not good with reading instructions. It really does a lot more than my first Kindle.....and I like that a lot

Reviews.Title: 6th Kindle
Reviews.Author: Dianne Roberts "Nananana"
Reviews.Content: Since 2008 we have bought 6 Kindles for our grand children.They all love them and the younger ones use them in the classroom.They have become  avid readers since they received them.

Reviews.Title: It's nice but trouble with Amazon Silk
Reviews.Author: L. Pruitt "mommaoftwo"
Reviews.Content: I have been less than thrilled with Amazon Silk, the browser. It seems to work when it wants to. I am still evaluating whether I want to keep this Kindle Fire HD refurbished. I loved, loved my first generation Kindle Fire but I had to get another one after there were issues with the port. The browser takes way too long to load things which makes me wonder if there is a problem otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lynette M.
Reviews.Content: My daughter got this Kindle for her 9th birthday.  Got the pink case, charger and stylus too.  She loves it, and after comparing all the different tablets, I am very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Andrea buestan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Item for my 5 year old cousin and it is great. I used it for a little while before giving it to her and loved the way it works and all the aplications it has. I was able to set up the Kindle for kids use only and made in simple and safe for my baby to use her new tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Device, Though Rather Fragmented Software
Reviews.Author: Eli Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD since it was the most economical tablet--alongside the Google Nexus 7--however I found many mishaps in the functionality of the device. The main one is its inability to play Netflix videos seamlessly. For instance if I'm watching a show or movie on Netflix and find myself distracted, thus locking the tablet, I'm forced to shut the tablet off and back on just to resume the show where I had left off. Unfortunately the tablet does the same with Amazon videos.I find it rather upsetting since watching videos is the main focus of the Kindle Fire HD. It's like buying a Kindle reader and having to reboot every time you wish to pick up on a page where you left off before locking the device.I'm sure it's a software issue, but either way Amazon developer  should listen to these  grievances and fix them accordingly.

Reviews.Title: extreme bummer
Reviews.Author: rclark
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I bought my Kindle Fire HD in mid July.  Now I'm so sad I did.  It just up and died on me after 2 months.  I really enjoyed it while it lasted, but 2 months!  come on people that just sucks.  I don't recomend buying one if it's just going to die.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the Best Tablet/Reader On the Market
Reviews.Author: theagle
Reviews.Content: I now have a "family of Kindles".  My first one was the original Kindlefire with WiFi and we liked it so much that when the first HD Kindlefire came out we bought one for our visiting cousin, who really liked the one I had (the first one).  Then, when we saw how neat the new HD was and the larger screen....well, we just had to have one too (so I now had 2).  My third one was just purchased and, yes..I do use them all!I read lots of books, play Words with Friends, Scrabble and numerous word games with others, I use the browser as an information tool for just about anything, and, of course, there is the shopping and eBay to keep up with.I can't say enough about the enjoyment it gives me and it's super easy to use.  I always recommend it to anyone who asks me.  So do yourself a favor and get one.....you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great Price
Reviews.Author: missgrowtea
Reviews.Content: If you don't have constant WIFI it isn't the best.  I use mine for web browsing, movies, books.  If you don't have a internet connection you cannot do much but watch stuff you downloaded, which in turn takes up your gigabits.

Reviews.Title: get it!
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth over whether to buy this.  I don't know what I was waiting for--it's one of those purchases I use every single day.  I love it.  I read on it, I get on facebook and I get on the internet.  My family uses it to watch TV shows and movies.  It is easy to use and has a wonderful display.  I got the one with the special offers, which essentially consists of an ad (picture, no audio) on the lock screen.  It's fairly lightweight and fits in my purse easily.  You'll love it!My only regret is that shortly after I bought it, it went on sale from $199 to $159.

Reviews.Title: Sorry I bought it
Reviews.Author: cruiselyn
Reviews.Content: I had a kindle keyboard and I thought I wanted more so I asked for and got a Kindle Fire HD for my birthday.  I read and read about this Kindle before I got it to make sure this was what I wanted.  I am so sorry.  It is so difficult to use compared to the keyboard I can not believe it.  It is next to impossible to remove anything. There are no collections to divide your books into read and unread or travel and leisure or romance and mystery. Some of the apps may be free but they either cost each time you use them, or cost for a subscription or they just don't work. I am not very tech savvy but I can usually follow step by step directions but not with this device.  I have three different "how to" guides (which say different things by the way) and I still can't get it to do what I want.  I am stuck with it because I am NOT spending anymore money on this worthless project!!!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 7'
Reviews.Author: unicornlady
Reviews.Content: I bought my first kindle fire hd 7' in december 2012 i was happy with it .it worked great i had it almost 8 months ,then one day it started having issues.apps would freeze up won't work.when you  had it on book text to speech it would skip pages.so i contacted amazon they sent replacement that one was worse .so they sent another on it made popping noises along with the other issues.i am now on 4th kindle . i am still having issues with it skipping pages when i have it text to speech . i really don't no what the problem it .i have the 2 year warranty but come on these issues need resolved i am very annoyed by this . i like listen to book while i am doing something else . i have keep looking down make sure it is on the right page.i am hoping they fix this SOON!ANYBODY NO IF THERE'S A SOFTWARE UPDATE ???

Reviews.Title: Complete and Great !
Reviews.Author: Puntito
Reviews.Content: Great tool...after i got it i forget i have a laptop...sometimes i just dont use the smartphone, Great for reading, shopping, draw, multimedia... Many apps and books free and paying... Fast and Just Great...

Reviews.Title: Another great Amazon product
Reviews.Author: Eric Welch
Reviews.Content: I have a Nexus 7, Nook HD and a Kindle Fire.  All are very nice units and each has its distinct advantages. When Amazon had a sale on the HD units I couldn't resist since frankly their ecosystem and software is just superior.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: lou7697
Reviews.Content: Prior to this purchase, I was only interested in a e-reader. After trying one, I returned it due to contrast problems, so I decided on the Kindle Fire HD 7". The capability it's much more than I bargain for and more. I'm very happy with it and still learning more.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Entertainig the kids
Reviews.Author: iwhuff
Reviews.Content: Thanks Amazon for selling great products at the best prices. Kindle fire is perfect for surfing the web, playing games, and keeping the little ones entertained.

Reviews.Title: Best thing I ever bought
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Buying this tablet was the best thing. Add in the Prime account makes it better. Now I can read when I want or watch a movie or TV show. Download Netflix if you have it and it's all you need for entertainment. If you are wondering if this is the tablet to get or something else, I would highly recommend this one. A little hindered by the lack of the Google Play store, but Amazon's selection of apps is not lacking too much.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't get any better than this.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love the clear picture quality and the precise audio. I only wish that I had a portable Wi-Fi to carry with me at all times.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Can read it outside which is why I bought this one instead of an eink reader. Really happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: one stop shop
Reviews.Author: T. Harper
Reviews.Content: i bought this because i wanted to read my books while on vacation. instead of hauling my hardcover books. on top of reading all my books with ease, i have email access too. i downloaded all my epub books and am reading them too, through a epub reader.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: danxvaly
Reviews.Content: i like this litle things is working ok and the kids love it.very good if you don't need something more sofisticate

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Janice Storm
Reviews.Content: I am really excited about the Kindle fire, I have a lot to learn about it.  Thanks for the quick service.

Reviews.Title: More than I imagined
Reviews.Author: Brenda Harshman
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this only for reading books because my vision is bad and I could enlarge the font on it.  I had no idea it also had wifi so that I can go on line to look things up or even check Facebook.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Martin Rockett
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD has exceeded all my expectations I had when purchasing it. It has preformed at an exceptional level, I have wireless cable internet thought the house and it works well in all areas of the house.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE  RATEING
Reviews.Author: pauline  picone
Reviews.Content: LOVE MY KINDLE, STILL LEARNING ALL IT HAS TO OFFER. LOVE THE APPS. SELECTION. DO HAVE A QUILTING APP?I TELL ALL MY QUILTING FRIENDS, HOW EASY IT IS TO GET QUILT SITES ON THE GO, EASY TO CARRY.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: JP "Bernie"
Reviews.Content: It does what I need it to do. Convenient size and great picture quality. For the price you can't beat it. I would recommend it to anyone wanting a tablet at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: Meets my needs.
Reviews.Author: Bobbi
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle without back-lighting; my new Kindle Fire is perfect for reading in bed, or anywhere for that matter.It fits easily into my purse, emails are so much easier to read than on my smart phone and the games, especially Scrabble, are great fun.  Sound is good as well.

Reviews.Title: Don't leave home without it.
Reviews.Author: Terry S. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Kindle Fire. I use it everyday for reading, games, listening to music, playing cards online, viewing the internet and my email, coordinating with my contact and calendar notices. I don't leave home without it. the HD is great the speakers are better than the old one by far. and the best thing is affordability. Thanks  Kindle Fire

Reviews.Title: Much better than Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: I bought my daughter the Kindle Fire for Christmas 2011.  After about 1 year it started malfunctioning.  Of course this was after the warranty had expired.  We messed around with it for 6 months or so and attempted to contact amazon for troubleshooting help.  We did not have any luck.  We bit the bullet and bought the "much improved" Kindle Fire HD.  The Kindle Fire HD has much improved clarity and so far works just fine.  I sure hope amazon has worked out the kinks so the HD model lasts longer than a year!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: DJH149
Reviews.Content: exchanged dead kindle fire for referbished kindle hd - good folks helped me do this - price was great - my son is happy and now can skipe

Reviews.Title: Overall great product
Reviews.Author: lb17
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my son.  He loves it but he doesn't use it to it's fullest functions.  As most kids do, he mainly into downloading apps & playing games on it.  It was a great purchase for the price compared to other tablets. Overall it was easy to set up and the screen definition is great.  The only complaint, which seems to be a major malfunction problem with the Kindle Fire, is that it will not charge or turn on.  I went to a thread on Amazon & read several posts explaining how you have to do a manual reset for the system but it didn't work for us.  I called and explained the problem to Amazon.  A new Kindle was shipped out immediately because ours was still under warranty.  I packed up the old Kindle & returned it once the new one was received. It also has a really good battery life but it does take all night to charge if you're using USB included.  If you purchase the separate charger, I believe it charges in 4-5 hours.  Despite the malfunction problem, I would still recommend buying the Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: My HDF
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with my HDF.  I purchased it about three weeks ago and still learning how to work it.  No instructions came with it. Amazon nickle and dime you for eveything.  I paid .99 for the instruction book.  The audio system is okay however I hook it up to my speaker and enjoy my music better.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the family
Reviews.Author: Brian Nacy "nacymex"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a great deal for the family. My wife and kids find it exceptionally easy to use and pick it 9 times out of 10 over our other Android tablet. The user interface is intuitive and overly simplified. If you have used a stock Android device before, you may not like the forked addition. It has a solid build, rarely crashes and a free app each day helps you slowly build your app library.Solid device for the price, being a part of the Amazon ecosystem and for kids to use.

Reviews.Title: Works great with reservation
Reviews.Author: Richard Hammervold
Reviews.Content: Everything about the unit is pretty outstanding. However, the network connection to certain routers is rather difficult. I've tried restarting the device, toggling airplane mode etc. The only thing that seemed to work repeatable was to get the unit nearly out of range of the router and try to link... Works nearly every time.

Reviews.Title: thanks
Reviews.Author: Stacey Douglas
Reviews.Content: Great customer service.  I had the Kindle Fire HD for 2 weeks and the screen kept freezing up and turning the machine off.  I called the customer service and they sent me a brand new one out of 2 day delivery.

Reviews.Title: An excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: I just can't see why I haven't done this before.I use it all day. Easy to handle.And I become familiar with the interface.I'll try to buy one for my father

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: pamela milliman braun
Reviews.Content: it has so many uses, yet is portable, can go anywhere and i can use it day or night, i reccomend it

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: This was a gift my sisters and I bought for my mom for her birthday. We got the awesome deal for only $159! Quality is great on this Kindle and the sound is amazing! I have a Kindle Fire and I want this HD one!! Kindles are the best!

Reviews.Title: Best small tablet in the market
Reviews.Author: Marcus Fenix
Reviews.Content: Simply the best. Buy it for you or for your kids. Great apps, camera, features, super fast, clear pictures, great for browsing, reading, watching videos, taking pictures and much more. Love it

Reviews.Title: best ereader
Reviews.Author: ouida stokes
Reviews.Content: after researching ereaders for a while, I decided on the kindle fire and glad I did. this is a ereader and a lot more. im just learning everything ,but with amazons help, im getting there. they have the greatest support and make it easy to understand, glad I didn't go anywhere else. I have just read my first book and it was awesome. now im ordering a three boxed set for 99 cents, awesome price, right? it also came with all kinds of goodies that I cant wait to get into. thanks amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Mary Walters
Reviews.Content: I was able to check my e-mail when I was traveling.  I enjoy reading very much and playing games so it was great for that.  So glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Kindle was an Upgrade
Reviews.Author: S. Hanks
Reviews.Content: I was completely happy with the Kindle received as a gift a couple years ago -- until it stopped charging (though it began again AFTER I had ordered the new Kindle.) Nevertheless, I have been quite pleased with the differences between the two that I have noticed (in addition to the fact that I ordered a Kindle with 4 times the memory.) Programs on the new Kindle seem to run faster, including the touch response. Although it turned out to an unnecessary purchase, I am delighted to have the second Kindle ... a GREAT PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle is Ok.
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The Kindle has issues. It freezes up, it won't shut down when you want it to, and where you charge it on the Kindle broke in 2 months.

Reviews.Title: Fire
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: My wife loved this so much she just refers to it as Fire. She loves is and made a great gift.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for a great Price
Reviews.Author: Paul D. Miner
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased to find the Kindle Fire for a good price. Although it took a little getting used to as to how to find the onscreen controls, it seems very user friendly. I bought this for my wife expecting it to be very easy and straightforward. Not quite as easy as I had hoped.Great screen and resolution as expected.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: Bertha
Reviews.Content: I now use this instead of my laptop or desk top computers.  It also has great sound and lots of Apps and books to select from.  I use mine all through out the day.

Reviews.Title: Keeps Turning Off on it's own
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I went for the refurb since the warranty and customer service is the same. A week later the new price dropped 10 bucks lower than the refurb... go figure... then a week after that my refurb starts shutting down in the middle of whatever I'm doing and has to restart. Does this about 10 times then shuts down for good. Only thing I can see is the Kindle Fire logo, then black. Amazon customer service was great though, exchanged the item for a like product after a 5 minute chat online and it came in 2 days. Replacement has been fine for about 2 weeks now, no issues. Replacement's can be new or refurb units. 2 stars instead of 1 because of stellar customer support (the reason I went with the Fire instead of Nook in the first place).

Reviews.Title: GRANNY Loves it!
Reviews.Author: Michael Lay "mlay"
Reviews.Content: Granny wanted to text, facebook, read and does not want to do it on the PC so I bought her the kindle. Now she has a skype account and uses it all the time. She did not think she would use it and she uses it a TON!

Reviews.Title: It was my wife's idea, but I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Doyle from SoCal
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend the Kindle Fire HD to ANYONE who reads... a lot... and doesn't like all the newspapers and magazines piling up before they can read them all.  Secondly, and THIS is VERY important, if you have a problem (anywhere you travel... even overseas as I was during my first few weeks) the service (support) is phenominal!  They're there for you! Thirdly, the picture and sound is awesome.  They've done a terrific job building the Kindle Fire HD and their support system!  I can only imagine how they'll improve it even more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great Sound
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this kindle is the sound quality. The visuals are also stunning. The app store is very good but it needs to keep up with new titles and updates a little better.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: reader
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my new Kindle Fire HD.  I especially like how long the battery lasts.  My granddaughter also uses it and she has  a lot of fun with the games.  It's just the right size to take with me when I'm waiting for an appointment.  I have recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Clear perfection
Reviews.Author: Christine Carangelo
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I upgraded to the Kindle Fire HD.  I brought it on vacation and not only did I have many books to read but I was also able to stay connected with my email and facebook.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: CE "CE"
Reviews.Content: so this was a replacement for my other android tablet and its doing very well so far of course its only been two days.....im still learning.  The only thing im not happy about is that half of my apps that i use to use on my iphone and my other tablet ( google play) I either cant find on Amazon or cant download to Kindle.  The one thing they dont tell you when you purchase is that you can ONLY use Amazon to download thier apps i  the Amazon store ( similar to itunes)  this might be a deal breaker with Kindle.....im getting tired of being told what apps i can use or download from only a certain store.  my other tablet I could downlode from everywhere and everything...

Reviews.Title: This is the second one we have purchased, A gift for my wife!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hartley "Woodsmith"
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my kindle so much that I wanted my wife to have one too. We are both avid readers and the ability to borrow books from our library online has been a much appreciated feature. Being able to access the internet and answer email is a bonus.We enjoy the Skype application and we find the Kindle Fire HD to be an incredible value for the money. We both have the Poetic Bluetooth keyboard and truthfully it's like a mini-laptop. Kudos to Amazon for a fine product!

Reviews.Title: KIndle HD7 Review
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I have trouble with the library.  When I click on the featured book that I choose, sometimes it will let me read the sample it won't show the example.  Also, if I'm on a number in the 9 hundreds, it will kick me back to the 5 hundreds. I get tired scrolling through books that I've already viewed. Otherwise, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Gwendolyn Feemster
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband and he loves it. While he's not much of a reader, he loves it to play games and follow sports.

Reviews.Title: this is the 2nd one
Reviews.Author: Van
Reviews.Content: That should say how much I love to play with Fire. They are getting mad at me here so I must go.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Jennifer DeMont

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle 7

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is better than the original Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: jac-bo-bac
Reviews.Content: The HD is a lot better than the original Kindle Fire I got a couple of years ago.  I am amazed at the sound quality.  I am glad I went with the Kindle Fire HD over the iPad.  The iPad is cumbersome and I don't see that it offers anything more than what I am able to get at a much lower cost...the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Rhea Sala
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD was all I hoped it would be. Pictures are super sharp, Sound is dyno and its fast. I love it, I love it, I love it. :)

Reviews.Title: great media tablet
Reviews.Author: Bradley Voss
Reviews.Content: I wish it had more apps to make usefully for work but it exceeds my expectations for entertainment, it goes every where with me. I would also like it to be able to get my Google apps and it would be nice to be able to download flash.

Reviews.Title: really like it
Reviews.Author: Barbara L. Hathaway "keep reading"
Reviews.Content: I have the 7" HD,32GB version. I am very happy with it. The clarity of the images. I don't even mind the lock screen ads because they are beautiful.  I am amazed at the playing time. I'm used to charging my smart phone everyday. Two things I wish were better. I don't like the carousel thing. I'd rather the items were lined up in order and the usb attachment for the charger is rough and hard to connect. I'm afraid I'll bend it or something. I got the purple leather case. Really nice. All in all, really liking it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle better that ipad
Reviews.Author: Lore "lore..."
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle the wireless is super fast...is the best to  watch movies and read book.......I love that the web is pretty fast in this device

Reviews.Title: so worth it!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Ang
Reviews.Content: Bought an iPad mini but couldn't get myself to open it immediately due to its cost. I kept looking into other options and the kindle fire HD had always been my second choice. Finally it went on sale and I've decided to return the iPad mini. I like the iPad and have played with it often at the Apple store. But I've broken it down to price and purpose. Both product are practically identical but for short shows on Netflix, surfing the web and checking emails on the go, the price is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: Top notch!
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: This item was exactly what I expected!! I received this a lot quicker than I thought I would. Excellent service!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Marry "Marry Ann Brewer"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product, I have no problem in recommending this product to my friends. If it is possible, can you add an enter key on the keyboard.
