Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet  for my daughter's girls,  my son-load in-law can download  books and games for them to play. Amazing product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Leah Schroeder
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle but love it. Read every day and this is very easy on my eyes. Happy that I bought one.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed loyal Amazon customer
Reviews.Author: Colin Chan
Reviews.Content: After doing lots of research and seeing great reviews, I decided to purchase the Kindle Fire HD 7". My girlfriend owns an iPad 3, so I will be using that as a comparison.Out of the box, I was actually quite impressed by the kindle's look and feel, but soon was quickly and heavily disappointed.First I would like to say the few things that I WAS impressed or was pleased by. Again, the look and feel of the kindle was very nice, and looked well built. The interface and operating system was very user friendly, well organized, and easily understood. The Dolby speakers were crystal clear. And the fact that your Kindle doesn't ask you for a password whenever downloading an app (Something that an iPad or any apple product does). These are really the only things I was pleased by, and as you can tell, they are not that important.Now with the bad:First, after using it a few days, I noticed it was not that smooth and rather choppy and slow. Especially when opening apps, it was very laggy and choppy. Yes, it has a quite clear and nice screen, but no better than the iPad. Maybe the Kindle needs more RAM, or a better processor? I don't know. All I know is, it was nowhere near or even close to the iPad's standards in terms of the smoothness.Second, the touchscreen is nice, but not good. It is not that responsive and its not as.... Intuitive, I guess is the right word. It just doesn't feel right. Especially when scrolling down a webpage or "turning" a page in a book, it doesn't feel as if it's at your fingertips. Again, slow and non-responsive.Third, after using a couple times, apps such as facebook, vine, silk (web broswer), they would start to freeze and then crash. This would rarely happen in an iPad, especially in a new iPad.Last but most important in my opinion, the battery life. This is just flat out disappointing. With all new devices, I drain the battery until its at 1% or empty. I did this with the Kindle, and then charge it overnight. After my mourning routine, its been about 14 hours, I come back and notice that it was stuck at 99%. It would not reach 100%. Something that bugged me, but I thought "whatever".I read that Amazon states you can have up to 11 hours of continuous use, and realized that is a load of crap. I was reading a book, with airplane mode turned ON, no apps running in the back, and brightness at about 25%. After about 45 minutes, my battery has drained roughly 10%. So at MOST, if I continued to read until my battery died, I would get 7 MAYBE 8 hours with the lowest possible settings. However, this isn't that bad, but its not the worse part.The thing that made me most disappointed was the amount of battery life drained even when "sleeping." Last night, I used my Kindle until about 81% battery. With WiFi turned off, no apps running in the back, etc. I go to bed. I wake up in about 7 hours, and see that my battery has drained to 60%. I immediately thought I must have a defective Kindle or battery. But after doing lots of research, I found out that this is a common trait in Kindles! Ridiculous! It wasn't MY Kindle, it was everyone's! The only reason this is such a big deal to me is because my girlfriend once went on a family vacation but left her iPad at my house. After 4 days of it being turned on, WiFi on, everything on, but merely "sleeping." It drained from 89% to 86%. 3% over 4 days! Whereas my Kindle drained 20% in 7 hours!These are just the major negative features I have experienced, there are still many but minor things, including the ads and "Customers also bought."Please, don't call me a Kindle Hater and that I'm just trying to bash on Amazon or Kindles, because I'm not. I'm a loyal Amazon customer and really tried to love this, but I simply could not with all the CONS outweighing the PROS.All in all I am very disappointed in this product, but I did get it during a promotion for $150. I guess you get what you paid for, but I would recommend everyone to pay the extra amount for an iPad or iPad mini, because it will not disappoint like the Kindle, well not this much anyway.

Reviews.Title: We are a 4 Kindle family now!  We love them!
Reviews.Author: Becky Hicks
Reviews.Content: My kids take their Kindles everywhere!  If we had these before, we could have eliminated their other game devices!  I took mine everywhere before I got the Kindle app on my smart Phone!

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet at an Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this Kindle on sale!  They are or were on sale for something like $199 for this 32 GB version.  Couldn't beat the price.  I have a Galaxy Tab also but I won't do a comparison because I have each tablet for different reasons and they are both excellent in their own right.  This Kindle has a great picture.  Having a Prime account is definitely an investment worth having.  If you do buy a Kindle, beware of one thing which I found to be totally ridiculas.  WHen it was shipped to my house it was left on my porch by the delivery driver.  That in itself doesn't sound too awefully bad except it wasn't wrapped in any brown paper or placed inside a box of any kind!  No! It was in it's original Kindle Box left out for the whole neighborhood to see.  If someone had wanted a new Kindle it would have been a snap!  Thankfully no one took it but if you live in a more dense area you never know what could have happened.

Reviews.Title: I'm loving it
Reviews.Author: troublejo "troublejo"
Reviews.Content: HiI am so happy with it, tho I need to get use to it. It works fast. The customer service is great. I have another tablet, but the company folded and I couldn't get my questions answered or any help. The people at Amazon was so understanding, they stood on the phone with me, until I was satisfied. I was having trouble using the keyboard, I typed the wrong letter and didn't see it. Once I corrected it, it was okay. I wanted to get an inexpensive tablet, I am a senior and funds are low, but I wanted to get a fire from the first. Like the old saying goes, go with your first thought. I love dealing with Amazon they are always so helpful and I always get good buys on the items I want. I don't like the way the black buttons work. I have a hard time finding the start one, but I found a way to fine it easier. That is the only thing I dislike about it.

Reviews.Title: Limitations on End User are a Compromise with this Device
Reviews.Author: Evan Kastner
Reviews.Content: I am sure this product is excellent for people who just want to view movies, TV series, and books via purchase or subscription service from Amazon. I did not hang on to this product long enough to evaluate those features as they are of less interest to me.What I wanted from this device is an excellent e-reader at a great price. The Kindle Fire HD does satisfy these criteria. The look and feel of the device is great and the screen is impressive. However, I was upset to learn that there is a 5GB limit on personal document storage. I bought a 32GB version because I wanted additional capacity for my PDFs. Also, there is a 50MB limit on individual file sizes that can be transferred to the kindle. I do not know the technical software details behind this limitation in detail. I read that all files are somehow converted to some kind of Kindle format for viewing. This may be incorrect. I have many documents that I want the freedom to transfer and view on a device that exceed 50MB. The last straw is the Mac app "Send to Kindle" which fails to send anything to my Kindle. I am only able to send documents to my kindle by e-mailing them to an amazon cloud address. I used the online troubleshooting and my own Mac knowledge to attempt to fix the problem, but I am not even interested in contacting tech support as I have already decided that I have encountered enough trouble and enough limitations on my use of hardware that I have paid money for, that I am going to return my Kindle for a Nexus 7 that allows me more freedom to do what I want with my property.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for what I use it for
Reviews.Author: LBDDiaries "LBDDiaries"
Reviews.Content: I haven't really wanted to jump on the tablet bandwagon. I've been very happy with my plain, ordinary Kindle Touch.  I have a PC and a laptop, along with a cell phone. Why would I need a tablet or pad, too? BUT when the Kindle Fire HD went on sale about the time I was eye-balling a Kindle Paperwhite 3g I decided it was time to run a test to see if I'd use a tablet at all. The Fire HD was less expensive than the Paperwhite, so I purchased it.Right now it is a glorified e-reader that I love.  I like the benefit of being able to check things online in color without the software closing it down (like it would sometimes do on my Touch). That is a great benefit.  But just like my cell phone, sometimes the smaller keyboard drives me bonkers. I'm not adept at typing with my thumbs like so many can. I am a "poke one key at a time" typer - slow. Give me a real keyboard any day.Being that I am not gadget savvy, it is nice that it is VERY easy to begin using. Help is a simple tap away. Changing the brightness is a breeze (which you need when reading at night, to adjust your reading screen).  I love that I can read without a lamp on or an attached book reading light.  THAT is the entire point of my desire for a Paperwhite.  As an e-reader, it is wonderful.  Larger screen, easily adapted to personal reading desires - loving it for that.I haven't sent emails or the like but my son, who also bought one, says it is a breeze. He loves is beyond belief.  For me, when checking a website, it is small but easily enlarged with fingers. I mean, I can see why people love having everything at their fingertips.  Everything is right there, easy to see and in beautiful color.  In the end, tho, it really is just a glorified e-reader for me.If you are new to tablets, this is a perfect place to start and play around but you'd probably rather the larger one in the long run.  Will I buy the larger tablet?  Don't know. Not right now but maybe in the future as a replacement to my old laptop (as long as I get the keyboard to go with it).UPDATE 2 MONTHS LATER:  I've now had the Kindle two months and still don't use it for much more than an e-reader.  I do go online often then realize why I shouldn't - the print really is small and even when you expand (which it does very easily), to me it is awkward. It does sign on quickly and goes to the websites almost as fast as my laptop.  As far as I can tell, it does everything it says it will, with ease.  "Help" is not hard to find and the few apps I downloaded - calculator, etc., work beautifully.  All in all, I'm glad I bought it because if I do want to buy another book by an author right away, I can easily do so (smile).  But in the end, it is still just a glorified e-reader for me, one that only has 11 hours on it - which is a con in my book!

Reviews.Title: My first Kindle I don't love
Reviews.Author: John R. Sponauer "John S"
Reviews.Content: Longtime Kindle user here; this is my third Kindle, going back to the original, and all are still in operation. Also an Amazon Prime devotee (have bought everything from peanut butter to an elliptical machine) and quasi-tech geek. I genuinely love my previous Kindles for reading. They were/are transformational machines.I am also quite price-sensitive. Not wanting the size or the price of a full-size tablet, I finally decided to look at mid-size 7-inch-range wifi tablets for general app usage for work and home productivity, as well as music, games, etc. I have several devices that I was hoping this purchase could either replace or supplement:* A 3rd generation 32GB iPod Touch, which is my primary music player. Sadly, it has an increasingly bad headphone jack. I have an iTunes library of 2,000+ songs on it. I also use it for couchtime and hobby apps (Words with Friends, astronomy reference, Web, Twitter, Facebook, etc.). The tablet would replace it for the main apps, as well as music playing.* A Samsung Galaxy Exhibit smartphone, used for mobility-needed apps, GPS and quick photos (tablet would replace it for apps, etc.)* An old Vizio tablet (which just sucks on nearly every level and which sits generally unused :) ).I use some combination of my devices on the go, sitting on the couch at night, or in the car to listen to music.For this purchase, I considered the 32GB Nexus 7, the 32GB iPad Mini and the 32GB Kindle Fire HD. Prices varied from about $200 for the Kindle with Amazon's sale, up to $400+ for the iPad Mini. I chose the Kindle Fire HD and paid for the ad-free option, as well as a year of music storage on Amazon Cloud Player.I've had the Kindle for about a week now, and immediately put it to use on a five-hour family road trip and several-day camping trip. I have imported my entire music library into Amazon Cloud Player and attempted to download all songs onto the device (more on that later). I have also downloaded about two-dozen free and paid apps from the Amazon store, sideloaded several other using my Android phone and Dropbox, and have both downloaded and streamed HD movie and shows.PROSPRICE: By going with the Kindle vs. the iPad, I can find other things to spend the saved $200 onFORM FACTOR: I think the form factor is solid. Feels like a non-toy. It's a tad heavier than I expected, particularly with the Otterbox case on it, but it's not bad.SCREEN: The screen is really bright and vibrant. Love it. For reading in the full sun, look, it's not an e-ink regular Kindle, but I find the screen readable. Better than I expected it to be.SOUND: The sound is excellent, truly.PERFORMANCE: Performance so far is fine. Very little stuttering of anything (more on that later). I find it very responsive to commands. Very quick to go between apps, etc.BATTERY: Battery life is better than I expectedAPPS: With very little effort, you can install many non-Amazon-approved apps without rooting. I don't feel I'm at a loss for apps. Between what Amazon offers and what I've side-loaded, I think I more or less have what I need, with very, very few exceptions. Sadly, one of them is my beloved Sky Safari Pro astronomy app, which just doesn't work side-loaded so far. *sniff*AMAZON INTEGRATION: It couldn't be any more integrated with Amazon. Offers recommendations to what you're using, reading, etc. Seamless with the purchasing, etc. It really feels like an extension of their site, to be honest.CONS and ANNOYANCESCHARGING: The lack of an included wall charging cord is crazy. The official one (sold separately) is very effective, though, and does charge it quickly. USB charging performance using the provided cable is terrible, in my opinion.INTERFACE LIMITATIONS: The locked-down interface is more limiting than I expected it to be. Little things like you can't use your photos as a wallpaper or lock screen? Really? For what purpose is this removed for those of us who paid to have ads removed? Yes, you can dig around the file structure and perform some minor surgery to make it happen, but you shouldn't have to. Put it this way: Apple wouldn't make you do that.PERFORMANCE: OK, it's generally good. However, several times, my music has skipped and repeated several seconds or so, particularly toward the end of songs for some reason. Similarly, I tried to record a short video with it, and playback was stuttery to the point I couldn't use it. A few HD movies that were downloaded have stuttered a little bit. Not too bad.MUSIC / INTEGRATION WITH AMAZON CLOUD PLAYER: I have nothing positive to say about transferring my collection of music over. Well, I guess other than it imported my iTunes library fine into the Cloud. I created some new playlists in the Cloud easily, so that's fine too. But good lord, what a nightmare it's been downloading the library to the device for playing offline. Literally, it took days to download everything, and I still don't know what I'm missing, since the song total counts on the device and the Cloud don't match. The thing has completely messed up numerous times, stalling and crashing while downloading, creating genres on the device that don't exist in the Cloud (example: "13," which consists of a random collection of songs and albums, including multiple songs from the same album, so "13" isn't representing the track number). I have found no easy way to see what songs are still not on the device other than flipping through each song. It's just been one big poor experience so far. A very, very poor replacement for my iPod and iTunes. Not even in the same class in terms of user interface; even the control buttons are tiny and not as easy to find / use.INTERFACE LIMITATIONS: Similarly, there are no music controls on the lock screen, which is terribly annoying for using it in the car as a music source. Completely avoidable and not easily understood why this feature doesn't exist. This is a HUGE issue when using the Kindle in the car as your music player. To skip a song, I have to turn the thing on, swipe the lock screen, type my password and press Next Song (if I can press the tiny buttons while driving). Dumb, dumb, a thousand times dumb.GOOGLE ACCOUNT INTERFACE: That you have to sideload apps for YouTube, GMail, etc. is just crazy. Yes, the built-in mail apps works for Gmail. The official Gmail app is better.INTERFACE LIMITATIONS: Can't create or organize basic folders for apps?INTERFACE LIMITATIONS: The limitations of the Amazon App store are truly not terrible. However, since this is basically an Android tablet in all but name, why not offer more flexibility, like Widgets, etc.?WIFI: The "faster WiFi" is not noticeable to me at all.So, in short, was it worth the purchase? Meh. I guess so. I had hoped to like it a lot more. It's my first Kindle that I don't love. In fact, as I write this, I'm not even sure I like it, on balance. It may end up on eBay soon.However, for the price, I suppose I cannot complain, and there is hope that the software will be updated over time to replace the annoyances above. I wouldn't hesitate to give it as a gift to a tech-challenged person who sits around an open WiFi connection all day, but anyone with more experience or expectations may feel let down and constrained. I do.

Reviews.Title: Not what I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: Stephen E Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought a used Kindle Fire HD 7" a few months ago. I've tried my hardest to use it regularly, but the Operating System is not for me. I would love it to be set up like other Android devices, or the Apple iDevices, where it lets you have select Apps on a home screen instead of having you click or slide through a possibly endless list of apps, determined by your most recently used ones (which includes any books and documents too).I love the sound quality, the clarity of the screen, the size and weight of the device; but the system isn't very user-friendly (and I hate that there is absolutely no customization available). I have my own way of organizing things, and I have my own personal aesthetic tastes, and I hate that Amazon has decided for me how I'm going to interact with my device.Aside from that, there are a few more minor issues: the Screen Lock button and the Volume buttons are hard to use sometimes--it would be nice if they weren't flush with the rest of the device. I'd also like to set the Lock Screen background to something other than those advertisements; when you turn on the device, there's a few nice pictures that randomly pop-up, but after that you'll always get advertisements that don't even offer things I'd want.I would love to move to another tablet device, but I'm afraid I can't afford it. I wish I had known about the restrictions placed on the Kindle Fire HD before I bought it.

Reviews.Title: I kind of miss my old kindle
Reviews.Author: Fara J. Laners
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because my biggest complaint is that even with "silk", YouTube videos do not run as smooth or will not play at all like on the previous Kindle fire. A lot of the videos I was able to play before on my old Kindle won't play on the new.  On the positive side, the HD quality is very good viewing for movies/TV shows through Hulu and Netflix

Reviews.Title: ready to give it away
Reviews.Author: shey
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money mainly because doent have many applications especially the FLASH PLAYER, so you cant watch many video files or movies. In order to make it work you would have to spend hours going around installing a lot of other things. I am tired of it and ready to change it for a mini Ipod only after 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Having some issues after recieving my Kindle
Reviews.Author: M. Ortiz
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire HD about 2 weeks ago, and just started getting used to the controls, and the line setup. However, I now find that when I make purchases on Amaazon.com, specifically apps, they are not syncing onto my Kindle, even when I manually press Sync. I checked the troubleshooting and checked that Whispersync is on, and I have a strong Wifi signal. In addition to this, as soon as I got it, I noticed a yellow spot in the bottom right corner, noticeable while I am reading ebooks. I feel like the first issue is more tech support than anything else, but I am frustrated that I am dealing with this only a couple weeks into ownership.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: DebraAndrus
Reviews.Content: I love it.  Everything I had hoped for.  Only thing is I would like an instruction book as I am not real techno savy.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: kathryn a. stromme
Reviews.Content: I like it for playing games have not tried to read yet.  My husband likes it too.  The only thing I wish I had a manuel for it as I know I could do more but what????

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire H"D 7"
Reviews.Author: Lady of Jane
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my husband.  He really likes to read and loves the convenience of downloading as many books as he wants.  He also is able to access the local library collections,

Reviews.Title: Getting the hang of it...
Reviews.Author: Nichole
Reviews.Content: Although I have not owned a tablet before, this is a bit shy of "WOW" and a little better than "EHHH".  I purchased three of these for myself and my two daughters, and they seem somewhat impressed, but I wish I'd gotten an iPad instead.

Reviews.Title: Superb
Reviews.Author: Gma-LL
Reviews.Content: I kept going back forth on whether I should get the Kindle or an iPad (which everyone else in my family has). I'm glad I decided to go with the Kindle.First, it cost a lot less than the iPad. And in comparison to the iPads in my family, the Kindle is a lot faster. It also does everything the iPad does. I also get a lot of offers for items important to me, like books, at prices that I would not have been available for the iPad.This is the best decision and purchase I made this year.

Reviews.Title: Not so happy.
Reviews.Author: patricia
Reviews.Content: My kindle fire only lasted 21/2 years .Just died .Alot of money ,not to last. I love Amazon ,but i won't buy another Kindle.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: Mella89
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get the kindle fire HD because I read alot and I owned the paper kindle already which I loved. I've only had the kindle fire for a couple weeks now and I've already seen some discrepancies. I like to use the text-to-speech feature which allows the kindle to read to me. I'm on the road alot so having this feature is great so that I can travel and still get reading time in. However, the kindle will get to a certain page and then just stop reading and when I try to push play again it wont start back up until I go to another page. This is very frustrating when I'm driving because obviously I cant stop and read and then go to another page. Also, the other day my kindle just cut off by itself right as I was in the middle of using it. If I had the kindle for a year or so and it just started doing these things then it wouldn't be a huge deal, but this is just the second week. Not a good sign

Reviews.Title: New favorite gadget
Reviews.Author: Well Read
Reviews.Content: I have a 13" laptop, a 11.6" Samsung Chromebook, a Toshiba Thrive Tablet, an iPhone 4/s, and now this.  This thing is just right.  I use Microsoft Exchange for email and the native app is great for syncing both my calendar and email.  The native web browser is great.  And it makes a good reader once you adjust the screen back ground and brightness.  Yes the app selection can be a little less than great compared to the Google  Play Store but I have not found any great deficiencies.It lives in Amazon world and that includes Prime Movies.  I am now hooked downloading movies and shows to take on the road.At $159 is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Johnathan Wolford
Reviews.Content: Wife loves it and it was a lot cheaper than an iPad, but you also can tell why it is.

Reviews.Title: Kindle keeps shutting off.
Reviews.Author: ClumsyCarp
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Kindle Fire HD 7"  . I have been having problems with  keeping it on.  I try to read which is the most common function that I use. If I leave the Kindle sitting on the table, it will stay on as long as I don't touch it. as soon as I pick it up to read it shuts off and I have to repeatedly turn it back on to continue reading.  Other than that  I love it.

Reviews.Title: OH so much better than the first fire.
Reviews.Author: Robert Richenburg
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle HD. It is all that I could hope for, the graphics are sweet and with the 16GB I never have to worry about running out of room. It is so much lighter and thinner then my first KIndle, which is a good backup if something God forbid goes wrong with my HD. My kids like the clarity of the HD and it great for when they want to watch a show or movie that the rest of the family isn't excited about.  I have to add that the Prime membership is a steal and a must. The two day Free shipping almost pays for itself, if you're like me and order a lot from Amazon. The free library and discounts are another benefit. If you are like me and have that other online video company the Prime will be a real BLESSING. The Prime membership gives you access to all kinds of programing, movies and shows, that are not on the other guy.  I also have to give a big thumbs up to Amazon for working on improving and enlarging their App store.  All in all I love my Kindle Fire HD and I really don't see me using or purchasing any other 7 inch tablet.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle fire hd is amazing.
Reviews.Author: Steffie
Reviews.Content: My new kindle is amazing it has such fast Internet. Much better than my iPad. It also has very good sound better than iPad. There are so many apps. I love it. Camera is soap. But good for Skype calls. It's the best.

Reviews.Title: Okay this is awesome.
Reviews.Author: Flynne
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with this: I’m very anti e-reader because I LOVE paper books. This is something that had saved me a lot of headaches though, so I have to hate e-readers less because it really is awesome.I got this to go on vacation; about 800+ miles from home with a small bag to squish a week’s worth of clothes, toiletries, and other must-haves in. It was nightmarish when I couldn’t even fit ONE book into my bag! I fretted and beat my head against the wall and said a lot of bad words (even made a few up just for the occasion), when my mom suggested I break my no e-readers rule and just buy a kindle and stop whining. With a lot of frustration and hostility, I did order one, sure I’d hate it and would have it sent back in less than 24 hours.It got here and I was still unimpressed, I opened it up, determined to hate it, but the more I played with it, the more awesome it became. I did get all the little gadgets to go along with it (a case, a screen protector, a stylus and the accelerated charging block) which added to its appeal, and within a couple of days of hating even the idea of one BEING IN THE HOUSE, the kindle won me over. It was frustrating at first, like trying to see the internet pages with tiny font and whatnot, but I finally figured out how to zoom – and then I did all of my ordering of items from my laptop so I didn’t have to deal with tiny font or zooming. It saved my vacation, I did not have to hurt a single person due to my aggravation of not being able to read, and made life more interesting as I played with it.I am very happy with it thus far; I’ve only had it a few months, but so far, no real complaints! It turned a hater into a believer, haha.It will not by any means replace my paper books – I’m just ordering ones I can’t get (like ones out of print, very handy) or ones I’m currently reading but don’t have room to take along with me. It’s wonderful.I love the movie features too, but the glare sucks – I would look into buying a glare-free screen protector if you plan to do a lot of movie watching on it.I’m not a gamer and have no idea how the games work on this since I’ll likely never touch them, so please see other people’s reviews for that.Otherwise, I’m a very happy with my kindle! I hope it keeps up to its reputation as time passes.

Reviews.Title: "Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: GM
Reviews.Content: I Love my Kindle and everything it offers!!!!!!!• Over 23 million movies, TV shows, songs, magazines, books, audiobooks, and popular apps and games such as Facebook, Netflix, Twitter, HBO GO, Pandora, and Angry Birds Space• Integrated support for Facebook, Twitter, Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo! and more, as well as Exchange calendar, contacts, and email• Front-facing HD camera for taking photos or making video calls using Skype, Facebook, and other apps• Free unlimited cloud storage for all your Amazon content• Kindle FreeTime — a free, personalized tablet experience just for kids on the Kindle Fire HD. Set daily screen limits, and give access to appropriate content for each child

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Rachel Remedio
Reviews.Content: First tablet.. love it! Have never bought anything but apple and am loving it!! very impressed. great picture, sound, easy to use. everything you could want and more!

Reviews.Title: Super fast delivery!
Reviews.Author: D. Dyer "dd"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire. I had "x" brand tablet and could never get the danged thing to work right. The learning curve on this unit is super fast and the graphics are off the chart!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: R. Becerra Jr.
Reviews.Content: Love this new kindle fire. Great for putting movies, magazines, books, apps, and photos on. Very easy interface to use for all ages.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Margaret Butler
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HD.  I love it, love it, love it!  The sound is fantastic, it has automatic brightness adjustment and it is very easy to navigate!

Reviews.Title: Go for it!
Reviews.Author: DWC50
Reviews.Content: Want it all?  Go for the KFHD.  If you don't mind skipping advertisements then save yourself a few bucks (spend on nice accessory) and buy the 'special offers' version.  The special offers are only on home screen and with a swipe of the finger disappear, so what? I enjoy the picture, sound and use mine alot for reading books.  I say "go for it".

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: This is my very first tablet and I have been very pleased with it. There are many great things about it: It's small and very easy to carry around, it's great to read on, and there are many apps and games available for download. However, I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the battery life. I keep the wi-fi off most of the time so that helps save it, but now it's started losing charge while it's in sleep mode and I'm not even doing anything with it. I've had this since May (so not very long at all) and that's pretty disappointing. I hope next time the system upgrades something is done about it.

Reviews.Title: I like it - but not as great for overseas users.
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle so far, but I dont give it 5 stars because I am most of the time located outside of the US and I found that I cant download videos while overseas, and also, the prime membership trial free was not useful as I could not watch instant videos from overseas either.I am very happy with the screen display!I am not very technical so I didnt do very much research before buying. I just bought based on the price I could afford, on the size I thought to be comfortable to carry in my purse.I definitely think I need a stylus to navigate.

Reviews.Title: HD is great
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Sharpe
Reviews.Content: I really like this Fire edition, I had the Kindle keyboard but never really used it. I read a lot of books and I still would rather read the old fashion paper books rather then the Kindle but I'm working on it!

Reviews.Title: Duh, its a Kindle
Reviews.Author: May Family
Reviews.Content: It is awesome. Great apps for productivity, fun, and reading. The kindle is geared more toward entertainment but you can write emails, view doc, work on doc, and even take notes on pdfs. Plus you can set up profiles for your kids, giving them certain boundaries. Great for sharing.

Reviews.Title: good upgrade amazon
Reviews.Author: rod h.
Reviews.Content: easily replaces the slower and somewhat clunkier fire standard version..better colors,faster load times  beats most other pads even the $500 ones.

Reviews.Title: perfect page turner
Reviews.Author: Eldon Archer
Reviews.Content: I love to read but after my stroke I had difficulty in turning the page.  My kindle solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: carole judge
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing tablet, it is so versatile. I love the simplicity of using it you really can't go wrong. My Daughter and Son-in-law bought it for my birthday and Christmas present 2012 and it is one of the best gifts that I have ever had. I don't want to put it down, I love the games, the news and everything else. We can Skype our sister in America, take photographs and keep them in an album on the Kindle. My Daughter has an Apple Ipad and the Kindle Fire HD is very comparable to it, the battery life on my Kindle is just better than the Apple Ipad.The only downside is that sometimes photographs that are emailed to me are not always able to be shown..

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: sparky240volt
Reviews.Content: I like the 7" Kindle because it is easier to carry around with me and not heavy on my wrists when I am trying to read.  The screen colors and the camera are great.  The colors are super and the price was great.  This is my 2nd kindle fire hd since my puppy decided to jump on the counter and chew up my other one.  However, I now have this new one and I am very happy with it and that is why I got right on Amazon and bought the same thing because I am just that happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle...but
Reviews.Author: I Keep Amazon Open
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle and couldn't live without it, but seriously 199.00 and you cant send a charger with it, I have to spend 20.00 if I wanted a charger or go to ebay to find a generic cheap charger. come on amazon send a charger.

Reviews.Title: Been Waiting for it
Reviews.Author: M. Higgins
Reviews.Content: Finally got it! It's everything I wanted it to be. I got a tip book to help me personalize it. Everything is starting off well.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: janet
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire.  the only problem i find is I can't read outside in the bright light like I could with my regular kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"  Wonderful device for all!
Reviews.Author: K. Gallagher
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Kindle user (my original Kindle still functions beautifully), but also have an iPad! I was looking for somethingmore portable and this is the perfect device that is also easy on your pocketbook. I cannot say enough about this wonderful little device.Being an Amazon Prime Member reaps so many benefits with this device - I can view hundreds of free movies,enjoy immersion reading (with an Audible account there are hundreds of choices), utilize Kindle Free timewhich is a great option for those with young children, and last but not least the option to borrow a wide variety ofbooks for free. The ads really aren't a problem for me. Amazon offers discounts on Kindle Fire accessories quite often.I had no problems whatsoever during the set up. Setting up wifi was a breeze, as well as adding email and social networkaccounts. Granted, there were no written instructions in the box, but Amazon always sends an email whenyour new kindle is on the way that includes links to instructions and videos on how to set up and use yourKindle.  I love the crisp and clear display and the sound output is surprisingly good.  It also includes a text to speechfeature that works with many books, magazines, etc. This is truly a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: mikeyb
Reviews.Content: I saw the opportunity to update, the price was right. It has exceeded my expectations. The screen is bigger and its faster than my old one.

Reviews.Title: KIndle Fire HD7"
Reviews.Author: Mary Martin
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed by Kindle Fire HD.  I mostly read on it but my Grandchildren play games.  It is easy to find a book or game that you want and download it.  Also directions are easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: constantly freezing up
Reviews.Author: PV2 Bunting
Reviews.Content: I bought this item because I thought it stacks  up just fine against the galaxy tab. Unfortunately so far the performance is underwhelming. Yes it is perfect for reading but when it comes to multi media it is lacking. So far Netflix runs fine but when it come  to other  apps like Facebook, Vine and Twitter  it freezes constantly. On top of that it has no instagram access. So far I am fully considering selling this and buying my original choice, the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. In the meantime I hope to hear from Amazon and receive some support regarding this issue. Maybe it is an issue with this tablet specifically?

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Kyle Hartwick
Reviews.Content: Got this when it was on sale for around 180. I've enjoyed everything about the product. Great value for the price paid. I wasn't looking for an expensive, unnecessary gadget like the iPad and this was a great alternative. Recommend to all who want great value for a nominal fee.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product
Reviews.Author: Muriel P. Enright "Muriel"
Reviews.Content: Speedy arrival, LOVE this.  goes on internet fast, downloaded a few games I love to play and finally...finally...read a book on here!  Loved it, back light is fantastic, easy on the eyes to read, recharge with usb cord right on my computer, can't say enought fantastic reviews about this product!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: vanman63
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a great device . Its easy to use and the Kindle Support Team is the greatest if you should run into any problems.My advice to you . Get one you'll love it .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Roe
Reviews.Content: I love it especially when travelling. I used to get the news the weather keep up with the emails. I am still discovering some of its tricks and how to use them. I love it as an ereader. I am glad I upgraded even though I don't use all the programs at this time due to my busy schedule even though I am retired.

Reviews.Title: reading on Kindle
Reviews.Author: J. Rudolph
Reviews.Content: I love reading on Kindle, I always wanted to read in bed when I couldn't sleep; butgot tired of holding flashlights.  So with the kindle, it comes with its own light, somuch easier...

Reviews.Title: Know what you are buying
Reviews.Author: Rooter
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed this device would not support face book games my partner likes to play. Down loads are slower than expected for video, otherwise works quite well for its intended purpose. There is some misinformation in instructional videos to sort out.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Gabriella Rivera
Reviews.Content: I debated about what kind of table would meet my needs....I love to read and use the internet and my phone's screen was just too small.  I did my research and found the Kindle Fire was exactly what I needed but the price is what sold me.

Reviews.Title: For my needs the Kindle Fire HD 7" is great!
Reviews.Author: Gingerdanger "Gingerdanger"
Reviews.Content: I wrestled with the decision to purchase this seemingly needless electronic gadget for a long time. I rent library books for free. I can mis-treat them and I don't have to baby-sit them for fear of theft. But library books are giant hard-bound behemoths that weigh a ton and I commute by bus so carrying them and my other daily stuff has become quite cumbersome.So I started researching the I-pad vs.Tablets vs. Kindle HD.I-pad - expensive, data plan, too much computer. I sit in an office all day, I have all the computer I need all day long.Tablets - much cheaper, but again, data plan and e-OCD (letting computer rule my life)Kindle - I love this thing! It's light-weight. I can rent library e-books for free, I can get cheap or free deals on Book-bub, it has built in wi-fi so I don't need to buy a data plan (if I need a computer that badly outside of work I'll use my smart-phone), it's user-friendly, it's backed by Amazon (that's a whole other review, but the short version is that it doesn't get much better than Amazon backing their products), reading books on it is a dream - so easy to set up the reading preferences and I can read in the sun. I don't ask for much with the few electronic items I possess and I couldn't be happier with this one. The only 'con' I can come up with is that this is my 2nd Kindle Fire HD 7" because my 1st one within a month developed a malfunction. The screen orientation stopped working. But a customer service rep from Amazon helped trouble-shoot possible fixes (none worked) and the end result, they sent a shiny new Kindle to replace the malfunctioning one. I truly love this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: More Google friendly apps...
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Curiel
Reviews.Content: Wish I could play Candy Crush on the darn thing...LOLOtherwise, I love it! Simple to use! And great picture, love the HD. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Pottersinc5
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this Kindle and am glad I did!! Great for everything including apps, reading, or watching your favorite TV channels.  I am pleasantly surprised at the quality of the picture also.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: KATHY HERRON
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle it does everything I want it to do.  I am still learning how to do some things on it!  The only thing I did not like was that it only came with a cable to charge it on my computer and it took forever!  I wish I had known that it did not have a power cord, so I could of ordered one at the same time I ordered the kindle!  But other than that it is great!

Reviews.Title: Best thing ever. I love reading and playing games on Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire and so does my 6 y/o Grandson!!  We play games together and have so much fun!  He wants to play against his grandmother , maybe because he can beat me.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Debra Gallagher
Reviews.Content: I bought it with my retirement gifts.  I like to carry it with me when I have to wait at the doctor's office.  My doctors don't have magazines I like to read.

Reviews.Title: Not love at first sight...
Reviews.Author: Titlelog
Reviews.Content: But it's growing on me.  Taking it out of the box my initial impression was how heavy it is.  Then I noticed that the screen is pretty small (it measures 7 inches diagonally).  I actually bought this because I've been using my Samsung Galaxy phone a lot to look at the internet, and just got tired of the small screen.  I think for personal use the Fire is fine in terms of screen size, although the black frame around it seems unnecessarily wide.  Web pages seem to load very slowly with the Silk browser, so I'm now using the Dolphin browser, which is faster and has Flash player capability.  I also bought the Fire because I'm replacing a Kindle Keyboard.  I never liked the dark screen, and the Fire is an improvement because of the back light and viewing options.  BTW, save the box it comes in because the beveled edge makes a good tabletop stand until you can get something else.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: A Reading Shrink
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably competitive Android tablet.  Some of the apps are awkward to use, and it takes some digging to find out how to get non-Amazon books onto the tablet.  The built-in Silk browser is too Amazon focused; I added the Dolphin browser.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: debra rabesa
Reviews.Content: I watch this instead of tv now. My only but was, this is my second Kindle , my first one was defective in a week or so, would not reset, just a blank screen. I was pleased with the speedy replacement and free shipping back of the defective one

Reviews.Title: Satisfied but....
Reviews.Author: frustrated
Reviews.Content: Great product. Only problem is on-off button is difficult to find and too small. It is black on black and difficult to see. Battery does not stay charged as long as my kindle e reader . With all this said I do love the product.

Reviews.Title: happy happy
Reviews.Author: Pamela M. Cebelak "pc"
Reviews.Content: i up graded from a kindle so  all went smooth  i also bought 2 for 2 family members  am pleased

Reviews.Title: Update your Kindle reader
Reviews.Author: S. Weiss
Reviews.Content: I have a kindle and I love it, but I wanted to update it to the FIRE.  My husband has a tablet and it's okay too but I wanted the FIRE because it's a dedicated reader that also does other things.  I watch Netflix movies, play games and even use Facebook on my new Kindle.  But best of all, I read!!  And when I read at night, I turn the page black and it doesn't bother my sleeping husband.

Reviews.Title: Does everything and more just as soon as I figure out how to use it.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: My primary excuse for finally purchasing the Kindle was to download textbooks for when I go back to school.  Of course I have wanted some type of e-reader/tablet for some time, but was now finally able to justify it.So far I have not been disappointed.  The size is perfect (never have liked the idea of carrying around a full size tablet) and yet it still does everything I want and more.I only have one gripe that made me take away a star.  I really wish this had come with an instruction manual, even if it was an e-manual that was already downloaded onto the Kindle (I finally broke down and bought a third-party manual).  This thing can do so much that it would really be great to have something handy to lead you through the steps of getting the most out of the device.  Sorry, but the help section in the Kindle reader is anything but helpful.  Redeeming this problem is the fact that the user interface is quite easy to learn and except for a couple things (like deleting content) very intuitive.I would also highly recommend spending the extra little money to get the larger memory and also eliminate the advertisements

Reviews.Title: I'd be lost without it!
Reviews.Author: june
Reviews.Content: This product is the best friend I've ever had. Lots of times I can't sleep it is total entertainment!I used to have to get up Togo on my computer.this is with me 24/7.Any orders are received on time and being a prime member just makes it better. THANK YOU AMAZON!!!!!!:)

Reviews.Title: Easy and Fun
Reviews.Author: James Wolfinbarger
Reviews.Content: It gives me access to facebook and e-mail when my computer is acting up as well as being great for just picking up anywhere and playing a game or anything else.

Reviews.Title: Ordered this kindle fire hd at full price n 2 days later it went on special for $40 less
Reviews.Author: Jamaal Mcleod
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom seeing that the previous kindle i bought her she found boring so i decided to get her this one with full color n video n apps but i have one major problem. I ordered this kindle fire hd on the 3rd August 2013 and 2 days later 5th of August 2013 it went on special for $40 less. My question is do I get a refund of $40 seeing that my order was placed less than 48 hours prior to the special. Can anyone help me with that?

Reviews.Title: Excellent ,well worth it!
Reviews.Author: barbara
Reviews.Content: More than what I expected! Movies are so excellent that you feel your atthe movies. Reading a book or bible verse brings you up close and personal.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: asiangirl
Reviews.Content: delivers everything I expected.  Love reading, exploring the internet. Is just the right size for my needs and handy to have.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: karin whitehead
Reviews.Content: Started out with a Kindle reader,three months later , I upgraded to the Kindle Fire. Six months later went to the Fire HD.I'm learning the ropes,but have noticed  a few things that I miss. For example, you no longer have the green light when you turn on, nor the Orange while charging. Next little quirk is the  ports to charge and connecting HD are in a bad spot when you have it in a case, forcing you to remove it to charge. I have purchased the authorized cover, but it still is a bother. I am no techno geek, so it takes me some time to figure out the ins and outs, but am learning to navigate this product. Would like to see the product come with instructions in a booklet to learn to use it,rather than the internal instructions. Otherwise I love my Kindle and have recommended it to several of my reading friends. It's money well spent!

Reviews.Title: Best buy ever
Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: I just love my kindle. I first wanted to get the ipad but it was too expensive and then all these tablets came out so I got confused as to which one I would get. And then the kindle fire came out and the price was good and I couldn't resist. Now I am so happy I did not get the ipad because I love love my kindle.Plus I know its from amazon and their products are good quality unlike buying a tablet from a brand I am not familiar with.Thanks amazon, you guys have never disappointed me which makes you awesome!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great value after the price break
Reviews.Author: Loran Perkins
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's first tablet. She couldn't be more pleased. Simple but powerful. I am an Apple person and I was even impressed.

Reviews.Title: WooHoo!
Reviews.Author: BuzziMc
Reviews.Content: I'm so please with my new HD kindle. Such an improvement to my last kindle. First off the sound is so much better and I can scan the net faster and easier. My last one also didn't hold a charge near as long. Hope others enjoy theirs as much!

Reviews.Title: from smartphone to kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Adela M. Howe "Calteska"
Reviews.Content: In order to save money on a very high phone bill. I decided to get this device. I was using my smart phone to read amazon books and do apps that I can also do with a kindle fire.  If you have WIfI and are around it most of the time. Home or office, then this is an excellent device, load it up and away you go. I simplified my phone to a simple basic device without a heavy data package. and do everything else with this device.  going for the 32gb was worth it. It is awsome.  and dont forget the accessaries that you can get. I have a keyboard case that works with the bluetooth. Not for heavy typing but it does get the job done. like facebook and simple email returns. etc.. Scan you faviorate reciepies, crochet patterns, or with ever; then  create them to a  PdF file (google PDF creater) and send this to your kindle email. then you have all the files you need.

Reviews.Title: Really easy to use
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Rieder
Reviews.Content: This e-reader/tablet is very intuitive, and is simple to use.  It's streaming ability is great.  I was able to view videos from Amazon Prime with great resolution, and only minimal signal problems.  I have read several books on it already, and I find the screen in reading mode very easy on the eyes.  I would have liked to have a camera on the back, but at this price point, you can't expect that.  I hope that in future iterations the Kindle will accept SD memory cards.  Web browsing is also simple, although if you have a bunch of redirects, you can't get everything.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: william w hall
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reader and the internet in the same machine. I also found it hard to navigate thescreen .

Reviews.Title: my kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: vicky
Reviews.Content: i really  like my new kindle fire, i havent had alot of time to explore it to much just yet but i will be able to in the next few months. but so far i feel it was the best $200.00 I have spent in a long time.

Reviews.Title: grandpawendall
Reviews.Author: Bruce W. De Vries
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed the kindle !!  It certainly gives me experience with figuring out technology, but the rewards are GREAT.  I just found the way to get my music in the backgroung while reading a book on the kindle.  Sometimes it is hard to figure out what you need to fix things ( a long time as well ), but keep trying their suggestions and use your common sense and they finally work.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: jjnew "jjnew"
Reviews.Content: the kindle fire hd is great. I got it for my mom. marry X-mas mom! its clear, bright, and fun. you can do many things on it like reading, games, internet. its a great gift for you or anyone else. you will love it!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: bgreen
Reviews.Content: Bought kindle fire hd for my wife and she loves it! Its awesome! Its portable,versatile. The image is very sharp. A all in one device!

Reviews.Title: Nifty device!
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I love the new Kindle Fire; just wish it would hold a charge longer.  I love the multiple use, instead of just a reader.

Reviews.Title: All I can say is WOW!
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: I hesitated purchasing a Kindle Fire for quite some time, unsure it would give me what I was looking for in a tablet.  I did extensive research around all available makes and models and kept coming back to the Fire.  I purchased this about 2 months ago and have never looked back.  The picture is crystal clear and the sound is fantastic.  I have watched movies, reviewed emails, played games, surfed the web and listened to music on this.  The special offers aren't even noticeable.  The battery lasts a good 8-10 hours depending on what I'm doing.  The price is really great too.  I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD to everyone.

Reviews.Title: it is better than i anticipated
Reviews.Author: Elsie Schivone
Reviews.Content: I am 77 years old and once I figured it out I love it..it does more than I thought it would and it suits me fine

Reviews.Title: Great buy and product!
Reviews.Author: Teri Sue "Mawmaw"
Reviews.Content: What can you say...it's a Kindle!  But the quality of the images are worth the extra in getting an HD.  I bought this for my mom, who is over 80, so that she could have the clearest images available for the price.  And I caught it on a special deal, which made it that much sweeter!  She's a newbie, so I wanted something that would be easy for her to use and good to fill her time.  Kindle provides that, for her and for me!

Reviews.Title: fire dh
Reviews.Author: nailman
Reviews.Content: I like it but I am learning how to use it.navagating is alittle trying for me at this time.But ill get it

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Judi "All hearts open, all people connected"
Reviews.Content: Choosing between IPad and Kindle fire HD I chose Kindle but now think iPad would have been better. I am going on road often off wi-fi grid  and both are problem there but the good thing is I can download my own city's digital books FAIRLY easily with wide selection. Unworkable issues:1. kindle fire too heavy to hold and awkward to read in bed more than 30 mins. Ordered case with it and prop option dies not work in bed.2. Prime is great for now getting free shipping til I get on road but I went thru all the kindle prime free movies, tv and books in two weeks; nothing left there I want to see or read for free so I will cancel prime once I'm done stocking up on what I need for trips.3. Kindle us WAY TO HARD to get around and find things like my email, my saved pics, free prime etc. I have a masters degree in information use and if I have trouble, other people must. It's a use ability/search and find function that's not so good. (Coming from a long time Apple user where I can always count on being proficient with their products in 30 minutes)Overall, I will use my kindle for my own library access and once in a very great while to purchase a digital book but do not feel its worth the price for such a small window of use.

Reviews.Title: I love the kindle fire hd 7
Reviews.Author: cathy yunker
Reviews.Content: It was so easy to start up.  I already had a kindle and it was so easy to transfer everything I had to the new one.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD
Reviews.Author: DALINDA L. BROOKS
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting one for some time and so when it went on sale I decided to take the plunge.  I really that is light weight.  The clarity is good..  I read mostly with mine so far and I can do that in the dark with out disturbing anyone.  If you are thinking about buying one< I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD7
Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: This is the best kindle in the world it just amazing. I cannot stop learning all about my Kindle and every day I learn something new.The internet section it the best. I recommend this Kindle to all just brilliant. Gerry

Reviews.Title: I think its great!
Reviews.Author: dianal
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire HD. I can take it anywhere, watch movies, TV shows, skype, internet, reads books to me, etc. I take it when I travel. It is easy to use, great picture quality, sound could be a bit louder, otherwise I am totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Linda Baker
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle. Used the first for six months then had a problem. Amazon very quickly replaced the Kindle and the new one is great. I love the 7 inch size which fits nicely in a purse. I am amazed at the technology in the Kindle. I can do most of the things with the Kindle that I can do with my laptop by adding an app. The print app allows me to print and that was one thing I really missed being able to do. Love my Kindle Fire HD 7".

Reviews.Title: issues with wifi connection
Reviews.Author: Mary Agnello
Reviews.Content: overall this is a good product, however, I have repeated issues with my wifi connection on my home network - in researching this problem, I've come across many similar complaints for the kindle - this is an ongoing problem that seems to plague many customers. I've had the device for a few weeks, and it works nicely for reading and is even better when the wifi connection works - love the idea of being able to access streaming movies and other content, were it not for the frustration I've encountered in connection issues, I'd rate it 4 to 5 stars, but since the device offers little in the way of transparency of operating system, the user is left with very few options - and all feedback I've read from similar complaints notes the customer service department, while patient and helpful, offered no other alternatives than what's provided on Amazon's help pages, except some offers of replacing the device - which could correct the problems, but could experience the same ones, regardless.I recently read an article that Amazon was about to release a new version of the product, which includes additional connection options, I only wish I'd waited to purchase it until then...

Reviews.Title: I like it but..
Reviews.Author: Chelsie
Reviews.Content: I've always been really impressed with Amazon's customer service. It's part of the reason I buy so often from this site. So when I finally broke down and bought a Kindle, I thought they would be amazing because it's expensive &, with so many options for tablets (or tablet like) choosing this one would make them really want to keep me happy. But I've been disappointed with the help; I ordered a Kindle but accidentally didn't correctly get the "As Seen On TV" special, I couldn't cancel my order but had to reorder (not a huge deal, but definitely an inconvenience). Also, the Kindle doesn't come with a charger..or a decent charger. It comes with one that goes into the computer and "slowly" charges. Quite annoying that I have to spend another 20$ to get a normal charger. You'd think it'd be included! Other than that, the actual Kindle is great; easy to download books, games and use. Also, being a prime member has nice benefits! Borrowing books once a month is nice and free streaming, good bonus!

Reviews.Title: Best money spent!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I positively LOVE my Kindle Fire Hd!!! I haven't put it down since it was bought! I am a Kindle Prime member and enjoy the free shipping as well as the free movies my subscription allows me! I'm planning on purchasing several more Kindle Fire's to give as gifts this Christmas!  My step mom loved hers so much she takes it everywhere, even on vacation too! Amazon customer service has been PHENOMENAL! They are quick to fix any issues that come up, without any hassle and that to me is worth its weight in gold!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Peggy M Rivera
Reviews.Content: I love it - I can get books, movies, games, apps and they are right at my fingertips.  I love Kindle Prime and the sharing and borrowing features. Still experimenting with my new Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jodi
Reviews.Content: I started with the very irst Kindle and when I got this I was amazed at what thas been upgraded. I can not wait to enjoy this for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Darlene Raymore
Reviews.Content: got this as a gift for my daughter and she loves it.  Can't get her to put it down.  better then an IPAD, especially the price.  I'm order another for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: AW
Reviews.Content: Lovely!!! Excellent quality, service and product. Loved making this purchase to your company.  Hope to do business with you again soon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD "7"
Reviews.Author: Elbert D. Howze
Reviews.Content: Very good product for serious readers.  Beats the heck out of carrying around the many books that I read at the same time.  Graphics are very high quality, easy to use and book pages are easy on the eyes.I highly reommend this product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS
Reviews.Author: shaunice pattillo
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. I love it. Bought as a surprise for my mom for mothers day and she loved it. Got it at a good price too which made it all the more worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: Th HD7 rules
Reviews.Author: joeysni1
Reviews.Content: Great product !!!!! I have the original Kindle and this is a much improved version. Work swell in bright sunlight and the internet browser is excelant.

Reviews.Title: handy and practical
Reviews.Author: gayly
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire! I have a larger laptop so now I can take my Kindle any where with me in place of my laptop. It's a little different learning how to maneuver around though having a smart phone with apps has helped a lot. I'm learning a little more each day and love it. Can't wait till I figure out all it can do!Handy, Practical and extremely affordable compared to notebooks and other Pads out there with great HD screen and amazing sound for such a little device.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann Bowline "Jo Jo"
Reviews.Content: I was not informed that it was a refurbished one when I bought it and there are time when it is very irritating when trying to play a game and  all the advertisements pop up .  I would have been much happier knowing this before hand. My grandchildren love all the games  so I guess if that makes them happy I should not complain.  If I had it to do over I would have spent the extra money and gotten a new one with out the advertisements

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Cathy Nichols
Reviews.Content: I returned a brand new 2 month old Kindle because of problems, and was told I was being sent a new one.  When I received it, what I got was a refurbished one, not a NEW one.  Not really happy about spending full price, and getting a refurbished unit.

Reviews.Title: It's not an Ipad Mini - it is better
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 7 inch tablet that is ready to work out of the box and already connected to a substantial ecosystem with apps, look no further.  This table is great.  This tablet stands up well to the Ipad Mini without question.  The fact that you can buy one for you and a friend for just slightly more than a single Ipad Mini makes it even better.  It is well made and durable, the screen is great, the Kindle ecosystem is awesome and Kindle Free Time is a must have if you have small children.You don't have to be techie to set up and use this tablet.  It is easy to use straight out of the box.  If you are looking for a tablet this is a great way to go.

Reviews.Title: really nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Craig Nelson
Reviews.Content: Overall kindle works well. I wish that web browsing was easier. When watching videos,if a email comes in it effects the audio of the video.

Reviews.Title: Good for kids when it works!
Reviews.Author: Megan "Megan"
Reviews.Content: The kindle is definitely not as user friendly as the iPad but for the money is comparable. There also isn't a lot of free apps although amazon does offer a free one everyday. Out of 4 kindle fires 1 of them had to be replaced due to constantly shutting down for no reason and now a second one is doing the same thing.

Reviews.Title: Hooked on Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Neville
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Kindle keyboard, Kindle Fire and now the Kindle Fire HD. I have loved all three products, however thereis one feature that I miss from the Keyboard model.  I liked the ability to organize my bookshelf in ways that I could differentiate from authors I wanted to peruse again for other works, separate the read from the unread and separate by genre. I do not like thefew simple preset catagories available.  If they could only incorporate this into the Fire I would be rating this a 5 and would be very happy with my Fire HD. It should be a simple programing fix and could be offered as an update, soon, please.

Reviews.Title: One must charge it every day.
Reviews.Author: Chuckwallah "Geezer wallah"
Reviews.Content: It comes with no written manual.  Even a short one to get started would be welcome.  Short tips and tricks section to guide one to the better results.  But most of all, I still can't get it to talk to my PC, perhaps because an earlier Kindle app keeps getting the downloads and won't let me transfer them to the KF.  Not really dummy friendly.
